Summary Heading: Great lodging in a convenient location.
Summary: Housekeeping only as requested, which was fine.  Comfortable, quiet adjoining rooms for our family.  We appreciated the convenient location.  Parking just outside our room.  A great choice for us.  We would be glad to recommend this lodging to anyone wishing to stay in this area, with a short walk to Disneyland.
Room tip: Excellent parking off the street and outside your room.

Summary: Enjoyable stay.  Parking is near your room and Disneyland is just across the street.  Rooms are very clean.  Beds are too comfortable.  I wanted to sleep all morning.  Also, you have IHOP on one side and Dennys on the other!

It’s a very nice Nice hotel/motel and in the perfect location! The rooms were clean and good size for a family and updated. It’s quiet and the hotel enforces quiet hours, which is very much appreciated as It’s a family location.  Parking is easy too!  There are restaurants all around it.

It's been a few years since I stayed at Park Vue but it used to be my go-to for family trips - you can't beat the location! I was happy to return for this adults only trip and see that the rooms are still clean and comfortable, the Mickey and Me souvenir shop on property is still well-appointed, and the customer service is still outstanding. (Shout-out to Carlos at the front desk!) The amenities have been noticeably pared down over the years though...way back when they had welcome baskets, glass coffee mugs and hot chocolate & coffee options in the rooms, full hot breakfast, and an evening snack reception. Over the years, this became breakfast only, and on this trip, complimentary breakfast was no longer available. It's understandable for management to make these changes in

Location to the park is supreme! Closer than several of the Disney owned hotels! Clean rooms, pool and hot tub, small store that has everything needed! Close to restaurants - walking distance! Friendly and very helpful staff!!!! Great value!

Took the kiddos for their first visit to Disneyland and we were so glad we stayed here. We booked a last minute trip and got a good deal. I stayed here once about 20 years ago and loved the convenience. Staying across the street is absolutely essential for families with young children. Mid day naps at the hotel spared us from the dinnertime melt downs we witnessed. It’s the only hotel that you see as you walk down the walkway to exit the parks and it’s a sight for sore eyes and sore feet. We were on the ground floor and didn’t have to hassle with stairs for our stroller which meant that the kiddos slept undisturbed after a long day. It also meant that door to door it was about a 5 minute walk to the main gates which helped tremendously for us to get to the parks early at open.

Summary Heading: Slept family of 6 with Tweens comfortably!
Summary: 2nd visit 7 years apart-once with younger children now with older.  The triple queen room (next to the laundry room) was quiet, did not hear much of the other people in the hotel. The beds were very comfortable and allowed for comfortable sleeps both at night and mid-day nap. Yes, the bathroom area was a bit tight at times, but was to be expected.  Free parking helps. Just disappointing that the breakfast is not being offered at this time. We had ability to drive to grocery stores and stock up on breakfast items.  Fridge is not large, but was able to hold gallon of milk (on its side), cold cuts, water bottles, etc. with a little bit of Tetris action.  We were told we could use a toaster if plugged in where the coffee marker is (do not use at same time) so bought a $10 toaster at
Room tip: Room beside the laundry room, ice machine, and a vending machine; did not hear a peep from this...

Summary: Right across the street from Disneyland, clean, cute and affordable. Staff was great, helpful and friendly. There is also an on site store with shirts, drinks and snacks. Was great to be able to walk back and forth from Disneyland. There is also no fee for parking which is a rarity! I considered spending more money to stay at one of the Disneyland hotels, but they charge an additional 35$ just to park per night. Rooms here were very clean, good sized and quiet. There’s also a pool and spa if anyone wants to take a break from Disneyland. I highly recommend this place and it will definitely be our go to for Disneyland visits.

Two awesome attributes for this hotel- clean and close. The room was spotless- white walls, clean floors, clean sheets. And the air conditioner was a godsend.  It was also so close to the park that we actually walked back midday and took naps so we could avoid the heat! The hotel is even Closer than the Disneyland parking structures.  To set expectations, this is a very basic hotel - super small rooms. But the layout of the room is great with the bunk beds and the price can’t be beat.

Booking here was a HUGE mistake. The room was terrible. My son got out of the bath and walked around and his feet were black - BLACK - from the grime on the floor. Something from the ceiling dripped on you while you were sitting on the toilet and the swamp cooler made the bedroom so moist it felt awful. Even if the rooms were nice - there is ZERO security here. Anyone can walk or drive all the way back down the length of the hotel into the darkness of the parking lot. And if they walk along the hotel, the are walking right past your bedroom and your door. It did not feel clean or safe at all. We could not wait to get out of there and we so bummed that we had to stay the one night for another room to open up down the way. We had rented two rooms here and paid the one night

This place is a gem. It is just across the atreet from the parks entrance so after exhausting day at Disney we were so grateful that our room is so close. Amazingly clean, spaceous and comfortable. One separate room with 2 queens and another room with sleeper sofa amd kitchenette. Super good value. We will be staying here again.

Good location next Disney and parking included. Floors were filthy. After walking around socks and feet were completely black. After arriving home and could still not get the dirt from the floors out of socks/ house shoes. The rest of the room appears to be clean. Due to the floors would not recommend.

Great location, and parking included. Unfortunately, carpet is quite filthy and AC too loud and didn’t work properly.  We stayed at 4 hotels during our entire trip so can attest to this.  Housekeeping woke us early at 8a for no reason and again a second time before checkout. Rude and unprofessional.  They need a better system to inform them of exact rooms who checked out so they know when to clean …not by knocking every unit multiple times. It’s way overpriced for this type of place. There were a few tiny bugs flying in the room but have entered afterwards. However,one positive is when we requested towels, service was quick.

Great place to stay. We had multiple rooms. All were clean & comfortable. They were able to put us all close together. The front desk staff was very friendly. On site security guards. You can't get any closer to Disneyland.

We have stayed here close to 10 times in previous years. We have tried the double room, the bunk beds, the mini-suite, and this time, the Triple Queen. The Triple-Queen by far was our favorite one! We don't know if it's the room itself or the place has been renovated, but IT WAS SO CLEAN!  The room was so spacious had nightstands for both sides of the additional queen. I love that the closet doors were gone and a shelving rack was there to place things. Our refrigerator was also both a freezer and a fridge, not just a freezer compartment. The bathroom was away from the beds (some places have it right next to the beds) and the carpet was very clean. We remember that our feet used to turn black from the carpet! We appreciate the updated electronic sockets that include USB ports.

The Park Vue Inn is a magical place. The staff is amazing, seems like they are always cleaning and keeping the parking area spotless. The housekeeping staff was amazing and did a wonderful job as well. All that and only 891 steps to the gate of Disneyland. This is a must stay. In the room before a shuttle could even leave the bus stop. Add that to the amazing staff and comfortable bed and you will have the best Disneyland experience short of  sleeping in the park.  Thank you to the Staff for the hard work it really made our stay so much more enjoyable.

The perfect place to stay for a Disney vacation. I can’t  say enough about the wonderful staff, everyone of them were helpful, kind and went out of there way for us. The room was clean and beds comfortable. Would choose this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Family vacation in a terrible hotel
Summary: We’ve stayed here for over twenty years and had the best time. This time, I got bitten so badly each night that I had to get medication. My father and daughter were also bitten numerous times. When I told customer service he literally laughed and asked what he thought he should do about it. We were so shocked we took a picture of him. Unbelievably rude and didn’t care at all about our experience. Housekeeping woke us up on accident at 7am (she apologized), there is no laundry service either. It’s always in repair or just missing. Couldn’t be more disappointed. The customer service is a joke.

Staff is always friendly and rooms are clean. Close to the park, but they never brought back the breakfast which other properties have and charge less then this one.  Price is kinda high for a bare bones hotel stay

I was worried when I booked this hotel.  I was afraid it was going to be a run down mess, based off the price.  OK, it's not a Radisson Suites, but for the price and location I was very happy.  The location is the kicker for this property.  You literally walk off the property, cross the street, and you're at the walk-in entrance to Disneyland.    The room was small (we had a queen bed and bunk beds).  There was the beds, a small desk, a small closet and a small fridge and microwave and a small bathroom.  If you're staying for a week and are planning to spend time in the room, perhaps look somewhere else.  If, however, you're staying at the park essentially all day and night and only crashing at your room, then this is the place to go.  I read complaints the rooms had thin walls

Summary Heading: Convenience of location makes up for basic room
Summary: Being literally across the street from Disneyland was extremely valuable to us, and we enjoyed this perk very much.  The room itself was pretty basic, although the bunkbeds were a nice touch for our kids.  I liked the room key app and the fact that both check in and check out was so easy.  The front desk was willing to hold our stroller rental for us when we arrived, and also our luggage after we checked out but before we left for the airport.  We would stay here again for the convenience.

Summary Heading: You can't get any closer to the parks than this
Summary: The proximity to the Disney parks is of course the major selling feature of this hotel, but it is also clean, and although the rooms are quite small, you only need a place to pass out after a long day in the parks.  A couple of things of note:  I received an email in advance letting me know the pool would be closed during our visit, and although we were disappointed, I really appreciated the heads up as it's happened to me more than once that you pick a place because it has a pool and then it's not open you arrive...this is the first time a hotel has let me know in advance.  Second, we were billed a resort fee but it was removed upon request; again, the decent thing to do, but that's not always what happens.  For these reasons in particular, I would stay here again, and

Summary Heading: Do not stay in this hotel, but if you do at least try to get a room in the upper floor so it may be less loud at night.
Summary: PROS: Right across the entrance to Disney, the reason why I chose this place. CONS: Extremely small rooms (the picture of the room seemed nice, the reality, completely different) Super small bathroom, not even enough room for toiletries No housekeeping service unless you stay 5 days, (I was there 4, so I wonder if that is even true) Cheap everything, not even creamer but white powder for the cheap coffee provided in the room. The hotel is not cheap, you can get a better one for the same price. Loud I never saw housekeeping except for the day I was leaving when they knocked in my door around 9:00 am. Check out is at 11:00 , so at 11:05 I was already getting calls from the front desk telling me to get out or pay for a late check out, even when I told them that I was just waiting

Summary Heading: Pack house slippers and ear plugs..
Summary: We stayed 4 nights in a triple queen room. We used the extra room for our toddler so the wife and I could enjoy our peace and quiet - however that wasn’t the case.   First off the walls are so paper thin you can HEAR EVERYTHING. Full blown conversations, running/walking, and doors closing that will rattle your room. We stayed right next to the custodial room (room 248) and they slammed their doors harder than the guests!!   Several doors need maintenance; the door leading into our toddlers room and the entrance made a loud squeaking noise when closing. The staff mentioned they had an engineer on site daily, so we kindly asked to have them fix JUST the door leading into our toddlers room. We came back that night to no subsequent notice and NOTHING ever getting resolved.  The last

First of all, the best thing about this hotel is the closeness to Disney.    Now to the hotel itself - I stayed here a few years ago and had a bad experience with cockroaches.  The management were kind enough to give me a discount due to the experience and they sprayed the room during the stay.  In subsequent years I have stayed at other hotels on Harbor and done well.  This year I wanted to be close to Disney so, based on reviews, I tried Park Vue again.  First, they met all my requests for adjoining rooms, second floor, etc which was great.  However, when I checked in, they said housekeeping would be only once (for a five night stay), no breakfast, the pool closed on the 2nd day of our stay and no fitness center.  I was upset about the housekeeping because they should at least

Summary Heading: Clean, spacious room in the perfect location
Summary: This was our first trip to Disneyland and the Park Vue was the perfect setup for our family. Everyone mentions location but it was even closer than I expected. You cross the street and you’re on the walk to security. So easy to run back to the room to refresh or nap. I have a toddler and was able to walk from the middle of the park to the room in 10 minutes (I’m a fast walker) maneuvering a stroller. We had a Double Queen with sofa bed room and it was spacious for our family of 4. Having the two rooms was a big deal for us since we have a toddler that naps and gets up early and a preteen late sleeper. We would have paid double the price and been crammed into one room if we stayed on Disney property. Now the room isn’t the Ritz but I thought the price was great for what you got.

A great hot breakfast for the entire family is a MUST have. Park Vue Inn used to have a  great hot breakfast but they have taken it away.  I'd urge the management to bring it back.  Beyond that: wonderful rooms, great location and great staff.

Great location at a reasonable price.  Checked in at 1:00 using the electronic key.  Checked out with with my phone at 11:00 while shopping.  Car was at hotel parking lot while We shopped. Friendly, helpful staff.  Being able to walk to Disney and many food venues has been a tremendous boon. As a bonus, the in-room complementary coffee tasted good.

Closest location to the park entrance! Nice, updated rooms with superb staff - Carlos & Front Desk Staff! Clean, pleasant, and a bathroom window you can open for air! It is an excellent location to both park entrances-so convenient.

Checked in online. Received electronic key. No one cleaned my room (due to COVID precautions).  Room was clean and comfortable -no frills.  I basically had a room with no direct contact with any hotel member.   I was shocked when I received my bill with a $10 per day resort fee. This is in no way shape or form a resort. I questioned and the customer service person responded they charge resort fee due to pool and fire works viewing deck (the website indicated viewing deck and gym are closed). Very disappointed that they couldn’t resolve this for me.

Stayed in just about every hotel on Harbor across the street from the parks and hands down, Park Vue is the best. From their easy to navigate web processes including no contact pre check in - Open Key is used to generate your room key so you can bypass the front desk if you wish- to the comfy , well appointed rooms. Was also very quiet which is almost unheard of at these hotels. Parking lot is compact, but not dangerously and they don’t stress about you parking there on your check out day which many do not allow( looking at you Desert Inn). Customer service requests were handled efficiently and pleasantly and Elizabeth at the front desk is a treasure- all in all, wonderful stay and I’ve already booked our next stay and as Magic Key holders, will be booking many more!

This was our 3rd stay at the Park Vue and this was the best yet!  The staff here is generous and hospitable. The rooms are super clean and well appointed, and the beds were so comfortable. You can't beat the easy walk to Disneyland and California Adventure, which made it easy for my family of 4 to do Disney without a car.  This hotel may lack some of the trendier amenities (water park, spa services, entertainment packages) but it more than makes up for it with the impeccable attention to detail in what they do offer as well as incredible customer service.

Just returned from a week at Park Vue Inn and was very pleased with this stay.  It was our first time at a non-Disney hotel, but convenience to the parks and Downtown Disney was great.  We had a double room with a pullout couch and kitchenette and it was plenty of space for us to sprawl out and relax on our midday break.   Very clean room, sticker to indicate it was sanitized between visits by housekeeping when selected, so felt very safe. Staff at front desk was extremely helpful.  We couldn't figure out how to turn down our AC unit, and the person at the front explained it to me but also offered to send someone to our room to help. I told them I'd try to figure it out. I must have sounded unsure because they then reminded me that I could call anytime up until 11pm if I needed

Summary Heading: Clean, Comfortable, and Close to Disneyland
Summary: This was our first trip to Disneyland, and I had checked out the nearest hotels to the front gates.  Park Vue wins that title.  The crossway to the park is steps away!        We had reserved a suite nine months out, and, from what I surmised from photos, it looked like it was one large room.  It is not.  The kitchenette, sofa, coffee table and a second bathroom sink are in the entry room with the beds in another room with a wall TV in each room.  We had tons of room and loved it!      Everything was very clean.  The beds are very comfortable.  The small refrigerator is a real one - not just a cooler - with a separate freezer.  There are pots and pans and a range top and microwave.  Sadly, there are only paper plates, cups, and tableware.  I would have loved real dishes but

ERIC was at the front desk and helped out immensely. He did his job quickly and made sure of each detail. Why such a glaring positive review, is due to Eric doing a little bit more. The hotel did have to help and was easy for them to accommodate the change in reservation and needs, but the extra more was exactly what we needed to make the vacation so much easier and enjoyable. Great place, and plan on utilizing the establishment on a regular basis.

Summary Heading: Never Thought We’d Leave Our Old Favorite…But Now We Have a NEW Favorite. Hello, Park Vue Inn!
Summary: This was our very first stay at the Park Vue. We’ve stayed at another good neighbor hotel for the last 20 years and decided to try this one and were not disappointed. So much so, that THIS is our new go-to hotel for Disneyland! Starting off, the front desk staff are the best. Each person we encountered there were friendly, and kind. The room was perfectly clean! With amazing air conditioning, top notch bedding and also towels were fluffy and soft. We had a 2 Queen suite with sofa bed and kitchenette. Bathroom was spacious and spotless. The kitchenette was equipped with an adorable refrigerator/freezer and stovetop, microwave and plenty of utensils, and cookware. Then, in addition to the kitchen sink, directly across was another large countertop with sink, huge mirror and plenty

Summary Heading: As close as you can get without staying on Park property, with beds you won't want to get out of.
Summary: We have been staying at the Park Vue Inn for years. You simply can't beat the location, directly across from the park.   The beds are extremely comfortable and the room has been updated.  We were disappointed that breakfast isn't offered anymore, but we were aware of that before going.  A warning: the laundry room is completely closed and this was not communicated to us prior to arrival nor has the website been updated with this information. Staying for 9 nights, laundry facilities are a must. We spoke to the front desk and asked if they could make arrangements with a neighboring hotel to allow us to use their laundry facilities. The Best Western next door graciously allowed us.  The wifi kicked us off daily at random times, so be sure to monitor that so you aren't wasting data.

We just returned from staying at the Park Vue Inn for my daughter's birthday (and Disneyland trip). We will only ever stay here from now on when we visit Anaheim! The location literally cannot be beat, you are right across the street from the Harbor entrance. The room was very clean and most important for my kids, it had bunk beds! They were SO excited to be able to sleep in bunk beds! It was also very quiet which was unexpected as I had gotten used to most of the hotels we stay at you can hear everything happening around you! Parking is also included in room rate which is amazing and made leaving Disneyland so much nicer!   The staff was also very friendly and helpful during check in and check out.   Overall, I would highly recommend!

Summary Heading: Another amazing stay at Parkvue Inn
Summary: I’m a repeat guest at Parkvue Inn and it is always hands down the best place to stay for Disneyland.  The hotel was nicely updated and the staff are just amazing.  They are really friendly and professional.  I also saw how the maid cleans and me being a clean freak - I approve! The bed was comfortable and perfect for a long day at the park.  We’ve stayed at multiple hotels over the years in Anaheim and  Parkvue inn is really the best bang for your buck.  You really can’t get any closer. We will choose to stay here again and again.

Literally a five minute walk into the entrance of both Disney parks. Rooms are clean. Get on the second floor and you can watch the fireworks show for free! Next door to IHOP for easy meal access. Has vending machines for snacks.

We had a wonderful five night stay at the Park Vue Inn. The staff here are helpful and friendly. The rooms are nicely appointed and the beds are very comfortable. It was so nice to have a fridge with a freezer too. It is located steps from the crosswalk into the Disneyland main entrance so it was a short walk if we needed to go back to our room for anything. Its was also quiet considering how busy the whole area is and that there were many other guests staying there. You can also view the Disneyland fire works from there. We look forward to staying at the Park Vue again!

Summary Heading: Plenty of room, VERY comfortable beds and pillows, great service.
Summary: Right across the crosswalk to enter the Disney Parks from the east side, the motel's location was more than convenient for a break during the summer heat from the parks. Our was a two-queen room, with lots of space for four of us, very clean and quiet. AC unit is in the sink area, allowing for a more pleasant night away from the unit. For me the best part was the VERY comfortable bed and pillows (more on the firmer side)... THANK YOU Park Vue Inn! We were able to watch Disneyland's fireworks while in the pool. Due to COVID, the room was not cleaned during our stay, but staff promptly picked up our garbage and provided clean towels when requested. There's a very handy little convenience store next to the lobby (closes at 10 PM). Didn't explore it, but there's a laundry room of

Summary Heading: Closest to main gate, excellent value
Summary: Since this property isn’t on Expedia, I never knew how great it was! It’s probably closer than staying on property— right across the street from the main gate. It’s very clean and updated, with high quality bedding, pillows and towels, coffee in the room, a cute pool, and friendly service. We were in 231, with 2Q and bunk beds— great space. Good access to plugs. The bathroom sink is separate from the toilet/shower, which is convenient for families, and there’s a refrigerator with freezer and big TV. We will be back for sure!

Summary Heading: Best place to stay when going to Disneyland
Summary: The most affordable and easiest place to stay. My kids and I feel like we lucked out finding this gem. Shortest walk to park, free wifi, free parking, quiet, and relaxing. Will never stay anywhere else but here!

For a 2 star hotel was not expecting a lot.  Ladies I am one of those very picky people when it comes to room and property cleanliness.  The property and rooms were spotless. Their rooms looked like they had been recently renovated and maybe they weren't so this just shows how much they care about upkeep. The decor in the room was very nice and tasteful. I like carpet in the bed area and they had tile in the entryway and vanity area. Somebody in management really knows how to take care of property inside and out. Kudos to them. Location was fabulous.  Left a tip for room attendant because they sure do deserve it. Thank you Parkvue Inn.

Summary Heading: Fully updated hotel within walking distance!
Summary: I have stayed at nearly every hotel along the walk to the Disneyland entrance and this one is my fav.  It is directly across the street...literally a closer walk than staying in a  Disney hotel.  It has free parking, comfy beds and all fully REMODELED rooms in 2021!!  Some of the pics still showing up online are old pics of previous rooms.  I am very picky and usually only stay in 4 star resorts but this place far exceeded my expectations.  Affordability and convenience is hard to find this close to Disney!  The added security guard at night made me feel safer as I was checking in alone late at night.  Trust me, you do not want to drive to Disney and make the mistake of getting stuck in their parking garage for an hour.  Walking is the only way to go right now with Covid because

The  Park Vue  is a wonderful location for Disneyland. They're right across the street . Even though the Park was close there's still a lot to do in Downtown Disney. . Our stay at Park Vue always a excellent experience.

The Park Vue Inn is always my choice to stay at when traveling to anaheim! Amazing staff and the cleanest rooms! We have been coming to the Park Vue Inn for three years now and this place never disappoints!

We loved the location of this hotel. The pool and bunk beds were great for our family. The hotel is basic but had everything we needed to sleep and rest during the day. Again, the location can not be beat! My only disappointment was no hot breakfast which was provided when we booked but the breakfast provided was decent and kept us going until lunch. I left a pair of shoes at check out and they have worked with me to return them.

Summary Heading: I can no longer recommend the Park Vue Inn
Summary: My family and I have been staying at the Park Vue Inn for 20+ years. In fact, we have evangelized it as the most convenient property to stay when visiting Disneyland. While the location is still great, The deal-breaker for me is that they will no longer hold your luggage. Maybe this is a new trend but I was stunned when I was told I would have to leave my luggage in our rental car until we could check-in. Maybe I'm out of touch but I have never had a hotel, where I was going to stay, not hold my luggage on my check in-out or check out day.   I would have been happy to pay a holding fee if that is what was needed for the property to keep my luggage safe.   But I was refused. If you have ever had your luggage stolen from your car, you know that any cautious person would never do
Manager Response: Dear Traveler,   We extend our sincere apology for the inconvenience you experienced upon check in. If you were told by any member of our staff that we do not offer this service we apologize for the miscommunication. Please note that we do offer complimentary courtesy holds and transfers of luggage before check-in and after check-out to every guest of our hotel.

Summary: We always stay here and have consistently experienced great and friendly attitudes by the staff. No, this is not a luxury hotel, but it is clean, generally up to date (some of the rooms have jacuzzis, is relatively quiet for a non-corridored hotel, has a nice little breakfast as part of its booking, and the convenience to Disneyland is unparalleled. We've already booked another stay...

Summary Heading: Clean and Extremely Close to Disneyland
Summary: Our room at the Park Vue Inn was clean and practical.  The bunk beds were great to have for the kids.  The location is spectacular and really can't be beat.  It's an older motel, but kept up well and our room was very clean.  The staff were friendly.  There was ample parking while we were there (at a peak park time).  The only thing that could be improved was the water pressure of the shower.  Other than that, I would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Perfect stay! you cannot get any closer to Disneyland, nice, clean, comfortable, good breakfast. It was my niece's recommendation, also near Denny's, Mcdonald's, and Panera. This will be my place for holidays to come.

Summary Heading: Another near flawless visit to an old favorite close to Disneyland
Summary: We last visited the Park Vue in 2012 and gave it a good review, and I have to say it's only gotten better.  There have been some much needed updates to the furniture and decor and they're all very thoughtful ones (tile floors and bath surrounds, stone counters, moving the bath vanity to outside of the bathroom so people can get ready while someone is showering, etc).  The beds and bedding are updated as well, making them very comfortable (albeit a bit too firm for me, but I'm unusual).  If you're a light sleeper, you should ask for a 2nd floor room, and you'll still hear movement on the walkway so earplugs would be useful.  As previously, the staff were all great, start to finish.  Also, it remains a breeze to get from the Park Vue to the parks, which makes it easy to come back

Summary Heading: The Perfect Place to Stay Close to the Park
Summary: We stayed here right before Christmas for a two day trip to Disneyland. We loved it! The lobby was so cute and decorated with a fireplace setting. They had free breakfast complete with make your own waffle irons. Our room was spacious and accommodating and the walk to the park was two minutes! Literally across the street. The front desk staff was so friendly and welcoming. We loved our stay and definitely will be back.

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay when visiting Disneyland!
Summary: You can't get any closer to the park!  It is even closer walk than the Disneyland hotels, without all the price.  Rooms were clean and very comfortable.  It is motel style so people do walk by your window to get to their rooms, but we had no issue with noise while we were there.  Rooms were spacious and you have a whole little kitchenette so easy to fix something for breakfast or make a lunch to bring into the park.  It is a quick walk back for a mid afternoon nap to head into the park for a late night.  I heard the breakfasts used to be much better with hot eggs and sausage, but we did fine with a toasted bagel and a hard boiled egg.  Would stay there again!

We recently visited Disneyland, CA and this was the hotel we chose based on a friend's recommendation. It is pretty much right across the street from Disneyland, so it is very convenient if you want to head back to your room for a mid-day nap. The rates, though pricey, are what I would expect for a quality lodging so close to a major tourist attraction. There is a full breakfast included with your stay. This was quite good, although I wish there had been more protein optons. There is a decadent Ice-cream parlor attached to Park Vue and it has an amazing variety of flavours. There is also an IHOP next door. The rooms are spacious and clean. The pool is nice and well maintained. The gym is very small, but most who are going to Disneyland may feel they've had more than enough

Our family of four stayed here mostly for the location!  Being right across the street from Disneyland entrance is so convenient!  We were able to take a midday break in the room and we brought two 14 yr olds with us that were glad the hotel was so close.  Not waiting for shuttles was a huge time saver as well.   We had a room on first floor with a Queen bed and bunk beds.  The room is pretty small, but we managed and the girls each sat in their beds to do whatever they wanted.  We could only watch tv from the Queen bed, luckily the kids didn’t mind so we didn’t have to fight over what to watch.  You can’t see the tv from the bunk beds.    Our room had a mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker.  All very convenient!  Checking in and out was very easy and quick.  No issues with

We have stayed at the ParkVue Inn and Suites before and it didn't disappoint us at all this trip either. We love staying here because the employees are so pleasant and very helpful if you need anything. It is just across the street from the entrance to Disneyland plus it is within walking distance to several restaurants. The rooms are very clean and the property is maintained well. We will definitely be returning here again.

Everything from the proximity to Disneyland, the property, the customer service, and the room was amazing. The only reason I did not give this place a 5/5 was the lack of variety at the complimentary breakfast. I expected more of a buffet style i.e. scrambled eggs, bacon etc. Instead there were only hardboiled eggs (which my 5 y/o doesn't like) yogurt, waffles, muffins, cereal. It was a good enough breakfast to get the day started but just not what I expected. I have seen some reviews re: noise levels, but I honestly didn't experience any issues with that. Also, there was plenty of parking. I really liked that at night there were security guards.

Mold in the bathroom in multiple places, under the faucet. LOUD, you here all road noises, the guy in the street corner playing the sax, all neighbors in the morning.  You stay here with the wonderful employee and location only. Breakfast was carbs, toast, muffins, waffles, danish, cold cereal, precooked boiled eggs.

Summary Heading: Excellent location.  Crosswalk to Disneyland entrance is right there.
Summary: Clean and comfortable and well maintained older hotel.  Chose this for its proximity to Disneyland entrance.  The crosswalk (across Harbor) is only a few feet from this hotel.  Could not be easier.  We were able to keep our car in the parking lot past our check out time (while we were at Disneyland throughout that day) which is extremely generous (not offered at other nearby hotel), Because we had a rental car (which was, by all appearances, safe in this hotel parking lot) this was a deciding factor to stay at this hotel.

The location of this hotel if you are staying to go to the Disneyland parks is perfect. The lady on reception that checked us in was very personable and went out of her way to facilitate an early check in and I couldn’t be more thankful after a 13hr flight.   The rooms are clean and beds comfortable.   The pool area is a good size and very clean.   We would definitely recommend this property to anyone in the future. It was perfect value for money and location is prime.

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay for a Disneyland visit
Summary: The hotel was clean, comfortable and reasonably priced.  Breakfast is complementary.  It offers the best location for a Disneyland visit. You, literally, walk across the street to the walkway into the park.  Parking at the hotel is complementary, too.  This saves you the $20-$30 cost to park your vehicle at the Disney parking facility.

This place is so close to the park it is “spooky”. Clean, quiet, a very nice light breakfast bar and a warm pool and hot tub to refresh your achey “skeleton”.  All of the staff were very kind and cheerful.  We will be back

This is my second stay at this hotel . I was looking for a good deal around the Disneyland area , walking distance and free parking . I love this hotel ! Is Right across Disneyland!  Safe , Comfortable beds , clean rooms and very friendly staff. They have complementary breakfast also . I decided to eat at downtown Disney so I haven’t experienced their breakfast.

We were a little uneasy about our trip to Disneyland, since we would be staying outside of the Disney bubble (we are used to WDW in Florida).   Well let me take any uneasiness away with this review. It’s not a 5-star hotel by any means, but this is quite a nice hotel when visiting Disneyland.   Decent rooms, free breakfast (hot = waffles) and several different food and stock-up store options (7-11, Walgreens, CVS, restaurants, fast food) all within walking distance (1 to 3 blocks away).  Our family of four (read as mom, dad and two adult children) didn’t have any issues of the room being too small  Hotel has a pool and a hot tub as well and Cold Stone (ice cream) is attached to the hotel.  This hotel is right at the crosswalk where you walk to east entrance. Literally right

It's 4 years since we last stayed at the Park Vue and it's still as good as ever. Rooms are spacious with all the facilities that you need. Free parking, free breakfast, good WiFi and a 5 minute walk to Disney, what more is there to need. I agree with previous reviews about the hot breakfast no longer been available but this is only a minor issue. I would suggest the carpets could do with a renewal has they have seen better days but overall still our go to hotel in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Still a great hotel, just need to bring back hot breakfast
Summary: We've stayed there many times over the years.  The things we love about it is the location (across from Disneyland, 5 minute walk), cleanliness (Clean rooms, pool and property is well kept), and friendly staff.  The one thing that we missed from this visit was the hot breakfast.  The hot breakfast DEFINITELY sets Park Vue Inn apart from the other locations.  Now the breakfast is just like any other place, yogurt, cantaloupe/pineapple/grapes, cereal, muffins, waffles, etc.  My family and I would really like to see them bring this back.  But overall, this is a great location.

Summary Heading: This is a nice little gem across from Disneyland
Summary: The Park Vue inn is really nice motel right across from the entrance to Disneyland.  There are alot of nice things about this motel, and that location is great, just a 5 minute walk to the Disneyland/DCA gates.  Being so close, coming back to rest from the parks for a while was extremely quick and easy, and the walk at the end of the day was nice and short when you are so tired.  Also, the motel is very quiet and we never heard any noise once we were in our room.  The staff is extremely friendly and the housekeeping staff kept the place very clean, and not just the rooms, they were constantly cleaning the outside of the buildings as well.  The rooms seem fresh with comfortable bedding and adequate dresser space.  It was hot during out stay, so we got to test out the AC and it

This hotel had wonderful staff, spacious rooms, clean and a perfect location to Disneyland.  The pool was a great break in the afternoon.  You can see the Disneyland fireworks from most rooms.  The breakfast is now average as they took away the hot food items.

Summary Heading: Gone down hill since 2 years ago- disappointed!
Summary: We stayed here 2 years ago in one of their deluxe jacuzzi rooms and we were super impressed with our stay! The room was clean, quiet and jacuzzi was fab after a long day at the Disney parks. Now we returned last month and while the hotel is still clean and the jacuzzi was still great, quiet it was not! There was some carpark work going on immediately behind our hotel room and even though it stated it would start at 8am, it started at 6.45am each morning and was so loud that even though I’m a deep sleeper, I was too awake from it to return to sleep, not ideal when you’re at Disney until after midnight the night before. This wasn’t the hotel’s fault but I do believe some kind of compensation should’ve been made for this. Two years ago when we stayed we were super impressed with

This hotel is directly across the street from the Disneyland pedestrian entrance. It is within walking distance to many food and shopping options. The room was super clean and the staff was very friendly. My family stayed two nights and enjoyed our stay and will return again when in the area.

Summary Heading: Great little hotel close across from Disneyland. GEM OF A PLACE!!!
Summary: My daughter and I spent nights at Park Vue Inn in July. I must say we were so pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness and cuteness, such that it in no way felt like a motel. Staff was nice and pleasant, AC was quiet, bathroom and vanity areas were spacious, and beds were awesome!! I would definitely recommend staying here! (As an aside, we stayed at the next door Best Western Park Place Inn in June, and were not as impressed. The clerk was RUDE! And our room was WAY in the back). Park Vue is much nicer rooms also.

Stayed here for a couple of days while visiting Disneyland.  This hotel is directly across the street from the main entrance, so it was very convenient.  Room was comfy and clean.  A bit outdated, but we weren't there much, so we really didn't care.  Breakfast OK but sufficient.

Summary Heading: This was our go to hotel, but no more
Summary: We’ve stayed at the Park Vue Inn an average of 45 days a year since 2014. It’s always won out because it’s price, cleanliness, proximity to the park and breakfast was comparable to another hotel that we used to frequent, but it’s pool was deeper. Unfortunately, on this summers 15 day trip they changed the breakfast without warning just prior to our trip!  The hot items have been removed. All that’s left are sugary carbs and slimy hard boiled eggs, which is not good fuel or good for health. We even paid $400 more to stay here then the other hotel because my kids liked the deep pool and everything else was pretty equal to each other. Once they removed the hot protein breakfast we ended paying an extra $40/day to get breakfast that could fuel us properly. That made this stay over

This may not be the nicest hotel in the area but any of its shortcomings are made up for in the location. It can't be beat! It's the closest hotel to Disneyland. It was clean and has a free breakfast. IHOP and Coldstone Creamery are located on the property.

This is our go to place when visiting Disneyland Parks. It's,clean,  the staff is great. A short walk to the park, which is much needed after a long day of walking in the park. And restaurants a hop,skip and a jump, or a short walk to Downtown Disney. Plus they have rooms to accommodate large families..

We have stayed at this hotel multiple times.  This is a poor quality hotel, however we have stayed for the continental breakfast and the location.  The hot food has been removed from the continental breakfast, leaving the price of this hotel astronomical for the quality.

Summary Heading: Fantastic service...old style motel but still very comfortable.
Summary: Perfect location, nothing fancy but we had a comfortable room. It's an older motel but it has been well maintained and updated. The staff was very professional and helpful. We were able to spend the day at Disney then come back to rest and swim before returning in the evening. The line at the Disney ticket booth was long and slow. We returned to the hotel to buy our tickets and it only took a minute. Lots of cheaper eating options easily within walking distance. Ihop next door. Breakfast was okay, the kids will like the waffle options but no hot eggs or meats, mostly sweet stuff. Would definitely stay there again.

The location can't be beat, however, when we made the reservation the hotel said there were good protein options for breakfast. This is not the case.  When we arrived an hour before breakfast was over, there was one slice of bread and two chocolate muffins left.  There are 3 choices of sugar cereals and make-your-own-waffles.  No fruit to be seen.  I did complain and they brought out more bread and chocolate muffins. I feel like this was a bait and switch.  The rooms are pretty basic, but comfortable enough.  Nice size fridge and microwave. Good TV options.  The A/C wall units are pretty loud.  The maintenance guy banged his ladder up against our window before 8 am to do touch painting and woke us all up. The ice machine closest to our room was broken our entire stay, but there

The location is perfect for visiting Disneyland as it's just across the street. Rooms are set around the parking lot in two floors. Rooms are nice and clean, nothing special. The pool is nice and quiet. There are basic laundry machines (no timer). Breakfast is very weak, it's a good thing there are different options nearby. We ended up eating somewhere else the next day

I read many reviews and travel posts about the Park Vue Inn.  Still was a little worried about the exterior doors, and smaller size.  NO NEED to worry.  Opened the door and was impressed with the updated room.  Best Location ever, walk across the street to Disney.  Would recommend staying here for families who don't want to deal with shuttle buses or Disney pricing.  The only drawback was the exterior window, you had to keep the room pretty dark with the curtains to avoid having anyone see into your room while not there - and so no sunlight.

We stayed in a room with a queen bed and a bunk bed for our 2 young kids while visiting Disneyland. The location can’t be beat! It is fantastic!! Our room was small but very comfortable. This was our second time staying here and I would definitely come back for a Disneyland trip!

Stayed here while visiting Disneyland.  So close to the gates!  Perfect place to stay - especially with the great service:-) Staff was friendly and helpful.  Outdoor pool and hot tub to relax in after a day at the park (kept very clean!) The bunk beds are a great addition so kids don’t need to share - which can sometimes be a challenge, at least in our family.  Breakfast was alright, nothing fancy.  Kids enjoyed making their waffles.  We would stay here again!

I love this place and cannot wait to stay here again, it is my new go to hotel for Disneyland. I was a bit hesitant about booking it since we had our daughter with us and the only room available was the deluxe king with a Jacuzzi in the room. I’m so glad that we went ahead and stayed here. The Jacuzzi came in handy after a long day at the park and we just wore our swimsuits, so it ended up being fine. It is literally the closest you can get to Disneyland without staying at the Disney hotel. The crosswalk is right outside of the hotel door. The continental breakfast was good and opens at 6:30 AM so we were able to eat before heading to the park. They had bacon eggs biscuits gravy waffles toast bagels coffee chocolate milk...the staple continental breakfast. The bed was really

Summary Heading: 3.5 Rating is more appropriate but had too many minor issues
Summary: So the biggest pro for this place is its location which is why we returned.  Hard to find a hotel closer to the pedestrian entrance. The front desk staff also continues to be good.   However, unlike our first time here, I believe we ran into a few more minor issues.  First, noise.  Although our room was towards the back of the hotel and somewhat private it was near a work project that was going on (to repair a metal gate of some type)  Although signs at the front desk advised that work would be done between 8am and 5pm, the workers actually started working before 7am or at least preparing to work.  We heard metal pipes being moved and even dropped.  Another noise issue was the ridiculously loud ac unit in the room.  It is right next to the bed and much louder than other wall

Great location to Disneyland with a complimentary breakfast.  Nice rooms and wonderful staff.  Get to breakfast early because during the rush it's a bit crazy.  Reasonably priced and your a 10 second walk to the crosswalk that leads to the main entrance of the Disneyland Resort

I stayed at the Park Vue Inn previously in 2012 and it was my first choice when returning to Disneyland recently.  You can't beat the location being right across the road from Disneyland.  If you want to get started at the parks early, or when returning after a long day, you really appreciate being such a short walk from the gates!  Our room was a basic motel style room but just fine for what we needed. Breakfast is included and was great, I really enjoyed the fresh fruit.  The exterior of the buildings were being painted while I was there, but it did not cause any inconvenience to us.

A family friend recommended this hotel for our first trip to Disneyland.  There are some definite benefits to this hotel.  The location couldn’t be better for quick access to the Disney parks.  It is literally right across the street. In addition, the breakfast included with the hotel stay was great.  The front desk staff was welcoming, friendly, and helpful.  The rooms were dark, and  outdated.  Unfortunately on the second day of our stay, I found a live cockroach in the bathroom.  Needless to say, I was afraid to put anything on the floor after that or leave any of my luggage open.

This was our first visit to Disneyland. This location was fantastic! Disneyland is directly across the street. My family of four loved this hotel. We arrived at Disneyland an hour before opening each morning - staying at this hotel made it very easy. Park Vue offers free parking - we didn’t move our car while we were here. We were able to watch the fireworks at Disneyland from our room.  We had a room with bunk beds. The kids loved them and they were big enough for a 12 year old and 14 year old. The bathroom was spacious.   Free breakfast is offered from 6:30-10:00. This was so helpful - it allowed us to grab breakfast and be at the front gates of Disneyland by 7 am. For breakfast we had eggs, sausage, bacon, biscuits & gravy, yogurt, toast, bagels, cereals and make your own

This motel is the closest you can get to the parking for Disneyland without being in the parking lot. The walk only minutes away from the Park entrance, so easy it's a sure bet you will take a break and return to the room while visiting the Disneyland attractions.  Our room was great with two queen size beds and bunk beds, plus a small kitchenette, roomy bathroom and clean and inviting. Parking is available close to the room. Breakfast served in the morning and the food is adequate (the kids loved it!).

You couldn’t ask for a better location than this for a visit to Disney Parks. It’s less than a 10 minute walk to the park entrance. The hotel itself is fairly basic. Clean, comfortable room. Breakfast is very good. We spent 3 nights.

Summary Heading: Perfectly located across from park entrances
Summary: We stayed two nights.  The service was good, the rooms are just okay, not bad.  But the location is amazing - easy to get back to the hotel to rest or clean up.  Free breakfast before the parks open, free WiFi and free parking all made for an easy trip.

I stayed here for Star Wars opening weekend. I stayed here 5 years ago and then stayed a couple of other places near Disneyland 2 years later. This is my favorite place to stay, location is only beat by Disney Grand Californian, but the free breakfast, great WiFi as well as great staff makes this the place to beat. The rooms are simple but clean, may need a bit of a refurb in the bathroom, our hardware was looking a little aged. Microwave and nice size refrigerator were great pluses. Quiet and quaint motel in the hustle bustle. We stayed in room 238 near back was nice and quiet.  This is my Disneyland go to place to stay from now on.

The option for everyone to have their own bed was a selling point!  Additionally, the location was FANTASTIC!  The breakfast had great variety and was just as nice as in a more expensive hotel.  The hotel staff was great when we needed band-aids and happily watched our luggage on the last day while we played more in the park!  The only drawback was a lack of elevator, which at the end of a long day in Disney, would have been appreciated.

Our family of 4 stayed at the Park Vue in in May of 2019. We were very pleased with all aspects of the accommodations.  The room was very clean, beds were comfortable, quiet, breakfast was terrific and the staff was professional. Also, the location is fantastic. Right across the street form the entrance to Disneyland.

I wasnt sure what to expect when I booked this as there was mixed reviews.This place is amazing.We got there early, around 9:30 am, we were expecting to have them keep our bags (which they said they would)but instead were told our rooms were ready.We booked two queen rooms with bunk beds.Rooms 110 and 108 on the ground floor.Not only did we get our rooms early,they still had breakfast going so we were able to get breakfast too!They knew we were all there to celebrate our birthdays and when we came back later that day, they had delivered a special treat bag for each one of us AND a certificate to cold stone for a free individual birthday cake!We were so surprised and grateful for this gesture. Pros:Customer service was better than any place I contacted,Breakfast was delicious and

This hotel is directly across from the Disneyland entrance. Very easy access. Includes a delicious breakfast. Nice selection of food. It has a small store on site and is also within walking distance to many restaurants and shops. Free parking is a plus! We enjoyed our stay.

My daughter and I stayed at the Park Vue Inn the night before going to Disneyland last week. It was a great location, right across the street from the main entrance. We had a suite, which had a bedroom with two queens, along with a living area with kitchenette. It was really comfortable. They had a nice breakfast, and parking was free (which is a real plus around that area). My only complaint is that the Park Vue Inn does not participate with Hotels.com, so I did not get any points for staying there. It was not a cheap stay, so the points would have been appreciated. I will not be staying there again because of that. But overall, the hotel was great-- close to Disneyland, lots of restaurants nearby, friendly people, free parking.

We have tried staying at other hotels near Disneyland but always go back to Park Vue. You cannot beat the location! The front desk staff has always been very friendly and it is such a great deal that parking is included.

we have stayed there before and it was good , nice and close to Disneyland, rooms were good , now since they renovated it's even better , had nothing bad to say , would return in a heartbeat,  thanks Park vue inn

We’ve stayed at numerous hotels near Disney and this one has been our favorite because my kids first and foremost LOVE the bunk beds, LOVE the delicious complimentary breakfast, LOVE that we are literally across the street from the park entrance, and there’s no hidden fees for parking, WiFi, etc.

This was our second stay at Park Vue Inn. It is located directly across the street from the Disneyland entrance which is so convenient. Our room was very clean, quiet, and comfortable. Since we were returning guests, we received a discount when making the reservation via phone. Although the rooms are small, we were only there to sleep and shower. The free breakfast is better than most and includes scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, and potatoes along with yogurt, cereals, waffles, bagels, fruit, oatmeal, toast, drinks, etc. It is served on the 2nd floor and accessed via stairs. Free parking is a nice bonus. Front desk service was prompt. The gift shop located on the property has some nice, more affordable souvenir items.

Summary Heading: Best hotel around that I have experience with the most friendly customer service
Summary: We cannot thank the hotel staff enough for the wonderful experience they provided during our stay.  Yes it is a  complete bonus having Disneyland across the street but the true priceless bonus was the welcoming feeling we had our entire stay by the customer service is employees provide .  You could tell they take pride in their job they treat you well keep the rooms extremely nice the grounds extremely clean and security to boot .  We loved the food the location and our room and especially the staff.  In addition the price was just right for all that was included.  We will be back ~

You cannot get any closer to Disney if staying off site. This motel is great in many ways - free breakfast, free parking, lovely staff, comfortable beds, plenty of USB adapters for charging electronics, strong WiFi signal, lovely little heated pool and hot tub, stone cold creamery (so awesome!!). The air conditioning is pretty noisy but hey, we could see the fireworks from our room! It’s a great choice for a family vacation. No hesitations recommending. Ps they also have a coin operated laundry ($1) which is great when you are on a longer vacation.

Sure, it's not the newest and fanciest, but it's clean, quiet, comfortable, and so close to Disneyland. The hot breakfast is a great value, and our in-room refrigerator/freezer was so much better than we expected it would be. Next time we'll bring ice packs and more food so we can save even more money in the park.   One caveat: The breakfast room is up a flight of stairs, so be prepared to leave your stroller in your room, or park it in the lobby.

This was a great stay! The hotel is across from the Disney entrance which made it very easy to go back and forth from the park for a rest by the pool or to change clothes when the evening got cooler. I was happy to see the rooms were updated and CLEAN. The staff was very friendly. I wish we had stayed here for our entire trip to Southern California.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland, makes it easy
Summary: The room we had was clean and updated.  Though the building was older, the rooms have been remodeled and clean.  The big plus for this facility is how close it is to the main gate at Disneyland.  It made it easy to return around lunch to let the little ones rest and re-energize for the afternoon and evening.  Parking was also on site that made it also very convenient.  The breakfast was a great way to start the day, again very convenient not having to leave for that meal.  I would advise trying to get a room on the 2nd floor since being next to Disneyland there are a lot of children staying with their noisy feet.

Summary Heading: Good Location and Nice Staff, but it’s a Basic Motel
Summary: The Park Vue Inn really is right across from the Main Gate. It’s convenient, but that’s about it. It’s been remodeled and updated, but it’s still an old motel underneath. All rooms are accessed from outside and all face the parking lot.   The breakfast area is on the second level. Even first floor walkways have a step here and there, so it’s not exactly disability accessible. The rate includes a basic breakfast and Wi-Fi. There is no resort fee and no parking fee as many of the other area hotels have. It seemed like a bargain for the added extras. The laundry room was clean and reasonably priced at $1.00 per wash, $1.00 per dry. There’s a machine for purchasing a single load of detergent—also $1.00. Staff were all helpful and friendly. You can buy Disneyland tickets at the front

We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland.  The location simply cannot be beat!  We could walk out our door and be through the turnstiles in 5 minutes.  The front desk staff were always friendly and helpful.  Every evening, they had fresh baked chocolate chip cookies and lemonade in the lobby so we enjoyed that after coming back from the parks at night.  Our room was clean and well maintained.  We had one of the farthest rooms, but it was very quiet since it wasn’t near the road.  We ate breakfast at the hotel every morning and it was very good.  One thing that could be better is offering breakfast a little earlier, like 6:00 or even 6:30.  Breakfast here doesn’t start until 7:00am.  The parks opened at 8:00am while we were there, so we ate as early as we could and

3 things we wanted for our Disneyland Hotel:  proximity to Disneyland, hot tub, free breakfast.  We got 1 out of 3 at Parkvue Inn.    Proxomity to Disney parks: The ONLY way to stay any closer to the Disney entrances is to stay in one of the Disney hotels (and I am pretty sure some of thos are actually further from the entrance).  :-)  Hot tub:  The hot tub looked to have been out of service for b.c quite some time and we did not see any work being done on it during our stay (Saturday-Wednesday).  :-(  Breakfast:  On the plus side, on the day we were able to make it for breakfast, it was very good.  The problem, however, is that for some CRAZY reason the don't start breakfast until 7am.  If you don't already know, if you plan to have even a few minutes of

Summary Heading: Can’t beat the location and clean, some highway noise
Summary: This is an older exterior-exit motel that is well-kept overall and located directly across from the Disneyland gate, saving precious walking steps for the park.  The price was not exactly a bargain during spring break season, but in line with what the neighboring close places were charging.  Also, we were traveling with little ones and found the hidden parking fees of other places just off putting.  The breakfast was also a huge plus and of pretty good quality.  The location made mid-day naps a possibility which helped us push to the end of the nights at Disneyland.  We found the room to be comfortable, bedding was good, but I’m not a fan of even small sections of carpeting, although it looked cleaner than most.  There was some louder than expected highway noise that could be

It's not the Ritz...it's not even a Hilton...but it's great!  Location, Location, Location!  The place is old but well kept and the staff tries.  The rooms are decent for what you pay, and mind you, you know you pay a premium for the free parking, breakfast and LOCATION! If you want to stay in a nicer place, close to DL, then stay on the hotels in Disneyland and stop complaining.   For the price, it's great!  We are hardly there except to sleep for the 8-9 hours and then off to the park anyway.  The breakfast is decent.  Hot meals, eggs...sausage...bacon-ish (the microwave stuff), biscuits, gravy, fruit, cereal, pancakes and waffles....saves you $20-30 for a family of 3-4 people and since we spend so much at the park, this helps!  We stayed here for our little's first trip and

Summary Heading: Second stay as great as the first
Summary: We spent a great week at this hotel enjoying Disneyland and surrounding attraction. We stayed here last year and had a great experience and our return trip did not disappoint. Beds really comfortable and best hotel pillows I’ve experienced including very high end hotels! We took advantage of a generous well appointed breakfast every day and the convenient laundry was also a bonus. I really appreciated the free parking and crazy close proximity to the parks. Our only complaint last year was the WiFi was poor, but it’s been upgraded and worked great this year. Hot coffee in the lobby too, and coffee makers , fridge and microwave in the room. Sadly the weather did not allow a swim in the pool but we enjoyed it last year. Please don’t change a thing! We’ll be back someday soon I

No wheelchair accessibility to breakfast or upper levels.   Must bathroom with bugs and spiders in room.   Convenient location and excellent staff but that doesn't outweigh the inaccessibility and condition of rooms.  Plenty of decent offsite hotels, this isn't one of them.

This hotel is closer to the entrance of Disneyland than some of the Disney hotels.  The room was very clean and the staff most pleasant.  The breakfast was well stocked, a self-serve model which changed a little on alternating days.  There was indoor and outdoor seating; however with the number of rooms, be prepared for a crowded breakfast room.  This can be good thing:  my wife and I sat at a table with four chairs leaving two empty.  We saw a dad and his little girl looking for a place to sit and invited them over.  Shortly, mom joined us too and we met new friends.  Very fun.  The proximity of this hotel must be considered.  Convenience is much enhanced with this.  For example, we needed to change into dry clothes after riding one of the rides.  It was most easy to do so at

It had been a few years since we have stayed at the Park Vue Inn and we were not disappointed. Very clean rooms, good internet connection, comfortable beds and awesome breakfast (crispy bacon, sausage, biscuits & gravy, fresh fruit...). Location was great as I was in a leg cast and saved on walking. Thank you for the great experience, will definitely return.

Well maintained rooms....great breakfast....friendly staff and very close to the Disneyland resort.  Welcoming lobby with fireplace.  Cookies and lemonade at the front desk.  Oh and the continental breakfast is a full breakfast Highly recommend the inn

We were 2 couples sharing the triple queen room & it gave us a bit more privacy than sharing a double queen... a separate room with queen & tv and sharing the bathroom. Although the property is dated, we found it very clean... room facilities, pool area, small fitness room & especially the breakfast area. You just can’t beat the location for a Disney visit & a reasonable cost. We all thoroughly enjoyed our 9 night stay and would return & highly recommend  to others.

Summary Heading: can't get closer to the Disney gate: noisy
Summary: Right across from the Disney gate and free parking.  Can't beat it for location.  Continental breakfast includes eggs, breakfast potatoes and sausage for a lot more.  If you are a light sleeper, get an upper level room.  The hotel is noisy - you can hear every footstep, every door closing.  There are signs all over asking people to be quiet, but it's not the people, I rarely heard voices. It's the building.  Very low lighting in the bathroom and a loud fan when the light turns on.  Nice toiletries, friendly front desk.

Summary Heading: Great location, clean.  great place to stay while at Disney
Summary: We've been staying here for the last 5 years and look forward to year 6.  Great location to Disney-across the street, clean pool, great breakfast, and great staff.  The only thing I would do next year is stay on the 2nd floor. Loud walkers may interrupt your sleep some nights.

Great Hot breakfast of bacon, scrambled eggs, DIY waffles, cereals and juices Directly across from resort entrances Parking included for two cars per room Can park before check in time after obtaining pass, enter resort and then check in after enjoying parks.

Wasn't sure what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised. Rooms were recently redone and are very nice and clean. And this place is literally right across the street from Disneyland. We walked 10 minutes and into the park. The continental breakfast could have been a little better but fresh coffee and a bagel got us through the morning.

The hotel is right across the street from Disneyland so its really convenient. The rooms are spacious and clean. The free breakfast is satisfactory. The staff was friendly. The only complaint I have is the housekeeping. They didnt keep things in the room stocked and they came late in the day. I would stay here again because of the proximity to the parks.

Summary Heading: I am all about being close to Disney
Summary: Rooms are good enough. Clean. But most importantly across from Disneyland.  I am all about staying across the street on Harbor Blvd. We have stayed at just about everyone and this one is good for the money. The pool is great for taking a break.  Free Breakfast.  Close to a market to stock up on snacks and water bottles to bring in the park.  I used to be a regualr at the BW mini suites but they remodeled, increased their price and lost me as a customer.

You really can't beat the location of this hotel for visiting the Disneyland/California Adventure parks.  Right across the street so it's easy to come back during the day if you need to rest, drop off souvenirs/grab lunch, etc.  The room we had included a well sized mini fridge and microwave for making food in your room.  Room was well sized, clean and comfortable.  Nothing luxurious, but the idea is you're spending all day at the theme park, not in your room!  The front desk was very accommodating on holding our luggage before and after checkout so that we could get more hours in at the park right after we arrived & right before we departed. The included breakfast has a good variety of kid friendly foods - waffles, cereal, fruit, yogurt, bagels, toast, eggs, bacon/sausage, etc.

Yes, as others have pointed out, it is aging. The AC/Heating units in the room really need an update. Decent beds (but crappy little pillows). But it was clean and comfortable, and the staff was excellent. There is a nice enough pool and hot tub (which was actually hot!), a very respectable hot/cold breakfast included, a well stocked little store, and a good price/value. But the real selling point is that you get all that and a location right across the street from the Disney parks. Can't beat that.

The Park Vue Inn has a great location for those headed to Disneyland as it is directly across the street from the main entrance (only Disney's California Hotel would be better).  Built in 1962, it is an aging facility whose rooms have some fundamental old problems - poor insulation, old-style wall AC/heat units (not the longer newer type which are fairly quiet and efficient, for example.  Beds are good, furniture is fine, and there is a minifrig and microwave.  There is a good hot breakfast room on the second floor facing towards Disneyland and it has the usual scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, waffles, cereal, bread, yoghurt, fruit assortment.  There is an outside eating area as well and that's a great place to view the daily fireworks show.  The staff are very competent and

Summary Heading: Nothing bad to say about the Park Vue Inn
Summary: Reasonable rates?✅ Across the street from Disneyland? ✅ Clean & comfortable? ✅ Free parking and free quality breakfast included? ✅ Hospitality? ✅ Fridge & microwave? ✅ WiFi & cable? ✅ I’ll be back? ✅✅

There is nothing fancy about this hotel, just your basic needs! It is literally located at the crosswalk to the Disneyland main gate. Linens and towels clean, room tidy, beds and pillows comfy. Rooms exit to outside motel style, however the property felt safe and was monitored by security. Staff was very nice and helpful, and full continental breakfast was a bonus. It offered sausage, eggs, potatoes, waffles, toast/bagles, yogurt, cereal, and drinks. We were only in our room to sleep so the basic amenities were fine. Had a coffee maker, fridge, TV, hair dryer and plenty of places for charging electronics. This is the closest hotel you can find to Disney, and for that we will stay again and highly recommend!

My family and I stayed here last week for a trip to Disneyland. The room was one of the cleanest rooms I had ever stayed in. It was small, but met our needs. It had a microwave and refrigerator and it was nice to have the vanity outide of the bathroom so that someone could use the sink while someone else occupied the shower. The noise level was as expected for a small inn. I could slightly hear the shower of the room next to me and people walking by, but I feel like that is normal. The breakfast was beyond my expectations. I have to say that I have never stayed anywhere else that has offered such a nice and fresh spread of food. They had eggs, turkey sausage or bacon, potatoes, waffles that you make yourself (and the staff is happy to help if you need it), toast, bagels, cereal,

We stayed here for 3 nights. Everything was perfect. The proximity of it's place to Disneyland is just 2 minutes walk.  The staff are friendly and accommodating. I just have one  complaint. The carpet needs to be replaced. It's already dark in color.

Very clean and extremely convenient for visiting Disneyland. We stayed here for the first time in Dec. 2017 and came back again this year in Dec. 2018. Excellent experience both times - staff was friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and nice, and a great value for the price.   There’s two things that make this hotel a must if you’re visiting Disneyland: 1) Location. Within VERY close walking distance (the crosswalk to the Disneyland arch is 20 ft to the right of the hotel). We have previously stayed at the Grand Californian, and it was closer to walk from this hotel than to walk from the Grand Californian to the Disneyland front gate. 2) Breakfast. Free self-serve breakfast every morning including eggs, biscuits & gravy, waffles, etc. which was great to either sit down and eat

I would stay here again anytime, it's so close to the park!  We had the two room suite with enough room for two parents and 4 kids. They even provided cake and candy for my daughter's birthday. What a sweet surprise! A hot breakfast buffet is included, which makes this hotel an even better value. It's not fancy, but it's clean, and did I mention it's so close to the park?!

This hotel was prefect for us.  We had a room with two queens and a sofa bed.  Plenty of space for a large family to be comfortable.  I would gladly stay here again.  Advantages: As close as you can get to the parks, not even a five minute walk to the entrance to the park security checkpoint.  Closer to Disneyland park than any hotel operated by Disney itself.  Clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff.  Nice motel pool that would meet the needs of young kids, with a jacuzzi.  Standard hotel breakfast with eggs, sausage, a hot side dish and the typical waffle makers (2).  You can control the heat and A/C for your own room, to your liking.  Seems either recently remodeled or really well-maintained.  Generally an excellent value compared to other options, I can’t see how you could

We have stayed at many hotels to fulfill our Disney fixes (incl the DLR hotels) and this might be the holy grail!  This place is literally across the street and a welcome sight after a long day in the parks. Check in was a breeze!  The front desk guys were very attentive and friendly even when we checked in so late at night!  The room itself is very basic.  We had a room with two queens and it did everything we needed it to!  The room was clean and came with enough toiletries and towels.  Maybe the AC was a tad bit loud but that's my only negative.  There are lots of outlets for the tech junkie family to plug into.  They serve breakfast; nothing to write home about but an easy choice to fill up and go when you need to be at the park by rope drop!  If you're on the fence just try

This motel is GREAT!  We stayed October 25-29, 2018.  We had 2 rooms, one a double queen and the other a queen with a bunk bed.  There was a total of 6 of us.    The double queen was rather spacious and the beds were surprisingly comfortable, I am a bit of a bed snob, and actually slept very well.  The queen & bunk room wasn't as spacious but worked great for our son and his family.  They had no complaints other than they wished the room was a little more spacious.  The motel has been updated in the last 10 years, and it has been well cared for.  We found it to be clean!!!  The breakfast was about what you would expect for a "Hot" breakfast.  No variety that we saw, Scrambled Eggs, Turkey Sausage, and Potatoes, every day, plus of course the Waffle maker and cereal choices.  It

Summary Heading: Queen + Bunk beds are the perfect option for a family of 4
Summary: We chose this hotel for two reasons. #1 proximity to Disneyland & California Adventure. It is literally across the street. #2 Bunk beds! My husband, teen son and pre-teen daughter stayed in this room and bunk beds allowed my husband and I to share a bed as usual and each child to have their own private bed.   The room was small, but it worked fine since we spent most of our day in the park. The beds were comfy. The bathroom was clean and updated. The tv and wifi worked. There is a little store on site that sells souvenirs, toiletries, snacks, drinks, etc. for very reasonable prices.   The breakfast wasn't anything to shout about, but it was free and the kids were happy with it. There was hot coffee which was good enough for me.   There was a coin laundry on site which we used,

Summary Heading: The beds were not very comfy
Summary: This was our second stay at Park Vue Inn, the previous stay being September 2017. In 2017 I remarked that the beds and pillows were quite comfortable. Something happened as this year everyone thought the beds were way too hard and the pillows lumpy That being said, it is still a good place to stay especially since you don't need to rent a car as you right across the street from the park entrance.

Summary Heading: The only place to stay for a Disneyland Trip!
Summary: I have stayed at several hotels around this area and I truly do think that this is the best hotel in the area. My family raves about the continental breakfast, as that does offer a lot of value to a family that is visiting the park. We always sleep great and there really is not another hotel that is closer than this! It always makes for a good time and they always treat you with kindness. We went for my wife's birthday and they were extremely kind to her and made sure to do some little things to make it special for her. I really appreciated that and it has made a life-long patron for me and my entire family!

We stayed for two nights this week. Two rooms with 2queen beds and bunk bed in each room. The rooms were clean & comfortable. It is located directly across the street from the main entrance to Disney. With free parking, that alone made it worth while. The frig and microwave a plus.  It was great to grab a free quick warm breakfast before heading to the parks. I would absolutely stay there again.

Summary Heading: What?? No Manager or Maintenance on duty???
Summary: We unfortunately stayed here for 2 miserable nights on October 19th and 20th.  I would give "0" stars if possible.
