I've never heard or been subjected to such terrible service and conditions!! It was an outrage!!  Check in:  Normal nothing great.  We were told the motel was sold out and all of the rooms needed to be cleaned.  Fine, no problem.  We asked to be text when the room was ready.  NO TEXT AT ALL!! We walked back about 3:30p.m. to check if the room was ready and it was.  What happen to getting a text about the room being ready??  Room 221 on the 2nd floor:  Now.  The room was a double queen for about $200.00 + tax, etc.,.  Now.  It's a basic room with a tub/toilet combo, sink is out of the tub/toilet area.  Small frig/freeze.  Very old wall unit air/heat AND terribly
Manager Response: I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience you experienced the first night of your stay. I understand that the situation was frustrating for you and did not meet your expectations.   Our managers and our maintenance team are on-call after 11pm. This was communicated to you when you asked to speak to a manager. The front office manager and the on-call maintenance were both contacted that evening regarding your complaint about the tub. Since we were unable to move you to another room and it would be after midnight before the on-call maintenance would arrive, you agreed to stay in your room and have maintenance clear the drain before 8am.   Our maintenance crew knocked on your guestroom door at 7am and you asked them to come back in an hour. They returned at 8am, cleared the drain and cleaned the tub. Housekeeping arrived shortly afterward to service your room. You requested different pillows and the housekeeping supervisor informed you that currently we only have standard size pillows. You then made additional requests to housekeeping and we accommodated those requests to your satisfaction.     Although we don’t like to receive negative reviews about our property, we appreciate your feedback. We will use the information you provided in the rest of your review to evaluate our services. Should you become willing to give us another chance to be of service, we would welcome that opportunity.

Summary: My 5 stars do mean this is a 5 star hotel. It means it fit all my needs perfectly. This is a motel with free parking. And unless you stay at a Disney Hotel, the only place closer to the park entrance is the IHOP across the parking lot. Our room was very clean and had everything we needed. Shampoo, etc., hair dryer, fridge, microwave, coffee. Breakfast was better than many. Eggs, sausage, potatoes, 3 waffle irons, yogurt, cold cereal. We needed a place to sleep the night before and after our 16 hour day at the parks. The location was key and everything else was a perk. I would stay there again with no hesitation.

Summary Heading: Across the street from Disneyland, clean comfortable Rooms & Good Breakfast
Summary: Our family enjoyed our stay at the Park Vue Inn.  The rooms were clean with a microwave and refrigerator.  The breakfast was good with varied items each morning. It was fairly easy to find a parking spot.  They had chocolate chip cookies, lemonade and water in their lobby in the evenings. Best part is Park Vue Inn is across the street from Disneyland. We loved being able to walk across the street to our room after a long day at Disneyland. My husband, son, and I would stay there again.

I love this hotel and stay almost every trip to Disneyland (2-3 times a year)... This is not a fancy hotel. The main draw is the proximity to the theme parks, the walk is the closest of anywhere... But I love the fridge/microwave in every room, and the kitchenettes in the suites. Free (hot) Breakfast, and Free parking, almost unheard of in this area. The pool area is perfect for kids and always immaculate.

This is a great place to stay if you are visiting the park, it is right across the road from the main entrance. The breakfast was good and the room was clean and comfortable, what you need after a long day at the Disney. Plenty of restaurants nearby and there is a convenience store onsite for supplies if you need them. I can't speak highly enough of this hotel, would definitely stay here again. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. Tip If travelling from Aus book and extra night accommodation as check is at 3pm, our flight arrived at 6.30am so was a long tired wait.

Not the flashiest hotel in the world but it’s clean, friendly and the closest you’ll get to Disneyland, with the front lobby literally opposite the crosswalk to the Disneyland park entrance.   Why spend bucketloads to stay in a Disney hotel when you’re only going to be in your hotel room a few hours a day to sleep at the end of a big day at Disney. Save your $$ for a great Disneyland experience and go with Park Vue.

Summary Heading: I can't say enough wonderful things about the Park Vue!!
Summary: This is our fourth time staying at the Park Vue! Each stay has been awesome! The staff at the front desk are always friendly and helpful! When I say "thank you: they always respond with "my pleasure"!  On our first three visits we reserved a room with bunk beds and a queen bed and was always happy with that option. This trip, I reserved the suite and we loved it! It was nice having two TV's and the extra room!  There is a huge selection at the continental breakfast and is always clean and fresh!  Room was very clean with plenty of towels and very comfortable beds.  Very short walk to the front gates!  We look forward to staying here again on a future trip!

Summary Heading: 14 Nights at the Park Vue Inn
Summary: My family of 3 stayed at the Park Vue Inn for 14 nights in August 2018 and we just loved it! This was our 3rd time staying at this hotel. My comments/reviews are below:  Location: Excellent location right across from the entrance to Disneyland. I counted 650 steps from the hotel to the Disneyland entrance which is far fewer steps that it is to the Disneyland hotel. Also, there are a variety of restaurants in the area. Central location.  Pool: The pool area is lovely! Nice and clean and a variety of seating: tables and chairs and lounges. There are areas both in the sun and in the shade depending on what you are looking for. The hotel supplies towels in the pool area. There is also a small hot tub which we enjoyed more than once as we watched the fireworks. The pool's deep end is

We are Disney regulars and have a couple hotels we usually go to.  For our last trip we decided to try Park Vue Inn for a few reasons - we have heard several recommendations for it, it's right across the street, and the price is good.  We were very pleased with our stay!    The proximity to the parks made it very convenient for us to take a midday break at the hotel.  I had read some noise complaints, but we didn't experience any major issues.  We kept the bathroom light/fan on plus we always travel with a fan for white noise.  We only heard footsteps upstairs in the mornings and had no problems with loud t.v.'s or voices.  I think the footsteps were to the breakfast service as we were near the front of the hotel.    The staff was friendly, the room was clean, and most

Summary Heading: A good place to stay when visiting Disneyland!
Summary: We had a very pleasant stay at the Park Vue Inn while we visited Disneyland. The location can't be beat - an easy 5 minute walk to the park's front gates. The room was very basic but clean and nice. The free breakfast in the morning with patio seating was a great way to start each morning! My 11-year old and husband enjoyed the pool. The staff were all very friendly and the people at the front desk were very helpful and accommodating. For the price it was a very good value. We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Thank you for making our Disneyland Engagement trip perfect!!
Summary: We stayed at Park Vue Inn on 8/22 and 8/23/18 to go to Disneyland and our son proposed at the Park.  The staff at Park View went above and beyond with coordination of rooms (the engagement was a surprise as was the second room we had reserved) as well as accepting delivery of flowers and chocolate strawberries with balloons as well as placing them thoughtfully in the room (even to go as far as to place the fruit in the refrigerator). Everyone was friendly and willing to assist with whatever we needed.  Room as immaculate as always and has been updated- was very nice-bathroom and sheets were clean and fresh.  Breakfast was delicious -waffles, eggs and bacon or sausage on alternate days-and was tended to by the staff so that food was replenished as needed but serving are was kept

We love the proximity to the park and the easy location of eateries nearby. The bunkbed rooms are always a hit with the kids. the free breakfast is light and simple but having some food before racing off the the park is a great benefit.

Booked this hotel for 5 nights.  Resort fee is $10/day. It includes parking, breakfast, access to the pool & fitness centre, and WiFi.  Other reviewers have noted that if you stay in a ground floor room you will hear noises from the rooms above you.  Note: If you choose a room on the second floor you may want to place a towel at the base of the door to the room to help keep out the bugs.  While in the room on the first day I found an ant walking on my arm. On the second day I found an ant walking along my glasses. My son discovered the gap underneath the door and plugged it with a towel.   Pros 1. Location -within walking distance to Disneyland, California Adventure and Downtown Disney -just cross the street (South Harbor Boulevard) and within 10 minutes you are at the security

Summary Heading: Best bang for your buck in the area!
Summary: The Park Vue Inn is a simple motel, but it offers lots of amenities and is closer to the Disney park entrances than most of the Disney hotels.  With free parking, hot buffet breakfast, nice outdoor dining area, clean pool & hot-tub with plenty of towels, and rooms that include bunk beds for kids - it really is the best bang for your buck in the area. If you are looking for fancy, then pay four times the price and stay at a Disney property.  But, if you want a decent, clean place to crash for a few nights while visiting Disney and want to be able to walk back to the pool for a quick swim and feed all your kids on a budget.... this was a fantastic option and I would definitely recommend!

This hotel is excellent! Very clean rooms and comfortable beds. Across the road from the entrance to Disneyland and extremely convenient. Breakfast was great with a very good selection of food and drinks. Very quiet and spacious rooms. You can watch the Disneyland fireworks from your balcony. The staff are very friendly, welcoming and helpful. Will definitely stay here again!

Nice hotel, friendly staff, clean rooms, good included breakfast, nice pool and VERY close to the parks (5 minutes walk). Can totally recommend.  We had the suite, and it was perfect for a family of five.

We just keep coming back. The staff are all kind and helpful. Breakfast is fantastic. Rooms are clean. The A/C wasn’t working and they immediately moved us to another room, even transferred our luggage for us and comped that night for us.  We won’t stay anywhere else near the park. Enjoy!

Traveled with our adult children and younger grand kids (9-11) Our room slept 6 with two queens and a pull out couch perfect for our needs. The full kitchen was a surprise and even though we didn't use it was well stocked. The free full breakfast in the morning was great. Eggs, Sausage, Waffles, Cereal, Juice and Coffee. Very clean Safe and right across the street from Disneyland.

Very clean, quiet, comfy and safe room - only a 5 minute walk to Disneyland and California Adventure parks. Great breakfast and rooftop view of DL fireworks. Have stayed at another hotel for all prior trips here and the Park Vue Inn exceeds in all areas. Will definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay fro Disney trip!
Summary: This 2-level motel-like property is directly across the street from Disney entrance.  It is clean, friendly, and has a great free breakfast.  The staff is very friendly and responsive.  The rooms have been updated in the last handful of years.  They aren't 5-star quality, but are pretty good....and most likely you are staying here to go to the parks, and not hang out in your room all day.  This is third time we've stayed there, and will continue to do so every time we visit Disney!  Great value & location!!

Summary Heading: Closest to Disneyland - Clean - Great Breakfast
Summary: Park Vue is the closest to the crosswalk into Disneyland.  It's close enough to walk back for a mid-day nap for little ones (and parents!) if needed.  It was VERY clean.  The free breakfast was one of the best we've had.  They had 3 workers who kept everything well stocked and the tables clean.  The scrambled eggs were freshly made. Breakfast room on the 2nd floor had plenty of seating.  There were available parking spaces.  It is next to several family-friendly restaurants.

Perfect location Disneyland! Many places to eat within a very short walk. Rooms are clean and comfortable! Service was great! People were very friendly! If your going to Disney I highly recommend staying here!

We thought this hotel was perfect and for a great price. My daughter loved the bunk bed, it was nice to have a fridge and microwave in the room. We used the pool and hot tub and could even see fireworks from the pool. It was great not to need a car or wait for a shuttle since we were right across the street. We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Location, location, location....and great place to stay!
Summary: While not a "luxury" place to stay, this place deserves its excellent rating as it does absolutely everything you could need for a Disney visit.  Location is pretty much unbeatable, walk out of the motel, cross the road and you are at the entrance pathway to Disney - awesome. Easy to see the nightly fireworks from the balcony in front of you door.   The rooms were very suitable and clean. Beds were a little high of the ground, but very comfrotable. Aircon / heating worked well. Wifi (free) was great.  While simple the breakfast is more than adequate to set you up for the day with quite a few options and great waffles.  All staff except for 1 we encountered we're friendly, polite, efficient and keen to help. Cookies, cordial and hot drinks available free at reception were a

This is a great Hotel directly across from Disneyland's main entrance. I really feel it was faster to walk to the hotel from the front gate of Disneyland then walking to the tram and then walking to your car in the parking structure. I was able to  park my car the day of arrival, prior to check in, and keep it there until midnight the next day, even though I checked out earlier that day. It really made my stay stress-free. The hotel staff made you feel welcomed from the point of check-in to check out. This hotel was clean and the rooms were nice. The staff in the breakfast area and housekeeping were very helpful and professional. I would recommend Park Vue Inn as an affordable stay to friends and family.

We stayed here for 6 nights for our first family Disneyland trip in May 2018. The combination of price, park proximity, breakfast being included and friendly staff made this a perfect choice for us. We stayed on an upper floor to reduce noise which I would recommend. Our room (queen and 1 bunk) was clean and modern, albeit a bit small. We were never in our room except to sleep or change for a swim though, so we didn’t need a spacious room. Literally directly across from the gates to Disney, which was invaluable. We could pop back for a swim, or to reset before the fireworks (which are viewable from the upper breakfast deck, but I highly recommend being IN the park for them as the experience is incredible). Walkable to restaurants, pharmacies, other amenities if need be. We’ll

We loved our stay at Park Vue. It was comfortable, clean and quiet. Would definitely stay again. Fabulous proximity to Disneyland. My only criticism is the Fitness centre could be improved with a bike.

Stayed here again for free wi-fi, parking & delish breakfast. We had friends visit for 90mins & they parked free also. Alondra at front desk was great, & to walk across street & be at Disney is invaluable. Prices have gone up here, like everywhere, but engineer came to help w/jacuzzi, so all was fine. DO be aware to get early to Mouse House is important, I'm gonna write next review on the "Crowd-iest Place on Earth" !!

Listed as a "budget" hotel, im not sure what we paid qualifies as budget.  Location to parks is superb.  None better. Free wifi appreciated, and parking.  Breakfast is a pretty good offering of cold and hot item... waffles, bacon, eggs, cereal, potatoes, etc. On the downside, soundproofing is miserable.  Probably not uncommon for this age of hotel.  If youre a light sleeper, look elsewhere.  Housekeeping spotty, but front desk responsive.

Summary Heading: Park Vue Is Where Its At!
Summary: Park Vue is approx 20 minutes from the Santa Ana (John Wayne Airport) and about 20 steps from the entrance to Disneyland. The location could not possibly be better. The hotel is located across the street (literally across the street from the entrance) but it is far enough away you don't hear any park noise aside from the fireworks.  Our room had two queen beds that were SO comfy, a tv, a bathroom and sink along with a large closet, mini fridge and microwave. Our room did not have a safe but that wasn't a deal breaker for us. Complimentary breakfast is served on the roof top which was really neat. It is a full hot breakfast with waffles, eggs, sausage or bacon, hashbrowns or biscuits, gravy, fruit, yogurt, bagels, toast, bread, cereal, coffee, tea and juice. If you are not into

We stayed here for our first Disneyland trip with our twin  two year olds, and will stay here for future Disneyland trips.  Location is directly across the street, customer service was great, a decent  breakfast buffet, clean rooms, on-site laundry room, and parking.   The lobby has coffee, tea, hot chocolate so it was nice to grab a coffee on the way to the park, and grab some hot chocolate returning from the park to the room at night.  They allow you to take breakfast back to the room, just ask for a tray. This was nice as I let the kids have breakfast in bed while I got dressed.   Overall, great stay for our first family Disneyland vacation.

Summary Heading: Fabulous location! Super close to Disney entrance.
Summary: We enjoyed our visit at the Park Vue Inn.  Its location is perfect if you are visiting the Disney parks.  It is a quick walk to/from this hotel to the Disney parks.  I've stayed at the Candy Cane Inn (loved it!!) but the only thing we didn't like was waiting for the free hotel shuttle (or walking back on our own to the CCI.)  The Park Vue Inn is so close and was much appreciated after a long day at Disneyland.  I highly recommend staying in a room on the 2nd floor because we had a room on the 1st floor & could hear almost every noise above us.  Any time someone walked, showered, used the toilet, etc., we heard it.  And, the worst noises were from the housekeeping carts or luggage rolling along the walkway upstairs.  It sounds like a plane landing--no joke.  Otherwise, the room

We found this hotel by reading Disney Tourist blog which gave it an extremely high rating and the hotel did not disappoint!  The beds were so comfortable that I miss them now we are home!  The full breakfast each morning meant we could eat before going to Disneyland and it was the closest hotel to the Main Gate.  Just cross the street and you are at the gate within minutes.  The staff were friendly and responded immediately to our requests and helped us get a cab the morning we left.  Rooms were clean and quieter than I expected (although you can hear the fireworks every night but to me that is a bonus!)  We had a room with bunk beds and my teen sons really enjoyed not having to share a queen bed.  We never used the pool but it was nicely surrounded by shrubs to give it more

Stayed here with 12- and 9-year old, 4 nights. Everything worked in this hotel - bunk beds for the kids, hot tub and pool, decent breakfast. 5-10 min walk to the park entrance. Handy off-site places to eat - iHop, Panera, pizza.There's a microwave and fridge. Comfortable beds and pillows. Minor plumbing issues fixed quickly. We got one magic morning with our tickets and MaxPass. Could see (and hear) fireworks from the room. Handy on-site shop for miscellaneous items. Pool was across the parking lot.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for family trip to Disneyland.
Summary: This hotel will be our top choice for trips to Disney.  This is our third trip to Disneyland with our kids, but this was by far the best hotel experience.  The location is very close to the entry gate and was within a short walk.  Great service too!

Wonderful stay at the Parkvue during a visit to Disney.  Clean, comfortable rooms, pretty grounds, helpful staff and a good complementary breakfast.  The motel is so convenient - directly across the street from the entrance to the parks and Downtown Disney.  Convenient food options located within walking distance for lunch and dinner.  Would absolutely stay here again!

Can't get much closer to Disneyland than this. One of the days was really hot so we just walked less than 56 minutes across the street and waited with the AC on until it cooled down. Nice rooms with free wifi and free parking and a tasty complimentary breakfast. I would stay here again.

Even though this is a 2 star rated hotel, it has 5 star location. Can't get any closer. I have stayed at Disneyland hotel before and it is a long way to the park from there. We loved the ease of just getting up, grabbing a coffee, and crossing the street to get in line! You can even see the fireworks from the hotel, and take a nap when you get tired from the running around! Would stay here again!

First of all...the location can not be beat. It is literally right across Disneyland which is not only convenient but also saves you on the parking fee.  Pros- ++We booked the family suite, which has 2 queens & bunk beds. It was enough space for 5 of us. Unfortunately, they said the bunks were uncomfortable and slept with us in the queens. ++Free wifi ++Free breakfast ++Free parking ++Clean room ++In room safe, fridge  CONS-And these are pretty significant ++AC did n't work at all. Fortunately for us, it was in the 50-60's outside, so the room was not hot or uncomfortable. ++We were on the 1st floor and the noise from upstairs kept me up/woke me up. I could hear the doors closing, toilets flushing, people talking. ++The toilet was clogged on the morning of check out. That was
Manager Response: I am truly sorry for the experience you had during your recent stay and I apologize for the interaction you had with the staff.  Considering your mention of all the good reviews you read about our property I was surprised to read your comments to contrary.  We appreciate your feedback and we discuss all reviews in our weekly management meeting. The managers from each department have taken the necessary steps to address your comments with their respective staffs. Should you decide to change your mind about not staying again, we would welcome that opportunity to be of better service.

Summary: We usually stay at a resort, but I wanted to save some money and reduce walking time. The location of the Park Vue simply cannot be beaten. It's directly across from the park!   The room was clean, the free breakfast was very nice, and the hot tub was a bonus!  The only downside, a low flow shower, and very uncomfortable pillows; but after walking a day at the parks, you don't notice the pillows at all.

We have stayed in several hotels across the street from Disneyland but this one is definitely the best. It’s clean and quiet. The continental breakfast had 2 waffle makers, which the kids loved. They also loved the bunk beds. My only issue is that Mac products sometimes have difficulty connecting to the Wifi and the staff is aware of this but never gave us the heads up at check in. With so many families with iPhones or iPads they should have a sign at the front desk. It was a super easy fix but the front desk had to get their IT guy on the phone so he could manually get our iPads on the WiFi. It worked great after that but I wish I had a heads up. Other than that, the stay was perfect. We will definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: No hotel has a better location for Disneyland access!
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue Inn last year when visiting Disneyland.  The hotel is in general a nice 2 star property - clean but with no frills.  The room stayed dark and cold which are our only real requirements.  The staff was helpful as we did have an issue they needed to address for us.  They took care of it quickly.  The best part of all is that this hotel is literally across the street from Disneyland.  There is no property closer (including the Disney properties (I am of course not counting the Grand Californian's proximity to California Adventure.  For a cheap hotel with a great location though, you can't beat the Park Vue.

Summary Heading: Best location, very clean, quiet, you will love it
Summary: Our family stayed here for 5 nights in late March and will stay here again when we return. There is no better location, literally across the street from Disneys main gates. Our bunk bed room was nice, clean and spacious. The bunk bed itself was very comfy and sturdy enough for my 7 yr old monkey. Generally, I sleep poorly in hotels but not here! Disney coma notwithstanding, the grounds and balcony area are quiet in general and very quiet at night. It makes for a peaceful sleep until we all start waking up and heading for breakfast at 7am. I kept the fan on low just in case (heat and cool worked great BTW). Expect to hear the nearby traffic if you’re closer to the front desk. Well stocked with towels, pillows and even eye makeup remover. The fridge is a good size and water

Loooved our stay here - plenty of FREE parking - great service and it’s the closest to the Disneyland gates. Made it easy to come back and forth from the park during the day. We got a small room with a queen bed and bunk beds - it was super small but the kids loved the bunk beds and it kept them from having to share a bed - bonus!!! The pool, breakfast and laundry were really nice too. Only downside is I wish breakfast would have opened earlier - sometimes we had to wait when we wanted to get the park before it opened. We will be staying here again!!!

Park Vue Inn is very close to the entrance to Disneyland.  It's very easy to come and go to the park.  Facilities are clean and safe.  Breakfast is provided as part of the room rate.  Breakfast is good with bacon, eggs and waffles.  This is a great value for being so close to the park.

This hotel came recommended to us by friends and although it was a bit more spendy then others further away it was worth every penny!! We went on the Roaring Rapids in California Adventure and it was super nice to just be able to go back to the hotel and get dry clothes! It was clean, beds comfy and the staff was great!! When we come back we will stay here again...I won't even look around!!

Summary Heading: Nothing Better for a trip to Disneyland
Summary: I'm almost hesitant to write this, as I feel like Park Vue is still a bit under the radar, and is a hidden gem.  When it comes to a visit to Disneyland, there are no shortage of hotels from which to choose. We've always stayed at ones near Disney, but a shuttle ride away.  This year, we decided to choose a hotel that was walking distance to the park.  We literally could not have chosen one any closer.  After extensive research into all the hotels that are on Harbour Drive, Park Vue really stood out from the pack.  The staff was exceptional and so helpful, the room was well appointed and comfortable, parking is free and they let you leave your car there until midnight on day of checkout, breakfast is included, and did I mention - its walking distance to Disneyland??   I really

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn each year.  Our last trip was in August of 2017 and was fantastic. We booked the king suite.  It is quiet, VERY clean and the location is simply amazing.  When you are exhausted from a day in Disneyland, it is simply a walk out the main gate to your hotel.  The staff are outstanding, the rooms wonderfully clean, recently updated and have comfortable beds. The rates are ok but you cannot get a better or quieter locations. A light breakfast is also included in the room, nothing fancy but fills the spot and has warm food to boot! We have already rebooked a trip this April and looking forward to returning.  I highly recommend this room if you want a clean room, excellent location (it doesn't get much better), comfortable beds and a nice breakfast with

This was our first but not our last stay here.  It was so convenient to the entrance to Disneyland.  The room was clean, updated and there were very comfortable beds. I appreciated the many outlets and USB ports.  The included breakfast was very good. My husband was sick for a couple of days and had the do not disturb sign out,  They called to make sure everything was ok.

Nicest front desk people. We were early so they told us where to go get great Mexican food and then texted us when our room was ready. Our room was SUPER clean, quiet, cool, and nice. Continental breakfast had eggs, waffles, juice, coffee, potatoes, sausages, cereal, milk, toast, peanut butter and more. It was great. Very clean. The mattresses were pretty bad. My back was killing me by the end of our trip. But that was our ONLY complaint. Housekeepers were very nice. Grounds crew carried our luggage upstairs for us and back down again. Nice little gift shop with snacks on sight. The best part was we were right across the street from the Disney entrance. I will always stay here.

Summary Heading: Nothing closer to Disneyland, the end
Summary: Deals were good, and splurged to the closest lodging to the Disneyland entrance. Room was great as before. Ihop just at the parking lot, Denny's, Panera, McDonalds, just a short walk. Room discount at Coldstone Creamery. Check-in staff friendly.  Nice to be able to just walk across the street to Disneyland, no marking, no fuss. Even nicer to walk back to the room for snacks, or a rest. Really love the signs around the property reminding people to mind their noise for others. Hot breakfast on the 2nd floor 7am, very nice. In room safe. What's not to like. Perfect stay.

My 15 year old daughter and I had a 5 night stay here on the final leg of a tour around the West Coast.  Although the location is undoubtedly what sells this place, it also has other things going for it.  The staff are very friendly and we had no trouble replacing a lost room key.  The beds were very comfortable.  We had a ground floor room which meant we had to pull the curtains for privacy but we were able to park right outside.  Would definitely recommend this hotel if you want a Disney fix without paying Disney prices!

This hotel has absolutely the best proximity to Disneyland you can get without being inside the park!  Perfect with kids who may want to go back and nap at some point in the day. For the money, terrific hotel all the way around. Highly recommend!

Summary Heading: Park Vue is a little known gem.
Summary: I stayed here from January 15 through January 17. I have stayed here before. I have also stayed at the Disneyland Hotel.  This hotel is by far closer to the parks than Disneyland Hotel. The rooms, surprisingly, are even nicer than the Disneyland Hotel.  Especially for the value. It's a pleasure only having to walk a short distance at night when you're tired from walking around the parks all day.  It is an exceptionally clean hotel.  It also appears that they renovated it to look very modern in the rooms. Has a great reception staff who is eager to help. Additionally, they have a great breakfast including eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage, and biscuits with gravy. They also have waffles and an assortment of juices.  This is such a great value that I will return again and again.

We've stayed at the Park Vue hotel many times.  It is conveniently located across the street from the Disneyland entrance.  The front desk employees are helpful and friendly. The free breakfast is basic but suitable.  When we stayed in January 2018, they had scrambled eggs, turkey link sausage and potatoes as the hot offerings.  One morning biscuits and gravy replaced the potatoes.  They also offer make-your-own-waffles, packets of instant oatmeal, bread/bagels to toast, cold cereal, yogurt, mixed fruit salad and hard boiled eggs.  The breakfast room is on the 2nd floor and there are no elevators. If you need a wheelchair to get around, you will need to send a member of your party up to fetch your breakfast. The lobby has coffee/tea/hot chocolate all day.  In the evenings after

Summary Heading: Perfect Place to Stay if Visiting Disneyland
Summary: This is literally across the street from the park entrances and downtown Disney.  No more than a 5 minute walk to the park entrance.  It is an old motel that has completely renovated each rooms.  I am a bit picky about hotels...so was a bit reluctant...but was pleasantly surprised.  It comes with a free breakfast to get the day going before Disney and a free spot to park you car.  Breakfast is similar to a Hampton Inn breakfast.  The pool was very pretty, but we didn't visit it as it was to cold.  And the staff were all very helpful and nice.

We stayed in a triple queen with my 6 year old twin grandsons and their parents. The room was spacious and everything we needed for 2nights. It was winter and we spent all our time in the park and did not use the pool. Right across the street from the entrance. The staff put our bags in the room when it was ready as we arrived early and went straight to Disneyland. Great breakfast with plenty of offerings. Very friendly staff.

Summary Heading: Excellent and wonderful property and staff
Summary: Stayed at Park Vue Inn for 5 nights from 19Dec to 24Dec at their Double Queen Mini Suite.  Staff were excellent, warmth, knowledgeable and friendly right from the front desk, housekeeping and maintenance guys.  Room was excellent, clean and immaculate. Bed were super comfortable and toilet was clean and everything was functioning properly.  Abundance of eateries nearby just a stone throw away such as Denny’s, Tomy Roma’s, next to IHop and a Cold Stone Creamery on-site. Could not have ask for more.  Cold Lemonade, cookies and hot coffee/tea are made available at the reception area.  A BIG THANK YOU and KUDOS to all the staff at Park Vue Inn Anaheim for making our holiday a memorable, wonderful and unforgetable experience.

First, you see a Motel and then you walk inside your room to find bunk beds!  Very well updated room.  Very nice to have a fridge and microwave in the room!  Staff is very friendly!  Breakfast is typical hot/cold items.  Viewing deck for evening fireworks available.  Didn't get to the pool because of time constraints.  Free parking for your vehicle.  This property came highly recommended from one of my FB travel pages and didn't disappoint!  It is a small room but we weren't in it for long!  Well worth it!

Always stay close to Disney but this was our first stay at Park Vue. It definitely  won't be the last.  Easy, quick check in, clean, nicely decorated room wuth everythimg we needed. Breakfast was sufficient.  Plenty of room both inside abd out. My only wish would have been hot cereal, oatmeal maybe, instead if the eggs which were cold both mornings. Overall nothing but good things to say about this hotel. Would recommend to anyone  wanting a good place to stay on your next trip to the happiest place on earth.

We have stayed at Park Vue the last few times with our toddler going to Disneyland.  We have stayed at the onsite hotels and Park Vue is quicker to the park than a couple of the Disney hotels.  Great location, clean, free breakfast and the price is tough to match.  We do not need a fancy hotel to sleep and shower as we are at the park all day.  Park Vue checks all of our boxes for comfort and affordability while enjoying Disneyland.

Front Desk staff friendly and helpful. Tidy rooms, free coffee and lemonade ( Not the 7 Up/Sprite kind )  at front desk was great. Clean pool and hot tub ( no time machine sadly ;)  Has guest laundry facilities which helped at the back end of a week trip. Across the road from Disneyland was brilliant. Restaurant like Denny's, IHOP and Tony Romas all close by.

The Park Vue Inn is a decent hotel. Clean. Up to date. Easy access. Walking distance, straight across entrance to Disneyland. Hot breakfast included. Next to IHOP. Other popular eateries nearby. Scooter rental next door.  Discount tickets few driveways down. Service was outstanding. The reason is because the staff went beyond their duty and shipped my husband's walking stick back home across the pacific o. Very much appreciated !! Aloha !

Just your basic motel from the 60s or 70s, but it is close enough to the convention center that you can walk there easily. You avoid being gouged by the big full-service hotel chains. Free rudimentary breakfast. Free fast WiFi. Comfortable bed, and it’s quiet at night. Clean room. Fast check-in and checkout. The light over the sink doesn’t work, but everything else was fine. Certainly not memorable, but satisfactory.

We had three nights here for our Disneyland trip, the room was tight for four people but we weren't really their to spend time in the Hotel, the position is great directly across the road from the entrance to The Park.  Breakfast was good and was available until 10am great after late nights at Disney. I was the Senior of the group and I use to walk back from the park on my own it was perfectly safe always lots of people around and the fact this Hotel is so close. Reception staff were friendly, we enjoyed our stay.

This is the perfect hotel for your trip to Disneyland.  We have tried several others and always come back to the Park Vue.  The staff is fantastic, the complimentary breakfast is great and you can't beat how close you are to the front gate of Disneyland.  We have stayed here probably 10-15 times over the last decade and have only had wonderful positive experiences.  The staff is always helpful and polite.  The front desk once referred me to a local florist so I could surprise my wife with flowers in the room for a birthday.  When our kids were younger, the bunk bed rooms were an instant favorite and remain a cherished memory now that they're older.  We recommend this hotel to all our friends and have stayed there with friends and family.  The Park Vue is not a luxury hotel, it's

Great location and room amenities. Try and get a room on the 2nd floor so that you won't hear families above you. Breakfast sets you up for the day and it was fantastic watching the Disney fireworks from the hotel 2nd floor with other families. Easy walk to and from the park with the delicious Cold Stone Creamery attached with a 10% discount for guests, superb. Plenty of large parking spaces with efficient reception staff and a gift shop on site where you can pick up drinks and snacks etc. The real gem here is the swimming pool which is an oasis in the middle of the car park but is cleverly screened off and provides a relaxing, refreshing alternative to the manic crowds at Disney.

We stayed for 5 nights and enjoyed it very much! I actually cannot say anything negative about this hotel! We travelled with a group of 10 of us and we all had a great time! The hotel is RIGHT across the street from Disneyland, you cannot get any closer! The rooms were clean and the breakfast included was more than adequate to start the day!  The pool was great and never anyone there! We got there early and they stored our luggage while we took off to the park, we came back that evening expecting to pick our luggage up from the front and it had been delivered to our room! Was a very nice touch/surprise! I found all of the front desk staff to be super friendly and very helpful! The last day we were going to check out then spend the day at the park but my son ended up not feeling

This is a great hotel, clean and the location is amazing. Rooms are snug but fine. Breakfast was good and quick. Pool was great. Good value for money in this strip. We wanted to stay one more night but Park Vue was full, stayed nearby and tbe difference was huge in friendliness, cleanliness and noise

I am reviewing this hotel for exactly what it is: an inn. I read a lot of reviews before booking a room here and having stayed here for 5 nights, I feel qualified to write a review.  The room was a regular room. They were clean and we had two queen beds in our room. The towels were enough for a family of 4. The body wash provided was a little too harsh for my skin, but not a deal breaker. Overall, the room was dated but it did its job and had a safe, a TV, a fridge, a microwave, tea/coffee station, a big closet with lots of hangers, lots of trash bin all around to motivate even the laziest of us to do proper trash disposal.    The complimentary breakfast in the morning was a plus. It meant we didn't have to think about what/where to eat each morning and saved us $30-$50 every

Summary Heading: right across the street from Disneyland
Summary: We prefer the Tropicana because it is cheaper, but they were full and the Park Vue was also a good deal. You are literally across the street from the park entrance. Service staff was very helpful, beds were comfortable, nice size room, and the parking is free. They do have a pool and jacuzzi, but we did not have time to try them out.

You can't get any closer to the parks! We had a 2 queen bed/bunk bed setup for the 6 of us and it worked very well. Beds and pillows were comfortable. The first 2 nights it was very quiet but on the 3rd night we had inconsiderate people who enjoyed stomping on their  floor so I would opt for a 2nd floor the next time we stay as I can't fault the hotel for the behavior of it's customers. The breakfast was nothing fancy but it was adequate: scrambled eggs, waffles, bacon, sausage,bagels, toast, biscuits, fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, cold cereal, really good orange juice. You will save quite a bit on your dining budget by not having to buy breakfast. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. We would stay there again. Water pressure and hot water in the shower was very good. Contrary to a

Summary Heading: So very happy with our stay!
Summary: I've been to Park Vue Inn before (in 2010) and the rooms have been updated since then. They are really nice now! I stayed in a room with a queen bed and a bunk bed for my two daughters and we couldn't have been happier. While the rooms are a tad small, they are quite nice and the beds are super comfortable. I usually don't sleep well in hotels but I slept like a baby here. As a point of contrast, I stayed in a nice and very expensive hotel just a few weeks ago and I found Park Vue Inn to be a far better experience in just about every way.  First, our flight arrived early in the morning, well before the check-in time of 3pm but they allow a pre-check-in and will hold your luggage for you. Perfect! After the pre-check-in, my daughters and I spent the day at Disneyland, then came

You can't beat the location.  So close to Disneyland!  The staff was so friendly, everyone you came across was kind and courteous.  It had a full breakfast that went for 3 hours, so it wasn't packed and they had lots of outdoor seating.  Grab your coffee in the lobby if you like it strong! They have a nice little coffee maker down there.  The rooms are up-to-date and clean. We only opted for housekeeping twice and both times they did a great job.  The room wasn't huge (we had 2 queen and a bunk bed) and it was definitely tricky finding places to stash all of our stuff, but we managed.  We didn't spend much time in our room, so it didn't matter.

Park Vue Inn is in a great location. We had a room with two queen beds. The sink is outside the main bathroom which is extremely helpful. There was a refrigerator and microwave. The shower head was perfect and the  tub drained nicely. The rooms are all outside entrance with stairs only to second floor. We watched the fireworks from the balcony our first night there. Breakfast was scrambled eggs every day (egg substitute product was used and they were good!) turkey sausage or bacon and diced potatoes. Two of the days they had biscuits and gravy. The sausage, bacon, potatoes and biscuits were rotated daily. Also available were three kinds of cereal (Raisin Bran and Honey Nut Cherrios--don't recall the third variety), waffles (long-ish wait at times), juice, hard boiled eggs,

Summary Heading: Great location right across from Disneyland
Summary: Chose this hotel for its location it's a great spot right across from Disneyland they offer a free breakfast with a selection of gluten free items I took my own gluten free bread with toaster bags and I had eggs , sausage , gf honey nut Os , peanut butter, jam, yogurt, fruit and coffee and juice. There's also a handy fridge, microwave and coffee maker in the room. Wifi was a bit slow but I was at the back of the resort it was a bit better nearer to reception was fine for me just checking email and Facebook. Rooms were comfy and quiet.

I can't emphasize enough how awesome the location of this motel is. We had the suite with a kitchen and separate bedroom. Very updated and clean.The only thing we didn't like was the fact that we were on the second floor and there was no elevator to bring up the stroller. We left in on the ground level and just packed it everyday in the trunk of our car.   If you have mobility issues, the get a room on the ground level. Although the breakfast room is on the second level, so that could be a complication for you.  Great staff also. For my expectations I still give this 5 stars.

Summary Heading: Location, location.... you know how this ends
Summary: I would recommend this hotel for families looking to save a few bucks on their Disneyland experience.  We were LITERALLY an 8 minute walk to the front gates, and that's with tired kids and a street light to wait for.  It is closer to the front gate than even the Disneyland hotel (with a cost of 4x as much).  It was close enough that we could go back for naps.  The rooms are  fine- clean and we enjoyed the queen/bunk bed situation.  Bathroom smelled of urine.  Ameneties were basic, so bring your own shampoo and toothpaste.  TV was fine and they had HBO, a nice surprice.  the wifi was also very good.  The pool was old school, right in the middle of the parking lot... but it was clean and nicely landscaped and thus hidden from cars in the lot.  There was also a fitness room.

Summary Heading: Visit to Disneyland - Mother and adult daughter
Summary: This property had been recommended to us by friends. Great location for Disneyland, immediately across the road from main gate.   It is an older property, since 1962, with cars parked out the front of each room and a walkup to upper rooms however, the room was spacious and well equipped with microwave, coffee maker and even tea bags!!. I was impressed with the amount of USB outlets and power outlets available for use (usually I have to unplugged something else to use the power outlets). We had 2 Queen beds and they were very comfortable.  The room was clean although a little dated.  We had a lower ground floor room, thankfully as I didn't feel like lugging two suitcases up a flight of stairs.  Despite the cars parked directly outside, the room was very quiet and we were not

Have stayed at this property for the last 8 yrs. and many years ago in the 80's. This property is well maintained, staff is friendly, great breakfast IMO. and it is right across the street from Disneyland. Can watch the Fireworks from Disneyland from this hotel..just an added bonus. The only downfall (and it can happen at any hotel) is if you have noisy people above you, you can hear them.

It's not a 5 star hotel but you can't ask for a better location. Straight across the road to the entrance to Disneyland. Park Vue offers great accommodation. Beds are comfy, bathroom clean. Does have a fridge & microwave if required. Breakfast included (incl hot food & waffles) which is good. Fuel up for the day. You can easily come back to the hotel for a rest & swim if needed before heading pack to the parks for fireworks or World of Colour. You can see the fireworks from the top floor of the hotel.

This hotel made our August Disneyland trip fantastic!  First it's directly across from the traffic light to cross into the Disneyland Resort.  You absolutely cannot get any closer off Disney property.  Every day we walked back to the hotel at about 1pm to go swimming and relax in the room before heading back out to the parks a few hours later.  Second is the bunk beds.  I have a 14 year old daughter and a 12 year old son.  They do not share a bed without pushing and fighting.  This bunk bed configuration is awesome!  My son is 5'8" and fit in the bottom bunk without a problem.  Third is the free breakfast.  I honestly didn't care for the breakfast but the ability to grab something quickly on the go in the morning is a bonus.  It's on the second floor with outdoor seating.  This

If you're staying on Harbor Blvd, you're doing it to go to Disneyland.  Nothing is closer than the Park Vue.  Reasonable rates, clean, free refrigerator/microwave, free parking and a pool all make a very compelling argument for staying here.  Staff was very nice.  No issues with noise and we were only halfway back from the street.    A few issues that bothered us:  I booked the queen with bunk beds.  I didn't realize how tightly packed this room is for a family of 3 or 4.  With 3 of us, I had to get creative with where to put the 3 full sized pieces of luggage to they could be accessible.  Also, the bathroom has just one overhead light which is combined with the exhaust fan.  So either the light and fan are both on, or both off, which is annoying if you want to use the bathroom

Summary Heading: Great motel walking distance from park
Summary: This was our second visit to park vue inn. Had a room with 2 queens and pull out couch. We didn't use the pull out because mattress was very uncomfortable, so my kids just slept in same bed. Other than that, all was great. Breakfast room very busy but we just took food back to room. Choices were cereal, variety of breads, fruit, etc. A hot item or 2, but I didn't try them. Nice pool area. Location is unbeatable. Loved being able to just walk across the street and you were at Disney! Would stay here again.

The hotel is similar to the neighboring hotels on Harbor. But it is my new favorite because of the big parking lot (free parking) and the hot breakfast (waffles are a big deal for the little kids). Also, the pool is surprisingly okay. You can't stay any closer to the parks than this hotel. I totally recommend.

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn on a recent trip to Disneyland and I have to say it far exceeded my expectations! It feels very retro with the outdoor entrances and the pool in the middle of the parking lot. Love that old California feel! The front desk staff was lovely and helpful. They had cookies and lemonade in the afternoons which was a nice treat after a long day in the parks. The location cannot be beat! It is literally right across the street from the main gates. Our walk, door to gate, clocked in at 7 minutes! The parking is tight, but we didn't have any problem finding a spot when we arrived at 3:30pm. The rooms are updated and very clean. The decor was simple and modern. While not huge, our double queen had plenty of space for our family of 5 (my 3 kids are small and

I stayed at this hotel before the D23 Expo in July. When I first drove up it reminded me of the beach hotels I've stayed in and enjoyed.   The room was perfect. It was nicely updated with plenty of space and USB charger ports. The bathroom looked updated.  I was impressed.   I encountered 2 issues - the first was with parking. I had a hard time with finding a parking space because it is a small hotel. I drove around twice and finally found one in a corner when someone pulled out. I avoided leaving the hotel in the car after that, worried that I would come back and not have a place to park.  I saw plenty of cars in the lot without the parking permit.   The 2nd was with the complimentary shampoo  - it had mango in it which I am allergic to. I went to Target down the street and

We had a wonderful trip to Park Vue Inn.  The location is superb, right across the street and not across the street like some Anaheim hotels claim, literal right across the cross walk to Disneyland.  We made the 5 hour drive late afternoon so we arrived around 9pm and Jonathan and Charles greeted us with a smile and gave us the much needed chuckle after our long drive.  We had a room on the second story and I wasn't exactly thrilled as they have no elevator and I have littles and a stroller but Charles jumped up and took all our luggage up the stairs for us.  Everytime we left or came back from the park and those guys were there they would have us rolling.  They honestly added so much fun to our trip!  The room and grounds are great!  Clean and well maintained but Charles and

Summary Heading: Check & double check if you have disability related requirements
Summary: I selected the Park Vue Inn based on it's fantastic reviews, location for walking to the Disneyland Parks, it's free breakfast, wifi and parking. I had contacted the hotel via email to check they had ADA / wheelchair accessible rooms, specifically a roll in shower and was informed that yes they did and that this would be reserved for me. Arriving after a long flight from the UK to LAX and then a less than straight forward shuttle ride to the hotel, we were greeted with free cookies, lemon water, air con and great service - but when we got into the room, it did not have a roll in shower.  The bathroom was not accessible to me and after a long flight, this was not acceptable - and a surprise given the prior correspondence. We called and went straight back to reception who said

Summary Heading: Park Vue Inn is the best
Summary: I have stayed the Park Vue Inn about 4 times the past eight years.  I currently live in Europe and visit family in California every two years.  The rooms are very clean the staff is very helpful.  The breakfast has more than enough variety.  Of course the best thing about the hotel is the location but it really is a nice hotel with great prices and service.  See you in two years Park Vue.

Summary Heading: Perfect location, very clean and updated - friendly responsive service
Summary: Perfect location for Disneyland.  Great breakfast, replaced food frequently and I appreciated that it was changed day to day.  Kids were happy with cereal and fresh waffles and we liked the fruit and hot items. Room was comfortable and clean and we could see the fireworks from our room!

We stayed three nights at Park Vue Inn and were very pleased with our stay. From the front desk staff who were always very friendly and greeted us warmly each time we came into the lobby.  Not to mention chocolate chip cookies and cold lemonade in the lobby every afternoon. We had a room close to the lobby with a queen and a bunk bed. The only thing lacking was space for our luggage.  The room was tight but we managed fine.   There is a pool and jacuzzi which never felt crowded.  Each afternoon we came back to relax and swim and there would only be a handful of people at the pool.  We have stayed at the Grand California before and the pools are always so crowded.  Standard breakfast buffet in the morning with an indoor and outdoor seating area was sufficient but only opens at

We stayed at this hotel for four nights on a recent trip to Disneyland.  I originally had booked at a larger chain property, but a friend who had stayed at the Park Vue talked me into switching.  I am so glad we did.  This hotel is located right at the crosswalk to get to the entrances to the Disney parks.  Can't beat that location.  Also, parking is free.  The room was standard size- we booked a double queen room for our family of four.  We were mostly at the parks so this was fine for us.  The beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean and well maintained.  Also the room and pool areas appeared to be newly remodeled. The breakfast offerings were tasty, varied, and plentiful.  Breakfast is located upstairs with seating inside or a lovely outside rooftop setting.  The pool

Summary Heading: Great location, clean and updated, great service
Summary: We stayed here in 2009 and 2010, and loved the convenient location.  We open and close the park every day, with a midday nap at the hotel, so all we need are nearby beds and a bathroom for a few hours a day.  We were willing to live with some outdated amenities.  Came back for 2 nights in July 2017 and found the Park Vue to be even more comfortable and very clean, with updates to A/C units, TV, and bathrooms.  It is surprisingly quiet considering the proximity to the crowds crossing Harbor Blvd directly out front and the number of families with young children.  Free breakfast is adequate, includes gluten and dairy-free options, and starts at 6am for those of us that want to be first in line when the ropes drop at Disneyland.  The guest desk provided great service, accommodating

We stayed her from June 13th -17th for our first visit to Disneyland.  It was a great hotel and a great location to the parks and Downtown Disney.  From the minute we checked in the staff was amazing.  Our room was very nice and spacious.  There was always someone working on the grounds making it look nice and the pool was always clean.  The housekeeping staff was also very friendly and made sure we had everything we needed and if we wanted extra towels or wash clothes they had no problem leaving them. The 1st day we were there we did not do any parks because we only had a 3 day hopper so we decided to hang out at the resort and go to Downtown Disney.  When we got back we headed upstairs where they serve breakfast and watched the fireworks, I highly recommend doing this, we had

We stayed at the Park Vue because we wanted an easy location where we could park hassle free. First off, we could park our car until midnight on the day we checked out. This was great because we had a late night flight home and planned to spend the day at DCA and jet to the airport after the World of Color show. It is a short walk across the street and they will store your luggage or you can put them in your car trunk. This place has to be closer than Disney property.  They greet you with lemonade and cookies and breakfast is included. You can see fireworks from the balcony where you eat breakfast. The hotel isn't fancy but it is clean and the beds were comfortable. We also liked the little pool with the nice shaded deck chairs. You also get a Coldstone Ice cream discount

This is the place to stay if you intend to visit Disney. It is literally across the street!!!    Add to the great location the complimentary parking (albeit very narrow spots) and breakfast (so so) and Park Vue Inn is a great value.   We also enjoyed the view of the fireworks at night!  As to the rooms, they are reasonably sized and the beds comfortable.

We stay here every time we go to Disneyland.  The location is just across the entrance to Disneyland, has free parking, free internet, good sized refrigerator, a microwave oven, and delicious complimentary breakfast.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  I highly recommend the Park Vue Inn!

Our whole family stayed here for three nights when in town to visit Disney Land. I don't have any complaints. Staff were friendly and accommodating, the free breakfast was much more than a continental breakfast, and you are directly across the street form Disney. Would stay here again in a heart beat.

Summary Heading: Clean and closest to main gate entrance
Summary: Best place to stay within walking distance to the Park. Don't end your long day waiting in yet another line for a shuttle bus to a hotel. This hotel is just across the street from the main gate entrance. We have stayed here 4 times over the years and each time it gets better. The refurbished rooms are clean and have a nice size fridge and microwave. The full breakfast is included and there is a nice rooftop patio to eat on or watch the nightly fireworks from. The staff is always the best and there is never any wait for check in. We will definitely stay again and again.

Perfect location for Disneyland (Right across the road). When the kids were tired, we walked back and had a swim then went back to Disneyland. The rooms were perfect for what we needed, the breakfast was good too. Check in and check out was no hassles. Overall a great stay!

Summary Heading: Improvements at the Park Vue Inn
Summary: A couple of improvements to the Park Vue since our stay last year. Although I could not check in until 3, I was able to relax at the pool for about an hour while I waited. New wide pool umbrellas create better shade areas. Once checked in found all the doors are now digitally keyed, (as is the pool). Had trouble connecting to their internet, front desk went out of their way to get me connected, wouldn't let up until I got there.  New refrigerators in the room, much larger, separate freezer space. When I asked to move closer up front, I was so tired from walking around all day, they nicely accommodated me to an available room.

The Park Vue IS very close to the entrances to both Disneyland and California Adventures.  The hotel is clean and comfortable and the rooms come with a fridge and microwave.  We've stayed before but it had been a while.  The pool area is inviting.  The breakfast is pretty decent  with fruit and pastries available along with eggs and some type of protein .  Waffles and cereal and various breads are also included as well as drinks. There's an I Hop right next door if you want more variety but considering the Park Vue includes the breakfast,  we usually hit I Hop at the end of the day. I'm not sure of the wi fi policy since we didn't use it but I'm sure its on their web sight . The Park Vue is a great value too!

Literally across the street from the Disneyland entrance. The rooms were lovely, clean and a nice size. Not cramped. Beds very comfortable. Free parking and an ample free breakfast. We did not make use of the pool as we were only there for two days and that was filled up with being in the parks, but it looked nice. Staff that I encountered was very friendly. When we do the parks (whether DW or DL), we are there for the parks, not the hotels. We arrive close to opening and stay until closing. We don't go back to the hotel for breaks or meals and then return to the parks, etc. So the hotel has never been the priority for us. As long as it's clean, convenient and reasonable we're fine. Compared to staying inside the parks, the price for the ParkVue Inn was terrific. As another

There were five in our party - three adults and two children.  We reserved a mini-suite for two nights.  We arrived prior to check-in and were given our free parking pass so we could go to Disneyland. Our suite was very clean and neat.  We had an  adjoining room with its own air conditioner and TV.  There was also a kitchenette (microwave and refrigerator). All three queen-size beds were comfortable.  Included in our price was a daily hot breakfast and free parking.  We had guest come to spend a day with us and they were also given a free parking pass for the hotel lot!  The location of this hotel is literally across the street from the Disneyland entrance - only a 5 minute walk.  We will definitely be staying here on our next visit.

You can no beat the location! We went to Disneyland as a group with 6 kids (5 & 7 year old) and 6 adults. They accommodated our room request to be near each other. The rooms were good sized with small fridge and microwave. The beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was very filling. Parking was close and convenient to the room. There is a convenient store, which came in very handy more than once. The pool and hot tub were very clean and close. We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay for Disneyland outside the Disney Hotels!
Summary: I cannot rave enough about this place! Great parking availability. Great breakfast in the morning for FREE. Amazing customer service. And it's an easy walking distance to the park. If you want that Disneyland hotel distance walk but without the Disneyland hotel price than Park Vue is your place!

Summary Heading: Fantastic and so close to Disneyland!
Summary: Our experience at the Park Vue Inn was fabulous! My husband and I arrived from an early flight before noon. The room wasn't ready, but the staff was so very friendly and accommodating. We purchased our 2-day passes to Disneyland, they stored our luggage and we headed to Downtown Disney to pass the time until check in. This motel is literally across the street from Disneyland. From the lobby, maybe 15 steps to the crosswalk, across Harbor Blvd and into the Wonderful World of Disney! From the moment you step through the Disneyland archway immediately after crossing the street, music is playing over speakers to bring you into the Magic Kingdom mindset. It is maybe 1/4 mile to the security gates, and once through them, you are at the entrance gates to Disneyland and California

We chose Park Vue Inn based on the review of disneytouristblog.com. It is one of the closest hotels to Disneyland, about 5 minutes walk. And there are so many restaurants around. We got a Double Queen and Bunk bed room for our family of 6 (3adults and 3 kids). It is smaller than the other family rooms we had during this trip. Our room was located on the first floor (good since they don't  have an elevator and we had large luggages!) at the back of the property. We could hear noise from the 2nd floor guests arriving late night and leaving early morning. But we were too tired to be bothered.   Hot breakfast is served which was enough to start our day. They also have cookies, lemonade and coffee at the front desk available all day. Parking is free. Laundry facility is available.

Just stayed at this inn for a couple nights while visiting Disneyland and California Adventure. The distance from the parks is the best part of staying here, just across the street from the entrance and you're back to the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, and were kind enough to hold our bags since we got there early and checked out well before our flights. We had an updated room which was nice, although the settling foundation cracks in the ceiling didn't look great. The noise level was the most annoying part of staying here. I'm glad we were wiped out at the end of the day otherwise I would've had trouble falling/staying asleep - maintenance banging sheets of metal at 11:45pm, big trash pickup crashing the canisters down and beeping at 6:30 am. Since the AC unit

Summary Heading: Really great stay, friendly customer service, no problems
Summary: I don't write many reviews, but felt compelled to give a positive review of Park Vue Inn after a very pleasant stay.  The front desk staff was helpful and friendly. They even sent up a little goodie bag of candies for my son's birthday when they found out we were visiting Disneyland for his bday. I thought that was a nice gesture.  Our room was comfortable and clean, and even had up-to-date interior decor (didn't feel old or outdated).   The beds were a little soft, but not uncomfortable, and that's just a personal preference anyway.   The walk to the entrance of Disney was an easy 5 minute stroll. We were traveling with a toddler, so this was invaluable for coming back quickly to the hotel for his afternoon nap. I definitely recommend staying close by at this hotel or another

It has been a few years since we have stayed at the Park Vue Inn. We were pleasantly surprised with our recent visit. The room updates are well done, like the floors and the bathrooms. The AC unit positioning was a bit curious, the little wall that comes out from the sink area seems to block some air flow. Beds were comfortable, pillows were ok, I like me a skinny pillow.  Hot breakfast was better than I remembered, waffle machine always a plus. Staff were very friendly and check-in was easy and they stowed bags for us as we came a little early for our room to be ready. You cannot beat location, literally right across cross walk from the parks. This makes a huge difference when spending a lot of time in the parks and being able to walk back to room with ease for naps shower,

We visit Disneyland at least once a year and ALWAYS stay at the Park Vue Inn. You can't get any closer to the park. They have great amenities including free breakfast, free parking and free wi-fi. The rooms are always clean and include a good sized fridge, microwave, coffee maker and safe, the outside areas/pool/parking lot are well maintained, the staff is friendly and accommodating and there is a visible onsite security patrol. There is also an outdoor area for smokers that is far enough away from the rooms yet in a safe area that is also patrolled by security. This hotel is a great place for families and couples alike. We love this place and can't envision staying anywhere else.

I stay here every time I go to Disneyland. I have never been let down. I feel safe, it's the closes hotel to the main gate, they treat you good and the food is good. For those that are tall the shower head is taller than 5'5". If you are celebrating a special occasion let the front desk know before you arrive and if you go to Disneyland let a cashier know and they may give you a button for your celebration.  I would highly recommend this hotel!!!

Summary Heading: Best location! Easy nap break for small kids 👍🏼
Summary: We loved the proximity to Disneyland. The property was well maintained, and updated, it feels like the owners care about their customers. We forgot a toothbrush, and was sure I would have to buy one in the shop there, but they were happy to provide one at the front desk.

I booked this hotel last minute and didn't have high expectations but I was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean, spacious and modern. It had a small pool, laundry room and free wi-fi. Breakfast was also included. It was quite good. They were low on some items though. We arrived early to the hotel and although our room wasn't ready we were able to park in the carpark. It is really close to the disneyland entrance and lots of restaurants. The only negative was that one of the queen beds was really hard.

We love this place! Great location! The staff is friendly and the place is clean, easy in and out to Disneyland. We have stayed here many times and have never had a complaint. They used to have a beautiful gift basket in each room, I wish they still did that, it was a special touch.

Summary Heading: I ALWAYS stay here to go to Disneyland
Summary: This is my favorite hotel for Disneyland.  It is the closest hotel to the Disneyland entrance (closer than the Disneyland Hotel!) You get a clean and comfortable room, including bunk beds for the kids, in-room coffee maker and refrigerator, free breakfast, free Wi-Fi, free parking, cookies and lemonade at the front desk, and a swimming pool; all for a very reasonable price and no resort fees!!!  I think they must have remodeled since the last time I was here because the room was even nicer than I remembered.  The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was filled with light.  There was plenty of bathroom counter space and the toiletries were good quality (I hate tiny motel soaps, shampoos, and conditions but these were good!)  The shower flow was "soft", not the needle-like jets

we pre reserved the triple-queen suite for our family of 6 and it was just as described-easy to park, excellent bedding, really good hot buffet breakfast, and as close to the park gates as a hotel can be.  literally directly across the street on the crosswalk.

Having worked in the hospitality industry for 15 years, I can tell you this place knows how to get things right. The location cannot be beat with a quick walk to either Disneyland Park or California Adventure.  The remodel they completed a few years ago has been so excellently maintained. They now have RFID key locks which makes getting into the room easier without having to fumble around for a key to put into the lock itself.  The breakfast area outdoor furniture was recently upgraded and is really nice. They also have a huge umbrella to provide shade from the sun. This is our go to hotel when visiting the Anaheim area.  Kudos to the ownership and the staff for such a well run hotel!

Summary Heading: Excellent location, staff, service, breakfast but...
Summary: The beds and A/C are SO noisy!!! I am not sure what is up with the beds but they are super loud/squeaky and the A/C also. Both combined really disturb sleep.  Breakfast is good, location can't be beat, staff is excellent, rates awesome.

We haven't stayed at the Park Vue for many years. Park Vue popped up in a last minute search for a reasonable price so we decided to go for it.  It actually turned out to be a pretty pleasant stay. The rooms has recently been upgraded, the beds were very comfortable, the room was spotless.  Yes, there is noise in the morning, this is a hotel directly across the street from Disneyland, who sleeps in when you are going to Disneyland?  If your goal is to get some rest, stay somewhere away from the parks, but if you are excited about going to the parks, this place is for you. Just walk out of your room and across the street, boom you are at the park! Great place to stay if you like to take a break in the middle of the day, no taking a bus, tram or a long walk back to your hotel!

Months ago I made a reservation at the Park Vue Inn for a Spring Break Disneyland stay.  I called five days before arrival date to confirm our reservation and make sure my sister could check in without me as she was arriving before me.  The woman I spoke to confirmed the reservation, added my sister's name and explained how when she arrived, she would need to present her credit card for payment.  We had a rather detailed conversation about our stay.  My sister arrived to check in and was told the reservation had been cancelled.  We did not cancel, in fact the only thing I had done was confirm the reservation.  Needless to say that left us in a terrible bind to find something new at a busy time.  No apologies for the cancellation were given.  In fact, the man I spoke to when I
Manager Response: Dear Traveler,  I was concerned by your review and I would like to apologize for the experience you had.  I can assure you that your experience is highly uncharacteristic for our hotel. Upon further investigation, this seems to be the result of a miscommunication. As it turns out our reservation records indicate that you did call a week prior to your scheduled arrival and the conversation you had with our agent left them with the impression that you were canceling your reservation.  Per your request, we refunded your deposit and sent you a confirmation email for the refund and the cancellation. When your family arrived at our hotel a week later we explained that you had called and cancelled the reservation. We also shared the reservation record with the email confirmation of the cancellation and the refunded folio. We then made accommodations for your family at a neighboring hotel since we were now sold out. Upon their departure, your family did not leave our staff with the impression that they were upset and in fact they were very understanding. That said, I do realize how frustrating this must have been for you and I am truly sorry for what happened. My hope is that you can find a way to give us a chance to make it right. Should you change your mind about never staying here again, we will be here ready to deliver exceptional service.

Summary: Another great stay at this hotel.  3rd time and we love it.  This time they had new security door entries and added a secure entry to the pool.  Also the rooms had Bluetooth speaker alarm clocks.  Rooms very clean and smell great.  Service great everyday and 24 hour coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby.  Free breakfast and free parking also a great plus.  Breakfast is a hot cooked breakfast everyday and changes every other day.   Staff and workers are so friendly and hardworking.  Never want to stay anywhere else.  Plus you can see the fireworks from the upstairs rooms and patio. Location is the best, when you are tired it is only a 5 min walk back to the hotel.  Nice pool too!!!  I can't say enough.

The family 2 adults and 2 kids spent 4 nights at the park vue and it was comfortable and neat.  The pool was fantastic to cool down after a long day at Disneyland.  It was only a couple of hundred meters to the front entrance and dinner places were close by.  Get around it people.

Late review, we stayed at this hotel last year for spring break for 6 days. And definitely it had the perfect location, across  Disneyland parks. Economic and served the purpose, don't expect luxury, but it was comfy for our group of 4 people. A room with a queen and a bunk bed, full bathroom, microwave a mini fridge. Downstairs, there is little convenient store where you can find the essentials, and iHop is next to the hotel. We saved money this time not staying at the hotels of the Disney resort, and the walking distance to the park was the same or less. We felt safe.

My family of 4 stayed here for 5 nights.  I stayed here due to the great reviews.  I def would not give it 5 stars.  I would rate it as a step below a Fairfield Inn (which is where we usually stay).   Let me start by reviewing the positive.    You CANNOT beat the location.  It's literally right at the entrance to Disneyland.  Absolutely perfect for location.  That's the best part of the hotel.  You can watch the nightly fireworks from the hotel balcony.  The free parking is a huge bonus, also as most of the other hotels in the area charge for parking.     The hotel rooms and the property are very clean, although we did notice quite a few gnats in our room.  Kind of gross there.  Housekeeping did not clean our room one day even though we did not have the do not disturb sign on

Summary Heading: You can't beat it for location AND price!
Summary: We booked the Park Vue Inn on a recommendation from a family member, and we were not disappointed!  The location just can't be beat.  For where they are located, I am surprised the price is not MUCH higher.  Literally across the street from the parks!  We are typically Disney World visitors, and I cannot lie, I got pretty spoiled being able to walk from our room to the gates in around 7 or 8 minutes.    The breakfast is top notch.  Pretty much everything you would get at a full buffet, and they are constantly refilling.  The only down side is there is limited seating inside, so if you are there when it's raining, like we were, sitting outside wasn't possible.  We had to take our food to our room one day.  If you get there right when breakfast starts, though, the place is pretty
