Stayed 1 week with two kids, 6 and 8 yr from March 11 to March 18  I read a lot of reviews and they are right on, the hotel location is simply AMAZING. You get out of your room and cross the street and enter Disneyland  it has an IHOP next to you and a lot of choices around you for eating  We tried the free breakfast and is not bad if you are in a hurry, you get tired quick but is free and hot and available   The hotel pool exceeded my expectations as well, is in the parking lot but surrounded by vegetation so it feels very private, the pool is deep and heated to the perfect temperature and had a great hot tub, perfect for taking a break from the parks and after the parks, it closes late and has towels  The room was clean, I would have preferred the second floor, you do hear

Room was very clean.  It had bunk beds for the kids.  Nice breakfast included.  Scrambled eggs, potatoes and sausage or bacon.  Cereal, yogurt and fresh feuit.  Waffles, coffee, juices, tea and hot chocolate.  Mini bagels and cream cheese.  Directly across the street from Disneyland.  Great staff.  Pool is heated.  Best stay ever.

We stayed 6 nights. This hotel is right across from Disneyland, you can see the fireworks. Very clean rooms and property. All staff were friendly and professional, especially the lovely housekeeping ladies. It was nice to take a "mom" break and have the room serviced each day. Our room had a microwave, fridge and coffee maker. Clean pool and hot tub, and a very clean laundry room. There is a small store where you can get snacks, drinks and all kinds of toiletries. Breakfast was included in our stay. Lots of variety, even the picky kid found something they liked. The breakfast area was kept clean and well stocked. It was busy but not crowded. In the photo I included, even my kid's stuffie was treated well! Great place to stay for a family Disney trip!

We just returned from CA and the Park Vue Inn is a great hotel for a Disney vacation. We were in the back of the hotel and it was an 8 minute walk t the entrance of DL and DLCA. The rooms were clean, new bathroom amenities. The pool was warm and the area was clean. Beds were comfortable. The price was a great value. If I am lucky enough to return to DL, this will be my hotel.

Great hotel for Disneyland visitors!  The location can't be beat.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.   Our son really enjoyed swimming in the heated pool in the afternoons when we took a little break from the parks.  The breakfast buffet has a nice selection of food with both hot and cold items.  It is a little noisy at times because it attracts families, but it quiets down nicely later in the evening.  Our family will definitely stay here again when we visit Disneyland in the future.

Summary Heading: Great location, great value, excellent service!
Summary: Spent one night in the hotel and two days in Disneyland parks. We arrived early in the morning and the staff kept our luggage safe before check-in while we visited Disneyland. Upon check-out the next day, they again kept our luggage safe while we spent most of the day at the parks. Very accommodating! The hotel is directly across Harbor from the parks. We had an inexpensive late lunch the first day at Denny's (which I think is just 2 buildings south of the hotel) just before checking in and then heading back to the parks. The beds were so comfortable, the room seemed very clean and in good condition, although slightly dated as I'm sure all the hotels along Harbor are. This place is hard to beat! With brand new annual passes, we hope to stay here quite a few times over the coming

We loved staying so close to Disneyland, it is such an easy walk and really appreciated it at the end of the day.  We had a room with two queens and bunk beds, which worked well for our family of 5.  The breakfast was great enough variety for everyone to find something they liked.  Cookies at the front desk were always a nice tread for the kids.  The pool was warm and the kids enjoyed it very much.  Our room was in the back which made it nice and quiet.  My kids enjoyed the gift shop, cheaper then disneyland.   I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Excellent rooms, excellent location, excellent value
Summary: I and my two teenage kids stayed 2 weeks ago during the President's Day weekend.  It was our 2nd stay after our original visit 3 years ago, and our experience has been consistent.  Both times, we found Park Vue's rooms well-maintained, clean, relatively quiet, and with comfortable beds.  The quality of bathroom tiling in our room was above average for equivalent properties as well as many higher priced and luxury properties.  The only drawback to the room was the use of daylight fluorescent bulbs which were too harsh for my taste, and I hope the management will switch to soft or warm white bulbs.  The free hot breakfast in the morning includes waffles, scrambled eggs, potatoes, breakfast meats, as well as breads, bagels and muffins.  Location is just across from the Harbor Blvd.

We're delighted by our room here. The beds and pillows were the most comfortable of the five spots we stayed (including the Hilton-Universal). Big screened TV. New carpeting. Crown molding. Only downside is the smallish tub, although it did have new tiles, in a large dimly lit room. Included breakfast was a bit of a mad house since most of the guests are heading to the same place - Disney - which is right across the street. I think the Park Vue is closer than two of the Disne hotels! There's also a coin laundry on site which is great if you need to wash some clothes.  There are plenty of eating places a short walk away.

This was our first time at this hotel and it is directly across the street from the Disneyland entrance. Free breakfast is nice. Only two complaints 1. A large spot on one side of the bed was caved in. Very uncomfortable. 2. Had to ask for toilet paper every day (we stayed 4 nights).  We may try it again next time.

Summary Heading: We would stay here again if we ever make it back to Anaheim.
Summary: First stay at PVI (4-nights Jan 31 – Feb 4th).    Booking went smoothly.  So did asking for a rate-adjustments when the price went down.  I received e-mails within a few hours confirming the price adjustments.  Our stay was quiet.  No noise from freeway, outside or rooms beside us. Very clean room with fridge that kept items cold.  Comfortable beds.  Safe in nightstand between the beds large enough to fit 2 tablets, Nintendo DS and lots more.  I really liked the option to open the windows in our room.  If it was warmer, I would have.  I loved all the USB and regular plug outlets everywhere.  Especially the ones beside the bed.  No issues with Wi-Fi.  We had an issue with water not draining from shower, reported it before heading to parks and it was fixed by the time we came

Despite some glitches making the reservation our stay was stress free.  Decent room.  Decent bedding, fitted sheets could have been bigger as to not pop off but overall a comfortable sleep.  Clean room.  Breakfast ok - more fruit would be a huge improvement in my mind but it is included and I refuse to stay anywhere in Anaheim that isn't.  Pool was good for the kids - more fun in warmer weather I am sure but it was heated nicely in February.. the biggest advantage is the location and the reason I would return.  In my mind it is here or the best western next door - it is simply not worth staying farther away and I would have real difficulty paying resort property prices.

Not a 5 star hotel but it is actually quite nice. Nice beds, flat screen TV wall mounted, ample bathroom space. Bathroom was clean with natural lighting. Room service was excellent. Staff was courteous and friendly. A full breakfast and free parking are provided. Finally, the location cannot be beat. If you are going to be at Disney all day, do you really want to drop 4-5 times the amount you will pay per night to stay at the Grand Californian for the 5-8 hours of sleep time that you will spend in the room. There is also a fridge and microwave in the room which we used for a lunch break from Disney to warm up and eat a previous night's dinner. Stay in the back of the hotel if you can. We were in room 235. Much less foot traffic in the morning going to the free breakfast if you

Summary Heading: Fabulous Location for Disney, Otherwise Fine for a Non-Kid Visit
Summary: This is one of around three hotels that are right across the street from the entrance to Disney. This was super convenient for us, and we appreciated that the hotel let us keep our car parked in the lot even after we checked out.  We had a king room over President's Day weekend.It looked to have been recently refurbished with nice USB chargers, areas with a nice laminate and some rug that seemed relatively fresh. The room was in the far back corner of the hotel, which was generally low-traffic. But when someone was in the hallway near our room or someone was upstairs, it was easy to hear with the A/C off. The breakfast was notably good for a typical free breakfast: eggs, bacon, and fresh waffles, plus the typical continental stuff.

We really enjoyed our recent stay at the Park Vue Inn. The location is fantastic, across the street from the entrance to Disneyland, less than a five minute walk for us. Our room was very clean, the beds were comfortable, wifi worked great,  the breakfast was pretty standard hotel breakfast in a clean breakfast room with plenty of outdoor seating if the room itself gets full, and in our interactions with staff they were always polite and helpful. My only Con  really was the walls are pretty thin so when the baby in the room next to us started crying we definitely heard it but overall we will stay here again. We were closer to the park than when we stayed at Paradise Pier Hotel but we were just as comfortable and imho definitely a better value.

I debated between this hotel and a cheaper one further from Disneyland, but I'm very pleased with the decision to stay at Park Vue. The free parking, free breakfast, and location to the park saved us money and time overall. We traveled with 3 kids (4, 3, and 1) and had plenty of room with 2 queens and a pack n' play that we brought.   The microwave and fridge in the room were a big plus for bottles, and the breakfast provided was way better than I expected. Over the several days we ate there, we tried sausage, bacon, eggs, potatoes, biscuits and gravy, and fresh waffles from the waffle makers there. It was perfect for a quick, hearty meal before going to Disneyland, and a more leisurely one before our road trip home. I would absolutely stay there again!

Great location for Disney everything. Great little breakfast before heading into attractions. Clean rooms! Bunkbeds for kids!! Pool was great! Great reasonable place to lay your head after 3 days of walking for hours!

No this place isn't fancy, but for the location (across from the east entrance) this hotel is perfect for walking to and from Disneyland throughout the day. The rooms are clean and everything worked.  We stayed in the queen with bunk beds room, which included a small fridge and microwave. Space was a little tight but my two boys (under 10) loved the bunk beds. We could even view the park fireworks from our window. Great rate with free breakfast. Would book here again!

Family of 4 two kids 9yrs and 2yrs. Stayed in room with bunk beds  Pros.  Location across from Disney and California adventure, free breakfast and parking, beds were clean and room was functional but very small.  Cons.  On arrival I was greeted by the front desk guy smoking near the front door. Always nice to walk through a cloud of cig on arrival. I was told that you could buy tickets at the front desk 24hrs a day I called and confirmed this twice because we were arriving late and going to the park the next morning. When I arrived the front desk clerk did not have enough tickets available said he ran out.  I came in next morning and same thing no tickets.  I found some tickets 2 blocks away at a discount store.  The room is small and dated but it worked for as much time as you

This hotel is great for families going to Disneyland.  It is directly across the street from the main entrance.  So easy to go back and forth to the hotel room.  The rooms are nice and some even have bunks for the kids!  The hot breakfast in the mornings is substantial enough to get you going and can save you time and money in the parks.  There are quite a few restaurants near by (within walking distance) too.

A couple of my girlfriends and myself traveled down to Anaheim to go to Disneyland for a few days and I have to say we were all blown away with this hotel. Breakfast is served every morning from 7:00am-10:00am it's a nice hot breakfast right before you start your day at Disneyland . The walk over to the Disneyland resort is truly remarkable. It's about 5 minutes at the most. So that's always a plus. The rooms are really clean and well kept. There is a jacuzzi out in the pool area so we really enjoyed that after a long day. I'd also like to give a special thanks to the tall dark and handsome man at the front desk :) (Charles) He was very helpful when we had questions about Disneyland as well as just general questions. He was always smiling and it made our stay that much more

We've been to Disneyland A LOT, and we've stayed everywhere from the dive motel several blocks away to the Grand Californian itself. But, I don't know that I want to ever stay anywhere but the Park Vue Inn after this. First of all, what they say about walking distance is correct: there is nowhere closer. The Grand Californian may be closer in terms of its situation, but by the time you walk through Downtown Disney and wind through the hotel to your room, it's actually quite a distance compared to the Park Vue Inn. We were close enough to easily see the fireworks from our window. Second, the rooms were always perfectly clean and comfortable. There was a little bit of noise as guests were headed to or from the park, but nothing that we hadn't experienced at every other hotel near

This is the closest hotel on Harbor from DLR area. It's right on the crosswalk. The staff is so friendly. The rooms are clean, we had a room with 2 queens and bunkbeds, we all fit very comfortably. Very good breakfast, not just the standard cereal and muffins. Great pool area, It's our favorite hotel when visiting Disneyland.

This was our third trip to the Park Vue Inn and once again it did not disappoint. The location can't be beat - right across from the Disneyland gates. My kids loved the bunk bed (tip: use the extra blanket in the closet as a curtain at the end of the bunk beds to provide some privacy.) The free breakfast is fantastic - hot food, cereal, fruit, etc. - and it's a great way to save money and fuel up for a busy day in the park.  The Park Vue is a motel style hotel with room doors facing the parking lot and yes it can be a little loud as there are lots of families with young children staying there. But those are both very minor things to consider when you consider how much you pay.  The convenient location, renovated rooms, great service & free breakfast make up for all that. Anytime

This was our first time staying here and our first visit to Disneyland.  We went for a Star Wars half marathon in the middle of January and this location is perfect.  It's great for going to the parks and was perfect for the race.  The hotel and room were clean, staff was friendly, and since we were up early for the race we noticed they have a night security guard walking the grounds.  The rooms are updated and everything was very clean.  They do provide free parking which is a big plus since it seems everywhere else charges to park.  The breakfast was good but the inside seating area is small.  There is a outside seating area that we used one morning and it was nice to eat outside.  I'm sure everyone else has talked about the location to the parks and that is one reason we

We stay here every time we can get a reservation! They book up fast for holiday weekends! The free breakfast is fair, Waffles, eggs, a meat (bacon or sausage), coffee, orange juice and cereal. The beds are ok (a little firm for me). The remodel from a couple of years ago is clean and comfortable. The view of the fireworks is spotty from the balcony, so go into the park for that. Cold Stone ice cream is connected to the building, so that's a nice break from the  parks on a hot day. The pool is small, but fine. Very nice staff!

We stayed here during a recent trip to Disneyland. It is literally across the street from the entrance. We loved how close it was because we could pop back to the room if we needed a break from the parks.  The room was spacious (it had two queens and a set of bunkbeds) and clean. We were grateful to find something with extra beds for our family.  Their breakfast was great and delicious. It's not just cold cereal and baked goods. They had eggs, sausage, and other options as well.  The staff was helpful and always cleaned our room well. We will be making this our go to spot for when we are at Disneyland.

Great place to stay, right across the street from Disneyland! Great rooms for families  Breakfast is decent but there's so many cafes around to please everyone. Very clean and really nice staff  I always look for availability here first before I go anywhere else!

Summary Heading: Probably the best of the good neighbour hotels.
Summary: This hotel is always professional, friendly, quiet and accommodating. They are quick at dealing with issues and a good price value. We had an issue with the roof leaking from the rain outside and they quickly fixed the problem, made sure everything was okay, and apologized for any inconvenience. They are directly across the street from the Disneyland walkway. IHOP and Coldstone creamery are right next door as well as a few other restaurants within walking distance. They are always are first choice in accommodations when planning a trip to Disneyland.

Again a great place to stay. Always try and book this hotel when doing a Disneyland tour. Have booked again on the last part of our vacation tour in Jan 2017. A must when looking for simple comfortable lodgings, decent free breakfast, wifi, great staff.

A good basic hotel for visiting Disneyland. The included breakfast was good, but the dining room could be bigger at times there was no place to sit. Rooms clean and basic, beds comfortable. The pool is small, but never busy. Location is great.

Selected this property because it was advertised as "close to Disneyland."    After staying at the PVI for three nights, I agree. It is literally across the street from Disneyland-less than a five minute walk to the security check station.    We visited the park from opening to closing and returned to the room for naps daily.   Was somewhat hesitant because of other reviewers mentioning noise. We did not experience any issues, but maybe that was because we were assigned 2nd floor rooms.   Complimentary breakfast was excellent and convenient-one less meal to purchase at Disneyland.   After staying here once, I can't imagine staying anywhere else.

I stayed at the ParkVue this January 2016 and have just rebooked for January 2017. This hotel/motel is listed as 2-stars but the customer service is definitely 5-star. I've interacted with numerous employees and I find them even more kind than the Disneyland cast members. The rooms and lobby are clean, the decor is not too hard on the eyes (especially compared to other S Harbor Blvd hotels) and the location is the closest you will get to Disneyland. I cannot begin to explain how convenient this place is. You cross the street once and you're at Disneyland, which is the best thing to think of when you go home at 12am when you close down the park or want to take a mid day break.   The free breakfast is not very good to be honest. Bagels, egg and sausage are plastic tasting. The

This is a well maintained 1950's motel.  The location is really great!  It's right across from Disneyland and the path to the Disneyland entrance.  We went to Disneyland at the early morning opening, and came back to the motel for a quick rest in the afternoon, and then went back to Disneyland for dinner and night.  We ate in the motel breakfast buffet each morning.  The motel is full of families visiting Disneyland, and has a nice atmosphere.

Hotel stated that it was disability friendly.  However, the reality was anything but.  No wheelchair access to first floor amenities.  Path at ground level was spilt level requiring access to and from room through the driveway/car park.  Staff vehicles parked in disabled carparks which were not located in front of so called disability rooms.  The disability rooms only contained a wheelchair accessible shower. Lucky for us our disabled family member was a child.  If it had been an adult the stay would have been very difficult.  Noise at the hotel was also an issue from guest in upstairs rooms, the upstairs path which was used as a running track by children to view fireworks and guests in adjacent rooms.  Every time a tap was turned on or a toilet was flushed in the upstairs room

A few quality features led my family and I to stay at this motel: 1.  Right across the Disneyland gate 2. Free parking and wifi  3. Microwave and mini fridge in every room They have free breakfast though we didn't check it out during our stay.  It's on an upper level, which leads me to the cons: 1. No elevator.  A pain when you have multiple kids and luggage  2. It's a motel so all doors are "outside" Really those are the only major negatives I can say.  I've stayed at my share of hotels in Anaheim and if I had to choose, this and the Camelot Inn (both almost next to each other) were the best. I love how Park Vue has quiet time signs posted throughout the motel though!  I've only seen this there and it seemed to help as with all the motels I've stayed at in this area, this was

This hotel is located exactly across from the Disneyland main gates and is easy walking distance.  Nice rooms, clean, comfortable.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  Comes with a continental breakfast.  Only complaint is the water in the showers is very noisy.  We could hear the people next doors shower, woke us up.  but, everything else is good.

Stayed at Park Vue during a trip to Disneyland and location is perfect.  We usually stay at Disneyland Hotel but Park Vue is closer.  Staff was friendly, room was clean, beds comfortable, free and easy to find parking, decent pool.  Breakfast was good and coffee readily available there and also the lobby.  We stayed on second floor to avoid hearing noise from above.  Children running and talking loud outside in early morning but to be expected.  Will definitely stay again if we go back to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: No frills but convenient and great value for money. Second stay.
Summary: This is a great family hotel. Very conveniently located to Disneyland.  Staff are friendly and reasonably helpful, although I do think we got more in=depth service / information from staff during our first stay 5 years ago. *For example, given its location, I would expect that staff would at least be able to tell me which bus I needed to catch to get to Knott's berry farm).  Rooms are fairly standard but they are very clean and comfortable. Just be aware that this truly is a FAMILY hotel and therefore you are going to hear loud kids, sometimes running around outdoors or, in our case, in the room above, sounding like baby elephants even after 10pm... this isn't the hotel's fault, unfortunately some parents make no effort to consider other families when they are staying in hotels!

Summary Heading: Another great stay at the Park Vue!
Summary: The Park Vue Inn is still our favorite place to stay by Disneyland.  I'm happy to see that nothing has changed for the worse since we were there last!  The rooms are clean, comfortable and well-maintained.  The beds are extremely comfortable, which is so nice after a long day of walking.  A few other things I noticed this time around - plenty of towels, awesome water pressure in the shower (though it's quite loud, so trying to shower before waking the kids for the day was pretty much impossible, unfortunately) and despite being on the first floor when the hotel was completely booked, it was pleasantly quiet.  The breakfast is good - eggs, sausage and potatoes or biscuits and gravy, cereal, bagels, bread for toast, yogurt, etc. so plenty of choices.  The members of the hotel

Summary Heading: Clean, well priced & a great location
Summary: The location of this motel couldn't be beat, being directly opposite the crosswalk to the parks.  It was fairly basic, but the room was a good size for our family of 4 (QS & bunks) and it was clean.  Breakfast was a great addition and had something for everyone.  We had an upstairs room towards the front and didn't have any problems with noise.  The only thing I would have liked added would be a kettle in the room.  We don't drink coffee so the coffee maker wasn't much good to us.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  We would definitely stay here again.

This was our second time staying at the park vue inn and certainly not our last. They were able to accommodate an earlier check in time as well were super helpful over the phone. This trip we opted for the jacuzzi suite and have decided that we will continue to get this room type. The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable. Having the jacuzzi to soak in after a long day at the park was an exceptional treat. We always recommend this hotel to friends travelling to Disney. With the proximity to the park and customer service who would want to pay on property prices?!? A wonderful stay as always can't wait to stay next September!

Summary Heading: A great hotel close to disney and affordable rates!
Summary: This is the closest hotel to Disneyland, it was easy to return to the room during the day. Good breakfast included, nice pool,lots of towels and best of all the staff goes out of the way to help you. My daughter needed a pencil to do some make up home work and the staff searched everywhere to find one. When they couldn't find one i went to the gift shop and one of the staff grabbed the pencil from me and rushed to sharpen it. Not a huge deal but very much appreciated. We will be back!!!!! Thank you for a great place to rest after a day of Disney.

We stayed here for about a week while doing Disney and a convention. It was the perfect spot for our family of four - economical, comfortable and convenient. We would definitely stay again. It is right across the street from Disney's entrance and close to the Anaheim Convention Centre (it was about a 10 min walk).  We stayed in a kitchenette suite which was important for us considering how long we were there. There was a separate room with two queen beds, a large closet, dresser/desk and TV. The main room had a couch, TV, and small kitchenette which had a microwave, small (think beer size) fridge, two burner-stovetop and sink, plus a vanity sink and small counter. So while we cooked dinner there every night, we had to be creative with our shopping. There is a Walmart close by

This place is great!  Location is amazing - right across the street for Disney entrance.  The place is very clean.  We got a room with a queen and a bunk bed.  It was a tad small, but we barely spent time in the room.  The bed, however, was very comfortable!  The breakfast was great, also!  We will definitely try this hotel again!

We recently spent 5 nights at the Park Vue Inn for our first trip to Disneyland. We arrived early as we had an early flight in from Australia and unfortunately for us our room wasn't ready yet however we were able to park in the lot. We eventually got into our room at about 1pm and found the room to be clean (although the carpet could do with a good shampoo) and reasonably sized. The bedding was very comfortable and the air conditioning worked a treat, once we worked out the celsius/faranheit conversions that is :) Breakfast was good, nice and light and enough options. The location is great with small children as well, very easy to go back and forth to the parks during the day for rest breaks etc. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Best Location when Walking to Park
Summary: Located right at the crosswalk to enter Disneyland.  We had a king room with a jacuzzi tub in the room which felt great after walking all day!  Room was large and well maintained for an older property.  Rooms included a safe for storing small valuables. Housekeeping did a good job everyday and the little store on the property came in handy!  Best part was free parking!  All other properties charge daily parking fees!  Would stay here again in the future,

This was the perfect place to stay for our day at Disney.  We flew into Santa Ana airport and it was a very easy drive to our hotel.  We were literally right across the street from Disney!  It was amazing!!!  And it was quiet too, which I could not believe.  They have signs posted all over stating their quiet hours and everyone obeyed it.  They provide a great breakfast in the morning before you head over to the park so you are ready to go!  Would highly recommend staying here and the price is definitely right.  I am not sure why you would spend more to stay farther away!

We recently stayed in this Motel.  And it is a motel, not a Hotel.  It is directly across the street from the Disneyland entrance, no kidding.  Such a great location.  The room is very tiny, we had a queen bed and 1 bunk bed.  It was clean. and the staff was friendly.  the breakfast was very good.  Full hot breakfast and free parking.  The only real complaint is that the kids and people walking running past your room early morning is very loud and always woke us up.  But it is definitely worth it for the cost.  and we would stay there again.

We are annual pass holders and when we travel to Disneyland, we always stay at Park Vue Inn. We have stayed at two of the Disneyland properties and find Park Vue Inn to be a better value, with lovely amenities. The property is right across the street and we enjoy being able to walk to and from Disneyland...especially at night when you're worn out from having so much fun. The staff is very friendly and we feel their sincerity when they welcome us and our paths cross with housekeeping. We had a small issue with our toilet seat. We alerted housekeeping and maintenance had it corrected by the time we returned in the afternoon. The beds/pillows are very comfortable and I enjoy the PAYA (soap, shampoo) amenities. They have such a delightful fragrance. We didn't take advantage of the

This hotel was recommended by friends who have stayed multiple times and we are so glad they shared it with us. You simply could not have a closer location to Disneyland's entrance and enjoy a reasonably priced experience. The rooms were clean and complete with a fridge, microwave, and coffee maker so you could keep snacks or even make lunch to go. The breakfast was fine, something for everyone - and we had 4 adults and 1 picky child to please. Staff was  accommodating and friendly.

Summary Heading: My consistant first choice on trips to Disneyland
Summary: My son and I had annual passports for 2 years and made regular short trips to Disneyland during that time. We tried various good neighborhood hotels and this one is my favorite. I am only reviewing because we are done with DL and don't need to keep this secret hotel for ourselves. I consistently reserved on the hotel website and it always worked good, with the same price each time, never ever have I been charged different amount. Parking is a little tight but always easy to find. It is CLOSER that DL parking garage. Breakfast is very well organized. We had to dry wet clothes after a rain one time and it worked out good. I liked rooms with the bunk beds. All about the beds and the rooms was good. Its the vibe of the hotel I like most. It feels like you are still inside the park.

My family and I have always stayed here. So easy to walk to after a long day at Disneyland and no wait for shuttles! Nice breakfast in the morning and the rooms are clean. Affordable. We don't stay anywhere else.

My husband, daughter & I stayed two nights for our daughters 10th birthday (Disneyland was her present).  Check-in had a little bit of a wait, but went quickly.  They had lemonade and cookies in the lobby, nice touch!    Our room was upstairs and looked straight towards Disneyland.  Once we got in the room (two queen beds), there was a letter(see pics) for our daughter wishing her a happy birthday and mentioning a free dessert at Cold Stone at some point during her visit.  They also gave a little bag of fun sized candy.  This earned big bonus points as I don't even remember telling them we were there for her birthday. It helped her feel very special. We didn't get to check out the pool, but it had kids in it both nights.    The breakfast is upstairs above the little Disney shop.

Located literally right across the street from Disneyland -- the breakfast nook looks out on Space Mountain and the Matterhorn.  Great staff, lovely clean rooms that are well maintained and comfortable.  Given its proximity to such a huge attraction, its price is actually incredibly reasonable.  Parking is tricky as it's very limited, but I've never had too much of a problem.  There are also quick and easy food options for lunch and dinner (breakfast is included) such as IHOP and Cap'n Kidd's buffet (cheap food but an admitted guilty pleasure).

Summary Heading: Surprised in good ways and bad!
Summary: Over the years of being a Disney Annual Passholder, I've heard and read many great things about Park Vue Inn... unfortunately for me and my family, all of the times we've visited Disneyland they are always booked. Which is usually a good sign right!?! So let's just say this place was always at my top of the list of closest hotels to stay out on South Harbor Blvd. That being said, we've had the opportunity to stay at most of the hotels on that exact same street. Which is beneficial for those curious about comparing neighboring hotels to this one. Let's be honest here... yes, Park Vue Inn is literally a crosswalk away from where you need to walk in order to get to the entrance, but so is Best Western Park Place Inn (where I've stayed previously) and also Tropicana Inn etc...

Great location, room was bright and sunny, person at check in  was nice, room was clean, updated rooms,  breakfast was great. swimming pool was nice and clean but didnt use it !  people above us were so very loud, got very little sleep.

Super close to the park, and the rooms seem to be quite a bit nicer compared to similarly priced neighboring hotels we have stayed at.    We were in a room with King bed and Jacuzzi for a few days in July, and everything was clean and comfortable and quite spacious.     The breakfast in the morning was also pretty good continental style, and of course, you can't beat the proximity to the front gate of Disneyland.   Staff was nice, and efficient.    My boyfriend and I are Disney annual passholders, and this looks like it will become our go-to hotel every time we are in Anaheim.

This place checks all the boxes when considering a place to stay within walking distance of Disneyland.  The breakfast is simple and clean.  The staff were quick and considerate.  They have larger rooms with multiple beds.  We will return here again.

No frills, but super close to Disneyland. They were generous with the towels (yey!) but the soap was weird and fruit scented (boo!). Room has a mini fridge and a microwave, which we didn't use, but is good just in case. The breakfast room upstairs was crowded, so I skipped that too. After a LONG visit to Disneyland, it's nice to have some place so close. Extra added bonus was the view of the Disneyland fireworks from the parking lot! Cold Stone Creamery on site in case you've been meaning to gain weight while on vacation. (I had vanilla with Kit Kat.)

Park Vue Inn is now starting to feel like home, after our second stay this year. Once again it was fabulous, very clean and comfortable, and with everything you need from a decent breakfast to tea/coffee/hot chocolate, lemonade & cookies in the lobby. All staff are friendly from front desk to housekeeping to maintenance to security, they all say a friendly hello.The onsite store sells everything you could need or have forgotten. Location, of course, is opposite the entrance to Disneyland. We'll be back again for sure.

Summary Heading: Convenience & value are the best features
Summary: This is a no-frills motel which is just across the Disney Resort (Disneyland & Cal Adventure Park) with basic and OK breakfast (pancakes, waffles, eggs, bacon, cereals, coffee, juices) which really helps a lot in managing costs in Disneyland.  This had the same price as a more upmarket hotel we were considering in Anaheim that offered a free shuttle to Disney but I chose Park Vue due to the proximity & free breakfast.  With small children (3 and 6 year old), I knew we needed to be able to rest & chill & maybe go back to the motel quickly in case it got a bit to much.  We ended up not doing this as the walk back is still about half an hour roundtrip which adds up when you think about all the walk you already do within Disneyland.  Re: the breakfast, my son has severe allergies so

We stayed here 6 nights.  Hotel was clean, staff was great and the location is fantastic.  We were on the second floor.  Very quiet.  Breakfast was fine.  It is not fancy but would absolutely stay there again.  People please remember to leave a tip for those ladies that work so hard replenishing the food items and cleaning up.

We came to Disney with family.  Daughter-in-law found this hotel with on-line research.  Location can't be beat as it's right across the street.  Price was fine as you are paying for location as well as hotel.  Car stayed in hotel lot for 3 days as everything is within walking distance.  Rooms have been updated with new fixtures, paint, etc.  Breakfast was good.  As others have indicated, you have an excellent view of Disneyland fireworks from the outside patio at breakfast area.  It's the best.  No crowds and a great view.  Definitely a place to consider when going to Disney.

this hotel was in the perfect spot. right across from the entrance. rooms were clean and had all the things you look for in a hotel. extra bedding and dishes if you need to use them. great that we were able to come back in middle of day to refresh and give the kids down time. glad they had TV's in both rooms so there was no problems with who was watching what. beds were comfortable with extra pillows and blank . loved that they had coffee and water in reception area. thanks for front desk answering all the many questions and AAA discount. would definitely stay again. glad I booked early

This is the perfect place to stay if you are planning a trip to Disney.  It was so close to the gates - which made for easy returns to the room for naps, sweatshirts, snacks, etc.  Really made things easy and convenient.  I will not claim that this is a luxury property.  It's a basic motel set-up, with cars parked right up to the hotel room windows downstairs.  There was a fair amount of exterior noise from families heading to the parks early, so not the best for sleeping in.  But, when it comes to convenience and basic comforts, this turned out to be a great option for the price.

Picked this hotel because of its best location right across Disney's gate. Room was just fine, not spotless and a bit tired but we could sleep well for 2 nights. Good breakfast. The on-site Cold Stone ice cream was yummy and having I-HOP next to the hotel was a plus. At the time of our stay the rate was quite competitive (Jan. a few years back). Due to the ideal location, it got fully booked fast. When coming back last year we stayed in a nearby airbnb. Cheaper, could accommodate the whole family and had kitchen facility but had to drive a few minutes to Disney.

Located at the crosswalk for Disneyland, this is a great location when choosing a Good Neighbor hotel option. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, large enough for 3 adults (two queens beds and a cot). Didn't have any problems with sound or loud neighbors.  Did not check out the hotel breakfast, but did eat at the IHOP located in the parking lot. A lot of good parking for hotel guests.  Staff was very friendly and helpful, even with our many questions about getting a cot, extra room key, etc.  Would love to stay here again.

Summary Heading: Fantastic location, directly across from Disneyland
Summary: Easy walk across the road across the road straight in to Disneyland- which was a real bonus after a long, enjoyable day. Family of five adults shared a room - 2 doubles in one room, with wardrobe, bench/ table and another room with  a sofa bed,/ lounge. 1 bathroom but an extra vanity as well as a kitchenette. And small table and chairs. Close to lots of food places ( would recommend The Pizza Press) a couple of doors up )  Two TVs and lots of charging points. Full breakfast included. No elevator so may be a problem for strollers  - but overall very happy with our stay.

Great location, just cross the street and you are in Disneyland. The room was very clean. The bed was very comfortable.  The cooler worked great. They have a great breakfast spread. Eggs, potatoes, biscuits and gravy, cereal, toast, fruit,  and much more. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel. I will definitely be back.

ok "Inn", but very close to Disney!!! It's across the street........ Friendly front desk staff.  No elevators though, only stairs..... priced fairly.....stayed on two different occasions. Worth a shot if the price is low.....

Directly across the street from the park entrance, I'm pretty certain this is physically closer to Disneyland Park's entrance than Disney's hotels (except the opulent Grand). It has a nifty mission-style facade and a Cold Stone next to the lobby.  This hotel has been recently refurbished, so the decor, furniture and bathrooms are all very new feeling. Oddly enough, the bed sheets were incredibly worn and not terribly soft. The small rooms come with safes, but ours was left open with the lock engaged and so we could not use ours. Be aware, if you are staying with children, the bunk bed is 6' or so from the queen bed, and the fridge and coffee maker are crammed in the corner (tight quarters!).  Our only true complaint is that the exterior wall is very thin, as you can hear folks

We stayed two nights here. Right across the street from Disneyland. When we checked the A/C in our room sounded like a lawnmower. They sent a maintenance man right up and he couldn't fix it so they moved us to another room. In my mind this was a good thing. No muss no fuss. Price was not bad but might be higher in season.

We've stayed at this location in the last several years, though our last stay in Anaheim was at the Disneyland hotel.  The last time we stayed, there was a fruit basket in our room, and a bottled water for each of us, which was replenished daily. We missed that touch this time. We like the quaint, old motor inn. It's clean and comfortable. The staff are nice, many speaking as you pass.  We arrived very late on Friday, and were awakened by the room staff on Saturday morning, not early, but early for us. We got up and got out, and enjoyed the rest of our stay. We did, somehow, misplace a shirt during our stay there, which was disappointing.  This hotel is right across from the parks, which is very handy, especially when traveling with alternately-abled family members using walkers

Summary Heading: So happy with my choice to stay here!
Summary: Just back from 8 nights at Disneyland and staying at the Park Vue Inn.  I have to say I had reservations at 3 different hotels over the months leading up to the trip and I am THRILLED that I ended up here.  This is going to be a very detailed review for those of you who, like me, are trying to decide between a few.    Traveling party was me (mom), husband, ds(14) and dd(12).  We got a rate of $119 a night with AAA for the double bed and bunkbed room.  We arrived on a Tuesday after a long flight from upstate NY and traffic and a stop at Walmart (the one on Euclid - only about 6 or so minutes from the hotel).  Check in was quick and pleasant.  Lemonade, water and cookies and a computer/printer for printing boarding passes in the lobby.  The room worried me at first, it is quite

Summary Heading: First time staying at Park Vue Inn and it couln't have been any better! SO close to the main gates of Disneyland!
Summary: This was my first trip back to Disneyland in 25+ years. This was the wife's and eldest daughters first trip back in 5.5 years, and was our 4 year olds first trip ever.   We stayed at the Park Vue Inn for 5 nights in a 2 queen suite with kitchen. We knew the Park Vue was close to the main gates of Disneyland, but DANG! Our walk from our room to the gates with a 10 and 4 year old was less than 3 minutes!  Our room was clean and comfortable. 2 queen beds, night table, full sized desk, full sized closet were in the bedroom area. In the other room was the "living room" with a sleeper sofa (queen sized), coffee table and wall mounted flat panel TV. There was the kitchen and bathroom at the other end of the living room. There were pots & pans, utensils, plates, bowls in the kitchen. A

Summary Heading: If you're going to Disneyland - look no further!
Summary: Brilliant hotel. We had an amazing 4 night stay here. The location just can't be beaten for Disneyland!! Its right opposite the hotel. Even the Disneyland hotels are further away from the actual parks.  The staff were nice and very professional. The room was lovely - kids loved the bunk beds. There is a safe, fridge and microwave. Of course its also air conditioned.  Its a bit small but you're not there much if you're there for Disneyland.  The price was very reasonable.  The breakfast was brilliant and varied. Something for everyone. They have 3 (I think) waffle machines so not much of a queue.  The breakfast room is located upstairs, so there were nice tables outside which were not near the carpark or road.   We loved the lemonade and cookies in reception during the

This is our second time staying at the  Park Vue Inn and it did not disappoint! One of the closest, reasonably priced hotels in the area. It's the best one among the hotels across the street from Disneyland! We've stayed at a few other hotels on Harbor and this one is the cleanest, 'budget" hotel. It's also nice that it's not over-sized and you don't have to worry about waiting for an elevator with a hundred other people (the worst)! We will definitely stay at the Park Vue Inn again!

We booked the Park Vue Inn for our 4 night stay as a base for Disneyland and I'm so glad we did.   The accommodation was beautiful, we had a room for six and loved the separate room.  The room was so spacious and had every facility you needed.  The beds and pillows were so comfortable and the breakfast was fine, good to have an option at the start of the day.  The location was unbelievable! It was closer than two of the Disney hotels and so fabulous at the end of many 17 hour Disney days.  The pool and hot tub were lovely, beautiful temperature and so relaxing.  I would so highly recommend this accommodation for any families wanting a great quality but decently priced place to stay whilst based at Disneyland! Also, the staff were amazing! Thank you Park Vue Inn for a fabulous

Summary Heading: Can't beat the Park Vue Inn for location and value
Summary: We (2 adults, 2 teenagers) spent 3 nights at the Park Vue Inn (Sat, Sun and Monday). We arrived around 8 PM after an 7.5 hour drive from the Grand Canyon.  We chose this hotel because of the location directly across the entrance to Disneyland drive and the reviews on TripAdvisor and recent renovations.  Two years ago we stayed at the Grand Californian but their rates were so much higher.  The hotel is shaped like an inverted J.  The top of the J is closest to the park with the long part of the J parallel to Disneyland Drive.  We were given a room on the second floor in the middle of the bottom of the J - literally the furthest away from the entrance. When I asked about a closer room, they were completely sold out.  IN retrospect, it was a great location because 1. could see the

My two grown kids and I stayed here fo two nights while we visited Disneyland in Anaheim. The complex was surprisingly quiet  despite the presence of a lot of kids. This hotel is one of a few remaining two story, low rise accommodations in the immediate vicinity of the park. It has a small fitness room next to a store that sells inexpensive licensed Disney souvenir items. The hotel also has a small outdoor pool. The rooms are small but clean and well maintained, with beds that are plump and comfortable. The bathroom is also clean and well maintained. The grounds are also well kept by personnel that seems to be ever present within the property. I did not see an elevator. You can buy park tickets from the front desk so you don't have to endure the long lines at the park counter.

Summary Heading: A great hotel for families visiting Disneyland
Summary: This hotel was perfect for our family vacation.  It was very clean, staff were friendly, the breakfast has lots of options and was always fully stocked, the pool was clean and you can't beat the location if you're heading to Disneyland!  Parking was free which was a bonus as some other similarly priced hotels did not offer this.  I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: No complaints.  Perfect 5 stars.  Highly recommended.
Summary: We the family of 4 (2 kids) stayed there mid-August 2016.   The front desk is VERY helpful, parking and breakfast were included. The room is clean, all equipment like showers, vent fans, air conditioning, microwave, refrig, all worked great.  Each room has USB power adapters, so that charging my mobile devices was easier.  The swimming pool is a bit smaller but has plenty deep areas, and is also clean, and the access is easy.      This place has a souvenir shop in it, and it also sells some daily items, and it's opening hours are great.  Breakfast is decent enough.     This is the closest hotel to Disneyland, so it was easy for us to get out the park during the warmest time of the day to swim in the pool of this hotel, then to go back to the park again after cooling down.   I

Summary Heading: Would Stay Here Again: 41 Traveled with husband 54 and daughter 12
Summary: I chose this place because it was located right across the street from Disneyland.  Having gone there now, I can see that other places REALLY are just as close and across the street from the entrance, so next time I would feel comfortable choosing something else knowing how close other hotels also are.  Even being 'just' across the street, it is still a bit of a hike through the entrance, to the bag check area then security, then over through the gates to the park then down Main Street or Buena Vista (depending on the park you choose) and finally to the rides.  There really is no way around this. At the crosswalk over to Disneyland, there was always a homeless person asking for a handout (even at 11:30 at night, there was a man holding a baby selling candy bars for $2), someone

I would highly recommend this hotel.  You can not beat the location directly across the street from the entrance.  The front desk staff was so friendly when checking in.  I got there really early and wasn't expecting a room but was hoping I could park the car and head to the park for opening and they let me!! They gave me a parking pass to put on the dashboard.  He also mentioned they owned the IHOP parking lot as well if I couldn't find a spot in their parking lot.  I went back around 4:30 to get our room and found lemonade, ice cold water and cookies waiting for us in the lobby.  It was just what we needed after a hot day,  We unpacked the car and rested for an hour and headed right back but first stopping for Cold Stone Creamery ice cream!  You get a discount for staying at

This hotel is very close to the entrance to disneyland. Right across the street so it's an easy walk even with kids. The rooms are comfortable and you can see the fireworks from your room depending on which room you're in. We have stayed here multiple times and never had parking issues, parking can be tough at some motels in the area.  There are places to eat nearby and a Cold Stone on the property. Great choice if Disneyland is your destination.

Summary Heading: Can't stay any closer to Disneyland, park and walk
Summary: Checking prices and reviews, this one has the best reviews, and you cant get any closer to the Disneyland entrance. Keep you car parked, and just walk across the street. This alone save you so much on parking. Their prices were the same for places much further away. We didn't want to take shuttles, or walk far away after being in the parks all day. This was perfect.  Check-in was fast and painless. Stays for 3 nights. They give you a parking permit to place on your dash. You are also allowed to stay parked until midnight, the day you check out. Didn't know this, that's an extra bonus to stay here. Right out front of the parking lot, you have an IHOP, short walk left or right, you have a McDonalds, or a Denny's. You have it covered. Their included hot breakfast was pretty darn

We have stayed at the Parkvue previously and thoroughly enjoy our stay. The staff on the property is friendly and willing to help you with any issue. A great plus walking out your door and the cross walk directly into Disneyland is there. We stayed on the ground floor this time which was easier for me with my luggage. You do get the occasional little munchkin running upstairs but that was short lived. Rooms were refurbished couple of years ago I believe. In good/comfortable condition. I reserved two rooms with connecting door. Our price at this time of the year was $136.00 per night and you add in the great breakfast that is part of the room rate it makes this a very special deal. With our family of 5 saved  approximately $60 a day on breakfasts.  We were there 3 days so the

If you want to be close to Disneyland, this is the best place to stay (outside of Disney property). They have a complimentary breakfast that is legit. The room was clean and they even gave us a gift basket to welcome us. It was great to be so close to the parks that you could just walk across the street for a quick nap or to drop off any purchases. Loved it!

Park Vue's location couldn't be better. It's literally across the street from the entrance to the Disney parks. This is essential for our afternoon rest time (since we like to open and close the park each day). They have water, lemonade, and cookies for guests daily in the lobby...for free! The daily breakfast is basic but a great option to fill up your belly before a day of Disney fun. Rooms are clean and comfortable. We also love the little store downstairs - we used it to buy water bottles each day. I can't imagine staying anywhere else for a trip to Disneyland. The price is perfect for the perks here.

Summary Heading: Always stay here when we're in Anaheim
Summary: This hotel goes put of their way to make sure your stay is memorable ! Clean, safe, everything you could need. The complimentary breakfast has something for everyone. The staff, from maintenance to front desk are helpful and always have a smile for you. Plus after a hot day the lemonade and cookies in the lobby on check in were great ! Thank you for a great place to stay, don't change anything !

Summary Heading: What a perfectc location, What pleasant surprise
Summary: Location - Can't beat it. Walk across the street to Disneyland main gate. Very, very easy to get to the motel from 5. Parking is included in price of room.   Price - A lot less than all others I looked at for July.  Motel - Friendly, welcoming, and professional staff. Rooms are big and clean. That was a pleasant surprise.  Breakfast - From yogurt to bacon. Not bad at all.

Summary Heading: The perfect accommodation for Disneyland visit
Summary: This is our third year staying at Park Vue Inn their service is consistently good. Their rooms are your standard renovated hotel room. We book at 2 Queen bed room which are always comfortable and spacious for a hotel.   The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and the location to Disneyland is unquestionably the closest without staying at the in Park resort.   It is in close proximity to dining options including IHOP and Dennys so work well if you plan to be at the parks till closing then need dinner. Also the Coldstone ice creamery offers a 10% discount to Park Vue guests.

Summary Heading: This is truly my home away from home
Summary: This is truly my home away from home. Good complimentary breakfast that holds my family off until lunch. Breakfast includes waffles, muffins, toast, scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, potatoes, biscuit and gravy depending on day, fruit, yogurt, hard boil eggs, and cereal. Everyone is really friendly. I have been going here for years and stay 5-6 times a year. The Disneyland entrance is a 6 min walk to main gates; it is directly across the street. I have stood in all room types, all very nice and clean. When we fly I order from Von's, they will delivery grocery’s for those afternoon drinks and snacks. Rooms have microwave and refrigerator, small freezer area. The pool area is relaxing and my kids have fun. We usually pick up pizza from Pizza Press next door and head to pool for

Summary Heading: The most convenient reasonably priced hotel
Summary: We were in San Diego and decided to take the children to Disneyland since we were in California.  Based on other reviews, we booked a room at the Park Vue Inn.  It is the closest motel to Disneyland, California Adventure and Downtown Disney.  The person at the front desk was very nice.  When we checked in, he gave us a better rate than what I reserved online because we are AAA members.  The motel is two stories and all the rooms open to the outside.  They offer a free buffet breakfast and free parking.  We did not spend much time in the room, but everything was clean and the children loved the bunk bed in the room.  The bathroom was recently re-tiled. We would definitely stay here again.

We enjoyed three nights at the Park Vue Inn and really loved the location. The family triple room was fine for our family of four. The pool was great and well used. We didn't realise until our final morning that breakfast was complimentary - perhaps guests could be informed on check-inn. I also loved the guest laundry. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Our second time.  We love Park Vue!
Summary: Love this place. Fantastic housekeeping service, comfy beds, free parking, free cookies, coffee and lemonade in the lobby most of the day, free breakfast BUT the BEST part is the proximity to the park!  We could literally see the crosswalk to the main entrance to Dland from our room!  No kidding.  the ONLY complaint I have is the air conditioning system.  It works BUT it has a funny odor that comes out -- almost like urine.  I know that sounds weird but it's true.  AND it always seems to be very damp in the room, like humid/moist.  I think that's from the air conditioner too.  Our clothes were lightly damp if they were left out on a hanger.  The ones in the drawers were okay though.  so maybe they can look into that because last year when we came I went to the front office to

We enjoyed our stay so much the first time we chose park vue inn again. We were upstairs this time and it made a world of difference! Enjoyed watching the fireworks from our room and from the pool. The microwave was a nice addition. There wasn't one on our first visit. The front desk, ladies who take care if breakfast, and the housekeepers are all so nice! We loved our stay and we will be back I am sure. The walk to the park is so nice!! The picture I included is to show the walk the left is the hotel and the right is Disney land.

I have never been treated so poorly by any establishment.  What a horrible experince to have while on vacation with two small children.  There was an error in booking and i was kicked out even tho i had proof my stay included one more night.  I was treated like a criminal and they were going to remove all my belongings without me present.  I left Disneyland to resolve issue and prove my stay included another night.  The way i was treated was inexcusable.  Rude, threatening and non empathetic should not be how a hotel treats anyone, especially not a guest.

The price was not cheap, but places farther away are charging more, and didn't have a hot breakfast.  Breakfast here was pretty good.  It was nice to have cereal and waffles for the kids, and eggs and sausage for the parents - I need protein in the morning. This hotel is right across the street from where the buses pull in to drop people off.  Still takes about 15 minutes to walk past that area to get to the center space between CA Adventure and Disneyland, where you actually enter the parks.  If you want to be able to walk back to the hotel mid-day for a pool break, you'll want to be this close or it could take you much longer to walk to and fro. Very modern, nicely updated rooms with pretty quiet AC. Kids loved the bunk bed. And it was fun to have a view of the fireworks from

We just stayed for my daughter's birthday trip to Disneyland.  You can't find a better location to the park, it is literally across the street from the gate.  An easy walk.  It was so nice to be able to come back to the hotel during the mid day hours and just float in the pool and recharge.  The hotel is very clean, plus it has free parking, wifi and breakfast.  I would recommend to anyone taking a family trip to Disneyland.

I had stayed here in the past and decided to return because of the close proximity to Disneyland. I was pleasantly surprised by the refurbishing of the rooms since my stay few years ago. Floors, bath, and carpet all looked new. I stayed at the Grand California during my last trip and their rooms are minuscule compared to Park Vue Inn's, especially the bathroom. The cost at Grand California was more than double and didn't include breakfast. Park Vue offered Belgian Waffles, scrambled eggs, breakfast meats that changed daily, bagels, toast, cold and hot cereal, yogurt, and more. Very impressive! There are signs everywhere outside reminding people to be considerate of other guests and be quiet. We never heard a sound during our three night stay. We loved watching the fireworks from

We stayed here several years ago and decided on a repeat trip due to its proximity to the Disneyland Resort. You are literally across the street from the entrance.   We booked the deluxe room with the jacuzzi which was fantastic. The water pressure in the shower was a little low but not enough to lessen the quality of the stay.   The room was very clean and the A/C worked great. We appreciated that the staff left it on when they cleaned the room so it was cool when we came back from s long day at the parks.   The breakfast was fine. We had no trouble parking. Wifi was pretty slow but free so we won't complain about it   We will definitely be back!

This hotel was thoroughly enjoyed by my husband and son! 5 minute walk to Disneyland! Decent hot breakfast. Great view for fireworks. Clean. Beds comfortable. Per my husband, a lot nicer than it looked on the outside. Will stay there again, for sure, if we go back!

This hotel was perfect in every way.... Location, price, breakfast, clean, safe, bunk beds, refrigerators, microwave.... We highly recommend it for families on a Disneyland vacation. Loved watching the fireworks from our room.  Cookies and lemonade upon arrival.  Couldn't be closer to the park entrance.  My daughters loved the bunk beds. We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Nice, quiet room in perfect location
Summary: I recently stayed at the neighboring Anaheim Desert Inn & Suites and was disappointed in the cleanliness of the room and overall condition of the hotel. The one thing we did like was the location so this time we tried the Park Vue which is directly across from the entrance of the Parks. We had a 2 room suite and I was very impressed with the quality of the rooms and the quietness. We had 3 women in our party and loved the fact that there was a vanity in the bathroom and an additional vanity in the main living/kitchen area. The separate living/kitchen area was fantastic to have so people in our party could sleep in the bedroom without being disturbed by others that were awake. One of our party had recently stayed in the Grand Californian hotel at $600+ a night and said she

Spent a week here with the family while visiting LA/Disney.  Picked this hotel because it is literally across the street from the entrance to Disney.  You can easily walk to main entrance gates/ticket booths.  It is only slightly farther away than the shuttle bus drop off spots.  I don't think you can get much closer unless you stay in a Disney hotel.    We really liked the hotel.  Had everything we wanted: free parking, free hot breakfast, free wi-fi, pool, work out facilities.  There is also a little store on the property and a Cold Stone ice cream place.  IHOP is next door, and there are other food places with in walking distance.    The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, the staff was nice.  It is not super luxurious or anything like that.  But it was a good family

We are WDW veterans who made our first visit to Disneyland at the end of June.  I spent quite a bit of time online reading hotel reviews on Disney-fan boards.  There was hardly a mention of Park Vue Inn, even though the ratings are quite high on this site.  Perhaps its best to keep this affordable hotel a secret...  We picked Park Vue for the close proximity to the DL gates and the affordable prices. We stayed four nights in a room with a queen bed and bunk beds.  As other reviewers stated, you can't get any closer, even if you were to stay on Disney property.  Check-in was smooth and easy and the front desk staff was very friendly and attentive.  They provided water, lemonade, and cookies, which was appreciated as we arrived on a day with temps near 100 degrees.  Because we

Summary Heading: Best budget option within walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: My family (kids, husband and parents) recently stayed in a one bedroom suite during a weekend trip to Disneyland.  I was not expecting much but was very pleasantly surprised. Rooms were moderately sized and included a small kitchenette. In addition to free parking and complimentary breakfast (waffles, cereal, pastries, eggs, bacon, fruit) the hotel was a short walk to Disneyland and probably closer than walking from the Disneyland hotel. Staff was helpful and there was also a small shop on site for snacks and cheaper souvenirs. I would definitely stay here again as it was less than half the price of the Disney hotels, convenient for mid day naptime and allowed for the kids (ages 5 & 1) to get to bed just after watching the Paint the night parade.

Summary Heading: Solid value, clean, very close to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is like many on Harbor Blvd., older motels that have been cleaned up a bit. This hotel is very clean and right across the street from the Disneyland pedestrian entrance.  It's closer to the main gate than the Disneyland Hotel.    As compared to Best Western Park Place Inn (where we stayed last year), Park Vue Inn has a better parking policy (they let you remain parked in their lot until midnight of the day you leave instead of 2pm), but their hot breakfast has less variety.  Both are equally clean and the same distance from the Disneyland entrance.  Both pools are small and located in awkward spots near the parking lot, but Park Vue Inn has some nice plants around it.   The price will seem high to the uninitiated for an old motel, but both of these hotels are sitting

Very nicely located hotel for Disney - literally just across the street from the main entrance.  Hotel room was small, but serviceable (lets face it - you are never in the room!).  We had a queen bed and bunk beds, which was super great.  A small fridge, microwave and coffee maker was a very nice touch.  Our room was clean.  Breakfast was very nice and spread out so you could move around nicely.  Tables inside and outside, we could always find a table, so that was good.  Breakfast had a nice assortment of items as well as waffle stations.  Front desk staff was very helpful and accommodating, and there was lemonade or ice water available at the check in desk - so nice!  Free parking was appreciated. Great stay - I'd be happy to stay here again.

Summary Heading: Could u get any closer to Disney???
Summary: Awesome value nice motel. The kids loved the location of the pool. The continental breakfast was good. Overall super experience for the price. The motel was clean and staff was nice. Bonus is Cold Stone by the lobby

All of the excellent reviews are definitely legit. We stayed at this hotel for 6 days while visiting the Disneyland Resort. The location could not be better since it is literally across the street from the Disneyland entrance. The rooms were very clean, spacious, and comfortable. The free breakfast was outstanding and was kept well stocked. The staff was very courteous.  We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to Disneyland.

This is the perfect place for a family to stay for a Disneyland trip!  We stayed at this hotel for 4 days while visiting Disneyland.  We've stayed at other places in the area, but we've found our new favorite!  Our room was spacious, with bunk beds for the kids (so convenient!) and a queen bed for us.  There is no closet in the room, which would have been nice to stow suitcases, but that's a minor thing.  The beds were comfortable, with ample pillows and bedding.  About ten minutes after we got into the room, someone from the front desk called to see how the room was and if we needed anything.  A simple touch, but a very nice indication of the level of service.  Microwave, fridge and coffeemaker in the room all worked well.  Coffee was restocked each day.  The breakfast in the

This was my family's second trip to Disneyland, and we decided to give this hotel a shot due to its affordability and proximity to the park. We were really happy with our decision to stay here. The location cannot be beat. You literally walk across the street and you're in the park. The beds were comfy and the free wi-fi and mini-fridge came in handy every day. The pool and hot tub were great too, and never crowded when we were there in the spring. Plus, at night we watched the fireworks show from our room.   The only negatives I can think of were that the bathtub wasn't the cleanest for a couple of the days (there was sand in it--not ours), the breakfast was fairly substandard (thankfully Panera Bread is close by), and that it would be nice if there was a grocery store or

Summary Heading: Good value clean and close to Disneyland
Summary: Great hotel, great location & recent renovations. Stayed 7 days . Early check in seems to be not available but oh well. Just take a drive down to newport for a couple hours.  Not one problem during our stay. As for reviews of thin walls . Just like any other hotel in the area . Had to teach my son not to walk on his heels. Breakfast in the morning was always a pleasure. Until I found out biscuits and gravy are served every other day . :( (love b&g ) . Patio view for fireworks is great if you don't want to stay in the park all night . Staff always cleaning up the grounds reminds you of all the disney staff . Great gift shop on site . For if you forgot anything . This will definitely be our first choice as long as they are not booked .

Relatively cheap for the area but I would have preferred a comfortable bed and pillows for the long and tiring days we spent at Disneyland. Standard breakfast. 5 minute walk so could return for a rest during the day. Loud aircon made it hard to sleep

You can't find a more convenient location than this without being inside the park at one of the much more expensive Disney properties. It is an older facility, but it is well maintained. Free parking, free hot breakfast, immediately across the street from the Disneyland entrance. Staff was very helpful and pleasant. The pool is a bit small, but we ended up not using it since we were in the park all of the time. The beds were reasonably comfortable. We will use this hotel again the next time we come to Disneyland. Wifi was free and reasonably fast.

Most comments have been said before and I can repeat most. Real close to Disneyland - excellent for a quick recharge break if needed. Breakfast was plentiful and filling and without pretension. Kids liked to make their own waffles. Staff were friendly and helpful. Charles on reception was great and checked us in real quick and was there when we left too and it was all easy.  The room was great. We had a triple queen which the kids loved and it suited us as we had a separate room. If you want a really flash hotel then this is probably not for you but for a clean, efficient, convenient and cost effective choice you couldn't go far wrong with the Park Vue.  Only downside I guess is that the rooms open onto the walkway ( as lots of motels do) and as there are lots of people up early

Our room was very clean and updated. Cannot beat the location if you're going to Disneyland Resort. Our kids loved the pool! We left the park each day to swim and nap. We didn't feel bad about leaving the park for a little while because it only took five minutes to walk back.

Summary Heading: STAY HERE WITH YOUR FAMILY - GREAT BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!
Summary: We stayed here the last week of May and it was fantastic for our family of 4 (two kids 10 and 12).  The location is great (700 steps to the entrance to Disneyland).  The staff are very friendly and helpful.  The rooms are clean and well set up - yeah for bunk beds!.  The water pressure is great for that early Disney-morning shower.  The amenities were generous (included shower caps). The free breakfast will save you 56 bucks as that is what it cost us in the park for 2 adult breakfasts and 2 Mickey mouse pancakes, juice and tea. Plus, the free parking is great!   We used to stay at the Disneyland Hotel and/or the Grand Californian and we got tired of forking over copious amounts of cash for subpar service and a too busy pool.  We were way happier at this hotel as we never felt

Summary Heading: Wonderful and Excellent property with Friendly staff
Summary: Stayed there from 39May till 03Jun in their 2 Queens with Sofa Sleeper room.   Staff from check-in, housekeeping and etc were all professional, warmth, approachable, knowledgeable and friendly. All of them were all ready with a sincere smile and willing to help.  Room was clean, amenities were plentiful, comfortable bed and everything was in good working condition.  Will not hesitate to recommend your property to anyone who wanted to visit Disneyland and Anaheim.  Finally, Kudos to all the staff at Park Vue Inn.  We will be back.

If you got kids and going to Disney park stay here for shore, you are 5mins walk from the main gate you can't get any closer even the Disney hotel are further away, it has a free breakfast , but there is a great Ihop nextdoor. Big deep swimming pool and spa pool,  Many great different rooms with banks and even two room rooms this has three double beds. Free parking Great place to stay

My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, we went to Disneyland on a Monday and Tuesday. Location was great since the hotel it's right across the street from Disney we can walk and not worry about driving, the parking at the hotel is free so that saves you a few bucks. There is an IHOP on the same parking lot as the hotel where we ate breakfast every morning. The hotel provided free continental breakfast but we didn't want to try it. The hotel was very nice and clean and most important we felt safe. A little noisy in the morning from the kids excited to go to Disney as expected, but it didn't bother us at all. I really recommend this hotel, the staff was very friendly when checking in and out.

Our family of four road tripped from Edmonton, Alberta at the end of April with a second stop in Anaheim to visit the parks.  We've stayed at several of the properties on Harbor across the street from Disneyland/CA and had stayed at the Park Vue Inn some years ago.  We decided to book here again as a lot of the hotels charge for parking and that was a big turn off for us.  We were super happy with our choice.  Check in was quick and easy and we were given a room on the ground floor as requested (lots of stuff to load and unload).  As I said earlier, parking is free and ample.  The room was clean and was an adequate size with two queen beds.  It has a small microwave and fridge.  This was great for snacks, lunches etc.  It would be nice to have an extra mirror in the room as it

Summary Heading: Consistent value and quality for the price and location.
Summary: This was our second occasion staying at Park Vue Inn, across the street from the Disneyland Resort. We had another peaceful stay, this time in a room with a queen/bunk bed combo. Hats off to the front desk staff for accommodating us, this was a last minute booking and we were amazed to find availability at a very reasonable price. We stayed in late March during the infamous Spring Break week. Couldn't have had a smoother experience. Thank you Park Vue, for another great experience.

Summary Heading: Right Across the street from Disneyland
Summary: This motel is literally right across from the main entrance on the Harbor side.  The rooms have recently been refurbished and were attractive, comfortable, and clean.  They have free breakfast, which includes bacon or sausage, eggs, fruit, etc. It can be eaten inside, or outside on the deck.  The deck is also a good place for viewing the fireworks. There is free parking, until midnight of the

My daughter and I stayed here on our recent visit to Disneyland. We arrived late on a Sunday evening. Check in was fast and easy. Our room had two queen beds and was on the second floor. The hotel is across the street from Disneyland’s main gates.  Breakfast was very good. Each day the offerings included scrambled eggs, breakfast potatoes, bagels, bread, cereal, yogurt, fruit, oatmeal, and make your own waffles. Some days the breakfast meat was bacon other days it was sausage. A couple of times they offered biscuits and gravy. We really liked the biscuits and wished they had served them more than twice during our stay. The breakfast staff was on top of everything. Always quick to clean tables/counters and restock food items.   Unlike other reviewers our housekeeping staff was

I went Disneyland with my kids and their 3 year old and 7 month old.  I picked this hotel because it is right across from the main gate.  Not expensive.  Breakfast excluded.  We were pleasantly surprised. It was clean and the rooms were large.  The micro and fridge were priceless. Staff was very pleasant.  The place was filled with family's.  Free parking.  I think it was a great choice for a fam

Summary Heading: Room #231-Air conditioning unit smelled of urine.
