Summary: Upon arrival I noticed a strong urine smell coming from the air-conditioning unit.  I immediately let the front desk know about it.  They assured me somebody would look into it.  I was not made aware of any resolution.  Although it would have been inconvenient we would have moved to another room.  The option was never offered.  After making the front desk aware of the issue it was not resolved or to my knowledge even attended to.

We stayed recently at the Park Vue Inn and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  Our room was a queen bed with bunk beds configuration which suited our needs. The housekeeping staff were excellent in keeping our room clean and providing us with necessary items. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful during check in and throughout our stay.

This place is awesome if you're just looking for somewhere to sleep close to the parks. There's no frills but it's clean and updated. Our room had a bunk-bed which our daughter loved. The front desk staff is very helpful and you simply can't get any closer to the park in a non-Disney owned property. It's right across the street. There is a small store with souvenirs and basic groceries/snack options on site as well as a Coldstone Ice Cream. You can see the Disney fireworks from the hotel. Breakfast is basic but functional. We've stayed here a couple times and will visit again.

As others have mentioned in reviews the location of this hotel is ideal when visiting Disneyland/California Adventure.  The free parking and free hot breakfast are also perks.  The front staff for us were just average.  When asked for recommendations of where to eat locally outside of the parks, the young lady really didn't have any answer.  The greeting we received when we first arrived was OK....just basically covering the paperwork that needed to be done. The room was a nice size for two people, with nice amenities such as a microwave and refrigerator.  I felt there was a smell of "mold" in the room and the carpet is in need of a good cleaning, if not a replacement.  We were hardly in the room so these things didn't really matter.  I would not have wanted a baby crawling on

I LOVED that there was a fridge (freezer) and microwave in the rooms. I LOVE the granite countertops in the bathroom and desk in the room! I LOVE the color schemes, the carpeting is pretty, the laminate flooring in the bathroom is pretty. The room looks beautiful. The front desk staff were very accommodating about allowing me to store my breastmilk in the hotel staff freezer, which was amazing because I have to follow strict regulations to donate my breastmilk. After we checked in, I loved that we got a phone call to the room asking if everything was satisfactory and reminding us that we can call for needs at anytime by dialing zero. That took my by pleasant surprise. The housekeepers were AMAZING and made our room look fantastic. I felt very comfortable at your hotel and will

Summary Heading: Excellent location...but got a few tips.
Summary: This location is perfect for someone like me who likes to be able to take a break during my visits to Disneyland. It's directly across the street from the main gates of both parks, so it was easy to walk back to my room and rest before going back to enjoy the rest of the day at the park. The rooms were nice, the beds were very comfortable, and the room had a lot of outlets and USB outlets to charge multiple devices at the same time. There is also a safe, which I only usually see in Vegas.   The only bad thing I can say about the room is the noise. You can hear everyone that walks by your door or when a car drives by. In the morning, the housekeeping staff comes early (in the 6:00 hour) and the carts they push around make rattling noises. I stayed on the first floor, but you

Stayed here for 4 nights during trip to Disneyland. Location is brilliant, across the street from the entrance to Disney. Rooms are tidy and comfortable, nice pool and spa area and free breakfast.  Parking is free, good wifi and a guest laundry.

We had 4 rooms here and were happy with all of them.  There was a problem with a microwave in one of the rooms, but it was changed out quickly and without hassle when we let front desk know about it.  It is a family hotel, so there will be some noise. I suggest asking for a room on the top floor (of the two) to avoid foot noise from the rooms above.  The kids really enjoyed the pool and hot tub.  It was great to have to get away from the mid afternoon heat.  We were happy with the breakfast offerings.  There was something for everyone, and they were really good at keeping the items filled up.  The breakfast area is very busy first thing in the morning as everyone prepares to go to the park.  We went a little later a couple days (about 8:30-9:00) and found it to be much less busy

We had a rather large family staying at this hotel for our trip to Disneyland. There were 11 of us in total and spread out over 4 rooms. The hotel kept us all really close to each other. We had stayed here 5 years ago and liked it so much we came back.  It's definitely not a luxury hotel but it's perfect for a Disney trip, you're barely ever in the room. 2 of our 4 rooms had 2 double beds and the other 2 rooms had 2 double beds and bunk beds. The kids loved the bunks! The beds were very comfortable and clean. The rooms were all really clean, but the carpets could use changing. Normal wear and tear but I think it's time for a face lift.  The complimentary breakfast is REALLY good and plentiful! Waffles, bacon, hashbrowns... Lots of variety. And very friendly service. Any employee

We stayed for 6 nights, and had a wonderful stay. The rooms were good size with bathrooms towards the back. We had 2 queen beds. The breakfast was good and changed a little daily so it wasn't the same stuff everyday. We watched the fireworks from the deck off the breakfast area and you could see them very well!!! We were on the second floor next to a staircase but didn't have any noise issues. It was very quiet! The staff were all very helpful and accommodating. They had a pool too, we didn't use it but it looked very nice. Everything appeared recently updated. And the best part it is right across the street from Disney entrance!!!!! Great food places all located within walking distance and a cute little Shop attached to the hotel, that has everything you could be! We will be

Our family had a room with two queen beds and a bunk bed—ideal for this family of four.  While a modest size, the room felt like each person had their own space (probably because each person had their own bed!) The friendly hotel staff helped with the delivery and pickup of our rental stroller, served up a hot breakfast including DIY waffles which our kids loved, and made us feel welcome.  Best part: it is less than a five minute walk to the Disneyland gates.

After staying here back in 1995 I really wanted to come back here again. I tried to get a room but there was nothing available. When we arrived in Anaheim we thought hmm maybe we should try our luck in case someone had canceled.. it was our lucky day! They were able to accommodate us - we are so so so happy they could. We arranged to check out earlier from the other hotel which shall be left unnamed! Tonight is our first night and it is more better than I remembered. The staff are incredibly friendly and super helpful. The rooms are almost double the size of the room we were staying, they have complimentary hot and cold breakfast and free wifi, wonderful décor in the rooms and the price is second to none. They also have available in the lobby free refreshments, coffee, computer

Summary Heading: Another great stay at the Park Vue Inn
Summary: Second time staying here and loved it again.  Staff is so nice, rooms are nice and comfortable and clean.  Breakfast is very good and so nice to have before you leave for the park every morning.   Could see the fireworks from our room also you can view from the balcony by the breakfast room.  Will never stay anywhere else.  So convenient to the park, when you get tired it is only a 5 minute walk from either gate to the crosswalk to the hotel.  Hardworking housekeepers and maintenance staff, also very nice.

While visiting Disneyland we had a two rooms one was fine but the one I stayed in smelt like mold. The carpet was real dirty, that after taking a shower the bottom of my feet were dirty again from walking on the carpet to the bed. I took one of the white wash cloths and wiped the carpet and came up with dirt and long black hair, that was not my hair. The air conditioner smelt real bad, it smelt like mold. The best part of the stay was the great breakfast they serve.
Manager Response: I would like to apologize for the experience you had in one of your two guest rooms. I responded to another member from your traveling party that posted a similar review about the same room. We strive to provide exceptional guest experiences, and guest feedback is an important part of the process. As mentioned in your review, we identified a malfunctioning AC unit as the source of the odor, and we replaced the unit immediately. Preventative maintenance is a priority; however, sometimes equipment fails between scheduled maintenance. We know you have a choice and we thank you for choosing our Hotel. Hopefully you will consider giving us the chance to be of service on your next trip to the area.

Summary: Stayed here with my wife and 2 y.o. son for 1 night. I always look for suites or hotel rooms with 2 sleeping areas so my son can nap and sleep peacefully (and not annoy the crap out of my wife and I).  We stayed in the triple queen room at this hotel which was great. There is the main room with 2 queen beds, attached bathroom. Then there is a separate room with its own queen bed. We set up that room for our son and it worked really well.  They also let us park there early on day 1 and park there late on day 2.  The staff was nice, the location is actually the closest hotel possible to the entrance to the parks and there is an attached Cold Stone. What more can you ask for? Oh yeah, the price was great as well.

im leaving this review for my room, we had two and while one was good the other was horrible. Walking in our room had a weird odor but we figured it was just needing to be aired out. Unfortunately when the air kicked on it got worse. The air from the AC smelled like it mildew or mold. After showering we walked around the room barefoot and our feet were black from the carpet. We rubBed a towel on the carpet once and it was filthy. The room just seemed like it hadn't actually been fully cleaned. We said something to the front desk about it before we checked out and they apologized, we were loading up the truck to leave and saw them spinkling deodorizer on the carpet, this may help for the next people in the room but I really think they should look into the odor instead of trying
Manager Response: I would like to apologize for the experience you had in one of your two guest rooms. Another member of your traveling party also posted a similar review about the same room. We strive to provide exceptional guest experiences, and guest feedback is an important part of the process. As mentioned in your review, we identified a malfunctioning AC unit as the source of the odor, and we replaced the unit immediately. Preventative maintenance is a priority; however, sometimes equipment fails between scheduled maintenance. Regarding the carpets; our Hotel is very high occupancy, so we clean the carpets in every room, every month. We deep clean our carpets; we don’t just sprinkle deodorizer on them. We use a non-toxic, biodegradable, dry carpet cleaning material that is agitated into the carpet to deep clean them. The application of this two-step process is what you saw my staff applying to the carpet. We truly value your patronage, and we hope you will consider giving us a second chance to be of better service.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and to also see fireworks every night!
Summary: The hotel was really nice. Very clean, updated and spacious. We needed cribs and they actually have cribs - not playpens - which was great for the babies. The rooms were extremely quiet. I could not even hear our 2 smallest kids crying in the room adjoining mine. I stayed in my room with our 4 year old and we were very comfortable. The beds were "fluffy" and very clean. The air conditioner had to work overtime to cool and de-humidify the California air but after turning them way down - the temp was fine. We had trouble getting hot water but would call the front office and we would get hot water within a few minutes along with a heartfelt apology. I'm not sure what the problem was but it seemed like it may have been a breaker issue. We were very close to Disneyland which was the

Summary Heading: GREAT play for a Disney Stay!
Summary: It was so great staying just across the street from Disneyland.  You just park your car and walk the rest of your trip; especially with several restaurants within a block of the hotel!  The morning breakfast was wonderful and the ladies running the breakfast should be commended--great food and nice variety.  Every person we encountered at the hotel was very helpful and kind.  The room was clean and comfortable.  Lemonade and cookies in the lobby daily were a nice touch.  The only complaint I had was the laundry; don't waste your time.  Otherwise, I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Close to the park, breakfast included, decent price.  I'd stay there again.
Summary: Close to the park.  A hot breakfast is included in the price of the room, free parking, just across the street from Disneyland.  Close to several restaurants and cold stone creamery.  Small souvenir shop for anything you forgot to pack. We didn't even look at the pool so can't comment on that very convenient.  I'd stay there again.

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn for one night after a day at Disneyland. Although we live in Los Angeles, we had two small children with us and wanted to have a home base for a full day of fun. We had a queen room with a bunk bed. The location was perfect, front desk staff was friendly, and the parking and breakfast were free. That alone is a bargain. The bed was comfortable and the wall AC unit cooled the room with no problem. My only complaints were the small size of the room, though I know they offer larger options. There wasn't a closet or even a rack to hang clothes, and that struck me as odd for a hotel. I would definitely return though!

My family stayed here the week before Easter for our first trip to Disneyland. The hotel was clean. The staff was helpful and friendly. The location was perfect. It was a short walk to Disneyland and many restaurants are within walking distance.   There was a free breakfast, but we were not impressed by it. Instead we picked up things to eat in our room or ate in the park.  We had an issue with the wifi not working in our room one night, but was fixed the next day.   Parking is free. We were always able to find a spot, but the lot was almost always full.  There is also a small gift shop with supplies and souvenirs. The staff inside were friendly. I'm t was nice to be able to get things we forgot so close.  We enjoyed our stay here and will consider it again when we return to

Proximity to the park really can't be beat. The rooms are nice and very clean, along with the external property itself. Staff is friendly and responsive. The hot breakfast in the morning is decent and definitely worth the money savings it provides over the other area choices or food in the park. We've stayed here several times and it never disappoints.

Had an excellent stay here. The location is perfect-- right across the street and closer than the Disneyland resort hotels. Clean and comfortable rooms with a great pillow top mattress and a fun bunk bed for our son. Fast and free wi-fi, free parking, and even a convenient laundry room, which came in handy as we are in the middle of a long SoCal trip. The hot breakfast is great-- fluffy eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits, potatoes, Belgian waffles, and really good coffee. We ate right at 7am when they opened on the outdoor deck and had plenty of time to make it to the parks before opening (for cars land fans, with time to spare to get fast passes for racers). The first night we sat out on the deck at 9pm with ice cream from the cold stone creamery downstairs and had a picture

The Park Vue Inn is our favorite hotel when visiting Disneyland.  It is directly across the street from the entrance gates to the parks.  The provide a full breakfast in the morning, which will keep you full until the afternoon.  There is a Denny's next door which is probably the best bargain for eating while in the Disneyland area.  It is so close that we come home to rest late afternoon when the crowds are busiest. By the time we return in early evening, crowds are thinning and we have the run of the park.  They also have a little gift shop.  Most items are less expensive than comparable ones in the Disney gift shops.  They might be from previous years, but Mickey Mouse is Mickey Mouse!  It is a bit expensive, but parking and wifi are free, so that helps.

Right at the park entrance, so incredibly convenient location.  Watched the fireworks from our balcony.  Room seemed updated recently.  Every employee encountered was friendly and helpful.  Stayed in the room with bunk beds and the kids loved that.

Summary Heading: right where you want to be
Summary: Right across the street from Disneyland is about the best location you can have when visiting Disneyland. Leave the car, walk across the street, and you are a short walk from the entrance. Nothing special here, but clean and quiet. Easy in and easy out. Breakfast is typical motel food. Scrambled eggs, some kind of meat (turkey sausage one day and the thinnest bacon in the world the next). Toast, bagels, cereals, juices. Two queen beds in the room were perfect for two grandparents and a 6-year-old.   No need to bee at the park at night; you can watch the fireworks right from the balcony at this hotel. Surprisingly fast wifi at around 20mb/sec.

Summary Heading: Perfect Hotel for a Disney Trip!
Summary: This was my second time that I have stayed at Park Vue Inn and will continue to stay there for the rest of my Disney Trips. First of all it was one of the best prices I could find within walking distance of Disneyland. It is right across the street from the parks and a really quick walk to the front door of your room and really nice rooms as well! They have a fantastic free hot breakfast that will fill you up and save you tons of money in the parks. Also free parking for your stay and up until midnight on the day you check out, which is very rare around Disneyland! They also have a AAA discount and a returning guest discount. Not only is it a great location and hotel but also has a great staff. Everyone that we talked with was very nice and really cared about their guests. This

We stayed the weekend of 2/18-21.  The hotel room was a really good size, we were at the back of the hotel in a king jacuzzi room so it was nice and quiet (besides our neighbors.) It's nice that there is a sink in the bathroom area and in the little "kitchen area" It was great to have a table with chairs and a desk!  The bed was comfy, the heater and a/c worked!  The TV also had on demand for free and had a lot of great options for a hotel which was really nice when my knee bummed out after walking over 26 miles at Disneyland!  The downsides were used toiletries.. eww, and our jacuzzi tub that I was so looking forward to after a long day at Disneyland still had cleaning product residue in it which I don't really want to soak in :(  There was also hair on the shower walls and our

We stay here every time we visit Disneyland. Great staff. Always friendly and accommodating to our needs. Location is perfect. Right across the street from the entrance to the park. Very good continental breakfast! We have probably stayed here 15 to 20 times and have never been disappointed.

Even though had a room at the far side of the hotel, this was still closer to the front gates than if we had stayed on property.  As a frequent visitor to Disney World, where we stay on property; hardest decision was not to stay on property when coming to Disneyland.  It was the best decision I made.  Room with two queen beds was big with lots of extra space.  Although only two adults stayed, I would say that four adults to could stay comfortably.  Breakfast was okay.  Free parking was a great bonus.  When I return to Disneyland, will be staying here again.

overall a fine hotel.  5 stars for the price, 5 stars for location, but im taking off a couple points because the staff wasnt overly friendly and the place was pretty noisy with kids in the hallways at all hours of the night.

The hotel is clean & staff is wonderful. However the coffee they provide for free at the front is not as good as it was the year before we stay. It has a chemical taste. Told they are working on this.

I found this hotel on Trip Advisor so I wanted to review after our stay.  We returned yesterday from Park Vue.  We had a double queen bunk bed room.  Room 133.  The hotel lobby has great service and friendly staff.  They called to check on us shortly after we arrived and brought us the extra blankets we requested.  Our room was clean and serviced daily.  Our toiletries were replenished which was a nice surprise.  The breakfast room can get very busy an hour before the parks open so keep that in mind when going to eat.  Breakfast was good but ran out quickly.  Scrambled eggs were being made fresh on a skillet so it takes time.  The location is perfect for Disneyland.  The grounds were well maintained and employees were touching up paint when we were leaving yesterday.  Sidewalks

Summary Heading: Fabulous hotel for a Disneyland trip
Summary: The location of this hotel is THE best!  We literally walked out to the sidewalk, crossed the street, and we were at Disneyland.  The staff was super friendly and helpful.  Check in/check out super easy.  Hot breakfast was provided each morning.  Food was good with a decent selection.  We traveled with a 2.5 year old........our room was in the back corner, which was perfect!  It was very quiet, even for the 2 hour afternoon nap that we all took each day.  The room was a nice size, plenty of room for 4 of us.  Parking was never an issue.  They even allow you to park your car there until midnight on the day that you check out!  We will definitely be making this our go to hotel for our Anaheim visits.  Very impressed!

This hotel was awesome! Just a short walk across the street to Disneyland. They have nice rooms, beds are comfortable. They have a little store and a cold stones. Tony Roma's and IHOP are just a 2 min walk from this hotel. The staff was great, very friendly. We dropped off our bags before check-in (like8:00)and later that day they delivered our bags to our room before we even checked-in. Saved me a trip from dragging everything to our room.

This place is really great. Seems crazy to give a $129/night hotel 5 stars, but they meet all the needs here. LOCATION is insane not only AT the Disneyland gates, but also virtually next door to Pizza Press which, as the ratings will show, is a must-done in Anaheim.   Staff is always friendly, prices are great, breakfast is very good, beds are comfy, rooms are super clean and up to date, showers are good, coffee maker is full sized (!), and the pool is heated nicely!   No drawbacks at all. For this price point and even somewhat higher, you cannot go wrong here!

Summary Heading: Great place to Stay right across from Disneyland
Summary: This was our first stay at the Parkvue and we were very happy.  The location is amazing, you can even stand in the parking lot and watch the fireworks show.  The hotel staff was very helpful and nice.  The room was clean and comfortable.  Parking and breakfast are included which is a plus.

I have been to the Park Vue 4 times now and one more trip scheduled.  The rooms have always been clean, proximity to the park is perfect, and the staff has always been helpful.  I love the breakfast, and it is nice to fill up before heading to Disneyland.  Good choices, plenty at all times, ladies always friendly and smiling, please tip them for their work!  Our son loves the pool and even though its in the middle of the parking, you don't feel like you are when inside the pool area.  This is our go to hotel, location is the key and like the parking and breakfast included.

Although it's right across the street from Disneyland, you can almost miss this little gem. Placed behind Cold Stone Creamery, Park Vue Inn is a quaint, charming hotel. It's considered a 'budget' hotel, but it doesn't feel budget at all. Rooms were CLEAN, CLEAN, CLEAN! Even though rooms were a little small, we got a two queen room on the bottom floor and it was perfect for our family of five. And it was extraordinarily quiet even though it looked like there were a bunch of families staying there.... I can't say enough about this place and the price it right! Since 2013, we've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel (which is fantastic if you want to spend that kind of money), Best western inn ( next to park vue inn, which is OK- but more run down than Park vue) and the Fairfield inn (

I'll start off by saying I had mediocre expectations when I booked. I was WRONG! This place is amazing! Friendly, helpful staff all around, from maintenance, to housekeeping, to front desk... they were all awesome.   We were there early February for 8 nights, in a 2 Queen room. We were lucky to get one of the updated rooms, which I was happy about. The beds were comfortable, the room was clean and bright, it was perfect. I would have liked a bit more storage in the room. There is no dresser, but a desk with three drawers (not quite as large as dresser drawers, but bigger than desk drawers). With 4 of us there for 8 nights, I would have liked to not live out of suitcases for the week, but my son had to as my daughter, husband and I used up all the drawer space. :) And a shelf or

Location was perfect! Room was nice. We booked the queen bed with bunk bed. Clean, comfy bed. Could see the fireworks every night from our room. Only complaint, no closet or table to eat on.  Pool was nice and warm, gym was small but got job done. Breakfast/area was good, but when cold out side tough to find table inside. Great visit though!!! Highly recommend this place to a family on a budget looking for a great place to stay while visiting Disney.

Right across from Disneyland's main entrance - literally at the crosswalk. You cannot stay anywhere much closer to Disneyland, even the Disney hotels involve about the same amount of walking to the gates. This means you can hit the park early before the crowds, come back to the hotel for a break / nap, and back to the park for the fabulous evening entertainment. Actually, you can also see the fireworks from your room or the hotel car park.  The hotel is itself is clean and well-kept. They offer a free continental breakfast, although I could not take advantage of it as I have a disability and it was on the second floor (no elevator). But a plus for families heading off early. I had an accessible room, where the only problem was that the bed was too high for me to get onto. The

This place is in the best location for accessing Disneyland. It's straight across the road! The rooms are basic but very comfortable and clean. Our 16 and 18 year old each had their own bed as the room had double bunks. This was a real bonus. Breakfast was included which saved us lots of money as we could eat as much as we liked meaning that our belly's were full to conquer Disney each day. The staff were friendly and the free wifi and laundry facilities were a bonus. We were here over Thanksgiving and the place was packed! We would stay here again and we are telling all of our friends about the place too.

Can't beat the location, Disneyland is literally right across the street. The room was clean, in working order and had perks like a mini fridge and a safe. Wasn't expecting the wall unit air conditioning, but for a trip in February we didn't suffer due to it. The staff that run free hot breakfast were awesome. The waffle machines are amazing, there were options of cereal, sausage, potatoes and toast when we went  but I wouldn't recommend the eggs. The staff was impressive!!! They ran out of juice while we were there and they actually apologized when my husband informed them, and put more out right away. (At some other hotels, when they run out of free breakfast, they run empty and refuse to put more out) It was also handy having a convenience store and an Ihop in the same

Summary Heading: Being across the street is not worth the headaches.
Summary: I type this review at 5am as the people above me have for the last hour decided they need to pace back and forth and do god knows what else. At some points it sounds like a WWE wrestling match.  When I say you can hear everything above you I am not exaggerating. The floors creak like an old lady's knees. You can hear when people above and next to you turn on their showers. The beds didn't make anything any more bearable either.  There are several signs all over the property reminding people to be quiet. It's because you can hear everything through the walls. From people's kids running down the hallway to people rolling their suitcases.  I called the front desk at 6am after listening to the above ridiculousness for almost two hours and explained the situation. I requested a

Across the street from the Disneyland entrance on Harbor Blvd. Free parking. Free Wi-Fi. Free hot breakfast. Nicely heated pool and hot tub. Coffee maker and hair dryer did not work and TV was not working because it was on the wrong setting, but hotel staff took care of it in a timely and friendly manner. Other reviews about the outside walkway being noisey are correct when kids run up and down, but you are at Disneyland and kids are excited. Great value. We would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Clean, affordable hotel ridiculously close to Disneyland
Summary: This was my 4th trip to Disneyland. In the past, I stayed at chain hotels that have a 15- to 30-minutes walk to the parks. Normally, that's not a problem, but we generally walk 20,000 steps in the parks, so the closer you are, the better. This hotel is literally across the street from where the buses drop people off to enter the parks. It includes hot breakfast in the morning (mediocre, but nice for filling you up), free WiFi, pool and hot tub, and a small exercise room with one treadmill, one elliptical, one recumbent bike, and two dumbbells (different weights) -- the exercise room was always empty. There's also a gift shop. The people in the office were very polite, and the rooms were remodeled and clean with comfortable beds. I was entertained by the very diplomatic sign

If you are shopping for a hotel around Disneyland , stop looking because THIS IS THE PLACE TO STAY !  We were initially excited with how close the hotel was when booking , however it was all the great extra's that made this hotel a fabulous experience . We flew in from Orange County , and it only took us 30 min to arrive at the Park Vue Inn . It was very easy to find , and access.  We were early , however they let us into our room prior to check inn time . Parking is not designated , so you will need to find your own spot . Unload outside your door , then find a spot if their is not one close . BONUS parking is included in your stay ! (Most hotels in this area charge for parking ) Our room included a bunk bed and two queens . The room was clean and updated. I found this to be a

Summary Heading: Great location for a Disney vacation
Summary: We enjoyed our stay, we stayed for 5 nights, we were in room 110 which was ideal, because it was very close to the lobby and entrance to Disney which means less walking!  The room had a queen and bunk beds which was perfect for our family (myself, my husband, daughter 13, and son 10.) The room is pretty small but clean and adequate. There is a full size mirror in the room, which is nice, but the only place to get ready is in the bathroom with the toilet and shower, not very good lighting and the light and fan are attached. The fan is very noisy and doesnt work very well, so if someone just took a shower the mirror is fogged up. There is a nice gift shop that has just about anything you might need, including a nice selection of very reasonably priced Disney souvenirs, pharmacy

Summary Heading: Great Stay at the Park Vue Inn
Summary: We had a great stay at the Park Vue Inn.  We chose the hotel due to it's proximity to the entrance of Disneyland, you just walk out the front and across the pedestrian crossing.   Our room was down the back of the hotel on the ground floor as one of our party cannot walk too many stairs.  The noise levels were good, not an issue except occasional noise from what sounded like kids in the room above jumping up and down or on and off the beds.  We had a hire car so there was plenty of parking available.  Not always parking available outside your room; perhaps they could instigate reserved parking by room number.  We often had to park up the front of the hotel, quite far away from our room.  Again, not a major issue more a suggestion!  A real bonus of this hotel is the breakfast

We love the location and the room isnt bad either.  The only complaint I had was that they dont keep the carpets clean, socks got dirty fast, other then that the bed is super comfy, and sheets are nice.  The rooms were serviced daily, and they have some pretty good tv channels for late night watching after walking all day at the parks.  I would recommend this place for anyone who wants the free parking, and comfy beds, and close to park any day.

Summary Heading: Ridiculously good location at a reasonable price
Summary: This location is very literally across the street from the main entrance to Disneyland. I don't quite understand the economics of why there's such an affordably priced motel at such a fantastic location, but it certainly worked to our advantage. The motel's neighbors are a Cold Stone Creamery (hotel guests get a discount) and an IHOP open 24 hours a day, so you can't go hungry either.  The motel itself is pleasant, with solid amenities and good service. Breakfast was above average for motels in its class, though not outstanding (rubbery eggs and so on, but a good selection of choices; I highly recommend the waffles). The room was spacious and well equipped. No real complaints. There was some noise from children in the room above us, but nothing too bad. I'll definitely stay here

Walking distance to convention center and Disney Parks. Friendly and helpful staff. Clean. Safe. This was our second visit and wont be our last. Parking is great and included in room rate. You can leave your car parked there until midnight of dag of check out, which is perfect because not only is Disney right across the street, you save a grip of money on parking. Complimentary breakfast is great! Big variety and again, very clean.

I currently have a Disneyland Annual Pass and have visited 3x this past year. Each visit, most recently January race weekend I stayed at Park Vue Inn.  I have to admit the stays have progressively diminished my favorable view of the Vue.   Pros: proximity to the parks.  Literally right across the street from the the entrances.  Responsibly priced, friendly-ish staff, decent rooms.   Cons: the little things... Breakfast times are not ideal and the quality has diminished.  Some staff have been less than cordial. Shower did not work well and when addressed they offered to fix, but not the much more in apologies.   As I make the list this seems petty. All I know is hat when I visited in May 2015 I loved the place for what it is. After two more visits the Park Vue Inn was missing the
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us three times this year and thank you for writing another review. I appreciate your candor and honesty. However, it was disappointing  to read that your enthusiasm for our staff and our services has waned over the last two visits. I realize that you had high expectations based on your first visit and we failed to meet those expectations this time. I share every review with my staff, as we consider all feedback to help us improve our operations. Your comments have been addressed and we hope on your next visit you'll have a better experience.

Summary: We have stayed here about 6 times in the past and have always had a positive experience.  Our flight leaving on our last day was at 7am.  So we got up at 4am to take showers.  An enormous flying cockroach flew on my daughters shoulder as she was blow drying her hair.  So much screaming and at 4am (so sorry for all our neighbors).  She jumped in my lap and told me about this big, huge bug that landed on her.  It flew onto my bed and I determined it was a flying cockroach (by looking on the internet).  We both felt sick that that maybe was sleeping with us in our room, all 6 nights we were there.  The thought is just gross.  Maybe the housekeepers should close the doors when they clean.  I told a housekeeper as we checked out at 5am but I'm sure it didn't get reported to proper
Manager Response: I would like to extend a sincere apology for the experience you had during your departure. I can understand how this was upsetting to you and your daughter. I was concerned about your review, so I contacted our pest control service company, Ecolab. We have Ecolab service our property every month as part of our preventative maintenance. Our entire property is inspected monthly and our service technician stated that if there were a flying bug in the room most certainly was not what you said it was. Whatever it may have been, there was a bug in your room, and that was clearly unnerving and unacceptable. My entire housekeeping and maintenance staff work diligently every day to ensure the cleanliness of our guest rooms and all public spaces of the hotel.  Your review also mentioned that you spoke to a housekeeper while you were checking out at 5am. However, my housekeeping staff does not arrive until 9am, so I'm not sure who you spoke to about this incident. I truly wish you would have mentioned this to my front desk staff. I can assure you that a manager would have defiantly contacted you. I would like you to know that I appreciate your past patronage, and should you have a change of heart when considering a return trip to the Anaheim resort area, my staff and I will be here ready to be of service.

Summary Heading: Location, location, location! And good value, too
Summary: We stayed in Room  212 for one night for the Star Wars 1/2 Marathon. This room was great for the race because it had a small mini-kitchen with a refrigerator. It is literally across the street from the Park which made getting to the race at 4:30 am a little less painful. And the free parking is an added bonus. We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel for last year's race and paid double. This was less expensive, just as convenient and the room was nicer (and larger!). I appreciated the fact that they actually leave enough towels in the room for 4 people. We even got to see the fireworks show from our room! Highly recommend if you are visiting Disneyland or California Adventure.

Summary Heading: Good value and would stay again
Summary: There are lots of hotels close to Disney but here is why I picked Park Vue: -location - I wanted a place in walking distance and this one is right across the street -free parking - I saw anywhere from $5-$18/night for parking at most hotels in walking distance, plus we could park their prior to check-in time and they have enough parking (unlike some other hotels in area) -free breakfast - most hotels in area do not provide this, even if they are a chain that normally does (like Fairfield). This can be a huge added cost as well as its way more convenient at hotel and to not wait for food with young kids -bed options - many hotels in area have 2 double beds, or at least you have to upgrade for queens. They had a queen with bunk beds, which my boys prefer and it works better to

Park Vue Inn is just across the street from Disneyland, and after a full day in the parks I didn't want to walk a step further than right here. The room was clean and comfortable, and the staff are friendly. Breakfast was enough to get you going, and the make-your-own waffles were great. It's very close to restaurants, with an IHOP in the parking lot, a Denny's two doors up and a Tony Roma's next to that, with many more more options only slightly further on, including in Downtown Disney. There is also a gift shop on site that stocks many basic necessities. I would happily stay here again and highly recommend it to anyone visiting Disneyland.

Our room was on the upper floor and newly/nicely renovated/updated.  I would definitely recommend it for location and the buffet breakfast is a great addition (even being vegetarian it was a fair breakfast)  Any price difference between this and a further hotel is worth it.   I have a bad knee and there is no elevator, so I would recommend requesting a lower level in advance if stairs are an issue (we requested lower room upon check in but they were booked and couldn't switch)

Summary Heading: Love this hotel - especially with kids
Summary: We stay at this hotel almost every time we go to Disneyland! We discovered this gem almost 6 years ago now when we first went for our Honeymoon. It's literally across the street from Disneyland. You walk across the street at the light and you're on Disney property - about a 5 minute walk to the gates from there. This is great when you have young kids because you can easily go back to the hotel for naps. It also includes a really good continental breakfast. They've recently updated the rooms so they are now a little pricier than they had been - but we've recently stayed at a different, cheaper hotel, and Park Vue is definitely worth the extra money for the location, breakfast, and room. Usually when you tell them you are celebrating something, they'll put a small gift in your

Summary Heading: Great value and can't beat the location and free parking
Summary: This is nice property, nothing too fancy, but probably best value for the dollar on Harbor Blvd. and so close to Disneyland Resort. The property is literally across the street from the theme parks. The convenience as well as the free parking are selling points alone. And the property itself was very good, great condition, very clean, and the staff were professional and accommodating. Next door to a Denny's restaurant . We stayed in a double queen on the second floor. Experienced a quiet night, no fuss.

Being directly opposite the entrance for Disneyland and California world you can't get more convenient.   Rooms were reasonable. Nothing too fancy. We had a queen bed and two bunk beds in ours but other parties had two queen beds and their rooms were bigger. We were all on the bottom floor and there is noise from the upper floor and you notice the stampede to breakfast in the morning.   Breakfast was ok. Again nothing fancy and was difficult to get a table if it was raining.

This is one of the closest places to stay for Disneyland and California Adventure parks without actually staying with in the resort. Only 3-5 mins from gates.  We found it clean and comfortable for our needs - you don't go to Disneyland to sit in an hotel room. Beds are large and comfy. Outside the room is essentially a car park in the middle of which is the swimming pool. The pool is a good size and dero enough for older kids to have fun - the pool is well fenced and planted so that when you are in the pool it you don't feel like you are in the middle of a car park. We felt safe the whole time. Would stay here again next time.  Breakfast buffet is upstairs and of reasonable standard. Other resultants are very close in all directions. 7 eleven down the street.

This motor inn is an ideal position for visiting Disneyland and Disney California. We were a party of 8 adults and 4 children without transport so needed to be near the entrance of Disneyland and the Park Vue was perfect. We could come and go with ease. Our party had three double queen rooms and a queen with bunks. The double queen had ample room for 2 adults and 2 children although the queen with bunks would have been a little tight for 2 adults and 2 children had there been children in this room. The breakfast room was small and as it was raining the outside tables could not be utilised so many people had to take their breakfast back to their room. This would not have been an issue if fine weather had prevailed as there was a large outside eating area.  Peter at the front

Summary Heading: Location is Excellent everything else average
Summary: If I could rate this motel 3 and 1/2 that is what I would give it.  Pro: Location, Location, Location, Good Customer Service, Have two room suites Con: Housekeeping, Free Breakfast, Crib charge.  My family stayed here for two nights.  We booked a two room suite.  I booked the two room suite as we had our 20 month old and wanted her to have her own room.  There were not photographs available of the room so I didn't know what to expect.  The two room suite was fine allow in order to access the bathroom you have to go through the front room.  This did not end up being an issue but something to notice.  The beds were a little old and the mattresses were a little bouncy.    The staff at the motel was very friendly. I had emailed them prior to our stay and they were very helpful.  The

Summary Heading: Best location, checks all the boxes
Summary: This hotel scored best on a matrix I created for 27 Disney area hotels (yes, I am that kind of nerd). Here's why: free parking, free hot & substantial breakfast, TripAdvisor Top 10, Queen beds (not doubles), proximity to the park - you are already back in your room when others are still waiting for shuttle to take them to the parking lot. Park Vue is a bit pricier than some of the others but still scored the best and is the best value for your money. We requested a 2nd floor, quieter room, adjoining with my parents and got it. Never heard a thing except the fireworks. Slept great, beds were comfortable. Rooms were very clean. Excellent customer service, staff was so nice and called to check in on us. No problems finding a parking spot. Also, front desk staff are native English

RighT across the road form the entrance to Disneyland, you couldn't find a closer motel to the park. This means leaving the car parked while visiting and there are plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance.  The room was quite large and the beds were most comfortable. They try to keep noise to a minimum and it works quite well, but a ground floor room does suffer from some stomping on the wooden floors from the rooms above. Disney fireworks at 9:30 are quite loud but after a day in the park children sleep through them.  A good breakfast is provided with a slightly varying hot meal each day but with waffles, fresh fruit and cereal available there is plenty for everyone.  Family rooms with bunks seem to work quite well, but the rooms with a double queen bed are larger.

We had 3 kids with us all teenagers. The motel was very accommodating. The hotel is located directly across from Disneyland's main gate. Bus service to Universal is within a 2 minute walk of the motel as well. IHOP is right next door. Complimentary breakfasts were tasty as well. Lots of breakfast choices. The staff was eager to answer all our questions from transportation to where was good to eat. we had a great time!

Great hotel if your going to Disney or California adventure. Like the other reviews, The gates to Disney are literally a 5 minute walk from the hotel lobby. The staff was friendly, pool was nice break from Disney and the rooms were clean and comfy. Great free bfast available every morning. They had cookies, coffee and tea in the lobby. They will store your bags for you if you get there before check in time or if you were going to disney after you check out of your room. They will also allow your to stay parked their for the day you check out. All in all would stay here every time we come to Disney. All the reviews are spot on about this place. This hotel made our trip to Disney awesome!

Stayed Nov 4-8, 2015.  Had the King Jacuzzi suite as we were on our anniversary trip without our kids.  The rooms have been upgraded since our last trip two years ago.   Have no complaints about anything the Park Vue offers.  The staff are friendly, the housekeeping is wonderful.  Those ladies work hard!  Great location and clean spacious room.  We would definitely book a third stay.  Thank you, Park Vue for another great stay and wonderful trip.

We stayed here for seven nights and while researching found very few hotels offer free parking and/or free breakfast. When we found Park Vue offered both and is walking distance to Disneyland we booked.  Our room was clean and tidy upon arrival and housekeeping did well cleaning around our bags and things. The breakfast rotated a bit each day and gave us a good start to each day.  Thank you Park Vue for your friendliness, cleanliness and for feeding us. I have recommended you to my friends who are planning a trip next year.

I took my 86 year old grandmother to Disneyland , I needed a hotel close to the park and comfortable . This hotel was perfect !!!  We had a room with two queen beds . The beds were comfortable . The room was spacious . Ihop is right next door. there's also a Denny's and McDonald's within walking distance .  I was actually very surprised at how comfortable of a stay this ended up being. I was a little nervous after reading some reviews on here about the noise level and the walls being thin . The noise level wasn't an issue for anyone in our party . Overall we would definitely stay here again .

Previous reviews about Location are all correct. You can not be any closer to D-land than if you istayed in one of the ridiculously overpriced Disney hotels.  Park Vue was all that I expected.  It was clean, beds comfortable, breakfast gigantic and great variety.  We had a bunk bed room. They are on the small side.  Only complaints would be the incredibly loud bathroom light/fan combo and lack of drawer space. But nothing that would stop us from returning. Kids loved the pool we used every day.  Fun souvenir shop right on property and 10% discount at Cold Stone Creamery.  We have previously stayed at others nearby and Park Vue was very quiet in comparison. The staff checked in on us after  a day to see how we were doing. Free parking also a huge bonus/savings!  Staff was very

For the price it deserves 5 stars. Right across from the entrance. Typical free hot breakfast. Upstairs patio with perfect view of the fireworks. We had front row seats and no one else there. Basic room. Nice toiletries. Big TV. We arrived at 10 am so did not expect our room to be ready and we wanted upstairs. Looked like they were pretty full. They gave us parking permit good until midnight next day and we spent the day at downtown Disney. Room was ready at 2 pm when we returned. Staff was helpful and friendly. It's not the Hilton but room is clean and comfortable.

Wow!  So close to Disneyland and California Adventure, was a 5min walk to and from the park gates which was so handy to come back and forth as needed for breaks during the long hot days at the parks.  Our family of 4 had a suite which was brilliant!  We had our own room, air con unit and TV.  Beds were really comfy.  Kids had a bed each, tv, air con unit.  Little bathroom/kitchenette cove area and separate toilet and bathroom was perfect!!  Little things like charging docks were a welcome addition.  Rooms weren't ready on early arrival.  We left our bags in lobby, had lunch at Denny's next door, walked to Target to stock up on water and snacks and on our return our bags were in our rooms waiting (large family group 3 different rooms)  Nice surprise to find a little birthday gift

We stayed in September room 142 (I believe)   bottom left hand corner of the hotel.  A bunk bed double queen room.   From our room door, cross the street with a red light, through security to get into line was 5 minus 45 seconds.    We timed it every day we went to the park.    The pool was amazing!!!    The breakfast did the job, saved us lots of money.  You could see the fire works from the pool, the second floor, the breakfast area.   Second floor Im sure would have been annoying every morning having people walk by for breakfast.   Im glad we got a room in a corner no one ever was by our door.    We walked to McDonalds one lunch as it was only a 5 minute walk as well.    Tony Romas was also about a 5 minute walk.   Ihop is in the parking lot.   Kids eat free after 4pm so we

Summary Heading: Had a very nice trip, nice place to stay
Summary: Location is great and people are top notch.  We have stayed here a number of times and have always had a great trip.  It's so close to Disneyland that you are closer to the park than if you stayed at the Disneyland Hotel.

There is no question that this place has a good location. It is super close. That being said, it seems they feel they do not have to do much in the way of customer service because they have location on their side.   We arrived after check in time, but our room wasn't ready. They were not polite about it. We were made to sit and wait an additional 20-30 minutes while they finished, then they would give us our key. We asked to see a manager and were told he wasn't there but was "aware of the situation". We never heard from anyone.   We had a bunk room with a queen bed. It is very small and if you have more than one piece of luggage, there really is nowhere to put it. The bathroom has very little storage to put things. We were on the bottom floor and the noise from above guests is

Great location across the street from the main gate of Disneyland . Great to come back, rest and return. Near many restaurants . Good breakfast ( but same everyday). Good clean pool. Mostly enjoyable. Clean but Room & beds are small for a family. 😒😒

Summary Heading: Amazing Place to Stay While Visiting Disneyland
Summary: Right across the street from the park - we watched the fireworks from our hotel room! Great breakfast and great location - nothing fancy and the pool is in the parking lot but for a quick family holiday it was great. We have two girls 11-13 and had such a good time in Disneyland and staying at the Park Vue made it all possible - thanks!

Summary Heading: Very friendly staff, quaint and clean rooms
Summary: I was truly blown away by how close to the parks this hotel is. I was not expecting much, the rooms are small. But they had absolutely everything we could need. Comfortable bed and pillows for my bad back, gave us a great night sleep. Thin walls and "herds" of kids running down the walkway to get to free breakfast woke us up bright and early every morning. Breakfast was good. Sausage gravy with biscuits were good. Make your own waffle station was nice and several cereals to choose from.  Bottom line... We would most definitely stay here again. But it is what it is. It is a hotel conveniently located within (1/5 mile) to Disneyland entrance for a screaming low price. It is clean with small room with free parking, free wifi and free breakfast. The staff is absolutely wonderful.

We come to Disneyland once a year and loved this years trip staying at the Park Vue Inn!  Location is perfect across the street from the main gates, rooms are newly renovated, pool is great for a quick afternoon dip to rest and cool off, the breakfast is good and saved us money, and the staff was attentive and responsive is we needed anything.  We will definitely be back!  I would suggest requesting a ground floor room if you have a little one as it is tough getting a stroller upstairs at the end of a long day at the park.

I love this little hotel because it's so easy to get to Disneyland and not have to worry about parking.  Our family is annual pass holders so we usually stay here.   They just did major upgrades last year.  The rooms are nice.  The free breakfast is good also.  This is a great place for families with small kids that need a break in the middle of day.  We usually head out early come back at lunch rest and head back out.

Summary Heading: Value: Very good included breakfast and free parking before and after your night's stay.
Summary: Clean and quick and just across one crosswalk access to both Disneyland and California Adventure. The breakfast has scrambled eggs, cereals, yogurt, juices. Because of free parking BEFORE AND AFTER our one night stay and the good full breakfast, it was an excellent value in the end, and the beginning!

Summary Heading: As close as you can get to Disneyland without staying at a Disney Hotel.
Summary: Positive:  Location, extremely close to the park.  Simply walk across the street to access the front gates.  Good quality room.  Clean and quiet.  Good amenities.    Staff are extremely friendly and helpful.  Negatives:  The bed (a king) was horrible.  There was a dip in my side of the mattress so that it felt like I was going to fall out of the bed all night long.  Breakfast is of very poor quality.  We usually go and pay for breakfast.

This was our 4th visit to the Park Vue Inn and once again it cannot be faulted. The location is perfect, adequate buffet breakfast and clean and comfortable rooms. We stayed for 9 nights and the hotel is a great base for not only visiting Disneyland but also for the beaches and LA. The staff go out of the way to help and are all friendly. We stayed in a double queen room midway on the lobby side of the hotel and this offered a great view of the fireworks on a night. I would not stay anywhere else in Anaheim and can thoroughly recommend the Park Vue.

The staff is friendly, breakfast is amazing, and it is literally across the street from Disneyland! The walk to the park is even closer than Paradise Pier. We had the continental breakfast every morning and it was always fresh and well stocked.  There are even waffle makers so you can make your own fresh waffles!

We stayed here for our trip to DL in October. It was a fantastic experience! It was extremely clean and well kept. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was great. They had a good variety of food and it was easily accessible. We were able to eat and go straight to the park in 30 minutes time. We have three boys. The old two are teens and we loved they could walk back to the hotel by themselves without us having to worry. We could watch the fireworks every night from the door of our room, it was awesome! I highly suggest this hotel for your Disneyland Vacation!

Just returned from Disneyland and stayed at Park Vue with upgraded rooms.  I believe they have all been upgraded. Nicely decorated and very comfortable.  A bit of a plumbing problem but that was fixed while I was in Disneyland. The continental breakfast is not so continental as there are eggs, potatoes, sausage, fruit, toast, make your own waffle, and tables inside and outside to eat. Get there at 7 when they open to avoid the rush. Also coffee, juices, water.

We've stayed here many times & the access to Disney's front gate is invaluable. Just a quick walk, free parking, Wi-Fi & breakfast. The sweetest peeps at front desk, Erick & Ariel, rooms clean & ready, we love it here.

When we booked our hotel, we were told we would have to change rooms mid-stay, but they would move our luggage and there would be no inconvenience.  What they did not tell me is that they would not expedite availability of the new room, leaving my 2 year old without anywhere to nap that day!  When I requested that they allow us to access the new room before check in time, they told me to call around 1:30, which I did, and I was told that there would be access before standard check in times.  Although I was VERY upset that my 2 year old cried for hours at Disney because she couldn't nap, I was MORE upset that, upon accessing the second room after a long day/evening at Disney and putting my daughter to bed, I found BUGS.  Like 20 of them.  All over the bathroom wall.  They seemed
Manager Response: I would like to extend my sincere apology for the experience you had on the second night of your stay. I realize how important it is to get toddlers down for a nap and how frustrating it was for you to not have a room for a much needed afternoon break. Notes in our reservation system indicate that my staff did inform you when you made your reservation and during check in that you would need to move rooms. What made your room move more challenging was your specific request for a ground floor room. Due to our being sold out the night before and limited check outs on the first floor, there were very few options available. My front desk supervisor explained this to you when you called and our housekeeping staff did everything they could to expedite your room. I assure you this was made a priority, although to you it didn’t feel that it was. Your room was made ready shortly before 3pm, but certainly not as early as you requested. Please know that my staff did everything they could to get your room ready before 3pm. The following morning when your husband came into the lobby to check out, he very casually mentioned you found a bug in the vanity area and said “not a big deal” He just thought we should know. He was very friendly to the front desk agent and did not show any sign of being upset. We take every report seriously, so we had Ecolab inspect the room that afternoon and no pests were reported. The AC unit was also inspected and aside from a little wear on the weather sealing, no pests were found inside. The weather seal was replaced and the exterior of the building was treated as a preventative measure. I’m truly sorry to hear that we lost you as a customer, however if you have a change of heart we will be here ready to be of service.

Summary: This is my 3rd time at Park Vue Inn. Location wise (unless you are willing to spend 3 or 4 times as much money), it cannot be beat. The most amazing thing about Park Vue for me however is how well I sleep here, the beds are that comfortable. Also, this year my friend and I arrived hours before check-in, Park Vue has free bag storage (on arrival and departure), and when we returned from Disneyland our bags were in our room, and we only needed to pick-up the keys. The staff is very helpful and kind.

Why would you stay anywhere else...Right at the entrance to Disneyland...5 min walk to the turnstile..we had 6 people in a 2queen with bunk beds room (4 adults and 2 young teenagers)..it was tight but we were there just for sleeping...really clean rooms housekeeping are doing a great job..friendly helpful front desk staff..the breakfast served hot and cold items and a real great start for you day at Disneyland..

We stayed four nights at the Park Vue.  Upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised with the location - directly across the road from Disneyland entrance and we could see the fireworks from our room!! The buffet breakfast which we ate on the outdoor terrace was a great start to our long day.  The room was clean and comfortable and our children loved the bunk beds.  The pool was a good size (never crowded) and warm.  Facilities such as a laundry, on-site convenience store/gift shop and  ice cream shop (open til late) and 24 hour family friendly restaurant next store made our stay perfect!  The staff were friendly and helpful. Cookies and refreshments available   I would recommend this hotel, especially to families.

We have stayed at several places around Disneyland, even Disney hotels but the location of this hotel puts it at the top of my list. The free breakfast was great and had more than I thought (and they kept it filled). Plenty of seating was welcome to our party of 6. The rooms were basic but comfortable. Honestly, sleep is all you want after 15 hours at the parks! They have a small convenient store on site and a Cold Stone for ice cream. The staff was very polite and the grounds were very clean. You can see the fireworks from your balcony!

My wife found this property available on discount travel site.  It was listed at $89 per night for that night, $169 the next night.  Room was impeccable, remodeled recently, clean, very well appointed.  Swimming pool and patio was in excellent condition, workout room, and Buffet Breakfast also.  Breakfast was quite good, and being upstairs  and outside, it was perfect.

10 days spent here, and we were comfortable. The beds are firm yet gentle, which I loved. The breakfast was good- I looove rice chex!! We were at the back, and had no noise at all. Our room got the evening sun, so if you visit during warm times, ask for a room at the side, not right at the back. (I'd asked for that room, so it was not the fault of the hotel staff.) So easy to walk to the parks. We would stay here again, for sure.

What a fantastic location for this hotel, entrance to both parks straight across the road. From the time we checked in to the time we checked out great service. What I particularly liked was the phone call not long after getting to our room to see if everything was OK. And it was... We requested early check in as our arrival time was AM, they stored our bags for us while we waited till about 1pm for the room to be ready. Room has everything you need from fridge to microwave, tea, coffee & plenty of towels. Rooms were very clean, comfortable beds and pillows were ok too. Breakfast was basic but everything you needed. Breakfast room was small however a lot of people were grabbing trays and taking food back to their room & you can sit in or outside. Noise levels were OK, sometimes

Summary Heading: Perfect in every way for the budget
Summary: This property delivered right from reservation.  The price is outstanding for it's location.  Nicely renovated rooms. Spacious & great to have 2 bathroom areas.  Varied breakfasts were available over the time we stayed with the ability to take & eat in yr room if the area was busy. Lots of nice little extras & always plenty of staff on.

Summary Heading: Location,front door to the happiest a place on earth!!!!
Summary: We have been staying here for the last 5-6 years. Rooms are clean, breakfast is great!!  We love the location , right across the street from the entrance. We love it here so much. We have an annual pass so we are frequent flyers, or should I say frequent stayers!!!! Love you Park Vue!!!! The Espinosa's from Clovis, Ca

We stay here every time we go to Disneyland. It is directly across from the park entrance, walk out your door and cross the street and you're there, you can't beat this location. The staff have always been friendly and helpful, from the front desk to the housekeeping staff. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. I always feel at home when we go there. They are constantly making improvements to the property and it just keeps getting better and better. Love this place!

We had a wonderful stay at the Park Vue.  The beds were comfortable,nice towels, and a clean room.  The free breakfast was really good.  The location is perfect.  Only the Grand Californian is closer.  All the staff were super nice.

Loved the accommodations.  People were great and room was comfy.  i would recommend and return for sure.  Stayed here long, long time ago and loved it then a lot has changed and all for the better.  A bit on the expensive side but worth the price for the location if you are going to the parks.

The moment I parked the car and saw the proximity to the resort I knew I had made the right decision in staying here. I completed the pre check-in process as I arrived at 0930 in the morning, which was super easy and it meant that at 1500 I could collect the keys and carry on my Disney adventure. The reception staff were friendly and welcoming, and more than happy to sell me my 1-day park hopper ticket (a greater alternative to purchasing the ticket at the resort). The room was everything I needed. The A/C was powerful and the amenities in the room were what I expected (the wifi was amazing also). The free parking is brilliant as I was on the ground floor and managed to obtain a park right out the front of my room. The bed was so comfortable, which was fabulous given I had flown

We always stay here when we come to Disneyland great value friendly staff . They have updated rooms in our section clean quite great breakfast. This year you can rent electric chairs witch is a plus . When Grandma would come you couldn't take the Disney's off the lot . Now Grandma can ride back to the hotel.

Summary Heading: Great renovations big improvements and location , location, location
Summary: Our experience at the Park Vue Inn was excellent. When we arrived we had to wait as we were too early to check-in and room and it wasn't ready but it was worth the wait.  Since our last stay they have updated the rooms. The front desk staff very helpful they accepted packages on our behalf . we love the lemon drink and cookies on arrival. (so much my daughter wants to know what the lemon mix is they make up everyday).  There is lots of information available in the foyer of the front desk. Our room was clean and comfortable. They have made some great improvement. The floor in the main areas were now floating floor board which is a much smarter choice to carpet.  The bedroom had 2 queen beds and there was a sofa in the lounge area. the bedroom is carpet. there is plenty of storage

Summary Heading: Very Good with all the extras and the best location for Disney
Summary: We (BF and I - no kids) arrived a bit early on Labor day and our room was ready to go. First night a double queen and then we moved to a King Jacuzzi room for the other two nights.  Both rooms were very clean and had comfortable bedding. It was really a plus to take a bubble jet bath after Disney all day. Both rooms on 2nd floor toward the back of the hotel.  Nice and quiet. Slept like babies. The maid service and front desk service was absolutely fantastic. That's a big deal to us as my BF owns 2 restaurants and is very particular about the customer service his staff provides.  The breakfast was hot and good - especially for free. We didn't need a car as DLR is literally across the street - 5 minute walk to front gate. There were also decent restaurants within walking distance

Great Location. Walk across the street to the entrance to Disneyland. Other family members stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel on Disney property and we were actually closer to our room than they were, not to mention the price difference. The room size was sufficient for 3 adults (2 Queen beds)  clean and comfortable. Rented an intermediate SUV from Costcotravel.com ($49) for our 3 night stay so with the free parking amenity it was the least expensive way to get to and from the hotel and a run to Target for water and snacks.  The refrigerator provided in the room is a bigger compact size and kept drinks VERY cold. We did not use the microwave. The included breakfast was good. Park fireworks can be watched from the hotel. Hotel service and staff are the best, they aim to

With the exception of the Grand Californian this is the closet hotel/motel to Disneyland.  We booked the triple queen room online months ahead of time, which is necessary as this room configuration appears to be very limited.  The good:  Room was very spacious and recently remodeled with comfortable bedding.  We were in an end unit on the 2nd floor so noise from other guests was non-existent.  Most of the staff were very helpful and friendly.  Our kids loved the chocolate chip cookies.  The location is outstanding and the walk to the parks is about one minute longer than a walk from the shuttle buses. The adequate:  Breakfast got the job done for the day but I would be looking elsewhere if I was staying for a few days. It was your typical "free breakfast"  We stayed right after

Great location and the Inn was very clean and the breakfast was really good, hot breakfast included every morning. We would definitely stay here again! It's right in front of the crosswalk to the entrance of Disneyland, walk a short distance and you arrive at the ticket booths and then you make up your mind which park you want to go to, Disneyland or California adventure park, you can get Hopper tickets so you can take in both but we did one park on each of our 2 days there. Still wasn't enough time to see it all! But lots of fun.

Summary Heading: We Always stay here when visiting Disneyland
Summary: My family and I recently got annual passes to Disneyland, every time we have chosen to stay at Parkvue Inn, it's location is right across from the entrance to the park, they have a cold stone creamery attached to the lobby( they are open late) my husbands favorite part of the hotel!  We love that included in the price is parking and breakfast, the breakfast is great, they change it up. Sometimes u get bacon sometimes if sausages. There are always eggs, cereal varieties, Toast, bagels, coffee, juices, milk and yogurts plus plenty more. One morning they had biscuits and sausage gravy, little salt and it was great. I don't mind paying little more to stay here because So much is included. It makes it so much easier when checking out you don't have to calculate in your head how much

The motel is directly across the street so no waiting on a shuttle.  We had a room with 2 very comfortable double beds and a bunk bed.  It was a bit cramped but you don't spend a lot of time in the room so it doesn't matter.   The sink is on the outside of the bathroom so someone can take a shower while another person can get ready.   The pool is heated and you can watch the fireworks show from the pool.  The morning breakfast is decent but better than other free breakfasts that I've had.  If you want to go to Universal make sure you book with the front desk, a luxurious bus picks you up right outside and brings you back, better than driving yourself, no stress!

Summary Heading: Great Price, Great Location, Rooms Small but Up To Date
Summary: We could not have picked a better hotel in our price range for our visit to Disneyland. Literally right across the street from the main entrance, this place was a lifesaver when my nine year old (and I!) pooped out and needed some pool time. An easy walk away, the Park Vue Inn also has a Coldstone Creamery and small mini-mart on site for last minute emergencies. There are many restaurants within walking distance. Our room was snug with a queen bed and a bunk bed tucked into the corner near the bathroom,  but the decor was up to date and the price was right. They serve the standard hotel breakfast, with waffle makers, cereal and yogurt, although unfortunately the biscuits and gravy were not available every day. The pool is small but nice. We had a great stay here and will come

We have stayed here the last 4 years on our Disney trips, we love it. You can't beat the location!! The upgrades are nice, staff nice and free parking for hotel guests. We are returning in January and looking forward to our stay.

We stayed in Jan 2015- Feb 2015. The room was clean, spacious and looked recently renovated. There was noise from excited children going to the breakfast area outside the room. A little too loud early in the day. The breakfast included was alright. They included scrambled eggs, sausage, waffles and etc. The food wasn't fresh but it's free, right? The hotel is across from the street from the Disney parks and close to a lot of restaurants. I liked that fact that when you are tired from the parks you can get to the hotel easily. The pool was always crowded!

We have stayed here many times over the past nine years and it is ALWAYS the same - great service, great breakfast, great beds, great room, great location, and great FREE parking!   Location is key when visiting DL and the Park Vue Inn is literally across the street, with free parking (nearly every other hotel charges for parking). The rooms are quite, clean, well stocked, include a mini refrigerator, and fantastic beds! Breakfast is extremely organized with a variety of foods and thank goodness NO donuts!   From check in to check out we are always 100% satisfied.

Summary Heading: Park the car!  Disney is at your door!
Summary: Being  from the East Coast, we are familiar with Disney World and the towns and large areas that surround it, and the high prices of Disney properties, or the rental car prices paid to stay off property......so we were pleasantly surprised to find how easy and economically priced it was to stay right at Disneyland's door!  This hotel is literally right across the street from the bus parking lot at Disney.  It is a well maintained property, which has a small convenience store, and a reasonably priced souvenir shop.  The welcoming hotel office served coffee and iced cold drinks for their guests, which was great on the 90 degree that we visited.  The room was large, and had a fridge and microwave, and a large bathroom.  The hotel is surrounded by other hotels, great restaurants,

can't recommend enough. It is so close to the parks, just across the street from main gate. Very convenient after a day at the parks getting quickly to Room. Was able to see fireworks from window. It offers free hot breakfast and wifi which are a great plus. If I go back to Disneyland, this is the place.

If you are going to Disneyland, I highly recommend this hotel..Not only is it the closest hotel to the entrance, it has great rooms at reasonable prices, free breakfast, free parking and free wifi.  What more could you ask for? The room we had came with 2 queen beds and bunk beds plenty of room and very clean.

You don't much closer to Disneyland (unless you stay in the higher priced official Disneyland Resort hotels inside the Theme Parks).  The Park Vue Inn is reasonably priced and has good rooms for families.  Be sure to book well ahead as this is a popular hotel for Disneyland fanatics.

We stayed a few days while visiting Disneyland.   The rooms are basic but clean and you can't beat the location.   They have a hot breakfast which is a real time-saver in the mornings.   They had cereal, breads, bagels, yogurt, fruit, make-your-own waffles, and also hot items.  One morning it was scrambled eggs, sausages and potatoes, the next morning it would be biscuits and gravy, eggs, and bacon.   The bacon didn't really taste like bacon (no smokey flavor) but everything else was good.  Be aware that the breakfast room is on the second floor and there are no elevators. The location is right across from the park.  After a long day it was really nice to have only a short walk home.   There is an IHOP right next door and a McDonalds a couple buildings over.   The staff at the

Summary Heading: Best Value And Location To Disneyland
Summary: This is a must stay hotel if you are planing a trip to Disneyland.
