The pros are 1.Location >across the street I Mean Directly 2.Very Clean 3.Spacious 4.Comp Hot GOOD breakfast 5.Service outstanding The Not Too Negative 1.Hard to get a room>always booked 2.At certain times rates can exceed 300 per night 3.No assigned parking In all no too many complaints cant say really anything bad just wish I can stay more often,I don't because it is always booked, That is a sign it is great!

Summary Heading: Nice Stay Short Walt to Disney
Summary: Visited for a short weekend trip at Disney.  We arrived at 10:30pm at night and had no problem checking in or finding a parking place.  The only trouble was trying to get in the  parking lot as the fireworks just finished and people don't realize I could run them over very easily if I had anger issues.  We had a room on the bottom floor in the back corner.  It was a 2 queen bedroom and the beds were comfortable.   We had no room issues other than people stomping in the room above us when they got up in the morning and coming back at night.  It is an issue I have had at other hotels in the area. More thank likely the age of the property and the lack of caring by other guests and their children contribute to this problem.  The room included a microwave and fridge which did keep

This hotel is wonderful!  It is not a five star experience, but when looking for a comfortable and affordable way to do Disney, this is the best option.  They are a stones throw from the main entrance.  Even closer than the Disney hotels.  Also, the free breakfast was excellent.  One less meal you have to pay for in the park!  At night if we came back to the room tired and hungry we went to many of the other restaurants nearby.  McDonalds, IHOP, and Tony Romas were just a few we visited.  I have stayed at this hotel twice now and recommend it to all my friends. We are going again for Halloween 2016!

I stayed at this Hotel because my usual Hotel was not available.  The Staff here were very pleasant and accommodating.  VALENTINE checked us in late at night.  We had a lot of problems with the Airlines (Allegiant) and did not arrive until almost 1:30am.  The Front Desk Clerk (Valentine) made sure that our room was ready, and had our keys and paperwork waiting for us when we walked through the door.  We were on the 2nd floor towards the rear of the property.  We were assigned to a DOUBLE QUEEN Room.  It was very comfortable and newly renovated.  We were very pleased with the Location of the Hotel, and the Kids loved being next to IHOP, and the Swimming Pool was a HIT!  Also, being right across the street from Disney was the best choice of all.  Park Vue Inn also has a FULL HOT

Summary Heading: Can't beat the location for the price
Summary: Our family of 4 and my brother's family of 4 both stayed here last week. The hotel was able to accomodate us with adjoining rooms, which was great. We each had double queen rooms. They were snug and the bathrooms were a bit..odd, but it worked. The (tiny) toilet and bath/shower are in a room with a door, and the sink and closet open up to the room, right next to the AC unit. I had to keep turning off the AC to wash my face because it was too cold with it on. Other than that, the rooms appear to have been recently renovated and were clean and neat. There are little signs in the room asking people to keep noise and conversation to a minimum between 10p and 8a. We were not bothered by anyone else's noise. The biggest benefit to this hotel is the location. It is literally at the

My husband found this place and what a find!  We stay here every time we need a quick getaway to Disneyland.  The rooms are nice, clean and up to date.  Hotel ammenities include complimentary soap, shower gel, shampoo/comditioner, plenty of towels, air conditioning and breakfast.  Plus, it's located right across the street from the main entrance... what else do you need?  We will be back soon.

Come every 2 years and stay at Park Vue. They have done remodels frequently. Room seems to be constantly updated. Very clean rooms. We stay in the Double queen suite with kitchenette.  Large room with the 2 queen beds in one room  and sofa bed in the living room area. Room has 3 sinks. Park Vue is remarkably close to the entrance of Disneyland. Has a moderately sized outdoor pool. Amazing how quite it gets when you enter the parking area of the hotel. A needed relief after leaving the park. Has a Cold Stone Creamery attached to the front of the building. Also an I-Hop next door. A Denny's is also very close. Decent free breakfast. Can watch the fireworks from the hotel balcony. Nice little store for incidentals. Fitness room needs a little help. Their only treadmill is on it's

You can't get much closer to the entrance of Disneyland than this hotel.  Great location.  There's also an Ihop in the parking lot and a Cold Stone (icecream) in the lobby.  There are many restaurants in walking distance including McDonalds. The room was average size, about what we expected nothing fancy but clean. They have a nice pool which is in the center of the parking lot but they landscaped it making it feel very nice.  You can watch the fireworks on the rooftop (same place they serve breakfast)  great view!!!  The breakfast was decent, they had fresh fruit, waffles, eggs, etc.  I only wished they started breakfast before 7, doesn't really work well if you are trying to get to the parks early.  In the afternoon they had punch, cookies and candy in the lobby which was a

Summary Heading: Love Disneyland, love staying at the Park Vue even more.
Summary: We have stayed at the Park Vue out last 4 visits to Disneyland and we cannot say enough good things.  The price considering the location cannot be beat.  We love walking by all the people waiting for their transportation when we have  5 minute walk and we are back in our nice cool room.  It is especially nice talking a break in the afternoon and taking a power nap and get recharged for Disneyland in the evening.  There is a McDonalds nearby that we went  to a couple of times for dinner to take  break from Disney prices.  The free breakfast is great and has more than enough variety.  I always mention the Park Vue to family and friends that plan on going to Disneyland because I know they will appreciate everything about it.

Summary Heading: The way to go for Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue Inn 7/6-7/13. The best part about this property is the location. It was a 5 minute walk from our hotel room door to the esplanade separating Disneyland Park and California Adventure. We enjoyed the quick walk to the action every morning, a swim break every afternoon, and an easy walk back to your bed at night with tired legs! We requested a second-floor room with a full tub and got it. I would recommend room 218 anytime because it's quite centrally located and an easy walk to the breakfast room, laundry room and it also overlooks the pool. The motel is very noisy beginning at 7:00AM with people heading to the parks and the free breakfast, which starts at 7. We were always awake and ready to start the day, but I wouldn't plan on sleeping in here. We

This was our first time at the Park Vue.   We've stay at the Best Western Park Place Inn, the Carousel and the HoJo previously.   We wanted to give Park Vue a try this time.   The location of course is perfect.  As soon as you cross the street you're at the gates of Disneyland.    This is so nice after a long day in the park when your feet are tired and you're dragging.    The check-in in was nice and easy.   We were in a room towards the back and it was pretty quiet.  The beds were fairly comfortable.   The room did lack places for clothes.  There were only two drawers in the dresser and the closet had only 3 hangars in it.  I called the front desk to send more hangars.   I had to call twice more for the hangars and when someone brought more it was only another 3 hangars.  We

We have stayed at the Park Vue every June for the last 10 years and it is always a pleasure.  The rooms are always clean and updated.  Front desk always warm, friendly and helpful.  The free breakfast is a lifesaver.  Excellent food and lots of it.  The pool is lovely and clean.  If you call for anything, it is handled in minutes.   Closest to the park entrance and Ihop.   Never had a bad moment.  Our family vacations are always perfect thanks to the Park Vue.  Thanks Guys!  See ya again in June!

This was our 2nd stay at Park Vue Inn, and the remodeled rooms were done quite nicely. I re-clean every hotel room we stay in before unpacking, so I quickly find out just how dirty many rooms tend to be.  This was one of the cleanest rooms I've seen.  We stayed in a Queen/Queen room, and the size was fine for our family of 3.  As everyone mentions, the location can't be beat.  I like to get to the parks early, and it was easily done from Park Vue.  The breakfast was very sufficient.  My only complaint would be that sometimes we had to wait 5 or so minutes past 7:00 for them to open the breakfast room.  When wanting to get to the parks by 7:30, every minute counts, but we could still manage it due to the location.  We stayed in room 238 at the back of the property and never heard

One thing to remember when booking a hotel near Disneyland is that you are paying for the location...not room size! And the location of Park Vue Inn can't be beat! You are directly across from Disneyland.  You leave your room, cross the highway, and you are at the entrance....not the turnstiles but the entrance.  I would say from the turnstiles to the hotel is about 5-7 minutes, depending on your walking speed and how long you have to wait at the light to cross the highway.  At the end of a long hot day it makes all the difference in the world!!  Room size is small. We had a queen room with bunk beds, and I wouldn't recommend it for a family of four.  I would instead opt for the queen/queen room because I think it would have to be bigger!  There is no closet, which I don't think

This is an excellent location, right across the street from Disneyland. Perfect if need to take a break from the crowd. Rooms were very clean. Had 4 families and were able to get all our rooms close together. Breakfast was just right. At night the fireworks were great from the patio area.Several restaurants were close. Would love to go back again.  Was surprised to see Ponderosa pine trees.

This inn is directly across the street from Disneyland --- incredibly convenient.  You can come back mid-day or get something you forgot or need fairly easily.  You also get free parking during your stay, which most places charge extra for.  The rooms seem remodeled (like granite countertops), which is nice.  The beds are very comfortable.  The air conditioner is old style though, and a bit loud (you definitely need it in the summer months).  Comes with a mini fridge, microwave(!), and safe.  For all that, it's a basic hotel room that wouldn't command the price that it does, except for location, location, location!  Comes with a continental breakfast, which is basically bread items with a make your own waffle flip machine, a 'meat' (like bacon or sausage), and eggs/hash browns

As with other reviews, this is the  best kept secret around. You can walk out your room and within 10-12 minutes be in one of the  two parks. Want to come back to the hotel for a rest, lunch, whatever - no big deal  as it is so close.  As mentioned, the rooms are pretty updated, we had two  queens, good TV and modest bathroom. AC worked well so overall no  issues. We were on the  ground  floor  which some people may  not like for a motor in  but  we didn't feel unsafe at all. They monitor the cars in their small parking lot via a voucher/tag system so it is pretty good. It is quite nice to have a small convenience store on the  lower  level for goodies to eat or last minute  gifts for  people.  The patio dining  was really  nice  in June  as it was still cool in the morning  and

This was our first time staying here. Last year, we stayed next door because it was slightly cheaper and had suites for our larger group. This year, we stayed here for its free parking, wifi, and breakfast. The breakfast was GOOD...fresh, with a large variety to choose from! I would have love thicker/stronger coffee. The eating area was very friendly as well...eating on the patio was a great start to the morning. The staff kept the food well-supplied and clean. It was great to have high chairs for the kids. The convenience store below was a PLUS as well, as we had to get milk for our toddler, then I needed some feminine products unexpectedly. It made all the difference to just go downstairs for what we needed. The room was very clean, although the bathroom area was fairly small.

Summary Heading: First room was great, 2nd not so great.
Summary: We first stayed in a 2 queen with pullout couch room. This was fantastic and had a small kitchen. Beds were really comfortable and we had lots of space even with a rollaway in the room. The location for disneyland is perfect and from this room we could see the fireworks. We left the hotel for a few days to travel to san diego and realised we had left something in the room. We immediately rang the hotel to tell them and they said they would put it aside for when we came back, I also informed them that my children had ordered converse shoes and asked if we could gave them delivered to park vue to pick up on our return. This was fine. On our return our forgotten item was no where to be found. The package had been opened and we were placed in room 148 which is right next to the

Summary Heading: Great motel in best location for DL
Summary: I have stayed here about 20 weeks over the past 12 years and have not been disappointed. Awesome staff, breakfast, location, location- walk across the street and Disneyland is there! Don't plan on sleeping in past one hour before Disney opening because the kids are excited. Will keep returning when we are in the area with kids.

Bottom line, Park Vue Inn is STEPS from the entrance to Disneyland! It is closer to the gates than the Disney resort hotels, very easy walk. I had read it was close but once arrived was truly blown away by the location. At night you can partially see the Disney fireworks from the upstairs walkway and breakfast area.   The service here is excellent, really beyond what I expected. The front office staff is helpful and welcoming. They have complimentary cookies and punch at check-in, super nice after a long day of travel. We dropped off our luggage since we arrived before check-in and when we returned later it had all already been taken up to our room for us! This was super helpful since there's not an elevator for getting to the second floor.    Housekeeping is great, one day we

This was the second time we stayed at the Park Vue and it is better than ever!!!! They have renovated since 2012 and now have bunk beds for the kids! Staff is great and the location cannot be beat! Directly across the street from Disneyland entrance!

The rooms were updated very nicely. Everything was clean. The hot breakfast was far more than I ever would've expected. But really the gem of this hotel is its location. My husband and I walked around the Disneyland Resort, and this hotel is CLOSER to the main gates than 2 of the 3 Disney hotels. We easily went back to the hotel in the heat of the afternoon for a rest. One thing to note is that due to the proximity of this hotel to Disneyland, if you are in your room during the 9:30 fireworks and trying to sleep, it will sound like there is a battle going on outside and you are under attack. That's just a product of the proximity and I would definitely take a little bit of fireworks noise to be that close to the park!

Summary Heading: Great hotel in the BEST location!
Summary: I booked this hotel on line for me and my Girl Scout Troop.  There were 7 of us and we stayed in the room with 2 queens and a bunk bed.  It was absolutely perfect for us!  The room was more than efficient with a microwave oven, small fridge, desk and chair, plenty of towels, etc.  The breakfast in the morning is great- eggs, turkey sausage, bagels, toast, self serve waffles, fruit, yogurt, cottage cheese, variety of juice, coffee, hot chocolate, variety of cereal.  There was something for everyone!  The location is truly the best.  It is directly across the street from Disneyland, so we were a short few minutes walk from the entrance.  It doesn't get any better than that!  The value was excellent and the hotel personnel were top notch.  Our check-in wasn't until 3pm, but they

You really can't beat the location, directly across the street from Disneyland Maingate. The rooms were adequate, a little on the small side but clean and comfortable. Hotel staff were all super friendly, including the maintenance staff who were nice enough to stop what they were doing to grab us new room keys when ours stopped working. With that said, perfect location, free hot breakfast, clean & comfortable rooms, nice staff .. We'll be staying here again for our next trip in August!

Summary Heading: Great!! Highly recommend ~ location, comfort, clean
Summary: Highly recommend this hotel.  Stayed for 3 days this past weekend, was very clean and comfortable.  Beds were just right and pillows great.  A plus is parking right in front of your room ~ also on your checkout day you can stay parked in the parking lot until midnight.  Easy walk to disney.  Great breakfast as well that changed each day, hot foods one of the best around there, that saved some $$$.  Also they offer connecting rooms. I noticed some reviews of the bottom floor said it was too loud, yeah probaby is if you don't sleep with anything on , try bringing a fan or use a sound machine.  Only bad part was hearing people above you walk around in the middle of the night. Price is good compared to others, military discount as well if you call!  I originally booked the desert

Summary Heading: Adequate, not the cleanest or most comfortable
Summary: Stayed here one night with my young son for a last minute disneyland trip. This was my first time staying directly across the street from the park, we have stayed at the Candy Cane Inn before but we had to take the shuttle to and from the park, whereas this time we were able to just walk across the street to the entrance.   I can't speak to the breakfast as we ate in the park. My impression of the room was not entirely favorable- the carpet was very dark and sticky in a few places, and I didn't feel comfortable taking my shoes off when we were inside. We had the king bed room with a jacuzzi and the tub jets were pretty gross to look at, needless to say we didn't use the jacuzzi during our stay. The air conditioning unit didn't work properly (seemed to shut off after 20 min each
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for your feedback and I wish to extend an apology for what sounds like a less than perfect visit. I do appreciate when guests help me to better my service by sharing their experience. However, I really need to clear up something you said in your review. Your comment about pests raises unfounded concern for future guests. Since you didn’t have that experience during your stay I’m not sure why you mentioned it in your review. Our Hotel is inspected every month by Ecolab and my staff is trained to look for any and all pests. Additionally, we are inspected by the health department twice annually and we maintain a clean record to date. I need my future guests to know that we are a clean and safe hotel for families. Regarding your issue with the tub, we had that unit inspected and serviced since your check out. Regarding the AC unit, the air conditioner is set to turn off once the programed temperature is reached. That unit was also inspected and was found to be working properly. Although I am happy to participate in this public forum, I wish you would have brought your concerns to our attention during your stay or upon check out to give us the opportunity to properly address them with you. Perhaps you’ll have a change of heart when planning your next trip to Disneyland; if you do we will welcome that second chance to exceed your expectations.

Summary: We have stayed at the Park Vue 3 times now. We've also stayed at the Tropicana, Best Western Park Place and Disneyland Hotel. We have had one rough experience at the Park Vue but overall we feel like it's the best option. It is literally across the street from the main entrance. You go through a crosswalk and you are then walking down the bus and shuttle entrance towards the main gate. You can not get any closer. The rooms are pretty good. The bathrooms could be a little cleaner but they are mostly pretty nice. The last visit we were right next to the housekeeping closet in the back left corner. I would avoid that area of at all possible. It was very noisy early in the morning. Luckily we were up early getting ready. We've stayed in the room with the 2 queen bedroom and the sofa

Summary Heading: Disney Bound?  Perfect place to stay!
Summary: This is the 3rd time we've stayed at the Park Vue and it was great!  They are maintaining the rooms since the remodel nicely.  Everything was clean and comfortable.  I can't stress enough how close it is to the parks.  Less than a mile straight across the street!  An I Hop is on the corner as you walk to Disney . Pretty nice for that late night snack!  The hotel offers a nice breakfast featuring warm breakfast items that do change daily.   Its nice to enjoy the pool and spa area in the afternoon before returning to the parks.  It's also a good value especially compared to Disney resorts.  We now have annual passes and will be back again soon!

This motel is literally in the shadow of the Disneyland monorail. It is so close, if you forget something it is not a major schlep to walk back and get it. I have visited Disneyland several times and by 4 o' clock in the afternoon I am always physically and mentally exhausted. Staying here you can easily go back to your room, have a nap or a swim and be fresh for the pixie dust at night! (I napped both days I was here.)  In addition to all  this convenience the motel is very clean and comfortable. We asked for a second floor room in the back away from the street and it was extremely quiet. I could not hear my neighbors at all. The room was large and had been recently renovated, the bed was comfortable and there were lots of pillows. There were also lots of TV channels on a wall

Decent sized rooms, close to park, very convenient. Only downside is the 2nd bathroom sink is in the same room as the kitchen sink. The free breakfast in the morning is not great - but it's free. Overall, you cannot beat the location.

Across the street from Disneyland, this is a great place to stay to avoid the big bucks you would stay at a Disney location. Only negative comment is that our room fee was charged to our credit card before we checked out. I don't think this is a normal practice.

Highly recommended. Unbelievably close to Disneyland entrance. Great rates surprisingly adequate hot and cold breakfast with waffles, tea and coffee, boiled eggs, fruit, sausage, cereals. If for some bizarre reason you need to stay indoors and watch TV, they have a selection of channels better than some 4 star places that I've stayed in. There's a microwave in the room for heating up sandwiches bought from the Walmart which is a 5 minute drive away. All you could possibly ask for when you're on a budget.

Have stayed at this motel for many years and it is my favorite of all of the Harbor Blvd. venues.  The rooms are clean and well maintained, the staff is wonderful and friendly.  It's also very quiet with well-behaved guests. A really nice feature is having convenient electric outlets by the bed(s).   Best of all, it's just across Harbor Blvd. from the entrance to Disneyland and California Adventure.

The major draw of this hotel for most travellers would undoubtedly be the proximity to Disneyland. It's a short stroll away, so can't complain. The room was just okay. The air conditioning/heating unit was unbearably noisy so we had to turn it off. Breakfast was good (the highlight being the waffles). I would recommend this hotel but don't expect 5 star or anything

If you want to be close to Disneyland without all the bells and whistles and expense of a DL resort you cannot do better than Park Vue Inn... Location, Location, location!  The rooms are lovely, they look like they've been recently re-done on the inside.  The outside is not too much to look at, but let's be honest, I want a close, decent, reasonably priced place to lay my head so I can be at the parks as much as possible.  The continental breakfast was pretty good, I'm not one to praise food like that :O)  My mother who was my traveling partner said it was one of the best she's ever seen.  However, please note it is on the second floor and they do not have a elevator so it is not ADA accessable.  They do provide trays, so someone in your party can get some food for the person

Plenty of parking and located opposite the gates to the park. You couldn't get any closer. The staff were friendly The rooms were clean and spacious. The Wi-Fi was fast and constant. The breakfast was excellent too. We could not fault the place and would definitely recommend it. We travelled with kids so went to the park early morning. We stayed a few hours, left the park, went back to the room, went for something to eat, then went back into the park in the evening and didn't use the car once from when we checked in until we checked out!

Been to Disneyland a couple of times, and decided to stay out of the resort this time. Was a great idea. This place was really good. Rooms tidy and clean, laundry very handy. Obviously location is great. Only blemish was the breakfast, which was very poor. (Though it did give us a great excuse to eat at iHop).

It is directly across from the entrance to Disneyland and California Adventure. Easy walking to and from. So easy to go back to your room during the day if you need to. Free breakfast is one of the best I have ever had at a hotel. Price is competitive. You can see the fireworks from the hotel. The only draw   backs are no elevator. The breakfast is on the second floor. There answer to handicap people is someone can bring you a tray down. and the front desk employees are not very friendly. The other employees we came in contact with were wonderful. They do hold your luggage if you get there before check in. Luggage was waiting for us in our room when we got back from the park that night and got our keys. I really recommend Park Vue Inn. They also have a big laundry room. Did not

We visited this hotel right after they refurbished their rooms last June.  After extensive research for Disneyland hotels, and knowing we did not want to pay $400-$500 per night for a DIsney hotel, we picked this sweet place.  And we loved it.  We were up front in Room 107 and it was perfect.  The bunk beds were perfect for our teens and all the beds were very comfortable which was important to us since we were on our feet from sunrise to late at  night at Disneyland.  The best part of this hotel is that they are literally across the street from the pedestrian entrance.  It took about two minutes to cross South Harbor and be in the park.  So each day (we stayed five nights) we would get up early, play hard and then come back after lunch for a rest and swim.  Then we'd go back to

This was my second stay at Park Vue Inn and will be my last. We arrived before check-in so the hotel watched our luggage. I was told upon checking in that the luggage was in our room. Turns out they lost it. I was lied to repeatedly and it took and hour and a half before they figured whether it was stolen (including my husband's work computer!) or put in someone else's room. After all was said and done we missed out on over two hour's worth of time we would have liked to have spent at the park. This was especially annoying because we were trying to celebrate our wedding anniversary. I probably would have still stayed here in the future if it wasn't for how we were treated throughout this ordeal. As a side note, I have now stayed at the front and rear of the property and both are
Manager Response: I wish to express my sincere apology for the experience you had during your stay. However, I’d like to set the record straight. You arrived at our hotel prior to 3pm and your room was not ready. You left your luggage with the front desk and when you returned to the hotel in the early evening to check-in; you reported that your luggage was not in the room. My staff discovered a clerical error that sent your bags to the wrong room and 30 minutes after your check-in (not 2 hours), your luggage was returned to you. Your luggage was intact and no items were reported missing. Your husband was understandably upset and asked to speak to a manager. My front desk manager called and spoke to your husband and apologized for the error and she explained what caused the mix-up with your luggage. Your bill was adjusted and credited for the inconvenience, but your husband demanded full compensation for your stay. Upon check out your husband asked to speak to my front desk manager again and he stated that he was dissatisfied with the compensation he received. At your husband’s request I called him to further discuss the matter and he did not return my call. I understand how disappointed you and your husband were with the outcome, but I stand by the efforts made by my front desk manager to address and resolve your issue.

Summary: This place is all about the location. It's directly across from the main gate, but I'm sure everyone reading this knows that. The rooms are small, but updated, so they are okay. However,... If the front desk guy hands you a key to room 105, throw it back at him and ask him why he hates you. This room has no business being anything but a storage closet. It is the loudest room I have ever had the displeasure of not sleeping in. It is right next to the stairs, vending machine, souvenir shop and every single human being walking to and from the parks. It is also under the breakfast room (and you can imagine what dozens of excited children RUNNING for their waffles sounds like directly above you). Disneyland is not as much fun with sleep deprived kids because your walls are apparently

Summary Heading: Best value, family Friendly- and proximity to Disneyland CAN'T be beat
Summary: We have stayed at Park Vue Inn for our last 2 Disneyland trips (2011/2014), each for 5 days in July and have already secured our room for this summer’s trip.  As others have mentioned, this place is the best value for a non-Disney hotel.  Free parking, free Wi-Fi, free breakfast, and updated rooms are all examples of what you can expect when you stay here.  When we first stayed here in 2011; they were in the process of changing out all the carpets and updating the rooms; when we returned 3 years later yet again updating rooms (in a good way).  The beds are comfortable, and the rooms are decent.  Our first stay we had a bunk and 1 queen; the 2nd stay we had a double queen and bunk, and on this upcoming trip we will have the 1 bdrm suite with small kitchenette (although after

Summary Heading: A smart value for a Disneyland visit
Summary: I'm so glad we found the Park Vue Inn for our first visit to Disneyland with our kids. Not wanting to shell out the extra bucks for a Disney hotel, we were just looking for something that was inexpensive, close to the park, and clean. We found just that.  The most redeeming quality of the motel is simply its location. Of the nearby hotels on Harbor Blvd., this was the closest to the Disneyland & California Adventure entrances. You literally cross the street right in front of the hotel to get to the security checkpoint that gets you to the parks (and just past to Downtown Disney). We never had to use our car except to run errands at night.  We got a double queen room for ourselves and two young kids. The room was small, but we didn't spend a whole lot of time there anyway. This

This is our new favourite when at Disneyland. It is the closest non Disney hotel you can get to the park. We had a room with 1 queen and bunks, perfect for our family of 4. It was on the upper level about half way down, newly renovated, clean and quiet. The pool was great for unwinding in the afternoon, it is in the middle of the parking lot but surrounded by a high hedge and palm trees so you don't even notice. The hot breakfast in the morning was great with lots of selection for everyone although it can get quite busy and hard to find a table at times. The staff are very friendly and efficient. The in room wifi worked great. We will be back!!

Stayed at this hotel for Spring Break Disney Trip. Hotel is walking distance to Disney--pretty much right across the street. Great location! Also, as soon as you walk across the street to get to Disney if you look to your left is where the local cabs line up. So if you want to go anywhere (beach, airport...) there is no need to call & wait for a cab to come. Newport & Huntington beaches are 15 - 20 minutes away.  Hotel itself was clean & staff were great. Breakfast served free daily was good enough to get the kids going & didn't need to wait in another Disney food line. We stayed in a room with 2 queens & a bunk bed and had plenty of space for 5 people. Would stay here again for another Disney Trip. Front desk sells Disney tickets here if you haven't purchased yours on line

Loved staying here. So close to Disneyland, fast walk back from either park when you get tired and need a break.  Pool area nice.  Breakfast was great as well.  Free parking a real plus if you have a car.  Could not have picked a better hotel.  So many bonuses in staying at the Park Vue Inn.  Staff also very nice and helpful.  Housekeeping great, I used to do that job and it is very hard work so always remember to reward them with a tip at the end of your stay.  I never did until I actually did that job and know how hard it is.   Awesome place to stay.  We had an upstairs room and it was very quiet, especially after the parks close and everyone has come back to the hotel.  Before that it can get noisy with strollers rolling in front of your room but it wasn't bad.  Also you can

We had 5 nights in the Park Vue Inn and it was our second stay here.  It is in the BEST location....across from the park entrance, close to restaurants and shopping.  The housekeeping staff goes above and beyond by leaving special touches in the room that my kids loved.  The included breakfast is also fabulous!  Free wifi, but a bit slow and dropped out a bit.  However, we're at Disneyland....no time to browse the net.

Brought my daughter here for a surprise Disneyland trip April 2014 and you just can't beat the price for how close it is to the park. It's literally like a 7 min walk!!! loved the fact that that they had the coldstone creamy at the front entrance. they had a pool(we didn't use) the rooms weren't bad either. nothing fancy tho. just a basic room with comfortable beds. we didn't spend much time in the room anyway so it was perfect. Id come here again.

Great location,polite responsive staff,clean room,comfortable beds,close to restaurants,nice pool,and tons of excited families."Free breakfast"(Of course included in room rate) was quite average, but I guess the standards with included breakfast are mostly lower on Harbor Blvd.

Perfect location for Disneyland.  Literally across the street, right in front of the crosswalk to the park. Clean and comfortable room. Decent free breakfast. Walking distance to several restaurants. We will definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: The place to be for Disneyland!
Summary: My family & I stayed here March 28-31.  It was great! So nice and close to Disneyland gates which made it wonderful for afternoon breaks. I can't emphasize enough how convenient it was.  One evening we forgot our jackets in the room, my husband went and got them, he was back in less than 20 mins.  No buses to wait for!  The room was nice and clean. The beds could use an update. Mattresses weren't terrible but not great.  The grounds were beautiful! I was surprised a smaller motel like this would have such beautiful landscaping, especially around the pool area.  The pool was in the parking lot but with the greenery, plants and flowers it felt secluded.  We’re hoping someday to make our way back to Disneyland and we’ll be back to Park Vue Inn!

This one and best Western is the closest to Disneyland. This one is better for me for a couple of reasons. First, no parking fees. Check in wasn't until 3pm but you can go in earlier to get a parking pass for the day so u can park there and then walk across the street to Disneyland then check-in later.  You just saved like $25. Second, the breakfast buffet is wonderful. It's not continental like most places with just toast, fruits and coffee. There was many varieties such as boiled eggs, sausage, scrambled eggs, waffles, oatmeal. My kids and I actually had a real hot free breakfast. Loved it. Just remember to try to not eat too much. I got a double room so it was basic just like most hotel/motel. But it was clean, roomy shower, no tub, fridge, microwave, extra pillows. My kids

Unless you are going to Anaheim for anything other than Disneyland, this motel will fit the bill.  It's pretty no frills--basically a dressed up super 8 or hojo but with nice, updated touches like spa-like toiletries, flatscreen and comfy bed. We basically went there to sleep after spending all day at the park. And no one can beat the location. RIGHT across the street from DL.  Staff were friendly and allowed us to park in the motel lot even after we checked out early the next day (saving us the $$ of parking at DL). Great deal! Would definitely stay again. And did I mention, FREE BREAKFAST?!!

Location, Location, Location!! Can't get any closer to the park gates. Even closer than one of the Disney hotels! We (1 adult, 2 teens) stayed here Feb 16-24, 2015, and really had no complaints. Requested a room on the top floor at the back when we made the reservation, and that is exactly what we got. A bit more walking, but the lack of street/traffic noise was well worth it. They are in the middle of upgrading all the rooms. Never heard any noise, but we were across the parking lot from the renos. Our room was fully remodeled and was very nice. Beds were very comfortable...soft but good support. Blankets were lightweight, but plenty warm enough (we Canadians are used to blankets that are thick & heavy out of necessity) and the pillows were nice (although we always take our

Summary Heading: Literally Across The Street From Disneyland
Summary: You always read, oh we're right across the street from where ever you want to go.  But this is legit with this hotel.  Walk to the end of the parking lot, there is a cross walk, cross the street, you're at the park.  Could not get closer.  (You are entering from the opposite side as Downtown Disney).  The hotel is nothing fancy but I found it very clean.  Our room offered bunk beds, a microwave and refrigerator.  I knew this ahead of time and brought food to make.  The hotel is right next door to a few restaurants.  Very easy to eat if you don't pack food.  The hotel offers a free breakfast that includes all the standard items plus hot items such as scrambled eggs, sausage and potatoes.  Only negative, our room was on the ground floor, around two hours before the park opened, it

We have stayed at the Park Vue previously and our stay this year was even better than our last.   First and foremost my main attraction to this motel is the location. It is directly opposite the pedestrian crossing which connects into the main entry points for Disneyland and California Adventure Park. For families with kids that is priceless. No waiting for shuttles when kids need naps!!  Secondly, the prices are reasonable and very affordable for families. They even include breakfast which makes for an easy start to an otherwise busy day.    The staff were always helpful and friendly. The accommodations have been updated recently also. You can park your car and there is wifi available.  Overall the Park Vue Inn is clean, inexpensive, has all the standard facilities, free

The walk from our hotel to Disneyland was a breeze! We enjoyed the pool. The free breakfast, free parking, and free wifi were added bonuses. We didn't swim until our last day but we had the pool all to ourselves. I'm pretty sure we had the worst room in the entire place (clean room but it was so noisy!!) we were on the lower floor right next to the stairs that lead up to the breakfast area. We heard people dragging chairs early in the morning. Rooms are snug but we made it work just fine. Left the tv on with a towel over it so the sound would block out noise but there wouldn't be a lot of light while we slept. My kids are little and fireworks scare them. They plug their ears and bawl! I opened the curtains to my room and could watch them from our bed. Our stay was nice and we

First of all, this hotel is truly, TRULY, right across the street from Disneyland. When we came back at night and we were walking across the street with people, we had to wait to get into the parking lot because everyone turned to walk down the street and we were literally just going straight! THAT is how close it is. Great experience! Comfy rooms.  My only complaint is that the walls are paper thin so if you want to rest during the day, you will have to listen to people running and talking and maid carts being pushed down the hall. A minor thing really. Breakfast was great! It is quite the plus to have a hot breakfast included. It doesn't open until 7 though, so on the early admission day we ate at the IHOP which is right in the parking lot. Overall we LOVED the Park Vue and I

This is our second time and we were just as happy with this hotel!! Friendly and very helpful staff!!! They are so nice and there to meet your needs!! One girl even answered the phone and then put them on hold to answer my question before she continued. Lemon aide and cookies are in the lobby each day! Free breakfast and the kids LOVED the heated pool! I enjoyed the hot tub! Very clean rooms everyday and the little store there is convenient too. We love McDonalds is walkable and Ihop is next door for late suppers!! I felt very safe there walking around too.  Disney is literally right across the street!!!! Best choice and reasonably priced!! We also watched the fireworks on Sunday on the balcony and it was a better view than some spots at Disney! Spectacular!!

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable, affordable in an incredible location
Summary: The hotel is recently renovated with very pleasant interiors, extremely comfortable beds and great room features. The hotel pool is wonderful and conveniently located from all hotel rooms. Staff are friendly and the housekeeping team do an outstanding job. To top it all of it is across the road from Disneyland and right near many family restaraunts. Would highly recommend.

Firstly, the location can't be beat. Even closer than the Disney hotels. Tidy and neat, with a pool (daughter loves this) and free parking. Breakfast was free, but selection is a little limited (although adequate). iHop and Cold Stone Ice cream next door, Denny's down the road. Not a 5-star place, but that's not what you pay for. The only negative we found was that our safe was not actually bolted to anything (thieves can't open it, but they can take it away with them!). Management was notified of this. I would definitely consider staying here again, but I wouldn't guarantee it. I would consider other alternatives.

We really enjoyed our stay at Park Vue. The room was small but it was just what we needed, i love that they have bunk beds. Everything was clean and well maintained. Breakfast was great, i have actually never had so much selection in a free hotel breakfast. (Although that step down into the breakfast room tried to get me a few times, and i saw 3 kids trip )   The staff were all extremely nice and helpful. I saw people cleaning and maintaining the hotel inside and out pretty much the whole time, which speaks volumes to the pride they take in their hotel.   The best part was that it is really right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland. I thought maybe the front of the hotel would be close, but the rooms would be really far away but that wasn't the case. (The hotel we

Summary Heading: The best close hotel to Disneyland - lots of bang for the buck
Summary: Hard to get a room on busy days, but worth it. The Ramada Maingate used to be our go-to place for Disneyland trips. However they've gone so far down hill that I just can't recommend them any longer. Trying to find an alternative, we tried out the Park Vue Inn twice in the past nine months. Although getting a room can be tricky, the bottom line is that the rooms are reasonable, and the parking fee is appropriately. They serve a full hot breakfast, and are 10x closer to the entrance than other hotels. This is going to be our NEW go-to place for future trips. We think this hotel is awesome!

Summary Heading: Nice low cost option for Disneyland.
Summary: This hotel was a decent option for our family.  It's reasonably priced and you can't get closer to the park unless you pay the big dollars for a Disney resort.  The pool is very basic but it's clean and decent.  Breakfast is good, and you have to use stairs to get there.  Rooms are basic motel rooms but are clean, well-kept, and have been recently renovated.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  There is a souvenir shop on site with Disneyland swag at a nice discount from park prices.  Water pressure is good in the shower and there is no shortage of hot water.  Our room was nothing fancy but there are other options.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay however breakfast is not acessible
Summary: The staff are pleasant and extremely helpful. Great Location and newly renovated rooms. Breakfast area is not accessible You can only get there by steps .As I was travelling with friends and hated to have them go up and get my breakfast and bring it to me in the room.   Since I could not see what was up at the breakfast area a  I would suggest that the front desk have a list of items so I could pick what I wanted. A full list of everything up there that day. That would have been very helpful.

Summary Heading: Exactly what we were looking for.
Summary: We found this hotel to be a good fit four our family of 4 visiting Disneyland.  Our room was clean, reasonably quiet (room 7 upstairs near front of hotel), and very close to Disneyland.  The breakfast was above average for a hotel breakfast with plenty of options and a decent amount of seating. We had a room with a queen bed and bunkbed.  The room was quite small.  There was a large convention at the Convention Center, so we may paid more off season than typical.  It was still much cheaper than a Disneyland hotel.  I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Right across the street from Disney...
Summary: Only a few steps from Disneyland and Disney California Adventure Park, you will find the Park Vue Inn.  Location is perfect, but there is more. There is a variety of rooms and suites with all kinds of amenities. We had a mini suite with 2 flatscreen TVs, kitchenette and a Jacuzzi, and at quite reasonable rates - nice..! Rooms are a bit worn, but clean, and everything worked fine. Staff is friendly and helpful, and they can even help you with tickets for Disney. The Park Vue Inn has free parking and there is an excellent Hot Breakfast included. You can enjoy your breakfast inside, or outside on the deck. Next to the reception, you will find a Cold Stone Creamery - Yummy..! There are some restaurants in the area, but Tony Roma´s (Ribs, Seafood, Steaks) almost next door, is great.

Spent 5 nights at Park Vue, best location and very reasonable.  As it just across from Disneyland main entrance. My husband can easily walked back to the hotel for an afternoon nap while I was enjoy the 2 parks.   Our room was perfect one queen bed and bunkbed, clean well equips with coffee in room, microwave and fridge. Receptionist were friendly and helpful.  Breakfast included, they have great breakfast (in our opinion) apart from typical continental breakfast as other hotel provided. They generously provide you with - do it yourself waffles, scramble egg, bacons, sausages and gravy, fresh fruits, hard boiled eggs.   We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

So I have stayed here for a couple years now and am just getting around too writing a review. The place is great. Stayed here with friends and family. The name my sound cheesy and it could use a good paint job but this place is literally 5 minutes from the gates of Disneyland. Having stayed in the on property disney hotels I can for surely say that this is the shortest walk to Disneyland. Great Place!

Location is great, breakfast included in price, pool, best of all bunk beds for the kids.  Having a family with a boy and girl, bunk bends are the best, I'm really surprised there aren't more hotels on the Disney hotel strip that have bunk beds for families.  Room was nice, clean, had a bar fridge.  Breakfast had something for everyone in our family.  Staff were great too.

Summary Heading: Best Disney Hotel I have had!
Summary: Wow! We have stayed in many places in Anaheim and have landed on a favorite. Park Vue sounds cheesy and may seem to good to be true but it isn't.   It is literally across the street from the park. Parking is included. The rates are amazing. The rooms are clean and well appointed. It includes a decent breakfast. The staff are friendly. But there is more.  You are in walking distance of Downtown Disney, shopping, and multiple restaurants up and down Harbor. One of the secret spots is the balcony where you can sit and enjoy the fireworks at Disney! Incredible. There is a pool and a jacuzzi and a small exercise room.   We will be back. We had room 140 away from the street. Great spot and it had a jacuzzi tub and King size bed.

Summary Heading: We will stay here everytime we visit Disneyland
Summary: The Park Vue Inn is across the street from the Disneyland Park, parked my car and we walked to the park and restaurants every day. There was an excellent breakfast buffet every morning, were you can eat outside on the deck. Prices were great and the rooms were clean, comfortable and had all the services you would expect for twice the price. We loved staying here; it makes what is an expensive week affordable!

The Park Vue Inn is ideally located across from Disneyland - no need to use a bus or drive.  The rooms are clean and comfortable, and nicely equipped with fridges, microwaves, and coffee pot etc.  The room fees include wi-fi, parking and a very good breakfast (eggs, waffles, yogurt, fruit, cereals, breads, and more).    There's a pool and spa but we were too busy at the parks to give them a try.  The hotel is, of course, full of families with small kids.  Other reviewers noted noise from children and that is somewhat unavoidable in this location.  The owners / managers have put notices in the rooms and along the hallways asking for quiet between 10pm and 9am.  We didn't find the "kid noise" to be too bad at all.  The staff was friendly and checkout was efficient.    All around,

Summary Heading: The best place to stay when in Disneyland Anaheim
Summary: First, it's just across the entrance to Disneyland. Second, if I need to rest, I can easily decide to go back to my room and take the much needed rest from all the walking. Third, the breakfast is awesome. Fourth, service is great! Fifth, it's near food establishments. Sixth, there is always a parking space for guests. So, what else can you ask for?

This is the third different hotel I have stayed at on Harbor Blvd. in the past month.  It is adequate and meets the main requirement of being close to the front of Disneyland.  The room and beds were comfortable enough.  it had a basic set of amenities - fridge, microwave, free breakfast  buffet and free parking.  The atmosphere is essentially a motel setting.  Pool is in the middle of the parking lot (didn't use it).  They weren't able to accommodate our early check in (12:30 pm) but they were able to charge for the room when I got there.  I would probably stay here again if the price was low enough to make my first choice seem unreasonable.

Summary Heading: Great value, unbeatable location; accomodated family of five
Summary: I'll confess...I can be a hotel "snob." I often go for a big, brand name (and spend way too much for a sterile room) because I'm afraid the small motels won't be an acceptable quality. I'm glad I took a chance on Park Vue Inn. The biggest reason we booked here was that some of their rooms accommodate a family of five!! Two double beds AND a bunk bed! If your family exceeds four people (and your tween/teenagers don't like to share a bed), you KNOW how maddening it can be to try to find hotels. You often end up in two rooms (sometimes adjoining, sometimes not) and spending double what you'd like. Massive kudos to Park Vue for recognizing that some families need additional sleeping arrangements. Why (else) to stay here: NO parking fee; free Wi-Fi, free breakfast; super friendly

We stayed here as a family of 5 in a quiet little room at the back of the hotel. We traveled with our 2 children ages 3 and 5 and my mother for a Disney trip. We could not have found a better location. This hotel is as close as you can get to Disneyland's main gates! The hotel staff were amazingly helpful and friendly. The room was newly renovated and very clean. We were in a 2 queen room and requested a rollaway bed for my mother as the 5th person in our group. We used the heated pool and hot tub many times as we took afternoon breaks away from the park. Breakfast was a busy time and it was hard to get to the waffle machine. Other then that no complaints at all. We will always stay at this lovely place for our future Disneyland trips. Highly recommended to young families that

We stayed here for 5 nights. We were recommended here due to its proximity to Disneyland. You cannot get much closer than this. Our room was a little dark but would overlook that purely due to the location.  Rooms were clean and tidy. Our kids enjoyed the pool. We would often go back to the hotel mid afternoon for a rest and a swim before heading back. Would definitely stay here again.

We picked this hotel after staying at the HoJo down the road two years ago due to proximity to Disneyland Maingate.  We found the walk to be terrible after a day at the park especially with little ones.  Park Vue Inn is the perfect location if you are wanting a quick walk into the park.  It is also right beside the iHop and for this Canadian that doesn't have that option, that was a nice breakfast treat. LOL  Park Vue Inn has a very convenient check in/out process.  They were kind enough to give the family we were traveling with adjoining rooms to ours which was super flexible of them.    The rooms...we stayed in ground floor rooms across from the pool.  They suited our needs but smelled very musty and ammonia like when we first got there.  They look like they recently reno'd

This is directly across the street of the park, and was very convenient.  We requested a top floor and good view, and that's exactly what we received.  We were able to see the fireworks from the door, and it was near the back of the hotel, so no traffic noise.    The free breakfast was really good, and simple, saved a lot of money eating there in the mornings.  The hotel is remodeled and looks really clean, and well taken care of, the staff were always cleaning, and were very nice.  As with other reviews the noise of loud guests were the only negative, but this is not the hotels fault, they have signs requesting guests be quiet between 9 am to 10 pm.  We had some very noisy neighbors with small children, but after a few nights we didn't hear them much anymore.    I really liked

I have stayed at several hotels around Disneyland and have nice things to say about most of them but I've never been fully satisfied to book them again. I think I've finally found my place. The Park Vue Inn had the 3 things I value most for my Disneyland visit: proximity, breakfast, and no surprises. You can't beat the location. It's so close! The breakfast is excellent and plentiful. I didn't get any extra charges or come across anything dirty. I will be coming back.

Summary Heading: This hotel was very close to the park....
Summary: The park is literarily across the street, walk to the crosswalk and then cross the street and you are at the bus/shuttle terminals, where everyone else gets shuttled to.  You can go to park and come back to hotel for a rest anytime.  The fireworks view is right outside your door, perfect views.    The hotel itself is very clean, the rooms were remodeled, and had a newer feel.  The room was serviced everyday, and very nicely done.  The free wifi was very good, not weak at all for my needs.  The only things I thought were unimpressive was the tiny TV, and the room sound proofing.  I am not sure what they used to prevent noise problems, but you can hear everything outside your room.  Plus the other hotel guests that I encountered did not seem to care how loud their kids were, or

We arrived at the motel early and our room was ready which was a great start.  The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful.  Our room was very clean and looks as if it has been recently updated.  The beds were not that comfortable, the mattress was very hard and they only had two sheets and a blanket so we got a little cold at night.  The motel is in an excellent location to Disneyland just across the street, it's close enough to walk to the parks.  The breakfast was just ok and we ended up eating at the IHOP next door.  I would recommend this hotel for the location, service and price.

Just returned home yesterday from a 6 night stay at the Park Vue Inn. I read many reviews on all the offsite Disneyland hotels and chose this one because it fit our needs and had the best reviews. Check in was fast and easy. Our room was on the 2nd floor at the back of the hotel. After 2 nights in our room #228 we had to ask to change rooms because around the curtains in the room it smelled really bad like mildew/dog pee. It was bad that we were getting headaches and the kids were coughing lots at night. The front desk had no problem to moving us to a new room. We moved directly below to #128 and we had no issues with the room for the rest of the stay. The room was cleaned nicely everyday for us while we were at the park. Our kids are 3 & 4 years old and we chose this hotel for

Summary Heading: We keep returning to the Park Vue Inn
Summary: This was our 4th visit to Park Vue Inn and it just keeps getting better and better.  We stayed in a 1 queen/1 bunk bed room on the ground floor for 4 nights over christmas 2014.  The room was clean and has been renovated and they now have flat screen TVs.  The staff are friendly, the complimentary breakfast has a good choice of food.  The Park Vue Inn is excellent value for money and we look forward to staying there again when we next go to Disneyland.  Parking is also free which is a bonus.

Summary Heading: Couldn't be any closer to Disneyland!!! Very Clean Room
Summary: We stayed for 2 nights here. We had 2 Queen Beds. The room was very clean. The pillows were a little uncomfortable and the mattress was firm, we had a good nights sleep for both the nights we were there. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast in the morning was great! A lot of choices. The price was reasonable. We have rebooked to come back in July 2015. Can't wait to come back!!!!

Summary Heading: Being across the street from DL is the perk.
Summary: We had a 2 Queen bed & bunkbed room for my family of 4 (kids 3 & 5) for our 2 night stay the third weekend of January during our annual trip to Disneyland. Like many have already mentioned, you are directly in front of the crosswalk into the main entrance of the parks. This is a huge benefit with very young kids who need naps in the afternoon.  At first glance, the room smelled and looked clean (other reviews had mentioned the recent remodel). I thought the room would be a little bigger with the bunk bed but it did seem a little crammed.  Small downsides - This is a motel so yes, the walls are a little thinner (could hear other room guest         blowing their nose).  Doors face out to parking lots plus motel is on a major street (Harbor Blvd) so there is more outside noise.

Overall we loved staying at the Park Vue. The free breakfast each morning was great as well as the location! Only issue is we called and reserved the room months in advance, upon arrival we received a small room, with a queen bed and a bunk bed. We requested a king room when we reserved our room.  They did switch us to a very nice room with a king  bed and whirl pool tub and then due to room availability we were moved to a room with two queens. I wish this would have been discovered before, but when we called to confirm the room but there were issues with the reservation as they first told us our reservation was not on file, this again was their error (name misspelled). Had there not had been this issue when may have confirmed the room type and had noticed the wrong room was

We just spent 5 nights at this hotel. It was clean & priced very reasonable. It's great that it's right across from the park & you can see the fire works from the hotel patio. We will be staying again on our next visit!! We highly recommend this hotel!!

This a great hotel.  Super clean and the staff so pleasant and helpful.  We had a mini suite with a kitchen and living room and my wonderful friend who is a good cook made us a chicken and pasta dinner while there.  Pots, pans, dishes and silverware were in the room.  A free breakfast included eggs, bacon, fresh fruit, potatoes, toast, bagels, cereal, milk, juice and coffee.  They also had a waffle maker.  Nice seating indoors and out for breakfast.  Our sofa bed was not too comfy and the manager himself came up to put an egg crate mattress on the fold out couch, which worked perfect.  Pool and small gift shop and a stone cold ice cream too.  Super close to Disneyland.  This property really is right across the street from the parking lot.  It was a 6 minute walk for us and we

This motel was great!  It's directly across the street from the entrance road to the Disneyland main gate plaza - it's closer to the main gates that any of the Disney properties (I've stayed at all three) that will cost you a lot more money.  You'll pay a little more for this property than some of the other non-Disney hotels, but for me it's worth it not to have to deal with the shuttle system, which is crowded in the mornings and sometimes difficult to find a seat. The hotel has free parking and free wifi, huge pluses.  We stayed on the 2nd floor and didn't have any issues with noise.  We stayed in a 2 room suite, which had a small living room area with a TV, a fake fireplace heater and a couch which pulls out to a double bed.  It also had a kitchenette, which comes with a

We stayed here Jan 2-9.  Everything was great.  It was a short walk to the front gate of both Disneyland and California Adventure. I would say you are just as close to the parks staying here as you are at the Disneyland Hotel and maybe even closer than Paradise Pier. We had room 107. A Queen and bunk beds.   It was in the front of the complex and perfect.  The room offered plenty of space.  The beds were soft and comfy.  The breakfast offered more than enough to get us going in the morning. We used the pool 2 times.  It was heated and nicely kept. Pool towels were a bit small but we just used 2 to compensate. We used the laundry room.  It was $1 to wash and $1 to dry.  There is a machine to buy soap if you need it. Every staff member we dealt with was very pleasant and friendly.

Summary Heading: Excellent location if going to Disneyland.
Summary: You are literally directly across the road from the main entrance to Disneyland. Very convenient if you want to come back to your room for a rest. Dated decor but secondary to amenitites such as FREE parking, WIFI and breakfast. Has a lovely swimming pool and jacuzzi area. House keeping always did a lovely job with our room. No elevator to upstair suites, so something to be aware of for mobility and heavy luggage issues.

We booked the triple queen suite which worked out perfect for us.. the 2 kiddos had the private room so they could go to sleep earlier.  The room was renovated and seemed nice and clean, first floor though so it was actually very noisy!  The room above us was loud...squeaking floor, banging etc...  Breakfast was a lifesaver but get there early to get a seat inside if it's cold out.  Not  top quality but definitely a good selection and stations were always being refilled and cleaned up.  Location is perfect.  Lots of electrical outlets in our room for charging everyone's phones, laptops etc...  Parking fills up but you can always find a spot even if it's at the IHOP which has a shared parking lot with Park Vue.  Price is a little on the high side but so is everything when going

We booked 6 months in advance and payed $150 p/night for 4 nights, room with 2 queen beds. Fantastic from the moment we arrived. All staff went out of there way to make this a really pleasant experience.Rooms are comfortable and very clean. FREE car parking wi-fi and breakfast . We were all really surprised by the quality of breaky. And as close as you can get to the disneyland entrance. Once again thank you to all the staff for your contribution to our wonderful family holiday

Summary Heading: Stop searching! You've found your Disneyland trip hotel!!
Summary: Stayed 4 nights with my husband 4-7 Sept 2014. What a gem! Everything about this hotel is fantastic! I booked online directly with Park Vue and asked for a quiet room as travelling on our honeymoon. You wont get a better priced high quality room this close to Disney! We had a King Jacuzzi room #240, upstairs in the rear left corner of the hotel. Beautiful, clean, modern furnishings,flat screen TV great air-con, outside vanity and a massive double wardrobe to take all of our luggage. Fridge, coffee machine, HUGE in room jacuzzi, and even gorgeous towel animals every night on our amazingly comfy king size bed. Having stayed (and been happy) at Hojo's with kids, this time we wanted something super close to the gates, with pool and laundry.  Park Vue and their amazing staff exceeded

Booked this stay ahead Of time, likely about  3 months prior to staying, as they always get fully booked due to their easy access to disneyland. We are returning guests, been staying here since 2010. Cost was approx 145/ nite. 2 Bed non smoking. We get AAA discount.  goodness,  this is just across disneyland just walk 3/4 mile and your at the door. --free parking. --free breakfast. If you want upscale stay somewhere fancy like GrandCal, but for economical annual pass like me, this place is perfect.

The Park Vue is the closest hotel to the Disneyland entrance. The walk from my room to the security check took seven minutes, an absolute godsend if you need to take a break in the middle of the day. The employees are genuinely dedicated to providing guests a great experience. I requested extra towels and I not only got them right away, but I got them without asking every other day of my stay. Balloons arrived for a birthday. The beds are comfortable. The rooms are clean. The wifi is fast and free. The breakfast is ample and hot. The make-your-own waffles are delicious. Plenty of adults were raving about the biscuits and gravy. While I adore the experience at the Disney properties, this is a solid, close, clean, and friendly choice.

We stayed at this property for 5 nights earlier this month.  When we checked in around noon, our room wasn't ready yet but they offered to store our bags while we headed to the parks. Imagine my surprise when we came back at 3pm and were told that our bags had already been moved to our room. What a nice touch, especially since we were on the 2nd floor.  We had a queen/bunk bed room and while it was a little bit small, it was perfect for our family of 3. Although our room was closer to the front of the property, the traffic noise never bothered us and we had an awesome view of the fireworks every night. If you're looking for a quiet, clean property to stay that's close to the parks, this would be the perfect choice!

Great pricing for the absolute convenience for a Disney trip. Seems odd, but this hotel is definitely closer to the parks than if you were to pay the "big bucks" to stay at any of the Disney hotels. Granted, when you choose to stay at those hotels, you're paying for the ambiance and brand of Disney. While the hubby wasn't initially convinced about the price difference compared to staying a block down Harbor Blvd, when you & the kids are tired after a day (or even half day) at Disneyland, you will thank yourself for staying here! Rooms are cozy, clean & modern. & the beds were super comfy! We stayed on the ground floor at the back and noise was not a problem at all. Staff was friendly and complimentary breakfast was ok. On site store was a lifesaver when we forgot a couple of

I stayed here with my family of 4 in early Dec. along with my sister and her two teen sons.  Family reunion sort of trip to see Disney at xmas.  I've stayed at numerous motels on S. Harbor (Desert Inn & Suites, Tropicana this summer) and a few times at both the  Disneyland Hotel and Grand Calif.  What I liked about Park Vue Inn, other than proximity right across the crosswalk from Disneyland entrance, was the fact that the rooms were modernized, clean, and a large cooked breakfast.  The front desk staff was very helpful, my room rate was extremely reasonable, and the lobby was incredibly warm, cute and comfy at the holiday time (fireplace going, complimentary filtered water and warm teas which I didn't even know they had)...really nice and cozy ambiance.  My sister, who is quite

Summary Heading: Park Vue Inn an excellent choice for Disneyland.
Summary: We stayed here over 12/9 to 12/13/2014. The room was a little tight for 3 adults and a 4 year old, but comfy. The staff is very helpful and the grounds clean and well kept. The price is on the high side for an older property, but you are paying for the location which is literally a 4 minute walk across the street into the main plaza! Priceless! We had a really bad storm Thursday night (4 inches of rain overnight) and our closet and dressing area flooded. However the staff had it cleaned by the time we had breakfast and still put us in new and bigger room! We will make the Park Vue our hotel of choice whenever we go to Disneyland.

Closest motel to park. Directly across from entrance which was a plus. Our room was Updated and very clean. Very friendly staff at front desk. Only complaint this morning at 6AM we were packing the car to leave and not one outside light was on from the middle to back of motel.  Treacherous going down the stairs with luggage.  Not fun. Even with signs posted to be quiet some very obnoxious woman yelling over balcony at 7am to have her husband get her toothbrush.  No concern at all for anyone sleeping. Very pleased with the breakfast that is served on second floor near the front.  Quite a selection from eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, toast, coffee, etc..  Opens at 7am to 10am. Get there early as some people really haul the food away.  You can buy your Disneyland tickets at front

Summary Heading: Best place for Disney,  hands down!
Summary: We love this place.   The rooms have been remodeled and are fantastic. Staff is so polite,  friendly,  and helpful.   Right across the street from Disneyland.   Bunk bed rooms are a must for kids.  Includes breakfast. . .we wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Just got back from a 4 day stay. We stayed in 2 rooms during our stay. I had initially booked 1 queen and 1 bunk bed for me and my teen daughter. She is about 5 ft 4. I was concerned the bunk beds would be too short for her and asked if 2 queen was available, they did but only for the first 3 nights. We checked in late and had a nice quiet upstairs room in the back. It was roomy with a refrigerator and microwave. I love the sink outside the bathroom so someone can use the facilities and someone else can get ready at the sink. I heard people pretty easily but not through the walls just outside. We were lucky most people were on the disney timetable so we all probably get up and go to bed at the same time. We had breakfast which was great, hot and delicious way to start the day.

Summary Heading: Across the road from Disneyland main entrance
Summary: After all the positive reviews on TA, we decided on staying at the Park Vue Inn.  We emailed before our trip to ask whether we could leave luggage and have a small grocery order from Vons delivered as our flight arrived early morning.  Both requests were responded to quickly and we were looking forward to our trip.  On arrival, we were advised to check in at 4pm, no problem we were excited to get to Disneyland. We received a nice quiet room with 2 x queens and bunk beds in a quiet spot upstairs at the back of the motel, it was great for us.  However, one day, we arrived back to our room door wide open, housekeeping had accidentally forgotten to close it!!!  We were lucky nothing was missing, but were met with indifference from a phone call and visit to reception to advise.

This was a very nice hotel.  We had a 2 queen bed room for 4 people and a 2 queen sofa sleeper suite.  It fit 4 adults and 2 kids. They were very nice, clean and looked recently remodeled.  Beds were comfy and the hotel was quiet.  Had a hot breakfast that was good and free.  Parking was limited but ample and free.  A bit pricy but a great location that felt safe.

Great location & very clean rooms & a great  breakfast....what more can we ask for!!!. The price was very reasonable especially being so close to Disneyland entrance. The front desk clerks were always very friendly & accommodating.They even had fruit juice & cookies for the children or adults  at the reception desk.Many restaurants close by. We will definitely recommend Parkvue to our friends & return to Parkvue when visiting Disneyland.

I stayed at the Parkvue in 2011. I chose to return for a trip from Dec 3rd to Dec 6th with 9 family members ranging in ages from 7 yrs old to 70 years old. We had 3 rooms, all double Queens on the second floor in the back of the property for this trip. I personally believe this hotel is in the perfect location, directly across the street from Disneyland. About 7 minutes walking from door to park turnstiles. This will save your legs, and little ones from melt downs with its close proximity for naps, breaks or a quick dip in the pool to refresh. The value of free parking (even after you check out) or not needing a car at all (we didn't this trip), free wifi, and free hot breakfast as well as location makes this one of the best properties I've stayed at in the area.  Things have

This place is literally across the road from Disneyland.  It's clean comfortable. Breakfast is average,  pool is nice. So a great place to stay . My only suggestion is although they have a laundry on site, a laundry service for busy travelers would be really helpful but reception didnt know anyone around to provide that service.

I've stayed here a number of times and we keep coming back to this hotel. The rooms are a little older but they're pretty spacious and the double suite is perfect for large families. Parking is slightly better (more room) in this lot compared to the other hotels nearby. The location of this hotel is convenient, walking distance to the park across the street. I'd stay here more often if they weren't booked all the time. Get you reservations early!

Right at the entrance to Disneyland. 3 minute walk to inside. Quiet, clean comfortable rooms. Nice flat screen. Pool was warm and hot tub included. Great stay for my young family.  Only knock is the breakfast. Even though included in the price, breakfast was just so-so.

Perfect walking distance from Disneyland. IHOP in the parking lot where kids eat free on weekdays. Pool is heated. Breakfast is solid. Parking feels safe. Your room key will offer you a discount at the adjoining Coldstone. Exactly what we were looking for.

Stayed here for one night for a one day park hopping visit. Picked the property for its location. I stayed at HOJO the last visit and it was too far to walk after a long day.   The outside of the motel is nothing to write home about but inside furnishing looks like all recently refreshed.   Breakfast was filling and adequate.

Summary Heading: Great hotel if your planning a trip to Disneyland
Summary: We are from salem oregon, we stayed at Park Vue Inn which is the perfect location if your going to Disneyland and California, we went Thanksgiving weekend.  We were very impressed with our room. We had a suite on the lower level, the room was clean, roomy and comfortable. Our room also had a kitchenett which was stocked, bowls, plates etc.  As for the comfort of there beds pretty much depends on that persons prefrence....i thought beds were pretty comfortable.  Our room was also stocked with plenty of towls, extra blankets and plenty of plushed pillows.  Our bathroom overall was pretty good minus the crack in the tile.   Housekeeping....i must say they did an excellent job.  Pool was heated so to us that made it much more awesome for night swims and for the kiddos.  All in all

Summary Heading: A place we would all happily stay again
Summary: We spent 9 nights at the Park Vue Inn, 3 families, 3 generations and all with 1 bedroom units  The staff were brilliant and we loved getting to know our cleaners and the lovely touch of the towel animals on the bed, I felt I was back on a cruise ship  The rooms were large and comfortable with everything we needed for a fabulous stay  The positon was brilliant, we took our places for the night water show and it took my son 10 minutes to race back to his room, get jumpers and be back in time for the show   The included breakfast was plentiful and more than sufficient for what we would normally eat, my husband loved the waffle making machine, free wifi was great and being able to park our hire cars at the front door was so convenient....you can keep those massive hotels and give me

This is a wonderful Hotel. It is literally across the street from the main gates of Disneyland. No more than a 5 minute walk. The room we had accommodated 6 people with plenty of room to move around. It was clean without having that disinfected smell rooms usually had. A pool for the kids,free breakfast every morning,pleasant staff. I can't say enough about it. Many restaurants from fast food to high end dinning within walking distance. A great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Closest you can get to gate!
Summary: Place is a nice, average motor inn- but giving it an extra star for location and value.  We normally have stayed in the Disneyland Hotel over the past 10 years, but the ever increasing price tag finally became downright offensive.  Park Vue inn is directly on the crosswalk, across the street from the main gate...and is actually CLOSER to the DL main entrance than staying "on the property". (I timed it.)
