If you are into minimizing travel time and maximizing park time - this place is for you.  Paid a reasonable AAA rate of 120something a night. (Disneyland hotel and grand Californian were 500+ that weekend.) Clean room, free breakfast and a balcony up front where you can watch the fireworks. Free parking- even on the day we checked out we could leave the car there all day while

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: We were very happy with our stay at Park Vue Inn.   The room was great and the bunk beds were perfect for our two kids.   The location could not be any better, it was so close to Disney that we walked home for lunch each day, which was really nice.   The breakfast was great each morning and a good way to get us started each day.   They are doing some remodeling and that is good as some parts are a bit dated, but we will definitely stay here again on our next Disney vacation.

booked a room for 5 nights but left after first night-  If you have any sensitivity to scents--DO NOT STAY HERE- they put very strong air fresheners in the air conditioners in each room- my face swelled up from the chemicals-  Very rude when we asked for refund-   Hotel was close to Disneyland- breakfast included- that was all great- but the heavy scent- ruined my stay-
Manager Response: Dear Marty D,   I'm never pleased when a guest is unhappy, and I wish to extend an additional apology for your experience. That being said I feel this poor review is unfounded. Your complaint about the room came the following morning after your first night’s stay. My staff apologized and offered to move you to a guest room that had the air freshener removed and the room would then be treated with an OZONE air purifier to remove any residual odor, and you refused to move rooms. After you requested to check out, we refunded your entire stay and helped you relocate to a neighboring hotel. I'm truly sorry you found our service to be unsatisfactory. Our goal is to create great guest experiences, and we hope that you will give us another opportunity to be of better service on your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary: This was our second stay at the Park Vue Inn, and it is by far the best value for lodging at Disneyland.  The parking is free, breakfast is included and the rooms are beautifully decorated with all new modern decor.  There is no need to park at Disneyland if you arrive early because you can pre-check in and park your car for free and walk over.  We arrived just after 10am the Thursday before Halloween for one night and they had a room ready for us!  There was no early check in fee- again, a great value!  We had a room on the ground floor with a queen bed and twin bunks for the kids.  Everything I would want in a room was there- flat screen TV, coffee maker and refrigerator.  Immaculate bathroom and bedding.  The breakfast did not just have cereal and carb food, it actually had

Me and my party of 4 spent five nights at the hotel during our trip to disneyland. They offer free hot breakfast daily which is an exceptional way to start a big disney day! The parking is FREE and plentiful. There is an IHOP near the front of the property, and a pool in the center. They also have a nice affordable gift and sundry shop on site. We stayed in a double queen with bunk bed room and I was amazed at the usable space left. We were at the back of the property on the ground floor in the corner, we found it quiet, clean, comfortable, and an easy walk to the crosswalk to the happiest place on earth. I see why this older non chain hotel is rated so highly, and would highly recommend it for a disneyland vacation.

Summary Heading: One of the better motels across from Disneyland
Summary: I have stayed at almost every motel right across from Disneyland on Harbor Blvd and Park Vue Inn is one of the better ones.  They have updated their rooms to make them very modern and it looks really nice.  The location is perfect, it is a 5 minute walk to the Disneyland gates and they have Cold Stone right in the front.  Our only issue when we went the last weekend of October was we had a roll away bed in our room when we checked in, so we called down to request it be removed to give us more space.  We went to the park and when we came back about 5 hours later the bed was still there.  We were really tired and just going to leave the next day anyways so we didn't bother calling back down to the front desk.  Other than that the room was fine for us to literally stay one night

Summary Heading: Nice hotel in a great location
Summary: We were recommended to stay here and weren't disappointed - for the price, it is good value.  We stayed in one of the renovated rooms, it was spacious with two (good quality) queen beds.  The service was great - very friendly and accommodating.  The breakfast is plentiful, there's something for everyone.  I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: I really wanted to like it
Summary: For the last 4 years we've stayed at the nearby Best Western Park Place during our annual Disneyland trip. We wanted to try a new place, and the reviews for Park Vue were really good. The staff was friendly. They held our bags for us, and then delivered them to our room when it became available later in the day.  But the room.... I am really not a picky person, I promise you, but that room did not hold up to the reviews. It wasn't just small, it was tiny. I made the mistake of walking across the floor barefoot on our first night, and stepped in a sticky, damp area near the desk. There was "hair" on the mirror when we arrived, but the bathroom was clean otherwise. The heater was unusable due to a very strong burning smell when turned on, we were fine with not using it though as

At age 30, I decided to take my first trip to Disney. My boyfriend found this hotel on TripAdvisor and we decided to spend the night in Anaheim so we could get an early start in the AM.   The room is no frills, but it is very clean and well kept. You can tell when a hotel really cares about its rep; nothing was out of place and there was nary a spec of dirt in the immaculate bathroom. The provided toiletries were better smelling and higher quality than I would have expected. These details matter when choosing a motel, as you never know what you'll get.   You can park for the day at the hotel and walk over to Disney in the morning. IHOP is right next door which is very convenient as well.   I would warn other readers that the hotel is brimming with kids, it is across the street

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Recently renovated and includes real breakfast!
Summary: Very clean, renovated hotel, across Disneyland's MainGate. Rooms are clean, bathrooms are also clean. Rooms have mini fridge, microwave, flatscreen with good cable channels, including disneychannel.  Very corteous service. It has 2 coin operated laundry rooms for the hotel guests.  Complimentary breakfast, which is a real breakfast, it has fruit, cereal, scrambled eggs either with suasages or with bacon, waffles, milk, juices, yogurt, coffe. Great way for starting your day at disney.  Complimentary parking. It has a souvenir store which has more affordable prices than disney, but still pricey for disney related merchandise, when compared to the recently opened CVS phamacy located on katella st.

I chose this hotel after reading many reviews on multiple sites and was not sorry. I really wanted to stay in the park hotels but couldn't justify the cost. Except for access via the monorail, I think this hotel was as close as the in park ones, and you get free breakfast that was far from " continental".  The rooms have very recently been upgraded with amazing beds. I didn't use the pool but even though it is located in the middle of the parking lot, looked clean and inviting. You will not be sorry if you choose this hotel.

Based on the reviews here we stayed at the Park Vue for one night, prior to a day at the Disneyland Parks.  If you're looking for a cost-effective place that is close to the parks, clean and comfortable, and has a decent (free) breakfast, well, look no more.   The walk to the plaza between the two Disney parks is maybe ten minutes at most.  It's a five minute walk to where the shuttles drop off, so there's really no advantage to taking the shuttle.  Of note, the Park Vue let us leave our car parked at the hotel the entire day AFTER we'd checked out.  So when we were done with our day at Disney we simply walked back to our car and took off.  The place has clearly been remodeled.  Our room was clean, and the beds were very very comfortable.  Breakfast was the standard fare, but

For sure the best deal for Disney visitors. Great modern rooms with all ameneties including a kitchen. A tasty ice cream shop and a nice breakfast. Location allowed us to rest in the middle of the day and rush back for the disney parade and world of colors at the california adventure.  at the

I stayed here for the first time October 14-16th 2014 for my birthday and had a great stay.  I had done my research on tripadvisor and wanted somewhere REALLY close to Disney because my mom has bad feet.  After looking, Park Vue rated well overall, had a Continental breakfast, and was literally RIGHT across the street from the park.    My experience overall was great.  The staff was very accommodating, they let us park our car early (since we arrived in the morning well before check in) while we went to the park and let us check in later.  When we got back, the staff was friendly and easy check in.  The room was clean, remodeled, and comfortable.  Bed was nice and the Jacuzzi tub (we paid extra for the room with the big tub, WELL worth the extra money since our feet hurt SOO bad

This is a great place to stay. The washing machine and drier only cost $1 per load.  The location is fantastic. You can see the fireworks from the balcony. We watched them from our room. The pool is a little deep so bring floaties for your kids. The vending machine offers great snacks at good prices.  You can walk to Disneyland. The rooms are clean. The included breakfast is good too. Fresh fruit, cereal, waffles, eggs, bacon.  This place is value for money and the service is fantastic.

We stayed here for four nights and the experience was great!! Free Parking, free WiFi,and andood complimentary breakfast. Hotel is closeto Disneyland,  great location for families with young children who need to nap during the day! I will definitely be staying here again.

We are frequent visitors to Disneyland. We have stayed in off and on site hotels. Park Vue Inn is definitively one of the tops. It is very close. Free parking and breakfast. The rooms have been updated and clean. The staff have been very nice.  The location allowed us come back to the rooms in the middle of the day to take naps when the park is crowed.  We were worried about the noise level being so close to the street and to the entrance. Not a problem. Of course you will occasionally hear kids running around.  Free Wifi - it was fast too.

Very nice older motel that has been nicely remodeled and updated. Renovations,were,ongoing while we were there, but no problem at all. Very nice hot breakfast upstairs with outdoor seating available on the patio. Disneyland entrance is right across the street. Free parking at the hotel for guests. We really enjoyed our stay.

Summary Heading: Perfect location and hotel for Disneyland...
Summary: I stayed there with my family at the end of August for 4 nights. The location is literally perfect for Disney. Both parks are directly across the street from the hotel. You walk out, walk to the light and cross the street and you are there. Period. And yet, it is quiet as the hotel is back from the street. The rooms are immaculate. Newly renovated or made, clean, all of the little things you wouldn't think of. Delicious continental breakfast. A private pool area to relax after a long day at the parks. And it is close to other areas as well. Knotts Berry Farm was a 7 minute drive. It was truly the best hotel we could think of for the area and it was very reasonable priced. We took two adjoining rooms and were extremely happy with our stay and would stay there again. The service

Stayed here for one night while on a trip to Disneyland. We got a newly renovated room, #235 up stairs in the back of the hotel. It was clean and quiet. The beds were firm and comfortable. The soaps and lotion were awesome! We didn't try the breakfast or pool. This hotel is super close to the main entrance of the parks. I will definitely be coming back!!

Location, location, location...it doesn't get any closer to Disneyland than Park Vue! Plus they offer a great continental breakfast, free parking, and great places to eat and snack on either side of them (IHOP and Cold Stone). My kids also LOVED having a bunk bed in our room. This is a perfect place for families to stay when visiting Disneyland. Look no further.

Great service, clean comfortable beds, great location.  Free breakfast, free wifi and free parking.  The best hotel across the street from Disneyland.  Very nice place to stay, we will definitely be back.

Summary Heading: Look No Further, this is your place!
Summary: Family of 4 stayed for first time Sept 20-27. Overall, excellent stay! We will definitely stay again. Here is list of Pros/Cons and the Pros outweigh the cons big time!!  * RIGHT ACROSS STREET FROM DISNEY PARKS. You really can't be closer unless you spend $400+ to stay at the Grand Californian (which we visited by the way while here. I was not impressed, people standing in long lines and the place is dark & ugly, not what I think of when I picture California). I would hear the Disneyland train whistle while sitting at Park Vue's pool. When you are exhausted at the end of a park day you will appreciate being so close, believe me!  * Staff. All staff friendly, professional & knowledgeable.   * Internet ; Free and worked great, no probs here  * Parking, we flew in and were on foot

We loved our stay in a newly refurbished room. There is nothing that we did not like about this hotel and it seems to attract alot of Australians so we felt right at home. Breakfast was sufficient, the on site store is reasonable and we would absolutely stay at this hotel again.

Stayed here for 3 days while visiting Disneyland. Hotel is located across the street from the front gates, only about a 5 min walk. So location is a +, Parking is free which is a + , complimentary breakfast was also a + (egg, toast, waffles, bacon, yogurt, cereal ect.) only a few negatives, walls are paper thin so if you are on the bottom floor you can hear the guests on top of you walking or moving things -, also my boyfriend left his phone is the gym and went back about 10 min later and the guest on the treadmill said she had turned it into the front desk, when we went to the front desk they said they hadn't received anything, but when I used find my iPhone to play a sound it beeped behind their desk. So all in all for the price and location you can't beat it.

We make our trip for Christmas last year and had a great time. And I am now planning another trip and we are going to stay here again. Very clean rooms very nice staff and a pretty good breakfast. Best this is it's location just a short walk to the main gate. No long walk woo hoo...

Summary Heading: Excellent choice for a Disneyland visit
Summary: Wow. what a pleasant surprise this place was. It is across the road from the main entrance to Disney and the rooms are spacious, very clean and the beds are comfortable. I loved the free wifi and free, easily accessible parking. I didn't notice any noise from other rooms or traffic and had a magnificent week long stay. To top it all off the breakfast is very good with a reasonable selection of food and the pool and spa are a great way to end a long day on your feet at Disney or elsewhere. I will definitely stay here again.

Not only is park vue inn great on location, they also excel in outstanding customer service.  We spent one night on sept 20th, and my son forgot his cell phone under his pillow.  We were on our way to a 4-day cruise, and called them right when we were leaving port on Sunday.  Spoke to gentleman at front counter, not only did they find it, but held it until we came back on Thursday!  Warm cookies in the afternoon, free breakfast, and at least 1/2 the price of disney's hotels, this gem of a hotel gets my 5 stars!

I drive to Disneyland every few month and this is the only hotel I stay in. The location is right across the street from the gates of Disneyland and the parking is included with your reservation. If you are traveling with children, this location is the perfect spot. Its a short walk to the park so you don't have to deal with a long walk back to your room. They has recently renovated the rooms and they are great!  The last time I went here, I had mentioned that it was going to be my nephews birthdays. They took the time to leave a little goodie bag for our stay. They really appreciated it.   The complimentary breakfast is also a plus, it simply makes the morning much easier when you are traveling with family or friends.

Summary Heading: A good hotel directly across Disneyland
Summary: The hotel does not only live from the location next to Disneyland - it really is worth the money. The room (we had no 135) was very quiet - but this depence for a good part on the neighbors (above and door-to-door). The room was clean an spacious and the hotel offers free parking (nota bene directly across Disneyland), free WIFI and breakfast. From the hotel you can easy walk to Disneyland and in the evenings (even without entrance fee) you can go and enjoy the park surroundings. Nice place to be!

We had 2 rooms at the Park Vue Inn on September 8-12.   First the good things ; great staff quick and responsive, clean rooms, across the street from Disney,good breakfast,and free parking!   The only draw back to me is that is a loud hotel people do not pay attention to please keep the noise down signs. The walls seemed thin cause you could hear parents trying to put their children to bed and lots of crying.    But earplugs would take care of noise issue. I would definitely come back if I had earplugs !

This was our 3rd year at Disney and our first time at the park Vue. I mean this is right outside the door to Disney. Free parking, Free Wifi (lighting fast, i clocked 46mbs). Staff were great. Rooms were a great size. If we go back to Disney this year, I know where we are staying.

I was very happy staying across the street from Disneyland to walk back and cool off in the room mid-day and grab ice cream at Coldstone. 2 queen bed room was big enough for our family of 5. Nice remodeled room but beds were squeaky. Large fridge and microwave were nice to have, pool was clean and towels were restocked quickly when we asked for some, breakfast has a decent selection but could use fresh fruit and real eggs, plenty of room in the breakfast area for all guests to sit, appreciated early check in...great stay!

My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland. It's  directly across the street from the Disneyland entrance. The room was clean and breakfast was more than adequate. The selection consisted of scrambled and hard boiled eggs, waffles, toast/muffins, cereal, fruit & yoghurt.  We stayed on the 2nd level as I had noticed some reviews said this was a bit quieter.   My only complaints were I still found it noisy as you can hear people walking past your rooms as they head to breakfast. Maybe it's less noisy than the bottom level but I can't say for sure . Also the water pressure isn't the greatest in the shower. On the plus side, they do have a microwave in the room which is nice if you have brought leftovers back to the room and need to reheat them.  Denny's is

We spent 9 days at this hotel (11 people in all).  It is a comfortable, clean, reasonably priced hotel...just outside the gates of Disney Land.    PROS: - Location, Location, Location!!!!  We would go back to hotel early afternoon for a swim and then head back to park -STAFF is fantastic.  Incredibly friendly and helpful -Room with Kitchen is relatively well stocked (e.g., pots and pans). -Pool is relatively small but the kids LOVED it because it is quite deep (9ft at deep end). -Breakfast included.  Reasonable variety....waffles, eggs, cereal, bacon, sausage, yogurt. etc.. -DECK area at front of hotel.  We would go there nightly and could see the fireworks  We would go back !  CON:  -Not many..it is a basic hotel so don't expect fancy. -Rooms are on the smaller size but

Summary Heading: As Close To The Park As You Can Get
Summary: We stayed here as every other Disney hotel was full.  We've stayed at the Grand Californian before -- and with the price of this place at just 1/3 (or more) of the Grand Californian, our expectations were low.  However, this place was worth far more than the nightly rate.  It's the closest hotel to the Park....and I think it is even closer to Disney (not Cali Adventure) than the Grand Cali.  Definitely closer than the other Disney hotels.  The rooms are small, but clean.  And, they were renovated enough so that the place felt nice.  The breakfast was great and just what you needed to get in/out.  I think we paid $110/night and the rooms, distance to park and breakfast far exceeded the nightly rate.  Don't expect the Four Seasons...you get what you pay for and this exceeded those

We just stayed here Saturday for our trip to Disneyland. I had read excellent reviews and not so excellent reviews about this hotel on TripAdvisor.com.  I was excited about the location and wanted to try it with my hubby and I because we are taking our kids and their friends after New Years.  We have stayed at the Paradise Pier and Grand Californian, and let me tell you something, the price is awesome and it was much closer than the Paradise Pier. I'm not paying hundreds of dollars more just for an entrance to the park.  It was literally two minutes to the Disneyland entrance from our room.  The rooms were very clean, bed was comfy.  Trust me, after a day at Disneyland as soon as my head hit the pillow I was out.  The free breakfast was delicious. I don't know why there are

I booked this motel based on tripadvisor reviews and close location to Disneyland. This property is clean and the rooms recently renovated. Our room had two queen beds with good quality bedding and firm mattresses. The bathroom tile and flooring looked brand new.  Our refrigerator was a good size.  Based on previous reviews, we requested a second floor room and it was very quiet.  Parking was very convenient and free! Overall a very good experience.

This was a last minute trip with my son. I wanted to be able to walk across the street from Disneyland, so Park Vue was one of the closest. The price left plenty of budget to eat, drink and have fun, along with a few souveniers. The breakfast was impressive--a buffet with a waffel maker, biscuits and gravy, yogurt, fresh, fruit, bagels, cereal, juice and coffee. It was nice to be able to eat upstairs on the balcony outside the dining area. I was told you can watch the fireworks from there, however, we stayed in the park until closing each night. The room was updated and the beds were a little on the hard side but still comfortable. The bathroom was large and the refrigerator came in handy for leftovers and to keep cold drinks. Staff was friendly and kept our luggage when we

This is my second stay @ this location & no you can't beat the location! it's right in front of the cross walk to go into Disneyland. The price is very reasonable, rooms are nice they have been remodeled. the breakfast is pretty good, just as good as a Marriot, that I recently stayed at. I have recommended this to others. I've stayed at the Best Western, next to it & this is just as nice. Parking is free here too.

This is my second stay since you can't beat the location! Location, location, location; it's right across the street within a better walking distance than Disneyland Hotel & Paradise Pier. Free wifi & free parking & one of the better continental breakfasts. Other places charge for parking or additional breakfast items which I find ridiculous. My room this time was renovated & done very nicely. I was impressed with the new carpet & floors & granite tops, fixtures ect...front desk was helpful & friendly. Can't wait to go again. Stayed 7 days

Summary Heading: Can't get more convenient to Disney! Nice rooms & perks
Summary: Perfect choice! I spent a lot of time researching hotels for our 2 day stop at Disney. I was so happy with our choice. I've stayed on grounds at Disneyland before, but for the price, quality, and convenience the Park Vue was just as good.  Highlights: - right across from the pedestrian entrance to the Disney complex - recently renovated rooms are nice w/ comfy beds - parking included - mentioned at booking that we were celebrating my sister's birthday. After checking in, they dropped off a Park Vue coffee mug filled w/ candy and a certificate for a small Coldstone cake (Coldstone is located just off the lobby). It was an awesome surprise for my little sis!  - included breakfast is great to grab a bite before hitting the parks - super convenient to take a break when the parks get

The rooms were decently upgraded & clean.  Breakfast was surprisingly ample.  So nice to have ready for you before walking over to Disneyland!  Staff was always professional.  We were on the 1st floor & I heard footsteps one morning, but the noise wasn't excessive at all.  Would recommend this motel as a good low cost choice.  It's typical construction for the location (not a charming appearance) but that's not what I needed for my vacation.

Summary Heading: Very Happy, so close to the parks!
Summary: We were so happy staying in this hotel as part of our honeymoon. It was literally a 2 minute walk to the Disneyland gate, and the room was nice and clean. We weren't in the room much because we spent most of our time in the parks, but the free parking and breakfast were awesome. The free breakfast included waffles, eggs, etc. We were more than pleased with our stay and giving us such a great location to the parks during our honeymoon.

Summary Heading: Excellent Update, Close to the Park!
Summary: BEST hotel location for visiting Disney!  Right across the street!  Rooms are beautifully updated, staff was super accommodating, in room safe, microwave, and small fridge.  FREE parking (they will allow you to park there until midnight after you check out-just let them know you will be in the park for the day after you check out), FREE Wi-Fi, FREE continental HOT breakfast!  This last was heaven for me with the gluten allergy I have.  They had turkey sausage, eggs, and potatoes so I could actually eat and not have to bring my own food!  There is a Denny's and an Ihop next door if you want restaurant food.  After a day in the park, we always came back to a clean room.  We had stayed here years ago before their remodel and liked it then, but this update was beyond what I was

Have stayed in others in the area and this one is directly across the street light to cross into Disney. Nice newer remodeled spacious room with 2 beds and a mini fridge and microwave. Desk. Bathroom with tub. FREE parking and breakfast included waffles and the usual eggs, sausage, potatoes. Their wheat bread slices were fresh daily and very good taste. Could see fireworks from Disney nightly from our window. AC is in the back of the room so less noisy. Would always stay here again and recommend to anyone going to Disney. And the beds were comfy.

Summary Heading: Best location for Disneyland and FREE parking!
Summary: Great 2 night stay on our family trip to Disneyland.  I chose this hotel because of its location and great reviews.  It did not disappoint.  You can literally walk to Disneyland, which is right across the street.  No need to take the car and pay to park.  It's an older style motel, but the rooms have been renovated and are very comfortable and clean.  They also have a fridge and microwave.  We got a great rate with AAA discount also.  Breakfast was a full hot breakfast and the hot items were different each day. Eggs, sausage, bacon, biscuits and gravy, waffles, hash browns and the usual assorted cereals, muffins and yogurts. You can sit on the 2nd floor patio and watch the fireworks from Disneyland at night. My daughter loved having a Cold Stone Creamery in the hotel, and they

Best hotel location if you are visiting Disneyland! The Free continental breakfast wasnt too bad either. The walk to Disneyland takes about  5-7 minutes, which was awesome because half way through the day we were able to take the kids back to the hotel, let them swim,  take a nap for an hour or so nd then go back! The parking is free, 1 car per room. The parking area is a little tight, but is not a big deal. The only thing I did not like is that the workers came into my room while I was gone to take out the trash and fill any condiments such as coffee, cups etc.. this was my first time in a hotel and did not expect that. Now I know to next time, put the Do Not Disturb sign up before I leave. Other than that I enjoyed my stay and will definitely return when I go back to

Summary Heading: best place to stay at Disneyland
Summary: Third stay at this hotel (definitely not the last) and love it every time.  They are constantly upgrading the rooms and the rooms are spotless, the beds comfortable and the pillows divine.  The breakfast is great and no matter what time we came, we had seating and lots to eat.  The parking is free which is great as most other hotels charge.  The staff was friendly and pleasant to deal with especially the kitchen staff.  A absolutely great place to stay.

We stayed here for 7 days for our recent trip to Disneyland and we loved it! The breakfast was awesome I loved the biscuits and gravy and the potatoes were GREAT!! I didn't have much interaction with the staff but what I did they were nice and helpful, the cold stone creamery in front was Awesome they sing a little song if you leave a tip and the lady who made our snacks did some cool little tricks with our ice cream, we had a queen with a bunk bed which the kids loved, the air conditioner was behind the bunk bed and didn't really feel like it put a lot of air out so I was worried about getting hot in the night but it was never a problem, room was very neat and clean and one day when it was serviced they made a puppy out of towels my kids loved that, and you can't beat the

The hotel is literally accross the road from disneyland. During our day at the park we were able to come back to the hotel and rest before going back for the night. Rooms are ok- typical motel style. Breakfast is simple but it is enough to get you through the morning- waffles, cereal, toast, pastries etc. Staff were ok too- just average, no bad experiences but nothing overly positive either. Best part is location. Will stay here again

Summary Heading: A Great Location for Family Stay
Summary: I was more than happy with the one night I stayed at the Park Vue Inn with my family.  Perfect location for mid-day rest and pool break and to get to sleep immediately after leaving Disneyland after a long day.  Literally a walk across a crosswalk to the Disneyland gate.  The complimentary parking is a HUGE Plus.  Great breakfast with choices galore, and a nice veranda to sit outside, and enjoy the California sun prior to starting the day.  I will definitely stay at this hotel again if I am in the area.  I love to be able to support a local business as well.   As an added benefit, one of my family members forgot an item by the pool.  In many places, I'm not sure it would have been recovered.  I called the next day, and the item was found, and will be returned to me.  Customer

Directly across the street from the Disnyland Gates on Harbor Blvd.  Even closer than Disney parking with no extra charge.  They even let us leave our car there all day after checkout. Nice clean room with a bunk bed for the kids.  The breakfast was adequate with a limited selection.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  It would have been nice to have the TV mounted so that it could be seen from the bunk beds as well as the queen. If we ever go back to Disneyland we would definitely consider staying here again.

From the first day to the last day we stayed the Park vue it was just great!  The management, maintenance and cleaning staff were great, so helpful.  The rooms are clean and re modeled.  We had a 3 queen suite, great amount of room nicely done.  As everyone says 5 minutes to Disney.  Breakfast always hot and lots of it.  Great pool and hot tub to chill out after a day at the park.  We will definatly come back.

This was our second stay at Park Vue Inn and absolutely loved it.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  My family enjoyed the breakfast especially the waffles every morning.  Location you can't beat it - right across the entry to Disneyland. We arrived early in the morning so our room wasn't ready but the hotel held our luggage so we could go to the park.  My kids loved the bunk beds.  The laundry room was adequate and clean.  The rooms were clean.  We were completely satisfied.  We stayed at three other hotels while traveling in California and Park Vue was the best.

I had written an earlier review that I was disappointed with the fact we had left something and upon calling several times were told it couldn't be found. I am revising my previous review and am very pleased with the managers efforts to locate our lost item. The manager went above and beyond to look into and solve the issue. This makes me so much more confident in knowing this is a great place all around. My son loves the bunk beds in the room and we love the closeness to Disneyland. Far closer than staying at any Disney hotels. I would gladly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Disneyland.

Reasonable prices, short walk to the entrance of Disneyland. The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. They provide a free breakfast, free parking and free WiFi.I requested and rec'd a first floor room. All this was a great experience and we will return again!

We stayed here for 3 nights when we first arrived in the US.  I booked it for its close proximity to Disneyland - and geez were we impressed.  The room was sufficient and the kids were happy to have their own beds with the bunk beds.  Breakfast was ample to get you going for the day and we loved that it was so close to restaurants and we even had ice cream from the front shop.  I would recommend staying here to anyone with kids and wanting to go to Disneyland.  You could hear the fireworks from there as well.  Thank you so much for a wonderful stay.

Summary Heading: Perfect location for a short stay
Summary: We had a room on the second floor with a queen and bunk beds for the kids.  Very happy with my choice staying here.  Price was reasonable, plenty of places to eat right next door and a very short walk to Disneyland entrance.  The room was clean, breakfast was good enough to get you going for the day, and we watched the fireworks from the hotel when we were too tired to still be in Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Really wanted it to be better than it was...
Summary: I am going to add a prefix to this and say that I really wish that I could give this place a better review than I am about to. Believe me, it would be worse if it were not for the location and the attempts to make the situation better by giving us some discounts.  This story is not short, but it contains some things to think about. So when we arrived we were treated to cookies and lemonade at the front desk. The staff was very nice and they explained everything that I needed to know. We headed to our room 244 and it seemed pretty good. The room was clean and cool. My wife went ahead and unpacked as she does on vacation. Then I used the washroom and discovered that the sink drain was leaking. We called the front desk and they sent the maintenance guy over right away. The guy was
Manager Response: Dear MJW,   I would like to extend a sincere apology for the inconvenience you experienced during your stay. Although your review tells a different version of events from what the front desk reported, I assure you that the details of your complaints have been addressed with my entire staff. We strive to provide great guest experiences and we hope you will consider giving us another opportunity to be of better service on your next trip to Disneyland.

Summary: We stayed in a family room with a kitchen. It had two rooms, one had two queen beds, the other had a fold out couch and kitchen. The property was a bit dated but everything worked and it was clean. There was a free buffet breakfast every morning which the kids enjoyed. The staff were all nice. The room was one floor up so it was a little hard to drag our bags up - ask for a ground floor room if this is a problem. The best feature is the location. It is directly opposite the cross walk to the Disneyland pathway / gate which is fabulous for those with little kids who need to return in the middle of the days for naps etc. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Better Location than the Disneyland Hotel!
Summary: This inn is directly across the street from the entrance to Disneyland.  You can't get a better location!  Is it as fancy as the Disney properties?  Of course not, so it depends on what is important to you.  The beds are really comfortable, and the free breakfast is fine.  The price, however, which includes free parking, is great.  We priced the Disney properties and they were hundreds of dollars more.  Since we were seldom in the room, we didn't think it was worth spending the extra money.  Make sure to book early because the inn fills up fast.  People were there trying to get a room but it was completely booked.  Also, make sure to book directly with the inn.  Other websites ask you to pay ahead of time but the inn only asks for your card to hold the room and you can cancel if

My daughter and I found the location of the property to be ideal. Literally a cross-walk away from the entrance to Disneyland! No hassles with shuttles or parking. The property itself was clean and well kept, and we especially enjoyed the Cold Stone Creamery after a day at the amusement park. The thing we appreciated the most, however, were the professional and friendly staff. We were impressed that the staff at the desk was bilingual, and the managers Brian and Melissa went out of their way to make us feel welcome, almost like a member of the family! For anyone travelling to Disneyland or the Anaheim area, we would totally recommend Park Vue.

My wife and I, along with our two boys ( 6yrs and 1 1/2 ) stayed here for two nights in late June early July. Initially we felt the price was a little out of our range for our Disneyland trip, but we eventually decided to stay here because the location seemed too good to pass up. So we went ahead and gave this location a shot. It was EXACTLY what we were looking for as far as location, comfort and overall enjoyment.   We stayed on the upper level and we had a really nice view of the Disneyland fireworks. Although we didn't have breakfast at our hotel during our stay, the breakfast balcony was very nice and would also provide a nice viewing spot for fireworks. It was also a good area for us to kill time before check-in. Downstairs towards the entrance, was a little gift shop that

We are a family of 6 and find it tough to find affordable and comfortable hotel accommodation. We took a leap of faith on this property as we have never been to Disneyland before and we were so glad we did.  We had a suite room which was very comfortable and fitted us all in nicely for the 12 nights we were there. The kids used the pool and they loved it.   The room we were in wasn't redecorated but it was still clean and the decor although dated was fine.   My whole family has agreed that the beds are 'awesome' probably the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in.  The highlight is its proximity to Disneyland, so close literally a 5 minute walk and your through the gates in the park. It was so good at the end of a long day with young kids to walk 5 minutes and be  in your

The staff was awesome.  Traces me and family very well.  The pool was nice and really the really the self laundry on site was a saver.  Their air conditioning works great too.  Location is obviously the best.

This was my family's second time staying at the park vue inn and it was better then the first. The rooms are comfortable and clean the front desk staff was always helpful they held our luggage after we checked out and recommended  a few places to shop while we waited for our shuttle we will definitely be coming back.

Stayed at this property 3 nights over July 4th. Very well cared for. Ownership knows what they are doing. Room renovation was very well done. Beds were very comfy and towels were brand new. Rooms were very clean. Location cannot be beat. Very short walk to Disneyland.  Breakfast was great for included breakfast. Waffles, eggs, bacon, and potatoes all well presented and fresh.  Thanks for the great stay!  Will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Seriously - one of the best hotels near Disneyland
Summary: My husband is what I lovingly call a hotel snob.  He has to have interior corridors and a slew of other amenities that are impossible to find near Disneyland.  We've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel on the concierge level and he was pleased with that, but for the most part we end up several miles away from the park in order to stay at a hotel he'll approve.  This trip I put my foot down and insisted on trying Park Vue....  .....AND HE LOVED IT!!! :)  I don't know what more I need to say other than it was perfect.  Great location, amazing service, nice rooms, great shower, comfy bed, and a fridge to boot!  We have a new home when we visit Disneyland.  If you're thinking about it, just book that room.  I bet they exceed your expectations!

Very pleased especially with the proximity of this hotel.  Can't beat it.  Maybe because we had just come from a recently renovated Staybridge Suites in San Francisco, we thought the kitchenette area was in need of updating, especially the cabinets.  No other complaints.  Maintenance and housekeeping very attentive.  Had a minor issue with the cable on our TV not working and maintenance guy was right on it and quickly had our problem fixed.  Also had a plugged up toilet, and he quickly fixed that too!  Breakfast was more than adequate.  They had 3 diff hot selections each morning (eggs, hash browns, bacon usually).  I didn't eat it, but my very picky son said it was great!  They also had the usual cold selections: cereal, bread for toast, muffins, bagels on one morning.  I think

Checking in was super fast. Can't beat the location to Disneyland! We were able to come back to the hotel in the afternoon for a nice break. Room was very clean and always had fresh towels. Free breakfast isn't spectacular, but definitely enough to fill you up so you don't have to have to eat a breakfast at Disneyland. I was afraid that the free breakfast was going to be too crowded, but it wasn't bad at all. There is a nice little gift shop onsite as well. Provides all you need in a hotel since most of the time you are never in your room. Will definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Across the street from Disneyland and less expensive
Summary: Cross the street at the traffic light and you are at Disney!  The rooms have been refurbished this year.  Each room has a small frig, microwave, and regular 4-cup coffee pot. No-cost parking is close to the rooms, and each room has an outdoor entrance.  The hotel was very quiet; the management has posted several signs telling you to be quiet.  A full breakfast is provided, and you eat on an outdoor rooftop balcony or inside.  You can also watch the Disney fireworks from this balcony.  The staff was very helpful and courteous.  They have some connecting rooms. I called ahead 3 days to tell them I wouldn't be arriving until 1 AM and that I wanted a connecting room with a family that was checking in a day later than I was.  It was no problem and the man who checked us in at 2 AM

We stayed 4 nights at this hotel and I would stay again. The location is fantastic. The only closer hotel to the main entrance is The Grand.  THE ROOMS: Clean. Beds were comfortable. Flat screen tv with clear reception. Sink separate from bathroom which is very nice when getting ready in the morning. Lots of room around the perimeter. The only area of improvement for the rooms is they need to be brightened up. There were a few small holes in the walls where it looked like something used to be there but was removed. Nothing major, but noticeable. The paint could be touched up as well. However, there was not one speck of dust or dirt, which I think is most important. Give me some nail  holes anytime as long as my room is clean. Our room was actually spotless.  COMPLIMENTARY

My husband and I stayed there twice, and we absolutely love the place. We haven't tried staying in a Disney hotel yet, but we stayed at two other hotels in the area. It's absolutely worth it paying extra to get a hotel across the street from Disneyland. We stayed at hotels further away, and it was a pain walking back there after a long day at Disneyland. Park Vue Inn is right across the street from Disneyland, and walking back for the afternoon nap is no problem at all. We also liked the breakfast. It had a wide variety of items: different breads, bacon, sausages, potatoes, oat meal, cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, waffles. We highly recommend the hotel.

Summary Heading: great place so close to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here June 21st thru 24th.  Great location for sure, we actually left the park a couple times during the day to go eat and change shoes, and it took 5 minutes to get to hotel from gates of Disneyland.  People here very nice and very quiet at nite, except for the 1/2 hour of fireworks.  :) It will be awhile before we ever go back, gotta save up again to have the $$$ for disneyland, but when we do this place is the place we will stay.  Breakfast was very good too, only had to buy one big meal a day because of the size of the breakfast they gave us.  Thank you for the freebe, those are very rare anymore.  You wont be sorry if you book this hotel.  :)

Our family just returned from a great stay at the Park Vue. It was our 2nd time staying there and the first since they remodeled the rooms. The rooms are nice and very clean. They have a modern look to them and can comfortably fit a family of 4. Parking lot is decent size and never had a problem finding a space.  The front desk people are super friendly and polite. Check-in was a breeze and they even offer free cookies and juice in the lobby which were refreshing after a long drive. As others have said, the location can't be beat! It is right across the street from the Disneyland entrance and close enough so that our boys could come back to take a nap each day. We could see the fireworks from our balcony on the 2nd floor each night which was an unexpected perk.  The

This hotel is right across Disneyland. Should be great for families with kids/toddlers. Breakfast spread was good. We stayed in a room with Jacuzzi. Loved it after a long day at Disney. There is a iHop in same premises. All in all a perfect stay and would love to visit again.

First and foremost, the location of this hotel can't be beat. It's such a nice change from Disney World where you have to take buses everywhere. Here you can hop across the street and you're there.   This was the only hotel I could find in walking distance that offered free breakfast, wifi, and parking. All of the other hotels only had 1-2 of those items for free. The rooms were remodeled and the decor was very nice.  A couple of gripes:   The sheets were not changed the entire time we stayed there (6 days). They just made the beds. They also never replaced the items we used like shampoo, soap, and makeup wipes. There is also a nice little sign that says they will charge you if any towels are missing.   The breakfast could use some improvement and more variety. Muffins and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write and share this review. I am happy you chose to stay at the Park Vue Inn. However, I was disappointed to read that you found our breakfast to be mediocre. Most of our guests rave about our breakfast. I will look into the suggested improvements you mentioned. As far as your room service, all guest rooms are serviced daily unless there is a do not disturb sign posted or the guest specifically requests limited or no service. Linens, towels and amenities are replenished daily. Please know that we strive to provide excellent service and our goal is to exceed the expectations of our guests. We hope you consider the Park Vue Inn again in the future and we look forward to the opportunity to be of better service on your next trip.

Summary Heading: Perfect location. Easy parking. Nice rooms.
Summary: When we do Disney on the cheap, we usually stay at one of the nearby best westerns, but they were booked.  Park Vue Inn is a little more, but we were happy to get a room and the location and clean newly upgraded rooms exceeded our expectations.  We also arrived very early the day of our first night and it was no problem to get pre-checked in (no room yet) and get a parking pass.  The included breakfast is also a bit better than we expected with some slight daily changes for the main meal.  We will probably be choosing this place first on our next visit,

Wow!  The location is second to none being right across the street from the Disneyland entrance.  Our room had just been freshly renovated and we were very impressed.  Very clean, updated and included a fridge and microwave in our double queen room.  Staff were friendly and the amount of shops, food and of course proximity to Disneyland was great.  With the hotel being so close, we loved being able to come back and take a break in the afternoon.  We were surprised by how great the hotel was given the reasonable prices for the room and stay.     Parking and Internet was included, as was a breakfast in the morning.  The breakfast was a nice perk and the ladies that ran the breakfast did a fantastic job each day.  Didn’t use the pool, but saw it.  Not huge, but certainly big enough

If you're coming to Anaheim to visit Disneyland on multiple days, chances are most of your day will be spent at the theme parks and very little time at your hotel. The Park Vue is not the most luxurious hotel in Anaheim, but it is easily the best value. As the Park Vue Inn is just across the road from the Disney resort, it's only a short stroll to the entrance for either DCA or DL. No need for a shuttle bus to and from. There's nothing better than heading home after a long day at DL to a cool, clean, well made up room and free wifi (how did we ever live without it!). Except maybe having breakfast ready to go in the morning, saving us the time and effort of finding somewhere to order and eat. Breakfast was nothing fancy but there was something to keep everyone in the family happy

Very nice remodel of a 60's era hotel. Rooms and Lobby completely remodeled, grounds clean as well as the pool area. Parking is kinda odd, posted everywhere no parking here, cafe only! But both places are related and parking was fine.  Front Desk Gal issues you a parking pass to display on the car. Ice Cream creamery at front of hotel and Dennys and IHOP on left and right sides, DLand accross the street. Who could ask for more.?  Rooms and everything in them were perfect, super clean as well.  Only negative was (and nothing to do with the hotel) people who program their cars horn to sound when locking and unlocking the car. What a selfish and arrogant act. What kind of person does this in this environment, or any for that matter. Honk, Beep, Honk each morning and evening...

We were here 18 months ago. This time we only stayed one day as we only had one day to spend at Disneyland. We (two adults, two kids ages 6 and 9) arrived late Thursday night (try 1:30 in the morning!). The front desk staff was readily available and smiling and in a good mood for 1:30 am! He informed me that their property had actually been remodeled since I was last there. New carpet, new furniture, new tile floor in the bathroom, new paint, new sink countertop, new shower tiling, new shower and sink fixtures. I could still smell the newness. If super quietness is important to you, you should know that heavy walking or running feet can be heard through the ceiling if you're on the first floor (only two floors) and loud laughing might make its way through the walls. Those sounds

This was our second stay at the Park Vue Inn. Needless to say we favour this hotel. Why, well...... 1. It's proximity to both Disney Parks is definitely it's biggest bonus because at the Parks, we tend to be on our feet most of the time, except whilst waiting for the parades or fireworks but sometimes even then one is standing. The Park Vue Inn is built into the block so the distance from your hotel room to reception could be is quite a distance (guess 200-300m), so if you have little ones, asking for a room closer to the front of the hotel is advisable. We tend to like rooms to the back of the hotel and upstairs because these rooms are quieter. There is a laundry there too. We tended to pop into Reception on our way to the park, pick up some fresh water and and apple and on the

We took a gamble with this hotel and we really enjoyed it. the rooms were nice, The employees were also very kind. The breakfast was ok. It was so close and easy to Disneyland. The price was cheaper then a carper hotel down the road. The only complaint was that you can hear kids screaming and running up and down the walkways. and tree trimmers in the early early morning. Other than that, It was great!

My two young boys and I did a 3 day/2 night trip to Disneyland over Memorial Day weekend. When we arrived at 9am we were greater with a smile. They held our bags in a locked room so we could be off to Disneyland. When we returned at 3:30 for a nap our room was ready. They had moved all our bags into our room for us. This was so very appreciated!       We had a double queen room near the stairs on the first floor. We rarely heard any noise while we were in the room. The room was newly renovated and quite clean. The beds were very comfortable. The carpets passed the white sock test. The curtains blocked out the sun nicely.  The wood look tile in the entry and bath area looked nice. It could be a little rough on bare, tired feet. The room was very spacious. There was plenty of room

This hotel is all about location. A 5 minute walk to the front gate of Disneyland. But the issue I had with this place was the front counter help and the no early check-in. Check in is listed @ 3:00 pm. I arrived from the airport at 2:00. They greeted me, took all of my information. Charged my credit card. The whole time i'm thinking my room must be ready. They are checking me in. The next line out of the ladies mouth is "unfortunately your room is not ready. Please check back at 3:00" I find a place to eat since i'm not going to Disneyland leave and come back to check-in. I arrive back at 2:45 and wait the 15 minutes till 3:00. Still no check-in. (Room not ready) Since the employees don't stay at the front desk. (There must be a room in the back they hang out in). You really
Manager Response: Please accept my sincere apology for the inconvenience you experienced at check in. The circumstances that caused the delay would only sound like an excuse, so I'll save the explanation. I have addressed this situation with my staff to ensure this won't be repeated. I know that you said you won't stay with us again; however, should you have a change of heart, we would greatly appreciate the chance to be of better service.

Summary Heading: Just wonderful!!! Great for large families!
Summary: From the moment we booked with the hotel's friendly staff, till the moment we checked out it was wonderful. Staff courteous, friendly and professional. Clean room. Terrific breakfast. Directly accross the street from the entrance to the parks. We stayed parents and 5 children in the double queen and bunkbed room.  We told them ahead of time we would be 7 and they were fine with that because larger suite was taken. Would only add that it would be nice if the bathroom was a little more updated and if there was a table and some chairs to have a family meal in the room. Otherwise, perfect and would definitely book here again Pool was also great!

This was our second time we stayed at Park Vue this year. First time was in January 2014. We asked for a room on the second floor, because the rooms on first floor can get noisy from all the kids (quite understandably) running/jumping/doing what kids do on the second floor. Not a big deal, but can make all the difference for someone trying to catch an early sleep, or with a younger child. Anyway, the front desk accommodated, but we had to put the request in a couple of months in advance (my personal choice, maybe you don't HAVE to do it THAT much in advance :)). So the room was quiet. And clean! Unlike the last time. They're almost done with renovating the place, and it looks really clean and nice, and (not unreasonably, new). I really do hope it stays that way! We will keep
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Park Vue Inn again. My staff was thrilled that your new review showed improvement from your last review, and that we are now your go to hotel when visiting Anaheim. We truly appreciate your business, and we look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: My recent stay at the Park Vue Inn was the same as all previous:  comfortable, affordable, and convenient.  I visit frequently and used to stay at several different "good neighbor" hotels close to Disneyland, but once I found this one I quit switching.  Accommodations are clean and neatly appointed, staff is friendly and helpful.  I have no complaints.  Currently undergoing renovation which makes several rooms unavailable, so make your reservation well in advance.

We have stayed in 4 different hotels within walking distance to Disneyland.  This last one, Park Vue, was the best overall value.  Because we were bringing a toddler and preschooler with us, we desired the flexibility of close location for naps and breaks, and a complete breakfast.  This place delivered and then some.  It is literally the closest hotel to the main gate.  Once you walk past the bus pick-up zone and cross Harbor Blvd,  you are there.  I am a grandmother, but I was able to return to the room and back to Paradise Pier in 15 minutes, including the time it took to change clothes.  (Splash Mountain on a cool night!)  The breakfast was exceptional, with plenty of outdoor patio seating, which we all enjoyed on the sunny mornings. Every day there was plenty of eggs,

We just recently stayed at Park Vue for 4 nights and loved it! The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The morning breakfast was excellent. Being able to to just walk to and from the parks made this place all the better. The pool and laundry facility was nice as well. I would totally recommend this facility to anyone looking for a place to stay in the Disneyland area!

Summary Heading: One of Perfect place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: It's location is within walking distance to Disneyland gate which equipped with a perfect American style breakfast buffet and also a free parking for your car. Clean, comfy beds, and room serviced on daily basis. All the staffs are customer oriented and very helpfull. Definitely a perfect place to stay near Disneyland.

We decided to stay here last week based on a friend's recommendation.  Overall, it was a good choice.   We usually go to Disney World which always requires a couple modes of transportation to get to the Magic Kingdom.  It was really nice to walk to Disneyland and save the daily parking fee!  Plus not be charged for parking at the motel.  The room was clean and décor was standard.  An added bonus: when we came back after a day at Disney, there were new curtains in our room.  Was a little strange to us at first, but then we laughed about it.  We saw several rooms being completely redone, which is good to see for the future of Park Vue.  The room was serviced daily, which was nice...but they consistently left us 4 towels and 2 wash cloths for our party of 5.  They knew how many

Family of 5 stayed for 4 nights in a 2 room suite. Motel style accommodation with free parking at your door. You could not get closer accommodation to the parks, right on the crossing. Clean, comfy beds, room serviced daily. Small bar fridge and a microwave available. Only 1 bathroom. Our room was right next to laundry which had strict 9am/10pm hours and was not noisy at all. Breakfast available, basic cereal and hot food, waffles, toast, bagels, fruit and yogurt.  Nice indoor and outdoor eating.  View to fireworks from here at night.  Basic, value family accommodation close to pool would be great in middle of summer for a respite during the day. Our kids are 10, 13 & 16 and was perfect for us. Would be great for younger families as well.

I have stayed in many of the hotels near Disneyland, but I was very happy with this one.  the rooms are being updated and ours was brand new and very nice.  the staff was also very nice and helpful.  you get free parking and you are directly in front of the crosswalk that leads you to the parks!.  I was also very impressed with the free breakfast.  A great selection and also had outdoor seating with a view of the Matterhorn.

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn because it was right across the street from the pedestrian entrance. It was less than a five minute walk to the main gate. Parking is free, breakfast was good and they never ran out of food, and the staff was very courteous and nice. I needed to rent a scooter for getting around the parks and they recommended a couple of places to us and that made all the difference being so close. Great to be able to come back mid day and get a nap in and then go back. I would stay there again. It's not luxurious, but it's nice and clean and recently updated. If you're not a hotel snob you'll be pretty happy. I would stay there again anytime.

Summary Heading: Could not be in a better location for Disney
Summary: My son and I just stayed at the Park Vue in for three nights for two full days in Disney.  Let me tell you it's literally across the street from the entrance!!  When we've gone to Disney World we have had longer walks to the bus stops for their hotel shuttles! This is a great place for the rate you pay.  We found it to be clean, comfortable and quiet!  Filled with families.  Their free breakfast is fantastic with a lot of hot options including scrambled eggs and begum waffles.  You can see the Matterhorn from the breakfast room. They also had a pool that looked great (in the parking lot) but we never had the chance to use it.  If we ever return to Disney Land we will stay in this hotel again for SURE!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review. We are thrilled that you and your son had a great visit to Disney. Thank you for choosing to stay at the Park Vue Inn.

Summary: We just stayed there this past week. Wasn't sure what to expect, but I absolutely love it!! It was clean and comfortable. ALL the staff was wonderful, we stayed the bunk bed room with a queen bed. The kids had a blast in their own beds. Since it right across the street from Disneyland we were able to come back to the hotel and swim. I love the gift shop it has everything you can think of. FREE breakfast, can beat that, saves you a lot of money. I can't wait to go back there again. This is our new place to stay!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. My staff was happy to read your comments about their service. We truly value your choice to stay with us, and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: We have stayed at various locations on Harbor Blvd over the decades.  We are now continuously booking here or the Grand Californian depending on the purpose of the trip.  Both are fabulous LOCATIONS and each are intended for different purposes.  If you are planning to spend the vast majority of your time at DL, want good access to various food options, want to be the closest possible to DL, don't want to pay a fortune and want to feel like you got your money's worth - -  this is the place.  This is a motel that offers: free wi-fi, free parking, free breakfast, a pool, and a great place to get some sleep.  The biggest bonus is that you simply walk across the street to Disneyland...literally.  The staff has always been kind and welcoming.  We just returned and are already looking
Manager Response: There are many hotels to choose from in the area and we are certainly happy you chose the Park Vue Inn. Thank you for your review. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable and CLOSE to Parks!
Summary: Our family had two rooms at this motel and were extremely satisfied with both.  One was at the back at end of wing with bunk beds. Very quiet location.  The room was crowded and did not have much room for luggage or belongings.  Other room, 2 queen,upstairs mid wing.  I thought the first room was recently updated until I saw the second room which appeared even more modern.  Both were clean, comfy beds, everything in working order.  Loved having a fridge, microwave.  Good ice machines on property. Nice pool area. Able to park right by room. Felt safe and secure. As others have stated the AC unit is in back of room in sink area.  It does have to kept on high fan to cool the opposite side of room. Staff were exceptionally kind and helpful.  It was so very nice to be right across

Summary Heading: My New Favorite Place To Stay ;)
Summary: Yeah for FREE Parking, FREE Breakfast, & FREE Wi-Fi! Heated outdoor pool/spa. Located directly across from BOTH Disneyland and CA Adventure main gate entrances! Stayed in their non-smoking one queen one bunk bed room. Microwave & mini fridge included. Room & carpet were clean, beds comfy, friendly staff, cookies/candy/punch at check in lobby, welcoming gifts celebrating our kids birthdays both in the month of March. So glad we choose this boutique hotel! Our new favorite place to stay! Highly recommend. We will be back!   4's due to older building/decor but well maintained

Summary Heading: Walk across the street an you're there!!!
Summary: First time staying here. Booked late on a busy weekend an still got a deal. Arrived early an left my bag at the front desk. They took it to my room later an turn a light on an the a/c. I was like sweet!!! So thanks hotel staff! Both staff I dealt with at the front deal were very nice an willing to help. Room was clean lots of channels on the t.v., I like the wood laminate in the bathroom area. Helps to show its clean an cleaned daily. Fridge worked good. Beds were comfortable an clean. You also get a 10 percent discount at the Cold Stone ice cream place in front of the hotel. Overall great stay enjoyed the rooms, staff an hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Park Vue Inn. My staff was very happy to read the great comments you left about their customer service. We appreciate your patronage and hope to have you stay with us again on your next trip to Disneyland.

Summary: This place does not get 5 stars because the rooms are huge or that the bathrooms are filled with marble.  It's the location that brought us back (again) with a different set of grandkids.  An easy walk, perhaps 5 minutes, to the main gate at Disneyland Park.  And if you go to the Park EARLY in the morning you will actually get to ride some of the high-demand rides before the lines stretch out for an hour wait.  When that happens back to the motel pool, a snack and a nap.  And parking is FREE, unlike the next door property that charges more for rooms and then hits you with an $8 charge for parking your car.  The rooms are in fact large with two doubles, the kiddy rooms with a double and a bunk seemed smaller.  The beds are firm, the towels fluffy, and the flat screen is 37
Manager Response: Thank you for continuing to choose the Park Vue Inn as your destination hotel when visiting Disneyland. We truly appreciate your review and look forward to your next visit.

Summary: For your trip to Disneyland, this motel/hotel is located in the absolute best position, virtually right across the street from the front gate (cross over one road & you are in the walkway to Disneyland). We stayed in a family room which had two queen beds, the room was neat & tidy & covered all our needs. The hotel has a nice pool, it has a shop & plenty of food options in close proximity. The biggest asset though is its location, after 10hrs at Disneyland, there is nothing better than having to just walk across the road to your hotel & not have to travel around!!

Booked this for 5 nights during spring break in March 2014. Ended up only needing 4 nights due to our travel plans changing on the way there. They had no problem canceling our last night. We arrived around 7:30 pm and were able to check in quickly and get to our room right away.  LOCATION was awesome! Right across the street from the Disney entrance. No need for any shuttles. I didn't want to fuss with a stroller on a bus. You can see the fireworks from the terrace. Lobby was clean and spacious. Staff was friendly. There is an outdoor pool, but we didn't use it. I love that parking, wifi, and breakfast are all included in my rate! Show your room key at the Cold Stone downstairs for a 10% discount too! Right next door to a 24-hour IHOP and McDonalds is pretty close too, for when

Summary Heading: Your BEST option for a Disneyland vacation
Summary: Stayed March 3-8, 2014. Double Queen Mini Suite  I have 2 young boys that need their afternoon naps, so location was primary in deciding what hotel I wanted. We chose Park Vue Inn because a) location, b) price was VERY reasonable c) Tripadvisor reviews were good.  We were on the ground floor, relatively close to reception. So here are a couple of our observations / recommendations:  If you have a stroller (we have a double), I'd advise a room on the 1st floor. You stay at PVI because you want to come and go to DL at our leisure. Do you really want to lug your stroller up and down the stairs each time?  Breakfast is fantastic! Scrambled eggs, biscuits, sausages, bacon, waffle station, + the normal cereals and drinks. Whoever is complaining about the breaky here has to put things
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review and thank you for all the kind words about our staff, the property and the services. Regarding your concern, we do steam clean every carpet every month. However most people do wear shoes in the room so they are hard to keep spotless. We are having new carpet installed this May along with the new furniture. We appreciate your business and we hope you will consider the Park Vue Inn again on your next trip to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great place especially with a larger family
Summary: We have a family of 5.  The first night we stayed in a room with a queen and a bunk bed which was fine but the second night they moved our things for us at our request while we were at the park to a room with a bunk and 2 queens.  Way more comfortable.  We used the pool and hot tub which were okay but nothing special.  The free breakfast is a big plus.  Waffles, eggs, cereal and bagels.  Bacon or sausage too.  I think this was a great added value to the hotel.  Staff was really friendly.  We could see the Disneyland fireworks from our window and I think every room probably had that view.  It's one of the closest hotels walkable to the park.  We will probably book there again if we don't stay in the resort.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Park Vue Inn for your Disney vacation stay. We are very pleased that you and your family had a great stay. We hope to have you stay with us again on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: Make no mistake ... This is not a Luxury Hotel.  However, the rooms were clean, efficient, and affordable.  The staff was polite, accommodating and helpful.  But the biggest and best selling point is that it is literally right across the street from Disneyland.  We walked both days ... It is maybe a 2 minute walk .... And watched the fireworks show from the breakfast balcony.  Speaking of breakfast, the continental breakfast is standard - nothing special but it is also efficient and the staff keeps the room clean.  Would stay here again (unless somebody wants to help pay to stay in the park).
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a very succinct review of your experience. Thank you for the kind words about our staff and facilities. We hope you'll choose to stay with us again.

Summary: Right across the street from the main gate Disney entrance.  We've stayed in many hotels  on S Harbor all within a city block of the crosswalk to the main entrance.  This is probably in our top 3, depending on what you are looking for.    Pros:  There are many room layout options and can accommodate just about any family need. The hotel is older, but rooms have recent updates and were very clean.The front desk staff were all exceptional and helpful-the best on the block.  The room had a dorm size fridge and a microwave.  The gift shop/store was well stocked and open late- a plus when your kids decide they are hungry at 10pm and you don't want to make the walk down the block.  Cons:  The walls are very thin and each morning we could hear the kids next door wake up and parents
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we really appreciate your feedback, as this helps us to better our services. Hopefully we will continue to rank high with your family. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: The location of this hotel is perfect for people visiting Disneyland, especially with kids. It is the closest hotel to the entrance of Disneyland, Literally across the street. The rooms are decent, you get what you pay for, but the location is totally worth it. The bunk beds are a big hit with the kids, and the free hot breakfast was awesome, great way to save some $$$$. The pool was nice as well. Overall you can't beat this location for this price.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. We are so please you and your family had a great stay a the Park Vue Inn.

Summary: I read so many reviews on this hotel that were favourable, I was sure it would be great even though I knew it was considered budget.  I had phoned once and emailed once to request a second floor room near the back because we wanted to be somewhat away from the busy parking lot.  We were so disappointed to arrive quite late and be given the first room beside the lobby on the ground floor!  It was very small, musty and not at all private.  If you open the curtains, there are a bunch of headlights shining in!  The nice kid at the front desk was apologetic, but could do nothing to help because the rest of the hotel was fully booked and he explained rooms were not assigned in advance so he was sorry that my requests had not been honoured, but that I should have been told that in
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I'm sorry you were not satisfied with your experience, however I'm happy you found a suitable alternative for the remainder of your stay. We are in the process of upgrading our guest rooms and the transformation will be complete in May of this year. Hopefully you will take a second look when planning your next vacation to Disneyland. We look forward to the opportunity to be of better service.

Summary Heading: Great hotel right in front of the parks
Summary: Over the years I've stayed at many of the hotels surrounding Disneyland. I've stayed at the Park Vue more often than other hotels in recent years, and the reason why is simple: it's a great place to stay!  The only time I've been disappointed with this hotel is when there was refurbishments going on while they upgraded the rooms, and I had to stay in a room with a handicapped shower, that I just didn't know how to use without water spreading across the floor, and into the adjoining kitchenette area.   Everything else at this hotel has been great. The breakfast is superb, and plentiful, allowing me to save money by not eating breakfast at the parks. The distance to the resort is fantastic, and seemingly closer than any other hotel, including the ones on Disney property.  Don't

We stayed at the Park Vue last October for our family Disneyland trip. This hotel is located directly accross the street from Disneyland, literally the parking lot meets the cross walk, its awesome!!! We went during a pretty busy weekend and the hotel was full so we had to switch rooms.. This wasn't really a problem, they moved our bags over from room to room for us. I liked that they have bunk beds... The kids still wanted the bigger queen bed, but it just gave the room a fun feel. Perfect if you have 6 people in one room! Might be crowded for getting ready cause the bathroom isn't huge, but definitely enough room for sleeping! The only complaint I have about this hotel is the noise.. We were on the bottom floor and especially our second room that was closer to the front was

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn for one night and it was just perfect. We were able to park our car at the motel before we checked in which was so nice and convenien as we were headed to Disneyland. Check -in was at 3pm but we needed an afternoon break from Disneyland and came back to motel at 1:30pm to see if our room might be ready. It wasn't but within about 10 minutes they told us it was..... Wonderful! The breakfast the next morning had much variety.  We will definitely return to the Park Vue Inn...so glad we found it!

We chose this hotel based on free breakfast and location, which we were both great! HOWEVER...I don't expect to pay over $100/night for a room that smells like mildew, has mildew in the bathroom, and the AC/Heater smells like mildew. We couldn't run the fan, because our boys have asthma, and I was afraid it would make it worse. So we were freezing at night (thin sheets and blankets, we had to bring our own blankets in from the car), and weren't able to use the fan to block the tons of noise from outside!  The room was not fully stocked everyday, though 2 days we got fancy towel animals on our bed? The day we got there (4pm) there were maid carts everywhere, bags and piles of linens all over the ground, and the housekeeping staff hanging out downstairs. We had to maneuver around
Manager Response: We are sorry to read about your less than satisfactory stay. Please except our sincere apology for the inconvenience you experienced. The housekeeping supervisor has been made aware of your comments. We will continue to better our property and services, so hopefully you will take a second look at the Park Vue Inn before booking your next trip to Disney. We would love the opportunity to be of better service.

Summary: Stayed 4 nights mid Jan2014. Rooms are big has 2 x queen size beds , very clean , very homely feeling. Had a room at the back of the hotel , 2nd floor, there are no lifts just stairs , was quiet even with the excitement of children and Disneyland.
