The Hotel is the closest to Disneyland entrance just across the road could not ask for a better location as you could come back and rest then go back to Disneyland. Hotel staff are warm and friendly , breakfast is ample , make your own waffles, bread , bagels , cereal, yoghurt, juice , tea, coffee, eggs,sausage,fried potatoes, there is plenty , don't know why people complained on trip advisor about this breakfast. Yes it gets busy , but there was a good flow of people and the staff always restocked. As a retired Travel Agent I cold not
Manager Response: Thank you for mentioning the staff, and thank you for sharing your experience. We are thrilled you found everything you needed for a great family vacation at the Park Vue Inn. We appreciate your business and we hope you'll stay with us again on your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great location, great price, my second time.
Summary: I stayed at the Park Vue Inn for three nights in January.  It was the second time I've stayed there.   The location is excellent for Disneyland and very convenient for the convention center (which is where I was going), and the price is great.   The property is older but extremely well maintained.  Nothing feels tired, only styled from a different time.  Both times my room was on the second floor and had a queen bed and a bunk bed.  The room was spacious, and had a small fridge and coffee maker, too, as well as a room safe.  The staff was superb.  The included breakfast had hard boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, sausage or bacon (on different days), waffle maker, yogurt, sliced fruit cocktail, a few cereals, breads, juices, and milk.  (There probably was coffee, but I'm not a coffee
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We strive to provide great guests experiences like yours. As you mentioned there are some areas of the hotel that are a bit out of date. We've already began our transformation and by May 2014 you'll be pleasantly surprised by all the fantastic improvements we've made. Hope to see you and your family again next year.

Summary: We loved this hotel! Excellent location!  Free parking, free hot breakfast, free wifi. Nice pool and hot tub.  Also has a laundry room with three washers and three dryers which was really nice to be able to wash clothes.  Rooms were clean, breakfast was good, staff was nice.  There is an Ihop next door, also there is a Denny's, a buffet, a pizza place, a Tony Romas and a few other food places right next to this hotel.  You can see fireworks show from hotel. The walk to Disneyland couldn't be any closer, very convenient.  Really enjoyed this hotel because it had everything we needed.  We stayed on second floor and could hear foot steps from running kids in the morning but was not a problem but might be to someone if they were trying to sleep in, but didn't bother us.  Besides
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Park Vue Inn. We look forward to your next visit and we are thrilled you enjoyed your stay.

Summary Heading: We stayed again. Loved it again.
Summary: We stayed 2-2-14 to 2-6-14. Room was clean. Service was excellent. Room was roomy. Shower was good. Room was super quiet. Free Breakfast was just ok. Right across the street from Disneyland. We will stay at this hotel again 3 more times in the coming year.
Manager Response: Thank you for continuing to choose the Park Vue Inn as your go to hotel when visiting Disneyland. We really appreciate your continued patronage and look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Will be staying again, nice rooms, great breakfast, no issues whatsoever. Stayed for 4 nights, with the kids. 2 Queens, 1 Bunk. Lot's of room, stayed at the back and was very quiet. They we're reno'ing some room near us, but work started after 8 and guys finished up for the day well before we got back from the park. Glad to see them improving and upgrading rooms, many hotels don't.  Stayed at many hotels, for the distance to the Disneyland, the daily changing "full" breakfast (not your typical muffins and cereal) the cleanliness, comfortable beds - I will most definitely staying again.  Thanks Park Vue, had a great stay and was a pleasant place to start and end our days.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review. We appreciate your patronage and hope you will choose the Park Vue Inn again on your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary: We stayed here on our second trip to Disneyland after deciding that distance to the park was our number one priority.  The hotel was nice and always had our room made up upon our return and gave a great view of the fireworks at the park. Also, the hot breakfast was nice and saved a lot of money not having to eat at the park or IHOP. Definitely recommended for families with small children.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review and thank you for choosing the Park Vue Inn. So glad you had a great stay and found everything you and your family needed here while visiting Disneyland.

Summary: because of reservations we stay in two different rooms.  The first room had two queen beds in one room and a sofa sleeper in the other.  There was an electric fireplace which was a nice extra.  There also was a room with cupboards, dishes, pots and pans, small refrigerator and a full stove.  A lot more than what we expected.  The second night we had a room with two queen beds and it had another room with another queen bed.  Because we had to room once during our four day stay the staff moved our luggage to our new room while we were at Disneyland.  Both rooms were clean and roomy and smelled good.  We could see the fireworks from most of the area of the hotel even by the pool.  The pool was very warm.  I really found nothing wrong with this hotel.  This hotel is located right
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Park Vue Inn again. We are thrilled that your family had a great stay. We really appreciate your review and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: A solid 4!   I would absolutely recommend this hotel for the following reasons: - Close vicinity to Disneyland (walking distance) - Price includes parking for up to 2 vehicles - Unique accommodations (they have rooms with bunk beds) - Family oriented hotel - Hot breakfast (served from 7-10, includes eggs, hard boiled eggs, bacon, fruit, do it yourself fresh waffles, sausage gravy!, some pastries, juice, milk and more) - Room with mini fridge and microwave - Free wifi  I wouldn't recommend this place for: - People who plan on staying in the hotel all day - Resort style living - Romantic Hotel Getaway  This place worked for us for a multitude of reasons.  We came here as a group of 6 adults, 1 child, 1 toddler and 2 infants.  We needed a place that would allow us to have easy
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Park Vue Inn. We really appreciate your opinion and positive comments. We look forward to your next stay.

Summary: Stayed here in early January 2014. The bathroom was really not clean (hairs from various body parts in the tub and on the floor). Which is not a giant problem, as I've learned to carry a small bottle of bathroom cleaning product and disinfectant wipes. So before we used the bathroom and shower, I sprayed and wiped them. I probably would stay here again as the location is hard to beat. The rooms will get better as renovations continue, meanwhile it's pretty darn shabby. Value is ok too. When all the rooms are renovated then, I hope, they will match the price. Right now I'd say it's a bit of a stretch. But hey, somebody has to pay for all the work they are doing... :) It's also pretty loud... Our room was on the first floor, and because our kid is still little (3 years old) our
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review and thank you for your honest feedback. I have taken this review to my housekeeping supervisor and staff to address the issues you reported in your guest room. Please call us directly before your next visit and we will find the perfect room for you and your family.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose  General Manager

Summary Heading: Good value hotel across the road from Disneyland entrance
Summary: We stayed in a 'One Queen, Bunk Bed' suite for 4 nights in January.  We were looking for a good value hotel suitable for my wife and I, and our 2 young children (8 and 6) that was close to Disneyland so we could easily walk to and from the park.  The Park Vue Inn fitted this bill perfectly.  While nothing flash, the room was clean and well fitted out.  When our toilet got blocked up, it was promptly attended to and fixed so we were impressed with the customer service experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review and thank you for the kind words about the hotel and customer service. We hope you will choose to stay at the Park Vue Inn on your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of January with two kids ages 11 and 16.  I have stayed at two other Anaheim Motels in the past, also in walking distance to Disneyland and both were superior to the Park Vue Inn.  I chose this motel based on location, room category choices and breakfast included.  Although I travelled during the low season, it was over a weekend and there was also a conference going on in Anaheim so rates reflected more peak season prices.  If I had paid a bargain price for this room I would have been satisfied as you get what you pay for.  However, this was the highest price I have ever paid in Anaheim so my expectations were heightened and I was disappointed.  Location: Excellent, as others have stated this motel is located right by the crosswalk to the
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Please accept our sincere apology for the experience you had during your stay. I can accept that there were conditions in your room that were unsatisfactory and that we fell short of your expectations. We did receive the other survey you submitted and we will be able to address the areas of concern in that particular guest room. As you already stated, we are currently undergoing an upgrade to our guest rooms. The section you stayed in will be completed between April & May of this year. I realize this past stay was not so great, but I really hope you will reconsider our property on your next visit to Disneyland. My staff and I would greatly appreciate the opportunity to be of better service, and I know you'll be more than impressed with what you see in our new guest rooms.   Sincerely,   Brian DeRose  General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel many times in the past few years.  It is right across from Disneyland and a quick easy walk to the park.  The breakfast is great and offers many selections for adults as well as kids. The hotel is clean and the staff is always ready to help in any way that they can.  You can get fresh baked cookies, cold water, and fruit at the front desk.  They also have balloons for the kids and that is something my grandson always looks forward to
Manager Response: Dear Paula,   It's always great to hear praise for our staff and services. Thank you for choosing to stay at the Park Vue Inn again. We truly appreciate your continued business and look forward to your next visit.   Warm Regards,   Brian DeRose General Manager

Summary Heading: So sad that Park Vue has changed:(
Summary: We have stayed at Park Vue for many years, this last trip Jan 7-12th/2014 will be our last!! I have noticed the cleanliness has slowly suffered over the years but after this last visit I will not return. Mattress was not comfortable and even though we were exhausted from so much walking I found it hard to sleep, they need to upgrade the beds. The carpets were so dirty in our room and had a odour in the room that was hard to tolerate (this alone has made me not want to go back). I choose this hotel for convience in location and breakfast but have also noticed the options in breakfast were really low and better off to buy muffins and fruit and eat on the walk and avoid the growing lines at the disneyland main gate. The price is average but I have now found there are so many
Manager Response: Dear Darell,   Please accept my sincere apology for the experience you had on your last visit. It's always disappointing to read an unfavorable review. I truly wish you would have brought these concerns to a managers attention during your visit. We are in the process of a complete property upgrade that includes new bathrooms, new furniture, new carpet... and the list goes on. Should you have a change of heart, we would be grateful for the opportunity to win back your loyalty to our hotel.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose General Manager

Summary: As last year a great place to stay right across from Disney. Great staff, nice room and great free breakfast. (leave a small tip for the ladies they work hard) I would suggest that if you have a car you can go down Katella to save on more foods and you can stock up on some food as the hotel is so close to the park you can leave for lunch and have a swim break in the heated pool!

what a great hotel. this is litterally right across from disney entrance.  we were fortunate to be upgraded to a spa room.  breakfast included but your typical american continental breakfast. there is onsite washing machines and dryers

I usually love staying in a Disney hotel, but The Park Vue Inn is such excellent value for money, it was hard to justify staying anywhere else.  For an amazingly cheap price, we could sleep 6 people in one room, have breakfast and then walk across the road into the parks.  The room -especially the beds, were very comfortable, and we had no problem with noise. It was a happy end to our holiday in the USA.

Just ending a week long trip at this hotel.  Location is perfect!  Just a few minute walk from our room to the Disneyland gates!  Closer than even the Disneyland Hotel, I think!  Hotel offered a hot breakfast daily (eggs, potatoes, bacon, waffles, etc.) as well as cold cereals, toast, yogurt, fruit, etc.  Very good!  Great way to start your day and save some money!  There is an IHOP next door...very busy and expensive!  $60 for a breakfast for 2 adults and 2 kids!  Parking is plentiful.  Rooms are clean, but a bit small.  Had the room with bunk beds for the kids.  That was a hit with them!  Rooms are undergoing renovations right now.  Our bathtub did not hod water, so kids had to take showers instead of baths.  With a two and five year old, they prefer baths, but that was okay.

Our family of 6 (2 adults, 4 kids 14, 12, 10 and 6) stayed 4 nights with Park Vue Inn at the beginning of September in a family room on the second floor.  It's perfect location was a short walk back from the parks in the afternoon for a quick cool off in the pool and rest (sometimes a quick tea at either IHop, Denny's or McDonalds) before heading back to the parks for the evening.  The family room was clean and comfortable with 2 doubles in one room and a sofa bed (not so comfortable, but it is a sofa bed!) bathroom and kitchenette in the other.  Breakfast was lovely with a good variety of hot and cold options that were of good quality.  I made the reservation online directly with Park Vue and received a great price as well as very prompt and friendly assistance with any queries
Manager Response: Thank you for traveling half way around the world and choosing to stay at the Park Vue Inn. We are very pleased to read that you would choose us again on a return trip. We're thrilled that you and your family had a great visit. We value your business and look forward to your next trip.

Summary Heading: Great!  But one thing i'd do differently...
Summary: Get a second floor room.  I've stayed before and thought it was a great value.  I'd just want a second floor room.  Otherwise, the amenities are absolutely adequate.  Beds are comfortable.  Ac blasts strong if you need it.  Its a great spot.
Manager Response: Hi James,   It was great to have you back at the Park Vue Inn. Thank you for your continued business. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: This motel has plenty of pluses- free breakfast, nice little pool area, friendly staff, and it's one of the closest to Disneyland. However, it was INCREDIBLY noisy. There was a constant cacophony of car alarms, construction, and loud people walking by our room at all hours. This resulted in next to no sleep and I would really only consider staying here again if I was guaranteed one of the rooms on the second floor toward the back of the property.
Manager Response: Please accept our sincere apology for the disturbance during your visit. We appreciate and value your feedback. Please call the hotel directly before your next visit and we'll do what we can to find a room that's perfect for your needs.

Summary: On past visits, I've stayed at six other properties near Disneyland, including the Disneyland Hotel. For my money, this is the best of all of them. It is right across the street from the Park, and I got a great night's sleep because the bed was so comfortable. There were three adults and one child in our party. The child loved the bunk bed. The room size is typical and perfectly adequate since we didn't spend much time in it.  The positives: friendly staff, breakfast included hot items, beds were very comfortable, free wifi, lots of tv channels, three close-by restaurants, small store on-site with souvenirs and sundries, frig, microwave, very quiet near the back of the property, in-room safe, swimming pool and hot tub, luggage storage for people whose rooms are not yet ready for
Manager Response: We'd like to extend a great big Thank You for choosing to stay at the Park Vue Inn. We are so thrilled to read that you've tried the rest and deemed us the best! We appreciate your feedback and look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This is our second stay at the Park Vue Inn.  They have upgraded [and continue to upgrade] the rooms although it is still a budget motel.  We had adjoining rooms for my husband and I and our daughter's family [they could NOT guarantee adjoining rooms, but did accommodate my request].  This motel is directly across the street from Disneyland's main entrance which makes it perfect to come and go as you please, especially with little ones who need a nap [us too!!!].  The rooms were comfortable, the amenities great and the complimentary buffet breakfast perfect!  They have discontinued a few other things they offered 2 years ago, but still it was the perfect place to stay.  We will stay there again!    I highly recommend this motel to others.  If you're looking for a 5 star hotel,
Manager Response: Dear Vanessa,   Thank you for choosing to stay with the Park Vue Inn again. We have made some changes over the years and hope to keep getting better. Currently we are upgrading again and by your next trip you should be pleasantly surprised by the changes. We really appreciate your continued business and look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Will only stay here from now on
Summary: Our family of 5 stayed here for 4 nights over the New Year. We arrived early and were greeted warmly and given a pass to park our car. We then walked about 500 steps to the entrance of the park. You CANNOT beat the location! The room was ready around 2pm and we had no issues with it. Next time will ask for a room even FARTHER back in the corner to help cut down on the noise from little feet running to breakfast. Speaking of the breakfast - scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, bagels, cereal, yogurt, fruit - was a GREAT variety for a complementary breakfast! Every request we had from extra towels to extra toilet paper was taken care of quickly and with true helpfulness. This is the only place I will stay when coming to Disneyland from now on!
Manager Response: Dear Cheryl,   Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. Wow, that's so great to know that we are now your go to hotel when visiting Disneyland! We are very pleased to read that you and your family had a great experience. We hope to see you again sometime soon.

Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue Inn one night before a trip to Disneyland. Room prices were good considering it was during the Christmas/New Years Holiday.  Grandkids loved the heated pool, and all found something they liked at the breakfast buffet. Adults enjoyed the fresh cookies in the lobby and the positive attitudes of every staff member we came in contact with.  All enjoyed the fact that we were directly across the street from Disneyland's main entrance.  We would not hesitate to return.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review. We are very pleased that you and your family had a great stay at the Park Vue Inn. Hope to see you again this year.

Summary: Let me start by saying that there is no denying the location is outstanding. The entrance to Disneyland is literally on the other side of the street. The staff was nice and check in/out fast. The room itself however had several issues for me. First, I couldn't find an elevator, perhaps there is one I havent seen but I would have rather not carried strollers up and down the stairs. The room looks, smells and feels old. The furniture is worn out and made with cheap material to start with. The bunk bed's matresses were very soft and not particularly confortable. The bathroom had caulk isses all over, and the bath faucet was dripping. Additionally the bath drain wasn't working well, causing water to accumulate as I was showering. I also found (somebody else's) hair in my "fresh"
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel. We are sorry to read that you did not find our accommodations satisfactory. Sounds like there were some noticeable areas in your guest room that were less than perfect . We value the feedback, good or bad,  as this helps us  to better our services. We are currently in the process of upgrading the rooms and that includes new bathroom fixtures, new carpet and new furniture. Hopefully you will consider revisiting our property later this year, we know you'll be impressed with the improvements.

Summary: My family of 4 stayed here for 5 days/4 nights. Location is pefect and right across the street from Disneyland. We arrived early before our room was ready so we stored our luggage and went to  Disneyland for the day. We came back to hotel around 5:00pm to check in and all we had to do was get the room keys as our luggage was already waiting for us in our room!  Our room had a small kitchen which had microwave, small fridge and a small stove. We didn't use it but was nice to see it was available. Loved our bed/mattress so much that I tried asking what brand of mattress they used so I could buy one like it when I got home (couldn't find the name on the mattress ourselves) but management said many rooms had different brands and didn't know.  Rooms are a bit on the small side and
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Park Vue Inn and thank you for writing this review. We are very pleased that you and your family had a great stay. We are in the process of upgrading our guest rooms, so hopefully by your next visit you'll be pleasantly surprised by the changes.

Summary: We wanted to surprise kids with trip to Disneyland 2 days after Christmas. We had stayed at this hotel in the past and loved the location in regards to the park entrance.   Found room that 3 queen beds and 2 rooms. Perfect - each kid got their own bed to crash on instead of pull out sofa bed or double beds situated in other rooms and hotels. So, I booked early and glad that I did - the hotel packed up fast due to Christmas and New Year's holiday.  Hotel let us park when we arrived at Noon and we came back after 3pm when room was ready. Very spacious and clean. They used to have gift baskets in rooms, but we did not get one this time and figured they stopped the practice due to costs. Plenty of towels and room was very comfortable. Could not have been more pleased with the room,
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us again. The triple queen is one of the most popular rooms we offer, so booking well in advance is advised. We are thrilled you had another great visit and we look forward to having you and your family back to the Park Vue Inn very soon!

Summary Heading: not bad, but would go elsewhere
Summary: pros: bunk beds for the kids were nice as I didn't have to share a bed w/ my son; the closest hotel to Disneyland's enterance; great cable;   cons: one of the smallest rooms that I have stayed in and set up so that anyone watching tv has to be in the master bed; I have slept on osb board that was softer than the mattress; the pillows were soft compared to mattress, barely, and were thicker than some mattresses;  so so: breakfast was good except the waffle iron had issues 2 of the 3 days  I had the misfortune to have the stomach flu while we were here. spending 18 straight hours on this bed did nothing to make my malady better. it is a decent hotel that is very clean with a nice staff. I would spend more money and walk a little more.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review. I hope by now you have fully recovered. I was sorry to read that you were not satisfied with your stay. We do have several room types to choose from, including a family suite, and larger rooms with bunk beds, as well as single deluxe king rooms. Should you decide to give us another chance, please call the hotel directly and our reservation agents will help you select a room perfect for you and your family.

Summary: Just spent 3 nights here to celebrate christmas with the family. This was our second stay at the Park Vue and we were not disappointed.  It's clean, friendly and has a decent complimentary breakfast. If you're looking for 5 star luxury, this isn't it, but for price and convenience, it can't be beat. A quick walk directly across the street gets you to right into the parks. Disney was incredibly crowded (at capacity) when we were there, so be prepared for long lines, frustrated people and the possibility of Disney closing the parks halfway through the day for anyone coming in late.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us a second time, and thank you for sharing your experience. We're very happy you had another great stay. Hopefully we'll see you and your family again sometime soon.

Summary: This is the best location for Disneyland.  It is literally right across the street from the main gate.  We took our son, age 3, to Disneyland for the first time during Thanksgiving.  We had two connecting rooms with 2 queen beds each as we had family who traveled with us.  The rooms are a bit small and dated but they include a microwave and fridge.  There is also a small coffee maker but we just got coffee at the breakfast buffet.  The breakfast was simple but a good start for the day.    I would recommend the Park Vue Inn to anyone who is looking for a convenient location to Disneyland.  It had rained one of the days we were there and it was an easy walk back to the room to change and head out again.  On another day, my husband wasn't feeling well so he was able to go back to
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We are very pleased that you and your family had a great experience at the Park Vue Inn. Thank you for choosing to stay with us, we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: First time at this hotel; like everyone else happy about the closeness to Disneyland. Rooms very clean each day, breakfast adequate although crowded. Downside noise from guests. Hotel has signs everywhere asking for quiet but people do not respect them or the other guests. Kids running up and down the halls, people above us in late, up early and someone,(child) running back and forth constantly. This is not the hotels fault, but how nice would it be if people would use a little common sense and think of others. Would stay at the hotel again despite the noise. Would recommend to others, maybe next time ask for a room far away; couldn't this time as hotel was completely booked.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Park Vue Inn and thank you for sharing your review. We appreciate the feedback and we look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: I normally give rave reviews of hotels. i am  not one to complain or whine about the little things. But i am giving you a fair warning. DO NOT STAY HERE! It is very close to disney and yes we could see the fireworks from are room but other then that it sucked. The rooms are alot smaller then they look in the pictures. They are dirty, my feet where black from walking around the room  barefoot.the bathrooms are a disaster we could not even open the windows because the screens were so dirty. there where bugs in the lights, hair that did not belong to us in the sheets, the fridge froze are food even thought it was turned down to the lowest level. there was dust on everything (lamp shades, curtains, tv....) the hot tub had a ring around it like it had not been cleaned in a month the
Manager Response: Dear Zaina D,   I’d like to offer you and your family my sincere apology for your experience. I never like to leave guests with a negative impression of our hotel or our services. I will be using this review to hold my staff accountable for the deficiencies in service and for the conditions of your guest room. I really wish this had been brought to my attention during your stay so I could have addressed these issues. Should you have a change of heart, we would appreciate the opportunity to be of better service.  Sincerely,   Brian DeRose  Director of Operations

Summary: My wife, niece and I stayed here for 4 nights. The location is perfect. Many places to eat nearby, the room was clean with very comfortable beds. We didn't find it noisy at all and the breakfast was filling although sometimes busy if you left it too late. Service was great and very friendly
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review and for choosing to stay at the Park Vue Inn. We really appreciate the kind words about our property, rooms, staff, and services. Hope to see you again next year.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose  Director of Operations

Summary Heading: Can't Get Any Closer to Disenyland
Summary: Great family run hotel directly across the street from the entrance to Disneyland.  Nothing fancy.  But clean and comfortable with a good free hot breakfast including waffles and free parking.  Family rooms with bunk beds as well as deluxe king rooms with hot tubs available.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing our hotel. We are so glad you found everything you needed at the Park Vue Inn. There's more great upgrades and changes coming in 2014, so we hope to see you again in the new year.

Summary: I've stayed at several properties within close proximity to Disneyland, this is obviously the closest one can get. The room was fine - nice and clean. The beds were amazing - so comfortable!!!!The free breakfast was good - much better than just pastries. The breakfast potatoes were a hit with my group.  The only disappointment was when we left. First let me say the staff was great in storing our luggage while we spent the day at the parks and when we asked if they would order a cab for us for a certain time they were happy to do so. Much appreciated that we didn't have to do that. However, they didn't order us a cab, they ordered us a luxury SUV, which was nearly double the cost of what our cab ride was when we arrived. That was very disappointing - really the staff should have
Manager Response: Thank you for writing this review of our property and services. My staff will be thrilled when they read the nice comments. Please accept our apology for the mix-up with the taxi. The private transportation companies usually match or beat taxi pricing; I'll address this with my staff. We are really pleased that you and your family enjoyed your stay at Park Vue Inn and we are truly happy that you'll be returning for another visit.   Sincerely,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary: Last year we stayed here and only problem was internet was dropping out, this time had no problem with this. Comfortable rooms, free parking,  breakfast and great location. Will always stay here if visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay at the Park Vue Inn on your return trip to Disney. We appreciate that you took the time to write a review and we are thrilled with all the great comments. Looking forward to your next visit.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose  Director of Operations

Summary: This is our second review of this property. Our last review was a few years ago but, as time has passed and as we have travelled the globe;The Park Vue is the BEST place to stay if your main focus is to experience Disneyland and California Adventure. We have stayed at the fancier hotels. We have stayed at the Disney Theme Home. We have paid bottom dollar and we have paid top dollar. As far as we're concerned, the Park Vue Inn, is the best place to stay for families with kids that want to go hard and visit Disney and Cali Adventure on a daily basis. This is not a palatial estate. This is a motel. The rooms are nicely appointed. There is a fridge and a microwave. The pool is lovely and the there's also a hot tub/jacuzzi on the property. Free breakfast is an asset...if you wake up
Manager Response: We are truly happy that you chose to stay with us again. Thank you for sharing your experience. We are family owned and couldn't agree more about quality time with loved ones. See you on your next visit.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose  Director of Operations

Summary: My family and I were on a cross-country move to Texas and decided to stay at the Park Vue Inn on our first stop. After a long day of driving we checked into our room and found a lovely gift basket full of fruits, wine glasses and a bottle of wine (and an offer for a discounted second night). We were given the option to trade the wine in for a bottle of sparkling cider, which was perfect since I don't drink wine and my husband couldn't possibly finish a bottle on his own. So we shared cider with the kids instead.  The room was perfect for families. It had a queen sized bed and a bunk bed for the kids. Even with all that furniture, it didn't feel cramped at all. We never had issues with cleanliness as it was well kept.  The staff was professional, yet personable. They doted on my
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review from your 2012 stay. Although we have discontinued the wine basket and the social hour, everything at the Park Vue Inn is better than ever. By your next visit we should have even more great upgrades throughout the property and in our guest rooms.   Kind Regards,  Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary Heading: Some Good, Some Not So Good
Summary: My adult daughter and I opted for the Park Vue for an extended girls' weekend and ended with a mixed review of the property--  Good: Location, location...ideally situated across the street from the Disney resort, you are just steps from being on site. The room was clean, spacious, and adequate.  The hotel staff, front desk and housekeeping, were especially accommodating.  Not So Good:  We were on an upper floor towards the front and the noise from pounding feet and loud talking woke us early each morning, as people headed to the breakfast room on the same level.  Also, lots of late-night foot stomping as people returned from the park. (Not the hotel's fault that people are noisy, but there was no way to baffle the sound.) This would be a deal-breaker for (me) staying here again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for writing a review. So sorry about the disturbance outside your guest room. Aside from that it seems you had an ok stay. Thank you for your great comments about the staff, accommodations and our location. Please give us a call before your next trip and we can hopefully arrange another room type in a different area of the hotel that may be a little less noisy.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary: It's been said many times over, but the location is first class.  Literally closer to the parks than the Disneyland Hotel and better value too. The room was a good size, clean, and well serviced.  Having stayed at the Disneyland Hotel before, the room was better even if it didn't quite have that Disney Magic.  Breakfast included which was a simple enough buffet with some hot food (sausage / bacon / scrambled egg / biscuit) waffles fruit etc.  good enough for us to start the day.  Overall cannot say much more than that.  Definitely recommend this place.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for writing a review and for sharing your experience. We really appreciate all the great comments about our service, location, and overall accommodations. Thank you for your recommendation to other travelers and we hope you'll choose to stay with us again.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary: The front desk personnel are curteous and nice, but not very friendly.  Like most of the people from California; very business-like in their duties.  Being from the South, maybe I expected a little too much.  The room was clean and quiet, after 10:00 pm when all the future little WWE wrestlers finally get to sleep.  The free breakfast buffet next door is good hot food, cereal, coffee, etc.  DL and DCA right across the street, great location.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for sharing your experience and for taking the time to write a review. Southern hospitality is hard to top, but now we have something to strive for. Overall it seems that you enjoyed your stay. Thank you for choosing the Park Vue Inn.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary Heading: Our new go-to place when visiting Disneyland
Summary: We just returned from a family trip to Disneyland that included staying at the Park Vue Inn for two nights.  We were on a budget and with the little ones needed a nice clean place to stay that wasn't too far to walk to/from the park.  The Park Vue fit the bill perfectly and the added convenience of free parking and free breakfast, it made it easy to stay in budget and we were so close (literally RIGHT across the street from the main entrance) it made it painless going back & forth from the parks.  We had three rooms, all of us were happy and comfortable.  The rooms were clean, the staff was nice and seemed to truly care that their guests were kept happy, the shower was great with lots of hot water and great water pressure. We will definitely be back, this really is a great place
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for the great review! We're so happy to be your new go to hotel when visiting Disneyland. Thank you for choosing the Park Vue Inn, see you on our next trip.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary: If you want a place to stay close to Disneyland, you can't get much closer than the Park Vue Inn.  The check in was quick and easy with a nice, knowledgable woman at the desk.  Our room was in the far back which was nice and quiet.  We had a first floor room and weren't sure we had neighbors on either side or above us because it was so quiet, except for the last morning when we heard the pipes from someone's shower at 5:30 a.m.  We were so tired though, we went right back to sleep.  If you're going to bring a family of four, the rooms are a little on the cozy side but since there were only two of us, we were fine.  When the hotel says it serves a hot breakfast, they weren't kidding.  A lot of hotels serve waffles and instant oatmeal and call it a hot breakfast.  This place had
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for sharing your review and for all your great comments about our staff, location and amenities. We do have several room types, so be sure to call us before your next trip to Disneyland and we'll be sure get you into the best room type for the number of guests you have with you.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary Heading: Convenient to Disneyland and staff is very friendly and helpful
Summary: We were booked for 3 nights at the Park Vue Inn, and were thrilled at the proximity to the Disneyland entrance. We happened to be visiting during a minor heat wave for the time of year, and were very surprised to see a hotel room in SoCal that did not have air conditioning. We come from a cooler climate, but thankfully leaving the bathroom window open was enough to keep us cool at night. Unfortunately, we had a room with a pass-through door to the room next door, and the neighbors were incredibly loud, until well after midnight. We took our concern to the staff, and they not only got us a different room, but moved all of our luggage while we were at the park for the day! In the end, we did get a room with AC, had quieter neighbors, and slept like babies for our last two nights.
Manager Response: Dear Traveler,   Thank you for writing a review. I am happy that you found the staff helpful and friendly. Great customer service often goes unmentioned, so thank you for noticing. I would also like to confirm that every guest room has an A/C unit; not sure why you thought otherwise, but they all have them. We hope to see you and your family on your next trip to Disney! Thank you for choosing the Park Vue Inn.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary: When we arrived, we were checked in quickly.  Upon opening the door, we were not thrilled, but not disappointed either.  The room size was "cozy" (2 queen beds), and obviously a little dated and well worn--like a comfortable pair of shoes.  The price was great and the location was AMAZING!  For us, since we spend so little time in the hotel while visiting Disneyland, the lack of amenities and space wasn't really an issue.  Of special note, however, was the cleanliness--particularly the bathroom.  It could have definitely used a good day of elbow grease.  My kids got water all over the floor while showering, and when I went to clean it up, the previously white towels were decidedly gray.  I think that if we were to go to Disneyland again, I may look at the hotels directly on
Manager Response: Dear Makruger,   Thank you for taking the time to write a review. The hotel will be undergoing a complete cosmetic upgrade that's set to begin in January 2014. The model room is nearly complete and looks fantastic! We hope with these upgrades and improvements to the rooms we'll become your new favorite hotel when visiting Disney.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose  Director of Operations

Summary: Chose this hotel based on trip advisor reviews and the location to Disneyland and the hotel didn't disappoint.  The room had everything we needed including a TV, microwave, fridge, hairdryer and iron plus tea & coffee making equipment and supplies.  Property also has a coin operated laundry which was handy.  Kids enjoyed the warm pool and spa.  We found the room comfortable and the shower was perfect.  We had a room upstairs and didn't have any issues with noise from other guests.  The location is ideal as you are directly opposite Disneyland, there are also plenty of restaurants within a 5 min walk to choose from.  Breakfast was provided daily with plenty of options including cereal, waffles, toast, eggs & fruit.  Plus free parking, you can't go wrong.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for sharing your experience and for taking the time to write a review. We're thrilled that you choose to stay with us based on our Trip Advisor reviews. It's quite a trek from Australia, but we hope you'll stay with us again if you make another trip to Disneyland.    Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary Heading: Right across the street from Disneyland!
Summary: My family just got back from a 2 day/1 night trip to Disneyland. The Park Vue Inn is the most convenient motel to Disneyland. It's literally at the crosswalk across the street from the park. They let us park the car in their lot as soon as we arrived (at 8:00 AM) even though we weren't able to check in until 3:00 PM. AND they let us leave the car in the lot the entire next day even after we checked out. They provide a hearty free breakfast. We could make our own waffles, there was sausage, eggs, potatoes, all kinds of toast, cereal, fruit, etc. OK - so the room is not the Ritz, but it was clean and the beds were comfortable. There was a flat screen TV. It was very inexpensive considering all the perks. There's a nice little pool/jacuzzi area that we didn't have time to use. We
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for sharing your review and for choosing to stay at the Park Vue Inn. Yes it's true we're not the Ritz, but we're happy you found our accommodations comfortable and convenient. It's too bad you were not able to hang out and relax by the pool in between trips to the park. Now that you have an annual pass we hope to see you on your next trip to Disney.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary: I notice the standings have slipped for this hotel since we stayed there. We chose it on its outstanding reviews at tripadvisor at the time we booked. It was #1.   It was great for us. We got an extended room with an extra queen bed  and bunks for the kids and grandkids. And then we were right next door, in a separate king room with jacuzzi tub in the bedroom area. Corny but fun and clean.   The prices were outstanding (averaging just over $150 a night during spring break week! We booked well in advance); parking was free - not a minor issue in Anaheim  - as were breakfast and a dinner/snack buffet daily.  The food wasn't  anything we would normally eat. Suffice it to say my husband and I ate a lot of cold cereal and boiled eggs. But it was good to keep both generations of kids
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for sharing your review and for choosing to stay with us. We're so glad your family found convenience, value and everything they needed at the Park Vue Inn. Hope to see you on your next trip to Disney.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary: We stayed here for just one night this October, before our vacation at Dana Point.  We would definitely return there if we go back to Disneyland.  The location is outstanding, right across the street from the park.  We stayed at the Disneyland Grand Californian last year, and enjoyed being right at the park, but the price at Disney Resort was very expensive.  So, for the value and location, Park Vue is a great choice!  Room was clean, beds comfortable, and breakfast was good.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,   Thank you for sharing your review and for choosing the Park Vue Inn. We really appreciate your kind words. See you on your next trip to Disney.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary Heading: Great return visit to this lovely hotel
Summary: Park Vue Inn is really great. I recommend it highly. We stayed for 8 nights last week (October 12th – 20th 2013) and received really great customer service. We were in a room on the second floor and were given help to carry our luggage up and down the stairs to our room when we checked in and out, and they held our bags all day for us on our check out day so we could squeeze in some more Disney time! All the staff members were very friendly and helpful.  Room The beds were lovely and comfortable (although very high!). Cleanliness was really good. The carpets were very clean, and the bathroom sparkling. The rooms were serviced well every day. The shower was good. The wardrobe space was great including a safe. We didn’t have any issues with overhearing noisy neighbours; the signs
Manager Response: Dear Daisy,   Wow what a great review! Thank you for all the fantastic comments about your stay. We are truly grateful that you chose to stay at the Park Vue Inn again. The staff was thrilled when they read the comments about the great service. Hope to see you on your next trip to the Magic Kingdom.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary: Very pleased with hotel. Comfortable beds, clean and location closer than grand California hotel and $350 less a night. Our families new favorite. Plus free parking even on the day we checked out they let us leave car until park closed
Manager Response: Dear Traveler,   Wow can you walk fast! We are very close, most accounts are about 500 steps. We are really pleased that you chose to stay at the Park Vue Inn and that we are now your new favorite. Hope to see you on your next trip to Disneyland.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose  Director of Operations

Summary Heading: Great staff, but the facilities need MAJOR work
Summary: Let's start with the good first, because that's a shorter list. First off the staff is AMAZING!!! (Erick and Melissa are phenomenal) That says a lot coming from me as I work for the #1 tripadvisor resort in the world. With this said my expectations are high, however I don't expect 5 stars when I'm staying anywhere that isn't a Four Seasons, but I do expect some things that should be a given. Let this be the start of the bad...... Our room was dirty to say the least. Let me just break it down in list form   - blood on the pillow cases (yes that's plural)  - blood on the sheets of the bottom bunk, which we didn't use but it could clearly be seen - bath amenities were pre-used. (Not sure if this is an operations issue or housekeeping, either way it's UNSANITARY)  - towels had
Manager Response: Dear Mrs142,   I wish to extend an apology to you for having to experience these deficiencies in service. Bringing these issues to my attention during your stay would have resulted in an immediate correction. Since it’s after the fact I have no recourse other than this forum in which to express my regret for failing to meet your expectations. I will say that although unacceptable, your room is an exception, as nearly every room is steam cleaned monthly. That is not an easy task when the hotel is 98% occupied year round. Occasionally a room will not make it into the monthly rotation. As far as the linen and bath amenities are concerned I will not make excuses. Clearly your room was not inspected properly and I will hold the room division manager and the housekeeper accountable for that.  I assure you that we launder and replace linens and towels daily and never reuse any bath amenities. I appreciate your opinion and value the feedback, albeit in this case not flattering. Although you mentioned that you would not return; should you have a change of heart, we would welcome the opportunity to be of better service.    Sincerely,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary: We chose Park Vue for its location directly across harbor blvd from the entrance to Disneyland. It's super convenient because you cross Harbor Blvd at a signal there clise to the motel entrance which leads to the Disney entrance as you walk past the shuttle drop off points.  So it's really faster than taking a shuttle from another hotel.    The motel is clean and basic 2 story with the rooms facing the parking lot. It was surprisingly quiet at night and there were kids running around early in the morning really noisy. Maybe if you stay on the lower level you won't have the noise of kids running on the upper level walkway.    Loved the free parking and the complimentary breakfast which is very basic but there is IHOP in the parking lot just next door it's a little pricey for IHOP
Manager Response: Dear V Jay,   Thank you for writing a review. More importantly, thank you for choosing to stay at the Park Vue Inn. Kids get really excited when they're so close to the Magic Kingdom is nearly impossible to slow them down. Be sure to ask the front desk for menus from area restaurants that deliver. There are lots of great places with reasonable prices. Hope to see you on your next trip to Disneyland.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose  Director of Operations

Summary Heading: Across the road from Disneyland!  What more do you need??
Summary: Obviously we picked this place for it's fantastic location opposite the entrance to the Disney resort.  The rooms themselves were looking dated but comfortable.  Air conditioning was a little noisy, but I always take ear plugs with me wherever I go anyway so that wasn't much of an issue.  Free parking onsite was appreciated, as was the breakfast on offer.  I felt the cost of the room was also quite reasonable.
Manager Response: Dear Drew,   Thanks for sharing your experience and for choosing to stay at the Park Vue Inn. I appreciate your concise and honest feedback. We hope to see you again on your next trip to Disney.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary Heading: Response to Argenis P, Guest Relations Manager at Park Vue Inn
Summary: We checked into the hotel on Oct. 9th and was informed that there was no water and that it would be back on at 5pm.  We went for a bite to eat at IHOP and returned after 5pm and was told that the water would not be on until 10pm.  They did not want to give an earlier time.  There was no water offered, no water brought to the room to flush the toilet.  We were never told that arrangements had been made with IHOP to use their restrooms.  Since we had a meal there, we felt we could use the restrooms.  We had to go to the front desk and asked for water, which was given.  10 pm came and went.  There was one small note about the water outage and probable time the water would be back on.  At no time were we contacted by the hotel staff by phone or in person or written information
Manager Response: Dear Traveler,   This was definitely an experience we won't soon forget and we did learn quite a bit about crisis management. I won't share all the details regarding our efforts to expedite this repair and arrange for alternative resources and accommodations. I will say that we did relocate guests upon request to neighboring hotels; however it was not particle or possible to relocate everyone. I would also like to add that it's not as easy as you may think to arrange for showers in neighboring properties. Due to the volume of water needed to get guests through the night we did run out by early morning. However water was delivered the following day to guest rooms before 9 am and maintenance did fill all toilets to make them flush. I would like to thank you for finding a way to still say some nice things about our hotel despite the fact that we obviously fell short of your expectations. My hope is that you and your family will return to our hotel to give us another opportunity to be of better service.  Sincerely,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary Heading: Park vue has all you need when visiting Disneyland :)
Summary: This comples is just opposite the disney entrance. Rooms are clean and seems well maintained. Breakfast has hot and cold items which is a plus.   This will be our hotel of choice in our future disneyland trips :)

Summary Heading: Just across the street from Disney!
Summary: The reviews I read were not very clear about how far this hotel is from the street crossing which is the main entrance to the park. It is literally right there. IHOP is exactly across the street and this hotel's parking lot shares one with IHOP so in my view, this hotel is actually the closest you can get to the main entrance of Disneyland. That said, you will experience very loud fireworks noise on the weekends. We were there over a three-day weekend and had ZERO issues with loud guests either in the hallway or in the rooms next door or below. We did have a second-floor corner room so that might have helped but I believe the ample signage in the rooms and in the hallways reminding guests to speak and walk quietly did their job. There were no kids running around screaming like
Manager Response: Dear Photoguide,   Thank you for sharing your experience and for taking the time to write this review. Our goal is to provide great service and accommodations that lead to great guest experiences like yours. Thank you for choosing to stay at the Park Vue Inn. We look forward to your next visit.  Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose  Director of Operations

Summary: We spent 5 nights at the hotel.  It's 2-story hotel which is comfortable and clean.  The crosswalk  to the entrance of the Disney resorts is very close to the hotel.  The parking, breakfest (meat, eggs,  waffle machines, cereal, juice, coffee), and in-room safe are complimentary. We were there when the water pipe to the hotel broke for parts of 2 days.  It was unforeseen but inconvenient.  The hotel made arrangements for us to use the IHOP bathrooms next door and automatically discounted one night from our bill. The staff did what they could for us.  They brought bottled water to our room, kept us at least partially informed of what was happening, generally tried to help us, and kept apologizing for the inconvenience.   Since the water pipe break was unforeseen, the staff tried
Manager Response: Dear James T.,   I would like to extend my thanks to you and your family for your understanding in regard to the water outage. Despite the inconvenience you still had some really great comments about our hotel and I truly appreciate that. Thank you for choosing the Park Vue Inn and for recommending us to other travelers.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose  Director of Operations

Summary: This hotel was right across the street from the park and I had stayed there a few years ago and it wasn't bad.  My sister is in a wheel chair due to cancer so even even though it was pricey I booked it for four nights.  Didn't have a problem until the second day when the water main on their property broke.  No water!  Great for a hotel.  No toilet, bath, or anything for two days.  It rained on Wednesday and we were cold and tired - no hot bath.  Had to go IHOP to go to the restroom!  Yes, it finally got fixed late Thursday but the offer no compensation for our inconvenience.  To have my sister go all the way to IHOP was a serious inconvenience.   The mattresses were pretty hard but nothing we couldn't deal with.  The hot breakfast was just OK but they did have decent variety.  I
Manager Response: Dear Cindy,   I would like to apologize for the unsatisfactory service you received. I understand your frustration regarding the water outage. It seems as though our efforts to address this issue and compensate for the inconvenience went unnoticed. All guests were notified and informed of the progress and resources available to them throughout the outage. Guest rooms were visited by maintenance to deliver bottled water and the maintenance team also filled the toilets so they would flush. Phone calls were made to guests to inform them of the progress. If you were not in your guest room or had a do not disturb sign hung on the door then you may have missed these communication efforts. Guests were also compensated upon check out. If you did not visit the lobby to check out then you may not have received a final copy of your guest folio which reflected the compensation. I realize we fell short of your expectations and I wish to express my regrets for having done so. Please understand that our goal is to provide affordable, comfortable and convenient accommodations with great service. Unfortunately we sometimes miss the mark. My hope is to have another opportunity to be of superior service to you and your family.    Sincerely,   Brian DeRose  Director of Operations

Summary Heading: Happy with our stay to the Happiest Place on Earth
Summary: So convenient! The close walk made it so easy for our large family to get to and from Disneyland without having to wait for shuttles and load up our big stroller. Breakfast, Wi-Fi, and parking included were great bonuses as well! The breakfast was not gourmet or anything but we always found something for everyone and it made it quicker and easier to get on our way to the parks! No elevator to the second floor so we had to lug our luggage up the stairs, but we didn't have any issues with noise. The room was clean and made up each day while we were gone.  Friendly and helpful staff. We would definitely stay again.

Spent two nights at this hotel (two queen room) while visiting Disneyland in the latter part of Sept 2013. I have always wanted to stay at this hotel since it is as close as you can get to the main entrance to Disneyland, I mean it is right at the crosswalk to the entrance, but never was able to get reservations for the dates I needed which was mostly my fault for not make reservations further in advance. Very reasonable rate (123.00 + taxes) for being so close to Disney. This price also included a hot breakfast (eggs,bacon, biscuits & gravy, and etc). There is also an IHOP right next door if you prefer. Cold Stone Ice Cream is also right on the property if you want to satisfy that sweet tooth craving. Very satisfied with our stay and would stay again in a heartbeat. Highly
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We work diligently to provide a clean, confortable, and affordable home away from home. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn. We hope to serve you again soon.

Summary: We stayed here 3 yrs ago and was so happy decided to stay again. Last time we stayed in the queen bed/ bunk bed room. It was nice and very clean but we found it a bit cramped. This time we stayed 5 nights in the 2 queen beds/ bunk bed and 2 nights in the 2 bedroom suite. The 2 queen room #131 I don not recommend staying in. It's at the back if the motel and felt like a dungeon. Bathroom was awful. I HIGHLY recommend staying in the suite. It's worth the extra money and you are already saving money because of the awesome free hot breakfast. The suite has been updated and has 2 windows. It's very roomy. We will definitely be requesting that room again. The Park Vue Inn is great value for what you get. I would still recommend it to anyone wanting to stay close to Disney. Plus the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  Please know that we will be working on room 131. We will continue to work on our property to better serve our guests. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Okay, so it might not be as plush as some of the Disney resort hotels but it is a fraction of the price and only minutes walk.  The rooms are clean and comfortable. They can be a bit noisy at night, especially on the ground floor. The free breakfast provides a good start to the morning, although get there early to avoid the rush. Free parking so close to Disney is also a huge bonus.  The main benefit is that it is the closest non-Disney hotel to the park. This meant that when our daughter was getting tired we could nip back for a short break without spending ages travelling to and from the park.  If you are going to disney and do t want to stay in one of their hotels then you can not go wrong with the Park Vue
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property. The proximity to the Parks is one of our best amenities. We work hard to provide a clean and confortable place to stay. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn, we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: The location can't be beaten. We had a room with 2 queens and a separate living area which was great.  It meant we could put the kids to bed and stay up later ourselves.  The free wi-fi was excellent.  Breakfast was adequate.  It was only disappointing when they didn't refill items that had run out.  However, everything else was great.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Will definitely come back here. Cheaper than surrounding hotel prices. Clean well kept. One of the closest walking hotels to the park. Parking and wifi internet both free. They even let us stay parked for free  until the parks closed that night after checking out at 9 am. Right next to IHOP and Denny's for some inexpensive food. Friendly front desk. Frig microwave and safe in room.

I read about 50 reviews before I decided on this hotel. We approached our stay with hesitation but were looking for a location really close to the park as we have a 2-year old. We stayed 5 nights and couldn't have been more satisfied for the price and location. The staff was excellent- friendly, helpful, competent. Our room was a little dated but very well kept, clean and comfortable. The bed was comfortable. Everything in our room was in good working order. The pool was in great condition and perfect temperature. The free breakfast wasn't delicious but totally adequate with plenty of choices. And of course, the location - perfect! Our room was located upstairs at the far end of the property and we didn't experience noise issues. We will definitely recommend this place to our

Summary Heading: Pleasantly Surprised! Location Better Than Disney ;)
Summary: The other reviewers have nailed the location advantages - shortest distance to the front gates from ANY hotel, hands-down...including the Disney Resorts. I've passed this location a hundred times and assumed it was an average strip motel that got lucky in the 50's with a great location and had not changed much since. The reviews are 99% positive so we gave it a try for a Sat. night stay in Sept. and I was hoping for cleanliness and a mediocre breakfast.   Well, I couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised!   We had reserved a double queen room and the kids (ages 10 & 15) were thrilled to see that we ended up with a family room with bunk beds :) The room was freshly renovated, clean and spacious with a generous refrigerator, free wifi and onDemand shows for the kids during our

You cannot beat the location of this hotel. Directly across the street from the park entrances. It is smack in the middle. Good value as well since breakfast, wi-fi and parking are also included. Breakfast was decent with the hot dishes changing daily. Parking was easy, and wi-fi was good. Pool is also nice and fully enclosed (a little tricky to open the gate but at least the kids will not get out!). Towels provided poolside. Self-serve laundry facilities on-site as well.   Air-con in our room (146) was not set up as nice as other rooms, it was mounted high on the wall in front of the sink, this was irritating as it would blow in your face as you got ready in the morning. Bathtub and toilet were separate from the sink and a decent size.  In all, a great little place to stay.

Based on a recommendation from friends, we stayed at the Park Vue for one week while we visited Disneyland. The location is perfect - right across the road from the walkway entrance to the Park and having the pool, wifi & breakfast included in the room rate was a bonus! The staff were helpful & we would very happily stay here again.

Booked a trip from Australia to spend a week in LA. Was extremely happy with the service and the hotel staff!  Upon arrival at 8:30am I was told that our room was ready for us to check in even tho check in wasn't until 3:00pm.   Staff had left the aircon on and this was a great touch as it was boiling hot outside.   Maria on the front desk was polite, helpfull and one of the easiest people to deal with, Noting was ever too hard for her and she went the extra mile to make our trip wonderful.  She arranged for pick up and drop off for 3 tours and rang around to find the best deal for us, She arranged for a cab to collect us at 6am to get to LAX for our flight to NYC.   Upon check out we gave her a bottle of champagne to show our appreciation.   The hotel was less than 3 minuets

5 day pass at Disney & the Park Vie Inn served us very well. Directly accross the road made it so easy to get up late each day, have some of the provided breakfast food which was interesting but enough options to find something suitable & make our way over to the park. We came home mid afternoon most days for a cool off swim in the hotel pool which was perfect size for a dip. Room was really good value for our family of 6 & we were at the rear of the complex which was very quiet. Room service made our room up very cleanly each day & we would definitely return/recommend this hotel to family/friends. Plenty of restaurant options in close proximity too.

Park Vue Inn is the perfect hotel for a visit to Disneyland for families and singles.  The hotel is right across the street from Disneyland entrance.  The price is right-way cheaper than the Disneyland resort hotels.  Parking is free.  The free breakfasts are good for juice, milk, and cereal.  The ice cream store, Cold Stone, is attached to Park Vue in the front and discounts are given with room key.  Can't wait to go back!

I like staying here. I enjoy the convenient location. It costs less than I imagined it would. The staff is always very kind, and professional. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and quiet. Their free breakfast is pretty good, but the property is close to several family restaurants. They let you park free. I always feel rested when we stay here.

We just returned from our Disney trip. There were 17 of us with five rooms. We would all stay again. The rooms were great. The breakfast is ideal - has everything you need to start the day. Friendly staff. A great pool for swimming. But nothing beats the location. Opposite the entrance to Disney! This meant we could stroll back to our room each day at lunch time put our toddler down for a nap then return again in afternoon. We could also see fireworks from our room. Great dining locations just a stroll away. Will stay again and have already recommended it to others.

Summary Heading: Literally across the road from Disneyland
Summary: We could not have asked for more from the location, the amenities and the services nearby. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was perfect for our needs - 2 queen beds plus a foldout lounge in the sitting area with kitchen. Breakfast was included and was plentiful with hot and cold choices available - eggs, bacon or sausages, biscuits, waffles as well as cereals, freshly cut fruit, yoghurt etc. The fireworks were clearly seen each night from our room and although nothing beats seeing them from  inside Disneyland (spectacular to say the least).  As we are Australian we did not drive so found the bus exchange and the taxi rank across the road very convenient to take advantage of shopping the fabulous sales on non Disneyland days.  We thoroughly enjoyed the swimming pool ad spa

Nice Motel,free parking,free breakfast. The Greatest thing, it's so close to Disney front gate, which is a welcoming site when you have tired tootsies!! Will stay there again. Can't express enough...how convenient it is....Denny's next door, open 24hrs., kids eat free 4pm-Midnight, McDonald's close by. We were traveling with large group...so these options were great.Clean rooms,comfy pillows.Target is also close by, so you can stock up on water. We also took in the Medievil Dinner Show, close by, 20 mins. in Buena Park...kids Loved it!!

Summary Heading: Excellent room, great price, wonderful service
Summary: What could be better for a family of four staying near Disneyland than a room with a queen bed for us and a bunk bed for our daughters?  Add in the location, across the street from Main Gate, and a surprisingly good rate for being close enough to the park that you can walk back midday for a rest or a swim and it is fantastic.  The customer service was top notch, with particular kudos for the front desk where each question or request was handled quickly, professionally, and with a smile. I would definitely stay here again, and have already recommended it to friends who were planning a road trip to 'the House of Mouse.'

This is by far the best hotel near Disneyland, not because it has all the amenities you may want, this hotel doesn't  but it's because; it's across the street from the front gate, so you save on parking for one, the people there treat you very well if you are going to Disney for a birthday or anniversary, let them know and they'll have something special in your room waiting for you, the hotel has a fridge, microwave, free breakfast  although not to write home about it, it has a happy hour late in the afternoon. All in all a great small hotel.

Stayed in suite very roomy, loved the choice of continental breakfast inside or outside. Loved the biscuits and gravy. Rooms were clean. Staff friendly. Quiet and directly across the street from entrance to Disney's entrance.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We will continue to work hard, to provide a great stay for all our guests. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn, we hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Good Motel.  It is what it is.
Summary: Park View Inn is a good Motel.  It's not a beautiful resort property with lush grounds and a celebrity lifestyle.  It is what it is, a motel with a pool in the parking lot right across the street from the Disney Resorts. Somewhere between a Motel 6 and a Holiday Inn.  Our party booked three rooms and all three were clean and comfortable.  Our rooms were toward the back of the property, so It was fairly quiet through the night.  I did not hear any traffic noise at all.  The beds were quite comfortable, a little firm, which I felt was good for my back.  The free breakfast was as good or better than Holiday Inn Express or Hampton Inn type hotels.  The weather in Anaheim this week was in the high 90's to low 100's with high humidity, so it was very refreshing to get back to the room
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted that your stay was great. We will continue to work diligently to provide the highest level of customer service. It is always our goal to provide a clean confortable home away from home. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn. We hope to have another opportunity to serve you and your family.

Summary Heading: Hard to beat for families looking for price/location combo
Summary: When we last visited Disneyland, we stayed at a fancier hotel in a one-bedroom suite--maybe a Hilton?  That was great, but when I looked at that and similar hotels this time I was put off by the high price.  I also remembered that just about all Disney-area hotels offer shuttles to the park... but not always very regularly.  So I ended up opting for the Park Vue, which is literally about a 3 1/2 minute walk from the park's entrance.  I made the choice with some trepidation, having read reviews here that varied pretty dramatically.  We ended up having a very positive experience, so my assumption is that the hotel has just had some inconsistency issues over time.  It's nothing fancy:  The rooms are pretty simple, and the walls and floors are a little thin, so noise COULD be an
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. Thank you for the detailed review and your suggestions. It is always our hope to provide a home away from home. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We stayed here when my daughter ran in the Tinkerbell Half Marathon at Disneyland in January 2013.   The rooms are nice and clean.  It's just across the street from the park, so convenient.  The lobby has coffee and juice, apples.  If you check in late afternoon, youre greeted with warm,freshly baked cookies!  They have a good free breakfast on site. Make your own waffles, hot scrambled eggs, biscuits and gravy, plus a variety of cereals, bagels, toast, and fresh fruit.   You can watch the fireworks from their parking lot!  The pool is nice and there is. Jacuzzi/hot tub that's great for soothing those all day walking thru Disneyland aches and pains.  Let the kids splash in the pool while you relax in the jacuzzi!  There is an iHop next door and a Cold Stone ice cream parlor on
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. We are delighted to know that you had a great stay. It could get a bit noisy at times, which is expected being across the street from Disney. Once everyone gets settled in it’s very calm and quiet. Thank you for choosing Park Vue inn. We hope to have another opportunity to serve you.

Summary: Liked the proximity to Disneyland Resorts, the free wifi, parking and hot breakfast! The hotel itself was decent. The key selling features would be the proximity to Disneyland Resorts as you could go back and forth during the day without a lengthy traveling time. Great for kids!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. We are happy that your stay was good. We will continue to work on our property, amenities, and service to better accommodate all of our guests. We hope that on your next visit we are able to provide a great stay. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn.

Summary: We have stayed here many times over the past three years.  It is literally across the street from the entrance to Disneyland/California Adventure.  The beds are comfortable and the rooms have always been clean.  The only thing I would caution is that if you get a double queen room that connects with another room (and you are/are not associated with the guests in the other room) you can absolutely hear everything that is being said and done in the other room.    We also took advantage of the pool this trip because of the heat and humidity and it was perfect to be able to come back and cool off and then head back to the park later.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. We will continue to work hard to provide a great place to stay for all of our guests. Thank you for being a loyal customer. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Great stay for family with young children
Summary: We stayed here based on the proximity to the Disney parks. Location was literally across the street from Disneyland.  Nice, clean, basic inn with friendly staff. We arrived early and was able to park in their lot until check-in.   Great place to rest at mid-day when the sun is beating down on you then head back for evening fun. Our kids ages 7 and 2 had no problem walking back to the inn after walking all over the parks because its so close. Note: there is no elevator at this inn.  We usually eat at White Water Snacks (next to pool bar) at the Grand Californian- no crowds, can always find a seat, free fountain drink refills, hot and cold food selection for my young picky eaters :)
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. We are glad to hear that your stay was great. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel in May 2013 and found it nice enough to rebook for another 2 night stay in August. We booked a month or so in advance and only expected to be a party of 3. At the last minute we decided to bring our 2 teenage daughters along (they were going to pass because we go to Disneyland a lot). Knowing there aren't additional fees for children and that the room we previously stayed in would accommodate us, we headed in. I got the room I requested ( a queen with bunk beds), but was astounded at how tiny it was!!! As it turns out, the rooms are MARKEDLY different sizes (but not a different rate).  I spoke with the front desk and was basically told that had I not brought the girls the room would be fine. I disagree. There was no place to set a suitcase (they told me
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   I would like to begin by extending an apology for your experience.  I realize the room you stayed in felt a bit cramped. Room 115 can hardly be considered a closet; however if you have more than the recommended number of guests in that room I suppose it would feel like one. Room 115 is approximately 5 square feet smaller than the other rooms of the same type.
