I typically do not stay in motels with doors to the exterior, but I found no trouble with noise or other folks wandering onto the property. There is barely enough parking and the spaces are small, but it is free. (Parking tags help keep others from using their lot.) The rooms were spacious and the beds comfortable. The only reason why I did
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review. We are happy that your stay was great. We apologize for the inconvenience of the towel. We can assure you that our laundry employees do not smoke. We will take this information and help us better serve our guests. Thank you for choosing Park Vue . We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: My family and I stayed at the Park Vue Inn for 2 nights while visiting Disneyland.  We visit Disneyland quite often and have stayed at many of the surrounding hotels.  We decided to try Park Vue because I had read many good reviews about it, the location is unbeatable and the parking is free.  Check in was great, we were able to park and pre register early so we could enjoy the parks.  The hotel is right across the street (an easy walk) and that is were my positive comments run out.  After a day at the park my family stopped by the lobby and retrieved our keys and obtained our luggage.  Note: if you have a large family or a lot of luggage request a room at ground level.  The hotel does not have an elevator and you have to drag all your luggage up the stairs (like we did).   So
Manager Response: Dear Rachel,   It seems like you had a less than desirable visit with us. I'll save any excuses and just say that we do our best to ensure the cleanliness of every guest room and pride ourselves on our service. According to our records your room was serviced, but unfortunately the after hours maintenance was assisting another guest when your call came through. The tub was photographed to show the room’s division manager the area of complaint. I hold all of my employees accountable and I have addressed this incident with both the housekeeper and the department supervisor. I only wish you would have requested to speak to me directly and I would have had the opportunity to correct this issue sooner. I would like to offer a sincere apology for your experience. I realize we may have lost you as a guest but should you have a change of heart, I would like the opportunity to be of better service to you and your family. Our door is always open.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose  Director of Operations

Summary Heading: Great for Disneyland, ok for anything else
Summary: I usually stay in 4 and 5 star hotels for business and 3 for personal travel so that can help you understand my comments and rating. It's great being right across the street and it's better than the hotel property immediately to the south. I prefer to be close and walk in than get a hotel shuttle every day, but the rooms are ok. Bed was great, pillows poor, bathroom not so great. One morning there was no hot water. We called and they got right on it and it was hot in 45 minutes. But the boiler shouldn't have gone out in the first place. The breakfast is pretty basic but does have the make it yourself waffles. No fruit. Very nice people. Overall, I would stay again, but maybe try another property to see if anything is better and close.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us on this visit. We will utilize your review to help us improve our hotel and amenities for our future guests. It is our goal to exceed our guest’s expectations. We apologize for any inconvenience, and we hope that you would visit us again soon.

Summary: This motel is tops for location to Disneyland and California Adventure.  It's directly across from the access road running between the parks and as close as some of the Disney hotels.  Our room had two doubles plus bunk beds, which was great for our larger family.  It also had a separate sink/dressing area with a fridge and microwave.  The included breakfast was not kept well stocked, and the breakfast area was over-crowded even with quite a few rooms empty for refurbishing.  This could be a problem at high season, but it was nice to have something to eat before heading to the parks.  There is also an IHOP right next door, a Coldstone Creamery off the lobby, and many other restaurants including McDonalds nearby.  We would stay here again if visiting Disneyland for its great
Manager Response: Thank you for writing this review. We are pleased to know that you stay was Great. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: We had a 'split stay' in Anaheim, first staying for 3 nights at the Disneyland Hotel then transferring to the Park Vue for 5 nights.  We expected to be disappointed, but we weren't.  We already knew that the location of this hotel was unquestionably fantastic but the service and room were also excellent.  We stayed in a 2 queen w/pull out sofa room.  This room also had a kitchen and the sofa was in a separate lounge room so the room was quite big.  We could put our daughter to sleep and still watch tv without it disturbing her.  The room was very clean and when we arrived the towels were folded into swans which was fun.  They knew it was my birthday and had left a gift and a note to say happy birthday and a voucher for an icecream cake from cold rock (delicious!!) which was so
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We are happy that we were able to make your stay excellent. It is always our goal to not just meet, but exceed our guest’s expectations. We will continue to provide a clean confortable home away from home to all our guests. We thank you again for your kind words. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Our family of four just spent 3 nights at the Park Vue Inn.  It was our first time staying at this hotel after getting a recommendation from a friend.  We loved the location, right across the street from the main entrance.  The location was appreciated most by our legs after a long day at the parks, and there was also no complaining from our boys about the length of the walk back to our hotel. We found the rooms a bit dated, but liked the overall room size and layout.  We had a room with 2 queen beds, which were very comfortable.  We also liked having the sink and mirror outside of the bathroom with the shower and toilet.  The one downside to the rooms was the noise from adjacent rooms and the hallways.  It seemed like you could hear every conversation nearby.  Apparently, the
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us. We will take your recomendations to help improve our hotel. We are happy to know that your stay was pleasant. We will continue to work hard to provide a great place to stay. Thank you for your kind words, we hope to see you soon.

Summary: Four of us (3 adults and 3-year old) stayed in a room with one queen bed and a bunk bed. Room was small, but spent most of the time at the Disneyland or California Adventure Park, so it did not matter. It was equiped with coffee maker, fridge and microwave. The hotel was very close to the main entrance, and we were able to watch fireworks from our hotel. Parking was free, even on the check-out day (until midnight), so it was very reasonable. Complementary reakfast had a pretty good variety of things - coffee, juice, yogurt, fruits, cereals, waffles, toast, pastries, eggs, sausage/bacon. Only feature that needs improvement was height of the sink, which was too high for our toddler, and there was no step stool. There were many toddlers staying at the hotel, so it would be helpful
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. It has been our goal to provide a home away from home. We will continue to work hard to provide this for all our guests. Thank you for choosing Park Vue, we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Located right across the street from the Disneyland gate, this hotel was convenient and made for a relaxing trip. We felt like we could go back and forth from the hotel easily. We loved the free parking and free wifi. The breakfast buffet was pretty good, especially the waffles. The beds are comfortable enough. The bathroom fixtures could use some updating. The staff was helpful.Overall this was a comfortable, fun stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are pleased to know that your stay was fun and relaxing. We will continue to work on the property and are currently making some renovations in the bathrooms. Thank you for choosing Park Vue, we hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Very close to entrance, nice room. super staff
Summary: We were pretty pleased with this hotel.  It is right at the crosswalk to go into Disney, so it is probably as close as you can get.  Our room had two queen beds which were very comfortable. The shower was super.  The breakfast was very good.  We had biscuits and gravy, waffles, fruit, bacon and eggs.  Everything was hot and well-stocked. (We went about 8:30.) The staff could not have been any nicer.  We left our bag before we went to the park and it was moved to our room.  They were more than friendly and helped us with every question we had.  I felt like we got Ritz treatment the whole time! My one reservation was that the floor felt a little sticky (on the tiles) and the carpet seemed a little dirty (on our socks). Everything else was VERY clean...and we are obsessively picky!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We strive to provide the highest level of customer service to all of our guests. Thank you for your kind words. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Location can't be beat, right across the street from Disneyland. Staff is friendly. Perfect for families -- expansive breakfast spread, bunk beds for kids are great. Pool and hot tub are located in a gated area off the parking lot -- worked well for my kids.  Outdoor entry to rooms in typical California/motel style. Not a fancy (Ritz Carlton style) but clean, great free parking and and a great value!  Even has a Disney gift shop on site where we bought a Minnie hat for my daughter. A little funny that a sign for Cold Stone Creamery is on the same sign as the hotel, but oh well! Really convenient and no shuttle involved -- can easily walk from the park, have a nap or swim, and go back.  Enjoy!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience and taking the time to review our Hotel. I am very happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay. Though it's true we are not the "Ritz" we strive to provide world class hospitality and a clean family friendly environment; seems like we hit the mark during your stay. As a side note that Cold Stone is owned by the Hotel, hence the reason they share a sign with us. If you didn't have the chance to make to the Cold Stone this trip perhaps you will on your next visit. Thank you for choosing our Hotel. We look forward to your next stay with us.   Warm Regards,   Brian DeRose  Director of Operations

Summary Heading: Choose it if location and price are your main factors
Summary: This is not, by any definition, a nice hotel.  The rooms are small and poorly ventilated, the exposure of the rooms directly to the parking lot means you will be awakened at 6:45 a.m. literally every morning by the crowds that are headed to early opening of Disneyland or rolling their suitcases noisily across the sidewalk, and the place has the look of an old motel that has had a lot of surface-cosmetic fixups without any major renovation in a long time.  We stepped outside to clouds of smoke from smokers in the parking lot every day. But did my kids have a great time there?  They sure did.  Bunk beds, steps from Disneyland, nonstop cookies and candy in the lobby, and breakfast with a waffle maker are all a kid needs to find happiness at a hotel. We came here only after the
Manager Response: I would like to thank you for your honest review of our property.  We are currently undergoing some improvement projects, so the areas of the Hotel you're referring to are being renovated. I apologize for the disturbances you experienced. We make every effort to remind other guests to be mindful of their neighbors as evidenced by our many signs inside and outside our guest rooms throughout the property. Unfortunately people don't always follow the signs direction. We do have a smoking section located away from the hotel; however guests don't always adhere to that policy either. I am glad your family did enjoy their stay overall and I hope you will give us another opportunity to be of service.   Sincerely,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for...
Summary: We are a family of four and come to Disneyland every couple of years.  We have tried a few of the hotels close to the park and although I have never written a review before, thought I would share our experience at the Park Vue Inn (stayed there from March 1, 2013 - March 9, 2013).  The hotel is ok.  Location can’t be beat as it is literally right across the street from the parks.  The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful when we needed something.  The free breakfast was nothing to write home about…there were two different “Hot” breakfasts that switched every other day.  One day was scrambled eggs, sausage and hash browns (if you were there early enough before they ran out).  The other day was a scrambled egg patty (basically scrambled eggs in the shape of an
Manager Response: I appreciate that you took the time to give your review. It seems like you had a mediocre stay at our Hotel, and for that I must apologize. Currently the breakfast area in undergoing some improvements as you mentioned. Our breakfast is very popular and yes it can get pretty busy, but we shouldn’t run out of food. I will address that immediately with the staff. I will also address the concerns you had with your guest room with my room’s manager and housekeeping staff. Our mission is to provide a clean affordable home away from home. I hope that your next trip to Disney will find you staying with us. We look forward to an opportunity to be of better service.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary: Chose to stay here based on Tripadvisor reviews and their rating since I wanted to be the closest to Disneyland as possible!  So they are exactly across the street fro the walk-in gate.  Arrived in early am and there was no problem parking for the whole day.  Staff was nice and helpful.  The room is great for families or in our case a mom and two teens who all want their own bed since there are cozy bunk beds.  This makes the room tight but manageable since we were only there to sleep.  the room was adequately clean but showing age with bathroom paint starting to peel and other small details.  Definitely a much used hotel but really if you are doing Disney you are not in the room alot.  The breakfast was quite complete and the afternoon cookie were super yummy.  For a night or
Manager Response: We appreciate your review. We are happy to know that your stay was good. We are in the process of re-painting the bathrooms, and also the whole property. We should be done soon. Thank you for choosing Park Vue inn we hope to see you soon.

Summary: This was our third stay at the Park Vue Inn and this property never fails to impress us.  This time we stayed in a room with two queens and bunkbeds.  Our children who are 17 and 10 loved having their own beds and this also allowed Grandma to have her own bed with mom and dad in the other queen.  A definite bonus is the large fridge and microwave in the room.   Unlike some other reviews, we have always found the staff to be very friendly and very helpful.  It took literally 2 minutes to check in.  Twice we locked ourselves out and both times the staff was very helpful and quick to get us back in our room.    As always, we are thoroughly impressed with the morning breakfast.  It includes fresh fruit, yogourt, boiled eggs, bagels, bread, cereals, waflle irons,scrambled eggs and
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your kind words and tips for our future guests. We are happy to know that we were able to provide a great stay once again. Thank you for being a loyal customer, and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Excellent for families if you can deal with the noise.
Summary: This place is by far the best place to stay near Disneyland if you're on a budget. Located directly across the street from the main entrance on Harbor Blvd. The rooms are small, but they offer really cozy bunk beds for the kids. Simply put, if you just need a place to sleep and shower, you can't do any better for the money. My only major complaint is the noise level. From as early as 7am there are kids running up down the hall excited to get their started. One more thing, parking is included in the rate and they let us leave our car in the lot the morning we checked out so we could go back to the park. Big bonus points for that as most places in the area charge $15 a day to park in the hotel lot.  This is a place for families and those looking for an easy access hotel close to
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that your stay was excellent. We will continue to work hard at providing the highest level of customer. Thank you for choosing Park Vue, we hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Stay away! don't be fooled by the location
Summary: Rude staff, not clean hotel, noisy, and it's not cheap! There are several better options within walking distance! It's the worst place I ever stayed in. Rude staff, not clean hotel, noisy, and it's not cheap! There are several better options within walking distance!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We would like to apologize for not being able to provide a great experience on this visit. It is always our goal to provide world class hospitality. We would like to know more in specific where we fell short. If you could please contact management at the hotel, we would love to find out a bit more about your stay. Thank you again for your review, as this helps to keep improving our services for our guests.

Summary: If you are on a budget trip to Disneyland the Park Vue Inn is the place to stay. Great value for your $$ . It does have a 3* motel feeling but it is clean, the free breakfast and free wi-fi are great and the best part of it is the location, it's by far the closest you can be from the parks. We stayed there for 5 days with our 8 and 4 year olds and had no problems at all, some people complaint about the noise but it didn't bother us at all, we were usually in bed before he parks closed and we were so exhausted that never heard anyone walking by the rooms or anything like that A couple years ago we stayed at the Disneyland Hotel which was great but it does cost about 3x more and you pay extra for breakfast and wi-fi. We made the decision to use that extra money on the parks and we
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy that your family enjoyed your stay with us.  We will continue to work hard to providing world class hospitality to all of our guests. We hope to see you again soon. We will keep the cookies warm for you guys.

Summary: The best thing about the Park Vue Inn is convenience. It is right across the street from the Disneyland gate. The bonuses were free parking and free breakfast. The breakfast was pretty standard fare, the waffles were really good. The free wifi seemed really fast. The bathroom fixtures could probably use upgrades and the breakfast area could use more seating at peak times, but overall it was a great stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We thank you for your recommendations. We are currently working on some improvements to our property. These improvements include the remodeling of the dining room, and remodeling of the Bathrooms in all of our rooms. We hope that these projects are finished by your next visit. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn, we hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Best value for trip to Disney Land
Summary: The entry into Disney is right across the street! I appreciated the free parking and full breakfast the hotel offered in the morning. Our boys enjoyed the pool while my husband and I recharged in the hot tub before we went back for an evening of Disney. The hotel lobby also sells tickets to Disney inclusive of multi day hopper passes. We bought tickets when we checked in so we were ready to go the next morning. There is a Disney gift shop downstairs, a Cold Stone, McDonalds and 24 hour IHOP. An added bonus was being able to see the fireworks from our room! The boys were exhausted so we grabbed ice cream at Cold Stone and headed up to the comfy room to enjoy the show. Our room had bunk beds for the boys and a queen bed for us. We can't wait to go back to Park Vue Inn!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad that your stay was great. We will continue to work diligently to provide a clean, confortable, home away from home. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Do yourself a favour and STAY HERE! Love it!
Summary: What a great experience!  We recently spend 7 weeks touring the US and Canada - 2 adults and 2 children (aged 12 and 8).  We picked all our accommodation from trip advisor reviews.  This was one of our best finds.  You can not beat the location.  You literally walk out the hotel door, cross the road and you are walking through the main gate of Disneyland!  It is very clean and very comfortable and beautifully maintained.  We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds plus bunk beds so plenty of room to spread out.  Being so close we were able to pop back to our hotel room later in the day to pick up some warmer clothing for the cooler evenings.  Perfect.  Breakfast was provided which was a plus and was more than adequate.  The breakfast room does not have a lot of seating, but then
Manager Response: We are so very pleased that you to the time to review our hotel. Thank you for all your kind words and for your recommendations to other travelers. We strive each day to provide world class hospitality and service. It is our pleasure to serve and we look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: We booked our rooms at the Park Vue Inn, right Cross from the main entrance to Disneyland. It is about a five minute walk from the hotel to the ticket booths and park entrance, which makes coming back for lunch or a rest very convenient.  I was hesitant when I first saw the ratings for the Park Vue since we had stayed there many years ago when our four boys were just kids. There was a day when the park was surrounded by what we always called the Disney “Dive” hotels. And the Park Vue was right up there with them. You know the ones…keep your shoes on to avoid black feet) It was pretty bad. But I placed my trust in the TripAdvisor ratings and went for it.  There are 20 of us now, including 9 grand kids under 10 yrs old. We booked a couple of months early, hoping to get some larger
Manager Response: Thank you for giving us a second chance! We have made several improvements to our property and services over the years. Hopefully on your next visit you'll be even more amazed as we are currently undergoing some additional improvements to our property, services, amenities and guest rooms. We are so happy that your family group enjoyed our hotel, services and staff. We look forward to your next visit. Thank you for choosing our hotel.

Summary: Parkvue is closer to the gates than some of the Disney properties but I'm sure 1/3 the price. We went in with information gathered on trip advisor. We got what we expected:close location,clean,comfy beds, heated pool and jacuzzi, wide variety of hot breakfast and yes, noise. It is noisy because it is a motel with wooden floors. Kids are up at 7 am with excitement. Expect noise after 7 am and don't expect to sleep in. It is what it is. We had to get up at this te anyways. The warm pool,price,location and  breakfast outweighs the noise.  Everyday, we went back  in the PM for a swim. Be aware that the pool is 9 ft deep. My kids loved this but it could be dangerous for little ones. Supervising is necessary.   If you want to be quiet as possible take this advise.   Request a room
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review. We are happy that your stay was great. It is our goal to provide a clean, confortable, home away from home. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue 3 years ago and enjoyed our stay once again.  It's not a high end hotel but it was clean, had friendly and helpful staff, the beds were comfortable and the breakfast had a number of options (fruit, waffles, eggs, sausage/bacon, hash browns, cereal, toast, bagels, juice, coffee, tea...).  The swimming pool is quite warm which allowed my kids to swim even though the weather was a little on the cool side.  We stayed near the back of the property on the second floor (RM 236) in a room with 2 queen beds.  The room was a decent size (bigger than the room with a queen and bunk beds that we stayed in previously) and very quiet as it wasn't a high traffic area for other guests.  The people beside us were quite quiet which was helpful as I could see that noisy or
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. The proximity to the parks is one of our best amenities. We strive to provide the highest level of customer service. We hope to see you again soon. Thank you for being a loyal guest.

Summary Heading: The Best Hotel Deal for Disneyland
Summary: The Park Vue Inn was INCREDIBLE!  Every morning they provided us with a delicious hot breakfast. My kids LOVED making their own waffles!  My wife and I loved the variety of breakfast foods. From the yogurt to the eggs, it was simply delicious for all of our palates.  Also, the heated pool and jacuzzi was a wonderful way to unwind on a crisp February evening.  I can't say enough about how amazing this hotel is.......I just hope they don't raise the prices because you get A LOT more than you pay for! (woops, forget to mention this is the closest hotel to Disney's entrance gates:)
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to know that we were Incredible. It is always our goal to provide a clean, confortable, and affordable accommodations. Thank you for your kind words, we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Stayed at Park Vue from Feb 2-10 and found it to be comfortable and super close to Disney.  Lots of parking, decent breakfast which saves lots of $, and exactly what I expected based on previous Tripadvisor reviews and pictures.  Good value for the price.  Tonnes of nearby amenities.  Nothing fancy but clean and we had good service.  Would come back again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are very happy to know that your stay was great. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn we hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland but bit disappointed.
Summary: My family of six stayed at Park Vue Inn for 7 nights in early December mainly because of positive reviews in tripadvisor and included breakfast and social hour dinners(no longer available). It is very close to the pedestrian entrance into Disneyland and family-style restaurants/ takeaways are in close proximity. We had two Queen with bunkbed rooms side by side on the ground floor. THey were close to the front entrance, so quite noisy with everyone walking past. Rooms near the back of the hotel would be quieter. Rooms were generally clean, but my husbands room had a nasty, musty smell in it. Beds and bedding were comfortable. Breakfast was OK. THe laundry room was out of order which was a hassle with 4 children's clothes to wash. Staff did not know when it was due to be fixed.
Manager Response: We apologize that your stay was anything less than satisfying. We are currently working on many upgrades to our building, rooms, and amenities. We hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you. Thank you taking the time to review our hotel.

Summary Heading: Great stay for a great price!
Summary: Stayed from January 23-27, 2012 and had a great time, room was clean and it was especially nice to have a ground floor room, considerint we had a stroller.  Additionally we have the 1 queen and 1 bunkbed room which was great for our 5 year old to sleep in, just like at home.  Breakfast was great with hot items like, eggs, bacon, sausage, hashbrowns, waffles, as well as toast, bagels, cereal, hardboiled egges, yogurt, juice, milk and/or coffee.  However, it would be better if more seating in breakfast area.  But the greatest benefit of this hotel is the location to Disneyland, it's directly across the street from the shuttle entrance to the park.  You just have to cross the crosswalk and you are at the park, so convenient and easy to use.  This is the #1 reason we stay at this
Manager Response: We are very pleased that you enjoyed your stay and found our amenities and location to be exactly what you were looking for. Thank you for your review and for continuing to choose our hotel. See you on your next visit.

Summary: This is the closest accommodation to Disneyland and California Adventure. It's literally just across the road! We were hardly ever here as we spent most of our time at the parks but the rooms are large and comfortable and breakfast is included. I would definitely stay here again because of its comfort and convenience!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Our location is definately one of our many assests. We are so glad you enjoyed your stay and look foward to your next visit.

Summary: This is the closest off-Disney property, directly across the street from the Disneyland main gate.  We have stayed in numerous hotels on Harbor Blvd and we like this one the best.  The rooms are quiet enough to sleep through other guests coming and going and/or the Disney Fireworks.  Parking is tight but when timed correctly, we parked right outside our door.    Breakfast was good, the pool is heated and fun even at night.    With a 3+day Disney ticket purchase from the front desk, you're able to get into the parks 1 hour earlier than opening time.  Really worth it!!  Thanks, Park Vue, we had a great time and appreciated your hotel.  We'll be back.

We just left the Park Vue Inn after a 10 day stay. It is right across the street which makes it perfect for a duck out of the park to refresh and eat without paying inflated Disney prices. Because of the the location you can get from Star Tours to the hotel in about 10 minutes or so at a normal pace. The room came with a fridge and microwave so after a quick stock up at the Foods for Less on Katella for waters,cheap beer and grub you are all set. More stores are at the mall including a large CVS pharmacy. Check your fridge prior to going to make sure it is not frosted up. If it is they will defrost it or you can do it as I did. Its not that the fridge is not good it just the moisture in the Anaheim air builds up the frost over time and the fridge will not perform well if iced

Wow!  We have stayed at this hotel 5 times.  This trip, we decided to upgrade our room for a room with a jacuzzi tub.  It was awesome.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  They have great breakfasts and the hotel is directly across from Disneyland entrance.  Don't forget to try the Pizza Press (just down the street) awesome pizza in about 7 minutes.  We have also brought our son (age 6 mo and 12 mo).  It was great.

I reviewed this hotel in 2010, but there have been some changes and it seems like to time to do another review.  I always have really mixed emotions when I review the Park Vue because I don't want anyone else to know it exists!  In my opinion, this is the only place to stay when visiting Disneyland.  Why?  Here's my list: -it is closer to the parks than any Disney resort hotel except the very pricy (but nice) Grand Californian.   -it offers a better breakfast than any other hotel that is as close - and we have stayed at or carefully researched all the close ones.  The hotels of the Disney resort don't offer a free breakfast at all. -The Park Vue keeps its pool and hot tub at the perfect temperatures.  The pool is warm enough to plunge right into (and I am one of those "inch into

We were at the Park Vue Inn from January 27 to February 3, and were very pleased with our stay.  Our room was clean, a good size and nicer than I was expecting.  We were in a 2 queen room, and found the beds & pillows to be very comfortable, though not luxurious.  The water pressure in the room was very good (my husband loved it).  The free breakfast was very nice, and a good way to start our day.  The selection was not as varied as I'd been lead to believe by other reviews, but it was very nice.  Everyday there was a make-your-own waffle station, eggs, bacon or sausge,  3 kinds of cereal, fruit, yogurt, bread & bagles to toast, juice and coffee - it was nothing special, but it was nice to have something "free".  The breakfast room was clean with seating inside or outside.  We

We stayed here purely for the location, which can't be beat.  We stayed in the 2 Queens and bunk bed room, which fit our family perfectly.  The room was clean but had a heavily perfumed smell.  The bathroom was mostly clean except for some sort of leaching mess coming from the handicapped bar in the shower.  Tub seemed clean but we didn't want to bath children in it.  Mini fridge seemed to freeze everything no matter the setting.  Very little counter space at the vanity.  Pillows were all very flat and very used.  Avoidance of a comforter by using two top sheets with a blanket in between was novel.  Breakfast seemed less great than past visits, no longer did the hotel manager greet breakfast guests and take our tickets.  I only noticed the manager walking around with a scowl on
Manager Response: Your review is very much appreciated. I am not always aware of my expression. This observation will make me more aware of how others perceive me and for that I thank you. I would like to address your concerns about the property. I can assure you that everything you mentioned regarding your guest room has been corrected. Modifying some of our offerings like the gift baskets made room for better quality amenities and aesthetic improvements to our overall property and services. Many of these improvements are currently in place and the remaining upgrades will be completed this spring. We aim to please and hope you will consider giving us another try on your next visit.   Kind Regards,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary: The staff was excellent, they sold us our disney tickets. They had lemonade a and cookies in the lobby and the breakfast was great. Kids enjoyed the pool. The distance to Disney cannot be beat! Would stay there again in a heartbeat. The staff was all very friendly.

What a difference a year makes!! Last year Awesome basket in room upon arrival with a bottle of wine, water, and fruit. This year NO Basket. Last year huge birthday gift bag for my daughter. This Year NO gift Bag. Last year dinner social. This year NO Dinner. Last year pleasant experience with very friendly Staff. This year staff sucks. This year more money a night to stay?????? Brian quit making excuses. These small things were what made the hotel cool. Other than that tiny rooms with thin walls and trash trucks at 6 AM. No thanks will not return
Manager Response: I have to say that this is not the type of review I look forward to, but they do help me to better my services. I do regret that you were so disappointed and I can appreciate that your expectations were not met. As you mentioned in your review, you seem to feel I am making excuses. I know that managing any business requires making decisions that are not always easy to make. Yes it’s true we discontinued Social Hour and scaled back on the gift baskets. However in doing so we were able to upgrade other amenities guests overwhelmingly requested such as better Wi-Fi, Flat screen HDTV's with free movies, and high quality amenities, sundries, towels and linens. We strive to provide world class hospitality and service and there are many challenges in that pursuit. I realize I may never have the opportunity to win back your loyalty, and this I will have to accept. However, should you have a change of heart; our door is always open to you and your family.  Sincerely,   Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary Heading: Close but u get what u pay for
Summary: We travelled with our 4 year old and chose this place because of the location and various reviews on here so we knew what to expect.  I would recommed for the budget concious and those who want to be within walking distance of the parks. I would not recommend for people who require a little more luxary and being close to the park is not important.  Would we stay here again - No but that's a personal choice.   Pros Location Value for money Breakfast included Friendly staff  Cons Rooms Pool Noise

I was really overwhelmed with trying to find the best place to stay for our 4 day trip at Disneyland. I wanted to be close as possible to the park, and found the maps really confusing while trying to decide which hotel looked best. Park Vue hands down is the closest!  We had fantastic service. Checked in around 8:00pm. Very friendly staff. Snacks and juice were on the counter for us to help ourselves to. Seeing as we were checking in on a Sunday evening, they informed us the Fireworks at DL would be starting up soon, and gave us directs to the best viewing area on their property. We ended up just watching them from the parking lot, and had a great view even from there! We had an awesome King Room with Jacuzzi tub. Lots of room. Nice bathroom. Nice little mini kitchen area with

Excellent value, great location, awesome breakfast, free parking, but if flying, no need for rental vehicle.  Directly across from Disney main gate. We came with our kids and grandkids, was close enough to come back for a rest in the afternoon, or to stay with the baby while mom and dad went to Disneyland with the older kids for awhile.  Quiet rooms, very courteous staff.

This was a great choice for our trip to Disneyland. The hotel was clean, staff friendly, and the convenience to the park couldn't have been better. We enjoyed the breakfast, hot tub, afternoon cookies, fruit and drinks in the lobby, and free parking! The towels were not soft. We'd come again!

We recently stayed at Park Vue Inn as a recommendation from friends at work.  They certainly lived up to their word. We stayed there for 3 nights for the sole purpose of visiting Disneyland with a 3 day pass.   The entrance is directly across the road.  Absolutely fabulous location for the Park. Also great eating places all around the Park Vue Inn, and very inexpensive, and great food. We found the staff very pleasant, and when we walked into the room we were very impressed. We booked a Jacuzzi room, and after walking for hours around Disneyland, it was a welcome treat. The room was very clean, very spacious, and the bed very comfy. The whole area was spotless, and we noticed someone constantly cleaning up the area.   Oh just one minor issue.  The Internet is not very good at

This was our first time at park vue hotel. We stayed here because of the reviews on trip advisor. It is nothing fancy but clean and the beds are comfortable. The pool was very heated which is the only way I will get in one. It must have been at least 85-90  degrees. Because it is right accross the street from disneyland, we could come back to our room, have lunch, go swimming and then just walk back to the park. One night we did not feel like going back to see the fireworks and wondered if we could see them from the hotel. We opened the curtains and there they were. We layed in bed and watched them. The free breakfast was fine and the cookies at night were great. The hotel is not too pricey and you can not beat the location. We will stay here again. Oh yes and the staff was very

For the price, this little place is excellent value with breakfast included, fresh cookies and fruit and cordial at reception for you to take and friendly helpful staff to boot! Literally across the road from Disney entrance and a short walk around the corner to anaheim garden walk with shops and restaurants.stayed with 2 teenage boys in a double queen room, which had 2 queen beds , bathroom, coffee marker and uht milk (instead of the powdered whitener a lot of the more expensive hotels give you!) and a microwave.  Good clean room, comfy beds, tv and hot shower! What more could you ask for. Had a couple of issue with toilet blocking, which was attended to ASAP. I bought my tickets for Disney here $5 cheaper than the Internet.  Please note, nothing against the hotel because they

Summary Heading: Best location for people on a budget!!
Summary: If I was a budget conscience person or family visiting this is without a doubt the place I would recommend!!!  Pros Best location for Disneyland for people on a budget, right across from the entry to the parks and surrounded by convenience stores and restaurants, no need for shuttles or taxis! Parking available Wifi Free meals Fridge in room Pool Very family orientated Free cookies! Shower was good  Cons Meals aren't great The room we stayed in smelt a little stale but tolerable.  Don't expect too much of a slept in, lots of kids and rooms aren't great at blocking out that level of extreme excitement :)  As you can see very few cons about this place: overall a good experience!

Summary Heading: Best location and value to visit Disneyland!
Summary: My family and I stayed the week of December 17th-21st 2012. This is the kind of place you stay for convenience, location and value. Right across from the entrance to the parks, Ihop restraunt next door, nice outdoor pool/hot tub, friendly staff, clean rooms and free parking. It's not the Ritz, however I don't like paying for an overly expensive room when I am only going to sleep there for 6-8 hours and not there any other time. I have a family of 5 and it was perfect for us. Costco is 15 minutes away for you to go grab essentials to bring into the parks for snacks and drinks. Good way to save a TON of money. Overall, fantastic trip, happy with our stay at Park Vie and will do it again for our next visit!

Summary Heading: Incredible value,location & service.I never write review but had to as my stay here was far better than that at superior hotels
Summary: We stayed at the Sheraton on our last trip to Disneyland & although the hotel was nice the service was poor, baggage handlers rude, the room felt like it was miles from the lift if we missed the Disneyland shuttle it was a long wait for it to return. So, on this next trip we decided to stay across the road in very affordable accommodation which was directly across the road from Disneyland. As we where travelling internationally & had alot of luggage l requested a ground floor room when booking (didn't want to drag the cases up the stairs). The Park Vue Inn is not a ritzy 5 star complex but it accommodated our needs and l would highly recommend it to anyone / everyone. The location is incredible...with just a few minutes walk you are at the Disneyland gates which means if you are

Summary Heading: LOVE LOVE this hotel for Disney
Summary: We stayed for 4 nights over the holidays.  Loved this hotel.  The customer service was excellent.  The room was clean.  Directly across the street from Disney.  Perfect for walking back and forth with our two toddlers.  Free parking and free wifi.  Lemonade and cookies every afternoon.  Full hot breakfast with eggs, waffles, etc.  All included in the discounted price.  Will definitely be back to this hotel next time we come to Disney.  Perfect!

We have been to Disneyland many times and have stayed everywhere from the cheapest hotel to the Disneyland Hotel. This trip was two days at the park with young adult children. We wanted inexpensive( for Disney) and the shortest walk possible. The location can't be beat. The front desk staff were very friendly, cookies and apples at the front desk. The room was clean. We all slept comfortably, even my son on the rollaway we requested. The second night we heard a lot of noise from the second floor, children running around the room above after a day at the happiest place on earth. No big deal to us, our kids were small and excitable once too, but if quite is essential, get a second floor room. The maids were cheerful and friendly.  On check out the front desk clerk printed out

I did a lot of research selecting this location and booked six months in advance. When I booked, the property was rated #1 by tripadvisor travelers but I'm starting to wonder how and why?  Location? Yes - unbeatable. Much closer than staying at the Disneyland Hotel like we did last year. But this is an old motel. In other words, you park right outside the door and people walk right outside the window to your room. Yes, and you can hear the garbage truck coming in each morning at 6 am and other trucks with the back-up beapers going.  The room is very small; the furniture old and wooden; the bed uncomfortable. The bathroom vanity has been updated but the bathroom is smaller and the rest is old too.  The breakfast buffet is tolerable and better than some but they've stopped the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our property. We apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will use your review to help us provide a better experience for our future guests. Thank you again for your time, if I could be of any further assistance please contact me. It is our hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you.

Summary: Pros: location, breakfast, friendly staff, early check in, no sweat parking, fridge, microwave in room. Kind of Cons: a little noisy-but Understandbly so, no bathtub ( but they did let us check in two hours early and with no bath tub I imagine it's faster to clean, so I was ok with no bath  **hotel tax is 17%, ugh!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy that your stay was great. We are not perfect but we work very hard at providing great customer service, and a clean and confortable place to stay. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: We have stayed here on our last three visits to the US.  We love the friendly individual service from both the office staff and the housekeeping staff. We recommend this place to everyone we speak to and absolutely intend staying here whenever we can. It may not be the stereotypical 5 star in terms of fittings and furnishings but that is more than made up for in how they treat their guests.  Robyn & Leesa Cuthbert
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words. We work hard to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. Thank you for being a loyal customer, and for recommending Park Vue Inn. See you again soon.

Summary: Location is right across the street from Disneyland entrance.  Free breakfast is awesome when you have a family of 5.  Eggs, sausage, fresh waffles, juice, coffee, toast, bagels, fruit, cottage cheese, oatmeal, cold cereal, chocolate milk....different days offer buiscuts and gravy and bacon. Nice and hot.  The staff are very friendly and courteous .  Lemonade or punch or hot tea and coffee in the lobby always waiting. The hot tub was refreshing when we wanted a break from the park. We enjoyed our stay here.  Had a problem with our toilet and they were on it so fast. This is a great place to stay when Disneyland can be so exspensive.  There's also a little store here to buy water bottles, soda or souviners. Thank you Park Vue Inn for a magical time!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was great. We will continue to offer the highest level of customer service to our guests. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: We were looking for a good hotel close to Disneyland, and Park Vue could not be any closer!  Room was quite (we were in the back of the hotel), clean, staff was nice, hot breakfast gave us a good start every day (could get very crowded in the morning but this is expected). The hotel could not be any closer to disney main entrance, in fact, I think only Disney Grand California resort is closer to the entrance.  The proximity really helped because we had young childrens. Excellent hotel for the price and condition!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words. Our proximity to the Parks are our best amenety but we will continue to work diligently to provide a clean, confortable, and affordable home away from home to all our guests. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: If you are a light sleeper then possibly 1 star! Thin walls
Summary: You can't beat the location of the Park Vue for access to Disneyland.  Its literally 5 metres to the lights and the main entrance is across the road.  The rooms are fine if you are spending all your time at Disneyland but there is no lounge area or way to get some space. The pool is good for kids who need to unwind outside of the room provided you travel at the right time of year. You can't really complain about the breakfast for the price and its convenience.  There are limited facilites in the room to self cater unless you have some museli bars or non perishables.  The big issue for me was the thin walls.  There are signs everywhere  to remind guests to be quiet and not disturb other guests which seem to be a complete waste of time. I didn't get a lot of sleep while we stayed
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy your stay was great. We will continue to advise our guests to respect the noise level during night hours. This is a difficult task as everyone is so excited about Disney. Thank you for your patience. We hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you.

Summary: Stayed at PVI again on our return trip to USA from Australia in October. Had read reviews in regards to some of the "stripping" back of offereings such as dinner, welcome basket, etc but I stay there for pretty simple reasons - location and location. PVI isn't 5 star but it offers friendly service, comfortable rooms and has a quick breakfast included to fuel up before long days at Disneyland. I loved it (again) and the kids loved it! They wont let me book anywhere else so I will be there again next time. Thanks PVI!
Manager Response: We thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn and for being a loyal customer. We are happy to know that you and your family had a great stay once again. We hope to see you soon. Thank you for reviewing our property.

Summary: As avid Disney fans my husband and I travel to Disneyland three to four times per year. For this Thanksgiving we thought it would be great to have our family and close friends join us for the holiday at Disneyland. Because we are annual passholder with parking, we usually choose a hotel down the road, but on this trip with our family that has small children we searched for a property close to Disneyland that seemed a good value. We booked this hotel earlier in the year, (March or April) their website showed they had gift baskets and an evening social, as well as the free hot breakfast. Check in went smoothly, but that is where the good stopped. Our room was plain and dated. The bathroom had white powder (I think it might have been soap) on the floor. The water pressure barely
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I am sorry you didn’t find our hotel to be acceptable and that you had a less than satisfactory stay. We pride ourselves on great customer service and as evidenced by most of our reviews we do offer fantastic accommodations, service and rates. Unfortunately we don’t always bat 1000. It seems like we may have struck out with you; and for that I am truly sorry. Should you decide to stay with us again, we would take that opportunity to be of better service to you and your family.   Sincerely,  Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary: Excellent staff. Clean neat rooms. Perfect location.. Stayed for 1 week and enjoyed every minute while at the hotel. Breakfast was very good also even though it was nuke and serve. The person in the dinning room was very pleasant and professional. The cleaning staff was perfect. I am a maintenance supervisor for a property management company and I was impressed with the maintenance staff.  Thank you to all for an excellent stay. .
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn. We know there are many choices when visiting Disney. I have shared your kind words with our Maintenance team and also the food and beverage team. They express their gratitude and had a smile on their face. We strive to provide the highest level of customer service. We hope to see you soon. Thank you for your review.

Summary: This hotel is in a great location, directly across the road from the entrance of Disneyland.  The room has, TV, free wifi, luggage rack, microwave and tea and coffee.  The beds were extremely comfortable.  The parking was great and we were allowed to use it before check in and after check out.   Not many tables in the breakfast area inside but adequate and nice food.   We had an unfortunate incident where a car drove into one section of the hotel and our rooms had to be evacuated at 9pm at night.  I was very impressed with the way the staff handled angry guests when it was beyond their control.  Once we packed and arrived at reception we were advised there were no more rooms available and they had to relocate us to another hotel. This was just next door and booked and sorted
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, and thank you for your patience. That night was a bit stressful for us but our staff was able to work together and help everyone in a timely manner. We apologize for the relocation. We are happy to know that your stay was great before this accident. We are all happy to have been able to relocate everyone and also that no one got hurt. Thank you again, we hope to be of service to you and your family again soon.

Summary: I stayed with my 7 y/ o daughter and we felt very well treated with very friendly staff, specially Hector at the front desk, Gustavo from maintainance and Mr Argenis who showed excellent skills in dealing with some problem that arose when a car hit the pipes which supplied hot water and electicity to a part of the hotel. The staff dealt brillantly with sorting out where to accomodate all the affected guests. I was moved to another room and was given extra benefits, which made me feel really well looked after. The rooms were clean and comfortable, much better than the hotel we stayed in LA which was more expensive and was supposed to be 5 stars! There were plenty of towels, air conditioning and heater, laundry,very comfortable beds, and just across the road from Disneyland
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time in reviewing your stay at Park Vue Inn. We are glad that we were able to relocate you within the hotel. It was our pleasure to have been able to accommodate all the extras. We thank you for your patience and understanding. Having to relocate a third of our rooms was a difficult task. With the help of Hector at the front desk, Gustavo our chief engineer and the staff that came in after hours we were able to work together and take care of everyone. We have shared your kind words with the staff. We are all very thankful for your kind words. We hope to provide great service to you and your daughter again soon.

Summary: We stayed here in late November for a three day Disneyland vacation. I read other reviews and chose this hotel based on the affordable base rate, location, and free breakfast. Factoring in that you can park at the hotel for free, get a hot breakfast for free every morning, and can walk straight into the main park entrance in 5 minutes (no need to pay high Disney parking fees) this is an AMAZING deal. The room was clean and comfortable (ours had a fridge, coffee maker, and microwave,) there was minimal noise from other guests, and the staff was wonderfully helpful and courteous. We had local family come to the Disneyland with us and the staff allowed them to park at the hotel for no charge. The free breakfast was decent and had a TON of choices (bagels, toast, cereal, waffles,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are very happy to know that your stay was great. It is our goal to provide a clean comfortable and affordable home away from home. Thank you for choosing Park Vue inn we hope to see you soon.

Summary: Just returned from spending a week at Disneyland.  Stayed at the Park Vue Inn during the week of Thanksgiving.  Service was okay but hey, just needed a bed and shower.  The family of four has been rewarded with bed bug bites all over our bodies.  Stayed here two years ago and was very pleased.  This trip was a different experience and I think they may have changed owners or managers.  Staff not as friendly and service was lacking.  BED BUGS!  Won't stay there again.  Mike L
Manager Response: I wish to truly express our most sincere apology for what seems to be a very unfortunate experience. I take comments like yours very serious. I was able to track down your reservation and room based on your location, first name and last initial listed in your review. We checked our records and you left no comments or complaints with our staff. In addition to their regular monthly service and inspection I had Ecolab inspect your room and there was no evidence of bed bugs reported. As a precaution they inspected the rooms on either side of your room and the rooms above. Pest control and cleanliness are a top priority in our hotel.  In addition to regular monthly service from Ecolab, our hotel rooms are inspected by the health department of Orange County every six months. I can assure you and any future guests that we have a clean bill of health and no bed bugs.   Sincerely,  Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary: Not only is this hotel conveniently located right across the street from Disneyland but the staff is exceptionally helpful and friendly.  The rooms are clean and a decent size.  This hotel is a little more expensive than the others on the strip but well worth it.  I have stayed at a handful of other hotels on the strip and have never been as satisfied as I was with the Park Vue Inn.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are very pleased to know that your stay was pleasant. We strive to provide the highest level of customer service. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn we look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary Heading: Still good hotel, but disappointed a bit
Summary: Returned to the Park View in August (very hot weekend) with my mom, son and granddaughter. Asked far in advance for adjoining rooms, close to the front entrance so my mom didn't have to walk as far to the street. Our rooms were as far back as you could get them and not adjoining. We could have switched the next night but that would have been too much trouble after getting settled.  Breakfast was still a great feature, gift basket gone, but no big deal.  Utilitized the pool a couple of times, very nice, but all the towels were used by 11:30 a.m. Still closest to the signal to walk across to DL and able to see the fireworks well from the property.  We just felt that reserving that far in advance should have gotten us adjoining rooms.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We apologize for not being able to accommodate your requests on this visit. Our front desk works very diligently to insure all requests are fulfilled. Unfortunately there are occasions where we are not physically able to provide the adjoining room, or a certain location on the property. I assure you that this is not an easy task as we are a smaller property. We are happy you decided to stay with us and hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you.

Summary: I loved this hotel! It was a little more expensive than I would have liked but all the extra perks were well worth it. We were visiting for my daughter's 5th birthday and the hotel delivered a gift bag with Disney princess presents and a balloon to our room along with a coupon for a free Coldstone Petite Cake! My daughter absolutely loved it. The location is fantastic as well; directly across the street from Disneyland, all we had to do was cross the signal light to get there! This hotel was well worth the price!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are very happy to know that your stay was great. It is our goal to provide the highest level of customer service. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Excellent value if you are going to Disneyland or having a romantic night in.
Summary: The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. We mentioned that it was our anniversary and the staff had a special surprise waiting for us. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. Your stay includes a great breakfast which I was impressed with. I would definitely come back again.

Summary Heading: Awesome location to Disneyland, friendly helpful staff!
Summary: We stayed here this past summer, for 9 days on our roadtrip with our daughter and grand son. We had a 2 room suite, on the second floor, that included 2 queen beds in a seperate bedroom, and a living room area with sofa and coffe table, fireplace, flat screen tv, and a very nice kitchen with stove (even an oven!) microwave, coffee maker, small fridge and bar sink. There is a full bathroom and another sink and vanity area in the kitchen area so all together 3 sinks to use, making getting ready in the morning easy for a bigger family. The furnishings were quite new and in good condition, the maintenance came in one day and replaced the lovely ceiling fans in the bedroom with 2 new ones which were even nicer. There was another tv in the bedroom as well (flat screen as well) with

The only reason anyone stays here is to visit Disneyland - and we are no exception!  Like everyone else says, you are literally as close as you can possibly be to Disneyland without actually staying at a Disney property.  The rooms are adequate - nothing fancy, but they're clean and neat and lets face it, that's pretty much all you need here.  We had a room with bunks for our daughters which makes a nice change as so often in a hotel they have to share a queen bed which can cause all sorts of issues at the end of a long day! A big bonus.  It can be a bit noisy out the front of the rooms - even though there are signs everywhere asking to be considerate to other guests, I guess people are loud no matter what - but hey, that's life and it's really no fault of the hotel.  Breakfast

Summary Heading: A friendly, clean motel that is extremely close to the parks and has a fantastic breakfast.
Summary: This motel is a great value for families going to Disneyland. The rooms are clean, beds are comfortable and the breakfast is great. They offer scrambled eggs, bacon or sausages, waffles, bagels, toast, cereal, yoghurt, oatmeal, biscuits, potatoes and boiled eggs. Lots of seating. Coffee, juice and water all day in the lobby and delicious cookies every afternoon and evening as well as apples all day. We had bunk beads for our kids and they enjoyed them. The pool was great and the hot tub was perfect after a long day.  I read some reviews that mentioned noise. We were on the second floor near the breakfast room and can't complain about being disturbed at all.  Overall we found this place great and will stay there again.

My family and I had a great time staying at the Park Vue Inn. We went for my daughter's 18th birthday celebration. The people there were friendly and gave my daughter a special gift, including free ice cream at Cold Stone Creamery, located in front of the property. They are located directly across from the entrance to Disneyland. They also provide a nice breakfast and various dinner items. Great place to come back to and rest during the day.

First of all, I should mention that the Park Vue Inn lists itself on their website and also on a sign posted in their reception lobby that they are one of Disney’s “Good Neighbor Hotels”. They are NOT a Disney “Good Neighbor Hotel”. They are not listed on Disney’s “Good Neighbor Hotels” website and I double checked with Disney’s travel information to confirm that.  That being said, my wife and I spent three nights there and were pleased with the accommodations. It is definitely a 2½ star hotel and there are probably nicer hotels/motels for less money per night in the immediate area, but you would have to really shop to get a better deal.   The one thing you cannot beat is the location! The entrance of the motel is about 30 feet from the crosswalk that goes to the entrance of the

We used this hotel as a base to explore Southern California. It cannot be beaten on its location - being absolutely opposite the walkway entrance to Disneyland (over a pedestrian crossing). The room was very clean and comfortable, the staff gave excellent customer service, particular praise goes to the member of reception staff who was very helpful and assisted to do an online airline check in on the hotel computer when it was not going through on the house guest computer. The breakfasts were great, as were the free coffee, juices, cookies and trick or treat candy in the foyer. The pool is small but clean and very nicely landscaped, and there is a hot tub. The housekeeping was excellent. It is also very near to the bus stop where you can catch the Disneyland Express to the

Greeted by a cozy lobby, refreshments, friendly staff. Little things like directions to various places-including airport, printed out in the lobby. We were offered complimentary bottles of water which is a nice gesture as well. The room-we had the jacuzzi suite, was clean, well stocked with towels, shampoos, lotions, even bubble bath! Free parking is a BIG PLUS. And, like everyone says, You cant be closer to the entrace to Disneyland, It is DIRECTLY across the street! Just a short walk to the entrance gates. The housekeeping was superb, the pool was nice, everything was great!! Lots of pillows available and he beds were as comfy as any in a moderately priced hotel ; )

If you are looking for a clean, solid-to-nicer hotel with roomy rooms, free parking, in-room fridge & microwave, convenient IHOP & Coldstone creamery on site, with the shortest walking distance of Disneyland Resort, this is perfect.  Good TV channel selection & free wifi.  Breakfast included (though I didn't utilize but NO dinner as listed on the website I used).  However, there are a few things that made this stay not pleasant at all, most of which are completely out of the control of the management.  I really wish to be fair and informative to others.  It is a walk-up 2-storey.  If stairs are an issue, request downstairs (they do their best to accommodate).  Parking is safe but the spots are kind of narrow so choose wisely.  The walk-way in front of the rooms is brick so you
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review; I appreciate your kind words regarding our Hotel. I was however troubled by your comments regarding your service animal. Please accept our most sincere apology for leaving you with the impression that your service animal was not welcome in our Hotel.  Although we do not allow pets in our guest rooms, we do allow service animals on the property and in our guest rooms. I can assure you that I take ADA laws very serious and I respect the animals and their owners. I will certainly address this situation with my staff to avoid any confusion regarding ADA laws and service animals in the future. I hope you will not hesitate to choose our Hotel for your next stay. We look forward to an opportunity to provide you and your family a service animal friendly home away from home. Sincerely,  Brian DeRose Director of Operations

Summary: This is just about as close as one can get to the Disney parks.  Right across and at a crosswalk.  Our beds were comfy allowing us to rest well after a very full day of walking.  The pool was warm and inviting.  The hot tub clean and functioning.  One of the nicest surprises was the hot, varied complimentary breakfast.  We personally weren't traveling with young children this time, but for those who are the absence of super sweet donuts, muffins, danish etc. was a real plus.  The choices made it not too difficult to eat a healthy, filling breakfast before heading out.  The only negative was our room smelled a bit musty.  If we left the windows open while inside it was OK.  I would highly recommend this motel.  Oh and the staff gets a gold star for friendliness.

This hotel is definitely two thumbs up! We had to change our dates several times and it was always no problem. The room with two bunks and a queen was awesome.Never had bad smells and was clean. Breakfast was very tasty and filling. Location was perfect, right across the street from Disney Land. Laundry room on site as well as a very friendly convenience store. Free coffee and fruits in the lobby as well as WIFI through out. Can't believe how good it was, and we have stayed at some good ones in the area before. This was really the best stay ever in this area. Closer than in the park hotels to the entrance!

We stayed 3 nights in a spa room in the furtherest corner of the L shaped complex on the bottom floor.  When we opened the door we both laughed.  The room looked like it would have been used in one of those "couples" movies with the spa actually in the corner of the bedroom surrounded by glass bricks and mirror walls.  We didn't really care but would have been majorly disappointed if we were looking for romance!  If you want quiet you wont get it.  The family above us and beside us must have been elephants they were so loud.   Slamming doors and running could be easily heard.  As others have said the location is pretty much the only draw card.  It's old and dated and I agree about the breakfast - DON'T do it.  Even though it was included we went to Dennys instead.  The pool is

This hotel is  truly across the street from the Disneyland entrance. You can not stay closer. The employees at the front desk are fantastic! Helpful with questions, quick for check-in and check-out, and the fresh baked cookies are yummy. Our second stay and we will be back.

We stayed her for one night  visiting disneyland... I had written down five hotels that I had looked up on trip advisor , as we drove in this  was the first address .. we booked in to a king size room $133 for he night ...great room with jacuzzi and very spacious .   Breakfast was included, don't bother not good.  Great value and great location, very clean.

Overall a good stay.  The location cant be beaten for leaving Disneyland tired at the end of a long day, and strolling home.  Close enough to walk home for a rest and head back in for a long evening.  The breakfast was average, and the front desk staff seem to be operating just outside their level of competence, however the rooms were spacious and well kitted out.

Summary Heading: Unprofessional and rude Manager, but affordable...
Summary: location-great. price great. lack of general maintenance and room maintenance.  Very loud and sleep disrupting if you are staying ground level. Friendly staff except for the General Manager Argenis. I left him a voicemail and he never got back to me after a few days and was rude to me when  called as if I had done something wrong by calling him to follow up!He called himself head of guest relations.   Another thing that I found odd was that when I asked the front desk person of the name of the person that I was just speaking to (because she transferred me to him) she said Brian and I told her, no...thats not the name he used and she said Argenis. I asked her why she was trying to tell me the wrong name and she didn't have an answer. He was so rude and I've never been spoken to
Manager Response: Although we were not able to resolve this matter to your complete satisfaction, we wish to express our sincere apology for the experience you had at our hotel. Your initial complaint was that you recalled leaving a child’s costume in the room you occupied. During your stay you made no other mention of any deficiencies in our services or problems with your room. I assure you that we made every effort possible to locate the items you reported lost. When we informed you the items had not been recovered you were upset. You demanded a level of compensation I was not able to provide. I never intended to be rude or arrogant, and I am sorry you were left with that impression.  Although you expressed the intention of never returning to our hotel, should you have a change of heart, we would appreciate an opportunity to be of better service to you and your family.

Summary Heading: First visit and won't be our last
Summary: We are a family of five from Australia and we spent 2 nights here in a one bedroom suite which had two queen beds and a sofa bed. Whilst we didn't have enough time to utilise soothe facilities such as the pool etc, we were very pleased with what we did experience at the park vue inn. Check in was quick and courteous and the lemonade and cookies were a nice touch - little things like this really add to the charm. I was also glad to be able to purchase our Disneyland tickets right at the front desk. Our room was great for a short stay, certainly not five star but very clean and the beds were really comfy. Also naive quality towels and toiletries in the bathroom and we had a handy kitchenette with microwave etc which was great to heat our dessert from Mimis! The rooms are probably

Summary Heading: Lovely stay at the Park Vue Inn
Summary: This was our 3rd stay at the Park Vue inn and once again we were not disappointed. The rooms are spacious, clean and have comfortable beds.There is a fridge, microwave and coffee maker in the room which can be useful and the free breakfast and free parking is a great benefit. The close proximity to the Disneyland entrance make this hotel a winner every time and I would not stop anywhere else in Anaheim. Fresh baked cookies at 3pm everyday as well, what more can you ask for.

Summary Heading: Great price, great location, property quite dated
Summary: We stayed for a week Oct 6-13th.  The location cannot be beat as you are immediatley across the street from Disneyland entrance.  The breakfast was better than most, with hot eggs, bacon, sausage, hashbrowns as well as make your own waffles, fresh cut up fruit, and many other choices.  Most of the staff were wonderful and friendly!  The kids loved the lemonade and cookies at the front desk,and stopped most afternoons to grab one for the walk back to the park.  We found the room very quiet and did not hear much outside noise in the night.  The bunk beds were fantastic as well, no fighting over blankets with the kids makes everyone happier!  The property was dated and the rooms were not that large but we found it to be clean.  Our one dissappointment was that when we left we had a

We definitely enjoyed our 3-night stay at the Park Vue Inn!! Its proximity to the Disneyland main entrance means you're quickly back relaxing in your room, in the hot tub or by the pool after a long day walking the parks. The rooms are cozy (some might say step-saving), clean and comfortable. Staff is friendly and helpful.   The included breakfast offered food choices beyond the cold cereal and toast we were expecting. Hot item options consisted of make-your-own waffles, prepared scrambled eggs, and oatmeal.  We would absolutely enjoy another short stay here again!!

The Park Vue is excellent value for the money.  The front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful.  The location right across the street from the front entrance to Disneyland can't be beat, so no long walk at the end of the day with tired kids.  Our room was clean and even though it was busy and there are lots of people and kids, it was very quiet in the evenings.  We had a six person bunk bed room and it worked well for our family of six.  The kids really enjoyed the pool to cool down in the hot afternoon sun.  And having breakfast included was a great value for a family our size.  The selection of food was excellent - both hot and cold with all the usual, bacon and eggs, toast, cereal, yogurt and fruit, etc.  The make your own belgian waffles was a huge hit for our kids.

The hotel has signs up and in the rooms to be courteous of other guest.  We are frequent visitors and have stayed at other hotels.  Coming back from a long day at the park with the kids, all you want to do is get the kids in their pajamas and to bed.  At other hotels we have been woken up by other hotel guest being loud.  At this hotel we have never had a problem with late night noise.

Summary Heading: Great stay at Park Vue Inn
Summary: We arrived mid-morning and were not expecting to be able to check into our room until 3pm but we were in luck and our room was ready and we were able to use it straight away to have a quick nap after a long flight.  Room was neat and clean and our kids (5 & 6) loved the bunk beds.  Our room was on the ground floor (107) towards the front so we did get some noise from people above stomping around until midnight most nights and also people coming and going to Disneyland but from ready reviews prior to booking, we knew this would be the case.  Great location - could not ask for a better Disneyland location and the access to a variety of food was fantastic.  WIFI was great - had no problems.  Breakfast was reasonable.  Kids loved the pool and spa and there was no issue with it being

We stayed from October 6 th - 13th.  Although we were disappointed when we became aware of all the special touches were no longer available...we got over it.  I can see why the supper snack would be underutilized.  House keeping was wonderful and you cannot beat the location.  The kids loved the pool area and free parking was lovely.  The breakfast was enjoyable as my kids love bacon.  I enjoyed the waffles. Other hotels we have stayed at had more pastry items.  Bathroom great with sink outside for girls to do their hair.  The front desk staff were friendly and helpful.  We would definitely stay again.  We stayed 2nd floor near the back so quite quiet.  Excited feet early in the morning outside the door but come on its Disneyland.  Beds nice and comfy.

Our family will be back again for sure one day!!  We stayed in the 2 room suite on the 2nd floor.  Breakfast was great.  Boys loved the pool.  Watched fireworks from our balcony.  I do prefer to book higher star rated hotels but , this place was comfortable, clean and sooooo close to Disney.  Staff was exceptional!  Front desk service A+.  Drinks, cookies and fruit in lobby were delicious.  Remember that this is a 3 star rated property, so if you complain about amenities than book at a five star and pay the 5 star price!    THANK YOU PARK VUE INN STAFF FOR BEING PART OF OUR GREAT TIME IN DISNEYLAND.   CHEERS FROM CANADA!

We stayed in a two room suite on the top floor, several rooms down from the breakfast area. the room was clean and spacious with a kichenette area which had a fridge, microwave, stove, sink and coffee maker. We liked having the extra sink outside the bathroom so everyone could get ready at the same time. We did find the Air con a bit noisy though.
