The outside out the hotel is a bit uninviting, but once you get inside and realise the location and you soon over look that! The pool area was great and it didnt bother us in the least having it in the middle of the car park, it is surrounded by shrubs/vines on the walls.   Our room was cleaned every day when we returned after lunch for a rest. We had no issues with the towels or linen we had, but half way through our 6 night stay we

We choose this place based on trip advisor. The only thing going for it was its location to disney. It is just across the road. ThAt is where the good stops. Rooms have paper thin walls so spent the morning and evenings listening to the people in the room above us moving around. Decor is dated, paint peeling off walls. Plastic covers on chairs?? Whats that about. Free breakfast was ok. Price was reasonable but i will not be back.

Fantastic location just across Disneyland. In fact the nearest motel to the front gate. Staff at reception very friendly especially Hector and the 2 young female staff(did not get their names). Room are clean everyday and bed/pillow is very comfortable. No issues about that. A lot of food options around that area such as Denny, IHOP, MacDonalds, Tony Romas and a lot more. Easy to find affordable foods. Good location for pick-up point to other attractions such as Universal Studios Hollywood, Las Vegas, Legoland, San Diego Seaworld, Citadel Premium Outlet and a lot more. Highly recommended this property to anyone. And definitely my number 1 choice if we are to visit Anaheim again.  KUDOS to Park Vue Inn.

Summary Heading: Good location - close to Disney and ART shuttle buses
Summary: Stayed with husband and 6 yr old son for 9 nights from end Sept to Oct 2012. Location is great to Disneyland, as right across road. We also made use of various ART shuttle buses from Disneyland to surrounding shops/outlets/train station. Airconditioning worked well in room, especially when we arrived at time when they were experiencing hottest September weather. Had room on 2nd floor which was clean and quiet. Good view of fireworks from balcony. Had room with bunk bed and queen bed, which was cosy enough for just the three of us, but would find it a bit too small if had four in room. Made regular use of laundry facilities which were relatively cheap at $1 per wash or dryer. Little convenience store at hotel to buy little incidentals. Breakfast included, but basic consisting of

This hotel is super convenient to Disneyland, right across the street. The rooms are clean but the outside is very worn down. The front desk staff is very young. Reserved and paid for adjoining rooms back in June for an October stay.  Upon check in, no adjoining room for our teenagers. Front desk staff smiled and said too bad.  We have stayed here several times in the past but not sure about future.  Rooms were next to each other but adjoined other rooms. Even though you pay upfront, requests are not "guaranteed."

Stayed here in August for one night with two kids - 9 and 12. Across the street from the park (where the shuttle buses park).  Very convenient and easy.  Kids liked the bunk beds.  We were on first floor very close to the front and it was not noisy through the window at all.  Easy parking right outside our room door, which was so nice.  Staff at the front desk was very friendly too.

Our family of 5 stayed her for 7 nights at the end of Sept.  We love the location, being literally across the street from Disney is a huge benefit.  We used the pool area and the kids really enjoyed it. I liked that it got sun all afternoon and they had tables with umbrella's if you wanted shade.  The room was a standard room and was good. The beds are a bit hard but that is expected at a hotel.   We took advantage of the lemonade in the lobby to and from the park. We used the laundry room.  The washer and dryer took just over an hour for both and worked well.  They have a machine to buy detergent if you didn't bring your own.   The breakfast was a standard hotel breakfast and the kids loved the waffles.   I would definitely stay here again

Our first trip to Disneyland with the family was made even more memorable by staying here, due to its proximity to Disneyland, quality of hotel and availability of restaurants in the area.  Would stay again.

Stay was from Sept 29 thru Oct 2....awesome location--across the street from Disneyland our entire family had a great 4 day stay: clean room, great location, free breakfast (eggs, potatoes, bacon or sausage, waffles, toast, ceral, etc...), comes with microware and good size ice box although there is no elevator to the 2nd floor, they carried our bags to the room alot of free parking...AWESOME !! 3 washer/dryers avaliable (cost 75 cents ea) GREAT staff and service by all they also offered free bottle water to each family member, but ran out one day overall eveyone in the family loved our stay and will come back

Myself and two other nurses took a vacation recently and stayed at your motel. I have stayed there once before and each time the staff has been wonderful. Both my friends and I have family members who are planning stays at Park Vue in the next several months.Your location is the best.THe breakfast is just right. We appreciated the beverages, fruit and cookies in the lobby. I loved the chocolate chip cookies. When I messed up the room card the staff was very helpful. Keep doing what you're doing. You are appreciated. Even the cab drivers  made good comments about the motel. Thanks again. We are already planning another trip to Disneyland. You have become a favorite of the grandma nurses.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review Park Vue. We are happy that your stay was pleasant. We will be waiting for you on your next visit. We will keep the chocolate chip cookies warm for you. Thank you for telling your friends and family about us.

Summary: Once again another lovely travel experience with Park Vue Inn.  We were here from Aug 31 to Sept 7.  The staff here are wonderful, nothing is ever too much - a trip to Universal was organised by the front desk within 5 minutes at 8.15am for a pick up at 9!!  I was traveling with my elderly mother and our request for a ground floor room was no trouble at all.  The room was clean, the air conditioning was fantastic after the hot days at the park and the beds were so comfortable.  Mum and I had no trouble sleeping.  Free wifi, free breakfasts and close to everything.  The wi-fi dropped out a few times but I wasn't too fussed, it only took a call to the front desk and it was reset quickly.  Being so close to the park we were able to come back to the room to have a rest from the heat
Manager Response: Thank you for your review we appreciate your kind words. Thank you for being a loyal customer. We will continue to work hard, to provide a home away fro  home to all of our guests. Thank you again and we hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Park Vue Inn-- Home Sweet Home (for 5 nights)
Summary: My husband and our two kids (ages 9 and 12) stayed at the Park Vue Inn from September 28th until October 3rd while we visited Disneyland.  We were very satisfied and would definitely stay again!  WAYS THEY COULD IMPROVE:  - APPEARANCE- this is a older hotel with older decor, faucets of bathroom sink and drain etc looked dirty even when they were clean, could use a new paint job.  - LESS NOISE. We read reviews telling us to have a 2nd floor room as they were quieter but there was still a lot of noise.  I am hesitant to include this as a "con" against the hotel as they are situated RIGHT next door to Disneyland so OBVIOUSLY there are people getting up to have an early start at the park and they do have signs posted asking people to be quiet for the sake of other guests.   WHY WE
Manager Response: Thank you so much for reviewing our property and the detail in doing so. It is always our goal to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. We are happy to know that your experience was great. Thank you for the suggested changes to our rooms, we will continue to upgrade our rooms to better serve our guests. Thank you again for all your tips and kind words. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: A great stay and so close to Diseny
Summary: We spent five days here and had a great time. The walls a well insulated so we were not bothered by anyone. The fridge and microwave were very nice to have. The beds were super comfortable. Having a breakfast every morning was nice as well. We would stay here again with out a second thought.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad your stay was great. We hope to have the opportunity to provide excellent service to you and your family again soon.

Summary Heading: Wonderful Experience at Park Vue Inn!!
Summary: The Park Vue Inn exceeded all of my expectations! This was our family's first time traveling to Disneyland and we stayed there from Sep23-29, 2012.  We have a 9, 6 and 3 year old twins (4 kids). We stayed in a double queen with bunk bed room and were blown away.  This is a motel but it doesn't act like one (which is awesome!). Upon check-in, the staff was exceptional in welcoming us -- fruit bowl, juice and cookies (after 3 pm every day) and this continued with each staff we encountered. We were on the first floor but tucked away nicely in the corner and it was quiet. It really makes such a difference to have the "Quiet please" signs displayed around. The pool was clean and wonderful for the kids and our room was clean and upgraded/renovated (not dated like some of the past
Manager Response: We are delighted to know that your experience with us was wonderful. We have been working and will continue to work on upgrades to our services and property to provide a better experience for our future guests. We thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn and look forward to providing you and your family with great service. Thank you for your review.

Summary Heading: Solid Motel, Excellent location, Friendly Staff
Summary: This is more a motel than a hotel. So if you're expecting a hotel I suspect you'll be disappointed. The price is also a bit high, but it's inline with all the rest of the properties that are close by. My corner suite was the same price as a room at the Disneyland Hotel, but without the magic morning hours.  However, this location can't be beat. Even with the monorail, this place is closer and after a full day at Disney, you'll be very happy to walk right across the street to your room. It's a 4 min walk to the gate at most. Also, they don't have magic morning hours, but they do provide a hot breakfast. Some days it was eggs and sausage, other days it was eggs and bacon. 4 waffle stations, cereal stations and an assortment of bread for toast. It will get you through the morning
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We use reviews such as yours to help improve our services and property. We are currently working on upgrades to the property, of which one is the WiFi. We hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you. We appreciate the time and detail spent on your review.

Summary: Room did its purpose. Travelled with 2 young ones so was very handy to walk across the street for a break or for a nap. Would come back again. Housekeepers are very attentive to your needs and thank you very much for that!!We need more like them.
Manager Response: Thank you for your time spent in writing a review. It was our pleasure to serve you. We have showed your review to our Housekeepers, and they express their gratitude for your kind words. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: I don't undersand how this is rated #4 in Anaheim!
Summary: We checked into this hotel in January, 2011 and checked out 10 minutes later. The room was outdated, dingy and felt and smelled dirty. There was a potent and offensively harsh smell of chemicals they had used to clean the carpets. Despite the apparent scented evidence of cleanliness, the bathroom was grungy, dirty and had hair in the tub. It felt like a 1950s camping resort cabin. I cant imagine relaxing and lounging on the bed, watching tv there. Which would have worked out had we stayed, as the tv didnt work either. The remote was sticky and grimy as well. The noise from the outside corridors was very apparent and this was in the middle of the afternoon, when most guests would be at Disneyland. I cant imagine how loud it would be when people are coming home from the park.
Manager Response: I would like to take this opportunity to extend a sincere apology for your experience.  I would also like to set the record straight and inform you and the viewers of this review that we are in fact a Good Neighbor Hotel and have been for many years. We no longer advertise on Disney’s website, therefore we are not listed there. Although your comments about our property were not kind, I do appreciate any and all feedback, as this helps to make improvements to our service. I’m glad you were able to find a more suitable accommodation nearby for you and your family. I only wish this was brought to my attention during your check in. I can assure you that your experience would have been much different had it been. Since January of 2011, we have made several improvements to our property including new carpet and flat screen TV’s.  In addition we continue to maintain, upgrade and refresh our room types and amenities. I am truly sorry that due to your experience I will not have a future opportunity to be of better service to you.   Sincerely,      Brian DeRose – Director of Operations

Summary: There were a total of 9 of our family members (3 rooms) staying from 18 - 24 Sept 2012.  Like others have said in reviews, I was a little unsure if this was the hotel for us.  But after staying here, we are so glad we did and would definitely stay here again.  My husband had rented an electric scooter and the hotel suggested we have a handicapped room which had extra room for parking the scooter within.  The beds were really comfortable and the rooms were clean.  We didn't use the microwave but the fridge was great for keeping cold water (much needed as the temperatures were between 35 - 40C) and soft drinks.  While there, it was my birthday and on the dresser was a gift package from the hotel along with a note about a complimentary cake from the Cold Stone Creamery on the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. It is our goal to provide a home away from home at a great value. We hope to see you soon. Thank you for your kind words.

Summary: Had a stay 26/9 to 29/9..Fantastic, great location right across from main gate Disneyland, good clean room, helpful staff, good morning breakfast, and best of all late checkout on departure day. Have stayed b4 and will again when next in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad to know that your stay was great. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn. We look forward to serving you again soon.

Summary: The proximity to Disneyland and the price of this accomodation make this excellent value for money. The rooms are not very large and are quite dated, though comfortable enough.The air conditioner leaked but this was promptly repaired. Breakfast was included and while not gourmet , the make your own waffle bar was a big hit. Perfect for a place to stay near Disneyland parks and close to many food outlets.
Manager Response: We are very pleased to have been able to provide a confortable stay at an excellent value. We apologize for the AC; we have been running them non-stop in this heat. We are glad to know that we were able to fix this for you quickly. Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: I just returned from a five night stay in September with my husband and 8 year old son.  This hotel was everything it promised!  A short 3-5 minute walk directly across the street to Disneyland, it couldn't get any better.  My son was so happy with the swimming pool and hot tub and both were well maintained.  The breakfast food was not so good.  It was good enough to "get us by" but we weren't happy with the choices.  It was obvious they were not providing options such as bananas and flavored yogurts so the guests would not take them back to their room.  We stuck with waffles every day and brought our own fruit and yogurt to the breakfast area. One thing I was disappointed in was that they stopped serving dinner a week or two before we arrived. I was actually counting on that so
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize for the discontinuing of the social hour meal. The changes to our amenities are due to a decreased demand for these offerings and an increased demand for upgrades to our rooms. Again thank you for this review and thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn.

Summary Heading: Best location for walking to Disney Parks
Summary: This hotel is right across the street from the Disney Parks.  You can't get anywhere closer than this for the price.  The parking is free and the breakfast is free and has a great selection of hot and cold food.  The hard boiled eggs and cottage cheese were a plus for one of us on a high protein diet.  The room was clean and had a microwave and a refrigerator.  It wasn't large but we weren't in it except to recharge to go back into the Disney Parks.  We were there on 14-15 Sep 2012 when it was unseasonably hot (99 and 105 degrees F.) The second day, we went to California Adventure to ride the Cars race cars at 8 AM then walked back to the hotel for breakfast.  We went back to the parks until noon then walked back to the hotel for a nap and to cool off.  We also enjoyed the
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. We are happy to know that your stay was great. We will continue to work on our ameneties to better serve our guests. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn, we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: I have just stayed at this property for 9 nights at the beginning of September.  I was travelling with family (5 of us) and we booked a three queen bed room and a rollaway.  Leading up to our trip I was reading some negative reviews about this hotel and was contemplating changing my accommodation.  All I can say is I am glad we didn't.  The location to Disneyland is fantastic - so close.  The food outlets around this hotel are great - right out front is Ihop and you have Denny's, Tony Roma's, McDonalds, Mimi's cafe and a great pizza place right nearby and then you are not far from the Garden Walk or Downtown Disney which have great eating places.  So the rooms a little dated - so what - I didn't pay for 5 star so why should I expect it.  The beds are really comfortable, the room
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time in reviewing Park Vue Inn. We are excited to know that your stay was great. Thank you for choosing to keep your reservations with us. It is our goal to provide the highest level of customer service. We appreciate your review, and we hope to be able to serve you again soon.

Summary: Directly across the road from the entrance to Disney. You can't get closer unless you stay in a Disney hotel and the price is much cheaper. Can see fireworks from the hotel. The rooms are very small but well designed to maximize the use of the space. The bathroom looked clean but the bath drain became blocked on my first shower. They fixed it when they serviced the room and didn't have another problem with it. My shower was hot but then my husband said his was cold. The girl at the front desk didn't seem to have much local knowledge when I was trying to find out about transport options to other attractions. Would stay again if going to Disneyland. Free breakfast every morning was handy with a variety of dishes on offer.
Manager Response: Thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve you. We appreciate your review, as it helps us to improve our service. We have spoken with our front desk staff and are retraining to insure this does not happen again. We do have a variety of transportation companies that we have found to be well priced and reliable. We are glad to know that the rest of your stay was great. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: This was the first time we had stayed at this hotel. The staff on arrival and throughout our stay were extremely friendly and helpful.  Location is excellent right across the road from Disneyland so not far to come back if you need a rest during the day.  Breakfast included and is the normal standard for the USA and enough to start the day. Has laundry facilities which are a great bonus if you are travelling for a while (drycleaning is expensive).  Free wi fi is included which you don't even get at some of the more expensive places.  Would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are happy to know that your stay was great. We always strive to provide the highest level of customer service to our guests. We thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve you. We hope that we could serve you and your family again soon.

Summary: This was the 3rd time my Fiance and I have stayed at this hotel for our Disneyland trip. We always choose it for the excellent location, free parking, and free breakfast. It is a great place to stay when you want to take a break from the parks in the middle of the day, as it is literally right across the street. We usually take a break and recharge at the pool, and then feel all refreshed and ready to go for the rest of the day.  For what you pay for the value is exceptional. Unless we save up enough money to stay at the Disneyland Hotel, we will definitely be staying here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We thank you for being loyal guests. We will continue to work diligently at providing a clean, confortable, and affordable home away from home. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: Had another great visit at the Park Vue Inn. Perfect place to stay when visiting Disneyland. Very clean and very quiet.  The only thing I missed was the gift basket they would give you on every visit. It was such a treat...... either wine and fruit or apple cider and fruit.  Thanks to Hector for being such a great greater! (desk worker)  Hope he's there the next time I visit.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We have shared your kind words with Hector, and he expresses his gratitude. Thank you for continuing to choose Park Vue Inn. We did discontinue our baskets as they were not being used very much. We apologize for this. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Just returned from a trip to Disneyland and chose to stay at the Park Vue because it's right at the main gates.  No lie.  For that alone its worth the money.  Average, clean MOTEL type set up.  Friendly, helpful staff.  Fair breakfast that will get you through till lunch.  And so close you can just pop back over the road when you need a break.  I've stayed at other nicer places including the Disney hotels in the past, and I think they all have their pros and cons.  If you're taking kids and not wanting to spend much time in your room or hotel, then this is perfect.  But if you want a "Disney" vacation where the hotel is part of the vacation cos it makes you feel special and pampered, then try something a bit more glam.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time in reviewing us. Please know that it is our goal to provide a clean confortable home away from home. We are currently working on upgrades to the property, to better serve our guests. We hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you. Again thank you for the review.

Summary: This is right across the street from Disneyland! They are so helpful and friendly here, and do whatever they can to make your stay pleasant. Great place! There is an IHOP and Cold Stone on the grounds, nice pool and plenty of parking.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to know that our staff provided the highest level of customer service. We thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn, and hope to see you soon.

Summary: A very clean, very convenient place to stay in Anaheim.  You can't get much closer to the main gates of Disneyland!!  We had a bunk bed room for our kids, and the room was small but perfect for the amount of time we spent there.  Great having breakfast included, and the pool was wonderful as a midday break from Disney.  We will definitely return to the Park Vue Inn!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad to know that your stay was great. We are one of the closest hotels to the main gates, about 300 steps away we’ve heard. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn, we hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Very good value for money, amazing location for the disney theme park and plenty of shops bars and restaurants in the surrounding area. lovely pool area to cool off after a busy day at disney park, average breakfast but it did the trick. rooms very spacious clean and facilities in the room were very good, all in all a  very pleasant hotel.
Manager Response: We thank you for taking the time in this review. We are happy to know that your stay was pleasant. We will be having some upgrades to the breakfast we hope that you would come back soon to see the changes. Thank you for your kind words.

Summary: Stayed in a family room with bunk beds.  Room was clean and suited our needs but perhaps a little cramped for two adults and two teenagers.  Free Breakfast was OK.   The best thing about the Hotel is of course the location.  After a long day walking around the Disney Parks it is a relief to know you are staying just across the road.   The free WiFi would drop out continually forcing us to re-sign in.  Pool was clean.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad your stay was great. We are waiting on some final work on the Wi-Fi and we will have a new system in place. This will provide our guests with flawless Wi-Fi. Again thank you for taking the time in reviewing us, we hope to see you soon.

Summary: This is our second time staying here! We have had a great experience each time we have been here.  The rooms are clean, roomy, and comfortable.  The staff members are friendly, courteous, helpful and knowledgeable. Park Vue is literally right across the street from the Disneyland entrance.  Their parking privileges are the best in the area. We were able to park in their parking lot for two full days (before we checked in the first day, and after we checked out the second day). The breakfast is very good (especially since it is free). And, their prices are quite reasonable...
Manager Response: Thank you for continuing to choose Park Vue Inn. We will keep working hard at providing clean, and confortable accommodations at a great value. Thank you for writing this review. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Our family of 5 stayed at the Park Vue Inn from 22nd June for 11 nights.  The location of this property is excellent and only a few minutes walk for the kids (6yrs, 11yrs, 13yrs).  It was very convienent when the kids got tired and we could walk back to our room for some lunch and a swim.  It was walking distance (2 blocks) to convience shops where you could pick up some lunch and snacks.  The reception had free water, juice, fresh fruit and yummy biscuits later in the afternoon but you had to be in quick for those. We had a suite which consisted of two rooms, one with two queen beds and one with a pull-out sofa bed which was in the lounge/tv room.  We had a small kitchette which was great for making lunch and a bathroom with shower over the bath.  Our room was upstairs and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time in sharing your experience. We are delighted to know that we were able to provide a clean, confortable, home away from home, at a great value. We do apologize for the discontinued evening meal. The changes to our amenities are due to a decreased demand for these offerings and an increased demand for upgrades to our rooms. We thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn and we hope to be able to accommodate you and your family again soon.

Summary: Stayed 3 nites in september while visiting disneyland and hotel was directly opposite both theme parks.Staff were very friendly and helpful with cold drinks,tea,coffee and snacks always available in lobby.Free parking on site and no trouble getting a park near room.Rooms were comfortable and king bed was very comfortable.The only issue i had was the internet in my room kept dropping out and for this reason i only rated 4 stars.Overall would definately stay again and recommend to friends if visiting disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are delighted to know that your stay was pleasant, and that we provided great customer service. We are happy to inform you that we are currently working on upgrading our Wi-Fi and internet. We hope that on your next visit this will be finalized. Again thank you for your review, we hope to see you soon.

Summary: Just back from a two night stay. We visit Disneyland around 8 times a year and have always stayed at the Best Western Park Place Inn right next door. Our usual choice was booked so thought we would give this place a try since they are both the same distance from Disney.  We stayed in a two queen with bunk bed room. We could not help but compare the property to our usual place. On arrival the staff is quite friendly and welcoming.  The Park Vue is much nicer on the outside than the Best Western. The landscaping is well maintained and the outside is freshly painted. There are reminder signs for guests to be quiet throughout the property but results were mixed on that count. The parking lot is much easier to drive around in and it appears that they have more spaces for SUVs
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize for not being able to accommodate a great stay. We will use your review to help us improve our property for future guests. We would like you to please contact management in regards to the bugs. We do not have a record in our log about any complaints. We would like to speak to you in this regard. Thank you again for your review. We hope that you would allow us another chance to serve you.

Summary: This hotel is the closest you can get the the entry to Disney. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. Of the many great things about this hotel was that we were given a very early check in, this was appreciated more than words as after the flight from Australia we were all extremely tired. We loved the bed and bunks, coffee in reception, free parking, good size bathroom. Would come back again. Thanks to all the wonderful staff
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear that we could accommodate an early check in for you. Please know that it is always our goal to not just meet but exceed our guest’s expectations. We are glad we were able to do so. Thank you again we hope to see you soon.

Summary: This was a nice hotel right across from the Disney parks entrance. The room was spacious and clean. It was nice having a fitness center to go burn off the Coldstone ice cream I enjoyed (which is located at the hotel). Front desk staff was friendly and attentive. It was very helpful being able to park at the hotel and store luggage with the front desk while going and enjoying the parks before our room was ready for check-in. Our luggage was also delivered to our room for us, free of charge, while we were out. I also thought the price of hotel was very reasonable in comparison to the Disney resorts. I would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: We appreciate your time spent on this review. Thank you for your kind words. We are happy to know that you enjoyed your stay. It is our goal to provide a clean confortable home away from home. We will continue to work hard to be able to provide the highest level of service to all our guests. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Location is the best reason to stay
Summary: My family of 4 stayed here 7 nights (9/7/12-9/13/12) and the best part of the stay was the close location to the park.    Our original plan was for 6 nights and we decided to add a seventh night last minute.  All of the rooms with 2 queen bed were booked for that additional night so we stayed the 1st night in a bunk room with 1 queen bed.  Our children said the bunk beds were very comfy but the room was very small(Room 114).  When we booked that room we were told our luggage would be moved by the staff to our new room.  However, after we checked in we received a phone call that said we would need to bring our luggage to the front desk or move it our selves.  The mixed information worried us so we decided to move the luggage ourselves.  Nights 2-7 we were in a 2 Queen room(Room
Manager Response: We apologize for the incident with your neighbor on this visit. If this or something similar happens on your next visit, remember to always call the front desk. We can help calm the waters when issues like this arise. Thank you for choosing Park Vue, we hope to see you soon.

Summary: We stay at the Park Vue Inn every time we visit Disneyland....we've stayed at other hotels in the area and as far as we're concerned you can't beat the value, location and friendly staff. The rooms were clean and the staff were very helpful. The office has fresh fruit and juices every morning and in the afternoon they bake up some fresh cookies to enjoy. There is a free breakfast in the mornings to start out your day which usually consists of cereals, fresh fruits, bacon, sausage, waffles and many more items. I'm looking forward to my next visit!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are happy to know that your stay was great, and thank you for being a loyal guest. We hope that you will visit again soon. Again thank you for your review.

Summary Heading: Great hotel in a great location
Summary: I was very leary about staying at this hotel with the recent reviews I had read & actually looked at changing our hotel last minute.  I am very thankful I didn't!  This hotel is the perfect location, you can not get closer to the gate!    People need to remember this is a 2.5 star hotel, if you keep that in mind I'm not sure what there is to complain about.    We spent 7 nights with a 6yrs & 8yrs and we all loved it.  This hotel includes a CONTINENTAL breakfast, that is what it advertises and if you keep that in mind it is a great breakfast.  It has 3 cereal choices including a gluten free choice, bagels, toast, fruit, waffles & egg, hash browns & either bacon or saussages.  There is also juice machine, coffee, milk and chocolate milk, is it the best food in the world, no but
Manager Response: Thank you for writing this review, we appreciate your time and detail. We are very happy to know that your stay was great. We will continue to work at providing the highest level of customer service to our guest. Thank you again for your review. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: My husband is active duty navy and this was our 1st and last big vacation before he leaves for a lng deploymentI had a great time at the Park Vue, despite some reviews, I checked the beds for traces of bedbugs, and found none, the room was clean and cozy for my family of four. I really enjoyed the LOCATION, FREE PARKING, and FREE BREAKFAST.. I would like to suggest maybe adding blueberry as a waffle flavor. Staff was awesome... I will recommend you to other military families that are taking a trip to Disneyland/ California adventure. Definitely a great value for families on a budget
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your kind words. We will look into the blueberry waffles mix. Thank you for recommending us. Please let your husband now that we really appreciate his service to our country. Thank you again, we hope to see you guys again soon.

Summary: Location was great, breakfast was good, and the room was average.  We read the reviews about bed bugs, and maybe that had something to do with our thought process, because we thought we were bitten one night.  When we asked the front desk, they of course denied having any incidents of bed bugs.  Once we returned to the room from Disney that day, we noticed that our room was thoroughly cleaned, and they put a mattress cover on our bed.  We asked them about it and they mentioned all mattresses had mattress covers.  We obviously knew that was a lie, but did not want to continue arguing with them.  When we got back to the East Coast, we called the hotel and spoke with the manager who told us they had not replaced mattresses in over three months.  That too was a lie as they had
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad that your stay was good. We checked the room ourselves and also had a professional company inspect as well. We did not find any evidence of these pests. We did also place a mattress cover as all our rooms have these covers as a preventive measure. We have visitors from all over the world and some of them travel from hotel to hotel. We do take this very serious and clean the room very thoroughly as we search for any evidence of these pests. We have tried to call you back a few times and did not have an option to leave a message. Please contact us at your convenience. Thank you again for your review.

Summary: After hours & hours searching, I finally settled on Park Vue for our family of 20 for a total of 10 nights.  The things that helped me decide were the free breakfast, welcome baskets and social hour.  We make our group booking and paid the deposit then were advised the baskets and social hour were being removed.  Admittedly I did feel quite 'ripped off' by this however it was too close to our holiday dates and I couldn't find anywhere else to go for a reasonable price so I stuck with it.  We had a mixture of bunk rooms and Queen-Queen rooms and they were small but okay.  If you have a lot of luggage then pay extra and get one of the rooms with the lounge or separate rooms.  Housekeeping was hit & miss - great in some rooms, not so in others (even though we all tipped the same
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review. We are glad that your stay was great. We apologize for the housekeeping. Please know that we have spoken to our team and will continue to work hard to provide a home away from home to our guests. We apologize for the change in amenities and thank you for your understanding.  We hope that you would visit again soon.

Summary: Pros - Across the street from Disneyland, Free hot breakfast, Super helpful and friendly staff (checked us in two hours early upon our arrival), room safe, great parking, free Internet service  Cons - Very dirty carpet (made out feet and socks black), Towels were not thin as some reviews had posted but they were very rough feeling, not soft at all.   We (2 adults, 2 kids ages 8 and 5) enjoyed our stay and plan on returning in the future. Lots of places to eat at but mainly we stayed clear of the more restaurant type places and ate fast food and stocked our fridge in the the room and ate in. The warm breakfast was great before entering the park and you can get a great view of Disneyland fireworks from the upstairs breakfast balcony at night. You can't beat the short walk to
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are working on the carpet. We have a company which steam cleans the carpets for us on a weekly base. We are happy to know that you enjoyed your stay. We hope to provide great service again soon.

Summary: We stayed for 3 nights and were very happy.  The location is fantastic.  The staff were friendly, and great smiles from the cleaning staff whenever we saw them.  The hotel, is all one needs, the room was clean, the beds were comfortable.  The kids used the pool one afternoon. The breakfast and evening meal was basic, but good, and it was great that it was included in the rate. I really appreciated the signs everywhere asking people to be considerate with noise during certain hours.  I wish more hotels would do that.  Of course there are always people that just don't care.  I would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are very happy to know that your stay was great. We have discontinued the evening social hour as we did not have a great turn out. We have had guests request upgrades to our rooms and will be focusing on these upgrades. We apologize for any inconvenience. Again thank you for your time and kind words. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: Clean, small hotel that has everything a family needs for a Disneyland Vacation.  We have stayed here 5 times now since 2005, and they are continually upgrading and sprucing the hotel.  Since all we do is pretty much sleep in our room, this is perfect due to its close proximity to the front gate of DLR.  Makes coming back for an afternoon nap a no brainer!!! The breakfast that is included is also a money saver for a family on a budget, since its one meal thats already paid for.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to know that we provided a great stay. Thank you for noticing our new additions to the property and rooms. We will continue to work on these upgrades in the hopes to provide a better stay for our future guests. We hope that you would visit again soon.

Summary: We arrived at the Park Vue Inn on July 1st, tired and hungry after a long day on the road and so looking forward to the social hour and the welcome basket.  Well it turns out they had been discontinued the day before and although we had reserved several weeks earlier no one had bothered to let us know of this change in policy.  I found the counter and housekeeping staff generally friendly but the management was arrogant and rude.  They admitted that they had dropped the ball in not letting guests know of the amenity changes but obviously have done nothing to remedy the situation.  We also had no hot water our first evening/morning as the boiler had been shut off??? (We did receive a discount for that) The continental breakfast was adequate but the room smelled off-putting?  I
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize for not being able to provide a great stay for you. We apologize for making you feel that we were arrogant as we always strive to provide the highest level of customer service. We apologize again for the changes in our amenities and hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you. We are not planning on selling we are working diligently to upgrade our property to better serve our guests.

Summary: I would say this a more of an up-market motel than a hotel. The staff were very helpful and curteous and couldn't do enough for you. The rooms themselves were a little dated and could definately do with refurbishment. (we were on the ground floor). The location could NOT have been better - unless we'd pitched a tent at the entrance to Disney! We often popped back to the room during the afternoon and the walk was bout 7 mins door - door. It ticked the boxes (free parking, clean and close to Disney) for what we wanted. The noise was ridiculous though - you would think people would be a bit better at respecting sleeping guests - I had 2 women (not staff) talking outside my bedroom window at 6am! Not the hotel's fault, but not somewhere I'd stay if I wanted to have alot of sleep-but
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to know that your stay was good. We apologize for the noise. We hope to provide great service to you again soon.

Summary Heading: GREAT location for a DISNEY visit!
Summary: My family had a gorgeous stay at the Park Vue Inn from 08/22 to 08/25. All the best was the LOCATION - I couldn't believe that the entrance to Disney Parks and also Downtown Disney was only some minutes away - just across the street and a really short walk. This was our 5th visit in Anaheim and Disney but we'd never been that close. As we didn't want to pay the rates for Disneyhotels plus parking plus breakfast this was a real bargain to us. The rate changed during our stay - on an average the night was USD 146,00 including all (taxes, resort fees, parking, breakfast) for 2 adults and one teenager aged 17.  The 2 queen bed room was nothing fancy but quite spacious and besides we haven't spent a lot of time inside the room - just for the nights. We were glad we had a corner room
Manager Response: Thank you for writing a review about your visit. We are thrilled to know that you had such a great experience. We do apologize for the morning with the not so great breakfast. We have spoken to our breakfast team and they apologize for this. Again thank you for taking the time to review us. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: The Park vue was a great hotel for the price.  The location was excellent!  A quick walk to the park entrance. The staff was helpful and friendly. The room was clean and good size.  The free breakfast was yummy and plentiful!
Manager Response: Thank you for the review. We appreciate your time. We glad to know that your experience was great. It is our goal to provide a clean affordable home away from home. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: No longer a tolerable place to stay.
Summary: This was the response I sent to the hotel in their survey after my August 2012 stay.  I don't even know where to begin but will state I will never stay in your hotel again.  I have already contacted the many people I had recommended your hotel to, and told them to stay away.  The Howard Johnson will again get my business and my recommendations.   This was my third year in a row staying there.  My overall experience was summed by my checkout experience.  I was asked how my stay was.  I replied with disdain, "It was ok."  The response from the girl at the desk was, "Have you stayed here before?"  I said, "Yes, this is the third year in a row."  She replied, "Ok", and never asked another single question about my stay or what was wrong with it.  The apathy was apparent.  I was told
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review. The changes to our amenities are due to a decreased demand for these offerings and an increased demand for upgrades to our rooms. In order to continue to upgrade our rooms and stay competitive with our pricing we had to make changes to the offerings that had the least demand. Thank you for your understanding. We apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying.  Our goal is to not only meet the needs of each and every guest we serve, but to exceed your expectations to make your stay as pleasant and comfortable as possible. Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us.  Feedback such as yours assists us in improving our service and property on a daily basis.  In addition, please know that your comments and issues will be addressed. Thank you, and we hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you.

Summary: Just returned from five great nights at the Park Vue.  Made my reservations several months ago when the  Park Vue was still the # 2 ranked hotel in Anaheim and became more and more concerned with my choice as I began to see more negative reviews through the early summer, but upon arrival my worries were gone.  I was greeted at the front desk by a very pleasant young desk clerk (most of the front desk staff are young, but all very professional and pleasant) who explained everything and checked me in within five minutes.  I had booked a queen room with bunkbeds for our family of four.  We were assigned a room on the second floor and while a little on the small side, it had a nice flat screen tv, new carpet, and was spotless.  The room included a nice sized fridge and microwave as
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write us such a great review. It is our goal to provide a home away from home to all of our guests. We are glad to know that your stay was Fantastic. We hope to be able to serve you again soon.

Summary: This hotel is right outside the gates to Disney- it is literally minutes walk to the park. There is also a Coldstone creamery- can you ask for any more!! The location and helpful staff make this a perfect option if you are not actually staying in Disney. The rooms are a good size and clean, and the pool is great for a dip in the heat of summer. Parking for free is a real bonus too making this a good value option. There are signs everywhere encouraging guests to be respectful of other guests as the parks are open until midnight meaning guests are coming in at all hours- we found that this worked well as we were not disturbed by others at all for the 4 nights we stayed.  I have read some slightly negative reviews about here, but for what you are paying, free parking and location
Manager Response: We appreciate your time taken to write this review. We also are happy to know that your stay was great. We hope to see you soon. Thank you again

Summary: Great place to stay !! Straight across the road from the main gates to Disney so you could there in a few minutes + see the fireworks at night without leaving the hotel. Very clean rooms and a good size, with 2 huge comfortable beds. Tea and coffee making too which was wonderful. Great shower and good sized bathroom with vanity in main living area so one person could do teeth etc while other had a shower, Friendly helpful staff. Breakfast had everything you needed but the waffle machine didn't cook the waffles right through.We were in room 230 + on the second floor towards back so nice and quite. This meant only a couple of families had to walk past the door at night, Free & good WiFi. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad to know that your visit to Park Vue was great. Thank you for all the tips for our future guests. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: You stay at this place for the location as it's the closest motel to Disneyland along with it's neighbor on the other side of IHOP. Other benefits are no extra charge for parking and a hot breakfast, both of which I don't think are offered at other motels on the block without paying extra. The food is mediocre, but it's hard to complain when it doesn't cost extra. The room where the food was served had a bad smell, but you can eat outside. Rooms are clean with what looks to be partial renovations to the carpet and countertops on the kitchenette and vanity. Everything else is pretty outdated and the walls are very thin. Staff is friendly, but very young. Overall, if you're looking for a place that has a great location where you can walk to Disneyland in 5 mins and don't have to
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest review. We will continue to update our rooms and should be done soon. Thanks again for taking the time to write the review. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Not bad for the location only
Summary: Very disappointed with our three night stay at this place. Before booking, read lot of reviews about welcome gift basket, balloons to make kids extra special, evening snacks....None were available as of aug 15th. Breakfast was O.K and crowded place. Only things good were the location closest to disneyland, fireworks from our room which my kids enjoyed. The front desk were not very comfortable or welcoming.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize for a disappointed stay. The changes to our amenities are due to a decreased demand for these offerings and an increased demand for upgrades to our rooms. In order to continue to upgrade our rooms and stay competitive with our pricing we had to make changes to the offerings that had the least demand. The reason why we do not offer balloons at this time is due to a helium shortage. We apologize again for not being able to provide a pleasant stay. We hope that you would give us another opportunity to provide a great stay.

Summary: About 6 months ago when we started looking for places to stay in Anaheim, this place came highly recommended on several Disney chat forums I belong to. Then I began seeing more and more negative reviews, including on this site. We kept our reservations because we needed to accommodate my brother in one of our rooms and preferred some type of suite set up.plus, although still high, the price of the room included parking, breakfasts, social hour, and welcome basket. Did away with the social hour and baskets a month before we came. Ok, no problem, the price was still cheaper than a few other places I looked into.  We stayed 4 nights this past week. Easy check in, incredibly friendly, called a couple hrs later to see if our room was ok and if we needed anything. We appreciated the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are currently working on these cosmetic improvements. We continue to work diligently to provide a great stay at a great value. We appreciate your kind words. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: For the price this place is hard to beat. Located directly across the street for Disneyland you can be at the gate in 7 minutes. You can walk to various restaurants on Harbor and downtown Disney to eat. Now, it's not the nicest hotel I've stayed in but it is clean and the employee's seem to care. It has a small store that sells cheap trinkets, shirts, bottled water etc. and a laundry room which is convenient.  The pool and hot tube are very nice and it's great to come back from the park in the late afternoon for a quick swim and relax then change and head back for the fireworks.  All in all a good family place.  I'd probably stay somewhere nicer if it was just my wife and I, but like I said, a good value for the price when traveling as a family. The free parking is very nice too.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear that your stay was good. Please know that we are currently working on our property in the efforts to provide a great place to stay. We hope that you come visit again soon to see our improvements.

Summary: I couldn't recommend this accomodation highly enough, friendly staff, efficient service, clean rooms, located in the best spot in Anaheim (directly opposite Disneyland main gate) - you can lie in bed at night and watch the firework display nightly, free wifi to Skype home, best pool in the district! We will definitely stay there again on our next visit and are recommending to all our Aussie friends. Complimentary breakfast is a great start to the day and tours pick up from outside the front gate. What more can I say fabulous value and a wonderful surprise, thank you guys!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. It is our goal to provide a clean, comfortable, home away from home. We are glad we were able to accomidate such a great stay. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: I echo the "not what it used to be" review...still worth a stay, but I've dropped it a bubble.
Summary: We have been staying at the Park Vue every year for about 7 years...and with SoCal annual passes at D'land a couple of those years...we have stayed here quite a bit!  I wish I could say exactly what we paid back in 2005 or so, but I don't have that record...I SWEAR it was about $90/night.  The rates seem to have gone up considerably (now about $150/night).  I always counted in the little extras that they provided...the welcome basket with fruit and wine...wine opener, little plastic wine glasses...and the "social hour" at dinner time.  Even though it was just basic (Campbell's soup, sliders, fruit, juice) it was enough to make a simple meal for with 3 of us...which I figured was a MINIMUM value of $20 if we had to find a place to eat around the park somewhere.  So, as of July 1,
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize for the discontinued basket and social hour. The changes to our amenities are due to a decreased demand for these offerings and an increased demand for upgrades to our rooms. In order to continue to upgrade our rooms and stay competitive with our pricing we had to make changes to the offerings that had the least demand. Thank you for your understanding. The old bulky TV's are currently being replaced. We should be done by the end of September. We apologize for any inconveniences caused by these changes. It is our hope to improve our property to provide a better experience for our guests. We hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you.

Summary Heading: Perfectly located for Disney, just opposite
Summary: We chose the Park Vue Inn because it's the nearest hotel to Disney, just over the road from the entrance.  We thought they might be a little complacent as a result, but no way - the hotel is very well run, clean and tidy, with extremely comfortable rooms.  Full breakast is included and you can eat outside on a pleasant patio.   Good pool, not busy as everyone is at Disney!

Summary Heading: Happy here but unavoidable breakfast stairs can be challenging
Summary: Just returned from a 5 day stay here.  It was clean, staff was friendly, and we saved lots of money on our Disneyland visit by staying here.  Cookies and juice in lobby was appreciated. Our only challenge was that the breakfast service was located on the second floor and taking food back to the room was not allowed.  Our oldest traveller really had a challenge with those stairs and her knees.  It would be nice to be able to bring food down for those who can't do stairs very well.   We did not ask for an exception to the rule so in fairness, it may be possible that the Staff would have allowed us to bring food down. Even so, no elevator, food upstairs, and signs posted that food is not allowed to be taken out of the breakfast area means that families traveling with mobility
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review. We are happy to hear that your stay was great. I apologize for the stairs. On your next visit please know that we do allow our guests to take food to their room when the stairs are a challenge. I apologize that this was not offered to you on your stay. I have informed all of our food and beverage employees about this exception. Again thank you for your review we hope to be of service to you and your family soon.

Summary: We just returned last night from a one week trip to southern California, which included a 4 night stay at the Park Vue Inn.  We stayed in a family suite (bunk bed and queen bed) on the ground floor.  I will echo most of the other reviews - the location is awesome, but the accommodations themselves are mediocre at best.  You really are literally across the street from the Disneyland entrance.  It's very convenient.  Especially when you or your kids are beat and you want to take a mid-day nap, or if you're done with crowds and want to enjoy the fireworks from the comfort of the hotel balcony.  Aside from that, I wasn't really blown away.  The staff was always very nice and helpful, and the rooms had everything we needed - but that's about it.  The room was small and very very
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate all your suggestions, it helps us as we are curently upgrading our rooms. We hope that we could accomodate a stay for you soon.

Summary Heading: Sadly, not as good as it used to be
Summary: We've been staying in the Park Vue Inn regularly for the past eight years and have always been delighted with most aspects of this hotel.  However, on this trip I really felt that things had deteriorated.  The room was clean but the furnishings are now getting very battered and need updating.  I know that no one spends much time in the room here, but there is a real lack of comfort in the room; there is nowhere to sit other than hard backed dining room type chairs which are covered with plastic - unpleasantly sticky for bare skin!  The towels are very thin and the products in the bathroom are now provided in refillable containers - I'd like to think it was because the hotel is concerned about environmental issues, but I suspect it's to economise.  My biggest gripe is that
Manager Response: We apologize that your stay was not as good as in the past. We are currently working on upgrades to our rooms; we hope this will remedy these issues mentioned. We have tried to have the breakfast earlier but did not have a great turnaround. We hope that you would give us another opportunity to serve you. We thank you for your review as it helps us to better accommodate our guests.

Summary: We were very happy with this site and the office was very helpful! It was easy in and easy out with the motorhome. The RV park is close to pretty much everything. Everything was very convenient. Not far from Disneyland as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to know that we were able to provide a great stay. We are glad to have the RV Park so close to us as this makes it easy for our guests to have a place to park their big vehicles. Than you for choosing Park Vue Inn we hope to see you soon.

Summary: Park Vue Inn offers a bed to sleep in while visiting Disneyland, and the location is unbeatable. Otherwise it is a motel as motels go.  We - a family of five - had a three night stay in mid july. Park Vue Inn is clean and the beds are comfortable and in this way it serves its purpose. We had a room on the ground floor, so we chose to have the drapes closed all the time, making the room very dark. Besides the very dirty carpets everything else was nice and clean. We had a problem with our safe, and the staff was quick and effective in helping. All in all the staff was great. Breakfast was better than average but still very sugary - the coffee was fine at breakfast. The food was plenty getting refilled all the time and the breakfast area was never crowded. The potato dish was a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write us this review. We have a company which comes out every week and steam cleans the carpets. It can be a little hard to go into all the rooms as we have been sold out. We apologize for this and hope that it will not hinder you from staying with us again in the future. Again thank you for the review, we hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Basic accomodation but closest to the parks and with great staff
Summary: This is the first time we've stayed at the Park Vue Inn.  We've stayed at the Disneyland Hotel, Paradise Pier, and another off-property inn.  For the money, this is the best accommodation possible for Disneyland and California Adventure.  Other than the Grand Californian (at $420 per night!), you cannot get closer to the parks.  The rooms are very basic, but comfortable and have everything you'd need including a refrigerator and microwave.  The beds are firm, and you can definitely hear noise from outside, but we were so exhausted after a long day in the park I could have slept on a rock in Grand Central Station.  The showers were great, and I cannot say enough about the STAFF.  Top to bottom, start to finish, the staff were absolutely top notch.  So nice, thoughtful and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such a nice review. We are very happy to know that your stay was great. We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: Old motel with very small rooms.  Stains on comforter, towels.  Holes in walls.  The only good things are the remodeled bathroom and proximity to Disneyland.  There is no way this place deserves to be the #3 rated hotel in Anaheim.
Manager Response: We apologize that your stay was unsatisfactory. We are committed to providing clean confortable home away from home. We'll be looking into the issues you have mentioned in regards to the condition of the room and linens. To more directly address some of your concerns please contact the hotel directly.  We thank you for taking the time to write this review as it will help us better our services.

Summary Heading: Bed bugs, filthy, bad costumer service and in desperate need of remodeling.
Summary: I have been returning to this hotel for the past 5 years, several times a year since I'm a Disneyland annual pass holder. Last year I did not renew my pass so 1.5 years passed since my last stay here but oh my have things changed! First there was a huge price increase $110 to $170. The quality of the breakfast changed and is of poor quality now and they got rid of the social hour. The place is dirty, your shoes stick to the floors in the hallways and the carpets are filthy. There are serious maintenance issue also. We stayed a total of 3 nights and had the worst stay of my life. On the first night I was place in room 241 and immediately had problems. We arrived to the room from spending the day at the park and proceeded to use the restroom. I thought it was odd that there was a

What a great find in Anaheim if you are visiting Disneyland.  It is directly across the street from Disneyland.  The crosswalk to get to Disneyland is right at their drive.  At the end of the day, this was very nice!  The motel is very clean, and plenty of room in the double queen room.  We had a great stay.  Everyone was very helpful and courteous!  We will definitely stay here again when we return to Disneyland.
Manager Response: We thank you for your review. We are very happy that your stay was Great. We will continue to work hard to provide a great place for you and your loved ones. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at the Park Vue Inn.  The breakfast was great with many choices.  The price is affordable. The staff is very accommodating.  The location is perfect!  We will definitely be back!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We are glad that you had a great stay. We will continue to work hard to provide the highest level of customer service and a home away from home to our guests. We will see you soon.

Summary: At the time we booked this hotel is was ranked #3 in Anaheim on TripAdvisor, and had a 4.4 on hotels.com.  I paid a lot more than I normally would for a S. Harbor motel based on the reviews and the location.  Well, the location can't be beat, but the rest is fair at best, and poor at worst.  I just don't get the reviews, and I have stayed in 5 Disney area hotels.  I don't expect much from a Disney hotel - walk to the park, clean room, hot shower, comfy bed, and nice pool and hot tub.  It hit on the walk to the park, but that's about it:   - The room was clean enough, but the towels were thin and yellowed, and some had stains.  The place is old, with an old fashioned wall air conditioner.  The whole place just seems a bit grimy.  We had a double queen, and it was very small.  No

We stayed for the first time at the Park Vue in May. We will be returning this week. Pleasantly surprised with a gift basket upon arrival. One of the beds was off the base and stuck out but housekeeping promptly arrived to take care of it and apologized profusely for it being that way. Clean room with amenities. Liked having a microwave also. Breakfast was a nice selection. We did not take advantage of the early evening 'snack' offered. Liked the pastries and juice also set up in the lobby, (if we had wanted them). Felt gift shop was comparable in pricing. Aso liked being checked in when you park. We will be using the pool area this time as we are returning with my son and granddaughter. Highly recommend this to anyone. Quick trip to the signal and then across the street to

As usual, our stay was wonderful. Delicious breakfast, tasty social hour dinner, excellent customer service, nice rooms, and the closest hotel to the park!  We stay here a few times a year and have never been disappointed.Thanks Park Vue Inn.

Pleasantly surprised.  We frequent 2 & 3 star hotels... This was definitely one of the best.  Location is great abt 10min. walk w/ kids & strollers. Not having to deal w/ parking, shuttles, etc. was worth it in and of itself. Small rooms, but sufficient for our sleeping needs.  Decent pool/hot tub for the kids (heated) who needed a break from the die-hard Disney days.  Continental bfast was a great "bang for your buck" since we anticipated donuts & coffee and got a decent buffet instead.  Only issue was it opened @ 7am and Disney opened @ 8am so there was no such thing as a leisure bfast if you wanted to be the 1st in the gate @ Disney.  "Social hour" wasn't the greatest, but an added measure of service unexpected from a 2 or 3 star hotel.  Friendly staff... In fact, my 6 yr.

We stayed here for 4 nights and didn't want to bother taking shuttles everyday to get to the theme parks. Even though it is just across the road from the main entrance, it is still a bit of a walk as you will need to go through the bus parking area before you get to the entrance check point.   We looked at the Disneyland resort hotels but they were quite expensive. Even the cheapest one wasn't as good as Park Vue Inn (in terms of price and quality).    Every night the fireworks go off at Disneyland and you can see them over the rooftops of our accommodation.  Make sure you ask to stay on the 2nd level.  The only thing is that it can get quite noisy as the kids run up and down the corridors and the walls are very thin.  Breakfast is also included as part of the price which was a

Summary Heading: Has went a little down hill...
Summary: I think I have reviewed these guys before and I was a HUGE fan, but its really went downhill.  We went back to Disneyland this year and of course, we stayed at the Park Vue Inn.  Like I said, this was one of our favorite hotels but this place seems to have really gone downhill.  First off, a BIG little 'extra' they used to do is give you a gift basket saying "Thanks Smith Family for staying with us..." along with a bottle of wine or sparkling cider, some fruit and etc.  They do not do this any more.  We always loved that little extra.  Secondly, always on a budget, we used to love the fact that they not only served hot breakfast, but hot dinner as well and they got rid of the dinner portion as well.  Others in our party had sugar ant issues in their rooms, but fairly minor.

Dont stay here if you want 'posh' - the towels are a little thin, the bathroom grouting not pristine, the sheets a little old but .....  The hotel is 8 mins walk from the gates of Disneyland. Perfect location for the parks.   A fridge, microwave, coffee machine are provided and a good complimentary breakfast. Be aware though that breakfast doesn't start til 7am which isn't any good if you want to take advantage of early entry into the parks. However there is an iHop right next door and Dennys a 2 min walk away. There is also a great Tony Romas next to Dennys for dinner.   The hotel has a nice little pool for cooling off although we simply ran out of time to use it.   To sum up I would say the perfect location of this hotel out weighs any little niggles about towels etc, but it's

Park vue We stayed here as part of a two week road trip between LA, Palm Springs and Vegas.  I was travelling with my partner, and two kids aged 13 and 5.  Would definitely stay here again  How long did we stay? 2 nights Where we booked/how much we paid – £200 for a room with two doubles booked via expedia.co.uk.  At the time of booking (March 2012) this included complimentary breakfast and “social hour” tea as well as parking and wifi.  Since 1.7.12. they have removed the social hour food, however did not inform us of this, they instead provide cookies and fruit in reception.  About the place- The hotel is two storey set back from the road, plenty of parking with a small pool in the centre.  Next door to ihop and plenty of other hotel choices too!    Locally – This place is

We stayed at the Park Vue last year and thought it was fantastic - perfect location and all the added extras (breakfast, welcome basket and evening meal) made this good value for money.  We thought it was so great we recommended the Park Vue to other Kiwis travelling to LA as well as re-booking for ourselves, our parents and sister and her family.  When booking we explained it was a 'once in a lifetime' family holiday together and asked if we could be upstairs (as it can be noisy downstairs) as well as being together.  Firstly, when we arrived we were advised the evening meal had been discontinued.  This was extremely disappointing as I believe they had an obligation to advise their changes of conditions to all those who had bookings.  It was no good telling me when we arrived -

So it's not anything like staying at a Disney Resort, which we've done. Mickey is nowhere to be seen but that's ok.  Price wise, this place was Affordable!  Its a decent hotel especially considering the location is right across the street from Disneyland.  The rooms are in need of updating but they are a good size. The beds are not the best but we weren't in them that much.  The pool area is nice and we met some very nice people in the spa!  As for the breakfast, pretty good. It's included in the price of the hotel.  Eggs, bacon, fruit, cereal, drinks and much more. It was a great way to start the 5 mornings we were there. We being a family of 4 with a 14 and 23 year old. The light evening fare was ok.  Mostly designed for tired families with little kids I think. We didn't have

We've stayed at this hotel in the past. The thing that set it apart from the rest was the wine gift baskets and free breakfast and dinner. But this time there was no gift basket or dinner. So now I would rank it the same as its neighbors and base it on price. I also asked to setup a surprise basket for our anniversary but there was none and I had to call to get one. Overall the staff was friendly and the rooms were nice. But I'll base it on price and compare all of Harbour street. Too bad.

The plus  - it's close to DisneyLand, was a very easy walk for my little guys.  The con, very dirty worn out rooms and unfriendly staff. My little guy crawled for a minute on the floor and he was filthy. They truly need to train their staff on how to clean a room. We did not let him do that again. Wouldn't stay here again.  The sad part is we are not picky people.  This place was horrible.  Thin walls made it easy to hear everything the people in the next room were doing.

One of my favorite Value hotels by Disneyland.   We stayed a few months ago for our second time.  This is a great hotel for the price.  I believe the service/ cleanliness has slipped since our first trip a few years ago (but I am a clean-freak).  We stayed in the family suite with a kitchen.  The carpets were a little dirty (socks turned dark, though somewhat expected with disneyland traffic.) and the window seal in the bathroom was peeling and had a little bit of mold growing, which is out of sight to most people, but I am 6' 3" and just tall enough to see.  Aside from that the beds are clean and houskeeping seems to do a good job. The staff is overall friendly.  The breakfast is better than average (make your own waffles every morning was a treat).  Location is the best.  The

Summary Heading: Ok. Will stay elsewhere next time.
Summary: This hotel was adequate for our stay. We had a double bed with bunks. Stayed for a week. The biggest downfall was the small room, paper thin walls and housekeeping service. On the first day we went to Disney early and came back around 12 for a nap. Our room was not made up which was not that big of a deal so we went to the pool for about an hour and waited for housekeeping to clean our room. They didn't. We went back to park and returned at 6 pm and our room wasn't made up. We called front desk and we were told that house keeping services were gone for the day. The same thing happened the next day and we were told by the front desk that if we continued going to park early and staying in our room during the early afternoon that our room wouldn't be serviced. We were a little
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time out of your schedule to complete this review.  I apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying. Please know that these issues are being resolved, to prevent this from happening in the future. We hope that you would allow us another opportunity to be of service to you and your family.
Thank you for this review. Short and sweet. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Don't be fooled by these positives reviews, stay somewhere else
Summary: My stay wasn't awful here, it was sufficient. But I am so shocked to see such positive reviews for such a mediocre hotel.   This hotel has one plus, and that is its location.   The rooms are shabby, small, not particularly clean, and are in dire need of an update. The springy beds and rock hard pillows made for uncomfortable sleep. Your very average continental breakfast I see everyone raving about, was bland and seemed a bit unsanitary.  Customer service wise everyone sounds like good customer service providers but they don't deliver. Example: We had made a reservation for 6 people but when we arrived the room was only stocked for 2. We called the front desk and the woman who answered the phone was very sweet and asked us how our stay was, we requested for more towels and she
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review. Feedback like yours helps to better our services. Regarding your experience, we apologize for the under stocked amenities and misinformation regarding our housekeeping service. Our double queen rooms are always stocked with amenities for 4 adults. Requests for extra towels and other amenities including softer pillows are happily granted and I realize it seems that was not your experience. Our housekeepers service rooms from 9am-4pm, however there is a staff member that can service basic room requests until 11pm daily. Reviews like yours are taken seriously and taken directly to the staff and addressed to insure our service is improved and our standards for customer service are met. Though you have indicated a desire to stay elsewhere, we would like an opportunity to be of better service to you on your next visit should you choose to stay with us.

Summary: My Husband and I decided to visit Disneyland on a whim, and after searching high and low on TA for a suitable hotel we chose Park Vue Inn. PROS:  - Location Location Location - directly across the street from Disneyland - If you need a nap in the middle of your Disney day, you can be back at your room in 5 minutes from the Ticket Gate. - Breakfast Included  - Pool Available - Friendly Staff - Fridge, Microwave, Coffee Maker in our Room - we were going to the park very early so picked up our own breakfasts and had it in our fridge when we woke up in the morning. - Were able to store our luggage with the Front Desk after Check-out so we could play in Disneyland for a few more hours. - Room was generally clean and comfortable after a long day. - IHOP on one side and Denny's on the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We appreciate your Pro's as well as the Con's. This helps us to better serve our guests in the future. We hope that you will come visit us soon.

Summary Heading: Best location and value for Disneyland
Summary: This hotel was so convenient on many level. It really is right in front of the entrance of Disneyland, so that we did not depend on shuttles and could come back for a break before the parade. We arrived, jetlag on a weekend and could enjoy the fireworks from the terrace without braving the crowds. It has a clean sparkling pool and spa, fantastic after a day of walking through the parks, and you can see the fireworks from there.
