It serves a good breakfast and an evening snack/meal, so no hunting for food at night with tired children. It comes from heated up cans and plastic containers, but it will feed a fussy child. The free cookies, juices and coffees at reception are a great touch. It has an icecream shop right at the front, perfect finish to a long day.  If you want a good
Manager Response: Thank you Ausi friends for this wonderful review. We are very happy to know that we were able to make your vacation so convenient and confortable. We will continue to work at providing great accommodations for our guests. We hope that you will be able to come visit us again soon. Cheers.

Summary: This hotel is the closest to the Disneyland entrance.  It has a wonderful full breakfast including eggs, sausage/bacon, biscuits, cereal, fruit, pastries, bagetls, and waffles each day.  The rooms are spacious enough for a family and clean.  My only complaint was the shower area.  Our shower did not drain well and almost flooded the bathroom area.  We called maintenance and when we returned to the room everything worked fine. This may be an isolated incident, but it could be due to the age of the hotel.  Otherwise I was very pleased with the experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time out of your schedule to write this review. We are glad to know that your stay was great. We are also happy to hear that our maintenance team was able to remedy this incident. We hope that you would be able to come visit soon.

Summary Heading: Park Vue Inn Saved my Vacation
Summary: On July 25, 2012 we were returning from our short walk from Disneyland when my husband pulled our borrowed double stroller up the curb with our 2 sleeping children inside it. The stroller collapsed due to them being at the maximum weight limit and the screws in the sides popped out.  Gustavo and Daniel who are maintenance workers at the Park Vue Inn came to our rescue.  They pulled out their tools and new screws and 20 minutes later fixed our stroller which we desperately need for our next day at Disneyland...and it saved us $200 that I would have needed to spend to replace my friend's stroller.  I was so upset that it broke and then delighted when they were able to fix it.  The service was excellent, the rooms were big and very clean.  The pool was heated to 90 degrees which
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear that we were able to save the day. Gustavo and Daniel both express their gratitude for this review, and also continue to say that it was their pleasure to be of service to you and your family. Thank you from Park Vue Inn, we hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Happy Days -Very Close to Disneyland Resort®
Summary: This hotel was very good.  It was close to Disneyland Resort®.  it was just across the street.  As for the rooms, they were nice.  The beds were nice and comfortable.  The maid service was less than stellar.  They left their trash in our room in a trash bag.  The air conditioner is literally in the bathroom area which was strange .   The shower was very slippery!  We had to be careful before we got out of the shower!    There was food out on the walkway which had not been cleaned up.  The service overall though was great!  The staff at the front desk was very nice and helpful.    Overall, the hotel was nice.  My family and I would stay here again!

Summary Heading: Great location, Clean motel type accomodations
Summary: We booked this motel after reading the great reviews on this site.   Before leaving for our trip I checked this site again and saw some negative recent reviews that made me wonder if we did the right thing in booking here.    When we arrived after a long drive (traffic wise) from the airport we were pleasantly surprised with the look of the hotel.   We had no problem checking in and the front desk was very friendly.   The kids loved the free cookies, fruit and juices that were always there on the front counter whenever you went into the lobby.    Our room was clean and we had no problems with anything in the room.   It had a microwave, refrigerator and coffee pot.   The tv was a little outdated and seemed to get mostly spanish speaking stations.   But since we mainly watched it

Summary Heading: Ideal budget family accomm for Disney parks visit
Summary: We are a family of 4 with 11 & 14 year old children, and visited the Disney parks in early July 2012.  We knew that the days would be long, so wanted somewhere as close as physically possible.  I Google streetviewed the Disney plaza entrance, and saw that Park Vue Inn was the closest hotel, directly across the pedestrian crossing from the Disney entrance.  Looking on Tripadvisor, the reviews appeared good, so we got a reservation for a two room, 3 bed suite for only $180 per night.  It was everything we hoped it would be. First off, this is not the Disneyland Resort Hotel, or the Hilton, or the Hyatt.  It is a motel with limited service, so if you want a 5 star experience, this won't be it.  What it does do, it does well however. We were looking for a motel that was clean,

Summary Heading: you get what you pay for
Summary: This review will be broken down into the following sections: location/nearby service, room quality,check in experiance, food and customer service/maids.  Location. The park vue inn lives up to its claim to fame. It is right accross the street from the entrance. It is right next door to an I Hop, dennys is 2 hotels down and tony romas is next to that.  Room quality: WARNING to everyone with neck or back problems. Bring your own pillow. The pillows in room 140 caused some rough nights sleep. We fixed it by going to target (about 3 miles down south harbor blvd) and got $3 pillows and fixed the problem. I personally would not recommend a jacquzzi tub room to anyone with a toddler, but that had no impact on the review. Just an fyi. The TV system is about 15 years behind every major

I was first hesitant to stay here because wanted to be on disney property but after all the great reviews and the great price, my fears were soon quenched. Wow, make reservations here. The service and what you get for your money you can't beat it. We had to double queens that connected top floor as close to the dining area as possible. The bunk rooms are closer. They gave out as many water bottles as you wanted along with cookies and coffee. We would load our stroller up and head to Disney which was right across the street. The meals were great and lots of variety. I couldn't believe they offered great kid friendly meals in the evening for free. You really can't beat this place and the pool was so refreshing after a day of disney!
Manager Response: We thank you for taking the time to write this wonderful review. It is always our goal to provide a home away from home. We hope to see you and your family again soon.

Summary: My family and I (2A, 2C) stayed here for 4 nights between Christmas and New Years Eve 2011. We arrived late morning, left our luggage with reception and joined the hordes at D'land. On our return mid-afternoon our luggage was already in our room along with a lovely welcome basket. Our room was on the first floor at the far end of the complex, well away from the road. It was extremely clean and very quiet.   We loved the fact that we could easily wander back to our room from Disneyland for a break in the middle of the day - the kids loved the spa - and we didn't have to queue or wait for a shuttle bus. The location is simply fantastic.   The breakfasts are a little crazy - you never really know what you're going to get, it gets very busy just prior to D'land opening and at times
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your suggestions for our future guests. It is our goal to always provide a Home away from Home. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: My family and i just got back from a 4 night stay.This hotel was great for Disneyland.The morning breakfast is good and the hotel is  very clean.Like some have wrote before we weren't at the hotel too much because we wanted to go to the parks and this hotel was perfect.There's an IHOP right next door,McDonalds alittle down and the staff was great.We have two young children so at the end of the night is was great to just have them in the strollers and walk to our hotel instead of taking buses like WDW which at times can be hellish when the kids are tired.I would not hesitate to stay here again.Why throw money away to stay over at a Disney resort when this ones cheaper and almost as close .
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We are glad to know that your stay was great. We will continue to work hard to provide a great place to stay. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Remember, You are here for Disneyland
Summary: This is a great location. It is literally right across the street.  I asked them if I had to go left or right and they said to just cross the street. I saw the good and bad comments. It is a family run business.  I heard someone tell a customer when I was waiting for my family in the lobby. All of the staff we came into contact with was very courteous.  I dealt with both a young girl and young man. Also the maids were pleasant when you met them outside.  We left the parks at 11:30 each night and it was so nice to be able to take a short walk to the hotel.  We also took a short break during the afternoon heat. We have been to WDW and waiting, waiting for those shuttles in long lines, is a bummer. This is what we wanted to avoid.  It is clean. It was not as worn as some of the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are currently replacing all our linens and towels. We hope that by your next visit we will have finished this upgrade. Thank you for your kind words, see you soon.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay by Disneyland!
Summary: We took our granddaughter and her friend to Disneyland and stayed at the Park Vue Inn. It was our third visit to the Inn and, as before, we had a great stay! The staff is very friendly, the accommodations are very clean and the price was very competitive. The Inn is located directly across the street from the park so it is an easy walk.
Manager Response: Hello we are happy that you and your granddaughter had a great experience with us. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn. We hope to be of service to you soon.

Summary Heading: Will stay here only! Staff, clean rooms, service and more- all exceptional.
Summary: Oh my goodness- I am writing this review so long after the fact- sorry- but it is not less valid. WARNING- This review will be LONG! Lots of good to say.  I want to especially give thanks to Ernesto who set up my reservations, greeted us upon arrival- went above and beyond in making us comfortable as I was a mom traveling with 3 little ones on my own. He arranged a downstairs room close to the front desk so I wouldn't have to travel upstairs with (or far) with my double stroller and sleeping kids when returning to hotel in the evening.  Aside from that- Park Vue Inn does specially treat things for kids for birthdays, etc. Our situation was a little different- not a celebration, by my children and I had to leave our home for a week due to the fact that my husband had just had a
Manager Response: Better late than never. Thank you for taking the time to write such a great detailed review. Thank you for your kind words. We hope to be of service again soon.

Summary Heading: If you don't want to pay Disney resort rates...
Summary: this is the place. Everything went very well. The office staff were super. The location could not be better. My only complaint is that I booked through Expedia. The reservation was non-refundable, which I knew, but I found out it did not allow changes (not even for a fee).
Manager Response: Thank you for you review, we have shared it with the front office staff. They also express their gratitude. We hope to see you soon, and accommodate a bunk bed room for you and your family.

Summary: Just returned from a two day stay here and have to say overall it was a good experience.  We booked a suite room and had a bottom floor unit that was very nice.  Arrived early and was told our room was being cleaned.  When I returned at 3 pm, I was told that check in was not until 3:30pm, unlike what the website says and what is posted in the rooms.  The younger female clerk at the front desk with braces should have been nicer, when people are paying top dollar to stay where you work, be nice!  I observed her snapping at other guests and the following day when printing my boarding pass, I felt really bad for the lady who dared to inquire about a shuttle to LAX. She told me outside in the parking lot that she would never stay there again. Did I complain to anyone, no, I am on
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us.  Your feedback assists us in improving our service and property on a daily basis.  In addition, please know that your comments and issues will be addressed. We apologize for the inconvenience during your stay and hope to see you during your next visit.

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights. I didn't expect much when booking this hotel, and yet I still managed to be disappointed when I saw our room. The room was very dark and run down looking and felt very unclean. The walls are very, very thin and you can hear your neighbors and anyone outside as clear as day. The breakfast was adequate. The cookies and juice in the lobby are a nice touch. The location is the only highlight of this stay, but even that isn't enough to entice me to stay here again.

Summary Heading: The Best For Price, Quality, & Proximity
Summary: This hotel more than exceeded our expectations. Prior to our visit we had booked another hotel and then switched to Park Vue just because of the buffet breakfast. The food was great, the service was great, the room was amazing (there were a few rust or crack spots but not that noticeable), and it is right in front of the crosswalk to the Disneyland Boardwalk.  One night I called the service desk fairly late to ask about delivery, the person who answered not only gave us suggestions but also offered us menus which was extremely helpful. Everyone at the front desk and the janitorial crew were friendly - whenever I passed someone they smiled and greeted us. One of the highlights was probably how on top of customer service they were. We did not want any room cleaning during our stay
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time out of your schedule to write this review. We thank you so much for understanding our reasons for discontinuing our least used ameneties. We hope to have fully upgraded our rooms by your next visit, including the WIFI. Thank you for your wonderful review and all the tips for our future guests. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: We have stayed at the Park Vue Inn many times over the last fifteen years. The only attraction to the hotel in the past was its location. The rooms were worn out, the complimentary breakfast was barely adequate and there could be insects in your room. After extensive re-modeling the hotel is much cleaner, it has an excellent ice cream shop on the front of the lobby and the breakfast is actually pretty good. It is more expensive to stay here, but the improvements make it worth it. I would highly recommend this hotel to families with small children or anyone who wants a nice hotel that is VERY close to the DCA and Disneyland main gates.
Manager Response: We appreciate your review, we are very happy to know that you appreciate our upgrades. We are continuing to upgrade our hotel to better accommodate our guests. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: After spending many hours reviewing hotels for our first family trip to Disneyland we decided on the Park Vue because of such good reviews and the 'extras' included, the wine & fruit welcome basket, the birthday vouchers and the social hour. It was more expensive per night but because of the free evening dinner would be worth it. Unfortunately we got none of this.  After being awake for over 30 hours and travelling half way around the world we finally arrived at the hotel to a 'not very friendly' welcoming. Fortunately checking in early wasn't a problem. We were asked to pay in full which I thought was odd, but regrettably did so anyway. We were given our meal vouchers for the complimentary breakfast & social hour. We decided to leave Disneyland till the following day as it was
Clean great location fitness room rooms are big with six bed

We stayed here for three nights on a Disney vacation.  The location is PERFECT.  Directly across the street from Disneyland, it is only a 5 minute walk to both California Adventures and Disneyland gates. We were able to walk back to the hotel for afternoon naps and stayed until closing knowing we weren't going to have to fight for spots on the buses and trams to the Disney parking lot or nearby hotels.  The hotel is dated, not the cleanest, and the fitness center is comprised of three pieces of cardio equipment (what a joke but who comes to disney to workout anyway).  My boys loved the bunkbeds and the breakfast was great; however, if it wasn't for the superb location, we would not stay at this hotel. Like I said, it is dated but the location definitely makes up for all

We normally book at a hotel across and down the street, but for this trip, we booked at Park Vue because of the free social hour and the other extras.  The day before our trip, I looked again on Trip Advisor and read that social hour had been discontinued.  We called the hotel and asked why we were not notified of this change, and the response we received was that they were not under any obligation to inform us because the service was 'free.'  I asked to cancel our reservations, and was advised that as they required 48 hours notice, I would be charged accordingly. Apparently it's ok for them to change their service without notice, but not for us to change our plans.  We stayed at the hotel, and the only positive I can say about this hotel was the location.  The location,

This hotel is directly opposite the Disneyland entrance and was great for access back and forth. We were travelling with 2 teenage grandchildren and our room, one queen and bunks, was very crowded with all our luggage. Breakfast was Ok but we did not try dinner. Staff was very helpful and we found the beds comfortable.

This hotel/motel is the perfect location and price while visiting Disneyland!  The rooms were always clean.  My teenage kids took full advantage of the free wi-fi and the free breakfast.  The one minor thing was that we requested that the 3 rooms that we reserved be close to each other, which 2 were, but when requesting that those 2 be connecting rooms, they said they were but we found out differently once we got to the rooms.  Oh well...  On a side note...think about the very long days/evenings you'll be spending in Disneyland...you come back at night...your so tired and your getting up and doing it all over again tomorrow....do you really want to walk up a flight of stairs?  We stayed on the bottom floor last time and much preferred it!

Summary Heading: It's all about location for this place.
Summary: This hotel is all about location. It is located right across from Disneyland and if you don't  want to deal with the hassle of paying for parking this is the place for you. I booked this hotel for 4 days 3 nights because of the reviews on trip advisor. I am not a hard person to please but was not impressed by this hotel at all. The beds were not very comfortable and the pillows were all different sizes. The overall appearance of the hotel was nothing to get excited about there was no table to eat on in the room and just one chair to sit on. We booked two queen beds my Sister booked the same exact kind of room and they received a flat screen tv while we had an old school tv in ours. The staff is very friendly and called a couple times to make sure everything was ok. The free

Loved the proximity of the Park Vue to Disneyland - no other hotel is closer!  Also the breakfast is good(not fabulous) and filling and helps to save costs on Disney meals.   We loved the size of our rooms as we had the 3 queen suite.  For a family of 5 with all teenagers the space was worth every penny.  We can only hope to have the opportunity to return as Pennsylvania is so very far away!!!!

Summary Heading: Closest to Disneyland, really good value
Summary: We wanted a place near Disneyland. This place fit the bill.  I am recovering from a broken leg and needed a scooter and had Anaheim Medical supply deliver it to the hotel.  Made a big difference for me as my family was on the move all day long.  We were 3/4 of the way back (adjoining rooms) beyond the pool and our room was very quiet.  Really surprising given the busy street. The only down side is the food. It is OK but not great.  Hot food is microwaved but you can make waffles and toast and there is fruit and yogurt and cereals so its decent.  For the price, it was an amazing value.

Summary Heading: Beware of ants and other problems
Summary: We stayed 3 nights at this property. It is an older property, but the carpets are clean. It felt like we were staying at a motel built in the 70s.  Its location is great as it is across the street from disneyland. The rooms are quite small (we stayed in a 2 queen room), and there is no elevator to carry your luggage up the stairs. They got rid of the free dinners and the birthday package, which now only comes with balloons and a ice cream cake from cold stone creamery. My kids were disappointed. The swimming pool is located in the middle of the parking lot (really bizarre), and parking is pretty tight for SUVs. Also, there is a lot of pedestrian and car traffic as you leave the property on Harbor Blvd. The staff were professional, but I felt that they lacked that extra effort or

Summary Heading: Best Place to stay for Disneyland!
Summary: We have stayed here many times over the span of 13 years, you cannot go wrong. Clean, good sized rooms, great price, LOCATION, great breakfast every morning. I have never been disappointed, if I have ever had an issue the front desk has always helped me out. We travel about 5 hrs from San Jose, CA, and have had season passes frequently for Disneyland and stay here. I tell anyone getting ready to book a trip about this hotel, with Ihop right next to it and kids eat free after 4 pm, it's a great deal. Over the years I've tried many hotels, once I found this one I haven't gone to another to book. With Target down the street and a fridge and microwave you're set. Try it you won't be disappointed!

We stayed 3 nights at this property.  The Park Vue Inn exceeded my limited expectations. Our family has stayed numerous times at the Disneyland hotel but this trip we decided to take a chance and stay off property since our kids are now teens.  It was a great move!  We went back and forth to Disneyland several times daily since it is literally right across the street.  We had a rental car and parked right in front of our room for free!!!  The staff was kind and met my requests with a smile.  When we arrived in our room, we had a surprise waiting for us.  They had a cute Disney mug, candy, balloon, birthday greeting and ice creamery free cake certificate for my son's birthday sitting on the dresser. He loved that.  I thought it was very nice. Our room was small!  We had 2 queen

Our family isn't high maintenance by any stretch but our stay at this property for our family vacation to Disneyland was a BIG disappointment. While we were there management quietly discontinued significant advertised extras. We also had to ask 3 times for a crib to be delivered to the room. Then one morning we discovered ants - lots of them - crawling all over our personal affects. Even after notifying management, throughout the week this continued to be a problem. The "free" internet access was simply atrocious. Then, to top it all off, no one could clearly explain to us upon checkout, what exactly our charges were. The pleasant girl at the front desk said more than once, "This system is so complicated." Huh?? After 30 minutes of unsuccessfully trying to get to the bottom of
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying.  Our goal is to not only meet the needs of each and every guest we serve, but to exceed your expectations to make your stay as pleasant and comfortable as possible. The changes to our amenities are due to a decreased demand for these offerings and an increased demand for upgrades to our rooms. In order to continue to upgrade our rooms and stay competitive with our pricing we had to make changes to the offerings that had the least demand. The WiFi has been upgraded, and we are replacing older equipment with new. We have ECO lab service our rooms on a weekly basis to insure that these ants do not come back. Again we apologize for this and hope that you would give us an opportunity to make this up.

Summary: We reserved this hotel with low expectations and were pleasantly surprised with the room.  First, I was disappointed because they had filled all the rooms with bunk beds by the time we arrived, although I had requested that when I reserved.  I'd recommend you call a day ahead just to make sure they have it correct & will hold it.  We had a room with 2 queen beds.  The room was clean, average TV, free wi-fi, although didn't work great.  The bed was fine. It didn't have an overwhelming clorox smell like so many places have. The best thing was the location to Disney.  The sidewalk to the Disney gates is right across the street. Once you get across the street, it's less than 5 minutes to the gate (and I'm a slow walker). I'm pretty sure parking here is free, but you should check.

We were here for 4 nights on our first visit to Disneyland.  I had read about how close this hotel is to the entrance, and they were right - it's practically a 10 minute walk from the hotel to the park entrance.  We had 2 rooms, and both were very roomy with two very comfortable queen beds and a fridge and microwave, and a good-sized bathroom.  We were on the ground floor, and at times you could hear people walking and running above, but it didn't bother us.  The housekeeping staff did an excellent job in cleaning our room daily and providing a more than adequate amount of towels.  The gift basket and personal letter upon arrival were a very nice touch.  We also took advantage of the breakfast every morning before heading into the park.   The only complaint is the breakfast area
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We are very happy to know that your stay was great. We will take your suggestions and use them to improve our hotel. We also have informed the housekeeper of your kind words. We hope to be of service to you and your family again soon.

Summary Heading: Great hotel if your going to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed 6 nights. We had a great experience with Park Vue. If I had to complain about anything it would be they need to have someone help you with your luggage if your room is on the second floor. They do not have a elevator and I was with my Mom (she is 65) and my son (he is 6) so they could not help me lift the luggage. But, lets get back to the positive. You are so so so close to Disney. The free breakfast and Wifi was great. We only tried the afternoon social hour once and that was only because my Mom's wallet was stollen at Disney and we had to make phone calls to have her credit card stopped and to the airlines to see how we were going to get home with no ID. The social hour was OK., but we never went back because we were there to have fun at Disney not to stay at the

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn for 4 nights back in May.  Our family of 4 has a 5 year old and a 7 month old.  Pros Location is excellent. Since I am still nursing I was able to walk back and feed the baby. There are nursing rooms in the park but I just found this to be so much easier. Lemonade and cookies - LOVED them! great snack as we walk back and forth to the park Fireworks - you can see the fireworks from the outside dining area, we were too tired to go back but enjoyed seeing the fireworks in our pajamas. Room configuration - The bunk beds were a huge hit with our 5 year old Free Parking - i believe this is the only place that doesn't charge for parking, other good neighbor hotels around this area charges for parking.  Cons Rooms are old and dirty - my foot was black just

Summary Heading: Discontinuing the extras is a deal breaker for me.
Summary: Having read the positive reviews in the past about the social hour meal and other extras this hotel offers, I was looking forward to booking a room until I discovered that these extras have been discontinued. I hope these extras are brought back in the future. In the mean time, I will be looking for a less expensive hotel.
Manager Response: It is unfortunate that due to incorrect information you have decided to book elsewhere. We would like to take this opportunity to set the record straight. The changes to our amenities are the result of decreased demand for some of our offerings and an increased demand for upgrades to our rooms. In order to continue to upgrade our rooms and stay competitive with our pricing we had to make changes to the offerings that had the least demand. The only items we are discontinuing are the wine baskets, and evening social hour meal. We will continue to provide, free parking, warm breakfast buffet, free Wi-Fi, and cookies and juice in the afternoons. Thank you for your understanding, and we apologize for any confusion. We look forward to being of service to you in the future.

Summary Heading: No longer offering the "extras" that made it stand out.
Summary: Starting today, the park vue will no longer be doing gift baskets, birthday celebrations, cookies and drinks, or social hour. I know many people booked here for those reasons, including us. This is what made this hotel stand out from the other, less expensive options. I have been a loyal Park Vue customer for years, but will be booking at a different across the street hotel from now on and walking the extra 20 steps. Park Vue is no longer worth the extra cost without those amenities. We always felt like we mattered here, but without even a call to inform guests their amenities were severely downgraded, I will be treated like just a number elsewhere for less money.
Manager Response: We apologize for any confusion. The changes to our amenities are the result of decreased demand for some of our offerings and an increased demand for upgrades to our rooms. We have only discontinued the amenities with the least demand, the wine baskets, and the evening Social Hour Meal. We will continue to offer all of our other amenities such as free parking, free Wi-Fi, warm breakfast buffet, cookies and juice in the afternoon. We appreciate your understanding and we hope to be of service to you in the future.

Summary: Let me list the positive and negative comments directly.  Positive: Location  it was perfect for entry in and out of Disney Pool  Clean always towells availalbe Staff  Eric and then a lady (dark hair) both very helpful, she arranged for a shuttle quite helpful Breakfast  waffle maker, cereal  Negative: rooms :  ANTS  in all 3 rooms every day of our stay               Carpet  dirty (white socks turning dark in color)               Maid service  inconsistent  in stocking coffee and creamer  NOT one day did we have the same     amount in our rooms  I had to go and find a maid to acquire what was needed                Breakfast  food was cold, eggs must be the powdered quite poor quality, bacon paper thin, never knew what would be served 2 days no biscuits/sausage gravy and yet that
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write this review. We have initiated a few changes and upgrade to our hotel which will improve the experience for our guests. We apologize that your stay was anything less than great. We will continue to work at improving our hotel and customer service to better serve you. We hope that you would give us an opportunity to serve you.

Summary: Stayed April 2nd-5th 2012 Family of 2 adults and 2 teenagers (14, 16) from Singleton Australia  I would highly recommend this hotel for the very reasonable price and the location that can't be better! We have previously stayed on the Disneyland property at the Disneyland Hotel which we found actually was further away from the parks entrance than the Park Vue Inn!   We didn't spend an awful amount of time in the room as we stayed at the parks as long as we could. Our room was off the highway and extremely quiet. Was a 5 minute walk to both the park entrances. We got a free breakfast at the hotel which we found very good (hot and cold) and lets you fill up before entering the pricy parks. There is also an IHOP and an ice-cream shop on the hotel property if you prefer (other food
Manager Response: We are very happy to know your experience was great. It is our goal to provide a home away from home. Thank you for taking the time to write a review. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: We stayed 2 nights at Park Vue while visiting Disneyland and were very pleased with our stay. Yes the rooms and the building are very dated, but they are very clean. Other reviews said the carpets were dirty. They must have attended to this problem because we observed the carpets as freshly cleaned. Free breakfast and dinner were such a bonus when up against inflated Disney prices! Dinner was a "kids" meal and included a mini salad bar and soup options every night along with other kid friendly entrees like nachos, mac and cheese and chicken nuggets. Breakfast was abundant and included eggs, fresh waffles, and much more. The free wifi was spotty at best, but everything else was pretty much perfect for the price! I really enjoyed that free bottle of wine in the evenings to relax
Manager Response: We are working on improving our WIFI and internet. We apologize for this and hope that on your next visit this will be resolved. Thank you for your review, we hope to be of service to you soon.

Summary: If you are like most families planning to visit Disneyland, you are operating on a budget.  Disneyland is so expensive...tickets, food, and all the extras, so the perks that the Park Vue Inn offer really helps when you are  trying to save money.  We are a family of 5 (kids ages 4, 6, 9).  We stayed for 4 nights, arriving on June 13th and staying through the 17th.  We arrived early and our room wasn't ready, but the front desk labeled our luggage and kept it in holding for us so we could explore Downtown Disney.  The front lobby had complimentary coffee, cocoa packets, lemonade, water, and fruit punch to enjoy.  They also had a bowl of fruit (apples, oranges and bananas).  Upon asking, they gave us complimentary bottles of water each day to take to the park.  We never saw the
Manager Response: Thank you for writing this review, we appreciate your time. We are very happy to have been able to provide you with a great stay. We hope to see you soon

Summary Heading: Disappointed in the Park Vue Inn
Summary: I will never understand how this place became so highly rated on trip adviser.  We  were really disappointed by our stay.  The room was small, shabby and worst of all,  it smelled. We asked for a different room upon arrival and they were unable to accommodate us.  The linens had holes in them. The bathroom walls had a splotchy paint job.  Honestly it looked as if they were continually painting over mold and mildew growth. It smelled that way too. The room was very noisy. The included breakfast and social hour were poor quality. We had a one queen/ bunk bed room and it felt very cramped with 2 adults and 2 kids. It was difficult to find room for our luggage.The only advantage was this motel's location  near the entrance of Disneyland. I'm convinced however, that we would be able
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to express your experience. We apologize for not being able to provide a satisfying stay. We are currently working on improving our rooms and ameneties. These changes and upgrades are being made thanks to suggestions and comments such as yours. It is our goal to provide these changes and upgrades to better the experience of our guests. We hope that you would allow us to be of service to you once again.

Summary: Hotel reviews are usually pretty generous when they mention location, and blatently lie.  However, the Park Vuu is literally a 30 second walk to the Disneyland property, and in 2 minutes you're at the front gates.   The hotel is run by kids, 20-25 years old who though they lack experience, are nice and seem to know their jobs well.  The breakfast is simple, and what you'd expect, 3 cereal choices, eggs and sausage each day (stayed 3 days) and some fruit.  It opens at 7:00, so you have time to eat quickly, and rush over to DL and get in line. The light dinner is more for kids, we had sliders one night, paltry nachos the 2nd, and mac and cheese and chicken nuggest the 3rd.  Chicken noodle and tomato soup were offered each night as well, and for free it's worth walking back to the
Manager Response: We will be making some modifications to our Food Service quality and options. We hope that this will increase the satisfaction of our guests. Thank you for your comment. Please know that we will continue to improve our hotel to better the experience of our guests. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: The Park Vue Inn was great.  The kids loved the pool, the rooms were nice and the staff were friendly and helpful.  The standard 2 queen bedrooms had extra space to move around in and the 2 queen/sofa bed suite was very roomy and nice also.  We were a large group and the house cleaning staff made sure we always had enough towels, soaps, lotions and that our beds were made.  It was also a short walk to the main gates at either park (less than 10 minutes), and the two complimentary meals were an added bonus.  Really a great place to stay while visiting Disneyland.  We would go back again.
Manager Response: We are very happy to know that your stay with us was great. Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us and we will utilize your review by continuing to focus on making each and every guest experience the best it can be.  We hope to be of service to you soon.

Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue Inn, room 233 from 6/16-6/20.  It was the best location - the only thing closer as others have said is Disney's Grand Californian.  We've stayed at Paradise Pier before, but this was much closer.  To be able to stop by and drop-off/grab sweatshirts/hats/sunglasses and change shoes is invaluable while at Disneyland.  As soon as the sun sets it cools down fast.  Plus, if you get too wet on the water rides you have options to change.  The hotel room was very clean, comfortable beds, plenty of room for us.  We did see a stray ant or two, but so tiny and not an issue for us. The AC was a bit loud but I sleep with earplugs anyway so no problem for us.  The cookies at the front desk were great.  The breakfast was very good - plenty of choices, enough to get a
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words and suggestions. We have preventative pest control maintenance service done on our property on a daily basis. We apologize for this and will continue to improve our property to maximize our guests experience. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: We stayed 6 nights. The location is awesome- it is literally at the pedestrian crossing from the main entrance. The only hotel closer is the grand Californian at $3500 for 5 nights vs $950 at PVI.  Room with queen and bunk beds was perfect for our family of four. Front desk staff were mostly friendly and helpful. Liked the welcome basket, cookies and fruit at reception, included breakfast. The breakfast wasn't that great, we only did it twice, but nice to have the option anyway. We didn't make it to the social hour food at night. I'd definitely stay here again next time
Manager Response: We will be making some upgrades to these ameneties, and hope that by your next visit these will be completed. Thanks to reviews like yours we are able to make accomidations to improve our guests experience. Thank you for your time and comments.

Summary: I chose Park Vue Inn on the recommendation of a co-worker who has done the Disneyland thing a lot more than I have (it was our first visit). This place is right across the street from Disneyland, so we didn't need to worry about parking for the park and we could return to the room at any time if we needed to (we didn't, but it was an option). The rooms were clean and pleasant. The complimentary breakfast was nothing to get excited about, but it provided sustenance to get us through the morning. When you get tired of Park Vue's breakfast, there's an IHOP next door, and several other restaurants within walking distance. I would definitely stay here again - the convenience, quality of the hotel, and cost are just unbeatable.

We liked: proximity to Disneyland kindness and helpfulness of staff cleanliness breakfast and dinner provided fridge, microwave, and safe in the rooms  We disliked: walls are thin, we heard a lot from outside and above us the food was just okay, same sides each day, mostly precooked/frozen even with the blinds pulled, there was a lot of light coming in the fireworks are very loud at night

What a great spot! I can't imagine staying anywhere else for a Disneyland trip. It has a parking lot with an attendant, so you don't have to worry about Disney people taking all the parking spots. It is literally across the street from Disneyland - a quick 5 minute walk. Awesome! The rooms were pretty tiny and not the cleanest (we literally had dirt piled in the corner under the sink). But we didn't spend much time in the room and the places that mattered seemed clean. The pool was kind of odd -- it's in the middle of the parking lot, but the fence is covered in vines, to give the illusion of privacy. There's also a gift shop on site which was nice when we needed things we'd forgotten, but the biggest hit was having Cold Stone on property. We celebrated a birthday and they gave

I have stayed at the Park Vue now 2 times and just enjoy it! The plan is definitely to make it our "main stay" hotel while at Disneyland. Its right across Disneyland which many claim and are not it has parking and its available! Thank you Park Vue! We were greeted with a smile from the parking attendant to the front desk person.  We had a nice basket of wine, water and fruit waiting for us with a beautiful note as well. The breakfast well it was pretty dang good as well!  Emma
Excellent Customer Service, clean rooms, and the closest to Disneyland.  It was nice to have breakfast and and evening meal.  I would stay there again and recommend hotel to my friends.

The hotel was so conveniently located (at the the crosswalk to Disneyland's entrance!).  It was clean, well maintained and the staff was extraordinairly friendly! The breakfast was a hot breakfast and more than substantial enough to get you through to lunch in the park.  It was also quick and there was plenty of food.  We were able to watch the Disney fireworks from our room! The price we paid for all this was a great value and we will continue to stay here every time we come to Disney!

We did not stay there, but I wanted to write a review on their customer service.  We were booked in there for September and paid our deposit.  We decided on other accommodations for no reason other than we found a better deal.  I had read that people had trouble getting their deposits back and could never get a hold of the "right person" to help, etc.  I called and cancelled, the lady was very friendly and efficient and said I would have my refund in about 5 business days on my credit card.  It was there within 3.  I was worried I would have to call and keep on them to receive it, but no problem.   Anyways, just wanted to write about that since it seems to be one of the biggest complaints on here and to say I had no problems.

We stayed here for 4 nights and were very happy with our accommodations.  I would have loved to have stayed in the triple queen room, but this type was unavailable.  The Queen room was still good sized with just enough room for a rollaway, and the room was clean, comfortable and updated.  We tried the breakfast that is included and it was just fine.  You could fill up on waffles, eggs and bacon that would easily cost a family of five $60 in the parks or nearby restaurants.  We did not try the evening snack, but I'm sure it is worth stopping by, especially if one is trying to cut meal expenses.  They left a lovely gift basket for our daughter's birthday.  She was thrilled.  The pool area was nice and never seemed overly crowded, even though I know the hotel was booked up for the

Ok, the rooms were a standard fare you'd expect out of a economy type hotel (I had booked 2 rooms) - nothing fancy nothing bad but that was made up for by lotsa other things - location (directly opposite Disneyland entrance), excellent breakfast and nice light dinner included, welcome basket that included fruits and a wine bottle, lemonade / fruit punch / cookies in the lobby any time, nice swimming pool, discount for hotel guest at the on site Coldstone Creamery, courteous reception and housekeeping staff - kids and family had a blast when we not at the Disneyland park itself....would definitely come back..!

My kids loved the free lemonade and fruit punch with apples and cookies.. Breakfast was wonderful and supper was perfect for the kids and just enough for me and so nice to have something different than the park food. U can not beat the location! Beds were the most comfortable ones we had all week and loved the big rooms. Our other hotels this week had really small rooms. The staff was helpful and really friendly. Will be coming back on our next visit!!  Impressed!

We booked this hotel based on the Trip Advisor reviews but were let down. The walls are paper thin and we had very little sleep on all three nights thanks to the screaming kids in the next room. There is also a door connecting the two rooms which should be locked at all times however somehow the children next door managed to open this whilst my partner and I were asleep. You can imagine the fright when you see the door open whilst you are trying to sleep and who else had access to our room - very unsafe. We phoned reception to ask them to quieten the kids next door which they did. However, even after the call they were still extremely noisy and we ended up having to turn the TV up loud to drown out the noise in hope of getting some sleep.  On top of this, the following morning

We stayed here in May tow adjoining rooms. It was everything we expected for the price clean room, standard brekkie fare parking and most importantly the reason we chose it across the road from Disneyland. Worth the cost for the convenience alone. Would book here again for next Disneyland trip.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland and great for kids
Summary: This is not a 4 or 5 star hotel but this hotel is directly across the street from Disneyland and is great if you are traveling with children who need to come back to the room for afternoon naps.  The breakfast is great and they even serve a light dinner.  Most of the dinner foods are directed to children and are not gourmet but they will save you money by not buying dinner in the park.  The staff was wonderful and as we were celebrating our grand-daughter's birthday while we were there she was welcomed with helium balloons and a great gift bag.  The hotel was clean, if not the most up to date.  We did notice that they shampooed the carpets after each guest checked out.  The only complaint I had was the noise by other guests at the hotel.  If I ever stayed there again I would

Summary Heading: VERY surprised this motel got the top rated spot for Disneyland..
Summary: The Park Vue Inn is a perfectly adequate motel style stay.   However it is NOT what we were expecting at all from these glowing trip advisor reviews.   We've been to many hotels in the Disneyland area varying in price $125-$300.  The last time we stayed we were at the Sheraton and it was quite lovely in contrast.  We chose Park Vue over the Sheraton (similar price point) ($170) - based on proximity to park, the added value of the meals and the reviews.  We have 2 small kids and needed a home base rest stop for mid day naps, pool time etc.  Unfortunately this spot just didn't measure up to a place where we wanted to come back and hang out during the day- or use the pool (surrounded by a parking lot).  The free breakfast was VERY disappointing.  While I read reviewer after

This hotel is the best and closest to Disneyland for the money!! You are literally across the street to Disneyland's entrance.  This hotel gave us a basket filled with water, fruit and wine and had free breakfast and dinner. The rooms were decent and clean. Bed was comfortable. There is a pool that we didn't use-it is just a regular pool (no fancy slides). I stayed here for the location and the cost and compared to the surrounding hotels for these two factors, what I got and quality, this one is the one to stay out. This is not a "grand" hotel, it is a little boutique hotel.

We had a great experience doing our stay. We arrive early and was able to check in but not go to our room till 3:00 pm. We had checked two adjoin rooms and found out that they had just finished shampooing the carpet. We went to Downtown Disney for a while and came back just after 3:00 and was able to get into our rooms. The gift baskets were a nice surprise and right after dinner we had a knock at our door and Lee one of the workers brought a birthday bag of Disney items for our granddaughter who was celebrating her birthday. This was a surprise and made our granddaughter very excited. The rooms were clean and organized each day for us. The dinner was also nice, it was simple but saved a bunch of money so we didn’t have to eat out every night. We’re not regular travelers but

My daughter and two grandchildren visited from Oregon and since we were planning a two day visit to Disneyland we chose Park Vue Inn for it's location and price.  Right across the main highway to Disneyland and the children thoroughly enjoyed the breakfasts and the pool.   Would highly recommend for a family visit with young children.

Summary Heading: Great location for a Disneyland visit
Summary: I'm all about keying off other people's reviews so when we were looking for a a hotel very close in proximity to DL that was affordable, all signs pointed to Park Vue. I didn't realize how close this place was to DL...it IS literally right across the street! We stayed 2 nights in a double Queen room on the 2nd floor. The room was clean and fairly spacious for a small motel. Definitely enough room for the 4 of us! If you somehow leave before the fireworks start, no problem! Walk over to the sundeck or just outside your door and you have a great view of the pyrotechnics!   Pluses: - short walk to Disneyland - free breakfast on the 2nd deck every morning - Coldstone on the premises open late! - free parking - affordable rates - free cookies and lemonade in the lobby all day - they

Summary Heading: Stay here for the location, not much else
Summary: To be honest, the location is really the only benefit to staying here now.   The prices have crept up over time and the service has dropped considerably, as has the cleanliness.  The rooms are tired, the 'free' breakfast is over-crowded and not great. I was quite disappointed in our last visit here. There are nicer places to stay, along the same strip outside Disneyland, that are better value and offer much better customer service.  I wonder if they would rate as high on the TA hotels list if they didn't hand out cards asking for reviews on check-out?

Summary Heading: Never stay at a place where the manager ABSOLUTELY doesn't care about a customer complaint and in fact argues with the customer
Summary: We have stayed here about 5 times and always found it be satisfactory. The location is great, immediately across the street from Disney and the rooms are small and outdated (carpets are filthy, wear socks!) though sufficient for a quick sleep before returning to Disney.   On this occasion, we were surprised to receive a note from management upon returning to our room at 10:30pm that there would be palm tree trimming outside the rooms from 9-12 the next morning. Why not wait until noon to guarantee morning sleep for their customers who came and paid to sleep? We brushed it off to "make the best of it" and thought it was indeed 9am when we were awakened to the lovely sound of a chainsaw outside our window.  It was 715am! Within 5 min, all 4 people in our room were awakened!   I
Manager Response: Although negative feedback is never desired, I take this comment to heart and I wish to again apologize for the inconvenient early wake up you experienced.  In no way did I intend to condescend or be rude and I am truly sorry that you felt this was how you were treated. At the Park Vue Inn, we strive to provide the highest level of customer service and in this case it seems we failed to do that.  Although we were unable to accommodate your request for 100% compensation, we look forward to a future opportunity to be of better service to you. – Brian D. Manager of Operations

Summary: we stayed for 7 days, it was very enjoyable experience, buffet breakfast and pre dinner was wonderful and location was exceptional, it was good to be able to come and go from Disneyland as we pleased, the room was great except we got a room that had a sofa bed and we expected the mattress on the sofa bed to be a little better quality than what we got, the staff were also exceptional and very friendly. I would recommend anyone young or old to stay there.

Summary Heading: Great location, friendly, accommodating, comfortable, helpfulness galore!
Summary: This was our third time staying here, I don't think I would stay anywhere else in the area, whether I was going to Disneyland or not.  The staff is so helpful and courteous, the beds are clean and comfortable, the rooms smell good and the air/heat works every time.  The meal vouchers are great for breakfast and dinner, not full menu, but just enough to get you going in the morning and a great snack for the evening.  We had to park an extra car when we had an unexpected addition to our party, and the Inn let us park the extra car for free.  We love the fruit and sparkling cider basket(wine is usually in the basket, but they trade for the cider upon request) with the two little plastic wine glasses and the bottle opener included.  It was my daughter's birthday, and they brought to

We spent 3 nights and we very happy!  After reading all the reviews we decided to give this a try and we are so glad we did.  With two girls 3 & 6 the short walk back the the hotel was just a few short steps away from the shuttles to the Disneyland Parking areas.  We saved a bunch of money with the free breakfast, dinner & parking.  We got the double queen & bunk bed room and it was clean and comfortable.  We will definitely stay there again and will recommend to our friends!

I took my grandsons to Disneyland and it was perfect.  We walked directly across the street to the park, so no parking issues, never had to move my car. With both breakfast and dinner included it left us with some fun money to spend in the park. The room was good, beds were comfortable and we enjoyed the pool. We spent most of the day at the park and came home for a rest and dinner, then headed back til they closed. I would recommend Park Vue to anyone visiting Disneyland.

We just got back from 5 days at Disneyland and stayed here the whole time.  It is a great place not only for location which is directly across from the entrance, but also because it is clean, comfortable and accommodating.  Their service is excellent, the free b'fast and dinner were very good and the room is clean and will maintained.  I highly recommend staying here.

Summary Heading: Amazing and literally across the road from DL enterance!
Summary: Amazing for the price & location! It's directly across from DL. We had a jacuzzi room for my husband and self and our nanny was with my kids in a suite. Both rooms had a fruit basket and wine, but our room had a small gift and balloons since we were celebrating. They also have a breaskfast buffet that is included and a light dinner. It's more than worth the price, but don't expect the GCA either!

Unless you know someone who can recommend a hotel to you, you're pretty much stuck trusting the reviews that you read. We stayed at the Park Vue Inn after reading so many positive reviews. I'm so happy with our choice! Yes, the hotel is directly across the street from the entrance to Disneyland, but that is only one of the great things about it. The service is excellent, all of the staff are really friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast really is great, and the complimentary dinner is fine if you have kids and just want to grab something to eat.  We had a jacuzzi room downstairs, and it was great. It looked just like it does in the pictures. Very clean and nice, comfortable bed with lots of pillows. There were plenty of towels and just nice room overall. It was so sweet

Summary Heading: Location and service is a big plus
Summary: The location is great, straight across from main entrance so able to easily go back for rest up before hitting disney again. The room was basic but clean. There was aovely welcoming note and gift basket of fruit and wine on arrival-, this was followed up by a phone call to ask if everything was ok.  Service was great and would definitely recommend this hotel.

This was our 2nd stay at the Park Vue ( the 1st being in 2000 ). Both stays were very enjoyable and the hotel has had a bit of a face lift in the 12 years since we were there last. The location is unbeatable and the staff are great. We did have some problems with very noisy and inconsiderate guests next door, but this is not the hotels fault. The free breakfast is great and certainly helps with costs, not to mention convenience. It does get crowded - I would suggest asking the staff when 'peak hour' is and avoiding this if possible, at other times it is less crowded. The rooms are very clean and the welcome basket is a nice touch. We would definately stay here again and recommend it to other Aussies.

This is as close to the parks as you can get without staying inside the parks. The staff was friendly and helpful. They allowed us to park there before we could get our room and allowed us to stay parked there on the day we checked out. The walls are really thin so if you're a light sleeper you may have some trouble but after a long day at the parks it was good enough for us. They offer a breakfast buffet that was really good and they gave us a gift basket with wine, fruit and water which was a nice touch. Our double queen room had no bathtub so be aware of that if you have little ones who need tubs. Overall great hotel, we will stay here again for sure.

We've stayed at the Park Vue Inn while visiting Disneyland twice now (out of 7 visits). As everyone has already said, the location literally cannot be beat, and seeing your hotel as soon as you leave the gates of Disney is a welcome reprieve after a day of walking.   The free breakfast is a good start to the day - the hot items are mostly microwaved but there is fruit, waffles, cereal, toast, etc. Everything sticks to your ribs for the first few hours and saving on breakfast is very helpful. We've stayed at the Best Western Park Place Inn (beside the Park Vue), who also claim to have free breakfast, but the Park Vue breakfast is MUCH better. The rooms are clean, and the welcome basket on arrival is such a nice touch. Also, we were celebrating my Mom's 50th birthday during our

My family of 3 adults and 3 kids stayed at the Park Vue Inn from 17 May to 27 May 2012.As has been said in many previous reviews,the location of the Hotel to Disneyland main gate couldn't be better.It is by no means a luxury hotel (probably 3 star), but it is clean and comfortable. The breakfast in the morning was very good and the snack in the evening was nothing special, but the kids enjoyed it.We were on the second floor and it was quite noisy from about 6.30am in the morning as people were going to grab some breakfast before heading over to Disneyland.It was again noisy until about 12 midnight as families were making their way back from Disneyland. I guess this is to be expected as it is a family hotel. The pool was a great asset as the kids made good use of it. My biggest

Outstanding location, great customer service, and Lee from maintenance was very responsive.  I love the breakfast bar and Coldstone Creamer.  The fitness center was under renovation and the pool was getting fixed.  Stayed for business and vacation afterwards.  Great rates...I highly recommend for families.  I enjoyed the gift basket of wine, fruit and water.  Classy touch.  AAA++++++

This was our second stay at Park Vue. We love the location and appreciate the bang for the buck! We love the jacuzzi suite and compared to the other higher priced hotels this is the best we have found without breaking our pocket.

My husband and I stayed here from 8 May - 13 May in a Jacuzzi room.   Our room was lovely and clean and the jacuzzi was amazing!  I found the bed to be the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept on and the pillows the most comfortable also.  As everyone else has said, you can't get much closer to Disneyland than the Park Vue Inn.  It is right across the road.  There's an IHop in the same complex, Tony Roma's a couple of minutes walk away and McDonald's a couple of minutes walk away for that easy meal when coming out of Disneyland exhausted!  I didn't find the breakfast to be that great, but it's alright for a complimentary breakfast.  The staff are not very knowledgable in how to get around Anaheim which doesn't include Disneyland!  But I guess most people that stay there

Summary Heading: The Best Place To Stay for Disneyland
Summary: We have been staying at some of the various motels around Disneyland for years, and this is by far the best.  Friendly staff, and most important of all for a family, the rooms are extremely clean.  In fact it's much improved since the last time we stayed maybe two years ago, and the rooms are much nicer.  Clean baths with good shower heads, very comfortable beds with different thickness pillows to choose from...we were even shocked that there was a basket on the table to greet us when we arrived, with a bottle of wine and some fresh fruit.  The morning breakfast (included) is also very welcome for a family, and there was great variety.  We only stayed a single night this time, but they allow parking in the motel lot on the day you arrive (even before you can take possession of

Summary Heading: Location great, Our first visit was better. Will look elsewhere next time
Summary: We first discovered Park Vue in 2007 and had a wonderful stay, so when it was time to take our 3 year old to disneyland for the week we decided to go back purely for the location to disneyland and the great stay we had last time. Firstly let me mention our first visit we were on the top level(level 2), whereas this time we were Level 1(ground floor). We booked a 2 room sleeper which had a room with 2 queen beds and a separate room with a sofa and kitchen.  PROS:The room was great. We were happy with it all and have no issues on the room. Its your standard 3 star motel room. Not luxurious hotel. Free breakfast and supper is good. Probably a little better than other motels-except for the lack of seating. Staff were super friendly and great in providing special treats to my little

Summary Heading: Can't get closer to the Disneyland gate unless you pitch a tent!
Summary: Being literally across the street to the entrance of Disneyland makes this hotel a great choice.  Fair price for what you get.  It is a very basic motel, but has a nice pool area, and the rooms are clean and in good shape.  Granite counters are a nice touch.  Tiled floor and shower are older but clean and well kept.  Rooms are small...basic two beds with a TV, so really just a place to lay your head.  Our bed was a little soft, but overall comfy.  No street noise, but you hear the neighbors flush the toilet.  Very nice touch to be greeted with a basket of fruit and wine.  Front staff very friendly.  Breakfast was pretty decent...some hot food choices such as fresh belgian waffles.

Summary Heading: Great place for our family vacation
Summary: We had a very enjoyable time here. We had 3 rooms for our family - 11 of us. We took the rooms with the queen bed and bunk beds. Kids loved it! We stayed 6 nights and were very pleased with everything. The welcome basket was a very special touch - made us feel good about being there. Rooms were extremely clean, nice shower, very comfortable beds, exceptional staff - polite and helpful. Breakfast was great - hot foods  - little dinners were good - quick bite before we headed out for the evening - sure helped with food costs. Walk over to Disneyland was fast and we were so close it was easy to walk back for the little "appetizer" dinner - kids ate this food much better than the Park food. When they found out it was our anniversary - we got balloons and cups filled with treats! How

Love this place! We have stayed here numerous times in the past and the place just keeps getting better and better!  Love the breakfast, the staff and the rooms are nice.  Love that it is so close  to Disney and they don't even charge you to park your car.  Great value and will stay here agin next time.

Summary Heading: Location, Location, Location - but pick room type wisely
Summary: If you are a family like ours - 2 adults and 2 teens - 12 & 14 - who do extreme Disney (meaning get there at rope drop or earlier with Magic Morning and stay till they kick you off Main Street) then you can't beat the proximity of the Park Vue.  All we need is a good room with comfy beds to recharge before the next day of getting Disney-wasted!  We stayed in one of the 2 bedroom suites with 2 queens and 1 sofa bed and worked perfectly for our family - anything else would have been way too tight - only 1 bathroom but the room had an additional dressing area outside the bathroom which made it work - also had small kitchenette with fridge - didn't do any cooking but used fridge.  2 TVs was also really nice although didn't use those much either!  Everyone's assessment of bfast is

Well what can we say? It's a 2.5 star. The location is perfect because it's right across the street from Disneyland. I've never stayed at a motel or inn before so this definitely was a new experience for me.  I figured hey, its just for one night. They should reconsider pouring some money back into the rooms and replace the carpet. The phone didn't work and wifi would never connect. As long as those type of things aren't important then this is fine.

We stayed here for 8 nights in April while visiting Disneyland. We have no complaints and will stay here from now on when we visit. We couldn't get over how close it is. It is literally right at the cross walk you use to enter the Disneyland resort. Check-in was perfect, the room was clean, and staff were friendly. We had 6 people in a 2-room Queen suite and it had plenty of room for everyone. The bathroom area was plenty big as well. They left us a welcome gift basket, an anniversary gift basket and a birthday gift basket on the appropriate days. The breakfast is great, with foods like eggs and sausage, not just pastries. We never ate at the evening meal as we stayed at the park each day for dinner. Cannot recommend this hotel enough,

Summary Heading: The only place to stay when visiting Disneyland!
Summary: If you want to stay at a hotel near Disneyland.....this is the place.  I've stayed here several times in the past several years and it gets better every time.  The service is great!  The staff is great!  And it's only about 200 yards from the Park entrance.  Newly refurbished with flat screen TV's with excellent reception.  And the breakfast is the only way to go before you go to Disneyland.

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn for two nights in april 2012 to spend a day in the Disney Parks. We booked a room with two queen beds for two adults and one kid.   The room was quite large and well-equipped with flat screen TV, fridge, microwave, coffee maker and free Wi-Fi.  The bathroom area was clean and rather spacious. But the air-conditioner emited an unpleasant smell, same one in the breakfast room…  You can have breakfast indoor or on the nice roof terrace. The food was fair with hot items.  We could relax in the outdoor pool and the Jacuzzi.  We had a mixed experience with the staff : our check-in was difficult (our two reservations were not combined as we asked before) and we got poor information on the restaurants nearby, plus a classical key problem… But the parking

Stayed at the Park Vue Inn on Mother's Day. We were also celebrating our daughter's 6th birthday. Not to mention 2-days at Disneyland. Everything was perfect. The hotel staff were kind and courteous. They even brought us Mother's Day flowers and a welcome basket. Breakfast was perfect. Not too light as they tend to be, and not too heavy - it was just right. We didn't make the light dinner they served, but I heard from another guest at the pool that it was a nice addition. We go to Anaheim every year and this will be our hotel of choice for years to come.

We stayed here for 2 weeks and loved it. A couple of things on the down side they don't and won't accept TRAVELEX visa cards as payment We asked why but were not given a real reason and they also told us that most places around there won't accept travelex visa NOT TRUE.Every where we went we had no trouble using our card even the convenience store at the hotel accepted travelex as payment.Another thing was when we checked out we were hit with an additional bill to pay with extra charges the invoice was not itemized we paid as we had to catch a bus to Vegas I've mentioned this on facebook as well they stated that the extra charges were for taxes etc however I was lead to believe the taxes and other fees were paid upon check in.On up side you can't bet the location breakfast is

So I stayed here for three nights with my wife and 16 month old son. We checked in at 130 am and the staff was very nice. We were in room 107 on the ground floor. Great location for coming and going. The room was clean and serviced each day during our stay. The beds are just ok. The floor for a child is dirty but we always put down a sheet for him to play on. My wife loved the distance to Disneyland. We did not partake in breakfast or evening snack. We would stay here again definitely not four star but a nice place very close to Disneyland.

Great place to stay with kids, we could be in disney within 5 minutes or so all you do is cross the road and you are there. Lots eating places within walking distance and easybtonget to target etc without a car

The location is literally right across the street, the room was clean (including the hot tub), and they even gave us a free bottle of wine in the welcome basket! I love this place and so did my boyfriend! I will never stay anywhere else :)

My sister and her daughter flew in from Texas, and I flew in from Ohio, to celebrate her daughter's 12th birthday at Disneyland.  I booked the Park Vue Inn based on the proximity to Disneyland and the good reviews the hotel received on Trip Advisor.  Here are my impressions:  Location:  Absolutely perfect proximity to the main gate of Disneyland; literally across the street.  The very best reason to stay here, if you want to avoid parking fees charged by other nearby hotels, or the hassle of shuttling in from a more distant hotel.  Hotel staff:  Excellent.  They were friendly, attentive and helpful, couldn't ask for more.  In addition to the fruit/wine basket provided to all guests upon check-in (which was wonderful), they did up a fun package of balloons, some small gifts, and

The location was excellent, directly opposite Disneyland. As for the room, it was clean and comfortable. Eventhough there was not much choice for breakfast, the food was nice  and my kids loved making their own pancakes. The hotel staff was helpful too. We would definitely stay there again for our next visit.

Room was clean and comfortable. All employees were knowledgeable and helpful. Breakfast was delicious. Disneyland is right across the street. I have stayed here 4 times and will stay here everytime we come to Disneyland.

This was out first time staying at the Park Vue Inn. We initially booked the place because of the free breakfast, microwave and mini-fridge in the room, and the location directly across the street from Disneyland.(it truly is directly across the street) Our entire stay went flawlessly. All of the staff was overly courteous,always asking if we needed anything else,and leaving a daily courtesy call. Our room was clean, and we enjoyed the complimentary basket of fruit and wine that was left for us. The rooms were a decent size and clean,and the pool area was nice as well. While this place is not in any way a resort destination, it is a practical, affordable hotel that was perfect for my family and myself. We will return to the park Vue Inn in the Future.

Summary Heading: Worn out hotel trying to put on a brave face.....
Summary: OK, to put this in perspective, we booked three rooms for April 28-May 2; one each for my wife and me, my daughter and husband with two kids, my other daughter with a toddler.  Everything looks great as you arrive; right across the street from Disneyland's main gate, basket with wine and fruit in your room as you arrive, light breakfast and light supper complimentary.  Then you begin to notice first that the walkways are dirty, haven't been pressure washed in some time; and you walk across the room rug and your feet are BLACK!  Same experience in all three rooms.  Staff is apologetic, but "we try to keep up with it" doesn't help when you have small children who want to play on the carpet and it is filthy. Hotel offers internet service, but it isn't workable most of time which

Amazing service by the hotel staffs. Arrived early 10am, Frontdesk went all out to ensure cleaners are aware of our arrival to get our room ready asap, even though official check in time is 3pm. We went for bfast at IHOP right beside the hotel and got our room by noon. Lobby has juices ready, with cookies too. Overall, very superb service. Room was ok with everything you need there. Location cannot be better. Literally in front of disneyland entrance. All you need to do is cross the road and you're there.

Summary Heading: Good Place if You Don’t Need Housekeeping
Summary: Travel Dates: April 29th-May 5th, 2012 We have been to Disneyland 4 times in the past six months, each time staying at motels on Harbor. We stayed at the Camelot Inn in October and the Desert Inn in Feb and again in March. I did not write reviews on any of those 3 stays as I felt the reviews on TA reflected what we found in our stays: they are low end motels with their greatest perk being proximity to Disney. We had found what we expected and we were content. As I have researched our trips I could not help but notice the glowing reviews of the Park Vue Inn – especially the ones that stress the stellar customer service found there. As the customer service was significantly below par at the other properties, we decided to give the Park Vue a shot. What we found is a good motel

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay with young children.
Summary: I have to say that we were very pleased with our stay at this hotel.  You get so much more than you pay for here. The room (223) was larger than I expected, the beds were very comfortable, the free breakfast and supper were unexpected and saved us a lot of money. The room was very clean anf the staff friendly.  It's been said before but to reiterate, this hotel is maybe a 5 minute walk to Disney. So close that we ended up coming back to the room a number of times during the day. My kids loved the pool!  We did not have any noise issues to speak of.  The little shop they have attached has anything you could need altough it's stuffed in there so don't be afraid to ask if there is something you need.  Their is an IHOP right next door, mcDonalds and other fast food within walking

I was shocked at how nice this hotel was! Beds great,clean room and nice staff. We had my daughter with us and she has a severe peanut allergy. I called and told them this and they shampooed the carpet in the room she was staying! She also had her service dog with her and they welcomed him with open arms! I will never stay anywhere else when traveling to Disney!

No other hotel is closer to the park gates. We came back every afternoon for a nap and set out again for the evening. The welcome basket, and fruits, snacks, and water at the front desk was very much appreciated. The rooms were clean, and that's all that matters.

For those of us that can't afford the Disney hotels at least.  This is a great stay for families or those that want to save some cash and get some convenience.  Don't expect absolute peace and quiet because of proximity and the fact it's Disneyland (kids, can't escape them no matter where you are). The meals provided were basic yet enough. Of a cheap meal isn't your thing there are plenty of options.  Beds were comfortable, rooms clean enough, toiletry products familiar and most important of all, the staff was extremely pleasant and willing to help.

Summary Heading: Great location, good prices, good for families
Summary: Yes all of the above is true but if you have trouble with stairs not so good as breakfast is up stairs. Very close to park. Check in ok but I had a delivery that they never phoned me about and so the treat I ordered sat there until I phoned a day later. So service is not great but they did offer an extra day for  a discounted rate (not because I complained, I didn't, they just do this). Room clean, towels old and gray coloured from wear. Not pleasant smell in room. But there is a basket with fruit and wine.Not sound proof and matresses hard, bedding old and not white (but clean) you will not get a sound sleep. If you want a little luxury this is not for you. But close to the park it is so great for kids. Older and don't mind a shuttle or short drive? Then stay at Ayres Anaheim

I agree with all the positive comments made about this hotel.  They made an effort to give us a quiet room on request, and the welcome gift basket with wine and fruit was a nice touch.  The free breakfast and light dinner were very nice.  Lots of health choices like fruit and vegetables.  We found the front desk staff to be very helpful.

We had a family group of 13, and the accommodation   for  a week was fantastic. Children ages ranged from 5 to 15 and bedding arrangement was important. Had 3 units. Location was important, and having the bonus of a good breakfast and the social  couple of hours, made it all the better.
