Other guests a little inconsiderate to noise and chatter when walking past your room. Cleanliness was excellent, and restocking of coffe etc(they even found us some tea). Always plenty of towels. Have recommended to other friends , particularly the ones with children. Bonus to see the fireworks each night. Loved having breakfast outside on the spacious deck, be even better when roof covering finished.

Great location- 5 min. walk to disneyland, California Adventure, and downtown disney free parking!! Great welcome basket and gifts for my girls B-day!! Lemonade and water in lobby Breakfast and light dinner ok....... good for a few days and included in the price!! Cold Stone was very yummy!!

Summary Heading: Great Location Across the street from Disneyland
Summary: This was our first stay at this hotel/motel and I was pleasantly surprised. The location is perfect right across the street from the main park entrance. There are several restaurants around ranging from fast food to upscale sit down dining. The staff was super polite and very friendly. They have free parking and coin operated laundry as well as a pool (which we didn't get around to using).  We chose the room with the three queen sized beds. Two beds in the main room and a smaller seperate room with a third queen bed, it was great for 5 adults and a toddler, and the price on an online special was cheap for the location. Also in the room was a small coffee maker and a mini fridge that was blessedly empty not filled with a bunch of overpriced mini-bar crap that I never use because

Summary Heading: Very pleasant stay at Park Vue Inn
Summary: Last year 2011 springbreak, we planned to go to Disneyland for the first time and after lots of research, we chose to stay at Park Vue Inn for 5 days. The experience was excellent so we decided to stay here again 6 nights for the 2012 Springbreak, we reserved our room 6 months in advance to make sure that we have the room. We have 2 kids, a boy and a girl, age 6 and 9, so we had a room with 1 queen and a bunk bed. The kids love Park Vue Inn because first they can walk to Disneyland in 5 minutes and secondly, on the first day they come here, each will get a birthday gift bag and the gifts make them love to stay here even more.  As many have pointed out, there are so many pros about this hotel: - Disneyland just across the street, so you can visit Disneyland in the morning, go

Stayed 5 nights.  Best stay yet.  This time around we now have two kids in tow (4 and 17 months).  This was also our third stay in the last 6 years.  I chose the double queen with bunks.  So glad I took the advise of others on this site, they are way bigger then the single queen with bunk.  We didn't use the other bed, but was nice to have the space.  We got a welcome basket with Merlot and fruit, along with a birthday bag and balloon for our 4 year old.  A side note, the bunks are huge and I would have had not problem sleeping on them as an adult.  Pros:  1.  Free parking 2. Great little pool and hot tub 3. Personal touch (every time our room was cleaned they used our own blankets we brought on the beds along with setting up the stuffed animals on my daughter pillow) 4.

This was a great place to stay for our trip to Disney.  The hotel is literally right outside the front gates and it was a joy to leave the parks and within 5 minutes be back at the hotel.  The complimentary breakfast was a great way to start the day and the gift basket was an additional bonus.  We would definately stay here again when visiting the Disney parks.

This is a good no frills motel to be close to Disneyland.  It's a very short walk to the park.  The breakfast is good, not great, but good enough because it's free.  It includes protein, which I always look for.  It's older, but not creepy.  The staff are friendly.

Summary Heading: Dirty sheets on our first night
Summary: All this place has going for it is the location. Thefirst night we got.back to the room very late and the pull out had dirty unchanged sheets. We went and told the front desk.the.next morning and they said they were sorry and would look into it. Well when we returned the next night the room was not.made up and the sheets on the pull out were still unchanged. Guess all they did was look into it. I normally am easy to please and give good reviews. Please think twice aboit staying somewhere a little further from the park so you get more than just.a good location.

While this is an 'old fashioned' motor lodge, it is right across the street from Disneyl, Disney's California Adventure and Downtown Disney. Because of the location, traffic into and out of the hotel is monitored very carefully, so there isn't much traffic. The welcome basket with water, fruit and wine was most appreciated. Rooms were clean and well cared for, and staff always visible around the property.  Having snacks and drinks available in the lobby at all times was very nice, and the breakfast was good. I would stay again, given the opportunity.

Summary Heading: If you want to sleep past 7am, don't stay here
Summary: Though the distance to the park was perfect, all other aspects of this hotel definitely fell short of expectations.  The moment we walked into the room, we were immediately assaulted with a STRONG smell.  It may have been the chemicals they used to clean the room?  I have no idea, but it never left the room.  They leave their carts in the narrow walkway and they walk in and out of the rooms and congregate around them sometimes.  Talk about roadblocks!  The idea of breakfast and social hour was very appealing.  The actual food was mediocre at best, but it fills your tummy so that's all that matters.  The worst part was when kids/adults RAN down the walkway to get to breakfast, talking and laughing loudly at 7am.  We encountered one worker who was great (wish I got his name, but
So close to the Disneyland Resort and South Harbor amenities. Great lobby connected to Cold Stone Creamery... a.k.a. the best smelling lobby ever! Great for families!

Right across the street from the main entrance to Disneyland.  Location was perfect!  The room was small but perfect for us.  We were just sleeping there.  After a long day at the park all we needed was a comfortable bed and we got it.  We had the kids room.  A queen bed and a set of bunk beds.  There was a small fridge and microwave.  We got a welcome basket in our room with water, wine and fruit.  They have a full breakfast in the morning and a light dinner at night, all included in the price.  We had a great experience at the Park Vue and we will stay there again.

Summary Heading: The ONLY Place I Stay When Im in Anaheim!
Summary: I stay at this hotel twice a year, every year. I have stayed at other hotels in the area but always come back to Park Vue. Now, I will not stay anywhere else! Rooms are clean, beds are very comfortable, staff friendly & helpful. Proximity to Disneyland can't be beat. They also serve an excellent breakfast buffet: hot waffles, fresh fruit, bacon, cereals and much more! I always recommend this hotel to family and friends. Thanks Park Vue!!

Summary Heading: Over and Above the Call of Duty
Summary: It was my grandson's 8th birthday, and a trip to Disneyland was his gift. I booked two rooms, and the staff asked if it was a special occasion. When we went to our rooms (adjoined as a courtesy) we found an age and gender appropriate gift for my grandson and gift baskets for the adults. What a pleasant surprise! This is an older, refurbished, reasonably priced Inn. It includes a terrific breakfast and is kid friendly. The access to Disneyland is perfect. They let us park free until midnight on the day we left, even though we had already checked out. But the best part was the polite and very accommodating staff. I felt as if they valued my business and were enthusiastic in honoring my requests. We will return.

Summary Heading: For price and location, you can't beat this
Summary: What's not to like; Disney just over the road, nice pool for down-time, wonderful home-made biscuits and juice in reception and a small bill at the end.  Our thanks to all the staff, for whom nothing was too much trouble.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to that your stay was clean, convenient, and a value. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: It gets top ratings because in it's class of hotel it is BRILLIANT value.
Summary: Loved this hotel. You have to remember that this is a 2and a half star hotel to understand the consistent high ratings. If you want to compare the hotel to a 4 or 5 star hotel you will be naturally confused as to why others (myself included) rated this hotel so highly here and you will be disappointed if you book expecting a 4 or 5 star hotel.  Staff were friendly, location fantastic, rooms comfortable and clean - this is the perfect place to stay for all those things and to not blow all your cash on an expensive room...   You want luxury this is not it, you want brand new everything in the room then this is not the hotel for you... If you want fantastic value, clean comfortable and secure rooms and an undeniably superb location then THIS IS THE PLACE for you!  I recommend it to
Manager Response: Thanks for the kind words. We appreciate the time you took to review our hotel. We love to hear when guests experience what we strive for every day: friendly staff, comfortable and clean rooms, value. Next time you are in Anaheim we hope to see you!

Summary: Just finished staying there for 4 nights over spring break, very good experience, here's the low-down: - Location can't be beat for Disney; some of the family could come back to the hotel mid-day to re-energize, it's right across from the Disney entry. - We had a nice size suite with separate bedroom (two queens), living area with fold-out sofa, kitchen and bath.  Plenty of room for a family of 5. - Decor is solid if a bit dated.   - Beds were very comfortable. - We were on the first floor, definitely a bit noisy (doors to the outside, no interior corridors), but not a problem for me.  This is really more of a "motel" than a "hotel". - Very friendly staff. - The free cookies (always fresh and available in the hotel lobby) were terrific, they also serve lemonade and fruit punch,
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to write a review. We are glad you enjoyed your stay and the complimentary cookies. Please know that if you ever have an issue with noise you can contact our front desk and we will address the problem immediately. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Location great but everything else sub-par
Summary: I don't quite understand all these 5 star ratings.  The location is undeniably great, but the hotel itself is decidedly mediocre.  The furnishings are run-down, it was noisy, and the free breakfast was kinda gross.  We actually decided to pay for breakfast at the IHOP next door the second morning of our stay.  Next time, I'm going to walk a bit further (and pay a bit more) to stay at a nicer hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments. We are so sorry to hear that your experience was not up to the high standards we strive to achieve. Please know we take your feedback seriously and will share your input with our staff on our morning breakfast. Thank you again for taking the time to write a review.

Summary: I have stayed her twice now and find this the perfect location to stay at when visiting Disneyland!  You could not ask for a better location - right across the street from the main entrance to Disneyland.  The rooms are clean and the bathrooms are good size.  Mostly, the beds are VERY comfortable!  Standard size is a queen and always with four pillows!  The breakfast is very good too and convenient!  We head to Disneyland a few times a year and glad I found this place!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind words. We know you have many choices in hotels when visiting Disneyland and we are proud that we can be a part of your vacation. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary Heading: Friendly, easy, and a good value
Summary: This hotel property, literally across the street from the walking entrance to Disneyland, is a very nice place to stay.  Only 2 stories, and no elevator, but an easy walk to wherever you need.    The better parts are clean, comfortable rooms with a couple of extra amenities.  For instance, you get some skin lotion, just in case you forgot to sunscreen yourself and you get a little burned out in the open air.  There is ample bathroom space too, so you won't get crowded out by baggage or other cramped conditions you might bring with you.  The breakfast and dinner coupons you receive are a nice touch, as it's a pretty good money saver.  My family only had the breakfast, but it's a full breakfast, so you can calorie up before the long walking you'll be doing in the park.  The hotel
Manager Response: Thanks for taking the time to write a review. It makes all of us at Park Vue happy to know your experience was enjoyable and you found our staff pleasant. We hope you didn't get too sunburned! Remember we do have an on-site gift store to pick up those little extras you may have forgot. Hope to see you next time!

Summary: My husband, 2 yo daughter and I just returned from a 5 night stay at Park Vue.  Everyone here is correct when they say this location is fantastic.  It was great to just leave the parks at the end of the day and walk right back to our room.  We stayed in a 3 queen suite and were fortunate to be upstairs (requested ahead of time, thanks to reviews here) and at the end of the property by the pool.  The noise level wasn't terrible for us at this location, and I'm sure it helped being on the 2nd floor.  The staff was fine - friendly enough but not overly helpful.  Housekeeping was mostly good, although there were a couple hiccups that were minor enough for us not to fret over.  The rooms were clean where it counted.  I did a thorough bug check before unpacking anything, and the beds

My parents and I stayed here for a 2 nights after having read the positive reviews, and I must say, it lived up to our expectations!  The hotel clerks were friendly upon check-in, and even met our request for a quieter room in the back of the hotel, 2nd floor.  Fresh coffee, refreshments, and cookies were available in the lobby area as well, which is nice touch after a long drive.  We selected a room in the back portion of the hotel which was nice and quiet. As packed as the hotel was, we didn't experience any issues with noise level both at night, and upon waking up.  They offer free Breakfast and Dinner, as well as a gift basket with wine and fruit, and a lovely note welcoming you to the hotel, which is a nice added touch.  The hotel is also adjacent to IHOP, a Cold Stone

We stayed at Park Vue Inn the week before Christmas and were pleasantly surprised with our room. We booked the suite option that had a kitchenette and separate bedroom. There was lots of room for our kids to spread out and we were grateful to have the microwave, coffee maker and fridge. Since we had a rental car, the free parking was also nice.   All of the staff were very helpful and available for us anytime we had questions. The free breakfast and 'happy hour' meals were also very appreciated and it was nice that there was gluten-free Chex cereal available for breakfast for one of the individuals in our family with Celiac disease. (On different trips hotel personnel have just looked at us blankly when we have asked about gluten-free food)   Our room was well-maintained while
Great location Excellent staff 2nd time back And we will be back again It was my birthday and when I pulled in the parking attendant said happy birthday also balloons in room Thankyou Park Vue

Summary Heading: The best hotel and value near Disneyland!!
Summary: We recently had a fabulous stay at Park Vue Inn. The value is unbeatable and the hospitality is outstanding. It is conveniently located right across the street from Disneyland and provides a wonderful breakfast and dinner. I highly recommend this hotel for a perfect place to stay with your family on a Disney vacation!!

Summary Heading: Hop,skip and a jump to Disney's maingate!
Summary: Stayed here with my family for a quick trip to Disneyland. The hotel was clean and quiet, the rooms were very small, we had a room with a queen and bunk beds, thankfully it was just three of us otherwise we would have been tripping over each other. The breakfast was good, did not take advantage of their evening snack. Staff was ok, not overly friendly. Not sure if I would stay here again, it was fun to check it out but I think once was enough. Really enjoyed how close the hotel was to Disneyland!

We just got home from 5 nights at the Park Vue Inn in Anaheim and weren't disappointed in any way!  The hotel is right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland.  There are so many positive things to say about this hotel.  It's a convenient, short walk across the street to Disney.  The staff was always friendly and willing to help if needed.  There was always someone available at the front desk.  There were always cookies, fruit, & drinks (coffee, water, lemonade, punch) in lobby at all times.  The buffet breakfast was substantial enough to keep active park-goers fueled for hours - bacon, sausage, biscuits & gravy, eggs, make-your-own waffles, bagels & cream cheese, toast, French toast, cereal, fruit & yogurt, hot oatmeal, coffee, juice, chocolate milk, even donuts!

First I will share the great:  The location was the closest walk that could be to Disneyland.  The staff was very friendly, polite, and accomodating. Free breakfast!  Good: the room was good and we had enough space for the 3 of us. Nice granite bathroom counters, older furniture. Good firm bed.   OK: Breakfast was not so tasty to me, but it was free, so that is still ok.   Not so good: Our location the first 2 nights despite arriving early and requesting a 2nd floor room near the back was a handicapped room (no tub and shower sprays all over the floor) right next to the housekeeping/laundry station. This is also right across from the pool. This location was very loud during the day with foot traffic and workers shouting orders to one another. This happens and it was not the end

Have stayed at this hotel a couple of times over the past 15 years and I always say it is a great spot - walk across the road to Disney entrance which is great when you want to come and go. The rooms at the far end are a lot quieter so you don't have people walking past all night and morning. The breakfast is great and just enough. Rooms are large, have new carpet , beds are great  big and comfy no complaints with the rooms. Staff aren't overly helpful or friendly but that is Anaheim mostly - perhaps you are just another tourist. On this trip we.arrived at 11.40pm and even though I had booked the room 5 months prior, we were given the last one available which was upstairs - the downside of having luggage with you after a trip - the welcome letter was for someone else.

We are a family of four and we recently stayed in the queen w/bunkbed room.  It was a wonderful!  Fantastic service, and the basket of fruit and water was a great touch.  We had a birthday while there and the Coldstone cake was devoured by my kids!  The walk to Disneyland can't be beat.  We have stayed numerous places around Disneyland, and the Park Vue will be our go to place from now on.
So many amenities!!! Closest to Disney Resort, breakfast and dinner, free parking, snacks, welcome package!  Favorite hotel, will use every time we go to Disney Resort!

Fantastic location right across the street from the Disneyland Resort. It was like we were just walking to another Disney attraction (because it's so close!) the rooms and grounds were very clean, great staff!!

We stayed at the Park Vue from the 29th - 31st of March, wonderful experience. We traveled with 2 toddlers & 1 teenager, this is the best in family friendly hotels, heated pool, whirlpool, warm cookies all day & lemonade all day, fresh fruit & water to take to Disneyland, complimentary breakfast & a incredible welcome basket, all your needs are anticipated & met. This hotel is not the Ritz BUT who wants that when traveling with children, it was very clean and the staff was most accommodating. We arrived very early on our day of check-in, the hotel had been full the night before but the front desk staff gave breakfast vouchers & got us into one of our rooms within 2 hours, I couldn't have aasked for more. Definitely on my list of places to return to if I go back to Disneyland
Very pleased with this hotel. Perfect spot right opposite Disneyland main gate. Good value for money. Clean and tidy. Good breakfast included. And also a evening snack is free too.

Summary Heading: Location and meals make this a No Brainer!
Summary: We have stayed at the Hyatt, Grand Californian Hotel, and Disneyland hotel nearby. But because of the great reviews on Tripadvisor, we decided to stay at Park Vue during March 21st-24th. Upon check-in I was told that we did not get the queen/bunkbed room. Since they were totally booked they couldn't move us which got me fairly upset since we have a 10yr old girl and a 7yr old boy who do NOT like to share a bed. But the hostess was fabulous and got us a trundle for my son to sleep in and my daughter got her own bed. Win-win. We were also traveling with an infant so we had a crib in the room as well! Since I am pregnant being able to walk back to our room midday for a nap and not walk too much after all day walking was bonus! Fan in the room made it quiet (we also brought sound

Stayed last week. location superb right outside the gates. Close enough to return to the hotel for a swim late afternoon and then return to park at night. Rooms Clean and comfortable, Child centred Breakfast and a supper included Ideal for the children. Great touches such as free cookies for the children in reception. Definitely would return.

Summary Heading: Price and Proximity - That's about it
Summary: Summary - Rooms - A little worn out, small, and tired. Floor was dark and seemed to rub off on my kids white socks. Floors also felt moist but that may be the LA climate. Cleanliness was minimal. Found hairs in the bathtub on our arrival. In room coffee was OK but the staff didn't replace our regular coffee so we had to mix a decaf with the regular to get a decent cup (I know boo hoo but really how hard is it to count the clearly marked packages). The pool is nice. Hot tub was hot (in a good way)! Free (as in included) breakfast was nice. Eggs, waffles, toast sausage, biscuits etc. Had no issues there. Saved a ton on park breakfast. They had free dinners at night too. (until 7:30 pm) We did not partake I heard they were adequate. I Hop next door was nice as an alternate meal

OMG I cant say enought good things about this hotel.  We were extremly pleased with the service, clean rooms, good food and excellent location to Disneyland.  The staff was amazing during the dinner meals and shared magic tricks, balloon animals.  The waffles in the morning were always great.  I would highly reccommend this hotel if you are travelling with children.  We loved it!

This is a very clean hotel which is very close to Disneyland.  It is a very good value with a nice complimentary breakfast.  It is perfect for those wanting a nice place to rest after a busy day at the parks.  It exceeded my expectations.

This resort was perfect for our family stay!  Complimentary parking, complimentary breakfast & light dinner, bunk beds for the kids, room amenities included a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker and a well stocked supply of coffee, tea, and hot coco.  We recieved a welcome basket with fruit, bottled water and a bottle of wine.  The staff was knowledgeable about the area and were very friendly.  All staff from the parking lot staff, front desk, and housekeeping were accommodating, friendly, and seemed genuinely happy to be there.  The location was directly across the street from Disneyland, which was a SUPER PLUS...  It rained on one of the days we were there and to not wait in the rain for transportation and just run across the street instead was ideal.  We stayed Feb 26-28,

Summary Heading: Park Vue helped us save in many ways!
Summary: We were very happy that we stayed at this hotel. We were attracted by the fact that we could get a room with one queen bed and 2 bunks for the kids (we have young teens who can no longer share a bed). While the room was small - the bunks provided the kids with a spot that they could retreat to after a busy day and listen to their i-pods, etc (free wifi). We also had a fridge, microwave, coffee maker (and older tv and furniture). The next great thing about the hotel is that they let us park there on the morning of our reservation so that we could head straight to the park and avoid parking fees at Disneyland . They also let us check a bag at the lobby that we did not want to leave in the car and delivered it to our room later in the day when the room was ready. When I went to the

The location can't be beat! We stayed at the Park Vue Inn March 10-18, 2012 and had an excellent stay! Our room was at the back of the property on the ground floor. We timed our walk back to our room one day as we exited Disneyland's exit turnstiles, and it was just a little over 6 minutes! We've stayed at Walt Disney World resorts that had longer walks to the resort bus stops! The breakfast was excellent, and the evening light dinner was a great added bonus. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed picking up cookies and having a drink in the lobby as we came back from the parks each day - another great added bonus. I would recommend a second floor room since we did hear walking, running, and jumping from the children staying above us. We are already planning a

Polite staff. Clean rooms. Pool and hot tub. Very close to Disneyland. 5 min. walk. Free breakfast & dinner buffet: nothing fancy but fills the stomach. Free lemonade/coffee in lobby. Welcome basket.  Water pressure in bathroom sink and bathroom door wouldn't close properly.  We let the staff know - I would bet it is already fixed.  I would easily stay here again or recommend to friends. IHOP and other restaurants near by for lunch etc...

Summary Heading: Be prepared for lots of loud, excited kids.
Summary: If you have loud, hyper kids who are totally spazzed to come to Disneyland and you just can't keep them quiet ... Come here. You won't have to feel bad about your kids disturbing anyone, because this place is all about running, banging, stomping, yelling, hyper kids. It's across the street from Disneylnd, so that's par for the course. Ask for a 2nd floor room near the back if you want a chance at a little quiet, but even then I'm not sure. Good points: free parking, walk to Disneyland, free breakfast and some kind of afternoon snack, friendly front desk staff.

Location is the #1 reason people book this hotel as it is right accross the street from Disneyland.  The pool is in the middle of the parking lot but looked to be clean and well kept.  We had 3 separate rooms.  All seemed to vary in size.  (???)  Clean but very BASIC.  They were not able to accomodate us with a connecting room (even though I had requested it many MONTHS in advance) so we were spread-out a little too far to my liking.  The breakfast choices were abundant.  "Light" dinner is also available free to guests.  Had some hot water issues the first day but they were fixed by a very speedy maintanance crew.   Front desk was friendly and storage of our luggage before and after check-out was easy.

Summary Heading: Very nice stay at the Park Vue Inn
Summary: This review is a bit past due. We stayed her from Jan 5th to Jan 9th 2012. After a 9 hour drive we arrived about 9am. I was first told a room should be ready about 11am. To check back then. So we headed to the park. About 1130 we returned, and told not till 3. Very tired we ate lunch next door and then took a nap in the car while we waited. We have been to Disneyland 5 times in the past 4 years. Each time staying a new place. For the price I thought it was worth it. Some of the most important things while looking for a place t o stay for us are.. 1. Safety- Well lit areas, very close to disneyland. A parking attendant there at all times, mostly famalies around. This place feels very safe and comfortable. 2.Clean- The rooms are small, but cozy.We had two queens and a roll away.

As a "Value for money" family of Five, this being our 5th time in 5 years to Disneyland and our 2nd time to the Park Vue Inn. The 1st being 5 yrs ago, and the latest in December 2011, to us the "Park Vue Inn" is NUMBER 1, by a long county mile, we have stayed at many nice hotels in Anaheim, using the ART system and within walking distance of the main gate. BUT the "Park Vue Inn & Suites" IS the closest, most convenient and by far the MOST FAMILY FRIENDLY Hotel we have EVER stayed at in our 5 years of travelling to the USA as a family. Argentis "ARG" you are an absolute credit to the Hotel, and the Hospitality Industry in Anaheim, to us Aussies, we would consider you a "Good Mate" and we would welcome you at any BBQ back here in OZ as family member, just as long as your support

I went with three girlfriends and our kids over spring break this year to Disneyland and Park Vue definitely added to our wonderful experience!  Upon arrival and check-in the kids were thrilled to discover refreshments waiting for them in the lobby.  We arrived in the evening after a long day of traveling; the kids sipped lemonade while we did a very quick and friendly check in.    We were welcomed to our two adjoining rooms with a lovely welcome basket of wine, fruit and water and a personalized letter welcoming us.  I was immediately impressed with the cleanliness of the rooms, along with the amenities of fridge, microwave, coffee machine, hairdryer and air conditioner. Before bed on our first night we were treated to a fantastic view of the fireworks from Disneyland right

This was our 4th stay here. Wouldn't go anywhere else. Great room, great staff, great breakfast, best ice cream place attached to hotel. Always a gift in our room. Thank you Park Vue for another wonderful stay.

Summary Heading: Excellent location, Great Value, Super Rooms
Summary: We had a wonderful experience at the Park Vue Inn.  First we were celebrating both my husband's and my daughter's birthdays.  When we arrived, they both had a birthday treat in the room complete with balloons.  What a great way to start.    The room we received was in the corner and it was so quiet so we slept great after long days in the park.  It was very clean.  Parking was easy.  Checkout was so simple.  No one was in line.  Quick, easy and friendly staff.  The same with checkout.    Breakfast was what you would expect.  It did have several hot items and we never walked away hungry.  It was great to eat on the outside terrace and see space mountain in the distance.  Since we are from the east coast, it was convenient to have an IHOP on the premises for the first morning

Nice rooms and very friendly, helpful staff.  We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast every morning.  Never made it out of the park for the evening snack/meal.  Loved that we could walk to Disneyland and California Adventure and come back to the hotel to take a break throughout the day if we wanted to swim or hang out at the pool or get a sweater.  Loved not having to drive or deal with parking or shuttles to and from the park.  This was a very convenient and comfortable place to stay when visiting Disneyland.  The cookies and lemonade in the lobby were welcome and appreciated after a long drive into Anaheim.  I recommend the Park Vue Inn without reservation.

Staff was friendly and efficient upon check in. Our safe didn't work at first and we walked down to the front desk to bring it to their attention. Maintenance had fixed it before we got back to our room. Wine/fruit/water basket was a nice touch. Most convenient location to the Disneyland property. Our room was in back and really quiet for road traffic. Breakfast is adequate but a good value since it is free. Needs more indoor seating especially during crisp February mornings. Patio heaters made it tolerable to eat outside. Weekend breakfasts can get too crowded to enjoy. IHOP and Denny's are close alternatives.

This is my families 5th time in staying with this hotel.  We love the convenience of being a 5 min. walk from across the street from the main gate at Disneyland.  I'll start with the service.  We have stayed year in 2011 and 2012 and so the staff was the same.  The management does an excellent job with its guest.  Two managers in particular Brian De Rose and Argenis Porras are very good with guest relations. They understood that I was more into a buddy to buddy type relationship, yet were very professional in any services needed.  Perfect for me!  The other staff members where always helpful.  We didn't need a lot but when a request was made for like extra towels it was done with in minutes.      The property is very clean and maintained well.  The breakfast is one of the best

We have stayed here a few times before and loved the location.  Every year we go, the experience at the hotel gets better and better.  When we made our reservations, there weren't enough larger rooms available our whole stay, but they accommodated us.  They switched our luggage to a different room (which was an even better room than the first) and they went the extra mile.  It was absolutely no inconvenience for us.  The fact that we didn't have to pay for parking, their breakfast was decent, they had exactly what kids want for "dinner."  It couldn't have been better.  We do plan on staying with them again in the future.

Summary Heading: very close to Disneyland, great service, great free breakfast
Summary: The Park Vue Inn was perfect. The free breakfast was excellent. My daughter had waffles every morning, my son had cereal, and we had french toast and bagels. That was a great start to the day. The savings on breakfast gave us budget $ to eat lunch in the Disneyland park. It is close enough to walk back in the afternoons for some downtime. The free supper is pasta, salad and soup which was ok for 1 day, but the variety was not enough for my little ones so often we skipped that. There are 2 restaurants beside the hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Fresh fruit and juice in the lobby was a helpful snack. Beds were very comfortable and we have slept in much worse hotels for bed comfort. Rooms were spacious and frankly we were only there to sleep. In-room safe was handy for

I had a 10+ star weekend with friends in LA. So you may be surprised that I'm giving this place 1 star. Spent the weekend here and there are some definite pros for staying here. It's the closest you can get to DL without staying on property. There's a free breakfast and light dinner each day. The waffles are delicious. The price is cheap.    Now, the cons. When we arrived to check-in (after midnight) our door was WIDE open. Like you walk up and say, "WTF". Yes, wide open. And keep in mind it's more like a MOTEL w/ external hallways so the door was wide open to the parking lot. I called the front desk, after checking to make sure there wasn't a murderer hiding in our room, to complain. He was like, "meh, maintenance must not have closed it all the way (shrug)". I was too tired to

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while visiting Disneyland
Summary: Staff very friendly and helpful.  Rooms so-so, but because visiting Disneyland is what's important, all we need is a clean place to sleep and shower.  Free meals morning and evening--average quality.  Coffee available in lobby and matches Starbucks in taste.  Cold Stone Creamery attached to hotel lobby--convenient but too tempting.  We have no will power, so gave in every day.  Best of all, Disneyland's main entrance is, literally, steps away.  Cross the street and your there.  Lots of restaurants within walking distance.  That said, Disneyland eateries are often less expensive and better quality than, say, Denny's (next door to Park Vue).  Parking is FREE!  These folks really understand the meaning of service.

Summary Heading: Great value and friendly for Disneyland visitors
Summary: Let me state that this review is based on quality and value, not luxuriousness.  We had a terrific stay at the Park Vue: very friendly staff - front desk and parking attendants, clean room, and great location.  The breakfasts were fine, nothing special until you consider the price of the room and then it's a bonus.  The evening snacks were also nice being complimentary.  It is an older motel-style building, so the walls are thin, but if you have kids going to Disneyland you'll fit right in with the vast majority here so it's no problem.  If you want peace and quiet and no kids, I'd recommend somewhere else.  One morning it was quite cold outside and the majority of the seating for the breakfast is outside on a deck.  There were two space heaters set up, but they weren't doing a

This motel does an excellent job at providing clean, comfortable accomodations close to Disney.  The room itself is adequate, and the bunk beds were great for kids.  The motel kindly includes 9and refills) the coffee and tea supplies every day, which you can use with your coffee maker or microwave in the room. In addition, the lobby offers free lemonade, juice, coffee and cookies throughout the day.  The free breakfast and dinner are understandably crowded, but fine-good variety on breakfast, and plenty of food to get you ready for the parks.  The free parking and internet also saved us a lot of money.  Best of all,this motel is literally a stone's throw away from the front gate, so we visited back and forth between our room and disney much more often than we anticpated. In
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Its reviews like your that make us continue to work diligently to provide this home away from home. We hope that you would come visit again soon.

Summary: We booked this place because of the tripadvisor reviews and we were so glad we did. We arrived tired and cold after a day in the snow in the grand canyon and the jacuzzi bath was a very welcome sight as was the free dinner in the dining room. Not alot of choice but the tomato soup hit the right spot. The welcome basket is a nice touch and the sparkling cider was lovely! Breakfast was great too. In addition to the coffee maker in the room there are hot and cold drinks and cookies available in the lobby all day which just adds to the value of this hotel. Not to mention the reason why we were there in the first place, Disneyland! The hotel just at the crosswalk for the parks and incredibly convenient. We were there for leap day and after arriving at 6am we were ready for a nap
Manager Response: We thank you for choosing Park Vue. We are happy to know that we met the expectations. We strive to provide the highest level of customer service. We are glad you enjoyed our amenities, and hope to continue to serve you in the future. Thank you for your review.

Summary: This was recommended to us by friends as being close to Disneyland.  It was more than that. It was comfortable with a good amount of room for the family.  They had thoughtful touches in the room like a welcome basket with wine and fruit and nice details like good creamer for morning coffee.   The front desk staff were friendly and helpful as well.  We'll definitely recommend this hotel to other families headed to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review Park Vue Inn. We are delighted to know that your stay was great. We still believe that the little things are very important. The front desk staff expresses their gratitude, and hopes to see you soon. Thank You.

Summary: Great Hotel. As close to Disney as you can get. Very clean and comfortable room, some minor plumbing noise, but after walking around all day, it doesn't keep you awake. The included breakfast makes this real value for money. Free internet in front reception, and Lux Bus picks up literally at the front door. Met all our needs, our room had 2 king beds.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review on Trip Advisor. We are happy to hear that your stay was great. In regards to the WiFi we are currently fixing two of the gateways that are down. On your next visit you should have WiFi in the room as well. Again thank you for the review and thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn as your hotel. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: Conveniently located within walking distance for Disneyland and restaurants along the main road.  Room was ground floor, neat and tidy, although outdated.  There was a welcome basket of wine and fruit which was a lovely touch.  Unfortunately, being on the ground floor, we could hear every noise coming from the room above - kids bouncing balls, moving chairs, toilet flushing etc. which disturbed our sleep for the 2 nights we were there.  Breakfast was included, although not particularly tasty.  I stayed here with my adult daughter but would perhaps only recommend this hotel for families with young children.

It is not a 5 star resort but had everything we wanted and needed. We stayed here four years ago and it's been nicely renovated and upgraded.  First of all, it was extremely clean, something I am fanatical about.  There are queen beds, not doubles, and they are comfortable and made with sheets above the blanket, as well as under.  I love this feature as I know everything in the bed that touches me is clean!   The rooms were a decent size and had a small fridge and microwave to keep beverages, snack foods and any leftovers from restaurants.  There was a room safe for passports, laptops and extra money, but honestly, this hotel felt very safe.   Free Wifi.  The breakfast is the best free hotel breakfast we have ever had.  Every morning there was a specialty: cheese omelets and

We have now stayed at five hotels along Harbor Blvd, and I think we have found the hotel we will stay at from now on when we go to Disneyland.  We stayed three nights 3/1/12 - 3/4/12 in a queen/bunk bed room.  Our children loved the bunk beds.  Each one had a light so they could read in bed.  The bathroom was larger than many we have been in.  We also had an infant and was able to fit the port-a-crib between the wall and queen bed.    There was a little "kitchen" area with a small fridge and microwave.    We ate breakfast and dinner each night.  Breakfast had cereal, toast, donuts, bagels, pancakes, make your own waffles, fruit, boiled eggs, oatmeal and a special dish each morning (omelet, scrambled eggs...)  For dinner they had enchiladas, chili nachos, mini chicken burgers.

Just returned from a two night stay and was very pleased. The rooms were very clean and the staff was friendly. The continental breakfast was better than most. This motel is directly across the street from the main entrance to Disneyland and is about a five minute walk to the gate. It is an older motel but has been kept up very well. We would definately consider staying there again and would recommend this motel to friends.

We have been staying at Park Vue Inn for about 12years, the staff has always treated us like family. The rooms are always clean and comfortable.  The people always go above and beyond to make you feel special. This year we were there on Feb 22, 23, 2012. My sons 9th birthday is on Feb 27th. When we came back from disneyland to our room there was a wonderful present and helium ballons along with a certifcate for a cold stome bday cake! All I can say is they know the way to a mother's heart, making things so special for my son!! We will never stay anywhere else and neither should you!:D

First of all, the people at the front desk were very friendly and polite.  So were the gentlemen who gave you your parking pass.  The front desk area was very pleasant and their cookies were absolutely delicious!  Great first impression.  Even though the room was a little dated, it was always clean and the jacuzzi was fabulous.  The hotel always made sure it was quiet by 10:30.  The mornings were a little noisy, but what child would not be up and yelling by 6 when Disneyland was right across the street!  Location, location, location!!! The included breakfasts were tasty, but sometimes they ran out of stuff right before closing time. The fruit and wine baskets were an excellent touch(an upgrade on the wine would be good). I would not hesitate to stay here again!  Thank you for a

I reserved two rooms for our trip to Disneyland and was very pleased with our stay there.  The rooms and restrooms were clean and tidy.  We received fruit and wine baskets in each room the day we arrived.  We took advantage of the continental breakfast each morning, before our walk to Disneyland and California Adventures.  The motel is very conveniently located and a quick walk.  The pool area looked clean, as well.  It was a little to nippy for any of our party to swim, but the area was welcoming.  When we departed, we were given bottled waters to drink on our shuttle ride to the airport.  I would definitely recommend this motel for anyone wanting a a convenient location and an economical price.

This is a great location!. The staff was friendly. Beds were comfy. They give you a gift basket in your room. Breakfast was good. I liked that it was a smaller hotel. Only gripe; is that it's an older hotel so the walls are a little thin. Overall. Great place to stay if you want to be close to Disney.

My family and I had gotten used to staying at the hotel directly next to Park Vue Inn until we had some customer service problems and vowed never to stay there to gain. When looking for a hotel to lodge at after the One More Disney Day, I remembered that Park Vue was directly across from the shuttle entrance and coaxed my mom into booking the 3-room suite. When were first arrived in the lobby, we were amazed by the free cookies, drinks, and the fact that we were given free meal tickets for free! When we went to our room we were also surprised by the fruit & wine basket. The beds were comfy, the free meals were great, I was so happy that we chose Park Vue Inn! It is the best value for your money with wonderful employees and we will be staying here again VERY soon.

I was fortunate to stay at this property on 23rd February for one night.  I would have to say this is the best customer service I have ever recieved while staying at a hotel.  I am big traveller and travel from 2 - 3 times a year.  I have also stayed in the Disneyland region many times.  Before traveling I researched extensively on tripadvisor and expedia regarding accommodation and could not find many faults with Park Vue Inn so I booked it.  They did not let me down.    My experience began when we checked into our room mid way down, so quite quiet.  When we went to put our drinks in the fridge the freeze tray was half pulled out.  So I ran down to reception to report the issue and he said he would send someone down.  Given previous hotel experiences I asked how long as we were

Summary Heading: Perfect location. Great Stay for this family of 5.
Summary: We just got back from a great stay for 2 nights. We go to disneyland every year at this same time of year and this was our best trip. Last year we stayed at the Grand Californian and after staying here there is no way I would go back there.  The kids loved the bunks and we loved the price and all the perks. When the kids got wet on splash mountain, we just popped back over to our room to change. They had gift bags and balloons waiting for my birthday girls. The gifts in the bags were not junk. Princess pencil boxes. Dry erase boards. Good quality crayons and coloring books. Pens and more. Too much to list. Enough that we didn't need to bring anything else for them to play with on our trip. We loved the pool and jacuzzi which were heated perfectly. Pool 85 jacuzzi not too hot. We

If we stay here again I will bring some sort of noise filter or ear plugs, because our family needed to sleep after long days at the park.  The location is great!!  I choose this hotel from reading others review but I have to disagree based on one thing and maybe it varies by what room you get but this place was the loudest hotel I have stayed in! We stayed for five nights and we could hear every foot step, flush and use of the sink of the people above us!  Plus we could hear every person that walked by our room having a conversation at a normal volume.  I had requested a second story room prior to arrival, at check in they were not able to fill my request.   The breakfast is what you would expect, nothing fancy but decent selection.  The "light" dinner was a nice budget saver

This is the fifth time we've stayed at the Park Vue Inn and as always it was awesome! The location CANNOT be beat! It is so close to the Disney parks, probably closer than the Disney resorts! That is the main reason we stay here every year. Their service was impeccable.....we had a couple issues in the room that needed attention (broken TV remote, unwanted roll away bed) and they addressed it immediately. The front desk called our room just to make sure everything was satisfactory AND they brought a complimentary welcome basket to us!  The continental breakfast is wonderful......a huge variety of things to choose from and I was ecstatic to learn they now include a complimentary light dinner! We took advantage of the pool and jacuzzi which has recently been remodeled and it was

The Park Vue Inn is a great, family friendly, budget hotel. The staff is courteous and friendly. Checking in and out was quick and efficient. Room is very clean. Property was safe, clean and quiet. Free buffett style breakfasts and dinners a plus. A few of our favorite things: 1) Location - less than a 5 - 7 minute walk to the gates of Disneyland. Literally walk out of your room, cross the street and you are on Disney property. Also, we were given a second story room with a view of Disney's aerial fireworks display. 2) Housekeeping staff - though the furnishings are simple, a bit dated and show wear, our room was always clean. The bathroom looked recently refurbished. My favorite part - Bunk Beds! Our girls loved each having their own space. Plus, the house keeping staff would

Summary Heading: Another great stay...Best hotel for Disneyland!
Summary: I have stayed at most of the hotels along Harbor Boulevard over the years but Park Vue is the best. They have so many little extras to make your stay better. From refreshments at check in to the breakfast and evening reception. Plus more.  The bunk beds are excellent so my kids don't fight about sharing a bed.  The rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet.  The hotel location is so handy being situated right at the cross walk over to Disneyland which makes it easy at the end of a long day to make it back to your room. No shuttles...yay!  They also helped me immediately when my son realized he left his favorite pajamas behind (tucked under his pillow).  Thanks Park Vue...we will be back!

A 60th birthday surprise trip to Disneyland! Park Vue was Great.  Great Location. Great Service. Great room. Great Bed and bedding! Breakfast and dinner included at hotel.  2 queen beds and a bunk with a trundle.  Room could have slept seven!  We all said it would have been a great value when our kids were young.  Humm a grandkids vacation...maybe. Would highly recommend and actually book 2 rooms for our next excursion to the Happiest Place on Earth.

Walking from the lobby to the crosswalk: 1 minute.  Walking from the crosswalk to Disney Resort's bag check: 5 minutes.  Can you get closer to Disneyland than this?  I don't think so.  No extra charges for parking, breakfast, or dinner.  Fridge and microwave in the room.  Service was great -- parking attendant, housekeeping, front desk.  They are obviously very busy but they make an effort to be very helpful.  It's difficult to get into the rooms early because they are so busy but I don't mind as long as they're taking care of the rooms.  And they do.  Room was clean and updated.   Just one suggestion -- I know it's difficult with people like us tracking in dirt from the park but is there any way to keep the carpets cleaner?   We will be staying here on any future trips to

This was a great place to stay for our kids' first Disneyland trip. The walk to the front gate of Disneyland was even shorter than from the Disney hotels. While the property is aging, the service we received was incredible. Every employee with whom we interacted was pleasant, helpful, and had good things to say about the hotel and its owners. We were celebrating our kids' birthdays (within one week of each other), and they provided an incredible gift for each of them, compete with balloons! We loved the included breakfast and dinner. That saved us the huge cost of eating inside the park, as we were willing to take the short walk back in the early evening. The breakfasts were hearty enough to get us through most of the day in the park, and the dinners were things that our kids

Just as the reviews said, 2 meals (lite dinner & hot breakfast), and parking included...this inn was the perfect place for our visit to Disneyland.  My family arrived at 7:00 am on a Friday, and was able to park 2 cars without an extra charge for our entire 3 day vacation.  We checked in early (2 pm) and received 2 welcome baskets with water, fruits, wine/apple cider.  The front desk had cookies (freshly baked and excellent) and lemonade available.  Everything was clean and well attended to.  The beds were comfortable, and the air conditioner/heater could be manually adjusted.  On Saturday we heard some noise from upstairs, but it was not disturbing.  There is turn down of maid service available, and the front desk employees are very kind and competent.  We were able to get to

I have stayed in 10 different hotels on trips to Disneyland in the last 5 years. We will book with Park Vue again. Clean, convenient, very comfortable beds, friendly staff, easy parking. Refrigerator, microwave, ironing board & iron, coffee maker, blow drier and safe, all in room. Pool and spa looked inviting. With numerous restaurants within easy walking  distance, I couldn't ask for more. I was pleasantly surprised at the value.

Anyone new to the PVI - they are simply the best.  I just booked our 3rd stay there & wouldn't stay anywhere else.  Travel from LAX to their doorstep is a piece of cake on the Disneyland shuttle.  The rooms are very good, beds comfy, you literally walk across the street to enter Disney - which means if you need a rest in between rides you can do just that & then go back for more.  The staff is excellent - has been incredibly helpful in a couple of pinches we've been in, and free breakfast, cookies, fruit and water to boot!  Plus, as a parent trying to make money stretch, you cannot possibly beat the price!  Thank you PVI for making our trip pleasant, restful and, most of all, possible!

We really enjoy the Park Vue Inn. The staff are always warm and friendly from the managers to the housekeepers. They all do a wonderful job. They are quick to get your room ready for you to start your Disneyland vacation. The fact I am able to park my car and not use it the whole time I am there means something to me. Walking distance to the park is a major plus. You can lay in the pool at night and see the fireworks too. The nice welcome gift is so appreciated and if it is your birthday the cute tasty cake from Cold stone is a blast to have.

Ok. This is a harder review to write.  The reality is that these rooms are older and smaller than those we are used to staying in.  It's not a 4 star hotel BUT it's 1. Affordable 2. RIGHT outside both California Adventure and Disneyland. 3. Management is thinking outside the box. Cookies, juice, lemonade, and lemon water in the lobby.  Free breakfast, including waffle maker, free "kiddie" dinner for folks taking a siesta, Welcome Basket, with WINE and fruit, Free Internet access, and the middle of the Disney chaos, a hot tub and a pool where, if you do the back stoke just right you can look at the stars and palm trees and transport to another place.  Things that bugged me...we only had 3 thin drawers.  I'm an unpacker.  It just frustrated me not to be able to unpack, not enough

Summary Heading: Good value for your dollar right next to Disneyland
Summary: First off you need to understand what type of lodging this is, a circa 1950s Motel.  I tend to stay in more upscale hotels so if you are expecting Hotel or resort style accomidations this is not the place for you.  I was taking 3 toddlers and 2 teenagers to Disneyland so I wanted an excellent location, good value, and clean rooms.  Park Vue is all of those things.  Being a 1950s motel you will have small rooms and small older bathrooms.  Being a motel the beds and linens are not luxurious.  The room however is very clean.  The property is right across the street from disneyland, even my Mother (aka Grandma) could walk it without a problem.  The breakfast and light afternoon snacks are a great bonus and not having to pay Disney for parking is great.  This type of motor lodge

This was our second stay at Park Vue Inn. Both times we have had great deals. This last time we went up to celebrate both of our children's birthday's. When we got back to our room after an incredible time at Disney, The room was filled with balloons, and each had a large birthday bag full of cayrons, coloring books, activity books and more. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are clean, quite and enough space for our family.   Thank you Park Vue Inn in helping create a wonderful family vacation. We will be back.

Summary Heading: Go to one of the hotels next door (this one isn't worth it)
Summary: This is a small privately owned hotel and is directly located across the street from Disneyland.    My wife and myself stayed in the Jacuzzi suite for a week which they have four of in the corners of the hotel.  Walking past other rooms we could see inside they had many types of rooms including a single bed, single bed with bunk beds or two beds with bunk beds, which would be nice for families.  The pros. This hotel has a free breakfast and a social meal for dinnertime both for free.  The breakfast was simple with eggs bacon biscuits and gravy, cereal, waffles, donuts, toast, fruit, milk, and several juices.  The dinner changed each night of the week, they included: Hamburger sliders, chicken sliders, enchiladas, nachos, tacos, mac&cheese with chicken nuggets, each night they

We've stayed in several hotels in the area and this was definitely our favorite.  The location is simply perfect for quick and easy access to the Disneyland resort.  The room was clean and the beds quite comfortable.  We loved the breakfast and pool/hot tub and extra touches like welcome basket and Valentine flowers.  We also took advantage of the laundry room and free parking.  All of this for a great price.  I would highly recommend this hotel!

Summary Heading: Second stay and still a great deal
Summary: This was our second stay there and it was still a great deal.  I search the internet a great deal before we book anywhere.  On this trip we were able to walk around a bit and look over the other hotels in the area.  Here is one of the biggest reasons to stay at this hotel.  We found this hotel to be in the back of Cold Stone and IHOP with hotels on both sides cutting out the noise of the street so you can sleep! The other reasons are free parking before check in time and after check out time.  Just see the front desk for a pass.   We had the two room-3 bed suite. But I suggest the upper floor over the bottom floor.  My husband and I took our 18 year old son and his friend.  Everyone got their own bed and my husband and I got our own room that way.  Since my son turned 18 on one

I have been to Disneyland 6 times and these trips have always involved a hotel stay. This trip was from Feb 8-16, 2012. This was by far the best hotel we've stayed at! Free breakfast and free light supper, fruit basket welcome!!! Add to that the wonderful staff we experienced and you have a wonderful trip to Disneyland!!!  On our first day, our grandson got sick, the staff made us feel well cared for and even checked in on him offering suggestions for his upset tummy!!! The front desk staff checked in twice to see that our stay was going well and on Valentine's Day we got roses!!! There was nothing we could complain about, when we go back to Disneyland, and we will be back, we will stay here again. Lastly the location is perfect, literally right across the street from Disney,

all of the workers i interacted were pleasant and helpful. location was right across the street from Disneyland so its a good spot. the had a fruit basket and wine in the room. the free breakfast was ok, comparable to Best Westerns Id say. nothing special. free parking was included. rooms were clean,beds comfy. not a suite but it was fine

We just returned from a week long stay at the Park Vue Inn from Feb 6/12 to Feb 13/12. This hotel may be the best value we have ever received. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms are average but very clean, breakfast was great (the waffles are absolutely delicious), the location cannot be beat, and the view for the fireworks was not bad at all! Not only that, they have a social hour where the serve a kid friendly dinner. While we were there we had the dinner 3 times, tacos one night, sliders another and nachos a third. Nothing fancy but the kids liked it and it was a nice break to come back from Disneyland, relax a bit in the Hot tub, eat and then go back to the park for the evening. We also received a welcome basket in our room upon arrival. It had fruit,

Great location at the entrance to Disneyland and Disney's California adventure park. The only closer hotel are the Disney resort hotel and they are super expensive.cross the street and your at the entrance. Free breakfast and a free mini dinner are served, not the greatest food, but it is free. The rooms are average, and small enough to be crowed for 2 adults and 2 or more kids, but you don't stay here for the rooms, you stay here for Disney. Super value for the location. The staff is friendly and helpful. The hot tub is great after being at the park all day long. The rooms are clean and plenty of clean towels. Bunk beds for the kids, they loved it.

I chose this hotel at random, and was very happy I did.  The location was the best-right across from Disneyland.  The room was completely renovated, with a refrigerator and microwave, and very comfortable beds.  The complimentary breakfast was delicious. they even left a fruit and wine basket for us in the room.  My only criticism was that the free internet was so slow as to be unusable.

This resort hotel was the absolute best experience we have ever had at a hotel. They were the best hosts anyone could ask for. A personal touch was added in with our stay because of my son's birthday. They left balloons and a Disneyland/Park Vue coffee mug full of candy along with a personalized letter of welcome. If you want a reasonably priced resort hotel right across the street from the entrance of Disneyland then look no further. Top notch service with a smile and WILL stay here again.

I have to update my review on the Park Vue.  My husband and I came to stay for my second stay for a Valentine’s Day escape, and what we found in our room were a couple of beautiful roses, a heart shaped balloon and sweet note.  What a wonderful touch!!  This hotel continues to go over and above the other properties in this area.  I am still impressed!  For my first review of this property, please check out my profile page.  For everybody else, this is the place to go!!

We followed many other reviews from TripAdvisor and tried the Park Vue Inn for our visit to Disneyland.  It turned out EVEN BETTER than the reviews we read.   The hotel is not super-fancy so if that is what you are looking for this would not be your choice.  If however, you are looking for a good value, with an amazing location (right across the street), and with excellent amenities, then this is your choice.  The rooms are very decent, with enough space and very clean, the breakfast is good, the wi-fi worked well, and our service was excellent.  At one point the toilet would not stop running, we called the front desk, and within 5 minutes someone was at our room fixing the toilet.  Everything about this experience was superb.  We strongly recommend the Park Vue Inn to anyone
Manager Response: We are glad that we were able to exceed your expectations. It is our goal to provide the highest level of customer service. We thank you for taking the time to give us a review. See you soon

Summary Heading: Awesome Family Hotel and Great Service
Summary: This hotel was awesome! We go to Disneyland about 4-6 times every year and this was our first time staying at the Park Vue Inn. Now we will only stay here, when we go from now on. We have 4 kids so the 2 Queen / Bunkbed room was perfect, it wasn't the biggest room but you're not there for the room anyways. The breakfast every morning was great, hot options of waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. and the normal cold options of cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, etc. great way to start the day and saved us about $40/day. They also have a "Dinner-hour" with 1 entree and sides of green salad, 2 types of soup, fresh veggies, jello salad, etc. The 1 entree ranged from hot dogs, tacos, sliders, nachos, etc. not the highest quality food but good enough to go back every night and besides it

Definitely the best location of any of the off-site hotels near Disneyland.  This place has very good customer service and like I said an unbeatable location.  The rooms are decent.  The breakfast in the morning is above average.  The price increases continue to outpace inflation however, and I'm starting to look towards staying at a bit nicer place if the prices continue to rise.

We just got back from a four night mid-week stay here at Park Vue with our two 4.5yr old twins.  Husband and I agree that we will stay here each and every time we visit Disneyland in the future.  Despite the walls being thin. That is the only one con against all the pros.    We drove and were greeted with a very friendly parking attendant.  We quickly discovered that every employee was friendly.  The housemaids, maintenance walking by, managers, gift shop ladies, kitchen personnel were all so welcoming and accommodating.  A nice welcome basket with a bottle of wine, fruit and Cold Stone Creamery coupons was a nice touch.  I like the Mom and Pop motel feel rather than chain hotels.  If that is your style then this is the place for you.  They truly care about your experience with

There's not much to complain about here. It is a motel-style property, and there was a bit of noise, but nothing that kept us awake or woke us up.  The room was clean, comfortable, and a short walk to Disneyland.   The meals were very appreciated. We ate supper both nights we were there, as well as breakfast. Nothing too fancy, but it was just what we needed. We also liked the welcome basket and each time we were in the lobby, we were asked if we needed water bottles.  I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Summary Heading: Closest to Disneyland entrance; family friendly
Summary: Excellent staff - I made a point of telling the manager - from the cleaners who always had smiles to the reception and food service staff. You can't get closer to Disneyland entrance - so it was great to be able to walk directly across the road to start early and be able to return for a quick nap before heading out again for the evening. Excellent free breakfast and free evening meal (simple fast food and salad etc - but just what kids like and its free!) Rooms were comfortable - L shape family room allows parents to watch TV or read without disturbing kids too much. There are a choice of several good family restaurants within 1-3 minutes walk. As we planned to leave at 4pm they were happy to allow us to leave our car in their carpark.

This place is amazing!!!!  It really is right across the street from Disneyland.  We have 2 toddlers and we were able to walk back to our room for a break and then go back to the park for the night shows.  Everyone who works here is super friendly and nice.  The breakfast in the morning is GREAT!  It has a hot dish choice as well as waffles, cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, fruit, danish, etc. A great way to start off a day in the parks!  The kids loved eating outside on the patio.  The social hour is also AMAZING!  Every night is something different: Mac and cheese, chicken nuggest, hamburger sliders, tacos, etc.  Perfect for the kids, but I have to admit that the adults enjoyed it as well. Rooms are clean and comfy.  The whole family enjoyed the pool and hot tub.  We were thrilled

The first time I went to Disney I stayed at the Grand California and imagined that anywhere else would be lacking, and perhaps lessen the Disney experience. I was wrong. The Park Vue is in an excellent location and the corner room that we stayed in came complete with a Jacuzzi (not all rooms have them). We also received a Coldstone Creamery gift basked with a bottle of wine, fruit and some ice-cream vouchers. Everything in the room was spotless. In the morning we had the free buffet breakfast with sausages, bacon, eggs, biscuits and gravy, waffles, doughnuts, bagels, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, coffee. The staff are polite too. The only reason to deduct a star would simply be that this is a motel style place with the hustle, bustle and noise that comes with thin walls in a place

(3 adults 2 kids- ages 4 & 5) spent 7 nights at the Park Vue Inn in February. I booked the room off of the hotel web-site as they offered the best rate that I could find on-line. Overall we LOVED this place and would highly recommend it to any family that is looking for cozy, budget-friendly accomodations close to the Disney parks.   We stayed in a 2 Queen with bunk beds room towards the end of the property (231). The kids LOVED the bunk beds and happily played away on them whenever we had a little "downtime" from the parks. The queens were comfortable and we all slept well...but, that may have something to do with having severe exhaustion at the end of each day! Maid service was good, our room was made up in time for afternoon breaks around 1pm, with the exception of one day

We stayed in a neighbouring property last time we visited Disneyland but after reading the reviews decided to try the Park Vue Inn and we are very happy we did.  Perfect location, friendly staff, comfortable beds & the bunk bed room was perfect as we have 2 teenagers.  Breakfast was excellent, making waffles the highlight each morning.  We were too busy enjoying Disneyland to be home in time for dinner but it was nice to know it was there if we needed it.  We will be back, we wouldn't even think of staying anywhere else.

We just spent 4 nights at the Park Vue.  Clean - Comfy beds - SUPER CONVENIENT being right across the street from the main gate.  Great to be able to come 'home' for a break halfway thru the day.  Front desk staff are great.  Fresh baked cookies, cold drinks, and fruit are available at the front desk at any time.  We are in our 50's and the only possible negative was how noisy it was in the mornings ....but this is disneyland and the kids are super excited so you go there expecting this.   Denny's 2 doors down is great value and good food.   You won't be disappointed.....

The Park Vue Inn is clean, the employees are friendly, across form Disney and the price is reasonable. My family has stayed there three times and will continue to do so. They serve free breafast and dinner. So this can help your expenses

Located within a few minutes of the Disneyland maingate, this hotel goes the extra mile in providing amenities superior to its neighboring hotels.  The breakfasts and lunches gave plenty of choices to suit everyone from adults to toddlers.  The rooms and outside were kept very clean, including the heated pool.  The staff quickly responded to all requests and even allowed us to keep our car parked on site on our last day at Disneyland after we checked out.  This will be our hotel of choice for any and all future Disney trips.  The only downfall were the beds.  A bit too hard for my family, but we know this is an entirely subjective criticism.  We loved Park Vue!

We just returned from our stay here in one of the main level bunk bed rooms.  We were very impressed with the staff and friendliness.  Each person we met couldn't have been nicer or more helpful.  We LOVED the proximity to Disneyland and the highways.  Very nice not to line up for the shuttles or if we forgot something, could easily pop back.  Our room was a good size but a little hard finding spots for luggage.  Nice furniture and overall was clean.  We felt very safe and secure at the hotel and appreciated the parking lot attendant monitoring who was allowed access to the parking - always ample spaces near our room.     I would have to say our greatest issue was very loud upstairs neighbors.  They woke us up daily about 6ish and kept us up with their late night showers.

Summary Heading: Always a great place that cares about your comfort.
Summary: Incredible.  We love the location, literally walk out of your room, across the street, into Disneyland.  No trams to wait for and your room is close enough for your tired feet to rest. The beds were comfortable and fluffy.  The breakfast was wonderful.  And we were surprised at the dinner that was included now as well.  Warm cookies in the lobby all day long.  Everyone was very nice and really treated us well and constantly asked if they could do more.  It is our favorite place to stay in Disneyland and it won't hurt your budget, in fact they feed you twice a day, so it helps your budget!  They even had a welcome basket and offered a discount for the third nite with personal notes.  Can't be beat!

This is the place to stay if you're planning a Disney vacation and don't want to spend almost double for a Disney hotel. It's basically located on the cross walk from the entrance of Disneyland. They gave us an early check-in, welcoming fruit basket, balloons & gift bag for my son's 6th birthday and a free petite cake from Coldstone. Loved that it included breakfast, light dinner, parking, and internet at no extra charge. That saved us A LOT of money. The kids also loved the bunk beds. The workers were very friendly as well. I couldn't have been anymore satisfied.

Summary Heading: How did we miss this Treasure of a Hotel for so many years?!!!
Summary: We have gone to Disneyland for about 25 years almost every year. You can imagine how many hotels we have stayed and up until we have never repeated the same hotel.Well after staying at the Park Vue Inn at the end of January our search is over.From now on no questions asked we will be staying here. The rooms were exceptionally clean, fresh baked cookies, fruit, fresh coffee ,lemon water,fruit punch and lemonade are available in the office 24/7. We are big breakfast eaters and every morning there was a different hot dish,from egg omlettes to scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon etc. Then every morning there was fresh donoughts, cereal, fresh fruit, juice, coffee, hot cocoa, belgian waffles, yogourt, french toast, bagels, toast on and on. They offer dinner for free also but we never

We celebrated our one year anniversary with a three day trip to Disneyland and we stayed at the Park Vue Inn. You can't beat the location and value of this hotel, it's a 5 minute walk to the entrance gates of Disneyland and California Adventure. The proximity to the parks was great because we could take a break in the middle of the day and go back to the hotel to relax, rest our tired feet and/or take a nap (Disneyland can be exhausting).   When we came back to the hotel the second day (the day of our anniversary), we found a nice "Happy Anniversary" balloon arrangement anchored by two Park Vue Inn mugs filled with candy.  There was also a gift basket with fruit and wine. It was a pleasant surprise and it shows how the staff at the hotel take an extra step to make your stay more

Summary Heading: Loved the bunk beds and the pool
Summary: The location can't be beat.  Excellent service.  The breakfast and happy hour food can save you a lot of money.  Don't be afraid to spend a bit more money for a room here, it is more than made up for by the free parking and the money you can save not eating at a restaurant twice a day.  We were pleasantly surprised by the nice pool.

This was the perfect place to stay while visiting Disneyland.  Like everyone else says, "Right across the street."  You'd think being so close, the property managers wouldn't care much about letting the place go, but the upkeep was very noticeable.  We thoroughly enjoyed our time here and if I were forced to find a "negative" it would be the size of the bunkbed rooms.  Grandma stayed there with the two kids and my husband and I stayed in a double queen, close by.  The double queen had a larger bathroom/vanity area and felt much roomier.  However, my girls loved the bunkbeds!  It was well worth it!  Service was fantastic.  Every morning at breakfast, we were greeted with a smile.  Even when my 9-yr-old locked all our cash in the safe with no idea how she did so, hotel staff came

Summary Heading: Nice place, but be sure of your reservation plans
Summary: I'll get the bad out of the way first.  They have a very restrictive cancellation policy.  We stayed here on the first half of a work trip for my hubby, and found it was a little further from his job than he wanted.  If you don't cancel 2 days in advance, you get a one night penalty.  So poor hubby will have to walk on trip two.  I called to see if there was any wiggle room on that, got a guy who didn't seem to have it quite all together, and it seemed the answer was no.  The only other complaint was that their security is very lax.  If you say your key doesn't work, they don't look up a thing - just give you a key for whatever room you tell them.  No ID either.  Handy when my key didn't work, but is a security issue.  The good outweighs the bad by far.  The room, except for the
Helpful staff with a great location. Free breakfast and dinner. A welcome basket and clean room. All of the extras that will bring me back.

Summary Heading: BEST place to stay if going to Disneyland!!
Summary: This place was awesome! We spent four nights (Jan 25-29, 2012) and just loved this place!! The extra attention they give their guests was superb. We were surprised by a welcome basket with a bottle of wine, fruit and water bottles-what a nice way to welcome us. I also told them we were celebrating my son and husband's birthdays that weekend when I booked the room. When we came back to the room on the first night they had set up a birthday display that was unreal. There were at least 8 helium balloons (3 were even the really nice foil ones) and gifts!!! The gifts were amazing...my son got activity books, crayons, specialty pens, candy, mugs, notebooks...really, really nice stuff. He was so excited! They also included three coupons for  free mini ice cream cakes at the marble slab
