The hotel staff were over the top friendly, the room was clean and had everything you could need, the food was excellent nice to have more than just fruit and cold cereal like other places, location was awesome right across the street from Disneyland, the pool & spa looked great but we didn't use them, this is a awesome place to stay would recomend to others, just wish people were more aware of others in the morning and be a little more quiet not everyone wants to be up at the crack of dawn although I understand it's Disneyland and kids are excited but really folks

Our family just got back from a short 2 night stay at the hotel. It was exactly what we were looking for. It was easy to find, there was lots of parking, the pool was nice, the front desk staff were friendly and courteous and made us feel welcome, the breakfast was plentiful and constantly topped up and food areas/tables were wiped up as needed. Our room was spotless and while not huge, it was big enough for us to move about without tripping over one another or our luggage. Loved the welcome basket: it was filled with water bottles, fruit, and a bottle of red wine which could be exchanged for cranberry juice if desired. The bathroom was bright, had a marble counter, lots of towels, a dry line for wet swim suits in the shower/tub, the shower head was adjustable and had a nice

We have stayed at this hotel plenty of times because of the location.  We went down for our anniversary.  The hotel had a package of balloons and cups full of candy in the room waiting.  We spent the extra money for a  jacuzi suite...well worth the extra money.  It was quite bigger than we thought.  BUT it was WONDERFUL to come back from Disneyland and relax in the jacuzi.  We plan on going back soon and will always stay there.

We were not sure what to expect when arriving because at the price we paid we didn't expect much.  This hotel far exceeded our expectations!  The rooms were the perfect size (we had a queen with bunkbeds) and the bunkbeds were awesome, very solid and sturdy and each had their own built in night light mounted on the wall beside them.  The beds were all comfortable and the bedding looked new.  The towels were a little less then perfect but they had all brand name toiletries and the the room was very clean.  The breakfast and dinner saved is a fortune as did the free parking and free wifi as well as cookies and drinks/water in the lobby.  We didn't get a gift basket as everyone else had mentioned.  The staff was super nice and we had no complaints.  We even watched the fireworks

Great breakfast and dinner every night if you want it. Lots of nice people here, with a welcome basket of goodies when you check in. Location is great , closest to Disneyland , just across the street.

Summary Heading: Can't say enough good things about it
Summary: We were used to thinking of hotels as nothing more than a place to sleep, but the Park Vue Inn was much more than that for us. For the 3 nights we stayed there, it was home.  It is by far the best value for families visiting Disneyland. We're used to staying in budget, national chain hotels, but after researching other hotels in the area we decided to spend a bit more than usual for the convenience of being so close to the Park. Our expectations were exceeded in just about every way!  A family of 3 (2 adults, one 5 year old) we stayed 3 nights in a queen/bunk room, which was just right for us. The room was clean and orderly, and no weird smells. The sheets looked new and clean, and extra touches like crown molding, recessed lighting, and granite counters in the bathroom really

Summary Heading: Great place for a family Disneyland trip
Summary: We recently stayed 3 nights at the Park Vue Inn for a family Disneyland trip. We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds, which was adequate for the 5 of us. We got a rollaway bed, which turned out to be terribly uncomfortable (even my kids complained!) but when I mentioned this at checkout, they immediately offered to refund the extra charge.   The place is a basic motel, nothing fancy, clean, helpful staff, and I'd stay there again. You can't beat the location! When my 9 year old's shoes started hurting while we were in the park, it took 10 minutes to walk from the Pirates of the Caribbean to our room to get a different pair of shoes. I found the breakfast quite adequate and filling, and a big time saver. It's not gourmet, but I wouldn't expect that.  Another thing we liked is that
Was very nice , location is perfect, clean. free buffet style Breakfast and dinner. Heated pool and spa. staff very freindly.  liked the cold stone connected to hotel.

We just love the bunk bed rooms, so the kids don't have to share a bed(fight over covers!).  The location is the best one for walking to Disney.  The free parking is a rarity in the area as more and more of the nearby hotels are starting to nickel and dime you(parking, room safe, add-on fees, etc). We saw they lost their AAA approval as there were little stickers put over it in the brochures. We couldn't see why on our visit. They do give a AAA discount room price.  At night they have a snack/small dinner option, but we were always in the park and missed it.  There are cookies and hot and cold drinks in the lobby for an evening snack too.  The room was clean and we got a gift basket plus a special gift for our daughter who was having a birthday. She was so surprised when we

The main reason we booked this hotel is the great location, only few minutes to the Disneyland front entrance, the breakfast was a full breakfast, better choices than expected, the only thing we don't like they use a very strong cleaner inside the breakfast area, it is very bad to smell that first thing in the morning at 7 am, we mentioned it to the supervisor but didn't improved at all! Our room is located on the second floor, this hotel have no elevator, I wish they mention that on their website, as we need to carry  all our luggage to our room that is a bit inconvenience. On top the towel they provided are too thin and small. We all enjoyed the nice welcome basket, that's so nice of them!

Summary Heading: When I come back, I'd stay here again.
Summary: We enjoyed that it offered the breakfast which was adequate and the dinner which was OK for what it was. The meals are enough to both get you going and keep you going. It is a 5 min walk from the door of the hotel to the ticket gate, and that was walking with 2 kids. I wish I didn't have to walk across the parking lot to get to the hot tub, but what can you do. They even offered me water bottles for the trip home. And the snacks and punch in the lobby were nice.

I took my family -- daughter, son-in-law, and two young grandsons -- to Disneyland for three days and nights. We were on a tight budget and found the Park Vue Inn perfectly suited to our needs.  The breakfast was a full breakfast and the light supper fully adequate for our needs. The food was served buffet style, and, while not gourmet, the quality was fine. Having a small frig in the room was a great help since we could store our healthy snacks and lunch foods.  The location couldn't have been better: directly across the street from the Disneyland entrance. We could come and go throughout the day without effort, a real boon when mid-day naps were essential.   The staff of the hotel were pleasant and helpful; the room clean and the beds comfortable. All of us stayed in one room,

Although this isn't the most modern hotel, the location was fabulous and the hotel was in good repair. Particularly good was the room configuration of having the shower separate from the handbasin area. The location was convenient when we all got soaked on the Splash Mountain ride and we could go back to our room quickly, change clothes and return to Disneyland. Also, having just spent a week in New York, the laundry facilities were appreciated. We found the rooms and dining room to be clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. We highly recommend this hotel especially for families.

Older hotel, but neat and clean.  No bugs nor roaches noted, even at 3 am with flashlight.  Included is light breakfast and light dinner on top floor patio.  Food was fair, but free.  Everyone had smiles on their faces.  Mattresses comfortable, blankets had some holes.  Had microwave and cold mini-fridge in room.  Pantene 2-1 shampoo.  Corner room was quiet at night.  Five minutes walk across street into park doors.  Very convenient.  Will stay again because they have bunk beds which are nice.

Summary Heading: Park Vue is our new standard hotel for Disneyland visits
Summary: Ok, a delayed review post but... can you say Pride of Ownership? First time here, fantastic, everyone that works there was super nice, the even called the room 2 times during our 6 day stay to see if everything was ok. The morning breakfast staff is amazing, I don't know how they keep cheerful faces with all the rude, selfish guests grabbing at food. I stopped and talked to a couple of the employees, Olga is a great lady, Karen one of the "greeters" for the breakfasts or afternoon receptions, is super nice and fun to talk with. Room was great, clean, comfortable beds. On this trip we actually tried 2 different rooms and they were both nice. The rooms had pretty new looking carpet, most impressed with the bathrooms, they just totally looked and smelled clean, nothing was in need

Summary Heading: New Year's at Park Vue Inn
Summary: The great ratings are well deserved. This hotel definitely has the best location in Anaheim; directly across the street from the main Disneyland entrance and next to the 24 hour IHOP. I chose this hotel for the location, but they also offered a great nightly rate for this peak period.  Our room was on the second floor at the back of the property. No lifts so had to carry our suitcases up one flight of stairs, but not too bad. Rooms are simple and motel-like, but have everything you need - microwave, coffee maker, air conditioning and a great range of toiletries. We had a room with 2 x queen beds (although we only used one). Very comfortable. In fact we slept so well we missed using our Magic Morning Disneyland entry!  The complimentary breakfast had a nice range and was kept

For all the factors combined together as proximity to DL, free breakfast & light dinner provided as well as nice touches of free flow of drinks & coffee throughout the day with big chunky cookies as well, this motel is hard to beat. The rooms are very clean & they are just as you see on the photos. We were pleasantly surprised by the fruit & wine basket upon entry to our room. The view to the Fireworks at night adds to the Spectacular touch of Park Vue!!

We just got back from our 5 day trip to Disney. The Park Vue Inn is definitely a prime location -only a few minutes walk to the gates of Disneyland.  The room was great for our family of 5 with 2 queens and the bunk beds. Although we left a generous tip for the cleaning staff each day when we returned to the room we found coffee spills still on the counter and garbage not cleared away and a few other minor things.  We overlooked this since we figured we had received a good deal on the room and weren't expecting 5 star service.   The breakfast was good but it would be nice to have more fruits and maybe some granola. We found it to be a bit crowded in the breakfast room and we had to sit outside which was not the most ideal place to be since it was cold the few days we were there.

We stayed in the 2 bedroom room with 3 queen beds for 8 nights and couldn't fault anything. Free parking which is great if you have a hire car, and we used it as a base to explore all of Los Angeles. Had one problem with the hot water system which was fixed within the hour. Clean, friendly and whilst the quality of the breakfasts was so-so it was free, so can't complain. Couldn't do a week of the food but plenty of family style places nearby.  Highly recommended

Park Vue Inn is a amazing hotel. Closest hotel to Disneyland. Welcome baskets, fantastic helpful staff offering cakes and fresh bottles of water daily. Big comfy beds and clean rooms. Breakfast and dinner provide was simple, satifying a great pleasure to find and have daily. A gift shop on premises as well as a pool and laundry and a Cold Stone Ice creamery on sight with 10% off for guests. This hotel can't be faulted. Every thing was perfect and staff outstanding. Will recommend to all our friends and will stay here again ourselves if we go back to Usa. Thanks guys for a wonderful stay and a pleasant experience.

Besides the BEST LOCATION there is it is like one big family.  Very friendly & great for families.  They have a variety of different rooms & ones that even sleep 6 which is hard to find.  I go with kids so we usually get 2 queens & a bunk bed or a queen & bunk.   There is a mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker (with coffee/hot chocolate, creamers etc), blow dryer, WiFi, free parking, continental breakfast hot/cold, social hour (nightly snacks) & in the lobby there is always coffee, hot chocolate, water, juice & fruit available.  In the morning they have breakfast breads, afternoon mini-muffins & evening hot baked cookies. We have been coming for the last year since we have season passes to Disney.  They are very accommodating for special needs.  I have a scooter that I need to

Absolute prime, closest location to Disneyland entrance! Lovely food basket and very  Perfect for families as you can come and go to Disneyland for some "time out".  Rooms are very quiet, good size and the beds comfortable.  Value for money is excellent.  The breakfast is ok, but some healthier options would be great as well (more fruit).  The housekeeping and Front Desk staff were wonderful, very courteous and friendly. We would definately stay again for the relaxed way to spend time at Disneyland by being able to come back to the room during the day.
Again, Park Vue Inn was great.  It was just a quick weekend and everything was perfect.  And then asking for a taxi back the airport they provided a Lincoln.  (standard)   Everything was clean!!

Right across the street from Disneyland/California Adventure.  Room was clean, mattress comfortable, water was hot.  1 small problem was taken care of promptly and to our satisfaction.  Breakfast was more than a continental, hot and cold food items.  We were able to park there before check in, so saved the cost of parking at Disneyland.  The staff was helpful and pleasant.  We will stay there again.  The gift basket was a nice surprise!

Stayed here 1/9/12 to 1/12/12. Room was fine, not huge but definitely adequate. Beds were comfy and housekeeping was efficient. The breakfast was good enough--wouldn't call it a gourmands delight, but there was quite a variety and definitely sufficient quantity. Staff was always pleasant and courteous. We had brought food for lunches and stored them in the fridge in the hotel room. It was pleasant to be able to leave the parks for a bit, walk across the street to eat a simple lunch without having to pay an arm and a leg. We even brought a few things to zap in the room's microwave. The fresh fruit and wine in the room again was a nice touch. I would most definitely stay there again!!

If you are like us, we always want a nice, clean, well managed hotel to stay.  Besides having all that, the main reason to choose this particular hotel is the fact that it literally is RIGHT across the street from the main entrance to Disneyland!  You walk out of the driveway of the Inn and you are right at the crosswalk into Disneyland!!! Next you will find clean, nice rooms, a very attentive staff, and a welcome basket of fresh fruit, water and wine.  Every day you will find a great breakfast to get your day started and end with a nice light dinner!  These 2 meals save you a TON of money when you have hungry mouths to feed, not to mention the convenience when you are either excited to start the day or so tired you can't even think about where to eat! There is free parking, a

We traveled to the Park Vue Inn 1/6/12-1/9/12. The hotel was great, the rooms were clean and the staff was always helpful. We had some issues with locking keys in the rooms (had 2 rooms) and the staff was right there to open doors and issue new keys. The gift basket with fruit, water, & wine was a nice touch (the wine was cheap, but the thought was great!). I cannot complain about the breakfast. We have stayed at the Candy Cane Inn, which was TOO far of a walk with little kids and not a great breakfast selection and we've stayed at the BW park place inn, which has a horrific breakfast at the Captain Kidds buffet. Park Vue was the perfect hotel for the combination of location and food. They called everyday to ensure that our stay was perfect and ask what else they could do to

You might think all the reviews are overrated, but no, everyone is right! This place is exactly what everyone describes! If you want a 5 star bussines hotel and not going to Disneyland then this is not the place, otherwise you do yourself a disservice by not staying here! It is obvious this is a family owned hotel with owners and employees who still have pride in their work and who make you feel right at home! We like staying in the rooms towards the back even if it makes for a bit longer walk to the breakfast/dining room or to the front entrance. Noise from the main street is minimal and everyone is asked to be quiet in consideration of others. Rooms are clean, tidy and stocked, all staff is friendly and very helpful and parking is free. Any request you make, if there is a

Well were do I start. Well very noise floor poorly made building. Pool was not heated well. The TV and furniture was old and wore out.As food the meals they offeris low end perfect for little kids, not room on the deck,can't move around well. I would not pay the price for this place.

After a long day dragging 2 young kids around Disneyland, imagine then having to get a shuttle or a bus back to your hotel.  Not here!  Walk out the gates of Disneyland, past all those poor tired souls & into your hotel room.  Clean, basic but everthing you need is in the room, our kids loved the bunk bed.  Each night when we came back the room was tidied allowing us to dump kids into bed & then indulge in the ice cream from Cold Stone!  The staff were very helpful, especially given our odd hours of arrival & departure.  Breakfast was provided (outdoor eating during winter mornings can be a bit fresh) & the selection was good.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay off property
Summary: We have stayed here at least 5 times over the years.  It is the place we choose when we are not staying on property.  You cannot beat the location.  The walk is actually shorter than staying at the resort hotels.  IHop in parking lot as well as a gift shop.  Other eating places within close walking distance.  Rooms are small, but always clean.  Staff is always great.  Parking can be tight, we usually do not move the car once we get a parking spot.

We stayed here for the first time Christmas Eve thru the 27th and had a Wonderful time. We arrived finding a very nice wine gift basket that we used to celebrate are children's 30th Birthday our 3yr old granddaughter loved the treats.  The room was 2 bedroom 3beds and large, always neat, and clean. The breakfast, drinks/snacks in the office & dinner at 5pm were good, well maintained and greatly appreciated. (only wish the pre-made scrambled egg/cheese omelet could be improved everything else was good) The hotel location is PERFECT, and both IHop and Cold Stone up front added to our comfort.  The staff was very friendly and helpful. The attendant checked free parking was also very appreciated. We look forward to staying here again and highly recommend this for families going to

This is the ideal location for anyone going to Disneyland. You literally can't get closer unless you stay onsite. It IS across the street from the park. A nice touch is the juice and cookies available around the clock at the front desk. Cold Stone Creamery is located at the front of the hotel and your room key gets you a 10% discount. Free wifi and parking plus a computer in the lobby to use/print from if needed. The room itself is pretty basic motel-ish. The bunk bed is nice for the kids and with fun night lights built in to the wall. The TV needs to be updated badly especially the one in our room which is programmed to turn on to a channel that doesn't work but just displays snow and on about volume 100 so you have to be careful or otherwise it will wake up the kids! The

We absolutely loved our stay at the Park Vue.  The staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and comfortable during our stay.  The free meals and close access to the park cannot be beat!  We will stay there again!

Summary Heading: Great hotel & location - made the visit fun
Summary: The simple fact is you can't beat the location of this hotel. Right across from the entry into Disneyland therefore no worries about parking or transfers so when you have had enough for a while you can get back to your hotel without lining up for a bus. The rooms were large, clean and pretty modern. The breakfast is good and all you need. They even had a simple dinner available which was all we wanted after a day in the park.

The room was clean and right across the entrance from Disneyland.  Between the free meals, water bottles and free parking it makes it worth it to pay a little bit more than to stay at a cheaper hotel that is further away.

Checked in Jan 1st 2012 and checked out Jan 4th. My family booked this hotel because of the free parking, free breakfast and the reviews of the staff.   The room was clean although a strong chemical smell. We always bring a candle to take the room smell away. We had two queen bed room that was very spacious but really needed a small table instead of a desk.   Our biggest complaint was the hot water never got hot (just luke warm) and went cold rather quickly. We voiced concern at the end of our stay so they could have it fixed for the next guest.  Second complaint was the free breakfast. They had pancakes, waffles, donuts, biscuits and gravy fruit, and omelettes. Our problem was the omelette. The were cheese omelettes but the cheese was Cheez Whiz. It had to be that. It has a

This hotel was perfect for our family with a queen and a bunk bed for our 2 and 4 year old.  The room was a little small, but was just right for us.  They have a heated pool and jacuzzi that was great for nights.  The staff was extra friendly and helpful and made the stay even more enjoyable.  The continental breakfast and dinner weren't anything fancy, but saved us a lot of money and there was always something for everyone in our family to enjoy.  You can't beat the convenience to Disneyland and they have a small store that sells $.99 water so you can buy some before going into the park.  There is also a Cold Stone which had excellent service located in front of the hotel.  They also have a computer and printer available for guest use.  Overall, it was a great experience and

Summary Heading: Great spot to rest after Disneyland
Summary: This old-fashioned California hotel is perfectly located by the gates to Disneyland.  The hotel is clean and comfortable, though nothing fancy.  The prices are good.  When the kids were small, we used to come back to the room for a nap in the middle of the day.  It made a big difference, and we never once had one of those screaming, overtired kids you see in Disneyland in the late afternoon. One warning:  do NOT eat in any of the restaurants nearby on South Harbor Blvd.  They are uniformly horrible.  Main street Disney, although overpriced, is a better bet.

This was our second time at the Park Vue Inn and it is usually the first place I look for availability, you can't beat the location.  We stayed in a queen room with bunk beds.  It was a lot smaller than I had anticipated and was very cramped with 5 us in in the room.  We needed to use a rollaway bed and we had to fold it up each morning as you just can't walk around it when it's down.  We don't spend much time in the room so it really didn't bother us.  Room was clean and the parking was no problem.  The free refreshments in the lobby, free breakfast (which beats many of the other Harbor hotels "free breakfast" by far), free wifi and very helpful front desk staff all make this our top choice.  I hope they continue to offer these amenities, it makes all the difference and

Summary Heading: Good Stay for the Right Price
Summary: Park Vue Inn is a true "Diamond in the rough".  You can't get any closer to the front gates of Disneyland. Rooms are clean & affordable.  Recent rennovations removed the room's table. Could use it back.  Enlarged their continental breakfast offerings and has an evening social hour.  Returning guests used to get a nice price reduction, but like everything else, prices have increased.  Heated pool year-round.

Summary Heading: Must stay here for your DisneyLand trip
Summary: Great Experience, Highly Recommend.  Negatives Small Room overall.  Small Bathroom with single sink, Small towels.  No separate table in the room.  Positives Free snacks and drinks in lobby on check-in. Free fruit basket with bottle of wine in room Staff is really friendly and fun. Bunk Beds!!! (3 separate beds in 1 room)  Free BreakFast, very good!!  Waffle Iron for fresh waffles, cereal, danishes, doughnuts, scrambled eggs, cheese omelets, hard-boiled eggs, toast, milk, orange juice, bacon, sausage, biscuits with sausage gravy, cottage cheese, fresh fruit. Free Dinner!!! They call it social hour, not dinner, It includes mac-n-cheese, nachos, chicken nuggets, hamburgers, hotdogs, potato salad, water/lemonade. Location is closer than Disneyland Hotel or Paradise Pier.  it's
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are pleased to have had so many positives apossed to negatives. Please know that we are working on the negatives and hope to have fixed these issues before your next visit. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn as your hotel.

Summary Heading: Directly across the street from the Dland crosswalk!!!
Summary: ***A little late for my review.  We stayed back in September 2011***  We were pleasantly surprised with the Park Vue!!!  This place was the perfect location and value!!!  I mean I like staying at the Disneyland hotels for the experience but this place was excellent!!!  It is the closest motel from the crosswalk!!!    The Park Vue has a complimentary happy hour which is great but don't expect anything fancy.  It's nice to come back and have a quick bite to eat and go back to the park if you don't want to spend the extra $$$ for snacks at the park.  Happy hour is seriously no frills.  They have canned chicken noodle soup, bagged salads, and chips.  My kids didn't really care where the food came from, they just ate it and were happy.    Breakfast is somewhat no frills too but hey,
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad to know that your stay was great. We thank you for giving us your opinion on the Food we serve. Please know that we will be reviewing the menu and making changes for the better. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn as your hotel. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel many time for the past decade with my family and we are always very happy with the service and especially the location right across the street from Disneyland! The hotel has been renovated with newer rooms, beds, and definitely amenities. Park Vue Inn is family friendly with a pool, breakfast, and dinner. I would recommend this hotel to any family taking a trip to Disneyland. One thing to note for management - need slightly cleaner towels, especially next to the jacuzzi. Bathroom seemed to have nicer, cleaner, fluffier towels than the towels in the basket next to the jacuzzi.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. It is always our goal to provide a home away from home. We will replace these towels by the Jacuzzi with new cleaner fluffier ones. Please come visit soon. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn.

Summary: This hotel got a five star rating from my family.  Not only was the location perfect for us but the service was outstanding.  The accommodation was very clean and to a good standard, and I was impressed to see hotel staff even cleaning the airconditioning ventilation.  Breakfast was very good and Tony Roma's was just a short stroll away.  We would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: So close to Disneyland! So clean! Such great value!
Summary: I did a great amount of research before booking this hotel. I read hundred of reviews and looked at maps and decided to book here. How happy I was that I did! This hotel was so clean, and so close to Disneyland!! It is directly opposite the entrance! It's quite a walk to the actual gates of Disneyland, but this is the closest hotel. And so much cheaper than the Disneyland hotels! We arrived to a gift basket in our room filled with wine and other goodies. There is an iHop next door, but breakfast and dinner are provided. The buffet style meals were delicious. The staff were very friendly. Due to the cleanliness, value for money and fantastic location, I would recommend this hotel to every one of my close friends and every stranger I meet!
This is a very good hotel conveniently right across the  street from the Disneyland walking entrance in between an iHop and Denny's for easy meal planning.

Summary Heading: A good place to stay at Disneyland
Summary: I give this motel 5 stars for service and location if you are going to Disneyland especially with kids.  It is across the street from the main gate.  You don't need to ride a bus.  You just walk home at night and that is really good with tired, cranky kids.   Cons:  The Park Vue is a older 2 story motel.  If you want to sleep in, you will hear the excited pitter-patter of little feet as they scurry off to Disneyland.  However, since this is a small motel, there are few guests so the disturbance isn't too annoying.  I don't believe they have an elevator for guests on the second floor.  Pros:  The service at this motel is excellent.  They cater to your needs.  Just ask and within minutes it's taken care of.  We forgot toothpaste and they brought it right up, needed an extra

The Park Vue Inn is located right across the street from the Disneyland entrance. You are greeted as you drive in by a very nice parking attendent, check-in was fast and easy and we found a basket with fresh fruit, bottled water and a bottle of wine in the room with balloons. (It was our anniversary.) A surprise and a very nice touch, I thought.  Breakfast is included with the room, as is a "kid-friendly" dinner. A real money saver if you are traveling with little ones. Parking is free, also.  Next time I visit the park, I would certainly stay again.

I booked the hotel for 3 nights stay after reading all the fabulous reviews of the hotel but I must say that I'm quite disappointed.  The sound-proofing of the room was quite bad. My room was located on the ground level and on the first day while I was there, I had to retire early due to jetlag (after flying over 16 hours).  Unfortunately, my family and I woke up to the noise of kids and adults chattering away going back to their rooms after (I supposed) was the theme park visits, and my family couldn't sleep very well after that.  Every morning around 6+am in the morning we woke up to kids stomping and running along the corridor.   The beds were too high, and too soft for my comfort.  Even my daughter of age 11 commented the same.  The towels were also a little too thin.  On

I have been to many hotels on this strip before but this was my first time at Park Vue Inn.  This was by far the best motel I have stayed in.  From the first moment you drive up you are greeted by a very nice parking attendent and parking is free by the way.  The lobby was very festive as it was a week before Christmas and the front desk employees were very nice and had us checked in very quickly.  There was ample parking and we got a spot right below our room that was right next to stairs.  The room was very large compared to other places.  We had a Three Queen room.  It had two queens in the main room with the bathroom and vanity area and then had a door that lead into a separate room with another queen.  Each room had its own TV and air conditioner/heater.  The room also had

Just stayed 2 nights and it was my daughters 5 Birthday. What a surprise to see not only balloons for her, but gifts as well. Over the top. The breakfast was great!! Rooms clean, bunk beds very cool. Great location!! Anyone that anything negative to say about this hotel have serious problems. I generally stay at 4-5 star resorts. Service was as good

Summary Heading: My only choice when I return :)
Summary: I really truly enjoyed this hotel. It is actually set up like a motel, which I found pleasant in such a warm climate. The service in the area is notoriously poor, but the staff at this hotel were all super friendly & helpful & the lobby is always set up with complimentary cold drinks, coffee, & cookies~a very nice touch upon arrival (as was the unexpected gift basket with wine in the room).   The value was incredible as the room price includes a continental breakfast with different hot items every day; as well as an evening appetizer buffet (again with a different hot item every day so it is basically a meal). The pool is located in the middle of the parking lot which struck me as a bit odd when I first saw it, but it was actually fabulous! It meant that it was private, & the

Stayed here for 5 nights last week and found everything to be as stated in reviews and online. Can't get a better location and the hotel was clean and functional. As somewhere to use as a base while spending the days at the parks etc then its fine. The breakfast is ok and the social hour very useful for kids. There are also plenty of places to eat within 200 yards so if you dont like the simple breakafst you can stuff your face elsewhere. Its not the Ritz but you pay for what you get, and the staff were always helpful. As for the noise issue its not too bad, after all its opposite Disney so what do you expect?  A monastery? All in all good value and hard to beat for the price.

I can't believe the good reviews on here to be honest.  We stayed 5 days after 2 months travelling around America and Canada and it was the most over priced, horrible place by a long way.  The ONLY good thing about it is the location - but there are lots of others just as close along South Harbor Blvd.  I would definitely check out others in this location, but AVOID this one if you want any quiet at all.    First off, we have a noisy nearly 3 year old and we are tolerant of kid noise, and this place has a lot of it!  But it also has pool noise until about 10pm, breakfast starts at 7am so there are people running and banging along the verander, the cleaners are very noisy with walkie talkies too, which disturbed my son's afternoon nap (so much for the convenience of coming back

The hotel itself is nothing special. Having stayed at other nearby hotels, such as the Doubletree, the Park Vue is nothing more than a nice motel in the end and it lacks any kind of extra comfort, decor or luxury.  The staff was attentive, if distracted - the vibe I got was "Here is your key, c'ya!". The rooms are basic, with comfy beds and spacious, but not much of a decor at all - the floors, curtains and doors were of the most basic standards. The pool is tiny and in the middle of the parking lot (we never used it).  All this said, the walk from the hotel to the park and back is worth all of it. There was a huge sense of relief in knowing that the hotel was right outside the main gates. I would stay here again just for the fact that is reasonably priced, clean and right in

Summary Heading: Such a great hotel for a trip to Disneyland!
Summary: I had read through a ton of reviews about where to stay with my 3 year and 10 month old for a quick trip to Disneyland.  This place got a lot of positive reviews but I also read the negatives.  What a GREAT hotel! We originally wanted a suite so we could put the kids to bed early but the bunk bed sold us on Park Vue.  And for the first time ever, our 3 year old put herself to sleep because she was so excited about the bunk bed. :) We have stayed in a lot of motels (and 5 star hotels) and this place far exceeded our expectations.  It was clean, comfortable and the staff was very friendly.  The welcome basket was a wonderful surprise and the continental breakfast was great for a motel! I loved that the shampoo in room was Pantene and my husband said the coffee was good. The best

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn for seven nights.  We have stayed at several other places near Disneyland, including the Paradise Pier.  The Park Vue was the best by far.  We had the two room three queen suite.  It was large enough for a family of six.  It was a bonus to have a separate room for us adults.  We always had plenty of towels and shampoos.  We celebrated two birthdays while there and were amazed at the large, filled gift bas, balloons, and Coldstone cakes for each child.  The breakfast and dinners were great.  The meals were geared towards kids.  One morning an employee heard me tell my child that they were out of apple juice, and within minutes, it was fixed.  It is great to watch the fireworks from the deck there.  All of the staff were friendly and helpful.  We even

We had a great stay December 4-7. What a wonderful staff - everyone went out of their way to make our visit comfortable. This is a small family style motel - not a 5 star hotel. And for me, that was a good thing. After visiting the Grand Californian and Disneyland Hotel, I have to say that I was very pleased with our decision to stay at Park Vue.  The room was pleasant. The 2 queen room was perfect for the two of us and I really appreciate the fact that they have nice white sheets and no bedspread. It just feels so much cleaner. The cleaning crew was friendly and extremely efficient. Absolutely no complaints. And to top it off, the view of the Disneyland fireworks from the room was impressive.  I hadn't planned on taking advantage of the food offerings, but the breakfast was
For the price you can't beat the location.   Rooms were clean, service was great, and included breakfast and dinner.

Summary Heading: Pefect location across from the main entrance to Disneyland/California Adventure
Summary: I have to say the hotel management has done a great job in improving the rooms and all the amenties provided since I last stayed here over 5 years ago. Clean and comfortable with an ample free breakfast and dinner, I really can't say anything bad about stay here.

We've stayed at this Inn many times, we're Disney passholders and each time it seems to get even better. Location as stated couldn't be better for Disney, the room was fresh and clean and the welcome basket is just the nicest touch, I don't know anyone else in this price bracket that does that. I have found some of the service to be spotty, some are just friendlier and more helpful than others, but it's always ok. However Fernando is just helpfulness personified and always has a smile and this time Karen was excellent too, thank you, it adds to our whole trip. The breakfast just keeps getting better, my kids LOVE making their own waffles, I love the fact that there are hard boiled eggs and fruit as well as waffles....parking is brilliant, the staff are SO helpful with that, the

We spent 4 nights at Park Vue over the Thanksgiving weekend and have nothing but good things to say. From the warm chocolate chip cookies in the lobby, which we made sure to check regularly for consistency to the welcome gift basket in the room, everything was perfect. The complimentary breakfast was far beyond expectations of a typical continental breakfast. I mean, make your own waffles?? The evening get together was a nice light meal but was really disappointed  to have missed the Thanksgiving meal which I heard was very good!! Free parking, friendly staff, bunk beds for the kids and walking distance to the park. What else could you want for a great price??

Summary Heading: OUTSTANDING SERVICE!!  We stay every year!!
Summary: We have been staying at the Park Vue for years...we use them every time we go to Disneyland.  They've raised their rates considerably over the years and if they continue raising then they will eventually be out of our budget range.  HOWEVER, they do offer a free breakfast, and now a free "social hour" dinner.  We take advantage of both and for 3 of us even if we went down the road to McDs we'd be spending another $45 or so per day on food (though I should subtract out the tips I leave).  We have found a lovely fruit and wine basket in our room the last few visits (for being return guests), and this visit there was an "over-the-top" gift basket for our son who was turning 7...balloons, coloring book, puzzle, rubber stamp pens, etc. etc.  REALLY sweet.  My only complaints (this
This hotel is clean and close to Disneyland.  You must be an early riser because it can get a bit noisy.  You can not beat the location.

We spent 7 nights at Park Vue before Thanksgiving and I can't speak highly enough of it.  We arrived late on a Sunday night, after a bit of a disastrous flight and shuttle experience.  The staff made us feel welcome from the get go, had us checked in quickly and the welcome basket was a lovely touch.  We had a room downstairs with two queens, which was perfect for me and my mum.  Being on the opposite side from the breakfast room meant we didn't get much noise from overhead which was good, but I think if you were underneath the communal areas it would have been hard. The included breakfast was much better than I had expected and we used that facility everyday.  Saved us a bundle on buying breakfasts out!  We did have the free dinner once as well, and it was just as good, but we

This is our 7th year in a row staying at the Park Vue Inn. It is located directly across the street from the entrance to Disneyland. We arrived, parked our car and it never moved until we left and the parking is free. They have made numerous improvements to the rooms since we first started staying there bringing the rooms up to a quality that compares with some four star hotels we have stayed in. Since our stay last year they have added a body wash, shampoo, and conditioner dispenser to the shower/tub and installed new shower heads. Their rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. They offer a free breakfast which varies from day to day. To be honest it isn't the greatest free breakfast offered at a hotel/motel but it has improved over the years, you can't beat the price and it

Summary Heading: Good hotel when visiting disneyland park
Summary: We stayed there the week before thanksgiving 2011 for 3 nights. The hotel is just opposite to the park and walking with the kid on a stroller to the park is very convenient. They offer AAA discount. The free breakfast is very impressive (bagels, cereals, milk, juice, bread, tast, eggs etc.,). Parking is free, and so is wireless internet. They also have free social hour in the evening (light snacks), which is helpful for having something quick in the evening. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Included microwave and refrigerator is a plus. staffs are friendly. we could walk in the afternoon to the hotel so our kid can have nap and go back to the park in the evening. There is IHOP right next door and a Indian buffet and PF chang a block away. The only issue was the walls are thin

On a recent trip to Disneyland, we stayed at the Park Vue Inn. We stayed in a room with a queen bed and a bunk bed. The room was not very big, especially for four people, but it was adequate. This is an older motel style inn. Don't expect luxury.... Expect motel.  Despite all this we thought it offered good value.  Park Vue is located as close to Disney as you can get without actually being in the park. We literally just had to cross the street to go to the parks. They have free parking and even allowed us to leave our car there all day on the day we checked out.   We took advantage of the free breakfast during our stay and found it to be a real time saver. It offered the usual breakfast fare such as cereal, bread products, waffles, eggs and other hot items. The lobby always has

Summary Heading: Park Vue Inn is the best!
Summary: Stayed with family there for 5 nights.... GREAT place to stay, I'm already telling everyone how wonderful the hotel is... CRAWLING distance to Disneyland, it's so close to main gates that one could really crawl to see Mickey and the gang... clean rooms, excellent breakfast, good showers, free parking and wifi....

This was our first stay at Park Vue, but our 3rd time in Anaheim.  We have finally found our perfect favorite hotel!  With complimentary beverages in the lobby, meal vouchers for a breakfast buffet, and a light supper, the value is wonderful!  The staff was friendly and welcoming, and our room surprised us with a complimentary gift basket.  The room with queen bed and bunk beds was great fun for my granddaughter.  Free parking for our local family driver and walk to Disneyland across the street made getting around super easy. We will definitely stay here on our next return visit, and recommend it to others heading to Disneyland.

We just returned from a 2 night stay here and it was wonderful. The location could not be better - it is right across the street from the main entrance to Disneyland. We came with our 5 year old and 1 year old in a stroller and the walk to the main gate was maybe 10 minutes. Fantastic!  When you arrive, they greet you with cookies and fruit as well as lemonade. Nice! The staff was so busy but they did a nice and quick check in.    Our room had 2 queen beds, a mini fridge, coffee maker, and to our surprise, a nice basket filled with wine, fruit, wine bottle opener and a very sincere welcome note. It really made us feel welcome. The furniture in the room looked a little worn and the carpeting was a little drab but honestly, it felt very comfortable and was super clean. The heater

Summary Heading: Park Vue Inn at Disneyland rocks!
Summary: We spent Thanksgiving at Disneyland, and used Park Vue Inn as our base.  The room was clean, with 2 firm queen beds.  A gift basket of wine and fruit was waiting for us, along with a personalized greeting.  T here were also vouchers for a very generous breakfast each morning and a filling social hour each evening.  They even offered a turkey dinner with all the fixings for free on Thanksgiving.  We were steps away from Disneyland.  I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Great Location , Clean and lots of extras
Summary: Just returned from California and a sleepover at the Park Vue, while visiting Disneyland, great service, lots of nice touches welcome basket, breakfast , light supper, and super nice people that run the place, thanks for the info from the manager he was great to chat with and wanted feed back to make things evern better, families check out this hotel, comes with lots of special things, kids birthdays they make them feel special.... Went with Friends that had stayed at this resort many times with there families .. thanks again for the great stay

Summary Heading: Excellent value; less than 4-minute walk to D-land!
Summary: Yes, we timed the walk.  From the hotel lobby to the park entrance the walk is 3 min and 40 sec.  Our primary reason for choosing this hotel is the closeness to the parks.  We stayed before at Disney's Grand Californian - yes, the special park entrance to CA Adventures is nice but you're paying 3 times the price.  Keep in mind that the other Disneyland hotels are at least a 10-15 min walk to the main park entrance (neither are connected to the parks).  Park Vue is a simple, motel-style lodging (2 floors, all room doors face out, no elevators).  Parking is included in your room rate as well as buffet breakfast and light dinners.  Breakfast included toast, danishes, cereals, make-it-yourself waffles, whole fruit, eggs, sausages, yogurt, coffee, milk, juices - straightforward and

I just returned from my sixth stay at the Park Vue Inn and, as usual, everything was excellent.  The location can't be beat, since you're only one crosswalk and about a five minute walk away from the main gates of Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure.  This short walk back on tired feet at the end of the day (or for afternoon naps) is wonderful, and you can head back to your room with one of the fresh-baked cookies that are usually available in the lobby. The rooms are super clean and comfortable (the mattresses seemed new and especially comfortable this trip) and a 'welcome basket' and thank you note await you in your room.  The staff is always genuinely friendly and helpful.  When you arrive early to check-in but your room isn't quite ready yet, there's a secure room
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are very happy to know that your stay was great. We hope that you will come visit soon.

Summary Heading: Can't get a better location with kids!
Summary: Can't say enough good things about this place!  We have 2 young kids so the location (right across the street from the entrance of Disneyland) couldn't have been better.  No traffic, parking, walking miles and wasting precious minutes of ride time!  Plus we could take a quick walk back for naps and then return in the evening.  Enjoyed the hot tub and heated pool after a long day on our feet.  Great breakfast to start the day.  Our girls LOVED the bunkbeds!  Even had a personalized welcome basket in our room when we arrived.  We couldn't have asked for a better place for our first family trip to Disneyland . . . and we will be back to the Park Vue Inn as soon as we can!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are gald to have been able to provide a great first Disney trip. We hope to be of service to you soon.

Summary: We're Disneyland regulars and Park Vue is our place to stay.  It's just across the street so when the kids get tired we can come back and nap - no long Anaheim Resort Transit bus ride.  The staff are friendly and the rooms are clean.  And they have bunkbeds in some of the rooms which kids love.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Thank you for being a loyal Guest. We will see you soon.

Summary: Excellent location - just across the road from Disneyland; excellent staff - friendly but not over the top -  helpful and courteous, and (importantly) housekeeping was reliable and thorough; great breakfast with good variety. Loved the 'welcome basket' delivered to our room.  An excellent family-friendly hotel that also makes couples feel welcome. Have stayed there before several times, and will definitely visit again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are very happy that we were able to provide a clean, confortable home away from home, with great customer service. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: The reason why I only gave it an average rating was because of the size of our room. We had the queen bed with bunk bed room and it was so small that we had nowhere to open our 4 pieces of luggage or to store them!!! That was my only complaint, the rest of our stay was good. The hotel is in a perfect location close to the main entrance of Disneyland, the breakfast had tons of choices, and the food was good, plus having the lemonade on the front counter was a bonus!! We did not stop in for the snacks at happy hour except one night when it was closing just to see and my son had some chicken noodle soup, so he was happy, but I don't know how the other food was.  Would I stay here again? Probably, but would stay in a larger room.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize for the smaller room. Not all of this room type is that size. We are in the process of changing the room all together. We thank you for your patience in this and hope that you would give us another oportunity to serve you.

Summary: This hotel is ideally located directly outside the gate of Disneyland.  This privately owned hotel provides excellent customer service and blows the chains away. The rooms were clean and nicely sized.  The layout in the rooms with the two beds was convenient with the sink outside of the bathroom with the shower and toilet.  The breakfast and afternoon snack beat expectations.  This is our second time at this hotel and am happy to refer them to friends and others.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We will continue to work hard at providing the highest level of customer service. We are very happy to have been able to provide a great stay, and hope to be of service to you soon.

Summary: This is an excellent location for visiting Disneyland.  It is right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland and next door to IHOP!  When your little ones have had enough walking from Disneyland, it is so nice to just have to walk that short distance to the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. The short distance to Disney is one of the great reasons why our guests stay at Park Vue Inn. We are glad to have been able to serve you and your family. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Do not stay on the first floor
Summary: This is our third time staying at this hotel.  In the past we had stayed on the second floor.  This time I requested the first floor because they do not have elevators and we would be using a stroller everyday.  I have to say, that was a huge mistake!  This is the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed at.  I am used to hearing some overhead noises when staying on lower floors but this hotel must have poor structural issues and no insulation!  It was horrid!  Our wake and sleep time was made by our upstairs neighbors!  I swear it was as if elephants were above us!  We couldn't sleep whenever they were awake due to all of the noise. In the past we had never had issues with housekeeping but this time we did.  We had to repeatedly go to the front desk for caffeinated coffee.  They would
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize for the inconveniences. We are working on the noise level around the property. As we are so close to Disney it is sometimes hard to keep the kids from being loud. We hope that this does not prevent you from returning. We hope that other than the noise your stay was great. The housekeepers also have been informed of your review and will be sure that each guest room has the appropriate amount of amenities. We appreciate your feedback as this helps us to improve our service. We hope that you will give us an opportunity to serve you in the future.

Summary: We have stayed at the Park Vue Inn many, many times while visiting Disneyland.  We have been pleased each time.  Our visit in November of 2011 was no exception.  The staff were friendly and helpful from check-in to check-out and everything in between.  The breakfast is great and much beyond coffee and pastries.  It enabled my children to get a great start to a fun and busy day in Disneyland and California Adventure.  The thing we appreciate most about staying here is the location.  It is located directly across from the main Disneyland Resort entrance.  It is also located near several restaurants with various choices and price ranges, and I am confident that almost anyone can find something they like that is within walking distance.  We will definitely stay again!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. The proximity is great but we work hard at providing many extra's and great customer service for our guests. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a Disneyland visit!
Summary: We spent 1 night at the hotel and it was the perfect spot.  We arrived early and were able to park our car and head directly to the park to enjoy our day before checking in at 3.  The hotel is so close to the park entrance we were able to head back for a nap before returning to the park for the evening events.  We sampled the social hour and appreciated the simple food, but it definitely wasn't enough to fill us after a long day of wandering around California Adventures.  Our room was clean and comfortable and we were happy to see the complimentary wine, water and fruit when we checked in.  We would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Glad to have been able to accomidate your early check in. We hope that you would visit again soon. Thanks again.

Summary Heading: A perfect place to stay for a leisurely Disneyland trip
Summary: My expectations were already high for this hotel, (mostly because of the other TripAdvisor reviews), but I was still surprised at how much I enjoyed it. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are clean, the free breakfast is delicious, the rooms rates are very reasonable and the location is absolutely unbeatable. It was a 2 minute walk over to Disneyland--no parking hassles, no traffic to deal with---perfect! I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat. My only complaint is that the mattress I slept on was a tad uncomfortable. But the pros far, far outweigh any cons staying here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize for the bed not being comfortable we are replacing the older beds with new. We hope to be of service to you soon.

Summary Heading: Disneyland....You could not choose a better hotel thanks tripadvisor!
Summary: I did a lot of research before we went to Disney and chose this hotel from tripadvisor reviews. The trouble is no matter what you read, you always wonder if it will be quite as close as they say however this hotel ticked all and I mean all the boxes and more! It WAS just across the road and Yes we saw the fireworks from the Hotel just as the photos showed. I believe the fireworks are usually at the weekend and we stayed Sunday, Monday and Tuesday although it was Halloween Party night so they had fireworks!  Breakfast was very relaxed serve yourself but plenty to eat, no... it wasn't freshly cooked and the eggs came as a small pancake however for the price we thought it was really good. We were only at the hotel for food in the evening once and the food was choice of two
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad to have been of great service to you and yours. We hope to see your soon.

Summary Heading: This place has been perfect for us.
Summary: It's not fancy by any means but if you are spending the day at the park then who cares?  I like the fact if you need a break from the park mid day you can quickly walk to your room from the park and rest up and head back out to spend the rest of the night at the park.

We agree with the others who gave a high grade to this place.  I chose this place based on these good reviews, and my family and I were not disappointed.  We had a nice and simple wine/fruit basket waiting for us in the room.  The service was quick and friendly at the front desk.  The inn is a motel that is a bit dated on the interior, but for the price and the location of being literally right across from the Disney entrance, this was a very minor detail.    More importantly, the room was clean.  The bathroom was clean.  The breakfast was decent.  There were items that satisfied my two pre-teen/teens, my wife, and my brother.  Make your own waffles, scrambled eggs, sausage and juices for the traditional breakfast.  I always have oatmeal and yogurt, and they had this available
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad your stay was great. We have checked our phone system and are replacing any phone's that are not operating. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: The Park Vue Inn worked great for us.  It was nice to be able to park our cars at our hotel on Harbor Blvd and not have to pay for parking.  It helped to be able to walk to/from Disneyland since our group came home in three different waves.  Some reviews I read before my trip said the hotel was noisy.  The hotel has put notices in the rooms and hung signs in the walkways asking people to be quiet and considerate.  We didn't have any trouble with noise.  The breakfast was nice with hot & cold food choices.  We were impressed with the balloon bouquets and coffee mugs that were delivered to celebrate a birthday and a Marine graduation.  We will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. It was our pleasure to be of service. It is our hope to continue to deliver a great place for our guests. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: #1 - absolutely the BEST in terms of location...you cannot beat right across the street access to the entrance of Disneyland!  I loved that we had such a tiny little (just a few minutes) walk when our kiddos were pooped from a day at the park! #2 - service was fantastic!  everyone was very nice, they called a town car for us for the ride to the airport...which was really nice.   #3 - we loved the pool & hot tub, definitely our kids favorite part of the whole trip.  Clean, fun, & we watched the Disneyland fireworks from the hot tub!   #4 - rooms were clean and guests and staff were very considerate!  You can hear people walking outside of the rooms and people talking loudly next door but everyone seemed to understand that and noise was kept to a minimum.  Beds & pillows super
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to know that you had a perfect family getaway. We strive to provide a clean comfortable and affordable home away from home. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: This was the last stop on our whirlwind week in SoCal.  Our party was 2 adults, and 2 kids, age 8 and 15, and we stayed 4 nights. Our room had a queen bed and a bunk bed.  The room was very clean and the queen bed was comfy - didn't try the bunks myself but the kids didn't seem to have any complaints and seemed to sleep well every night. I had wrestled with staying here vs. HoJo (where we were last time) but based on the reviews and the fact that breakfast was included, I decided to give it a try and we will definitely be back.   The people that work here are either the nicest people ever, or really well trained.  So pleasant and helpful.  We did not mention that we were celebrating my niece's birthday but when a member of the staff saw her birthday button from Disneyland, he
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We will continue to do our best to keep the customer service at this level or higher. We are very happy to have made your Niece's Birthday a bit more memerable. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn over many other places to stay. We will see you soon.

Summary: First time at Park Vue Inn. Selected due to proximity, continental breakfast, and online rating. Service was excellent with juice & cookies at front desk, at eating area they always asked if everything was ok, and there was a complimentary basket of fruit, water, and wine in the room. Noise was reasonable, you could hear people in the pool at night. There was excellent temperature control with the heating/cooling unit provided. The breakfasts were good although a bit crowded; we never tried the evening food.  One negative was that many of the towels are really worn out and look like the rags we use at home. The other was the bathroom with toilet/tub - the toilet lid is used as a shelf for a couple of towels and extra toilet paper and looks horrific. They really need to add even
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are upgrading our towels, and are looking into the counter for this stile of bathroom. Thank you again for your suggestions and we hope to see you soon.

Summary: This is my 2nd time staying at the Park Vue Inn.  I brought my 16 year old niece and my 15 year old nephew and we stayed in a Queen with bunk beds. We all slept comfortably and soundly.  The beds may not look fancy, but they are comfortable.  Also it's clean and the food is great for kids.  The evening meal really saved me money since it serves the kind of food my niece likes, and we didn't have to pay for it at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to have been able to accomidate the meals for you. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn. We hope to be of service to you soon.

Summary Heading: Park Vue Inn will always be great in my book!
Summary: Still a great experience and the Relationship Care is warmfelt and very much apprieciated. Thank-you Park Vue Inn!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We will continue to work our hardest to provide a home away from home. We hope to see you soon. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn.

Summary: This is a great hotel to stay in while visiting Disneyland, especially if you want to save money!  The location alone made it very convenient since we had small children and grandparents in our group and had to return to the hotel every afternoon before heading back to the park in the evening. The hotel was very clean, and well stocked. There were gift baskets with a bottle of wine and some fruit in our rooms when we got there, and complimentary juice, coffee, cookies and fruit in the lobby at all hours!  The breakfast is good, much more than the standard continental breakfast:  eggs, bacon/sausage, toast, donuts, pancakes, make-your-own waffles, cereal, bagels, coffee/tea, juice...the only drawback being that you cannot take food to your rooms, so the dining area was a little
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Our Breakfast and Social Hour dinner are a way to help our guests save some money. We like to provide the highest level of customer service. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: What a fantastic choice of accomodation to visit Disney Land. Young grandparents travelling with 2 10year olds. Location of this ideal hotel is right opposite the main gates to Disney Land, which meant not  being dependent on shuttle buses or walking too far on a warm day when every one is tired. Our room was large, beds extremely comfortable, air conditioning worked well and made no noise. Bathroom was big enough, with bath, which is great for those that enjoy. The cleanliness was of a very high standard.  All staff were helpful and cheery.  Breakfast included,  also light dinner, which saved us a lot of money and was great not having to buy takeaway food.  We used the swimming pool every night. Cookies and lemonade available all the time.  There was a basket of fruit and a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are so thankful for your kind words both the employee's and owner's have read this review. Thank you on behalf of all at Park Vue Inn. We hope to be of service to you soon.

Summary: Was a little hesitant about staying in a place we never have stayed before. Husband had a friend that had stayed here and raved about it. It was just the 2 of us so what the heck try something new.  Our room was not ready after a 5 hour drive that is not what you want to hear. Yes we were early but it didn't seem full it was midweek. They did have bottled water at the front desk as well as coffee in the lobby. There were 2 other families waiting for their room as well. Finally got our room,upstairs which in a kid friendly room is a plus. It was basic but in need of updating. Welcome basket nice touch with wine and fruit. Could of been cleaner, bathroom had hair on floor and a dead bug on floor. You get breakfast and a evening snack. Food not to our taste.Even when my kids were
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize for the room not being ready upon check-in. We do have a limmited inventory and are usually always sold out. Many of our guests are from out of the country and don't drive. The parking lot being empty gives the illusion that we are slow. Never the less We do take your comments serious and will work on these subjects which you have mentioned to improve our customer service and property. Thank you again for taking the time to give us a review. It is our hope that you will give us another opportunity to be of service.

Summary: I have stayed at parkvue inn 2 times and a couple other hotels very close to parkvue inn and I will definitely  stay at parkvue,  hotel is very clean , and very close to the park,  We had a wonderful stay, i wish I could afford to come more often.  thanks
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy that you had a wonderful stay. We hope that you will visit us again soon.

Summary: Warm staff, clean rooms, perfect location and not only was there a continental breakfast the next morning, they included dinner the night of our stay!  Simple fare (mac & cheese, chicken nuggets, etc. the night we were there), but fairly good - kids would love it! We didn't have a reservation, but received a reasonable rate.... wow - free parking, free dinner, free breakfast and you simply walk across the street to Disneyland/California Adventure (#1 reason we chose Park Vue Inn)... what more could a traveler on a budget ask for? The room was nice.  The usual expected noises from a busy family place... you do hear the excited kids running around, but hey... it's Disneyland! This was our first stay at Park Vue Inn, but it won't be our last.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your understanding with the excited kids going to Disney every day. Our goal is to continue to provide these little things that we believe go a long way on your vacation. We hope to see you soon. Glad to have been of service to you.

Summary: This was our fourth trip to Disney and our fourth stay at the Park Vue.  Our first stay was in a single queen with bunk bed and we graduated this year to the 2 queen suite.  The new beds were amazing and we were thrilled with the extra space and television (this was nice due to the park closing at 8pm).  Customer Service is nop-notch, from Fernando at the front desk to Karen, our morning greeter at breakfast we truly felt like we were a part of their family.    Morning breakfast has much to choose from and the evening Social Hour was a nice break from park food.  Maintenance and Cleaning staff take great pride in their work and it shows. We also enjoy knowing that there is on site laundry - allows us to pack lighter so we have more room for souvenirs to come home. We have
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear that you fully enjoyed our amenities. Both Fernando and Karen say thank you for your kind words. We will continue to work at making Park Vue Inn the best place and best value for our guests. Thank you for comming back. We hope to be able to provide a home away from home for you soon.

Summary: this hotel is a great option if you are going to Disneylad park. It s right on front o the park wish is super convenient. The service was great we were there for our kid birthday and at the end of the day we came in for a surprise birthday present from the hotel management wish in my opinion is a great plus. My kid loved it. The complementary breakfast is more then ok, not just toast and fruit. we will be going back for shure
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Glad to have been able to make your kid's birthday's a little more special. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: Upon check in the service Fernado gave us was excellant. The room we had was a King bed with juccuci in room. Very clean room, service was excellant. the breakfast was very good every was something different. The Cold Stone Creamy was a part of the Hotel which was awesome, really good. All this was just across the street from Disneyland. Went we go back we will diffently stay there again...
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad to have been Awsome for you guys. We will continue to work hard to provide a great place to stay. Thank you for your kind words, Fernando expresses his gratitude for you taking the time to single out his service. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: The Park Vue Inn is just a delightful place to stay.  The staff was completely accommodating, housekeeping went the extra mile and the location is steps from Disneyland.  We used to stay at the Double Tree Suites, down the road, which we loved, to get away from the crowds. Once our kids got older (3 & 6) and were able to stay longer at the park, the Park Vue seemed like it made more sense for us.  We were right.  We were able to quickly walk back from Disneyland to our room for a more personal lunch, nice glass of wine and a break from over stimulation.  It was perfect. Then back to the park for round two.    The kids loved playing in the In-room whirlpool tub that was in the living space of the room. We could hang with them and talk while they played with water toys and their
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Fernando and John both say thank you for your kind words. We are all happy to have been of great service to you and yours. Hope to see you soon.

Summary: Three of our four family trips we've stayed at the Park Vue. I regret only not staying there the first time. The only thing between you and the park is a light controlled crosswalk. It might even be quicker than staying at most of the "Disney Hotels". A huge plus, they serve a great breakfast, and this year started doing a good dinner. The rooms are good, staff has always been friendly and helpful. Free WI-FI
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn, it is our goal to continue to provide great service to you and your family. Thank you for being a loyal guest. See you soon.

Summary: we stay here every year on our annual trip to Disneyland and have done so for many many years. This hotel gets better and better!  We have just returned from a trip the week before Halloween. Recent renovations have made it even more comfortable to stay at this property. Walk across the street and you're there at the turnstiles within 8 minutes!  Bed is comfy with thick mattress and plump pillows, name brand amenities. Also it was very helpful to have the large wall mirror in the bathroom when there are others getting ready at the same time.    Things we love: The welcome basket with wine, fruit and bottled water (they even provided a bottle opener); free internet (they have several hotspots it seems so the signal was always strong); cookies and juice/water at the front desk at
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Aloha from Park Vue Inn. Thank you for continuing to allow us to be of service to you and your. We try our best to continue to provide a confortable place at a great value. We are still working on the improvements on our property. We hope that you will come visit soon. A hui hou. Mahalo.

Summary: Having traveled from Australia and stayed at the Park Vue for the last five years I clearly am a supporter of the friendly hotel located immediately opposite the main Disneyland entrance. The rooms maybe a little small and dated but comfortable and well serviced and maintained should something go wrong. The inclusive breakfast is a great start to the day and the evening 'social' is yet another means by which guests can receive some value added services from the staff. Well priced - well located and family friendly. What more could visitors to Disneyland want to meet their needs.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We thank you for your kind words and recommendations for readers. Thank you for being a loyal guest. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: Best place to stay after trying tons of hotels around Disneyland and inside the park. Welcome basket with wine, clean room, comfy bed, full breakfast, and even gave my daughter a Halloween treat. The staff is friendly and when we had a problem with the toilet they sent someone right away. The prices are so reasonable. Seriously cannot beat this place for a Disneyland trip. We have found our favorite place to stay at Disneyland!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn as your hotel. We will work our hardest to keep providing a great room, and great experience, at a great value. Thank you for your kind words, we hope to see you soon.

Summary: We were as close to Disneyland as you can get which saves time and hassle. Free parking, internet access, breakfast and supper included. A clean basic pool and spa. The property is not luxurious but the room was spacious and the beds and pillows very comfortable. The ariconditioning ran well. The motel is well maintained for the age and always clean. The staff were friendly and the kids loved having an icecream parlour on site. The small shop had a good range of Disney t-shirts and souvineers. A screeching child next door ruined one of our nights but I suppose you have to expect that in such a location. I would definately stay again because it was so affordable.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to know that your stay was great. The bunk bed rooms are a favorite for the kids. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: Motel like rooms, asked for better towels and they did have but otherwise still like a motel. Breakfast was ok, can't beat hot waffles but everything else ain't so great. Walls are paper thin and lots of kids etc running around outside.  Bad if you are a light sleeper. But the parking at hotel is free.  They give a welcoming fruit basket that was nice and there's a little fridge to store cold drinks.    But Oh SOOOO close to Disneyland!  For those who've been to Disney World, it's such a relief to not have to park and ride a shuttle, then have to take a tram or ferry to then get to the park!    The inn is really just across the street. There's a few restaurants nearby (cold stone creamery just in front). Inop and tony ribs nearby.   If I go back, it'd be a toss up between
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We will utilize this review to improve our accomidations. We hope that you will give us another opportumity to be of service to you. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn.

Summary: From the outset the service at the Park Vue Inn was the best we have experienced in a long time. The rooms are spotless and so are the grounds, but the stand out feature are the people. For example, I was having trouble connecting my Apple to the free Wi-Fi internet. Brian and his staff sorted the problem and ensured that we had the best connection possible. The problem required understanding of computers and wasn't straightforward, but with determination they solved it and we were then able to access the Internet and make contact with our friends in Australia and UK on Skype. The staff always took the time to speak to their guests, putting their busy schedule second to making sure the customer was first. Friendly smiles, courteous - excellent. My family have stayed in hotels in
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are a happy to know that we were able to provide help and customer service to you on your stay. We enjoyed our converstions with you. Have a great trip back home, We hope to see you soon.

Summary: Don't expect anything fancy at this motel.The rooms are small and a bit dated and could even use a minor repair here and there, but you can't beat the location and the rates are reasonable.The staff is usually very accomodating.I always choose Park Vue Inn first when I visit Disneyland which is 3 or 4 times a year.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Please know that we will utilize your review to better our customer service. We are working on the upgrades to the hotel, and we hope that you would visit soon.
