Summary: For our Aussie family of 5 Park Vue Inn was perfect. Staff & service were fantastic. We were extremely pleased with the location & who wouldn't be when it's right across the road from the entrance to Disneyland! Many other nearby accommodations could not accommodate 5 in one room for the same rate & inclusions (breakfast & light supper). The breakfast and light supper inclusions certainly saved us some money. Although the quality of the light supper is not top notch it was good enough to be our dinner every night & filling. We weren't going to be fussy when most other places didn't even offer it. There was a laundry which we utilised & a good sized swimming pool. We would definitely stay at Park Vue Inn again & recommend it to our family & friends.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad that your stay was great. We enjoyed having conversations with you and visiting with your family. We hope to see you soon. Have a safe trip back home.

Summary: We booked a room asking for two queens.  We got a queen and bunk beds.  Not good for couples!  We were not given a new room and we had a long stay.  These rooms tend to be very small.  We hardly had any space to put our things.  The bathroom was extremely small.  Towels are very thin and small.  Nothing nice about the rooms.  Everything needs updating.  The sink was clogged and after someone fixed it they didn't take the gunk with them.  We returned from Disneyland to a horrible smelling room with sink gunk in the garbage.  No apologies from management for the clogged sink.  Everyone that complains about the air conditioner in reviews is right.  The hotel is right across the street but so are other hotels.   After a tired day at Disney, I'd rather come back to a nice clean hotel
Manager Response: We are sorry your last stay was not satisfactory. We strive to meet or exceed our guest’s every need.  We appreciate your feedback, as this makes it possible for us to better our service.  We would like an opportunity to be of service to you and your family in the future. Please contact the hotel management to discuss the details of your last stay so we can address the issues you had more directly. Thank you again for taking the time to write a review.

Summary Heading: Best Customer Service I've Seen In Years
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue for 5 nights this October. I was so impressed with my interactions with the staff. They were so courteous. We received a dayly phone call from the front desk just to make sure everything was okay with our stay. One night we returned to find we had no hot water. With a phone call to the desk it was fixed within 15 minutes.  This place is not new or fancy, if you're looking for that, look somewhere else. But if you're looking for a clean place in an unbeatable location, stay HERE!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to know that your stay was great. When ever we incounter issues like the water, we like to make sure it's fixed as soon as possible. We are glad we were able to take care of it so fast. Come visit soon.

Summary: This hotel is ideally located across the street from the main entrance to Disneyland.  Friendly staff, easy parking, ideal location.  But the rooms are sparse and depressing and the free food that is offered is pretty bad.  To me it would be better to do away with the free food and the free in room gift basket and price the rooms a bit lower.  This is bare bones accomodations so I think it should be more value priced.  But the convenience can not be beat.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your recomendations are using your review to improve our hotel. We hope you will give us another opportunity to be of service to you. Thanks again.

Summary: I chose Park Vue Inn to book accommodation from Australia for our  3 families based on recent reviews of this establishment and was not disappointed. The comments of recent visitors are consistent with our own experience particularly cleanliness of our rooms and friendly service by staff.  Apart from the breakfast, a bonus  was the availability of a  complementary very light dinner  between 5-7 which was very much appreciated on a couple of evenings after a long day in Disneyland. I would have no hesitation in recommending Park Vue Inn on location, value, services and cleanliness at this point in time to my friends.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are very happy your stay was great. We will take the room tips you have provided and use them to improve our room accomidations. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: 2nd Visit Was Exceptional ~ Won't Stay Anywhere Else!
Summary: Well the Park Vue Inn did it again... they made another Disney trip even more amazing with their property, service and staff.  Our family stayed at the Park Vue in October 2007 and we were pretty happy overall.  This trip we decided to give it another go since the location was so great and the free breakfast really helped with our budget.  First off we made reservations for 2 rooms back in May, and even though we ended up changing our dates slightly, the gentleman who assisted me over the phone was more than accomodating with it.  Additionally, because our family was attending Mickey's Halloween Party this year for the first time, I thought it would be neat to order some costumes online, however being in Canada, I knew it was very unlikely we would receive them in time for our
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are very happy to know that we were able to provide a home away from home for you and your family. Thank you for being a loyal guest and we will always keep the fresh baked cookies for you at our front desk. See you soon

Summary: Just stayed at Park Vue Inn last week with my wife and baby daughter for our Disneyland trip... What a GREAT place for families!!!!! It was cheap compared to other hotels, it had a coin operated laundry, room service was great, it's across the road from the Disneyland entrance and staff were very helpful. There is also a supermarket store 10 minute walk from the Inn and places to eat all around there. Definitely the place for families to go if planning a Disneyland vacation!
Manager Response: We appreciate your tips for future guests, and thank you for taking the time to review Park Vue Inn. It is our goal to accomidate our guests as best possible. We hope to have another opportunity to serve you soon.

Summary Heading: First Time To Disneyland...and I would go back!
Summary: Chose Park Vue after consulting Trip Advisor. Glad we did. First time to Anaheim, five days at Disney. Stayed at the PV the whole time. Check in was a breeze, room was tiny but great. Pillows were super thick, requested thinner ones for my three kids, no problem. The room is irrelevant, we were only there from 11pm till 9am, spent all our time at the park. I wasn't expecting the Ritz, and it certainly isn't fancy, but it's clean and comfy. Stayed on the bottom floor, the noise wasn't bad, I actually liked hearing the giggles walk past our door and the kids getting excited. That's what it's all about, right? The meals were kid friendly, BASIC, but fuel and appreciated. So were the apples and oranges at the front desk.  Have to say that the highlight of the hotel for the kids was
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Hello you are welcome for the tips. It is our goal to provide the highest level of customer service to all our guests. Some of the more firm beds are the new beds they just need to be broken in. My apology for the soar shoulders, hope that on your next visit we can find a softer bed for you. Thanks again for taking the time to write this review. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: It really is the closest accom to the Disneyland entrance. Rooms are a bit small but have all you need. We had a 4 day pass so it was nice to be able to come and go as we pleased because it was so close. We got soaked on splash mountain so just walked back, got changed and were back in the park on the next ride 15 mins later. Decent continental breakfast and IHOP, Denny's and other eateries nearby.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy that you enjoyed your stay. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: Located directly across the street from Disneyland, it's one of the shortest walks you can have to the parks.  We've stayed at several of the motels in this area, and Park Vue has had the best breakfast, and even offers a nice dinner.  Certainly an attractive option to the expensive offerings in the parks. Heated pool is actually heated (rare in our previous motel experiences). Will stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn we look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Fantastic value family disneyland accommodation great staff
Summary: Australian family stayed 8 days in sept 2011 helpful staff and warm welcome on arrival, facilities to change freshen up room available within a couple of hours note "arrived early morning", welcome basket  free wifi great worked fine. Rooms very clean beds comfortable toiletries coffee etc provided fine, breakfast buffet free, fantastic and so convenient for families staff cheerful. Oh dinner buffet too light dinner but great and so convenient for evening return to disneyland. Computer access at reception incl printer fine staff helpful to assist. Also coffee cookies cold drink and fruit thank you. Thank you Park Vue Inn, can't imagine a better value accommodation and helpful staff in Anaheim. Recommend to all hope to come back.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to writing this review. We appreciate you recommending people to us. It is our goal to provide a great value to our guests. We look forward to being of great service to you soon.

Summary: We chose the Park Vue Inn based on positive reviews in TripAdvisor and because of its location and were not disappointed.   The location, price and service are the reasons for my high rating. The 2 queen bed room was small, but intelligently laid out. The breakfast was mainly pre-made foods, but it is so convenient not to have to go out for breakfast that I can't complain. The pool was nice, though if you're travelling with smaller kids, note that the shallow end is 3-1/2 feet deep, so bring water wings.  The service was mostly good. The only oversight was that housekeeping overlooked our room one day (no biggie, as we're fairly neat and towel re-users).  The other positive was the other guests. Maybe its the proximity to the happiest place on earth, or maybe it was the general

I have stayed at the Park Vue Inn two times and both visits were great. Since my first visit was a few years ago and my latest visit was just a few weeks ago (Sept 30th, 2011), the details of this review will be taken from my latest and greatest visit to the Park Vue Inn.  I just turned 30 this September and my sister, who was born two years and a day before me, just turned 32. To celebrate these milestones, we decided to go visit Disneyland on one day, and California Adventure the next in a two day birthday celebration. Although both my sister and I are located in the Los Angeles area, we both decided to stay down in Anaheim for convenience. When my sister asked me, "Where should we stay when we are down at Disneyland?", I didn't even hesitate when I told her we were staying at

I have stayed at many of the hotels on Harbor Blvd and this is one of the better ones. The rooms are clean, the beds a bit on the hard side, but comfortable enough. The breakfast was a plus and better than most, they even had some hot items. The evening meal was also a money saver, but not gourmet by any means - hot dogs, nachos, chicken fingers, etc. The bunk beds were also a plus when traveling with children. All of the hotels in this area of Harbor are within walking distance which is a huge plus, however many of them are now charging for parking.

My husband, my son, and I stayed at the Park Vue Inn for 4 nights, while we visited Disneyland and California Adventure.  The location was fantastic.  We were able to walk to Disneyland in approx.7-8 mins.  So even after walking around the parks, our 5yr old was able to walk back to the hotel.  We had the room with a queen bed, and a set of bunk beds.  The room worked fine for us, but it was a little small.  It was clean, and had some updated things in it, nothing fancy though.  Everyone was very nice, and the lobby had juice dispensers and cookies or pastries set out for whoever wanted them. ( We would stop by on the way back from the parks and grab a cup and snack).  Also I liked how the lobby was decorated for Halloween.  Also worth a mention is the continental breakfast, and

Just stayed 1 night . When we first checked in , it was very easy and the front desk was very nice. Complimentary juices, candy, and cookies available. When we got in the room, we were surpised to receive a gift basket, which included bottled water, Wine, and fruit. And since it was my husband's birthday , he also got a birthday note and bouquet of balloons. The room was a nice suite, which included a kitchen(which included an oven, microwave oven, plates, utensils), a separate room with 2 queen sized beds and in the living room was a sleeper sofa. The beds were pretty comfortable. We didn't use the pool, but it was pretty big. Breakfast was nice...make yourself waffles, premade french toast, bagels, donuts, cereals, oatmeal and fruit. They also had hard boiled eggs and cheese

My wife and i went on a trip to Disney land and decided to stay at this hotel.  It was a good choice.  The hotel let us do an early pre-check in so that we could park our car for free in their lot while we went to disney land.  The location is right across from Disney land which was great for when were were exhausted and were ready to go to the hotel.  The had a nice letter waiting for us with a great gift basket waiting for us.  The service was great and every time i go to disney land i will stay at this hotel.

We stayed here for 4 nights.  The location of the Park Vue Inn can't be beat.  It is virtually across the street from the entrance path to both Disney parks.  We requested and got a large room with two queen beds on the top floor.  Our room was the same size as our children's room at the Grand Californian - and at 1/3 the price.  The front desk staff was super friendly and helpful.   We received a welcome pack of fruit and wine after check-in.  The wifi worked well in our room. The breakfast was okay - with the make your own waffle machines.  The breakfast room was crowded at times, though.  We never did try the included light dinners, so can't comment on that.  We were able to purchase multi-day Disney Park Hopper tickets from the front desk.  We were glad that we didn't

Summary Heading: So close you can see the fireworks!
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue Inn 2 nights in mid-October. We had a room with bunk beds - the kids loved it! From our room we could see the park entrance and the fireworks. We enjoyed the free breakfast and the free social hour - which served as our meal for the night. The rooms are small, but who cares, you are only there to sleep and shower before walking "right across the street" to the park entrances. The location can't be beat. The place was clean and well kept. The front desk was very friendly and accomodating. We got a welcome basket with sparkling cider and fruit. We took full advantage of it. We never saw the pool, too busy enjoying Disney. We did eat at the Cold Stone that is attached to the hotel. Those guys are a lot of fun down there - we enjoyed our stay and will stay

You could not be closer to Disney. This well laid out motel was clean with very friendly staff and was home for 2 nights. Our room had a fridge and we arrived to a welcome pack of fruit and wine. A couple of decent restaurants are just around the corner and it is so easy to nip out of Disney if you get completly wet through on the rapids to get changed as the wife had to do.Laudrette on site at decent prices if needed.Breakfast is a bit of a bun fight though if you arrive at peak time. If you can put up with this then you will enjoy.

We stayed at the Park Vue in October 5 thru 9, 2011.  Upon arrival we were given keys to a second floor room away from the hustle and bustle of the breakfast room and street.  This was exactly what I had asked for in my reservation.   The room had 2 queen beds, with a seperate vanity and bathroom. We didn't hear other guests at all during our stay.  The walls are thick enough so noise doesn't carry.  We even came back to the room and took naps on 2 days and didn't hear anything.   The only blip was I don't think the maid knew the previous family had left.  There were clean sheets on the beds and clean towels - however, there was a used soap in the shower, a "welcome letter" to the previous family on the desk along with 2 half used water bottles, and 2 pieces of fruit.  Our

Stayed here Sept 19-24, 2011 on the advice of my daughter who previously stayed here in 2010. This joint was as good as it gets. Right smack across the street from Disneyland. It took us exactly 3 minutes and 17 seconds to walk to Disneyland/CA Adv from the Park Vue Inn. Our room was immaculate compared to my bedroom at home. (I'm a slob). My wife even liked this place and she's extremely fussy, like most women. Tip: You could go to Disneyland during the day, walk back to your room for a quickie in the afternoon, then go back to Disneyland, all in about 17 minutes flat - it was that close.  Breakfast was pretty good - it sure in the heck beat McDonald's where I normally eat when on vacation. I didn't eat dinner at the Park Vue but I did peek in one night, stole a carrot and some

Stayed at this lovely hotel from Sept 23rd th Sept 27th  Located directly across from the entance gate at of Disneyland. Had four rooms.Brought our grandchildren with their parents.Arrived from Vancouver B.C. via  Carnival cruise line to the San PedroPort and had a shuttle reserved from Prime Time Shuttle who also were quick and very efficient and a little cheaper than the "other guys"..From the moment we arrived at the hotel we were warmly greeted by the friendly staff. We arrived early so we had all our bags put into their secured storage area, My wife who is recovering from an operation had a scooter waiting at the hotel for her(what a wonderful way to enjoy Disneyland) Our scooter was pearranged off the internet through Deckert's medical & scooter rental, and was delivered

We have been staying at Park Vue for the last 8 years and it only gets better and better.   This is no chain hotel, and it shows!  We come every June with our kids and other family members. The rooms are always super clean and comfortable.  At checkin they have a gift in your room ( wine and fruit basket ) The front desk is always available, always helpful and even have cookies for your when you come in.  The breakfast and afternoon mealtime is yummy with lots to offer. My kids love making their own waffles in the easy to use machines.  The pool is great, lots of towels and the little market has pretty much everything you might forget as well as some great afternoon snacks. To top it all off, they put a Coldstones Ice Cream shop in the front of the hotel, and we guests get the

Summary Heading: Excellent Experience at an Excellent Value
Summary: Enjoyed a great stay at a great price. What hotel offers breakfast and a light dinner to their guests? Only downside was the slight noise (although they routinely ask guests to please be considerate) and the lukewarm hot tub. Very minor problems, in my opinion. Loved the welcome basket and personal messages from the front desk staff checking to make sure our stay was going well. Everyone was friendly and attentive, and we were easily able to check out a day early due to a change of plans. Will definitely stay at this hotel again. Did I mention they are right across from the Disneyland main gates??

We were at the Park Vue in May 2011 for two weeks which was a christmas gift for our two teenagers.Well we were there our daughter had her 13th birthday and the hotel sent up a basket for her with ballons and a gift card for a icecream cake from cold stone creamery  which made her day.The staff treated us very good,the fresh baked cookies and cold juice were well recieved by us after a long day at disneyland.The breakfast was very good but the social hour food wasnt good at all,i wasnt expecting an all excusive resort anyways so we got to try some awesome restarants in the area.I couldnt have ask for a better location or more attentive staff and would recomend this property to any one who is looking for a great disneyland experiance and doesnt need to be pampered at one of the

Wow - what a nice place!   Older place, but it's been recently renovated and is exceptionally well maintained.   Cozy little two-story setup.    RIght across the street from the main Disneyland / California Adventure entrance -- you'd have to be on-property to be any closer.  Lots of little extras -- we even had a complementary bottle of wine with fruit in the room when we arrived.   The breakfast buffet had plenty of hot items (sausage or bacon, depending on day, eggs, hash browns, make-your-own waffles) along with plenty of cold items (yogurt, fruit, cereal, donuts & pastries, etc).   Very little variety from day-to-day, but quite decent for free.  The indoor breakfast area tended to be pretty crowded, and the big-screen TV blaring the Disney channel was pretty annoying.

My family and I stayed at the Park Vue for a quick trip to Disneyland.  We had four rooms, one with bunk beds for children.  I believe this hotel has been recently renovated as the carpeting and bedding are new, the walls appear to have been freshly painted and wallpapered and other “new like” touches are scattered around.  Being an annual passholder, I’ve stayed at most of the hotels on Harbor and will say that as long as this hotel stays as it is now, it is my new Disney hotel of choice.   Check-in was a breeze and the lobby personnel were friendly and accommodating.  While the room wasn’t to be ready until after 3:00 pm (as is customary for all hotels), they held our luggage while we ran around the parks all day and our luggage was waiting in our rooms upon key pickup.    The

Summary Heading: I've stayed many times and recommend it
Summary: I've just spent another pleasant week at the Park Vue Inn. I always find the staff pleasant and helpful and the rooms comfortable. I also appreciate the nice gift baskets delivered soon after my arrivals. The complimentary breakfast is good--omelettes, bacon, juices, lots of choices.  An important advantage for me is its convenience--only about five minutes' walk to the entrance of either Disney park, and about 15 minutes' walk to Downtown Disney shops and restaurants. Makes it easy to take a quick break from a park during the day.  I very much appreciate the fact that parking is free, as is the wifi. The prices are reasonable, too.  If you're looking for a luxury hotel, this isn't it; but if you're looking for a hotel which offers all you need, I find the Park Vue Inn a nice

Great service and wonderful staff at the Park Vue.  We stayed in the Queen/Bunk Bed Room.  The room was a little small and lacked storage but was fine considering we were mostly at the parks.  The staff is what made our trip excepional.  Plus all of the extras.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if going to Disneyland
Summary: The Park Vue Inn is a great value. You get free breakfast and free parking, as well as afternoon snacks, which could be considered dinner. The day we were around for the afternoon snacks, there were hot dogs, chips, chili, soup. The breakfast buffet consisted of eggs, bacon or sausage, pancakes, waffles, doughnuts, cereal, fruit, coffee, juices. The food was really good and the staff was constantly refilling trays and making sure there were enough utensils and plates. The room we had was clean and roomy. The location to Disneyland is great! It is literally right across the street from Disnayland's entrance. Oh, and there was a complimentary gift basket in our room when we arrived. There was a bottle of wine and fruit. How nice! We picked this hotel based on trip advisor reviews

Summary Heading: Hotel Cancelled Our Reservation 4 Hours Before Check In
Summary: I booked a room here in June based on the solid reviews here on TA. It was in the ideal location for our 1 day at Disneyland and sounded very clean (my biggest thing). My boyfriend and I were coming from Las Vegas to finish our vacation at Disney but first we were making a stop at the beach since he has never been to CA. On our way to the beach around 11am (check in is at 3pm) we got a call saying that their computers had overbooked the hotel and they were cancelling our reservation. Needless to say we were quite mad but said we would come by when we were finished at the beach because we didn't want to do this over the phone.  We arrived around 2 and spoke with the desk clerk who told us that even though we booked (and payed for) our room in June because we were only staying the

Summary Heading: Great place to stay close to Disneyland
Summary: Location is perfect just across road from Disney.  Room is comfortable and clean.  Bathroom good. Needs better choice of pillows.  TV in rooms need upgrading to LCD.  Reception were more than helpful.  Breakfast was excellent and waffles even better.

When going to Disneyland, and we go twice a year.  I always stay at the Park Vue, for the past 10 yrs.. the rooms are nice and the best thing about it is that its so close to the main gate at Disneyland.. like 100 yards away :) we stayed there in March  & Sept 2011 this year a few changes that i loved was that they added Free dinner, they have always had the breakfast which are really good.. saves you some money, so you can spend more at Disneyland.. they even gave our lil one a birthday gift and a mini ice cream cake for celebrating her 4th bday.. Stay at the Park Vue, you'll love it!!

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in Anaheim!!!
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue Inn for 4 nights in September 2011. It is our second stay there and we loved it. Location is perfect, room was great, excellent staff, breakfast and light dinner included in package and all at a very affordable price. It was our daughters birthday and they made it very special for her by giving her a birthday gift of balloons, books, beach ball, pencils and an ice cream cake. We would definately stay with Park Vue Inn again. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Can't beat the location, Great value, VERY kind staff!!
Summary: This was our first time to the Park View Inn, (and it will not be our last) and I first off cannot stress how close this hotel is. It is (like others have stated) at the crosswalk to Disneyland Resort-closer than ANY of the Disney hotels.  We arrived to "Happy Anniversary" balloons, and within 10 minutes of being in the room, a knock at the door asking us if we would like more towels!!  I can't remember a hotel asking the guest, not the other way around.  The free food was a nice bonus, Breakfast was make your own waffles, fruit, cereal, toast, eggs, sausage one day, bacon the next.  Dinner both nights had soup and salad, one night enchiladas, the next nacho bar.  They have a guest laundry, a pool, and free parking. The room itself had very comfortable beds, and it had plenty of

Summary Heading: We were over-charged; hotel refused to discuss it with us
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue Inn for four nights in July 2011. We had made our reservation through the Park Vue's website and originally reserved a room with 1 queen and 1 bunk bed.  We later decided that we would rather have a larger room.  We accessed our existing reservation online, hit a button to "modify" the reservation and changed it to a room with 2 queens and 1 bunk bed. We received an email confirming that the change we requested had been made. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were told we actually had two reservations in the system - one for the room type we originally booked and one for the room type to which we had changed. We told the desk clerk that we had not made a second reservation, we had only modified an existing reservation. For some reason, the online

Great hotel, with everything you need and more. Stayed with 3 kids, aged 5,6, and 8, lots of room. The pool was 30 feet from our room, and is surrounded by flowers and trees. No noise, quite hotel. Most of the time we were the only people in the pool and hot tub (very very clean). Free food was great. Fireworks at Disney are only Fri-Sun in the off season. Will be back. Thanks Park Vue

I almost hate to share how we feel about Park Vue Inn.  We love it.  It is directly across from the main entrance to Disneyland....unlike others that state that on their site as "across the street from the park".  Park Vue is just perfect.  Clean. Nothing fancy or too expensive.  The pool is The Best on the Blvd.  It's close to everything.

A superb hotel for the money, yards from the entrance to Disneyland. The rooms were clean and well appointed, and had a fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The front desk staff were very helpful and there was complementary internet access. The complementary breakfast was very good with a good range of items both hot and cold, although there were times when they couldn't keep up with demand and there was a wait for stuff. Nice pool and hot tub too.

Firstly, let me say that I agree with MerryGoWorld about the running kids. We  were in the second floor and from about 7:30 to 9:00 we had 'stampeding' kids (one even tried to open our door). So ... parents, be respectful of others and realise that not everyone gets up at the crack of dawn. Otherwise, rooms were clean (though on the small side). Great option of bunk beds, free breakfast a great money saving option. Didn't get a chance to try dinner though. Pool was lovely and warm. All staff very friendly and helpful. And the location could not be better, after a long (in one case 14 hour!!!) day it was great to just cross the road and be at your hotel.

We stayed as a family with four children in October. We stayed in two adjoining rooms and that was perfect for our family.  We loved being right across from the entrance of Disneyland.  Also the complimentary breakfast and dinner were so nice and saved us so much money.  The breakfast was yummier than the dinner, but we would have been eating at fast food places otherwise so we were grateful for the food they provided.  The rooms were clean and the staff was generous.  The downsides came from noise from other guests.  The rooms faced the parking lot and many people used automatic car locking devices that honked their horns throughout the day and night.  There was also a lot of noise from people rolling their luggage on the sidewalk outside the rooms.  This wouldn't happen in an

We chose this Inn based on reviews we read on Tripadvisor. Our family group was comprised of three adults. We were happy with our stay here. The rooms are very clean, the property is well maintained, the beds were comfortable. Parking is free with a placard guests receive for their vehicles during check-in. The Inn has two stories with walkways to the rooms facing the parking lot which is very well lit. We didn't see elevators. The entrance to the Inn is literally next to the stoplight on the street that leads into Disneyland and California Adventure, just a short walk away. The Inn also has a fitness center, gift shop, and an ice cream parlor in the building. Several eating establishments are within walking distance. We didn't partake of the evening food but breakfast was more

This is a great motel. The location is perfect for the Disneyland Parks. Walk across the street and you are literally minutes form the gate. The rooms were very clean, the rates were affordable, the staff was excellent. They left a gift basket with fruit and wine (or apple juice if you want it) They checked in with us to make sure we had everything we needed. You can easily come back to the motel from the Parks to take a break to take a dip in the pool or hot tub, then head back to the Parks. This was a nice advantage for us. We will stay here again for our next trip down to Disneyland for sure.

This hotel is perfect for those who want an easy Disneyland experience. It takes 5 mins to walk to the gates of Disneyland and California Adventure. Perfect for nap time or enjoying your free dinner at 5pm at the hotel. Here are a list of my pros and cons about this hotel.  Pros Gift basket with letter to family (Bottle of wine, wine/bottle cap opener, two bananas, apple and orange) Free cookies, fruit, lemonade and water at front desk Beds and linens are new and comfortable Rooms are very nicly renovated air conditioning pool and hot tub Free breakfasts (cereals, milk, pancakes, waffles, toast, donuts, fruit, yogurt, cottage cheese, hard boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, oatmeal, coffee and juice, and every morning the serve a different entree Free dinner

Stayed here for 4 nights and was pretty happy with the choice! Great location! Right across the road from the Front gate of disneyland! Hotel was a bit hard on the eyes at first but the rooms are quite nice and very clean! Staff were friendly and helpful!! Loved it

This is an AWESOME hotel for a family going to Disneyland and one I will keep coming back to in the future!  When checking in, there are cookies and punch to enjoy.  Our room had a gift basket with fruit and wine in it.  (You could trade the wine for sparkling apple juice if you wanted.)  And within two minutes of getting into our room, the phone rang.  It was the front desk asking us if everything looked okay.  The room was nice and spacious with a fridge and microwave.  I was a little nervous about the carpet being really dirty from all the reviews I had read, but the carpets were very clean.  In fact the carpet looked new.  My kids never got black on their feet from the carpet and, as mentioned, it was very clean.  However, I can understand how the carpets get really dirty

Summary Heading: Location, food, amenities and affordability all rolled into one
Summary: I have stayed here multiple times, each time it gets better and better! I was part of a 16 person family reunion, and every one of us was comfortable, satisfied, and taken care of. Getting a hearty breakfast in the morning gave us strength to get through a day at the parks, and saved us a bundle on food. The social hour was also excellent. The staff went out of their way to meet every request, even after we'd checked out and needed our bags stored. A highlight for me was when I came back to the room before it had been cleaned because the baby needed a nap, and when the housekeeper knocked, she was willing to come in and clean (and was AMAZINGLY quiet) even though I had to stay in with the baby. We will not stay anywhere else when we go to Disneyland. The rooms are large and

Summary Heading: The most friendliest Hotel we have ever stayed at !!
Summary: We have just returned from the USA after a months travels.We stayed at the Park Vue Inn for 7 nights and had the best time. The staff were amazing nothing was too much trouble and by far the friendliest people we met while in America. The Hotel rooms are a good size and very clean and comfortable. I think what makes this hotel so very special is the little extras, like the supper they serve of an evening and the refreshments always in the lobby great after a day at Disneyland. The distance to the park would have to be the best on the strip across the road and you are back to the Hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. It was our pleasure to be of great service to you and your family. It is always our goal to provide a home away from home. Come visit soon, Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn as your hotel.

Summary Heading: Really close to Disney, great place to stay! =)
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue for our Disney vacation September 2011.    We loved this hotel because: The room was clean. Comfortable bed. For breakfast they have the basics, actually is what most restaurants serve you, eggs, sausage, hashbrowns, bread, waffles, fruit, yougurt, cofee, juice, oatmeal, cereal...  =) The welcome basket is a really nice touch.  The staff very friendly and accomodating. We didn't hear noise throughout the night. Walking (5 minute) distance to main entrance to Disney. Could see Disney fireworks from our room (first floor). Refrigerator, microwave, safebox in room.   Only thing, is they really need to change some of their towels. We had a couple that were worn out. Yet were very clean..  Definitely will stay here again and recommend to friends!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Sorry about the towels, we have already placed an order for new ones. Glad that we were able to accomidate everything else on your stay. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: Every member of the staff worked very hard to make sure our stay was wonderful.  Best Disneyland Hotel!

Park Vue was easy to find from the 5 north. The people at the check in were nice and I got to park my car for two days. Plus it does not get any better than right across the street from disneyland.  The breakfast was ok nothing to brag about but it is included and you are already paying an arm and leg for food anyways.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. With many hotels to choose from we thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn. We hope to be of service to you again.

Summary: We just got back from our Disney experience and the Park Vue Inn was all that I could have hoped for.  It was economical, (especially since they are literally across the street from the park and could have charged so much more), the rooms were clean, and the staff was very friendly and accomodating.  My one pet peeve about staying in hotels is noise all throughout the night since I am traveling with small children, and I never heard a sound form anywhere.  The beds were comfortable and the breakfast in the morning was easy.  Sure, it's standard hotel breakfast food but considering we never had to leave to get it or pay extra it was worth it! My kids LOVED the bunk beds and the welcome basket was a nice touch. I would definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad to have been able to accomidate a clean, confortable, stay at a great value. See you soon.

Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue for for our Disneyland vacation September of 2011. Overall, everything was really good, and they went out of their way to meet our needs, which was wonderful. I see what people mean (in other reviews) about the carpet being dirtier than anticipated, and I just made sure to have the family wear socks so they didn't touch the floor too much.   The breakfast was excellent, we had a range of choices from bagels to waffles to cereal to eggs and biscuits and gravy... we loved the free breakfast buffet and highly recommend it. The free "social hour" dinner was so so, we had stale chips and stale taco shells with our dinner, but, hey, it was free.  The welcome basket was a great touch, with fresh fruit, bottled water, and wine (which we could have exchanged for
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize for the crib. We are happy to inform you that we have purchased new cribs and are also taking a closer look at our maintenance on them. Thanks again.

Summary: With so many choices along Harbor Blvd., we chose Park Vue because of the closeness to Disneyland (we didn't want any more 'non-park' walking than absolutely necessary!).  You can't get any closer than Park Vue.  We also chose it because there were no parking fees and the 'extras' that they include.  There is an expanded breakfast, afternoon light "dinner", and lemonade/punch/water bottles/fruit in the lobby at all times. They also give you a free "welcome basket", which includes 2 water bottles, 2 pieces of fresh fruit, and a bottle of either white wine or sparkling cider.  We also told them we would be celebrating a birthday, so there was also a gift for birthday person (a mug filled with fun-sized candy bars with four balloons attached). In our experience, the newly
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Thank you for your suggestions we are reviewing our line up of foods provided. We will continue to make changes that will better the experiance for our guests. Thank you again we hope you will allow us to serve you soon.

Summary Heading: Clean rooms, good breakfast and pre-dinner snack, great rates, good staff and right across the road from  Disney!
Summary: Ok the rooms are tight but hey who's spending time in their room except to sleep and shower when you're across the road from Disney and California Adventure Park! Literally.So convenient to have the breakfast buffet and the pre-dinner snack was great for us. It made us take a break and recharge before heading back to the Parks. Essential with young kids. the Guest Relations staff who were there at meals were great - the staff at reception a little snooty but efficient.. And of course the cost of the room was reasonable.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We have spoken to all the Food & Beverage employees and have showed them your nice words. We apolgize for the front desk and they have also been informed. We are glad that our F & B was useful to you and yours. See you soon.

Summary Heading: The best of all hotels around...
Summary: I’ll just highlight the bullet points: reasonable rates, even lover compared to neighboring hotels, FREE parking for the time of your stay (other hotels charge $9 a day), pool, Jacuzzi, fitness room, a small store where you can buy Disney merchandise at a lower price, clean rooms, all basic accommodations included (mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker with all the supplies, safe in the room), many options to choose the room type, either for a family of 2 or 6, quick service, early check in, they have an absolutely the best continental breakfast: boiled eggs, omelets, sausages, bacon, yogurt, cottage cheese, cereal, doughnuts, you can make your own waffles, pancakes, juices, coffee, fruits, and so on.., they have social hours where in the same cafeteria they have 2 kind of soups,
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, and thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn. Glad to have been able to make your vacation a great one.

Summary: Can't beat the location, value and service here at the Park Vue Inn. Conveniently located right across from Disneyland.  We had adjoining rooms on the first floor with free parking right outside our doors.  Rooms were not fancy, but clean.  Breakfast was average, but can't complain when it's free.  Employees were all nice and helpful.  When we needed directions to get to somewhere, the front desk provided maps that they printed out for us.  The fruit and wine basket in our rooms were a nice touch upon our arrival, as well as the daily bottled water and cookies in the lobby.  We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend this place to others!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. It's the extra we believe count. Glad to have been of service to you and yours.

Summary: We just returned from another stay at the Park Vue, and as usual it was great. You can't get any closer to Disneyland as it's just across the street.   There is a free breakfast, which includes hot items every day. There are eggs (scrambled or hard boiled) and alternating sausage and bacon. You can also make your own waffles, yummy! This time they have also added pancakes and french toast. There is also fruit salad and the usual continental fare. I believe this is probably the best free breakfast in the area.  The social hour was also a big money saver for us as we used it for dinner several nights.During our stay there were sliders, tacos, enchiladas, nachos, mac and cheese and chicken nuggets. (1 of those is offered each night) plus every night there is a salad and 2 or 3

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay with Kids
Summary: We stayed at Park Vue for one night to celebrate our kids' birthday.  I think it is the closest hotel to Disneyland aside from Grand California.  Super convenient. It is also shares a parking lot with iHop.  We told them ahead of time that we were celebrating 2 birthdays and when we arrived in our room there were gift bags for our kids and a welcome basket.  It was a wonderful surprise and our kids were so happy.  They also gave us a voucher to get a free ice cream cake from coldstones which is in front of the lobby.  Another plus is their full breakfast - waffles, eggs, cereals, fruit, etc.  The facilities are old, pool is small and have to cross parking lot to access.  Rooms are a good size but dark.  Great value for the convenience if you're going to Disneyland and customer
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to have been able to make your stay and your kids' Bday a little more special.

Summary: Fabulous base, just about as close as it gets to the park entry gates at such reasonable value. Its all about the value. Not fancy but covers all the bases. Has pool with pool towels provided, basic breakfast and basic dinner (which is all you need when you are themeparking it every day). The laundry is very efficient. Ice machine. The kitchenette doesn't have any real cooking equipment / capacity but means you have a few extra sinks for everyone and a fridge and benchspace. You don't cook anyway! Great with little kids where you can duck back and refresh at anytime with a nap! Sofa bed is fine for the kids. Housekeeping was very good!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are gald to have been of service. We will be upgrading the extra's in the kitchenette suite. Thank you once again for your suggestions. See you soon.

Summary Heading: If We Can't Stay Here We're Not Going !
Summary: My daughter (now 18) and I are great Disneyland fans and since we discovered the Park Vue Inn 3 or 4 yrs ago we literally plan our trip around availabilty there.  We live in Hawaii and any trip to the mainland will include a trip to Disneyland, I check to see if we can get at least 3 nights at the Park Vue before I make my plan reservations. We used to stay at the Disneyland Hotel but never again, it's very nice but you always feel as if your still "in" the park, there's no real respite.  The Park Vue is right across the street from the main gates but when to go over there to take a break you really feel like you're "out".  The rooms have everything you need including a microwave and free internet.  The front desk staff is outstanding and will make every effort to meet all your
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear that you plan around us. We are happy that we can provide you with excelent service on you vacations. We will see you soon. Mahalo

Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue for 2 nights in August (26th and 27th), 2011. The hotel was right in front of the entrance to Disneyland which was a huge benefit with small kids (8 and 4) as they would get tired in the afternoon ... we would come back and rest ... and then go back in the evening for either World of Colour or Fireworks at the Castle. The park at night is a totally different atmosphere than by day and should be experienced. The staff at the Inn were very helpful, the rooms were clean and comfortable and we had no issues with noise. We had a triple queen room with 2 tvs and we had no issues. We were given a welcome basket in our room after we checked into the rooms, breakfast was fine and so was the dinner/snack in the evenings. The pool is a salt water pool and the kids
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize that your experience at Cold Stone was not ideal. The managment of the Cold Stone store has been informed of this review and is using this review to improve their service. We are glad your stay at Park Vue Inn was great and we hope to be of service to you soon.

Summary: We all (Two adults and two kids over 8) found that the hotel was a great location and the staff were all very helpful and friendly.  As with a lot of guests, we pretty much used the room to sleep and did not spend a lot of time at the actual hotel but that was the way that we prefer it to be anyway.  The included breakfast was a godsend as it allowed us to start the day with a reasonably healthy selection of foods, including yoghurt and rasin bran along with some fruit, up to bacon and eggs with biscuits (or scones for the Australian and UK visitors), bagels, waffles and toast.  We were more than happy with the selections to choose from.  The rooms were tidy and clean, stocked well with soaps, coffees and even a wide selection of teas.  The closeness to Disneyland was very
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We continue to work diligently to keep all of these amenities and our customer service at an exceptional level. We hope to be of service to you soon.

Summary Heading: Sssshhhhh - need to keep this one a secret!
Summary: What a gem!  Stayed here for a week while in Anaheim to run the Disneyland Half Marathon.  Smaller, quaint property that is only two stories.  No elevator.  It is an older property but very clean and well maintained.   I found the beds very comfortable and the breakfast was deluxe.  The refreshments in the lobby were so appreciated.  We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite as there were 6 of us.  We had two sinks and a jetted tub.  Soap, lotion, shampoo and conditioner were provider in dispensers hanging on the wall.  There was a small coffee maker and coffee to make that first cup in the morning.  Housekeeping did an excellent job of cleaning and ensuring that the coffee supplies were replenished every day.    This place really embraces the concept of customer service.  It is all the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. It was our pleasure to be able to accomidate the marathon for you. We are committed to demonstrating the highest level of customer service. Thank you for choosing the Park Vue Inn as your hotel. We will see you in January.

Summary Heading: Great Location and Amenities at Motel Prices
Summary: You can't beat the location!  Literally across the street in front of the crossing to the main gate of Disneyland and CA Adventure.  Since there is a lot of choices in accommodations, Park Vue Inn makes the added effort of welcome gift baskets for all rooms.  Traveled with family and I thought they overlooked my gift basket since I did not receive one when I checked in.  I found it was delivered to my room later!  My sister received hers when she checked in so you will get a basket one way or another.  The gift basket contained a bottle of wine, 2 bottled waters, fruit, and complimentary bottle opener...not bad for essentially a motel!  I stayed here about 3 years ago before the Cold Stone Creamery and they have made improvements in not only in the lobby but breakfast was
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We see you were able to take advantage of all our amenities. We strive to provide a quality, clean, and affordable home away from home. We hope to be of service to you soon.

Summary Heading: Absolutely the BEST. We'll be back for sure.
Summary: This was my 3rd time staying here.  It has clean and roomy rooms. The beds were VERY comfortable and I slept like a baby every night. I stayed for 7 nights with my family (6 of us in one room) and there were no complaints about anything.  The room service was exceptional and breakfast/evening staff were delightful and friendly.  Pool was clean and the lids loved it.  This hotel is directly across from Disneyland and is perfect for families, groups. friends or couples.  I Hop and Dennys and Maccas are all within a 2 minute walk. I have no hesitations reccommending this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: Great to have been able to provide great service to you once again. See you soon, thank you for your review.

Summary Heading: Wanted to like it more than we did
Summary: Stayed here for the closeness to Disneyland and were thrilled with that.  Nothing better than being able to just walk across the street to the parks.  Unfortunately, that was the best part.   First the good.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  The room did have the new carpet, so that was nice.  Bed was comfortable.  Check in and out were no problem at all and had no issues with correct billing.  Housekeeping was fine for daily service.   Nows the so-so.  Breakfast was just ok.  Not much variety (only Raisin Bran and Fruit Loops for cereal?) and the eggs were icky in my opinion.  But it was free, so shouldn't complain I guess.  The evening food was also just ok.  At least they had salad so there was an option.   The room itself was much smaller than we expected.  We
Manager Response: We apreciate your input and will use this information to better our services.  Thank you for your review. We hope that you will give us another opportunity to be of service.

Summary: This hotel had many great atributes, but it gets a very low score from me because it was just so NOISY in the room at night, that me and my boyfriend got a terrible night's sleep, and because we were so tired, it almost ruined our second day at Disneyland.  The air conditioning made such a racket that we turned it off and then all we could hear was people stomping around above us, people getting out of their cars outside and talking and the loudest buzz from the fridge in our room.  I ended up having to sleep with EARPLUGS in...not what you expect from a $120 a night hotel at all!  My boyfriend kept waking up and as a result was exhausted the next day.  Beds were fairly lumpy, neon lighting in the rooms...all in all a very bad, and depressing night's sleep!  We could see that
Manager Response: We apologize for the noise keeping you up at night. This is something we continue to work on. Our location being accross the street from Disneyland and CA Adventure brings excitement to everyone. Thus causing much of this noise. We thank you for your review and will use this information to improve our property. We hope that you would give us a chance to be of service to you soon.

Summary Heading: Perfect Place for CLOSEST Access to Disneyland and Free Meals
Summary: We have stayed at Disney's Grand Ca, Paradise Pier and other hotels in the area and this hotel has the closest access to the Park (except Disney Grand CA- you can enter into CA Disney from the hotel- but way more expensive).   Our room rate was $109 for two queens, microwave and mini fridge.  Rooms clean.  It's structure is motel with doors opening to outside- but rooms are updated (not TVs).  Staff very friendly and shared they are talking about renovating and adding floors- I'm sure they'd get the business.  The close access to Disneyland is the BEST.   All you do is cross the street and you are there- just need to go down the walkway where shuttles drop off.  The other wonderful benefit is the free breakfast AND free dinner.  We saved so much on meals- it was great.  Decent

Everything was perfect. They even helped us celebrate our anniversary with a welcome gift basket of fruit and California wine (which they gladly exchanged for sparkling cider) and a balloon bouquet with two Mickey mugs filled with chocolate. Rooms are better than most, very clean and well apportioned. Included breakfast buffet is well above standard (included eggs, bacon, sausage, fresh fruit, waffles, biscuits and gravy and much more). And they even offer an included evening meal! The staff were all exceptionally helpful, friendly, professional and smartly attired. Great location and value! We've tried a couple other area hotels, including the Disneyland Hotel, and we've settled on Park Vue as the best,  Here's a little something I saw: At breakfast one day a 5-year-old girl

Summary Heading: 5 minute walk to Disney main gate!
Summary: Stay here for the convenience and the fact that it will save you money. You can walk to the Disneyland Park and Disney California Adventure main gates, as well as the Downtown Disney Shopping Precinct. You won't need to pay for Disney Car Parking nor public transport buses.  Breakfast is included which is not only convenient it will save on a  hefty restaurant bill. Dinner is also included (it's basic, but does the job), so it's feasible to leave the parks around 5pm, have dinner at the hotel, freshen up, and return to the parks for the evening.  We stayed 5 nights in room 247. We are from overseas and didn't have a car so it was important for us to be in a convenient location. This hotel was in the perfect location for us. Plenty of room for the two of us. Two comfy queen beds,
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Glad to have been of service. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Clean, convienant and GREAT customer service!
Summary: We had a great experience at this hotel.  We stayed for 3 nights while we were at Disneyland for the half marathon.  Any time we needed anything we called and they would bring what we asked for in less than 5 minutes!  Everyone was curteous and kind.   They offer free breakfast or a light dinner as well.  We had their breakfast on 2 of the mornings and it was GREAT!   I highly recommend this hotel!  I will be staying here any time I go to Disneyland!!

We booked directly with the hotel and got 2 connecting rooms for our family of 2 Adults and 3 children (8,10 & 14) as we found the rate per room very reasonable. We were given rooms further back on the upper floor and facing the park. Each room had 2 queen beds and 1 bathroom. We were more than comfortable with so much space and 2 bathrooms. The rooms were clean and simply decorated. The front desk staff were very helpful and efficient and there were snacks and drinks at the lobby all day. There's also a computer and printer for guest use which we found useful for printing out some google maps and directions. In the room, we received a very totful welcome basket which was a nice touch. The bathroom was fine with a good shower. The hot breakfast buffet was delicious and had eggs,

Summary Heading: Affordable...and went way beyond our expectations!
Summary: We picked the Park Vue Inn for its super close proximity to Disneyland and it's low price and free parking.  We expected it to be clean and cheap.  It was so much more!   We had an average size room with a Queen bed and bunk beds.  Nothing elaborate or fancy...exactly as described on website.  We stayed 7 nights and enjoyed the complimentary breakfasts and happy hours.  This helped our budget so much because food at the Disney Parks is really expensive.  Again, it was nothing fancy...but it was so convenient.  Also, my kids looked forward to chatting with the friendly staff members each day.  We also enjoyed the pool and hot tub.  Simple and located in the parking lot - but you can see the fireworks from them!  I didn't expect to use them as much as we did - but we came during a

My family, 2 adults & 2 children aged 5&6 stayed were based here for a week whilst visiting Disneyland and area.  We paid $1000 for the week, a lot cheaper than a disney hotel.  The hotel is located across the road from disney resort, which was great if you wanted a break from the park during the day.  The hotel is well run, clean and good size rooms, breakfast is included as is a light evening buffet.  Staff are friendly and v helpful.  You do not need anything more for a visit to disneyland.  I would highly recommend this hotel and definitely would return.

We stayed here from August 3 - August 10 and it was great!  Staff were very friendly and accomodating.  Rooms were very clean aside from the carpet.  We wore shoes all the time in the room.  Great location to Disneyland.  The meals were perfect and helped the pocket book immensely!  We even got to have the dinner on the day we checked out even though check out is at 11am.  We really thought that was great.  The pool was perfect for the kids.  At night it was very quiet.  We would definitely stay here again.  Jusy hope they get the carpets changed before we go back.  Another suggestion would be to have th front desk cash traveller's cheques.  Thanks Park Vue!  Hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Very nice To be right across the street from Disneyland!
Summary: Nice Place, clean, comfortable, affordable, and directly across from the park! Highly recommended! Full Breakfast!

Summary Heading: The Best Place to Stay in Disneyland!
Summary: We went to Disneyland last year (December 30),  and we stayed at this hotel. I can not  stress enough the comfort and cleanliness of the rooms. The breakfast buffet was fantastic! It is literally in front of the Disneylan Entrance.. probably a five minute walk, or less.. The staffs are great as well. I think this is the best bang for your buck.! I could stay at the Marriott or Hyatt but why when Park Vue is not only an excellent value, but also have really clean rooms.... less the luxury. Thank you, Park Vue! I will be staying at your hotel this coming December!

Summary Heading: Couldn't ask for a better place to stay in Anaheim.
Summary: We came for a five day trip to Disneyland and after umming and ahhing over hotels in the area decided to book this one due to its proximity to the park and its reviews on TA. We were pleasantly surprised with the cleanliness, facilities and also the complimentary breakfast and tea. Many people suggested staying at one of the Disneyland resorts because they are right next to the park, but I argue that PVI is actually closer (I may be wrong, but the walk through Downtown Disney seemed longer). I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family if they decided on a trip to Disneyland. If I come back I'll stay here again without doubt.

Summary Heading: Every time we come back we have a wonderful experience
Summary: Every year for my  daughters birthday,  I take them to Disneyland.  I always stay at the Park Vue Inn.  I  love this place because is affordable, clean, and everybody is that works there is very nice.  Besides is only at walking distance to Disneyland and CA  Adventure.  The rooms are  always kept clean and have a microwave and a small refrigerator for your convenience. They provide breakfast and happy hour with no alcoholic beverages in the afternoon.  People at this hotel always makes you feel welcome.  I highly recommend it!

Summary Heading: Park Vue is an amazing value, best place to stay for Disney parks
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue from 8-22 through 8-26 2011 and had a wonderful stay. I've stayed in a variety of hotels in the Disneyland area as well as around the world, and for  this location Park Vue wins hands down even over the more upscale resorts and hotels. The staff is amazing and kind, the location can not be beat. Directly across from the parks via a busy intersection. It's a quick walk about 5 or 7 mins and you're in the parks! You can also see the fireworks from the pool. It's great to come back to your room for mini breaks in the afternoon and be so close by.  The extras from the Park Vue make this motel a very big value. Free parking, free wifi in the lobby, lemonade and cookies, you can ask for free bottles of cold water at the desk (they did ask our name and room

We were looking for the "perfect" hotel for our first trip to Disneyland with our 2 young kids (4, 1.5) and one mom.   1st surprise- this hotel is literally across the street from Disney.  There are many others close by but none closer that I could see! 2nd surprise- the rooms had a more updated look than I expected.  Not fancy, but definitely serviceable, clean, neat and contemporary. 3rd surprise- quieter room than anticipated (and I'm pretty sensitive.  We had an upstairs room not too close to the stairs).  We felt this place was a good value for the price paid, given the location, the quality of the room and the amenities of a nice, basic breakfast buffet and water from the front desk.  I'd recommend it to friends for sure.

We will be back!  My family and I rented 2 suites and 1 room with 2 queens & bunk beds for a mini family reunion.  The staff was AMAZING, the rooms were updated and clean,  they brought a gift basket t our room and called after check-in to make sure we were satisfied.  They had refreshments and treats in the lobby (all the time), free wi-fi and even a computer in the lobby if you need it.  Free parking, they even have 2 free meals a day to take advantage of and Yes it is more than just a continental breakfast.  Dinner was salad, soup and an entree like sliders, or tacos, or chicken nuggets.  Best of all they are right across the street from both Disney Park entrances, all for a very reasonable price.  I have been to Disneyland and stayed in hotels in the area at least 25 times

Summary Heading: wish someone had recommended this hotel sooner
Summary: Myself and 4 members of my family stayed at this fabulous hotel in one of their suites for 10 days over July 4th.  This is definitely the best place I've stayed at in Disneyland.  Their staff was so helpful and the suite had been renovated and was beautiful.  They had a welcome basket for us which we appreciated greatly.  The breakfast was great and was plentiful every day.  They had a hospitality hour which we didn't take advantage of but heard it had sliders, macaroni and cheese, hot dogs, etc.  We did come back early for July 4th and their lunchean area was all decorated and there was a full spread of food, cake and all.  The pool was well was clean, warm and there was plenty of shade.  I will definitely be rebooking this hotel on any subsequent trips and we do come often.

Summary Heading: Hands down the best motel for Disneyland
Summary: I have stayed in a wide range of places from youth hostels in South America to the Mandarin Hotel in Thailand and I would definitely recommend The Park Vue Inn.  I can't really add much to all the other reviews:  clean, convenient amenities (body wash, hand soap, lotion, shampoo with hair conditioner), great location and incredibly friendly and helpful service.    The ability to easily come back to the hotel for a swim and rest at the middle of the day is great.    I love that they don't nickel and dime you for everything.  They let me keep my car parked in the lot after I checked out for the day because I still wanted to go to Disney for half a day before heading home.    I did the ballpark math for 3 people and when I subtract what I would pay for breakfast, parking, shuttle

Right across the road from front gate of Disneyland, best location you could want. The staff were very helpful, welcome hamper in room was lovely. The room was clean & very comfy with 2 queen size beds. Breakfast offered an amazing choice with the option of making your own waffles, certainly a bonus. This hotel is great value for money, not only so close to Disneyland that you can return for a short break during the day, but also close to large shopping & restaurant centre.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are glad to have been able to provide great value. See you soon.

Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue Inn from August 13-21, 2011.  The location CAN NOT be beat for Disneyland!  Our room was 107 and we could walk out our door to the intersection which was less than 50 yards away, and cross the street directly onto the Disney property.  This hotel/motel is the closest one to the parks, hands down.  We got a fruit & wine basket on our first day, and meal vouchers for breakfast and a light dinner daily.  Breakfast was make your own waffles (great), fruit, pastries, drinks, some kind of meat and usually something else like potatoes or eggs, etc.  "Light dinner" was just that...we only made it back to the hotel a few times for that...one time it was little chicken patties with buns, salad, chips, etc.  Not meant to be a full dinner, but could definitely hold
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Bricio has read your kind words and is very thankful. We are a Disney's Good Neighbor Hotel, we are currently not advertising on the Disney web page. We hope to be of service to you again soon.

Summary: I am so glad that we chose the Park Vue Inn for our Disneyland visit.  The hotel's location is definitely the best, since you can walk to Disneyland and not worry about parking fees, taking the shuttle, etc.  The hotel price includes a full hot breakfast in the morning and appetizers in the afternoon. The staff was courteous and efficient.  I mentioned that my husband and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary and they put complimentary balloons, fruit, wine, and candy in our room!   The rooms were clean, the IHOP restaurant is next to the hotel, and there is even an outlet store on the hotel, so you can buy all kinds of Disney toys, hats, shirts at a much discounted price than at the park.   We will definitely return!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. It was a pleasure to be of service. Again Happy Aniversary, we hope to see you soon.

Summary: This was a great hotel for us to venture to Disney.  We had a renovated 2 bedroom suite which was roomy-the only downfall was only 1 washroom and with 6 people it is nice to have 2.   The window a/c units also tend to be noisy.  The breakfast was a nice way to start the day and there are many restaurants close by if you don't want to eat in the park.  It is great they let you park early the day of your arrival so you can be off to the parks.  This was a great value for the money.

Nice welcome ,since there was a bottle of wine and a friendly welcome letter at the room. good breakfast and a evening brunch was always there at the reception. the best place to stay, since there is right across the street from Disneyland entrance and you can walk back to the hotel for a nap.

Summary Heading: This is the only place we stay
Summary: Directly across the street from Disney entrance. Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Includes breakfast and light dinner. Upon arrival we have always received a package with fruit, wine and waters. The service is great. There are restaurants nearby, and a cold stone ice cream attached to the front of the hotel. We never stay anywhere else.

Summary Heading: So close to Disneyland, definely would recommend!
Summary: I chose to book with Park Vue Inn after reading so many reviews and we were not disappointed! Some of the reasons for choosing this hotel were it's proximity to Disneyland, free parking, free wifi, free breakfast, the pool, in-room safe and the free water from the hotel lobby. Unfortunately, the reviews I read about the water led me to believe it was just there in the lobby, but I never saw it and didn't ask. Now after returning home and reading more reviews I see that I should have asked at the front desk. Instead, I did spend quite a bit at the gift shop for a flat of water, but it was still way better than buying water within the park, and the fridge in the room had a freezer that I put a few bottles in and they were still cold when we needed them, during the heat of the

Summary Heading: Great experience and so close to the action
Summary: We always take our ratings pretty seriously, so when we give a hotel a five rating, it has to really earn it.  Granted, the Park Vue is a three-star class hotel, but when we review a hotel, we take everything into account, so the value and service you get can take a three-star hotel and turn it into a five-star experience.  We arrived at the Park Vue for a Disneyland vacation at around 2:30pm and our room was already available, which was nice.  We got to unpack a bit before we headed into the Disneyland resort.  The lady at the check-in desk was very nice and got my husband checked in very quickly while I waited with our two sons (five and three years old) in the car.  On a hot July day, they had iced water with slices of lemon as well as some freshly baked cookies in the lobby.

We have just left the Park Vue Inn today and couldn't wait to write a review. I booked this motel based on the Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed. Everything everyone else has said is true. We arrived from Australia after a 14 hour flight and were so happy to arrive and be able to park our car straight away. We also loved the free bottled water, cookies and fruit. we had breakfast there every morning and it was great. We had dinner there a few times and it was ok to see us through to some Disneyland snacks. The pool was great, and it was so convenient to come back to the motel in the afternoon for a rest. The location and value cannot be beat. Thank you Park Vue Inn!

We enjoyed being so close to the main entrance of Disneyland.   Great for travelers like us who had small children along. The room was on the smaller side, but fine for the amount of time we spent in it.  Most of the time very quiet and beds were comfortable.  The added bonus of the breakfast and light dinner are extra good deals- we saved a lot of money eating those meals at the hotel.   Staff is friendly and helpful.  Kids also enjoyed the pool and spa.  And we could watch the fireworks from our room or up on the patio.  Very good hotel.

My family and I recently stayed at Park Vue Inn while visiting Disneyland. We had an incredible experience. Not only were the rooms very nice and clean, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. They went above and beyond to ensure that our stay was a pleasant one, and it was! Aside from the wonderful service received, the location is very close to Disneyland and California Adventure and within walking distance to many restaurants and shopping. I will defiantly be back and would most defiantly refer anyone to stay at Park Vue Inn. I would like to extend a BIG thank you to the staff for their hospitality.

Summary Heading: We had a great time, we'll be back!
Summary: The Park Vue was alittle expensive, but it was exactly what we needed for this trip. It was clean, and directly across the street to Disney. We were surprized with a nice wine and fruit basket in our room that was alittle out dated but very clean.  Free breakfast and a light dinner everyday really help us out and the pool was great, never busy. The only complaint we may have is the front desk could have been more friendly and helpful but we intentionally did not call on them much. Also, stay away from the little gift shop, they are also not very helpful or freindly, and expensive.

My family of four stayed at the Park Vue Inn for three nights.  Our primary goal was to stay as close to the park as possible, so we wouldn't have to walk far or worry about driving from a hotel to the park and pay for the parking.  This couldn't have been better.  The Park Vue Inn is located right at the pedestrian crosswalk that is straight up the walk to the main gates of California Adventure and Disneyland about 375 yards.  The staff were extremely helpful and  very generous in accommodating our needs, and exceeded our expectations.  The rooms were very well thought out, in regards to providing the little things that are helpful in a hotel room.  Like enough places to hang all of the towels for four people, iron and ironing board, in room security safe, nonslip mat in

We stayed here for 3 nights and loved it!  The rooms although not fancy are very clean, spacious and comfortable. As other reviewers have commented, the location can't be beat!  The free breakfast and free parking put them over the top for value. We will be staying here again!

We stayed here for a few nights in April and had a very nice time.  The rooms were immaculate, beds were comfy, staff was friendly, and the breakfast was hearty -- cellophane-wrapped donuts here, but a good selection of hearty and healthy food, along with treats if you want to indulge.   It was a great value... we had one of the rooms with bunk beds and it worked out perfectly for our family.  It wasn't huge, but we all slept well and we weren't spending a whole lot of time in our room anyway.  And, you can't beat the location.  The entrance to the Disney Parks is literally across the street... a 5-10 minute walk to the Disneyland entrance.  My husband carried my sleeping son back from the park.  We'll be back!

Summary Heading: We loved it and will definately be back.  This is the place to stay!!!
Summary: We arrived to Park Vue Inn before check in.  They let us park our vehicle on the property and use all the amenities until check in time.  This hotel offers lemonade, fruit punch, lemon water, coffee, hot tea, and cookies or pastries throughout the entire day.  As well they have a beautiful breakfast with large variety (everything you can think of) as well as serve a dinner.  The dinner has a different entree nightly but always includes 3 different soups, salad, and a jello.   The rooms are very roomy and clean.  The refrigerator is larger than standard room refrigerators and worked out very well.   The beds and pillows were very comfy.   All accomodations were met throughout our stay.  The staff was very friendly and easy to talk to.  We saved so much money not having to

RIGHT ACROSS the road from Disneyland.  Reasonable price with lots of great extras, such as free full breakfast and dinner!!!  Nice pool and fitness room.  Even a welcome basket!  New carpet!  They work hard to keep things quiet...and it was.  Really enjoyed our stay!  Connecting room was a huge help with our large family.  All of our requests were accomodated (crib, bottom floor, connecting room.)  Rooms were nicely cleaned each day, and staff was friendly and helpful.  We will definitlely stay here again!!!

Summary Heading: Wow - Even better than the reviews!
Summary: Have just stayed here with my 3 children (and my brother and nephew who were in a separate room). I can't praise this hotel highly enough. The staff were very friendly; the room was great (we were in a queen bed + bunks which was ideal for me as a 1 parent + 3 children - aged 12, 14 and 18) - it includes a decent sized fridge, coffee maker and microwave oven and a good bathroom. The beauty of the hotel is it's location directly across the road from Disneyland -it enabled the kids to go back and forth, you can virtually see your room from the Disney gates! We didn't use the Coldstone Creamery on site as it seemed expensive but ate at the IHop next door, there are many fast food places nearby and the Garden Walk shopping complex which is a 10 minute walk away has several

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn early August and have to say overall we enjoyed our stay. They are located directly across the street from the entrance, although the actual entrance to Disney and California Land is still a little of a walk. This was a nice experience because our family has never stayed quite so close before. The breakfast was decent. They had waffles and pancakes, always a hot sides like eggs and/or bacon/potatoes. Fruit and cereals, cottage cheese and pastries. We enjoyed this everyday. In addition, they do indeed have a "lite" supper. Its not really all that "lite," you can have as much as you like. One night they had enchiladas and another night they had hamburger sliders. If you utilize these two amenities, then you can save considerable money. Now its not

We were highly impressed with the hotel upon arriving. Its directly across the street from Disneyland which is super convenient for us since we have to young kids for naps.  Breakfast was good and social hour was enough to keep your belly full! We will stay again when we go back to Disney when the kids are older.
