Summary Heading: This will be our first choice if we are ever in Anaheim again
Summary: Wow! You can get no better location than this.  The pool is great.  Our room had a bunk bed for our two girls and they loved this. The room had everything you could imagine needing. The only down side to this was that there was no room for your suitcases. We just unpacked what we were going to be using and left the suitcases in the car. The complimentary breakfast was amazing as well. To do a wash was only $1 and same for dryer! I had planned for $2 each. Even though this is not a Disney owned hotel it had the warm welcoming feel we always have when we stay in Disney owned property at Disney World. Our last night we stayed in Paradise Pier (Disney hotel). I preferred the location of Park Vue Inn. I think the only one that would beat it for location would be Grand Californian,

My kids and I stayed here for the first time on our visit to Disneyland this summer and found this hotel just right for our needs.  The front office staff was extremely helpful and pleasant, the room was clean and comfortable, and the convenience to Disneyland couldn't be beat.  The upstairs room we had was surprisingly quiet (though this could have been just a stroke of luck based on schools not being out yet in the LA area and guest volume low), but we appreciated each good night's sleep.  We enjoyed the pool and hot tub--clean, well kept, uncrowded--and the fresh cookies and drinks in the lobby were a nice treat.  The room came with a complimentary basket with fruit, water bottles and a choice of wine or sparkling cider, and the mini-fridge kept everything cold.  We visited

Summary Heading: Fine Hotel. Been there twice and there will be a third time!
Summary: Park Vue Inn review My wife, two daughters and me have been to this hotel 6 years ago and I confess I didn't remember how was our stay. Only remembered the excelent location and that we had no complaints. For me is easier to remember bad things than good ones, so we decided to try it again.  This time my mother, who is 75, went with us. Also my brother who lives in Vancouver - Canada stayed in this hotel with his wife and his two boys, following our advice. We stayed from july 22nd thru july 29th.  We arrived late, at about midnight, and everything was ready, both connecting rooms, and we could fastly go to bed after a long trip (I'm from Brazil).  Breakfast was very good and the person responsible to check our breakfast tickets was very polite. Waffles, toast, omelet, bacon,

Summary Heading: My new favorite place to stay!
Summary: We decided to give this hotel a try when the place we were staying at started parking fees, and we're so glad we did! I love that they have not followed suit incharging parking fees for their guests (which I completely disagree with), and it seems more like an independently owned property as opposed to a corporate chain. Upon check in there are cookies, fruit and beverages for guests to enjoy. Once you get into your room, there is a fruit & wine (if you don't want the wine, simply call the front desk & tell them you prefer apple cider, and they'll swap it out) basket with a personalized letter waiting for you! The rooms are nice, particularly the 2 queen suite, which is like a little one bedroom apartment, & the beds are comfy! The free breakfast is so much better than other

The breakfast at the Park Vue was really special.  It had so many good choices for adults and for kids.   They always have fresh baked cookies at the front desk and something cold to drink too.  The kids get balloons and my grandson always looks forward to it because it makes him feel special. The rooms are clean and the whole hotel has a very safe feel to it. The front desk people are always happy and very helpful :)

This was our first trip to Disneyland with our 5 year old granddaughter.  I am so glad we chose the Park Vue Inn.  Our flight was early and we arrived at the hotel around 11 AM.  They held our bags and we immediately crossed the street and entered Disneyland.  We arrived back at the hotel around 4 and our room was ready along with the fruit and wine gift basket.  Our room was very clean, comfortable and quiet.  We ate the  breakfast every day and also came back to the hotel for the social hour and swimming.  The pool was very clean during our stay.  My granddaughter  told the desk it was my birthday and I was given a birthday cake from Cold Stone which the three of us ate while watching the Disneyland fireworks on the patio.  What a great way to end a perfect birthday!  There

We stayed for 2 nights to visit Disneyland and our idea was for a hotel to lay down our heads before hitting the theme park but this hotel is worth more than this.  The reception area was very inviting, with drinks and biscuits available.  Our room, which contained two double beds, was spacious with a great walk-in shower.  We were left a welcoming pack containing fruit and a bottle of wine.  At 5-00 a small buffet was laid on which was enough to 'fill the gap' before returning to the theme park.  Whilst the breakfast wasn't anything wonderful there was plenty of it with a reasonable choice of food, much better than some hotels we'd stayed in.  The hotel couldn't have been handier for the park.  We didn't have chance to use the pool and it was a shame we hadn't booked another

Excellent room service, and friendly attendants. Food was great! Room was very clean. Pool and hottub was very nice, clean and well kept. Very well located right across the street from Disneylands' entrance.

After reading a ton of reviews we chose the Park Vue Inn for our family trip to Disneyland.  The location was absolutely a huge bonus, but then there's also free parking, free wifi, and free breakfast?  PERFECT!  We had 2 rooms that were adjoining.  There was 6 of us and this worked perfectly.  The rooms were very clean and had brand new carpet.  I was concerned being on the ground floor but it was totally fine.  We got to the Park Vue about 12:30 on the day we were checking in, they allowed us to check in and offered to hold our luggage until the rooms were ready.  When I cam back at about 3:30pm, not only were the rooms ready, I was pleased to hear that they delivered our luggage to the rooms!  They had also delivered some balloons and a mug filled with sweet treats for my

Summary Heading: Everything was great except for feces in the pool
Summary: We chose this hotel due to its proximity to Disneyland and the positive Trip Advisor reviews.  The front desk staff were generally very friendly and helpful.  They always made sure apples, cookies, and lemonade were available at the front desk.   However, I saw no evidence of free bottled water but perhaps I needed to ask for it.  When we checked into our room, we were greeted by a lovely gift basket which included a bottle of Californian wine.  The breakfast was adequate but I opted for the continental items as the hot items looked like cheap microwave fare ("scrambled eggs" were flat round eggy disks).  The supper was very processed but I enjoyed the big salad.  All in all, the food was adequate ... except for the cookies which were really good!  Our room was small but clean

Summary Heading: Clean Rooms, Friendly Staff, Right Across Street from Disneyland
Summary: There are several similarily priced good neighbor hotels near Disneyland, I reviewed many before settling on Park Vue Inn. What brought us to Park Vue Inn was the hot breakfast and the closeness to DL, literally right across the street! They also give you chilled water bottles at the front desk if you ask to take into the parks.  Rooms were clean and quiet, we asked for and recieved a second floor room. Breaksfast wasn't super fancy, but it was hot and met our needs. Hot waffles every day for me, those were pretty good. We did not take part in the lite dinner option available, so cannot comment on that as we were always in the parks at those time.  Pool is not that fancy or big, but again met our needs of a place to cool off in the afternoon.  IHOP and Coldstone Creamery in same

After doing much analysis about which hotels to stay in for our first time to Disneyland, and since we have a baby (don't want to walk too far) we decided that you can't beat Park Vue's location since it is the FIRST hotel at the mouth of the Disneyland entrance.    After staying there, we realized we were right...and that most hotels are "about the same in terms of price and quality" and that the location based decision was paramount for us.  Imagine going home after hours of walking and being tired, and having to walk another 20 minutes with two tired kids.  I also liked the fun food that they had for breakfast and dinner, which they call Social Hour.  I especially liked the yummy breakfast potatoes, biscuits, fresh do-it-yourself waffles.  They have warm cookies and cold

We had a minor hic-up in the beginning. Barico was awesome. Fernando tried to make up for his attitude in the beginning. And Ernesto needs to learn some customer service skills. When a guest asks for a manager get a manager! I don't care that it's sunday, that's what they get paid for. Make sure you count your pillows when you arrive because when you leave and it's not the amount they say you will be charged $10 for each pillow missing! The pool was awesome the food is microwaved just like everybody says but it's free and for dinner the adults might want to go elsewhere because it is for the kids. If you stay for dinner eat salad. One awesome thing that Brian(One of the managers) did for my husband is get him sugar free syrup for his waffles because he's diabetic. So if you need

Summary Heading: Our third time at Park Vue and now even better!
Summary: This is our third stay with the Park Vue Inn, and they just keep getting better.  The breakfast now includes two waffle makers, pancakes or french toast that you can heat up, and a daily selection of hot items, like eggs, or omletes, potatoes, bacon or sausage.  Plus their usual fare of cereal and toast, donuts, juices, etc.  They also now serve a light dinner, which for us did the trick.  Every day there is a salad course available, two soups, plus a hot main course type item. Menu for each of the five days this week was mac and cheese and chicken nuggets, tacos, mini hamburgers, enchiladas, and chili and nachos.  We were able to go to the park after breakfast, come back in the afternoon for a nap and rest (easy walk since it's the closest hotel to the parks), eat our light

They were so organized.  Clean rooms, friendly staff, the entire stay was great!  The food was awesome.  Your stay includes breakfast (yummy) and light dinner (incredible) for a very reasonable price.  I would recommend this place to everyone.  Also, you can walk to Disneyland, its right across the street!!!

About as close to the Disney main gate as you can get.  Friendly staff.  Clean.  Good price compared to surrounding hotels.  You are greeted in your room with a personalized welcome letter and fruit/wine basket. They call you shortly after your arrival to make sure you are satisfied with your room.  Plus: FREE parking. FREE breakfast (including eggs, sausage, waffles, pastries). FREE light dinner. FREE punch, lemonade, pastries, cookies always available at front desk. FREE botted water available at front desk (grab several and take them into the park).

We stayed in the Park Vue Inn in july 2011. Perfect location.  Management was very helpfull and eager to meet your needs. Free car parking. Room very complete; everything was there. Basket with fruit and wine, (with corkscrew) safe in room. Kids liked bunkbed. Breakfast elaborate, on terrace. In evening you can watch the fireworks from Disneyland on the terrace. Swimmingpool clean. We will recommend this hotel to everyone. Excellent value for money. Angela Eleveld, The Neherlands  Tip for the owners: open laundry earlier; people want to go to disneyland very early and want to do laundry before that time

Summary Heading: Great deal for Disneyland visitors and we would love to stay here again
Summary: Location to Disneyland cannot be beat.  The hotel staff was extremely friendly and efficient.  Breakfast buffet beat any "continental" breakfast I have had at a hotel.  The kids enjoyed the pool.  I would highly recommend this hotel to any family wanting to go to Disneyland on a budget.

Staff is always very helpful. Recently, we were helped bt Bricio (sp?). Amazing service at 11:30PM at night. The Park Vue is a nice hotel for a very good value and with staff like Bricio making you feel like you are spending $500 a night.

Summary Heading: Nice place, very well situated for Disney
Summary: Very nice little place, situated just across the road from Disney.  I found the staff very professional and helpful. The pool area was a bonus also.  I would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Park Vue Inn is the Disneyland hotel to stay at.
Summary: My friend/co-worker recommended staying at this hotel. I had never stayed here before. Two things made me take is recommendation. First was the fact that it is right at the entrance to Disneyland. Walk out your hotel room door and walk about 50 yards to the security check point. Second was the fact that they have a Cold Stone creamery at the hotel and they deliver to your room!   The rooms are comfortable. It was quiet. The staff were pleasant, and the Breakfast was better than most. I did not use the pool, however there were kids using it when I was walking over to Disneyland and it looked clean and very inviting.  Refrigerator and Microwave in the room was nice and they even left me a complementary fruit basket with water bottles and a bottle of wine (you can sub for apple

Summary Heading: Perfect Disneyland Vacation for Family of 5!
Summary: We picked the Park Vue Inn based on the reviews posted to Trip Advisor and other sites.  It exceeded our expectations.  The room was ready when we checked in, the desk staff was very nice and accommodating.  Each room comes with a personalized welcome letter and welcome gift basket with a bottle of wine, bottled water, and fresh fruit.    We stayed in the 3-Queen room...perfect for our family of five.  The rooms are large, especially the over-sized bathrooms!  Perfect for getting ready all at the same time.  Each room has a refrigerator and a microwave as well.  The beds and pillows are comfortable, nice, big screen flat-panel tvs (we had two in our room).    Each morning started with a buffet breakfast (waffles, eggs, potatoes, sausage, pastries, bagels, cereal, fresh fruit,

Summary Heading: Doesn't get any closer than this to DISNEY
Summary: my family & I stayed here for a week in July. We booked the queen bed with bunkbeds room for ourselves and our 3 children..  The room was spotlessly clean but quite small after we added our luggage and the pack n play. There is a small area with a fridge, microwave and coffee maker. and then a hanging rail with safe underneath. Kids enjoyed the bunkbeds and the little area that end of the room to play with their toys.  The bathroom is very clean, a good size with a small vanity area, shower is good too. No problems with hot water or water pressure etc. Welcome basket in the room was a nice touch too.  Our room was on the ground floor and somedays if we were lucky enough our car was parked right outside too.  Had problems connecting to the internet and only managed to connect one

Summary Heading: Very convenient to all attractions, great staff, great location
Summary: My daughter and I were impressed with the Park Vue Inn, for its locality, the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, and the basic, yet comfortable room.  It was so close to Disneyland, and the budget buffet and family restaurants in this location were all right on our doorstep.  The office staff were all helpful and attentive to our needs, and we would definitely be staying in this central, convenient location again.  The walls are quite thin and we could hear the people next door at times, but it was not too bad.  We were glad of the breakfast each morning, and the free early evening meals  were basic, but nice.  The pool was relaxing and refreshing.

When we arrived at the hotel for our stay 7/23 through 7/29/11, we were pleasantly suprised to be greated by two very helpful and pleasant individuals at the front desk.  We then headed to our room and found a welcome basket with fruit and wine which we traded for apple juice as well as a welcome letter addressed for us, a mini coldstone gift certificate for a birthday cake for my daughter, a bouquet of balloons, and a mini princess bucket of candy and pencils.  She was thrilled!  The welcoming us to the hotel was very positive.  I would say this was about the only pleasant thing we experienced at this hotel.  We typically stay at the Candy Cane Inn across the street (fabulous) or the Double Tree down the street and have always been very happy.  We thought we would try this

We hadn't, booked in advance as we have been traveling along the coast, so called in on the off chance they would have a room, to our surprise they had there jacuzzi room available for a very reasonable rate,this room certainly had the whow factor. The hotel is right outside Disney's main gate and within walking distance of a number of restaurant,The Ohop next door is great for breakfast. The staff are friendly and helpful, all in all a great stay.

This is more of a motel than hotel, but still nice.  Directly across from the pedestrian entrance to Disneyland, you can't argue with its location.   A minor kerfluffle with our room was quickly and courteously resolved.  Fruitbasket w/ white wine a charming welcome.  Couples, book one of the two King Bed rooms with a jacuzzi for two in them!  You won't regret it, and the rate is really reasonable.   Morning breakfast is rather plebian, and the 'social hour' didn't thrill at all, but for rates and location, and the sheer friendliness of the staff, you can't beat the Park Vue Inn.

Very average, very clean. Pool average, Most everything average. But free parking and a very short walk to Disney. Stay here! Arrived to a nice fruit basket and bottle of wine in our room, with a personalized welcome letter. Can't beat that. And having a clean room that was perfectly nice after a long day was perfeect. Everyday went back to the room for about 1 hour to rest. So close, it can't be beat. Stayed at a few Dinsney hotels, but this was the best. You really won't regret staying here.

Some places can bost location, some can boast service, some can boast amenities as well, but if you wanted to get a place that offered more than one of those perks at the same time, you will most likely overpay for it.  Not at the Park Vue.  You quite simply cannot beat the being across the street from Disneyland (unless you aren't there for Disneyland)...not across the street and down the block but RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET.  And free parking...need I say anymore about that?    So...there are a couple of hotel/motels right next to them, but then I present to you this:  How many of them offer free breakfast?  Is it a menu order breakfast?  Nope.  Is it just a plain old continental breakfast?  Nope.  What you will have is a few dry cereals, your donut array, a make your own waffle

Summary Heading: Plan to visit again!  Great Trip!
Summary: Our stay at the Park Vue Inn was great!  I was surprised for such a small Inn, the personalized service we received; from a gift basket which includes wine - to complimentary large breakfast (GREAT), and light dinner.  The staff is very friendly and professional and pay a lot of attention to detail.  We definitely stay at this lovely Inn again.  It's right across from Disneyland and you can stay (parking free) at Disneyland for several hours, go back to your room and relax for a couple hours, and then head back to Disneyland to finish the evening with parades and fireworks!!  We loved our stay and plan to do it again and again..

This was our second time taking our kids to Disneyland and first time staying at the Park Vue Inn.    Our first trip was in September 2009 and we stayed in the Paradise Pier, a Disney resort hotel.  Yes, the Paradise Pier is a 'fancier' hotel, but it is way more expensive and  a longer walk to Disneyland than Park Vue Inn.    Let's face it, when at Disneyland, your time is mostly spent at Disneyland, and your hotel is a place for sleep and a rest in the afternoon if needed.  It was so nice to come back to the Park Vue  in the afternoon when the temperature soared for a refreshing lemonade and apples, and to take a dip in the pool, which was very clean.   There are a lot of 'free' things that Park Vue offers that make it such a great deal.  I know they have been mentioned before

The front desk and housekeeping employees were very friendly and helpful, the "breakfast guy" left something to be desired.  We got a room with new carpet, so that was good.  Rooms are basic, seemed clean, bathrooms could definitely use some updating.  Beds were actually pretty comfortable and we got a nice fruit and wine basket that was unexpected.  The free breakfast was definitely not one of the better ones I've had.  Spent two nights with a friend for an adult's only trip to Dland, not sure I'd bring the kids back there, but I'm picky.  But for the cost and proximity, overall it was good.

Summary Heading: We will loved it and will go back!
Summary: The hotel location is really tough to beat, and easy walk even at the end of a long day.  The rooms were not large, but did not feel overcrowded.  Hubby and I took our son for a surprise trip and found the room comfortable for the three of us.  We had bunk beds, a small closet area, a microwave, coffee maker and dorm size refrigerator and then a queen bed for us.  There was also a desk and two chairs.  If you were to eat in the room it would either be on the bed or floor unless you took turns at the desk but otherwise we had everything we needed.  I was a little worried about the room location - first floor by the ice machine - but only heard the outside world once through the weekend when someone was filling a cooler.  Breakfast was decent, lots of choices.  They had toast and

Summary Heading: The best and a view of disneyland!!!!!!!!!! im comiing back!!!!!!!!
Summary: This hotel was great! they had great service and its a beautiful hotel and they make it house  warming! i recomend this to everybody who wants to go to disneyland or any place near it!!!!!!!!!!!!

Summary Heading: Second stay was as good as the first
Summary: Stayed here summer of 2010 for a first trip to Disneyland with my brother, sister-in-law and 4yr old niece.  This time we brought Grandma and Grandpa too.  Asked for 2 adjoining rooms and while not guaranteed that is what we did get.  Worked great for my now 5yr old niece to be able to go back and forth.  Took in an Anaheim Mighty Ducks Hockey game and found the arena to be just a short drive away.  Breakfast was still as varied as before and everyone got enough to eat.  Welcome baskets were lovely again and it is an absolute plus being able to leave the car there and walk to Disneyland!!  The only complaint we had this time was that one room did not have a stopper for the bathtub but the adjoining rooms solved that problem.  We would definitely stay here again!!

Summary Heading: An economical price to stay with an excellent service in front of Disneyland
Summary: My family and friends who went to Disneyland this July highly recommend this place to stay anywhere near Los Angeles and it's right in front the Disney gate.  A truly economical price to stay when all basic amenities inclusive and carefully maintain by the staff who endlessly deliver an excellent service to accommodate our pleasant experience likewise to every travellers.  Our multiple nights booking in different times in different rooms for nearly a week were consistent to the services they have all provided.  Thanks to the staff for all your hard work.  Allow me to name a few of you:  Fernando, the gracious lady, and all the people at the desk who firstly assisted my wife;  and Brian you rock!  Keep up all the good work Guys!   We look forward to see you next time.  Ciao,

Summary Heading: We're definitely choosing this hotel again!
Summary: Here's why we're choosing this hotel again (and again) whenever we visit Disneyland:   1.  Friendly, professional staff  2.  All the lemonade, fruit punch and coffee that you want after that long trip to Anaheim 3. Permitted parking 4.  Clean rooms with a comfortable bed for the parents and fun, snug bunk beds for the kids 5. A refrigerator, microwave, etc. 6. Tons of toiletries  7. A welcome gift basket of fruit and wine 8. pool and gym,  9. As much breakfast as you want  10. Directly across the entrance  to Disneyland 11. More than reasonable rates, especially when we're AAA members Need we say more?

I just returned from a fabulous stay at the Park Vue INN.  My husband and I have visited many of the area hotels in the past and up until now our favorite was the Grand California Hotel on Disneyland property.  The Park Vue Inn is the closest non Disney Hotel you can get, actually I think its a shorter walk than the "Disneyland Hotel".  We stayed in a suite with a kitchen for 3 nights and I paid about 2/3 of what I did last summer for a basic room for only 2 nights at the Grand California.  I know you can't compare Grand Californian hotel to the Park Vue but if you are going to the park, you won't be in your room anyway!   I think the room was very modern looking, comfortable beds, quiet, very close parking and clean.  Great for families, especially the breakfast, dinner and

This hotel isn't the fanciest, but it was nice and the value was fantastic. A little dated, but clean. We spent the night so we could go to the parks over 2 days. We got a really nice full self serve breakfast for all 5 of us (a nice $ saver), and if we had made it back to the hotel that night we could have had dinner too. Car parking alone for 2 days at Disneyland would have been $30, and this hotel didn't mind us parking early. We didn't need much from them, but the staff we dealt with on the phone to book it and in person were all very nice. We will stay here again.

We had the best time at Park Vue in this summer. The hotel was great...but one thing stood out....The excellent customer service. One young man in particular named Bricio was friendly and helpful and really made us feel welcome. He happened to be in the parking area when we pulled up and helped us with our luggage. Later that day we had a problem with our key and he remembered us and our room number and helped us right away. Whenever we saw him around the property we were greeted with smiles and a friendly hello. He also happened to be the person who checked us out and was soo helpful and even assisted us in printing out our boarding passes for our flight back to Hawaii. His overall attitude was great!! He was positive, friendly, helpful and genuine. Big Mahalo to Bricio..we

What a nice surprise!  We took our 5 year old granddaughter to Disneyland and wanted a location within walking distance to eliminate parking fees and the high cost of the Disney hotels.  The Park Vue was ideal; literally across the street from then entrance; a welcome distance a midnight!  Should we ever go to Disneyland again - would definitely stay here!!  Welcome basket: lovely fruit, water & wine - WOW! Breakfast: standard fare; only 2 complaints - service/eating area small & you aren't allowed to take food to your room (which would alleviate the small eating/service space. Bathroom: love the idea of the open shower with handheld shower; drainage was horrible; the entire bathroom got wet - upside to that - housekeeping every day (although I feel sorry for them having to

This was a top notch experience.  We stayed 5 nights.  The service was great.  We arrived minutes after new carpet was installed.  The gift basket of sparkling cider and fruit with the personalized letter to our family was a nice touch.  We felt right at home the whole time.  They even left a balloon bouquet surprise for our daughter's birthday with some fun little toys and a gift cerficate for icecream cake in a cute Mickey Mouse bag.  It was so nice to walk straight to Disneyland from our room.  They always had fresh juice or ice water, fruit, and fresh baked cookies at the desk which were refreshing after our walk back from the Disney parks.  The room was a bit snug but was clean and I liked how the shower and toilet is separate from the sink so family members can get ready

We'll be back to the Park Vue on our next trip to Anaheim & Disneyland as it was a wonderful and positive experience staying there. We were treated with dinity and respect from a very courteous staff and Ernesto made sure our every wish was accommodated. The complimentary meals provided were sufficient and we enjoyed just not having to go some where for breakfast and/or supper. the rooms were exceptionally clean and well made up. Being absolutely across the street from the gates of Disneyland is a great plus. The swimming pool was well maintained the surroundings to it were a great place to relax.  All in all, it was an excellent  to stay.

This hotel is right across from the pedestrian entrance to Disneyland.  We were especially impressed by an anniversary gift that was waiting for us in our room when we arrived.  The staff was very nice.  Will definitely stay here again!

Name should be Park Value Inn!  After staying at half a dozen hotels along Harbor Blvd. the last few years, this hotel definitely gives you the most bang for your buck.  We stayed for two nights and had a standard double queen room.  The room was recently remodeled with new carpet and granite counter tops.  If we were staying 3 nights or more I would prefer a room with a sitting area, but we were only there two nights and did not spend much time at all in the room.  In my opinion, the extras offered by this hotel certainly put it at the top of any of the other hotels in the area.  Free parking and free breakfast are two perks that are hard to find right across the street from Disneyland.  The combination of these two saved our family at least $50 a day.  While the breakfast is

My family of 4 stayed here July 8-15/11 in room 210 in a bunkbed/queen room. We loved it. For starters, you can't get any closer to the Disneyland entrance than this hotel. It was wonderful to be able to just head out of the gate, take a short 5min walk and be in our room, especially after a long day at the parks. Check in was easy, we arrived early - 1pm - and our room wasn't ready - although I wasn't expecting it to be as check in as at 3pm. They offered to take our luggage for us so that we could go over to the parks or whereever. When we came back at 3:30, our room was ready and our luggage had been take up to our room for us! Which was doubly nice as there is no elevator to the second floor ( it only has 2 floors). Our room was down from the breakfast room but didn't find

This is the second time we have stayed here, and once again, we had a top notch experience! We arrived before check in and were allowed to park while we went to Disneyland and waited for our room. We received a note to pick up our comp fruit basket, as the staff would not give it to our minor son (good call).  The amenities were great: breakast buffet included juices, coffee, milk, fresh fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, bacon, make-your-own waffles, and a variety of pastries (donuts/danish), including toast/cinnamon toast and bagels to be toasted. Light dinner was kid-friendly chicken nuggets, mac/cheese and tossed salad. The fresh fruit and cookies, coffee, pink lemonade and fruit punch in the lobby was a very nice touch. The kids loved the bunk beds and the pool. The

You can read over and over about the TWO good qualities this MOtel: location and free food...  so I'm going to focus on the reasons I rate it as a POOR choice:  all due to BAD MANAGEMENT.  We made advance reservations and were told the motel remodelling would be completed in May... but during our mid-June stay, power saws, hammering, and general construction noise were a daily occurence.  I complained at the front desk and was told there was nothing to be done about it. I threatened to move to a quieter motel and just got a shrug in return. This is NOT an appropriate response from management of a QUALITY motel.  I would gladly have changed motels if we had only needed ONE room rather than FIVE.  We had a family reunion with 5 rooms for 5 days - booked months in advance - but the
My son and I visited Southern California and this was our favorite hotel. The pool was great, food wonderful, outstanding location and excellemt value.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for the family & we'll be back!
Summary: My family and I had an excellent experience at the Park Vue!  It was recommended to us from several family members that have also stayed there.  As many have already mentioned, the location simply can't be beat!  It's literally right in front of the crosswalk to the Disney entrance which was nice, especially after returning from walking all day long!  I felt for the people that had to continue on further to their hotel.  By the time they reached theirs, I'd already be swimming in our pool!  We arrived very early and had no problem with an early check in.  The staff was great, extremely polite and very accommodating.  Our room wasn't 5-star but neither was the price.  Matter-of-fact, with all the included "perks" that we received during our stay it offset the already great price

Summary Heading: amazing customer service, large clean rooms, great value for location!
Summary: Spend the weekend with the family to Disneyland and booked a few rooms. Staff was friendly and went the extra mile to ensure our stay was warm and pleasant. They left a fruit basket (with wine!) in our rooms and even gave us a Cold Stone creamery cake for our father's birthday, which was why we were visiting.   This place was great! Highly recommend!

Summary Heading: Great service, awesome location, we will be back.
Summary: We stayed for three nights of a Disneyland visit and the location was perfect. It took us six minutes to get into either park (at a leisurely walk) each day. In addition, the staff and service here was awesome. Everyone was polite and they gave the impression of genuinely enjoying their work. The breakfast and afternoon snack were much nicer that we had expected - my 13 year old daughter loved making her own waffles (and mine too). Our room was toward the back of the property and it was clean, comfortable, and quiet. We all slept well each night after full days in the parks. The rooms are basic, but nice and though it was full we hardly heard the other guests at all. It was our first time here and we will definitely be back.

My husband & I stayed at the Park Vue Inn in April 2011. It is a 3 star hotel but has so many extra's that we didn't expect. A nice buffet breakfast & we also got a free evening meal that we very much appreciated. The rooms are basic but clean with two Queen size comfortable beds. Since the Motel is directly across the street from the entry  to Disneyland it was and easy walk  to go and have a rest and a light meal before heading back over for the nightly entertainment at Disneyland. We would not consider staying anywhere else if we are to visit Disneyland again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. It is our pleasure to be of service to you. See you soon we hope.

Summary Heading: We love the Park Vue Inn!
Summary: Park Vue Inn helped make our family vacation to Disneyland more memorable and affordable. My 9 and 5 year olds loved the bunk beds in the room. Although the rooms are not large, the space is used really well and was all that we needed to be comfortable. The beds were very comfortable and we slept very well each night. My kids loved the free breakfast selections each day. It was a great start to the day in Disneyland. We usually took a break from disneyland mid afternoon to accommodate our 5 year old napping. That gave us enough time to have a light dinner at the social hour and saved a lot of money on food. For  both meals they had a decent selection to choose from. The staff worked very hard to accomodate the guests and made themselves available to help in any way. They even
Manager Response: You are very welcome Thank you for your great review. We take pride in our customer service. It is always our goal to exceed your expectations. We hope to see you soon. Thank you for choosing Park Vue Inn.

Summary: Hotel is directly across from the Disney gate - you can't get closer!  Lobby is very nice, thoughtful amenities such as a fruit basket, safe, bottle of wine. I never could get the wifi to work.  Breakfast is stated as continental, but is much more.   I know this is a high traffic hotel, but several aspects were dirtier than they should have been. All the breakfast tables needed to be washed off. One morning I was there when they opened and not only did all of the tables have crumbs from the previous day, it was clear they hadn't seen soap for a while. The next morning I went to breakfast right before they closed, same thing. The carpet in the room also felt dirty and was worn.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We take all guest comments very seriousely, and make sure that we do everything to make every stay a great experience. Our carpet is in the process of being installed we should be done by mid August. Thank you again and we hope that you will give us another opurtunity to serve you.

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel 2 times while in the Disneyland area and each time I have had an amazing experience, along with each members of my family.  The location is ideal- right across the street from the main entrance to Disneyland.  The rooms are well equipped with a queen bed and bunk beds for the kids.  The added bonuses are the full breakfest and light dinner, along with the IHOP on site and an ice cream store.  The staff this last visit made our stay even more memorable, especially Bricio.  After long days at the park over the holiday weekend, he kept the pool open late for the kids and for me to soap in the hottub.  He was friendly each day asking what we did and he even provided a complimentariry extra bottle of wine after hearing us talk about wanting a refreshing

Summary Heading: Great Stay - Would definitely stay again!
Summary: We just got back today from staying 3 nights at the Park Vue Inn.  We've stayed at three other hotels "right across from the main entrance" but after reading the great reviews, we decided to try this one.  We were not disappointed!  We really didn't have any problems at all.  Our queen/queen room was perfect for this short getaway with my teen daughter.  Thought it was a nice touch when they delivered a basket of wine, fruit, and water to the room right after we checked in.   Everything in the room was very acceptable (and I'm one who brings my own Lysol wipes, just in case!)  I had read several reviews talking about the dirty carpeting before we stayed.  Happy to report that at least two rooms were having new carpeting installed when we arrived, and our carpeting looked to be

Summary Heading: Not sure if we will stay again
Summary: Overall, the experience of our stay was 3 out of 5.  We had a few issues like the fact that our room was right next to a boiler.  So every night I was hearing a rumbling sound and I had to sleep with an iPod most nights.  Some nights I just went ahead and slept on one of the children’s bunk bed.  When I booked the room I was under the impression it was a suite but at check in of course we found out it was not.  I did bring it up to the attention of a manager who said when a suite opened up they would move us but I never received a call.  I later found out the hotel was completely booked all week so there was no way we were going to be moved.  Since the room was used most for sleeping next time I will have to choose a hotel where my sleep will be much better.  The amenities that

Summary Heading: Location does not count for eveeything
Summary: First, location for Disneyland is ideal. Across from pedestrian gate, saving time and parking fees. Couldn't be better.  Second, staff helpfulness and attitude were exceptional. Truly nice people, eager to help.  They really try to make you feel welcome with cookies and drinks in the lobby, a welcome fruit basket, etc.  Now, the downers:  Room was exceedingly small. Had a queen plus bunk beds and a trundle bed. Room was so tight, couldn't open more than one suitcase at a time. Also showed a lot of wear and tear with marks on the walls, etc.  Cleanliness was also an issue. Someone else mentioned that their white sox were black after walking on the carpet. Ditto.  Finally, there was a smell in the room that aggravated my wife's allergies to the point where we had to check out

Let's face it . . . hotels, motels are ten a penny in Anaheim, so it isn't difficult to secure a hotel of some worth. Over the last number of years though, this has been our hotel of choice and our sixth stay at the Park Vue Inn.  Since our last visit in 2008, a number of upgrades have been taking place and the place is looking great. Pool - wonderful, comp breakfast - even better than before and now even a small gym. The staff are very friendly and most helpful. Denny's, Ihop, Tony Roma's and some small shops are very closeby. . . walkable! And of course. . . Disneyland main gate, just across the road. Wouldn't consider anywhere else now! Looking forward to returning, hopefully next Summer 2012.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We have been focusing on making the Park Vue Inn more accomidating to our guests. We are almost done with the new carpet install, and are working on many other upgrades for our hotel. See you soon.

Summary Heading: We loved it and we'll be back
Summary: We have stayed here many times, we usually like it because it is so close to Disneyland's main gate that we don't mind walking back and forth to the park several times a day. This last stay we had a pleasant surprise with an upgraded breakfast(there was a wafflemaker, sausages and pog juice(passion orange guava)).  They also offered a light dinner which was new, they were very kid friendly with chili dogs, mac and cheese, chicken nuggets etc....  The rooms are always clean and the staff is always friendly.  We will definitely will be back.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are so glad you enjoyed our breakfast and social hour. The P.O.G. juice is one of my favorites as well. We look forward to being of service to you soon.

Summary: We had a wonderful first time stay near Disneyland. We chose Park Vue due to the great online reviews and were not disappointed.  Allowing us to park before check-in and leaving our car after check-out was very convenient. I would like to think that it was on purpose, but it probably might have been a coincidence, that the room that was assigned to us was right next to our car which we had parked there earlier that morning. My 6year old and 8 year old loved the bunk beds.The great customer service and warm breakfast buffet were also a plus. They even had a nice complimentary fruit basket and a little surprise for our anniversary( balloons and candy filled mugs) waiting for us in our room  when we arrived. It is literally the closest hotel to Disneyland, right next to the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  We are glad that you were able to use most of our amenities. We hope that on your next visit you can take advantage of our Social Hour Meals. See you soon.

Summary: we stayed at the Park Vue Inn while traveling to Disneyland for my son's birthday. It was so conveniently located to the Disneyland entrance, I was ready to accept some less-than-perfect accommodations for the location. Fortunately, there were none! The room was clean & comfortable as were the beds.The staff was courteous and attentive.A special shout out to Argenis who noticed my son wearing a Disney "birthday" button one night when we were at dinner. When we returned to our room later that evening ,my son was greeted with balloons, a gift & even a cake! How thoughtful! If we go back to Disney, we will DEFINITELY stay at the Park Vue.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Thank you as well for your kind words. We are happy to have made your son's Birthday a little more special. See you soon.

Summary: We chose this hotel for its proximity to Disneyland.  Travelling with a 7 & 9yo we didn't want to walk far after a long day of fun.  In Australia we stay in 4* hotels so I was a bit nervous as to what we would get.  This place was FANTASTIC.  The room was very clean (except for the carpet which needs a good steam clean) and our room was always cleaned daily.  The room was small but we were only there to sleep so it wasn't a problem for us.  The beds and pillows were soooooo comfortable.  I have neck and back problems but had absolutely no problem sleeping and woke up feeling great every day.  The place was very quiet, so no disturbed sleep.  There is plenty of cupboard space, a safe, coffee maker, microwave, mini fridge, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, hair dryer,

Summary Heading: Great place!! Absolutely the closest hotel to Disney's main entrance!!"
Summary: We go to Disneyland at least twice a year and I can't belive this was our first time staying at  Park Vue Inn. We usually stay at a "Good Neighbor" hotel or 1 of the Disneyland Resort Hotels. This is, by far, the closest hotel to Disneyland's main entrance!!! (Even closer than the Resort Hotels!) For this reason, we will never stay anywhere else during our trips to "The Happiest Place on Earth"! Being so close the main entrance of both theme parks is perfect at the end of a long day (especially for the kids!) No standing in line for shuttles and no walking miles back to the hotel. It's also nice if you want to take a break in the middle of the day to go swimming or just go back to the room to relax for a little while. The service was outstanding, very friendly, helpful staff.

Summary Heading: Couldn't of asked for a better hotel!
Summary: Just recently got back from a stay at this hotel and will never stay anywhere else again! Fabulous service, people, grounds, food, and location!!!! They went above and beyond for my parents Anniversary which was so special! Honestly don't even want to let to many people know about this place...want to keep it a secret so doesn't get sold out or change. :)

From check in to check out, they went above and beyond any hotel that we have ever stayed at.  From gift baskets to free breakfast and being so close to Disneyland, we will stay here any time we go back

Summary Heading: Great Hotel....... until you leave something behind
Summary: My family and I have stayed at this hotel 4 times over the last few years.  We've always had a good experience.  At our last stay I left my cell phone charger behind.  I called the hotel and was told they have my charger and the only way they could get it to me was if I had a Fed Ex account, which I don't.  I asked if they could simply mail it to me or do COD, they said they couldn't.  I was then told that I need to speak with a supervisor.  EIGHT days later, after calling everyday and leaving messages for supervisors, no one has returned my call.  I am so disappointed with the lack of customer service by the supervisors. While we were staying at the hotel, customer service was great.  We were greated with a welcome basket and letter in our room, had an abundance of pillows and

Summary Heading: We love the Park Vue Inn!!!
Summary: We had stayed at the Park Vue previously and returned because of the great proximity to Disneyland.  In the future we will return to the Park Vue because it will be like returning home!  The rooms are spacious and clean, the staff is extraordinarily helpful and you can not beat the fact that Disneyland is literally across the street.  We also took advantage of the breakfasts and social hours, which saved us a lot of time and money.  We would eat breakfast in the morning before leaving for the park, then return in the afternoon to enjoy the pool and the social hour, which should rightfully be called dinner.  The food is nothing fancy but there is something there to please everyone, and they take extra care to make sure the food is "kid friendly", i.e. chicken nuggets and tacos.

This hotel is right across the street from Disneyland. The rooms were clean and the staff went out of their way to make sure we were satisfied. It was my birthday and our room had fresh fruit, wine and birthday balloons, plus a voucher for a free ice cream cake from Cold Stone (right next door). The hotel had a BIG breakfast selection (hot and cold items including eggs, sausage, bacon, waffles, cereal, muffins, fruit, yogurt) and a free dinner too! Nachos, chili, hot dogs, sliders... we saved a bunch by eating their meals and the kids enjoyed swimming in the pool in the afternoons. We would stay there again for sure!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to have made your Birthday a little more special. Thank you for celebrating with us. See you soon.

Summary: We planned to stop at LA on both legs of our trip to Europe (on the way there and on the way back), we wanted something close to Disneyland.  Our family stayed at the Park Vue Inn on the way back from the UK and I can honestly say we will never stay anywhere else.    The rooms are quite small, I would recommend booking a two room suite if you are traveling with children, our luggage alone took up quite a lot of floor space!  However its super close to Disneyland and California Adventure, adjacent to Ihop .. Coldstone is in the same building (and you get a discount) and a short walk from McDonalds.  Park Vue provided breakfast and what they call social hour (which was in fact dinner) and at reception there is fruit/cookies and juice available throughout the day .. we saved a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. It was our pleasure to provide these amenities and services to you and your family. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: THE CLOSEST HOTEL TO DISNEYLAND (even closer than the park ones)
Summary: Wow -what a great place.  Booked 6 nights from Australia after great reviews on tripadvisor (they don't advertise in the travel brochures) and we were not disappointed - in fact they more than exceed our expectations.  We had two queens and two bunk beds (not listed on their web floor plan) very quiet and very clean and the kids loved the bunk beds. Great toilettries and coffee making.  Fantastic welcome Fruit Basket upon arrival and came with Wine  (we were very lucky and given a complementary bottle every second night).  Sooo close to disneyland, in fact the entrance is literally right across the road.  Customer Service - 5 stars.  Everyone was so nice.  The Free Breakfast and Dinner saved us a fortune and there were also drinks, snacks and coffee in the foyer during the day.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are always happy to hear that our guest have had such a great stay. We will continue to work diligently to make Park Vue Inn a home away from home. See you soon.

Summary Heading: We loved it and will be back!
Summary: We absolutely loved this place!  Check-in was a breeze and the Front Desk Manager Laura was the best!  The breakfast was great right before a long day at Disneyland. Hint: arrive early or it is a little crowded. The "Social Hour" was great also, every night something different....a great way to save some money!!!  The staff was always courteous and helpful.  A high five to Argenis...he was wonderful! Our room was always fresh and clean when we would arrive in the afternoon.  We had the 2Q, with bunks room.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Laura and Argenis both are very appreciative of your comment. Our goal is highest customer service. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: We stayed here 4 nights recently on our West Coast tour. We chose it simply because of the great reviews on Trip Advisor and its close proximity to Disneyland. We were not disappointed. Staff very friendly and helpful. Great breakfast, plenty of choice.  Rooms basic but clean, fresh towels every day.   It was great popping in and out of Disney several times a day for a break, lunch, shopping or whatever. The hotel was excellent value for money and if we visit Disney again we would not stay anywhere else.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are currently working on the improvement of our hotel. On your next visit we hope to exceed your expectations onece again.

Summary: This was our second visit to Park Vue.  The beds were good for one person but with two it slumped to the center. We didn't like the pillows at all - too soft! Overall the room was clean except for the carpet. The staff at check in and housecleaning were very nice. We ate breakfast a couple of times, it would be nice if we could take our breakfast to the room. Proximity to Main gate seemed closer than DL and Paradise Pier resort hotels.

Summary Heading: I will always stay outside the park for Disneyland now
Summary: This hotel is very conveniently located outside the Main Gate for Disneyland. It was easier to get back to our room there than to the report hotels inside the park (where we had stayed on a prior visit). Room rates are very competitive with others in that area. The size of the room was smallish/cozy, but very clean. My son loved the bunk beds in our room! The breakfast and light dinner food offered, and included in the room fee price, helped us stretch our food budget quite a bit. This is the best complimentary breakfast I have ever had at a hotel/motel. Hot "entree" choice each day, sausage or bacon, a waffle maker, pastries, fresh fruit, cold cereal, and assorted beverages. A welcome basket in the room upon arrival was a nice touch. The pool is not fancy, but good for a

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for, not much
Summary: This hotel was right across the street from the entrance to Disney and the price was cheap, that's about all that was right with it.  The breakfast doesn't open up until seven and when it does it is a nightmare.  The room that it is served in is very small or you can eat outside where it is cold and rainy.  You are not allowed to take the food back to your room for family, they actually will stop you if you try to leave with so much as a slice of toast.  The food was very poor quality; think microwave bacon and stale bread.  We only ate there one and then skipped it the next 2 days.  The room seamed dirty.  My daughter spilled some water on the floor and I put a bath towel on the floor to mop it up.  When I picked up the towel it was totally black, this was immediately after

I booked a room at the Park Vue Inn through Expedia.com about two months in advance of my stay based on the good to excellent reviews. The check-in process was smooth and professional. I was given a room with a queen bed and a bunk bed. The room could sleep four people comfortably. I asked to be moved into a room with just a queen bed, but there was no availability. I had no complaints about the room. It was closer to the front office and the gift shop, and was therefore, closer to Disneyland Resort. I suspect that the rooms further back are a bit quieter; there was considerable pedestrian traffic in front of the room. I did not avail myself to the free continental breakfast, but I'm sure it was nice and very welcome to the guests. This hotel is the most convenient for those

The location of the hotel could not be beat. Walking to Disneyland entrance was short and only one traffic light to cross. The rooms were clean for the price and the service of cleaning not bad.The noise of other patrons wasn't too bad for the location. The services of dining was ok with Denny's close by and I-hop.   The beware part was do not leave anything of value in your room when you leave for the day, you will lose it. We lost an I-pod player with charger and headphones for a total of probably of a value of $300. Again DON'T LEAVE ANYTHING IN YOUR ROOM OF VALUE WHEN YOU GO TO THE PARK, YOU WILL LOSE IT.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We would like to speak to you in regards to these items, if you could please call the hotel. We have a great lost and found system in place that has been running quite flawlessly. We also provide safes in everyroom for valuables such as these. We even offer a safe at our front desk for items that may not fit in the in room safes.  We thank you again for your time taken to review our hotel.

Summary: We reserved 3 rooms for our family of various ages from 2 years to senior citizens. First off, I couldn't believe how close the walking distance between the hotel and Disneyland front gate. Even with my limited mobility, I was able to get back and forth. The rooms were spacious, comfortable and very clean. The staff was awesome. From the front desk clerk to maintenance/housekeeping personal, everyone was helpful and very friendly.  They provided us a crib, wine, fresh fruit, hot chocolate and a birthday bouquet. I've stayed many times in Disney hotel and the hospitality was equal. THANK  YOU Park Vue. We'll be back!
Manager Response: Thank you so much, we are pleased to hear that your stay was Fantastic. We will see you again soon.

Summary Heading: We would definitely return if not for the carpet
Summary: We just returned from a fantastic 5 night stay and we would definitely return again if not for the dirty carpet! Location is the best and you can't beat the complimentary breakfast and dinner. The food is not the best but our young kids loved it so it worked well for us and saved us a bundle. The staff was very professional and friendly; just as good as any other hotel that we've ever stayed at.   Only complaint I have is what others have already touched upon... the carpet! On the first day, we were wondering why our sons' socks and jeans were so dirty and sure enough, it was the carpet. I know that the rooms must be heavily used since it is so close to Disneyland but they should really clean the carpets once in a while. It was the only negative thing about the otherwise great

Summary Heading: Very happy with our choice! (3 queen 2-room suite)
Summary: I spent a good amount of time researching the hotels near Disneyland before booking. We decided to stay at Park Vue Inn for the following reasons:  1) Location: right across the street from Disneyland. We spent 4 days in Disneyland and California Adventure. We knew we would be very exhausted at the end of each day, so the closer the hotel the better.  2) Free hot breakfast and light supper: we ended up eating not only the breakfast but also the dinner every day during our entire stay. Saved big $$$.  3) Parking: We arrived at 11am. After checked in, we parked our car right in front of our room and went to Disneyland. I always saw available spots in the parking lot at any time. Parking was not an issue.  4) 3 queen 2-room suite: I was lucky to be able to book this type of room

Every time we go to Disneland, we make it a point to stay at this wonderful hotel.  Literally across the street from the main enterance, it is as close to Disneyland as the resort property.  The staff is very friendly and attentative.  This time we go a special treat.  We got the hot tub suite, which was very moderately priced, and found a basket of "goodies" in our room which included a bottel of wine and lots of delisciuos fruit. The rooms are immaculate and very comfortable.  There are several resturants within a block.  It is absolutly ideal.  We have stayed there about 10 times and we will be returning.

Nice room, best pillows I have had in a hotel room for a while.  We enjoyed the breakfast and the social hour each night.  The fruit basket was a nice touch and the people were all very accommodating.  We will definitely be staying here again.  The kids loved the bunk beds.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel in a Great Location
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Park Vue specifically for visiting the Disneyland Parks. Our first impressions of the hotel were very positive. We were greeted warmly and checking in was a breeze. They had freshly baked cookies and juice, which were both complimentary. The hotel had more of a B&B feeling rather than a hotel, which we really liked. The staff were all fantastic. Only too happy to help with your inquiries, smiling, they looked genuinely happy to be working there.  The room we had was great, clean, tidy, nice size. The bed was comfortable for sleeping. We had a welcome letter and basket. The letter was personalized with our surname which I think is a great touch. And the basket had fruit and a bottle of wine! Very nice, these are the sort of touches that can make your

Summary Heading: Great Location & Service BUT Carpet DIRTY!!!
Summary: This hotel has the best location right across the street.  Nice breakfast included BUT the  Carpet in the rooms were DIRTY.  This is a deal breaker for all of us.  We will not stay here again because of this.  We talked to 2 other families and they all had the same complaint about the Carpet in their rooms!  Everyones white socks were black! Sorry, but that's just GROSE.

Summary Heading: We loved it and we'll be back
Summary: Some friends had recommended the Park Vue and we stayed on their advise.  The customer service was very good.  Staff were friendly and willing to help.  We had two plumbing issues in our room and both issues were tended to within 5 minutes of the calls.  We had the two queen bed room.  There was a larger bar fridge, microwave and coffee pot.  The sink is outside the bathroom which I liked.  The rooms were comfortable and a reasonable size.  The a/c worked great.  We received a welcome basket when we came which was really nice which included:  a bottle of red wine, plastic glasses, two water bottles and a few pieces of fruit.  We also received the Birthday treat which was a mug, some chocolate, balloons and a coupon for a small free cake at the Cold Stone.  Very nice.  The pool

We stayed at the Park Vue from May 14-19.  We picked this location because of the great reviews and the location.  Again the location is fantastic! We had a one room suite with two queen beds and a pull out for 3 adults and 3 children.  We took advantage of the breakfast everyday however on the 4th and 5th days we were getting a bit tired of the microwaved eggs and such.  The service at the breakfast and social hours were great! We did the social most days and the kids loved the food however the adults only ate there for 3 of the 5 days and ordered take out the other days. Again it was whatever you could microwave.  The people who worked there gave us excellent recommendations on local Mexican restaurants in the area.   The beds in the room were new and super comfortable. The

I booked this hotel because of the great reviews and the reviews are right. This hotel is wonderful.  The location is the best.  Just a short walk in to Disneyland, no waiting on shuttles.    We reserved a room with a queen bed and one bunkbed.  This room was in front of the hotel and it was quiet.  The room was clean, the beds comfortable and yes, the carpet is dirty.  An employee of the hotel told my mom they were going to be putting in new carpet. The room had a fridge, microwave and safe.   We did receive the welcome basket, wine, water bottles and fruit. Cookies and juice in the lobby.  Coffee in the lobby also. However, we did not see the water bottles in the lobby, I don't know if they don't have these available or we just needed to ask.  We always bought water in the

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn from May 1 - May 8 for a family Reunion. What a wonderful hotel. The staff will go out of their way to help you with any problems you have. Our travel agent made a mistake on booking two of our family members rooms and the staff worked very hard to change the days so that they was staying in the hotel on the right days. The rooms were so nice (except the carpeting), the beds were comfortable, the breakfast was better than any of other 3 hotels we've stayed at while visiting Disneyland, it was so nice to get some water bottles on our way to the park, and always a friendly smile in the mornings. The gift baskets was an added surprise. Boy was it nice to be able to walk across the street to drop packages off or to lay babies down for a nap. The only

Summary Heading: Service was better than some 5 stars I have been to
Summary: The location is fantastic - closer to the park than some of the Disney resort hotels. The rooms are clean and comfortable - they really can't be beat for that price point. What really was impressive is the service. They were extremely accomodating - allowing us to leave a day early with no charge and everyone from housekeeping to the front desk were really friendly. We were welcomed with a basket of fruit, wayer and wine and when they noticed my granddaughter was wearing a birthday button they sent a present for her to our room. I am not talking about a little trinket. They sent her a big balloon bouquet and a big gift bag full of coloring books, stickers, candy, crayons, activity books, markers and a gift certificate to Cold Stone. I would highly recommend them and I won't be

This hotel is literally right across the street from Disneyland.  The hotel service was great, and their parking policy was the best I could find in the area.  I won't stay anywhere else in Anaheim again!

We just got back from our trip to Disneyland and the reviews weren't kidding when they said the hotel was right across the street from Disneyland!  What a great location!  The hotel itself was very clean and the staff was absolutely incredible and very friendly and accomodating.  We chose this hotel mainly for the location and the free breakfast as we have two hungry boys and it certainly didn't disappoint.  There was more than enough for breakfast and the host was always friendly and very welcoming.  There was also a small supper included as well which was an added bonus.  It was nothing fancy but the food was good and it did the trick if you want to save money or don't have the energy to go to a restaurant.  The added treat was a beautiful welcome basket waiting for us in our
Manager Response: We are so happy to have made your vacation and holiday memorable. Thank you for your review. Hope to see you soon.

Summary: This was our 4th time staying here and the room was clean and  great.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  It is well located and Cold Stone Ice Cream is a plus.
Manager Response: We look forward to serving you on your future visits. Thank you

Summary: Park Vue inn was a great choice for us.We recieved some nice gifts for our anniversary which was a pleasant surprise.The room was very nice and spacious and appeared to be very clean.The breakfast was ok as was the evening snacks.Being at the entrance to Disney was a bonus.Would stay there again if we ever return to Anaheim,would reccomend to anyone.

Summary Heading: So Close to Disney, Comfy Bed, Clean Pool, Wonderful Staff!!
Summary: I had booked with a popular booking service then discovered the "block from Disneyland" hotel was actually closer to 2 blocks.  Blocks in Anaheim are huge.  After a long day walking in the magic kingdom the last thing you want to do is walk more to your hotel.  Closeness is very important.  I canceled my booking with the 2 block hotel and continued my search.  This one is as close as they describe - across the street from the main gate.   We really wanted a jacuzzi room but they were full so we took 2 Queens.  Two days before we arrived we were offered a King jacuzzi room for our first of a three nights stay.  We were thrilled and took the room.  They kindly charged us the same rate for the King jacuzzi room as the 2 Queens. If you like accommodations that offer food as in

Stayed 2 nights at this hotel, free breakfast and free parking, right on Disneyland's door step. Still a bit of a walk to entrance but better than having to wait for a shuttle. Gift basket in room when we arrived. Staff were helpful and friendly. TV a little outdated and plug in bath didn't work but otherwise great stay, would choose this hotel again. Easy access internet in the lobby for free. They even let us leave the car in the car park as we went to Disneyland after checking out. Also Ihop close by was good for dinner after a long day at Disneyland. Downside was some of the neighbouring travellers let their kids run up and down the outside walkways but then that's expected when you're near Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Good Value,Great location. Good Service Hotel
Summary: Most of the reviews  for this hotel were accurate. Its location is right  across the park and the service staff of the hotel is very good. The bedroom,beddings and bath were clean . The carpeting needs to be replaced .But I understand that it is a high volume hotel so the rooms have to be scheduled for carpet repair in increments.We are also hoteliers in the Philippines so we are particular with cleanliness and staff service. The staff is well trained and on the ball. Park vue has many competitors .Its advantage is its location,good service and complimentary breakfast and evening light dinner.The breakfast waffles are also very good. I hope they can continue the good value and service. It will make a good experience for disney visitors.
Closest motel to Disneyland, great experience.   This was our second stay and would definately stay there again.  Great gift basket in the room when we arrived, great personal touch.

Our stay at the park Vue was great , my daughter stayed there are anumber of years ago and advised us that the location for a stay in LA was the best. We stayed for 4 days and we can say the service comfort and room cleanlyness was the best and it is right accross the road from the Disneyland entrance. you have all major tour companies pass by the front door for pick ups for most if not all tours thru out the region

Summary Heading: Wonderful little Inn perfect for a Disneyland stay!
Summary: Just got back from a five day stay at the Park Vue Inn.  We had booked on-line and although check in was not until 3:00 they accomodated us early.  Check in was friendly and simple. A welcome gift basket arrived at the room with fruit, water and a bottle of wine. The rooms are simple but well set up and very clean. The beds were very comfortable and black out curtains helped to allow sleeping in a possibility. it is very family friendly with all sorts of reminders to keep it quiet so that princes and princesses can get their sleep. You cannot beat this location, it is directly across from the main gates of Disneyland and California Adventure and on either side of the Inn is a breakfast place; IHOP on one side and Denny's on the other.  This hotel includes breakfast and the

I selected this hotel based on reviews from trip advisor. I rented 2 rooms for my family of 6.   I was not disappointed. I was greeted by awesome front desk staff. There was coffee and cold juice at the desk along with some bakery items.   When I walked into my room it smelled fresh and clean! I had two queen beds and the room was a good size. We had a basket with fruit, wine and water for us. The complimentary full breakfast and light supper was very helpful.   It was my birthday and I received a balloon bouquet and a petite ice cream cake from Cold Stone Creamery.   Staff was very friendly and knowledgable! The pool was clean and Miguel kept it open for 30 mins longer so my dh and daughter who wanted to relax in the hot tub before turning in. The night supper host was warm and

I can't praise this place enough. Directly across the road from the entrance to Disneyland so you can't beat the location. The staff are fantastic, so friendly and helpful. Our room was great with soft comfy beds, plenty of room to move and spotlessly clean. We were able to sit on our balcony and watch the fireworks from disneyland while we relaxed with a drink after a big day out. The breakfast has plenty to choose from, cereal, toast, bacon, pancakes, and much more. The social hour at night was plenty for us for dinner and you were welcome to eat as much as you wanted. Each day in the lobby there were bottles of water, fresh fruit and cookies to help yourself to and you were always made welcome no matter how many times you stopped in. The pool was beautiful and clean and it

We had a great stay at the Park Vue Inn. The rooms were neat and tidy and had all that we needed. It was very close to Disneyland's entrance, which was a bonus. We really liked the fact that it had laundry facilities, which enabled up to keep up with our washing. The breakfast was a nice touch, which included eggs, bacon, bread, pastries, waffles etc. juice and coffee. They also offered a light supper, but we never tried it. What was really nice was that we received a welcome basket which included fruit and wine, it was a lovely surprise. We will definately stay again and remember this is not a 5 star hotel, so if your looking for all the bells and whistles (Big White Fluffy Towels etc), maybe you should look elsewhere, but as I said it has all you need, neat rooms, very comfy

I stayed here with my husband and 2 grandchildren May 9-13.  From the time we checked in this hotel was great.  Cookies and juice or water in the lobby.  I had read the reviews about dirty carpet and so took flip flops for all of us to wear in the room - that is the only reason I didn't make this 5 star for cleanliness - the beds and bathroom were spotless.  The safe was locked open when we arrived - I phoned and someone was there to fix it in less than 5 minutes.  The breakfast included is nothing fancy but certainly adequate before walking across the street to Disney - less than 5 minutes.  The light supper they provide every night is good also - nothing fancy but the kids thought it was dinner.  The pool and hot tub were good - we used them every day from 2-5 then had supper

My family and I recently visisted Disneyland and stayed at the Park Vue Inn.  This hotel is conveniently located right outside the main walkway to the park.  Their service was excellent, always fast and friendly.  Their was a gift basket in our room and they even offered dinner and breakfast vouchers to eat free!! My daughters loved the bunk beds and the room was clean.  Can't wait to visit Disneyland again and would definately stay here again.

Summary Heading: Location, staff, heated pool, breakfast/ evening snack all made our trip more enjoyable, convenient and affordable
Summary: Brisio, (front desk), was very friendly and accomodating from check in to check out. We travel often and find accomodations less than advertised. Not so here. We had adjoining rooms with 4 adults an 3 small kids and everyone had a good time.  Our room was right in front of the pool/hot tub which made it even better. The hotel is right across the street from Disneyland so when we need a break, a short walk and you're "home".  Restaraunts are close by, geared for kids and/or adults. Rates are way reasonable, service was first rate from the front desk to house keeping. We will stay there again and again., Eric and Karla  Bush

My family and I (2Ad, 3Ch (3/7/12) stayed at the Park Vue Inn in late April and returned again in early May as part of a holiday to the US from Australia. Hotel absolutely exceeded our expectations and would advocate it as a must stay place if visiting Disneyland. It's premier location (right across the road from the Disneyland entrance) is matched by the quality of staff we encountered, who made our stay one to remember. They were only too happy to help with not only any needs from within the hotel, but also went out of their way to assist in providing advice on other elements (eg, shopping, transport) to make our stay more enjoyable. The Park Vue Inn doesn't seem to rest on it's obvious drawcard - location (who can argue when you're riding the Indiana Jones ride 10 mins after

Just returned from our trip, which included a stay at the Park Vue Inn.   Our stay was great!  This property, as you've likely heard, has the best location.  We went back and forth from the park to our room multiple times a day (travelling with 2 kids 2 and under).  Our room, a double queen, was spacious and quiet.  We requested a lower level room (due to our double stroller - didn't want to haul that upstairs repeatedly each day) and we also asked for a room at the back (away from Harbor Ave) and it was nice and quiet.   We really didn't notice much noise from others, but perhaps we lucked out with quiet neighbors this trip.  The welcome basket, cookies and drinks at the front desk were very nice.  We stopped in every day to grab a quick snack.  The included breakfast was a

Excellent family hotel close to the main gate to Disneyland Park. We checked in early Fri 8AM, received a parking permit and breakfast that morning, then headed to Disneyland. Room #238 was a quiet room clean, spacious, comfortable in the back of the hotel. Even the rollaway bed was comfortable according to both children, age 9 and 10. A complimentary welcome fruit basket complete with a bottle of white wine awaited our arrival. My daughter's birthday was May 5, when I mentioned this to one of the staff, we found a full birthday basket with Disney princess coloring books, crayons, treats, art projects, a lovely balloon bouquet and a coupon good for a petite size ice cream cake at the Cold Stone attached to the hotel.  All the staff were courteous and helpful, throughout

First of all, there is no closer hotel to Disneyland. I travel with my family all the way from Canada every year to go to Disneyland & we have stayed at lots of different hotels. Never again will I stay anywhere but the Park Vue Inn. The breakfast was unbelievable. Bacon, eggs, hash browns, donuts, pastries, waffles, etc. Social hour was great too. We have 6 people in our family and we spend so much money on restaurants that this helped out so much. A welcome basket waiting in our room upon check in, cookies in the lobby, and water & kool-aid. As everyone knows how expensive Disneyland is this hotel is the best kept secret out there. I will recommend this hotel to everyone I know. There is no other place that comes close.

we really appreciated the incredible location and very nice staff.  the rooms were clean, large, and comfortable.  breakfast was waffles, donuts, danish, bagels, fruit, yogurt, cereal, bacon or sausage, eggs, biscuits, and gravy. the breakfast room is up a flight of stairs.  at social hour there were enchiladas, salad, rice... plenty to make a dinner out of.  in the room, we received bottled water and fruit, and there was water, fruit, cookies and coffee available at the front desk.  the pool and hot tub were much appreciated.  we had sketchy wireless reception.  overall: the location can't be beat, the staff were great, the value is incredible, and the extras sealed the deal for us. much appreciated and we will be back!

Summary Heading: Location Great - Everything else a little Average
Summary: Honestly, you can't beat this hotel for the location.  That is by far the best thing about the hotel.  Only thiings that erked me about the place was the noise factor - we stayed on the bottom floor and you can hear those above everytime they move ...even hear the toilet flushing each time.
