The breakfast bar - okay - they don't like to put too much out so a bit like the quick and the dead to get a hashbrown.  On our first night I kneeled down to put on my son's shoes only to find when I stood up my jeans  (at the knees) were stained with 'dirt' from the carpet.  So put me off for the rest of the trip about the cleanliness of the room (particularly the floor) ... the rest of the room is cleaned each day.  Otherwise the staff are helpful.  You don't really come to a place like

Summary Heading: Best place to stay for a week!!!!
Summary: We stayed a week at the hotel. It was nice having it close to Disneyland so we could go play and then take the kid back to the hotel for a nap.  Just a hour nap goes a long way and everyone was happy.  We really enjoyed checking into the hotel finding out that there was a "Social hour"...that helped us a lot since we didn't have to buy dinner everynight.  Made sure to have nap time around dinner time.

Summary Heading: A close as you can get without staying onsite
Summary: My teenaged daughter and I went to Disneyland and needed a nearby hotel. I chose the Park Vue for the location and was happy with our choice. The staff were friendly and accomodating. Our room was on the 2nd floor toward the back of the property and was very clean, quiet and comfortable. I really appreciated the microwave and mini fridge in the room. We enjoyed the free breakfast on the terrace each morning. One evening my daughter wasn't feeling well so we returned to the room early where she was able to watch the Disneyland fireworks from her bed! This motel is as close as you can get to the park entrance without staying on the property. One day I forgot my camera and it was no problem to just walk across the street to our room to retrieve it. It was great to be able to go

Pros:  - clean, large rooms. Smelled a little much like cleaner overkill, but that's fine by me :) - breakfast buffet was OK, but they also did an evening social hour which I thought was great. - the pool area was great and even though it's in the middle of a parking lot, you don't feel that way once you're inside. Very well built, clean, large, and included a hot tub. Just like the pictures! - the location is THE BEST! aside from the grand californian, I don't think you can get any closer to the parks. Much nicer when you have tired feet and young kids accompanying. - the staff is very helpful and don't hesitate to give you a bottled water and cookie on your way out the door to the park. They also offered to hold on to our luggage on our way in and out of our room while we were

This hotel is directly across the street from the Disneyland entrance.  The parking was free.  Our room was clean upon our arrival and it was serviced daily when requested.  We were on the go most of the time so the room was perfect for our trip.  Otherwise the room would have been a little cozy for a family of four.  We would have preferred a different room but since we booked our package through Expedia, the rooms with a queen bed and bunk beds were not available.  The staff was very helpful and kind.  I had called ahead to make some delivery arrangements and they were most gracious.  We also received a nice welcome basket, birthday cake and gift.

The only good thing about the Park Vue Inn is the close proximity to Disneyland. You truly are only a five minute walk from the main gate area. Beyond that, there is nothing appealing about it. They offer meal presentations but what you get is poor quality food heated in the microwave or warming trays. The staff was polite but why wouldn't they be? They work right across the street from the happiest place on Earth. The rooms however were disgusting. If your heart is set on staying here be sure to bring slippers because the carpet was DIRTY!!! Within five minutes our socks were blackened at the bottom. There was blood smeared on the in-room directory accompanied by some lovely graffiti. I also found blood on a pillow case and numerous creepy-crawlies around the room. The bathroom

We've stayed at a few others in the area, none had the level of service Park Vue did.  From the moment we arrived, the staff bent over backwards to take care of us, and tripped over themselves to do so.  I rarely write reviews, and when I do they are usually to tell a horrid story, but this time I want to say thank you and HIGHLY recommend this place to all!

The breakfast, the location, the p.m. snack, the welcome basket and the Birthday goodies!! Wow what a great place and so close to Disney you can watch the fireworks from the room! We love this hotel, its not 5 star but it is perfect for the family going to disneyland for a great stress free time! Thanks  My only comlaint is that the beds on our secound stay were not as good as the ones onour first. But oh well I was really too tired to care!

After checking on websites for the best hotel to stay in Anaheim we booked our stay at Park Vue Inn.  Our family wanted a hotel that provided more than the standard stale pastry's and fruit.  Park Vue provides hot breakfast every morning and "social hour" every evening.  Social Hour is more like dinner than appetizers.  The food choices change daily so it was never boring.  The employees at breakfast and social hour are VERY friendly and enjoyable.  The room clean and stocked (we stayed in a 2 queen room).  Our children we very happy to recieve birthday baskets and ice cream cake for their birthday's.  We thought it may be difficult to sleep their since many families stay there, but not so.  The Park Vue post signs asking guest to be mindful of others and to keep noise levels
Manager Response: It was a pleasure to be of service to you and your family. We are so happy to have made your childrens birthdays a little more special. We thank you, and look forward to seeing you again in November.

Summary Heading: CLOSEST YOU CAN GET TO DISNEY!
Summary: We have stayed here several times and will be back again. It is a motel, by no means elegant, but the location is right outside the gates of Disney, the free breakfast, cookies &  bottled water are definitley a plus and the staff is friendly.  If you are looking for a deal close to the action, this is it!

Summary Heading: GREAT HOTEL, GREAT SERVICE & GREAT LOCATION
Summary: We stayed for the weekend to celebrate my daughter's 5th birthday.  The room was clean and nice, the staff even left a basket with balloons and disney books for the kids.  Breakfast was great, they had a variety of fruits, juices, waffless, eggs, toasts.  It was very convenient to eat and walk across the street to disneyland. Come back later to relax without the hassle of shuttles or parking lots, eat a burger (included) and go back to disneyland.  The staff was great and always helpful, they even included a small cake from their ice cream store.  You will not find anything better for the price. I will definately recommend this hotel.

First of all, this is a 2 star motel so the rating is based on that.  The motel was pretty clean, inside more so than outside.  It's an older property showing it's age, but right across the street from the Disney entrance.  I would not give this a greater weight because you have quite a few choices within 500 yards of this property... Not that big of a deal.  The staff was friendly, no issues.  The wireless Internet did not work, called them about it, seemed like a chronic issue... Oh well.  The rest of the stay was good for a 2 star motel, so if your counting your pennies this might be your place.

Summary Heading: Only place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: Three words location, location, location! The entrance to Park Vue was across the road from the Disneyland entrance which helped make our stay so much more enjoyable!! One of the only few places that offered free wi-fi, breakfast and parking. The staff were very friendly and helpful the Park Vue is an excellent hotel all round.

We have stayed at Park Vue a number of times and recently stayed there with friends from out-of-state...  As usual the stay was great.  What stands out most is Biricio who took great care of us.  He helped my husband with the luggage as my husband had hurt his back.   We also saw him behind the reception desk and he was always happy and pleasant.  Biricio has great customer service.    We just booked again for a short stay and look forward to another pleasurable time!   Thanks Biricio for making our stay great!
Manager Response: We thank you for your great review. Bricio has recieved this message, and is greatful for your words. We look forward to being of service to you soon.

Summary: Closer walk to main gates than when we stayed at the Paradise Pier last year.  Helpful, friendly front desk.  Convenient to park right outside your room.  Overall the room was very clean.  My only warning is that the carpet is very dirty, so bring some extra socks for your kids feet if you don't want them to turn black.  I did not fault them for this.  It is the flat style of carpet and gets walked on everyday by people directly in from Disneyland and the street so I can't imagine how they could keep it clean.
Manager Response: We have started installing new carpet in our rooms and we are very excited. Come visit us soon so you can experience the new upgrades to our hotel. Thank you for your review.

Summary: My husband and I (two big kids) stayed at this hotel on our trip to Anaheim/Disneyland. We mostly chose to stay here because of the proximity to Disneyland. It was so nice to avoid parking lots and shuttles everyday. Plus, we were able to go back to the hotel to relax during the day.   The employees were all very courteous and helpful. However, my favorite part was the breakfast that was included with the room purchase. Now, I love breakfast, but sometimes I have to just "make do" with typical hotel breakfast options. Not this place. They had everything from hard boiled eggs and sausage to fresh waffles (DIY, but still fresh). It was the best way to start out a busy day at the park.   The room was quite nice and spacious enough for the two of us. I didn't realize until after
Manager Response: Wounderful words as yours give us fuel to keep provideing a home away from home. We hope to see you soon

Summary Heading: Stay here when you go to Disneyland!
Summary: This was a fabulous place to stay when we surprised our kids with a whirlwind trip to Disneyland after landing in Las Vegas the night before.  The hotel is ABSOLUTELY directly across the street from the park gates- not up the street a block and over.... right across!!! We only stayed one night as our vacation was actually Vegas for a wedding, but we thought we were so close we would drive our rental car and spend two days at Disney.  They fed us supper (free!) left a fruit basket with a bottle of wine in our room, and offered a wonderful hot breakfast eggs, sausages, breads, cereal, fruit, and make your own fresh waffle in waffle iron- best free breakfast we'd ever had.  They even offered ice cold (again free) water bottles in the lobby.  They even offered (once again, free)
Manager Response: We apreciate your words. Our goal is to provide the highest level of customer service. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Good Value but not great customer service
Summary: The property is well located across the street from Disneyland.  It is a a good value for what you pay--basic, clean rooms with free basic breakfast and happy hour food.  Unfortunately, the property is not well managed and we had too many surprises.  The front desk staff was never willing to help, they lacked logical thinking and truly didn't understand what it meant to provide good customer service.  We lost of item of clothing that was found by the hotel staff and placed behind the desk.  Then it "disappeared" and no employee could tell us where it went.  I wouldn't stay there again - too many surprises and hassles.  I walk an extra block & stay at a flag hotel.
Manager Response: We are sincerely sorry about the item of clothing that was lost. We do remeber when you told us you misplaced it. We tried our best to recover this item for you with no luck. We have since tightend up our lost and found system to better accomidate our guests.

Summary Heading: Park Vue Inn - Good value and Great location
Summary: Stayed April 22 to 29 with two kids - 6 & 9 yrs.  Great front desk service - quick and very friendly. Rooms very clean, small, beds very comfortable.  Only one chair in room.  If your plan is to hit the park, eat meals out, then this is the perfect hotel for that purpose.   In room safe was a bonus, as well as bottled water, and cookies available at front desk free.  'Welcome basket' was a nice treat. Breakfast was good with all basics.  Fruit, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, hot cereal, eggs, bacon or sausage, hashbrowns once, toast, make your own waffles, french toast, pancakes, donuts, cereal, juices, coffee, tea.  Good food, not excellent, but certainly more than enough to start the day.   Evening light meal available, however, we never made it on time.  Fireworks could be seen
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, and the recomendations for guests to come. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary Heading: My New Favorite Disneyland Vacation Hotel
Summary: This small, hacienda theme hotel right across from the main entrance to Disneyland is a cut above the other bargain accomodations.  The rooms are clean and bright, the staff friendly and helpful.  We were offered cold water and cookies during check-in, given a basket of fruit and a bottle of wine for our room (sparkling cider available if you prefer), and served a full breakfast each morning of our stay.  A "light supper" is also offered during the evening social hour, but we did not participate in that as we had made other plans. We have stayed at several hotels near Disneyland, and this is the best bargain we have found so far.
Manager Response: Thank you for your very kind words. We look forward to being of service to you again soon.

Summary: This hotel was so close to the Disneylad enterance, I can't imagine staying farther away. the rooms were kinda on the small side, but they were functional. Rooms were pretty clean, and  I am fairly picky. The hotel gave all my children under the age of 10 small Easter baskets since we were there over Easter, I thought that was a nice personal touch. Plus a nice welcome basket with a bottle of wine! They were very accomodating with helping to arrange travel to airports and universal studios and newport beach. Would definetly stay there again. Very, very good free breakfast and a 'social hour'. Like a continental supper.

We stayed in April for 3 nights. When we first arrived, they forced me to try one of their warm-out-of -the -oven cookies, which was perfect after a hectic day getting there. Loved the gift basket! The breakfast provided some protein and was a great start for a good solid day at the parks. The evening social spread (which was an unexpected suprise) was a perfect quick snack for the adults and a meal for the kids after nap time. This is not the Grand Californian, but I thought it was a perfect place for a family that spends most of their time at the parks like we do.

Summary Heading: No complaints! Highly recommend Park Vue!
Summary: I can't say enough about this hotel!  Beyond friendly and helpful staff! Perfect location  We stayed in one of the first rooms on the lower level.  Sure it was busy and noisy as the kitchen was directly above us. I would stay in this room again though!! Earplugs were helpful. Close to everything - a small store, the lobby and Disneyland!  We could see the entrance path from our bed!  Speaking of which -the beds were very comfy.  The pool and hot tub were wonderful.  Yes, in the middle of the hotel & parking lot but my kids could have stayed in it all day. You don't really notice it's odd location.    It does not have an elevator to the second floor eating area or rooms but they were happy to serve us in anyway. We did use the wifi without issue. And the safe worked fine.  Also,

Stayed 3 nights. Lovely to get a nice complimentary basket of goodies including bottle of wine. Great room and facilities. Very clean and comfortable.  Extremely convenient location for access to Dysneyland- main gate directly accross the road! I only like a light breakfast (cereal, toast and juice) but if you require more, it's there and as much as you want. At time of booking I was not aware that there was also complimentary dinner. It was great, after a big day at Dysneyland, to be able to come back have a good hearty meal and head back for more fun. If you are expecting a la carte dining- you are in for a disappointment. But if you are happy with tasty and plentiful then you'll be more then satisfied!  Staff were extremely helpful, service prompt and had good local

Summary Heading: Good Location, Friendly Service, Sticky Carpets, Not for Light Sleepers
Summary: STRENGTHS - location, cost, adequate breakfast, well meaning & friendly service, good free wi fi access.  LIMITATIONS - Sticky floor tiles, sticky and dirty carpets, poor quality construction of buildings means that the vibrations of someone walking along the balcony or shutting the door is felt 3 or 4 rooms away.  In general, I would recommend this hotel but more so because it is the best of an average bunch of hotels along the South Harbour Blvd. The staff do try to cater for your needs and the location cant be beaten but certainly no 5 star hotel and people with respiratory conditions would be advised to stay away due the dirty carpets.

The biggest thing that I did not even know about was the free dinner. When we checked in they gave us vouchers for breakfast (which I knew about) then they gave us dinner vouchers. The free dinner saved us a lot of money we were expecting to spend. The next best thing was the location. It was right across from the main entrance to Disneyland and California Adventure. We did not have to take a shuttle to get to the park, we just walked across the street. It was perfect.  If we ever needed anything the staff was super helpful. They had free fruit, cookies and bottled water in the front office. Perfect for a evening snack after all day in the parks.  The amenities alone were a huge savings, but the room rates were great as well. I don't think I could have picked a better place to

We just got home last night from our much needed Disney vacation. Staying at the Park Vue is really what made our vacation so enjoyable. My husband has had back surgery and both of his hips replaced and is pretty much never comfortable in a hotel, no matter how much we spend. I read that the beds were very comfortable at the Park Vue, so I thought it was worth a try. We stayed in a room with two Queen beds and he was amazingly comfortable. Being able to get a good nights sleep is priceless when you fill your days with so much activity. We will never stay anywhere else. The rooms were incredibly clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. There is a nice flat screen television and a little microwave and mini fridge in your room as well. Not only do they serve a hot breakfast
Parkvue was great- so close to disneyland, good value- with the breakfast and evening meal included in the price. Staff really friendly and helpful. We were all happy.

Summary Heading: amazing hotel with everything our family needed
Summary: This is our 2nd time staying there. I wish we would of found this hotel years ago. The location and the price is just what our family was looking for. Staying here helped my family save money with a breakfast and dinner served everyday. The staff is very kind and friendly. The rooms were big enough for our family of 5 and we loved the pool area. Thank you again Park vue for making our spring break a special one for our family to remember for years to come. We tell everyone about this hotel.

Summary Heading: Perfect stay for visit to Disneyland
Summary: Found this hotel via reviews on this site.  It was exactly what I expected, and what I wanted.  It is literally across the street from the entrance of Disneyland. I would say it is actually closer to the main gates than the Disney hotels.  We wanted a pool, as we planned on coming back for a break during the day (kids 8, 5 and 17 months), but we never ended up doing it (one day it was too cold, and the other day we realized it would be a train wreck since we just bought our daughter a face painting). It was a great touch having the wine and fruit basket in the room (though by the time we got back to the room, we had just the energy to plan the next day and go to bed (we did 13 hours and 14 hours in the park on two days), so we never opened the wine). Also, the "social hour"

From the front desk to the housekeeping staff and everyone in-between, thank  you for a very memorable stay.  The special treatment of my grandson for his birthday was very nice.  Although we did not make time to enjoy the evening social time, complete with food and beverages, we did enjoy the morning breakfast a couple of times when time allowed.  I Hop and Cold Stone Ice Cream both next door was very convenient for late night treats.  Closeness to Disneyland's main gate was so appreciated at the end of a long day with tired little feet.  Also check out City Stroller Rentals as an upgrade to the parks strollers.  Very nice.

I am highly recommending this facility and here's why!  We arrived in Anaheim after a long drive from Northern California - needless to say....I wanted out of that car.  We checked in - little chit chat with the front desk - super duper nice staff....mentioned my birthday was coming up in a few - I don't know why - I just did!  We get into the room - there is a basket with ribbons - inside I can spy a bottle - on the flyer it stated could be cider could be wine - PLEASE LET IT BE WINE.  Yep - how flipping nice that was - a bottle of Sauvignon Blanc...couple of waters - some fruit and little plastic glasses :-).  How nice.  Property is situated beautifully between I hop, Denny's, Cold Stone, and Tony Roma's (yum).  Next day BIG day at the park - Lunch at Club 33 - yes....Club 33

Summary Heading: Good experience, Should you stay here?? - Depends!
Summary: We just came back from a week long trip to Disney and stayed all eight nights at the Park Vue.  Our experience was good and we would stay here again if they address some of the issues that they have.  Pros - They two major pros to this hotel are the location ( right across the street from DIsney) and all the food that is included. The buffet breaky was good. They had things for the whole family. Waffle maker, toast, 3 cereals, eggs, bacon or sausage, fruit, chocolate milk, doughnuts, muffins, yogurt, juice and coffee. The social hour is average. We ate dinner three nights when they served sliders, macaroni and tacos. They always a had raw veggies and lettuce and another salad,  Great to get free bottled water, cookies and fruit at the front desk.  Another pro for us was the

Summary Heading: Exceeded expectations but annoyed with additional charge
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at Park Vue in November last year. Breakfast was fanatastic. WiFi could be updated but it is a big hotel and worked much better outside. We had very warm weather while we were these so the rooms were nice to come back to after a long day at Disneyland. Free parking and free water was good too. We are from Australia so didn't know what to expect. We previously stay at Sheraton Anahiem 5 years ago and enjoyed Park Vue a lot more mainly due to the location.  The only problem they charged us $14 after we checked out and never answered my emails requesting what this mount was for. I hope it wasn't for the free welcome basket which we got on day 7! Otherwise very good.

We traveled with a 5 and 6 year old and grandpa in a leg cast.  We had two rooms -one with queen & bunkbed.  The staff was great - the location was perfect - closest motel to Disney entrance is absolutely true.  Would recommend this for a family trip to Disney.

We arrived after a 13 hr flight from Australia, obviously exhausted the room was not ready but at 8 am we didn't expect it to be.. We left our bags and on return they were upstairs in our very clean, comfy room. We were warned about the carpet and they are in the process of replacing all the carpets.. Although ours looked spotless the socks did get black marks on them.. Breakfast was great, we found if anything, there was way too much.. The staff are so pleasant and eager to help in any way.. I thought the location was excellent.. We were a party of 4 with kids 9&11 and we could spend all day/evening at the parks and be home so quickly and safely.. The pool was used by others and looked great..  If you are looking for a affordable, clean hotel with breakfast as close as you can

We've stayed here many times over the years and have seen this hotel evolve to become better and better.  We were so impressed with the service, the gift basket, the friendliness of staff, the water bottles, cookies and fruit at the front desk and a birthday surprise for me that was totally unexpected!  Your morning breakfast is more than adequate with so many choices and the evening snack is much appreciated.Thank you for the lovely stay and for your thoughtfulness.

We just got back from staying here for 4 nights and it was great. The service and location ( right across the street from Disneyland) was perfect.We were greated after our first day in disneyland with a welcome basket of wine, fruit and water. We loved the hot continental breakfast and "social hour", which was a full dinner that changed daily! The rooms are a little older but we hardly spent anytime in them. The kids loved the good size pool and hottub.I would recommend this hotel to anyone on location and amenities alone.

Wonderful stay.  Staff were particularly friendly.  Loved being sooooo close to Disney parks.  Easy to go back to hotel for a rest.  Kids loved the pool.  Breakfast made things heaps easier.  Would defiantly go back here again.  Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: The room is dirty and noisy, won't return
Summary: Just return from a 4-night stay with my family including 2 small kids. Pros:  It has great location and free parking.  There is free breakfast but we always have to wait in line to get the food as they keep running out.  There is free wifi but it's very slow. Cons:  The room smell a strong bleach when we get there. The worst part is the cleanliness of the room - the carpet is very very dirty that our socks get completely dark after stepping on it a few steps. Fortunately I don't have a crawling kid.  The toilet and bath tub is backup after 1 day and we found cockroach in the bathroom!   And there is some constant noise on & off , we complained to the front desk, they said they'll put a note but obviously they didn't do anything.  We chose Park Vue inn based on the high rating

We just had our first stay at the Park Vue Inn and really enjoyed it. We had three rooms, each with 2 queens. One of the rooms was supposed to be a king room, but none were available when we checked in. The walk can't be beat and the breakfast (waffles, cereal, yogurt, fruit, scrambled and boiled eggs, bacon or sausage depending on the day, and a assortment of bread and muffins) and snacks in the lobby (water, lemon water, cookies, fruit) were nice (we didn't come back for the evening meal) but I still feel like it was a bit overpriced. We paid $146 a night plus tax and fees. The rooms were very basic but clean, the Welcome gift basket was nice (fruit, water, and wine) and the birthday gift bags for the boys were very thoughtful (markers, activity books, glow sticks, etc. Plus a

What a great hotel!!  We traveled about 6 hours by car during the night to arrive at the Park Vue.  Our room wasn't ready but we were pleasantly surprised by the customer service and the wonderful front desk.  Water, fruit, cookies and mints sitting on the counter to help ourselves.  We decided to go to the park and they let us use the bathroom in the Lobby to get ready.  When we got to our room we were very happy.  It smelled great and they had a very nice welcome basket with fruit, wine and water for us.  Wow a hotel that doesn't charge $5 for a bottle of water.  Shortly after arriving in our room there was a knock on the door.  The hotel brought my niece a beautiful bouquet of balloons and a bag filled with princess goodies for her birthday.  She was so excited and it was so

Summary Heading: Fabulous!  I will definitely choose Park Vue Inn once again!
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue Inn for 5 nights and loved it!  Lots of great perks - gift basket, free hot breakfast, bottled water, freshly-baked cookies, social hour, discounted tickets to Disneyland, microwave, refrigerator, free parking, wifi, and right across the street from the park!  The prices were excellent.  I highly recommend the Park Vue Inn to anyone!

Summary Heading: Park Vue Inn was the perfect hotel for our needs.
Summary: The Disney Resort hotels were laughingly out of reach. So, I did a thorough search of each close-by hotel along Harbor Blvd.  The Park Vue Inn received exceptional reviews, so I decided to give them a try.  I'm glad I did because the Park Vue Inn was perfect for our extended family of seven.  We had two adjoining queen rooms on the ground floor.   The door between both rooms was always open to easily pass back and forth.  There was a Welcome gift  to share.  The bathrooms were immaculate and the beds extremely comfortable.  The morning breakfast was filling and there was enough variety to please any taste.  The light supper was an added bonus.  The Park Vue is literally at the crosswalk to enter Disneyland on foot.  It was easy to slip over to the hotel to change or rest.  I

If you are coming here and are reading the reviews then you won't be disappointed. This hotel lives up to its star rating very precisely. No, it is not fancy, it is somewhat dated and in need of a makeover and yes, the cleaning leaves something to be desired however, I knew ALL this beforehand and was prepared for it. What makes me give it a 4 star rating is all the perks as well as the most excellent location. The free water and cookies and fruit, the breakfast and the service were the reasons for my hotel choice and this is why I was not disappointed. I suggest to those who leave a bad review that they should have READ and heeded the prior reviews and perhaps have booked elsewhere. What you see is what you get. We stayed in the three queen room and it fit perfectly for me as

Summary Heading: Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous location... okay motel experience.
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue for a 3 day stay at Disneyland.  This was our first visit to Disneyland and we wanted something close, clean and reasonably priced.  We weren't concerned about the pool, since we were spending the first part of our vacation on a cruise ship and were really just going to be there to sleep.  We chose the Park Vue because of the location and the positive reviews on this site as well as on the disboards.  Overall, I am satisfied with our stay at the Park Vue and would stay there again.   I did have difficulty making my reservation.  I booked the "facebook" rate - so I had to call instead of just booking online.  I asked for an email confirmation - which never arrived.  It was a good thing that I phoned back - since my dates were wrong!  (the month before)

You need to understand that there's those that stay at the Disney resort hotels and there's the rest of us that stay at the budget hotels on Harbor Blvd.  If you are going to a beach resort somewhere, you look for the best.  Usually when you're going to Disneyland the most important "amenities" are how far do I have to walk to the park, is it clean and will they feed me?  This place is all that and free parking.  We've stayed at many hotels/motels on Harbor.  This one is our favorite.  Let me explain how it will be yours too.  They have jacuzzi rooms.  Let me explain further.  You just spent your entire day on your feet, standing in lines.  Can you think of anything better?  It is the most rewarding thing when you leave at 9am and return at 9pm to your very own large jacuzzi in

I booked the Park Vue Inn after many weeks of reading through various reviews of this and other hotels in the area. Based on the location and the more positive reviews than negative, I went ahead and booked... I was extremely nervous as we were travelling from Australia and had never used on line booking before.  How pleasantly surprised we were. The Park Vue do not advertise as 5 star - so don't expect it. What you can expect is comfortable beds, spotless rooms and extremely pleasant staff which really made our Disneyland experience enjoyable. The breakfast was manned by pleasant and happy staff, with the meals sufficient to get a good start to the day. Social hour was a bonus - do not think that it is a full evening meal. It is advertised as a "light meal" so we were not sure

Summary Heading: nice accomodations and lots of free perks
Summary: The best surprise about this hotel were all the freebies...bottled water, fruit, cookies, wifi, breakfast and dinner!  There was even a gift basket waiting for us in our room with a bottle of white wine.  I don't drink wine, so I don't know if it was any good or not.  The hotel was clean and updated.  Some of the rooms have been renovated with fireplaces and flat screen televisions, but ours had not.  Our room had a Queen sized bed and a bunk bed with a trundle that slept all three of our kids.  The room was small, but functional.  The rooms are not every soundproof, and it was impossible to sleep past 7:30 AM when other guests start moving around.  All staff was very friendly.  The breakfast buffet saved us a ton of money.  You can not get a better location for walking distance

Summary Heading: I've stayed often and will definitely return
Summary: The Park Vue Inn has lots going for it. It isn't deluxe, of course, but neither is the price, so that's fine with me. It *is* comfortable and the staff is friendly and attentive. It's a very good value, and its location can't be beat--five minutes' walk to either park gate. My only dissatisfaction in the past has been with unreliability of the free wifi signal; but not this time! It looks like the problem, whatever it was, has been resolved and the wifi access was strong and steady during my whole stay. The complimentary breakfast each morning is very nice--including omelettes, bacon, fresh fruit and lots more. All in all, I love the Park Vue Inn.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for the price, great location
Summary: It took a long time to decide on a hotel due to most charging for parking, no free breakfast, no shuttle(or having to take the ART-anaheim resort transit).  It came down to Candy Cane Inn or the Park Vue.  They were both the same price, Candy Cane offered the only hotel w/ their own shuttle that was free but it wasnt as close as the Park Vue.  It also didnt have the special birthday special package(balloons,gift ,cold stone cake) , the gift basket w/ a water/wine/fruit, or the social hour.  We were very happy in choosing the Park Vue Inn. It is so close to the park.  We loved not having to wait for a shuttle at the end of the nite. We have a 6 yr old and 3yr old, we were able to ake a break mid-day, kids napped then swam and had lunch then back to the park for the remainder of

Summary Heading: Not what I expected but ok.
Summary: After reading all these reviews and seeing that it was rated #4 on Tripadvisor I thought this place had to be awesome.  I thought it was fairly overconfident handing all the guests a card with the website on it and asking they review it.  I always review anyway so  this is my experience, good and bad.  It certainly was not awesome and I have to wonder what type of accommodation people are used to who rave about it and say it's amazing and wouldn't stay anywhere else.    We  arrived and were allowed to park for free for a few hours before our room was ready.  When we got in the room it was a queen/bunk room not a queen queen room as I'd booked.  It was ok though my kids liked it.  However that might have been a problem if it was not suitable.  They did not mention this at check

Summary Heading: Tired, grubby, noisey, but excellent location and good staff.
Summary: This 60's MOtel, masquerading as a HOtel is dog-eared, noisey, grubby and tired. It is in urgent need of an overhaul. If it wasn't for the brilliant location, very good staffing, free parking, (rare along the Sth Harbor Blvd strip) free breakfast, free evening social hour and free welcome basket, I'd be giving it just 2 green dots, not 3. The nearby IHOP and attached Cold Stone Ice-creamery helped too.  My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights last week and each evening we could hear the neighbours on our left, our right and above us. The walls are so thin that we could actually hear the mattress creaking and groaning as the people next door were turning over while sleeping. Like any older motel the guests cars are parked right outside the rooms and every night we could hear doors

We have stayed at this hotel several times, even pre trip advisor.  I have been so impressed each & every time and our visits there only improve.  We timed our walk from closing our hotel room and getting to the gate at Disneyland .. it was a seven minute walk, including the long light.  So I don't think it's possible to get a closer hotel.  The rooms are clean, the mattresses are now new and soft and the staff help you on a variety of issues .. from car rentals to buying the disney passes.  In additional to a full breakfast, which varied from morning to morning and is now comprised of you-make waffles, omelets,  sausage, cereals, sweet buns, all juices, coffee with flavors available, fresh fruit .. it just goes on and on. But in addition to this, they have added a lighter

Summary Heading: PARK VUE INN = BEST LOCATION, BEST VALUE, BEST HOTEL!
Summary: We chose the Park Vue Inn because we heard it was the closest to Disneyland making going back and forth with 3 young kids convenient.  When we got there we loved the Park Vue Inn for not only this reason but so much more!  Our great experience started before we even got there when I called from the road and asked about parking.  We fully expected to have to pay to park at Disneyland and then have to move our car at 3pm check-in which would have been a big hassle.  I was so happy when they told me to just come straight to the hotel and park for free!  When we went back to the hotel later that day to officially check in, the clerk was very nice and happily accommodated my request to switch our reservation to Queen plus bunks which was much better sleeping arrangements since we

Great front staff (Erick) But the hotel needs a update badly!!! We booked the king room with the jacuzzi as soon as we entered the room it smeeled moldy. We had to go to the store and purchase a air freshener. The spray only helped for a few minutes. The room itself was clean except for the jacuzzi, it had mold inside and for the 3 days that we were there it was never cleaned  so we did not use it. Some nice added items that they do  for there guest are a basket in the room with fruit and wine and since it was my sons birthday they had a gift and balloons in the room when we got back to the room on his special day.I think that these rooms get used alot since the location is across from the Disneyland main gate. I think that it is time to spend the money on a much needed updating

Summary Heading: Easy access to Disneyland, family-friendly hotel
Summary: We picked this hotel based on the reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. It is not a five-star resort type of place - , but they are very generous with their guests and we had a great first trip with our kids to Disneyland.   The location can't be beat - a short walk across the street to the main gates, while others have to take shuttles back to their hotels. We were able to easily come back for swimming or snack breaks during the day. We also really appreciated the full breakfast served in the morning - including eggs, sausages or bacon, waffles, fruit and many other items. Many hotels offer only muffins and juice in the morning - but to get ready for a day at the park, a full breakfast is most neccessary! We often came back in the evening for the social hour - it

Summary Heading: Close to park, pleasant staff, had great time.
Summary: Loved the proximity to front gates of Disneyland.  Great, inexpensive laundry facilities took the worry out of the trip.

Being Annual Passholders to Disneyland, my friends and I travel down to the park whenever we get a chance and we usually love to stay @ the Park Vue Inn.  The Inn really is the closest place to stay, right across the street from the park.  The rooms are great!  The bedding is really soft and the showers have hot water!  That's actually saying alot.  The staff is very nice and welcoming.  Plus, they offer you water, fruit and cookies in the lobby, in addition to the continental breakfast and a social hour/dinner.  Adn we usually have no issues with parking our vehicle.  The Park Vue is a little bit more on the expensive side when it comes to the hotels across the street from the park.  However, sometimes you can get a good rate.  And during the season when the hotels are normally

Summary Heading: Why would I stay anywhere else!
Summary: This was our 2nd stay at the Park Vue and while we were happy before--we were pleasantly surprised by improvements in the breakfast and (now) dinner. We stay in the Kitchen suite which makes feeding a family of 7 better on the budget--coming back for meals never slowed us down because of the proximity of the hotel to Disneyland.  We could have prepared less food, however, because the free meals were improved from the last time we were here.  The breakfast was fantastic...not gourmet, but eggs, sausage, belgian waffles are a whole lot more filling than toast and cereal you get elsewhere.  We planned on dinners in our room but did eat one dinner during the "social hour".  Our kids loved the simple fare and we could definitely forgo preparing food for this option in the future.

The park Vue Inn is in a great location, being directly across the road from the Disneyland entrance, we also loved the location of Ihops , Cold Stone and Dennys being almost in the car park. It was only a small walk to the new Garden Walk shopping and dining precinct and Bubba Gumps. The hotel provided comfortable beds and good sized rooms with flat screens in both bedrooms.At the end of a big day there was the pool for the kids. The bathroom was very clean, however some new towels would be a good investment. We loved that  breakfast was included offering hot or continental options, although very busy at times we enjoyed the option to dine outside in the courtyard. We found the staff to be extremely helpful and look forward tyo our next stay.

Summary Heading: The staff delivered on everything promised on the web page.
Summary: Our family group of 10 people ranged from age 6 to 80 with two birthdays, we would recommend and return to the hotel on another trip to Disneyland.  The staff was very helpful and friendly, rooms clean and the meals were a nice touch.  Several members of our group are vegan and Brian the food manager was very helpful so we could eat breakfast with our group.  The bottled water and fruit at the front counter was a nice touch. It was nice to be directly across the street from the entrance to Disneyland so you do not need to wait for a shuttle to another hotel.

Wife and I spent two days at Disney during St. Patty's week and we were pleasantly surprised how good this place is on so many levels from customer service, friendly staff, cleaning-ness, efficiently run,  everything works. We were happy that its 5-min away from Disney but all the extra amenities from the full blown breakfast, light dinner to the unexpected gift baskets and a special anniversary gift basket....etc. It was apparent that Park Vue cares a lot about  the comfort of their guests and making sure all their needs are met above and beyond the norm.  We had such a good memory of this place and surely would return.

We stayed here for three nights March 7-10, 2011.  The location couldn't be any closer. Each day we left the park for an hour and a half to go get a bite and a quick swim for the kids then walk right back to Disney. Not once did my kids complain about the distance :-)  The pool was heated quite nicely and was very clean. The hot tub is really hot.  The room was immaculate and certainly big enough for the four of us. Argenis and Brian were both very personable and would ask every time they saw us if we had what we needed or required help finding anything.  The free breakfast (awesome!) and "social hour" supper (while not gourmet), were tasty enough and they saved me a small fortune in restaurant costs.  The bonus bottled water and cookies in the lobby were also great. In the

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn for 4 nights during Spring Break in March and it was perfect.  I brought 3 teenagers with me and we were able to all 4 stay comfortably in the room.  With a 3-day Disney ticket, the hotel is across the street from the main gate at Disneyland so we were close enough to walk back mid-day to rest before returning for the evening festivities.   The free breakfast is substantial with waffles, yogurt, fruit, donuts, bagels, cereal, etc, and the social hour often had enough for our dinner (e.g. enchiladas) so we were able to stay within our food budget.   I'd definitely stay here again the next time I am going to Disneyland

We loved the location of the hotel.  The beds are super comfy and the breakfast is good.  We had two LARGE roaches in our room the second night.  Hotel staff came to our room and told us it would be sprayed the next morning and that we would get a call from management, which we never did.  Carpets aren't great..I always wear flip flops in hotels, so it wasn't much of an issue, but if I'd had a toddler crawling on the floor, then it would've been.  We found food crumbs and old paper towels behind the bunk bed.  For the price we paid, the rooms could've been a lot cleaner.  Staff is friendly and seems to be trying to do their best.  The pool is small, but nice and clean. This hotel is also very very loud.  Didn't bother me or my daughter, but it really bothered my Mom.

We loved that it was right accross the street from Disneyland. The rooms were a little on the small side. It was nice having a fridge and microwave in tthe room as well. The pool wasn't very secluded. Staff was friendly. Has continental breakfast.

Summary Heading: An ordinary motel that provides an excellent experience
Summary: I stayed here on a last minute trip to attend a show at the Convention Center (CC). This motel is a nice 20 minute walk to to the CC and is right across from Disney. The lobby is nicely decorated and they have complimentary cold water bottles, excellent coffee, cookies and fruit at the front desk. The staff was very polite and I checked into my room to find a gift basket awaiting me with a nice bottle of Cab and wine glasses and fruit!This must be a first. They have nice plantings outside along the room walkway and it makes the traditional motel setting much nicer. The room was pleasant and clean, although they could use some fresh paint. The furniture was looking a little worn, but it was fine.

Summary Heading: THIS IS THE PLACE TO STAY WHEN GOING TO DISNEY
Summary: Let me start by saying, I am very picky when it comes to hotels.  Normally we prefer to stay in a suite so when the kids go to bed, we have a living room to relax in.  However, when doing research we couldn't pass up this hotel and I'm happy to stay we stayed here. The staff was amazing.  The breakfast was GREAT!  Something for everyone and believe me, my kids are picky.  I like fresh fruit for breakfast and they had a bowl of it (fresh pineapple, melon, cantaloupe and grapes).  It did disappear fast, but I asked for more and they quickly brought it out.  The kids LOVED the waffles.  All the hotels we were looking at staying at did not do a free breakfast, so this was great to have.  We loved having Cold Stone Creamery on site.  They had a deal on the room key  - 4 ice creams

We stayed here as we wanted to be right across from Disneyland. Super convenient. Great value for the price paid, especially if you book early. Rooms were clean & spacious enough for our family of four. Welcome basket was a nice touch. Staff were super friendly & helpful. Breakfast was good - gets crowded by 8.30-9am so better to come down earlier if you need a place to sit. Cold Stone Creamery on site - great way to end the evening!!! Lots of eateries around the inn. Highly recommend.

We enjoyed our stay  ever so much at Park Vue Inn they were wonderful. We  asked for 2 things our first night extra towels and some extra tissue  and with in 2 minuets we had a knock on our room door and there it was.. all the staff was very friendly and the rooms were super clean and nice they left us a welcome basket and ever gave our girls gifts and petite ice cream cakes for there birthday (as that is what were were celebrating ). The food they served was great we enjoyed it.. My family can't wait to come back again to stay for a longer time.. we love Park Vue Inn

Summary Heading: Great Value Hotel close to Disneyland !!!
Summary: Loved this hotel for many reasons but the main one was that it was soooooo close to Disneyland so we could walk back to the hotel for naps ( travelling with a 2 and 4 year old) at lunch time and then walk back. We have a 2 queen suite with fold out sofa. Our room was on the second level. It was clean and comfortable and it was great to have the kitchen. This IS a 2.5 star hotel so if you dont expect anymore then you will love the value for money when visiting Disneyland. The heated pool was great for us as it was cold while we were there and the free parking was a great bonus.The rooms were cleaned daily and the small touches the cleaning staff added were great ( like organising all the toys for the girls). The free breakfast was simple but enough and very convenient and easy.

We actually stayed in two different hotels this trip to Disneyland.  We moved to Park Vue Inn to finish up our vacation.  They asked us what we were celebrating and personalized our visit.  We were able to park for the day, even though we couldn't check in till 3:00.  That was very important, saving us paying a fee.  Warm cookies were waiting as we checked in later in the day.  The rooms were recently remodeled with fresh linens and appealing decor.  Breakfast provided with a variety of sweet rolls, cereal, drink and fruit.  But the hot waffles were delicious.  The pleasant surprise was the social hour with soup (chicken noodle and tomato tasted like Campbell's) and other goodies.  The nachos were a hit with kids.

Summary Heading: Close proximity to Disneyland is great!
Summary: Clean rooms.  Directly across from entrance to Disneyland.  Continental breakfast included waffles, bacon, sausage, in addition to regular cereal and pastry items.  Friendly staff.  Great location and affordable price means that we will stay again.

Booked this hotel based on the location and the positive reviews posted on TripAdvisor, and we were not disappointed.  Front desk was friendly, our room was ready on time and was exactly as promised as far as location.  Had a 2 year  old and 6 year old and they loved the bunk beds.  The fruit basket was a very nice touch.  The room was very clean and well laid out, and it was very quiet (we were at the back of the hotel, away from the street noise).  Free parking and breakfast, and you could not be any closer to the Disneyland entrance (literally a 5 minute walk).  Could watch the fireworks while eating ice cream at the Coldstone Creamery onsite.  Will definitely return for future visits!

Summary Heading: Location is great.  Service was shockingly bad.
Summary: We stayed in a two bedroom suite.  The amount of space is very small for being a suite.  The location of this hotel is outstanding (5 min walk to the entrance of Disneyland).  I wasn't going going to write a review about our experience, but when we checked out, they handed me a TripAdvisor business card and insisted we review our stay.  I had made arrangements for a friend to leave Disneyland tickets at the front desk of the Park Vue Inn the day prior to our arrival.  I called Park Vue the day before our arrival to make sure that they had the tickets and that they were waiting to be picked up.  I told them that I would be there first thing in the morning to pick up the tickets.  They told me "no problem" and they said they would just need to see my ID to pick up the tickets.  We

Summary Heading: Glad we took the chance, nice surprise.
Summary: We stayed this past weekend at the hotel. 2 adults and 1 toddler.  I found the room very neat and clean. Bathroom combo with fridge and microwave was nice.  The beds in my opinion were very comfortable.  We got a 2 queen room and there was plenty of room for a pack and play placed against the wall opposite the second bed in the room.   You must call early the day you are checking in to secure a room on the ground floor. We did not, so had to lug our stuff upstairs.  The front desk staff did offer to send someone to help. The breakfast offered in the morning was what we expected.  The evening meal/snack was not, so plan on an alternative.  IHOP right next to hotel. The front desk and hotel staff were very nice.  I would stay again when going to Disneyland. Straight walk across

My 10 yr. old daughter & I stayed here for 2 nights. We changed to this hotel after staying one night at Motel 6 (horrible). This hotel is right across the street from main entrance to Disneyland. This made it very easy to come back to room for sweaters, rest, food, etc.. The welcome basket was a nice touch, wine, fruit, water. The free breakfast & light dinner also saved us some bucks! The food isn't fabulous, but it filled you up before going to the park in the morning. Eggs, bisquits, gravy, fruit, waffles, toast, bagels....enough choices to please both my daughter and myself. The light dinner was OK..1st night it was chicken sliders, soup & salad. The next night was hot wings, BBQ wings, soup & salad. It was perfect for us, we are not heavy eaters. The room was clean & the

Summary Heading: The Best Stay outside of Disney Property...
Summary: I love this hotel, It may not be super fancy or extremely large but everyone here will make you feel as if your staying on Disney property. We have stayed here a few times and my first stay here was not memorable.I had decided that would be the last time i would stay there (along with The Tropicana). That was a few years ago....    In 2008 we needed to book a room that was reasonably priced and with in walking distance to the parks. We have stayed at pretty much every hotel on Harbor Bl. between Ball and Katella so we knew where we wanted to stay.  Of course i waited to the last minute and nothing popped up but the Park Vue and my husband said book it. I am so glad we did, this was a completely different place. It all has to do with the front desk. They are awesome, especially

The hotel staff was great, the outdoor pool was heated and very warm,  they free breakfast was great, the free evening social hour meals were great for the kids, the location can't be beat and the rates were very reasonable.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for a family with children
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for the first time for our son's 6 year old birthday.  We chose the hotel because it was across the street from Disneyland and the price of the hotel included free parking and a free breakfast.  When the staff found out it was our son's birthday they surprised him with a bunch of balloons and a gift for him.  We were also given a welcome basket which included, wine, fruit and water.  The rooms are a bit small but clean, nothing spectacular, but if you are planning on spending your time at Disneyland it doesn't really matter.  We were told they also have an early evening happy hour but we never came back to the hotel in time to check it out.  Overall I would recommend this hotel and we hope to return again soon.

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn for one night. The location is unbeatable and the price is reasonable. The location of our room was not the best (underneath the breakfast room and next to the vending machine and gift shop), but I suspect this was because we checked in so late. We loved the fact that we were able to park at the hotel before we checked in. The basket that they left in the room was a nice touch and the room was clean. Unfortunately, there was no hot water in the shower the next morning, but I reported this to the front desk and they apologized profusely saying that it had just been reported by another room and they suspected an "issue with the pump".

Summary Heading: Good for what you pay for...sort of.
Summary: First of all, I'm giving it a "Very Good" only because I'm comparing it to motels it the same class.  The staff was great, the welcome basket was nice, but the breakfast was...um, free.   It put some food in you so you could head out to the park without being starving.  I've had worse, but not very often.  The folks that run the breakfast were friendly, helpful, and extremely busy.  They ran out of some types of food each of the 3 breakfasts we were there, and the evening snack there was just ok.  The room was small, we did not have enough hot water one morning, and the furniture was beat up a bit.  BUT, right across the street from Disneyland and the place was very clean.  Decent value, but i could have gotten the Embassy Suites South for the same amount, but would have had to

If  you're booking for another reason beside location, you might be disappointed, the staff is very friendly. Breakfast is simple, but saves you waiting in lines at the park.  We will stay here again. We would rather stay at The Grand California, but we don't like spending more than 300 a night on a room.  We stayed at the Marriott a couple of months ago, Which was a little nicer, but who wants to walk a long distance or ride shuttle buses.  one negative is the shower, it was really just part of the bathroom. So my two year olds fell frequently. Fortunately they are close to the ground to start with so no harm was done.  Location, Location, Location

My family had a wonderful time and saved alot of money staying at Park Vue Inn. The hotel was directly across from Disney, so it wasnt necessary to drive or get a ride. Food was available both for breakfast and dinner which was great. The guest relations mgr. Argenis(NICE GUY) even brought us a bottle of wine. We would highly recommend this hotel and we have.  Jeff and Jennifer  Beaverton Or

Summary Heading: The location is not worth the headache
Summary: My kids and grandkids and my spouse and I stayed in three rooms for four nights.  The heat in my youngest daughters room was broken.  The water in all the rooms was luke warm at best but my oldest daughter and her family had COOL water in the shower the whole time they were there.  They asked at least twice for it to be fixed and it did not happen.  The beds were hard, the pillows were harder.  The in room coffee was nasty with an after taste.  When my daughter called down for non-decaf coffee they told her that they could bring the shower cap but do not deliver coffee to the rooms. When I mentioned this to the manager I was told that they were probably short staffed and no one could bring it but that doesn't explain why they did indeed deliver a shower cap and two toothbrushes

Summary Heading: Perfect for our budget and needs
Summary: The Park Vue Inn suited our needs and budget perfectly! We were a group of two moms, a 2 yr old girl and a 14 yr old girl. The rooms were spacious enough to easily  accommodate our luggage and a crib. The front desk staff were extrememly friendly, helpful and efficient. The complimentary cookies and  bottled water available in the lobby were great. The complimentary basket of fruit and wine in the room was lovely. We did not use the pool, but it looked clean. Great to be able to leave our vehicle in the parking lot prior to checking in and after checking out. The location is unbeatable! We felt very safe. Even the on-site store had good bargains!

Summary Heading: not like before but still great for Disney
Summary: We stayed at this hotel about five years ago and it is not like it was before..  First the cleanliness, the room carpet needs to be shampooed or replaced. Our white socks got so dirty from walking on the carpet. As well the inside of the outside door was filthy from handprints and needs to be scrubbed or painted.  Second the breakfast has really changed. Gone was the casual enter and eat. Now you are monitored with the check in system. The other thing was the breakfast got so picked over and was not replenished regularly. More than once we over heard someone going to the kitchen to ask if there was more food.   Being the hotel suggests this is one of their features they should be able to estimate how much breakfast is required.   As well the bottled water that was to be

We stayed here for 9 nights with our children 5yrs and 12 yrs and it was amazing.  It was our first holiday in the USA and we found this hotel through Trip Advisor.  All staff were friendly and the level of service was excellent - nothing was too much trouble.  Special thanks goes to Argenis and Bryan who offered really great advice on things to see and do. It was really great to come home every evening to friendly faces who were always smiling.  The location of the hotel was awesome as it was right across the road from Disneyland and the kids loved the fact we could go back to the hotel for a rest and return later in the evening.  Value for money this hotel was great.  Almost everything is included in the price.   We would definitely return to this hotel to stay and we have

We spent two weeks at your hotel.  Very friendly staff.  The beds are comfortable.  It is a wonderful location right across from Disneyland.  They provide an excellent breakfast and also their Social hour serves as a light supper if so desired.  We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Just returned from a visit to Disneyland.  The Park Vue is directly across the street from the main gate. Price is very reasonable.  If you take into consideration they provide a full breakfast which includes waffles, cereal, bacon, sausage, donuts, toast, eggs etc.  & a "social hour" that is often a great dinner.  One day the "social hour" was sliders, one day it was cheese enchildas.  By providing room, breakfast and dinner the price becomes an exceedingly great value.  The staff was friendly  and went out of their way to help us in any way. Unfortunately our  weekend was cold and wet.  But being able to return to the hotel and take a break was wonderful.  Especially with the little kids.  This was our 2nd stay with the Park Vue Inn.  Also a small heated pool and a jacuzzi.

Right across the road from Disneyland main gates.  Rooms were clean and comfortable.  Breakfast and Happy Hour is included.  Food is nice for what you pay.  Spa was lovely and hot, very handy having onsite Laundry.  Free water, biscuits and fruit at reception.  Would definately stay there again for position.

Summary Heading: The Park Vue Inn was a great choice for my family!
Summary: We couldn't have been happier with our stay at the Park Vue Inn.  The location was excellent for visiting Disneyland and unlike some of the other hotels in the area they don't charge extra for parking your car.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  The rooms were clean and the shower was good.  We ate at the free breakfast each day and were happy to save the money on eating out for every meal.  The food wasn't fancy but they always had make-your-own waffles and several toast/bagel options in addition to the usual cereal and a couple of hot items.  Overall we were quite pleased with this hotel and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Summary Heading: The best location and the best staff.
Summary: A very nice place to stay when visiting Disneyland and California Park.  This hotel is located directly across from the parks.  Other hotels claim to be right across the road, but they are not directly in front of the entrance.  Staff are very friendly, and helpful. The hotel is very clean and very good value.  There is always freshly baked cookies at the front desk as well as water and fruit. The Park Vue also offer breakfast and dinner, although we only went to breakfast once during our stay, because my kids would sleep in. I can now see why the reviews for the Park Vue are so great.  A job well done to all the staff there.  I would recommend this hotel to everyone I know.

We enjoyed our Disneyland pilgrimage enormously in part because this hotel fulfilled our hopes for convenience (just walk across the street) and comfort (good beds and a well-trained and very helpful staff). The the good size, freshly decorated rooms both had a small refrigerator, microwave and coffeemaker. A free hot breakfast, AND a modest hot supper (mac and cheese, soup, and salad) was offered along with cookies and fruit in the lobby.

We used Trip Advisor to select the Park Vue Hotel for our Disneyland holiday, and the high ratings are truly deserved.  The location, in easy walking distance of Disneyland for young families, is prime.   Breakfast is included and most nights, the hotel also provided a simple complementary supper that was ideal for kids (hamburgers, mac & cheese.)  The staff were absolutely fabulous and thanked us for choosing Park Vue every day we were there:  thanks to Brian and Armenis who were two of the hospitality managers who were very kind to us.  The rooms are simple but clean and comfortable, and the employees truly take the motto of "family run" business to heart.  I highly recommend you select the Park Vue Hotel for your Disneyland holid

We have stayed a many hotels the times we've gone to Disneyland, including the Disneyland Hotel, and I can tell you Park Vue Inn is the best.  Since our first time staying at this hotel a few years ago, this is the only hotel we have stayed at since.  Not only is reserving a room easy to do, but the cost of the hotel is very reasonible, especially for what you get.  When you arrive to check-in they have complementary bottled water and cookies.  Every guest has a welcome package waiting for them in their room.  We just stayed there on Valentines day, and they also had a bud vase with 2 roses and a helium heart balloon.  How wonderful is that?  Their rooms are clean, and they have suites also if you want one.  We love their complementary continental breakfast every morning.  It's

I stayed at the PV with my 17yr daughter for 10 nights for and early 18th birthday present. After a long 14 hr flight it was nice to arrive early in the morning and not to have to store our bags until 3pm but have our room ready for us to freshen up in. I cannot say enough about how good the service was - the staff were always welcoming and friendly and those warm cookies at the front desk are a brilliant touch!! Also nice to be able to grab a bottle of water as we headed to the parks for the day. Recent reviews have described the breakfast and social hour supper to a tee - it was good, hot & filling - if you want more - go to a 4 star restaurant! Also, the view from the deck wher you eat was great when the fireworks was on. The welcome basket was a lovely touch. We had a 2

Breakfast, dinner, friendly and helpful employees...all located directly across the street from the main entrance to both parks. What more can you ask for? Free parking, early check-in and less walking than from the hotels within the park. Get a room upstairs, if possible as kids don't really know how to walk quietly!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: We had such a positive three day experience staying at the Park Vue Inn with our daughter's family including two grandchildren ages four and four months. The staff was so friendly, helpful and accommodating, the service was great, the rooms were clean and comfortable. Our rooms were near the back of the hotel and we had such quiet nights. The hotel is directly across the street from the pedestrian entrance to Disneyland. It was an easy walk and allowed us to return to the rooms to rest in the afternoons. We are planning to stay there again for our next Disneyland trip and will recommend it to all of our friends.

Spent many hours reviewing "reviews": of Anaheim hotels on TA before our trip and finally deciding on Park Vue.  The PV was exactly what we expected.  The breakfast was ample, from fruit loops to turkey sausage to waffles, lots of choice.   The room small but clean and quiet.  We had the bunkbed, trundle room and turned out that the top bunkbed was dangerous (the mattress was at the same level as the top of the guard rail, so the result was no barrier to prevent my 7 year old from rolling off) but used the lower bunk and the trundle it was fine.  We used the social meal for dinner more than twice.  The meals are mostly premade/canned but what the hell.  The kids loved it and it saved us quite a bit.  4 corndogs at Disneyland cost $26!  Yes, being right across the street and a

Summary Heading: Fantastic.  I would recommend this to anyone, without hestitation.
Summary: Our group included three adults and three kids (8, 11 and 13).  We all loved the hotel and friendly staff.  They clearly want you to come back and visit again. They work hard to earn your repeat business.  The kids and husband were surprised by the personalized letter and gift basket waiting in our room when we checked in.  So that was a fun way to start off.  Then we came back on Valentines to find chocolates, two red roses and a helium heart balloon.  Very impressive!  The building is designed so that all rooms are accessed from the outside.  We were on the second floor which means that most of the second floor guests walked past our window on their way to the breakfast room.  Hint to parents: hearing the  laughter of excited children in the morning is cute, it's the parents

Summary Heading: Every Disneyland traveler should stay here.
Summary: The room was clean and quiet. Warm and friendly staff treated us like family, like the ice cold lemon water after the hot cab ride, and the inside info on the best place to see the fireworks. The location is perfect, directly across from the Disneyland main gate, allowing us to take a mid day break, and quickly walk back to the hotel to take advantage of the "social hour"  in the evening, we then could easily walk back to Disney. Social hour was like continental dinner. Coldstone in the lobby is nice alternative to expensive park confections.

The location to Disneyland could not be better, a very short walk out of the Park when we needed a break. Free parking for both days, free breakfast with an amazingly generous selection, free dinner, and a heated pool and jacuzzi ! The employees were very courteous, efficient and fun! Six people in our party, including two kids and everyone was impressed and happy. Lots of extra touches to show they care! Free Wifi.

We have been staying at the Park Vue for over 20 years and boy has it changed for the better! What used to be a run down questionable place to stay has now become the ONLY hotel we will stay at on our Disneyland trips.  The rooms aren't overly huge, but they are clean and the beds are really comfy. The welcome basket is a nice touch too.  Being the closest hotel to Disney is great, but the absolute best part of this place is the breakfast and the social hour. They now have a hot breakfast everyday with eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns, biscuits, plus the usual fare. The social hour was new for us, but wow what a great idea! Each evening they offer what they call a light dinner. We were there for 11 days and saw a variety of offerings including mini burgers, mini chicken

We would definitely stay here again.  Great value and entrance is as close to Disneyland as you can get.  They allowed us to park both of our cars free of charge and also offered complimentary appetizers in the evening and a decent breakfast in the AM.  Room was a little small, but definitely big enough and the bunk beds for the kids was a great touch.  Room was plenty clean as well.  We will definitely stay here again.
We were absolutely impressed with the cleanliness and friendly service. We will definitely be staying here again!

We stay here when we come to Disneyland Resort. Great location. Lots of room options, love the Jacuzzi Room! Welcome basket is a great touch... we enjoy the wine while the little one enjoys the fruit for breakfast. Also, the mattress has always been comfortable! Big plus after a long day at the Resort. :)  The only complaint is that the maids come in the room even if the "Do Not Disturb" sign is on the door. We talked to the manager and it never happened again.  It's a nice spot. I hope they keep it as well kept as it is now. So many neighboring hotels have fallen prey to time and use, the rooms becoming wornout and undermaintained. Keep up the good work Park Vue! The next trip will be our fourth stay. :)

Summary Heading: great place, we will be staying again
Summary: location is great for disneyland trip..good breakfast to start off the day and in the evening social hour was good too, grab a bite to eat and back to the park..staff was very friendly..also nearby resturants and other activities...

Summary Heading: Perfectly fine unless you have a complaint
Summary: The motel is fine as is.  It offers free breakfast and social hour dinner (quality is on par with frozen dinner).  Parking is tough and we had to park several rooms away every day.  We reserved a room with a jacuzzi and wished we never did.  The jacuzzi was 3 feet from the bed and in the main room.  We couldn't use it without getting cold fast.  The room also smelled of mold and mildew.  I figured it was because the jacuzzi was surrounded by the room carpet.  The carpet was so dirty that our white socks were black within minutes of walking around the room.  Our shower was apparently leaking into the room below so the maintenance people came in one day to look into it.  I left the room while they were still working.  Upon our return from Disneyland that night, I tried to use the

It's across the street from Disneylands front gate for starters.  There is free parking at the hotel so when you get to Anaheim check in at the hotel for a parking pass and leave you car.  Then come back after check in time to check into your room.  And the day you leave, if you are going back to Disneyland the day you check out of your hotel just leave your car in the hotel parking lot until your done at Disneyland.  You just save a bundle on parking.  Upon arrival we received cookies and bottled water.  Water with lemon was available.  We received a welcome basket complete with Wine & cups, bottled water and fruit.  It was our 17 year old son's birthday so there were balloons, a cup full of candy and a certificate to take to the Cold Stone for a free cake.  The Cold Stone is

Summary Heading: Good breakfast and easy to get to the park.
Summary: Great location,cleanliness,easy access to Disneyland/California adventure/Downtown Disney. In walking distance to the garden walk mall/friendly staff/ Awesome breakfast and and an alright pool. in total i would give this a 8 out of 10

Hotel's location can not be beat, it is located at the crosswalk that takes you directly to Disney's front gate. The hotel staff is unbelievable, I've never experienced such gracious service. They are never too busy to smile and assist you. Free cookies, fresh fruit, bottled water and iced water with slices of lemon are located at the front desk the majority of the time. There is also a computer with printer available in the front lobby for patrons to use. The brick walkways throughout the complex were mopped twice a day and the grounds are very beautiful. The hotel has a gated pool and spa with towels located conveniently poolside. IHOP, Coldstone Creamery and a small gift shop and gym are also located within the hotel's grounds.   This hotel serves a full breakfast with enough

It is very rare to find the type of customer service that we experienced at the Park Vue Inn. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The rooms were very clean and perfect for our family. Our 12 year old likes his own bed, so the bunk beds were PERFECT! The complimentary breakfast and light dinner were AWESOME! This hotel is literally right across the street from the Disney entrance and a very easy walk for families. We are frequent travelers and have come across some very "interesting" hotels, but this one is a rare find. Clean, friendly, accomodating, attention to guests needs, great for families, and perfect location.

Summary Heading: Park Vue Inn was wonderful in every way!
Summary: Our family has stayed at Park Vue Inn each time we visit Disney Land. It is right across the street from the main entrance. The rooms very clean. It's quiet at night. And the staff go out of their way to make your stay a great one!!!

Summary Heading: Great location, free perks, friendly staff
Summary: Well you just can't get any closer to Disneyland park than this hotel. It is literally at the crosswalk to Disneyland.  We got a really great rate of $75 in January and it was totally worth the price. The room was a little small but had been updated. Plenty of parking, Nice pool area, free lite dinner, free contintental breakfast (we didn't get to partake but it looked pretty good.) Very friendly staff, free cookies, fruit and bottled water when we checked in. There was also a fruit basket in our room with more bottled water and even a bottle of wine-completely free. There is also a Cold Stone Ice Cream in the building and IHOP is right next door. I would definetely stay here again. That being said, i still wouldn't pay over probably $125 a night for the room. But the extra

I was glad to get visit with this inn this was the best customer service i have had in a long time it is great to know that ther is still great customer service out there. I was most impressed with the social hour voucher and the breakfast voucher and that it had a microwave and fridg in room they don't even have that in Vegas or Laughlin that I have stayed in. I plan on visiting this place again should i want to stay in Anaheim.  Patricia

Pros: Staff are very professional and friendly. Right across the street from Disneyland. Free parking, breakfast, wifi, fridge, microwave.  Negs: Giant, rock hard pillows. A little noisy.  Staff was very friendly throughout our stay.  Location is excellent of course, being right across the street from Disneyland.  It was a such a time and money saver not having to deal with Disney parking, shuttles, etc.  A quick 5-10 minute walk from our room to the resort was all it took.  Rooms come with free wifi, microwave and mini-fridge which was very convenient traveling with a 1 and 3 year old.
