Free breakfast (7-10) was so-so but I can't complain since it is free (the kids loved it).  Keep in mind that access to the breakfast area does not have stroller/wheelchair access.  Didn't have

On Jan 25, 2011 someone else wrote a review saying how unfriendly the Park Vue Inn is to disabled people. I too was just turned down three rooms because two out of eight in our party is disabled and need to use motorized scooters/wheelchairs. I was told our chairs would not be allowed in our rooms. I guess they expect people to leave them outside.  It is good to know what the Park Vue Inn thinks about disabled people. It is hard enough to find a hotel/motel that will work with us, but it is really disappointing to be discriminated against just for being disabled.

Summary Heading: No one compares to the Parkvue
Summary: We love the Parkvue, we stay there every year.  Having a room with bunk beds makes all the difference in getting the kids to sleep!  It's clean, the staff is friendly, the breakfast is huge and the best part is, you're truly the closest hotel to Disneyland.  Why would you stay anywhere else?

Summary Heading: Fantastic stay, right across from Disneyland
Summary: My wife and I booked this hotel for an anniversary trip to Disneyland.  You can't beat the location, it is right across the street from the park.  It is even closer than the Disneyland Hotel, and half the price.  We stayed in a suite with a spa.  It was fantastic.  The room was clean, and they even provided us with a complimentary fruit and apple cider basket.  When they heard it was our anniversary, they gave us balloons and mugs full of chocolate.  The breakfast was delicious and had a wide array of choices.  Overall, a great hotel and great vacation.

This was our third trip to Disneyland, and our first time at the Park Vue Inn.  Our next trip we will definitely be returning here!  We had the queen room with bunk beds and the room was very clean and well set up with a large "mini fridge" coffee pot and microwave.  There is also free wifi and a fitness room!!!  We did not visit the pool since we were there in February, and while warm it was not swimming weather.  The breakfast was very nice, especially compared to what we got at a similar priced and located hotel from our last trip.  Not just a few croissants, but a full warm breakfast if you want!  Best is that it is right across from Disneyland, a 5 minute walk to the park gates and you can even watch the fireworks from here!  The nice welcome basket with fruit and wine was

This hotel is located directly across the road to the entrance to Disneyland.  Nice & quiet, rooms were modern, clean & roomy.  We had a suite which also included, kitchen, lounge & spa of which hotel supplied bubble bath.  Staff very friendly.   The welcome letter & goodies on arrival were a pleasant surprise.  Cold stone creamery onsite was also an added bonus.  The only inconvenience is if your room is upstairs then you will have to carry your bags up there yourselves.  Breakfast was included although the area was a little small, not sure how they would cope in the summer season. Overall we were more than happy with facilities.

There is a reason that Park Vue Inn gets such good reviews.  If you're going to Disneyland and California Adventure the location can't be beat.  The rooms are comfortable and clean.  They have a coffee maker, refrigerator, and a microwave.   Everyone working at the hotel was friendly and attentive. The free breakfast is good and they have a free social hour as well.  In the office they put out free water, cookies, fruit, etc.     We did have an issue with the heater in our room, but someone came to our room within 5 minutes to fix it!  We were surprised to get gift baskets in our room twice - once as a thank you for staying there and another time as an apology for the heater thing.   We have stayed at a couple of other hotels in the area, but we plan on staying here from now on.

we have fallen in love with this hotel. we usually stay a bit further up the street at one of the fancier hotels but after one visit here we are hooked!  we average about once a month on a trip to disneyland and we have found our home away from home in this hotel.  the girls at the front desk are very sweet and incredibly helpful. the entire staff is extremely professional and they seem to really care about their guests. it was my nieces birthday on this last trip and they had a most amazing birthday basket filled with all kinds of goodies and treats for her....she was thrilled! they also set up a little ice cream cake for her.  the bottled water and yummy fresh baked cookies that can always be found in the lobby are such a brilliant and much appreciated addition to the stay.

We have stayed at this place a couple of times now and each time it gets better and better.  Fabulous breakfast and now happy hour in the evenings.  They spoil us with gift baskets in our rooms.  We love this place and it's right across the street from Disneyland entrance!!

Summary Heading: Across the road from Disneyland entrance
Summary: We stayed here as a family of 5 in January 2011.  Great place to stay as it is directly opposite Disnelyand/Calfornia Adventure - 5 minute walk.  Breakfast was included.  During the day you can come back to the room for a rest and go back to the parks, if you need to.  There is a pool and spa (we did not have time to use) and there is also a laundry available.

great spot to stay cross the road from Disneyland.We would get a early start with there free breakfast and then head a cross the road to Disney spend the day day there head back to the hotel have a swim and spa and a beer or too then go to Disney for the night time entertainment.Some great restaurant near by as well

If you are planning on going to Disneylan in Anaheim, you must stay here! We arrived quite early with a sick passenger (Man Flu!) and they checked us in early with no hassle. We also received free cookies and water at reception and a lovely welcome fruit and wine basket in our rooms. We had the King size spa bath room which was large, comfy and very clean. Breafast and the evening meal provided was an added bonus.   The best part about this is the fact that it is directly opposite the entrance to disneyland. You really cant get any closer than this, unless you pay a fortune at the disneyland resorts. It was great value for money and the staff were great. I really hope to return one day.  Thank you Park Vue Inn!

the rooms were clean & roomy.  the continental breakfast was satisfying.  the location, right across from disneyland, was awesome!  the staff was pleasant, professional, & personable.  the pillows though were extremely fluffy & hard to sleep on.  they seemed new which was nice but just too pouffy & they didn't conform much to our heads.   also, the laundry room was spacious & clean.  but it would have been more practical to have a change machine in the room.  we had to walk all the way to the lobby to get change for it when we ran out of quarters (we were staying the furthest away from the lobby).   overall we felt that we had found a reasonably priced hotel that was perfectly located.

You are directly across the road from the maingate of disneyland. Great breakfast that's included. Nice rooms. Many diners and eateries are within walking distance to the hotel. Safe area even at night. Great for families.

Summary Heading: Park Vue Inn is the place to stay
Summary: We arrived in a rental car about 8:30 AM and wanted to get to Disneyland right away. Check in wasn't until 3, but they gave us a parking pass and let us leave the car there. We walked across the street and headed for DL. Came back about 3 and unpacked our stuff. There was a basket of fruit, bottle opener and a bottle of wine (they give you the option of returning it for apple cider if you prefer). I took the car back to Enterprise on Katella and just wanted to mention they gave me a ride back to the hotel in their van. Thanks guys.   There's a complimentary breakfast and "afternoon social hour". Breakfast included eggs, sausage or bacon (it changed from day to day), fruit, cereal, waffles, bread, sweet rolls, toast, milk, coffee and juice.  The social hour could be easily seen

Great location across the street from the main gate entrance. Stayed three nights with our family and this hotel made the visit to Disneyland complete. Excellent service, rooms, and amenities like free breakfast and social hour. Staff is very pleasant and top notch. I would highly recommend this hotel if visiting Disneyland and will definitely be back.

Overall, staying at this hotel was was a pleasant exprience. It was just me and my son for one day one night and first the location is absolutely perfect. You are litterally across from the main entrance of Disneyland and next door to an ihop and Denny's down a half block or so and even a McDonalds right close as well.. When I arrived at 7 am they had Plenty of rooms for an early check in with no extra fee. The staff was more than kind on the phone and in person as well. After spending 7 hrs in the park I returned to find a complimentary fruit basket with a bottle of wine which you could switch out for a bottle of cider. The room was clean however it had smelled of carpet cleaner or something of the sort which I was not too happy about (it was strong) but I'm easy to please and

We had the room with the jacuzzi. It was a nice and quiet location. We had such a great stay. We loved that Cold Stone was just right out front and we got a discount there just for staying at the inn. Awesome place!

Park Vue Inn is a great place to stay while in Anaheim and going to Disneyland. I went with my boyfriend his sister and her boyfriend. We arrived to our hotel around 10am and wanted to check in and freshen up from our 7am flight. Although check in isn't until around 3pm they allowed us to check in and gave us a room immediately. They asked if we were celebrating anything special and we told them a birthday.   When we walked into our room they had a free gift basket with a bottle of wine, fruit, water candy etc. (if you have children they do have sparkling cider). The rooms are nice, not extravagant but not dingy either. The shower and toilet are separate from the sink and mirrors which is nice when trying to get ready.  So we left our hotel and when we came back the hotel had
I couldn't be happier with my stay here. The staff was great and you can't beat the location. We will definitely make this our home base when vacationing at Disneyland.

The service, rooms, breakfast, pool were all excellent.  It is the best place to stay if Disneyland is your destination!  We stayed 10 days and were very satisfied.  The breakfast is good.  There is a good variety of foods.  It does get a bit crowded at times.  The social hour was a bonus.  I wouldn't say the food was great but if we were near the hotel from 5-7pm we usually opted to eat there.  The pool and hot tub were clean and warm!  My kids could have swam all day.  The water bottles and cookies and fruit were a nice gesture, though, not available in the mornings.  My one real complaint is the pillows, they are VERY firm and thick.  I had to request a softer pillow and my neck still hurts from the first night.   Beyond that the rooms are clean and well kept.  I didn't have

We stayed at the Park Vue in early January. What a fantasitc place to stay, the rooms were clean and comfortable.  Breakfast was inlcuded and also a social hour - which was more like dinner. Being right across the road from the Disneyland entry was a bonus and so convenient. I would definately stay again.

This is a great place for families and the location can't be beaten as the hotel is right across from entry street to Disneyland. Breakfast  which is included was  fantastic value and very filling- even for big teenage boys. There were great choices and not just the standard muffin and piece of fruit . Our 2 bedroom suite was very spacious and easily accommodated 6 of us. The laundry facility  was excellent and made our stay so much easier to manage. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and it was no trouble leaving our luggage after checkout until our airport transfer on the last day of our stay. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting great value for money and great accommodation as close to Disneyland as possible

Summary Heading: Do not stay here if you have disabilities!!!
Summary: Let me begin by saying, I never stayed here. I TRIED to stay here because I had heard/read the good reviews. I called to book a room on the ground floor since we are traveling with two people with disabilities and one cannot walk stairs. I let the young man know we had two service dogs in our party and that was the beginning of our nightmare! He advised me it was not a pet friendly hotel and when I informed him that these were not pets, that these were service dogs, he said that only one would be allowed onto the hotel premises. HUH??? I have two people in the family with severe disablities and they each have their own service animal that performs different tasks. How was supposed to only bring one on vacation? I asked to speak to a manager, but there wasn't one on site. One was

We always enjoy staying at the Park Vue Inn for our trips to Disneyland.  It is located right at the crosswalk entrance into Disneyland.  They have a continental breakfast and dinner time.  There is a Cold Stone Creamery on property and IHOP and Dennys on each side.   The staff is always accomodating.  We even got a fruit basket and wine in our room.  Nice touch.  I would recommend this Inn for anyone going to Disneyland.

Clean and comfortable beds.  Convenient walking distance to Disneyland (for real).  Good breakfast and dinner provided with the price of the room.  Courteous and very helpful staff.  They even gave us a gift basket with useful things in it upon check in, and they let us check in early!  Great experience for our family!

Summary Heading: Convenient, thoughtful, great price, and great location for a large family
Summary: We were pleasantly surprised when our family of 6, 2 teens, and 2 10yr and under checked into the Park Vue Inn.  First off, we did not want to spend a lot of money for a motel as we were going to be spending all our time at Disneyland.  They had 2 queen beds plus a bunk which is HUGE for our size family.  They placed a nice note and a wine/water and fruit basket for us.  When someone heard that my 7 year old was celebrating his birthday at Disneyland, they came to our room with balloons and a present!  Not only do they serve a decent, simple, but decent breakfast, they also have a light dinner free with the stay.  Again, for a family our size, the whole stay saved us a lot of money plus appreciated the accommodations!  Clean and just right for us.

I had not stayed with Park vue since their remodel and I am very pleased.  We were staying for a combination family trip and customer service event at Disney and I must say I am very impressed with Park Vue in both instances.  The trip for the family end started with very polite, professional phone service, thanking us for staying with them in the past.  Prompt and convenient reservations via phone and when we arrived we were greated with a happy polite staff, fruit, water and wine basket, and beautiful accomodations.  We were traveling with a party in wheelchair and they really went the extra mile in accomodations- They do not have an elevator so it would have been impossible to get her to the free breakfast and social hour (which both saved money and time at Disney) Quiet,

Just returned from stay with adult daughter and myself. The location cannot be beat. At the end of the day when your feet cannot walk no more- there it is! Great location near Downtown Disney for the restaurants.  We had dinner at Brennans (outstanding!) and House of Blues (love that voodoo shrimp!). The free breakfast, free internet and evening social hour are a plus. The pool and grounds are well kept. The only negative was the lack of an elevator to the 2nd floor and the "noise" with children very early as they set out to enjoy disneyland. Ask for a ground floor if you have difficulty getting upstairs with heavy bags. Bring ear plugs for the kiddies unless you wish to be up by 7am.

Summary Heading: Right next to Disneyland, with lots of perks
Summary: We just got back from Disneyland and this hotel was very convenient, supplied free bottled water, had a free breakfast, and dinner, and we were treated with the utmost respect.  We had a fridge and a microwave in the rooms and the beds were comfortable.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with so many extras.  Fabulous!
Summary: We stayed 3  nights and were impressed with all the extras.  Free coffee and biscuits, free parking, free great breakfast, free basic dinner.  In addition our daughter received a huge basket of gifts for her birthday, with balloons and a free cake. Brilliant.

Summary Heading: great location directly across the street from disneyland and customer service was awesome!
Summary: We went for my girls 2cd bday stayed 2 night customer service was awesome. We were welcome with a fruit wine and water basket they give to everyone and 2 disney bags with 2 baloon boquets for the girls and cake from coldstone! There is free continental breakfast and a happyhour wich is more food! all included!  The price very affordable! Will be staying there from now on!

Summary Heading: We only had to buy lunch each day!
Summary: When i initially booked our 2 day stay a few months in advance as we were staying elsewhere before finishing off our trip here. Only days before hand did we realise the wrong dates had been booked and I emailed them. The very next day via a few email, it was all worked out, I was so relieved!. The stay it self was very nice. Across the road from the park, made alot of difference to a walk 2 or 3 times as long, in places we have stayed before. We loved the breakfast and social hour food. The food itself is simple, but filling, and my 10 year old loved the freshly made waffles we could make. We only needed to buy lunch for those 2 day. We stayed in a room with a bunk, and the matresses on the queen and also the bunk bed were all very comfortable. We recieved a welcome basket,

Summary Heading: WHAT A CLEAN AND COMFORTABLE HOTEL!!
Summary: This was our second time staying at this hotel.  The beds are COMFORTABLE as heck, and each bed came with FOUR INCREDIBLY COMFORTABLE PILLOWS, the rooms were very clean and ready when we arrived.  There was even a gift basket waiting in our room!    The staff is very polite, friendly and happily answered our questions.  I even overheard a staff member give directions to a guest who was looking for a hair stylist.   It is directly across the street from the entrance to disneyland and after a long day of walking around and playing it is WELL WORTH THE MONEY to have your hotel right outside the gate!  I wont stay anywhere else when we go to Disneyland.   Thanks Park Vue!

Summary Heading: The perfect hotel for you quick Disneyland trip
Summary: I loved this hotel!  My family suprised my kids by taking them to Disneyland for their birthdays and the Park Vue surprised us by bringing them both a bunch of balloons and Disney glass of treats.  Because we were a group, we had multiple rooms and they were awesome about keeping us downstatirs (mom can't walk up stairs) and very close to each other.  Our room were very clean and the beds were quite comfortable.  I will admit that there were a few minor things in our two queen room that needed fixing up, such as the broken hair dryer taped together in the bathroom.   The staff was very friendly and they have a great breakfast free to guests and they adjust their hours accordingly to Disneyland's hours, as well as provide you with that information.   Because we stayed at the

Summary Heading: Above and beyond in making our Disneyland trip affordable and relaxing
Summary: The staff were all very friendly and clearly took pride in their inn.  The location was perfect--directly across the street from Disneyland!  Our room was clean and having the bunkbeds for the kids helped everyone sleep better.  An unexpected bonus was all the food they provided.  We ate a hot breakfast each morning and there were the usual cereals and pastries.  We could then walk over to Disneyland or California Adventures for the day (we would eat lunch in the parks).  In the evening we would walk back to the Inn and eat their "light supper".  In essence, this consists of a hot comfort food and soups.  This meal was also provided at no charge to all Inn guests.  It was simple food, but the kids loved it.  We never had to eat at a restaurant!  In summary, we really enjoyed our

We stayed at Park Vue over 5 years ago initially. We had a great experience so immediately decided to stay again this trip. We were shocked that they were actually able to improve upon our previous pleasant stay. The rooms had been remodeled, they offer and extensive Continental breakfast and a phenomenal Social Hour in addition to a Welcome Basket of goodies. Add this to the super affordable rates and location directly at the crosswalk for Disneyland they really can't be beat.   Super quiet, we had an adjoining room and heard no noise from our neighbors. Laundry room was a huge perk too for our week long stay with three kids ages 13, 8, and 1. Friendly, attentive staff. Far exceeded our expectations. Honestly, this was a much more pleasant experience than we received at one of

We've been to disneyland 4 times within the last 7 years.  Stayed at 4 hotels around the main gate.  The rest of the hotels were 'ok'.  But this hotel, wow.  From the phone call in our planning stages to the final hand over of our keys on our last day, the service we received was above and beyond our expectations.  The staff was friendly.  The rooms were nice, clean, private enough, and comfortable.  It is highly evident this hotel staff soars above the rest in welcoming our hard earned money.  We had two birthdays during our stay.  The hotel was all over that with gifts, ready for us on arrival.  I still can't believe the service we received here.  This hotel was the closest to the main gate and it was the least expensive of the others.  I can't stress enough how thankful I a,

Summary Heading: Great location, great price, best service
Summary: The staff was so accommodating and helpful.  We arrived early and asked if we could possibly check in early and they went out of their way to make that happen.  The room was updated, clean.  Breakfast was more than we expected to get let alone the social gathering in the evening.  Thank you Park Vue Staff for making us feel at home!

Summary Heading: Almost don't want to tell anyone our secret!!
Summary: We have stayed at the Park Vue for every visit to Disneyland since our 6 year old was born.  We really have NO complaints!  The Park Vue is literally ACROSS THE STREET from the Disney entrance.  The staff is on-the-ball.  Parking is FREE no matter what time you get there (even if you don't check in until later).  There is a full breakfast AND now a "social hour" dinner served at NO extra charge.  I was there this time for my own birthday and not only did the Park Vue have a gift basket with wine, waters, and fruit, but they also delivered balloons, a mug full of chocolates, and a certificate for a small cake from Cold Stone (downstairs!).    I almost don't want to let anyone know "our little secret" spot.    The interior decor is simple and basic...but for crying out loud, I'm

We stayed for 4 nights in December. It was my daughter and mother in laws birthday and we were welcomed with balloons and gift bags. We also had a nice welcome basket. The beds were so comfortable and the room was very clean. Walk to the front gate of Disneyland was less than 5 minutes. Breakfast was very good. This will now be the only place we stay at when we visit Disneyland I highly recommend to all!
Had a great time  Staff was great Rooms were clean Great location right accross the street Definitly would stay again

Never really came back from a trip wanting to leave a hotel review and would've left this one the day we returned if it hadn't been for the 16 hours it took us to get back to northern CA (holiday weekend, snow on the Grapevine), but our experience at the Park Vue left me itching to tell others what a great experience we all had.  Property:  If you are expecting a state-of-the-art, 5 star hotel with a celebrity chef in each of it's restaurants, you won't find it here. If the purpose of your trip is lounge around in your hotel room and never venture across the street, you may want to consider elsewhere. However, what you will find at the Park Vue are updated, clean and safe motel rooms (no inside corridors), with the most effortless access to both Disneyland and DCA besides paying

The location of this hotel is ideal for visiting Disneyland. My fiance and his family went to Disneyland for new years eve, the location was perfect, right across the street from the main entrance of disneyland. The hotel gave us a welcome package (wine, water and fruits), they let us park our car there until check in time while we enjoyed Disneyland. A few of us walked to the hotel to grab some waters and fruits and returned to Disneyland! We were exhausted after spending a whole day/night in disneyland it was nice to walk shortly to our room and sleep! Great breakfast in the morning! The staff was so nice. Just one bad thing: houskeeping forgot to make our beds and brings us towels the next day but just a call up front and they brought us sufficient towels

Our family goes to Disneyland every year we usually stay on property. We tried the Park Vue Inn and will be staying there from now on. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and the staff was great. We loved the breakfast and the social hour. The location was great too. My family will definately recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Summary Heading: great place - closest to disney entrance
Summary: This is the closest hotel to the entrance to Disneyland - it is closer than any of the Disney properties.  We had 8 people in our group - including grandparents, teens, and young children. Everyone was happy with this location.  The staff were all exceptionally nice, and the hotel even had bottled water and cookies in the lobby during the day.  We requested connecting rooms on the first floor - which we got even though we checked in early.  I travel very frequently for business, and I was very impressed with the overall friendliness and helpfulness of all of the staff including maintenance, housekeeping, front desk .etc.  I have stayed here before and will definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Ideal Location, Especially for Family with Kids
Summary: We just returned from our first trip to Disneyland, one adult with 4 children aged 5, 10, 11 and `13 years old. When I booked this hotel, I chose it because it was close to the entrance to the park. It did not disappoint. Although there are some cons, the pros of staying hear far outweigh the cons, especially with children.  The biggest pros for us: 1) LOCATION: When you walk out of the Park Vue Inn, you literally cross the street and you walk through the "entry gates" and find yourself on a 1/4 mile pedestrian/bus way with Center Island that leads directly to Disneyland. At the end of that way, you go through Security and voila, you are ready to line up to get into Disneyland. I cannot say how important this was to us especially at the end of an exhausting evening, where

Summary Heading: Best Value Right Across From Disneyland Main Entrance!
Summary: We stayed here for our honeymoon and this time for my birthday. The jacuzzi room is the best and encludes two big, fluffy bathrobes! Each room has a "Welcome Basket" with fruit and either wine or sparkling cider. If you are celebrating something let the helpful and pleasant staff know. There will be a surprise waiting for you! They now have a full breakfast and a "social" hour. This saved us lots of money on food and it was a good selection! Don't forget to visit the on-site Disney store!

This Inn is always great very clean staff is really nice. This trip was for my little girls first birthday staff gave her a birthday cake and present with balloons! We had the room with bunkbeds (very small). kids can not watch tv from there beds and there directly in front of restroom. The position  of the AC is horrible right next to the bunkbeds so its very noisey for the kids and to cold for them next time were going back to the usualy queen beds. they serve a great breakfest but did not like the fact that you have to eat in there court yard and can not bring food back to the room. Kids were not feeling to good so going up there early in the morning was out of the question.   all in all great stay like always you cant beat the location

My family and I stayed here during the Thanksgiving Holiday.  We were greeted with a welcome basket of water, wine and fresh fruit in our room.  There were 10 of us and we had 2 rooms.  We had the Family Suite which sleeps 6 and a room with bunk beds that slept 4.  The beds were comfortable.  The staff was friendly and always had a bowl of free water bottles and warm cookies in the lobbly and  a coffee machine.  It tasted like instant however.  Breakfast was free and there was enough of a selection to find something for everyone.  The Belgian Waffle Maker was a big hit.   Go early during winter as the indoor seating fills up fast.  They also served light entrees from 5-7.  We only ate there once and had soup and nachos. The hotel is located at the crosswalk to Disneyland.

We loved it.  There were some negative comments on the site about the service etc when we were looking to book but after talking to some people on Trip Advisor we plumped to this one and thank goodness we did.  It's location (less than 5 mins walking to Dowtown Disney, Disney California Adventure and Disneyland) makes me wonder why anyone would stay anywhere else.  Breakfast appeared to cater to all comers from eggs to muffins to doughnuts to fruit salad and yoghurt and at these rates if this didn't suite there was a diner on every corner where you could get something else (we certainly never felt the need).  With Downtown Disney so close Dinner was certainly never an issue but we tended to stay closer to home (Tony Ramos ribs 2 doors down was heard to go past) and again with
We had a wonderful time. Location to Disneyland was great. Customer service was excellent and the rooms were clean and recently remodeled. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Family Friendly, convenient, with a very nice staff
Summary: My family and I visited Disneyland the week of Christmas 2010.  The hotel was literally right across the street from the entrance to the park - very nice as we were traveling with young kids.  The staff was very kind and when my youngest son became ill, we ended up leaving a day early - the manager refunded our last night stay (very kind of her).  I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Best family value for a stay at Disneyland.
Summary: We stayed with a family of seven in two clean large adjoining rooms for six days while visiting Disneyland and California Adventure and had an excellent experience.      This is the closest hotel to the main entrance to the parks making it possible to walk in through one well regulated crosswalk.  It made it easy to leave for a break during the day and to go back in after lunch or dinner.  (We could be in Main Street in D.L. in 10 minutes from our hotel room directly across the street.)    The choice location is not the only positive thing about Park Vue.  The "included" breakfast and dinner were very nice and real budget savers.  The staff were all friendly, efficient and helpful and the many little extras, like free cookies and water bottles, a prize arrival gift of the day

Summary Heading: We will stay again - no doubt
Summary: Besides the best location, the hotel staff was friendly and the room was great.  The manager's reception (dinner) every night was a great surprise and saved us a great deal of money.  They had something even my young and rather picky eaters would try every night.  The room was a nice size and quiet.  I think most people there were like us - sleep early and off to the park for the day which was great.  The staff was very helpful and friendly, including opening the laundry room early for me one day so I could get that chore done before heading over to Disneyland.  We will stay here again and recommend it to all.

Have not actually stayed here, but I felt it necessary to share this.  We have reservations at the PVI in 2011 and now I am hesitant to try this place.  Found this on bedbugregistry.com... Anonymous on 11/18/2010 "I stayed in one of their "suites" and came home with plenty of bites. I went to the front desk to get an answer and the first thing that came out their supervisors mouth was oh we will be giving you a discount. I know she knew there was bed bugs in this room she didnt even look alarmed. She offered me to move rooms to a sandard room. If there suite was infected what makes me think their standard room isn't."  Most of the reviews that I have read about the Park Vue Inn are wonderful .... hoping that their staff read this and respond accordingly to calm fears of this

Summary Heading: Loved this Hotel, will be coming back soon!!!
Summary: This hotel tailored to my family needs and was sooo close to the front entrance to Disneyland. Took care of birthday request for my grandaughters 3rd birthday.

If your looking for a convient way to come and go to the park Parkvue is the place to stay. You literally walk out of your room into the crosswalk into the park. The hotel staff was super friendly and accommodating. Pros:  location excellent, super friendly, accommodating, heater pool, continental breakfast if you want to save money breakfast and dinner, fresh baked cookies in the lobby excellent!!  Con: only negative was the food they offer is basically microwave, slop! Taco night consisted of meat that they heat up in a pouch and dump in a tin bin for everyone to scoop out of. As I was eating my taco there was a piece of hair in it. Breakfast,  the eggs once again just looks like frozen eggs warmed up, waffles were ok, donuts very stale not fresh, safe to just stick to a slice

On our recent stay at the Park Vue Inn, it lived up to what we had read on TripAdvisor and more.  We were going to Disneyland and the location is perfect, right across the street, which not only saved us on 2 days of parking costs and that hassle, but allowed us to easily take our 1 year old back to catch a nap.  In addition to the parking cost savings, the free breakfast and free "social hour" were both good and saved us another chunk on dinner costs.  Finally, the little touches were also classy, specifically the fruit/beverage basket waiting in the room, and the service-oriented staff both at the front desk and managing the meals.  We will definitely stay here again.

This hotel was great for our family.  Our trip was centered around Disneyland and you can't beat the location---right across the street from the main gate! If we needed a mid-day break, it was easy to come back to the room.  The staff was helpful and pleasant.  The beds were soft and comfy; we loved the bunk bed for the kids; breakfast is included in the rate and included hot items as well as the typical continental fare, which was sufficient for our family.   We loved the gift basket on arrival and we were celebrating a birthday and the special birthday balloon bouquet and gift was a real surprise and treat. This will be our hotel of choice when we visit Disneyland!

Summary Heading: PERFECT SPOT for a Disneyland Trip
Summary: If you are looking for a place to stay that is literally across from the entrance to Disneyland, stay here.  The staff is friendly and our room was in perfect shape.  We got a nice gift basket and some mugs for telling them it was our Anniversary. When you reserve your room pick an upstairs room because you can hear EVERYTHING other people are doing from walking to taking showers.  Also the shower head is a little low for us tall people.  Other than that, it was a great stay and well worth the price.  There are PLENTY of places to eat, and IHOP in the parking lot, and much more!! You will not regret it.  Just make sure you request UPSTAIRS.

My husband, son and a friend of ours stayed at the Park Vue, for our visit to Disneyland on Dec 1st, We stay 4 nights. We were greeted with the most warm and friendly person. I believe his name was Edwardo. There were warm cookies when we arrived, cold water or hot coffee. After a long drive that was nice. In our room we had a gift basket waiting, that was a real surprise. We had not stay at the Park Vue since  1984. We had seen the changes in other trips down there, but had not stayed there. This is now our new Disneyland home away from home. Since we do come to Disneyland every year at Christmas, we will now book at the Park Vue. We loved our stay there. And it's just a hop skip and a jump to the main gate. Thank you Park Vue for our very pleasant stay.We didn't have the

Summary Heading: Pleasantly surprised by EVERYTHING at this hotel
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue Inn in December 2010 for one night during our annual visit to Disneyland. The last two years we have stayed on property (for a ton of $$ more) and ended up liking this property more! The walk from the hotel to Disneyland is five minutes (max)- it is literally across the street. Since the monorail is down so much, the walk is actually shorter than it is from Disney's Paradise Pier or the Disneyland Hotel.  We arrived early in the day and our room wasn't ready. They gave us our FREE parking pass and told us to come back after 3:00. When we arrived back at 9:00, our keys were waiting and the room was ready. When we arrived in the room, our expectiations were surpassed. There was a fruit basket waiting with bottled water and a bottle of wine (!!)... If only

We stayed for our nine year anniversary.  It was a great price with an amazing in room jacuzzi.  A free breakfast that is stated as continental but in actuality it is like a full breakfast buffet.  Conveniently located directly across the street from Disneyland.  I would recommend this hotel to anybody, it is completely clean and the staff are very friendly.

We recently stayed at the Park Vue Inn. Our overall experience was good. It was very convenient having a hotel directly across from the maingate...especially with small children. The rooms were small but clean. We chose one of the double bed/ bunk bed combos and found it was a little tight for the 4 of us, as there are no closets and nowhere to put suitcases. The complimentary apples, water and cookies were an added treat. The breakfast was excellent and offered hot and cold items daily. We did attend the social hour one night but found the food to be just okay. The front staff were accommodating and assisted us when our keys stopped working. The pool was heated but we found it better suited to older children/adults, as even the shallow end was deep. Overall, we would stay here
From booking our stay to checking out, your staff made us feel very special. I look forward to our next stay.  Thank You

Summary Heading: Great Hotel with amenities, right across the street from Disneyland.
Summary: We really loved staying at the Park Vue Inn.  Normally we stay at the Candy Cane Inn and we love that as well, but Park Vue is a little cheaper and it's even closer to the Disneyland entrance!   Literally you walk across the crosswalk and you are there!  It's so convenient.  You can easily come back for a nap during the afternoon if you need it!  No need to worry about a shuttle.  We stayed in a room with a Queen and a bunkbed/trundle.  All 5 of us had a bed and we put the baby a bassinet that we brought.  The room was was tiny (super tiny).  It fit the beds and a dresser with a tv on it and that was it.  Our luggage took up the remaining floor space.  So it was really tight, but we weren't there to hang out in the room, only to play at Disney all day, so it didn't matter.  Our

Summary Heading: Great stay, will definitely be back!
Summary: This hotel was within our budget and right across the street from Disneyland.  The rooms are quiet, clean, well taken care of, beds are comfy.  We loved that breakfast was available every morning so that we could eat and be on our way quickly.  We especially loved that Park Vue Inn offered a Thanksgiving meal for free on Thanksgiving.  It was delicious and we liked that we didn't have to fight the crowds at Disneyland to get a table for dinner.  Very thoughtful.  The staff was attentive to our needs and very friendly.  Thank you for a nice stay.  We will be back!

Summary Heading: Great Service! Will stay here again!
Summary: I wanted to try out this hotel since it was directly across from the walkway to Disneyland. We'd stayed next door and I wanted to compare. Was a little hesitant becuz of some of these reviews, but our stay exceeded my expectations.     Staff, though busy, were polite and willing to accommodate. We called a couple times for things in our room, and they quickly came. We were there on Veterans Day weekend so it was packed, yet they followed up to make sure we got what we'd requested.    Afternoon homemade cookies were really good. Bottles of water to take to Disneyland was great. Evening light buffet was perfect for the kids--not the adults, but that was okay with us. Breakfast buffet was great (not the scrambled eggs, tasted like a mix; not the apples either--old/bruised inside).

I didnt stay at the hotel but tried to reach them on both email (no reply received) and phone to make a reservation. When I managed to get through on the phone from China i meet a very impersonal and unfriendly behaviour. So glad that i had this experience as it made my choice of hotel easy.

Wow, we stayed here 4 years ago, and they have upgraded since then. Loved the front desk amenities - fresh from the oven Otis Spunkmeyer cookies (several varieties available from 11am on), apples in a bowl, full bottles of water in ice water, and lemon flavored water to drink. These are all complimentary. Breakfast has expanded to hot items available every day, in addition to cold (cereal, fresh whole and cut up fruit, milk, oj, donuts, muffins, breads, etc.). Hot includes egg patties or cheese omelets, bacon or sausage, hashed brown patties, pancakes or french toast, plus make your own belgian waffle - yum! of course coffee, tea, hot drinks and cereal avlb too. Super friendly and helpful front desk service. They have a Cold Stone Creamery attached, guest receive 10% of their

The people and this hotel was very accomodating to my family, and all our needs.  Our room was clean, and had a very personal touch by the staff.  We have stayed here before and they left us a personal note to let them know if my family needed anything to just call the front and they would assist.  Our trip included continental breakfast which was amazing, not just cereal, fruit and bagels...but waffles (fresh), eggs, sausage...we had a great experience and just across from the Park....Will definitely return and recommend to anyone.

Summary Heading: Key never works, cockroaches, no fireworks view, small rooms
Summary: Really? Has no one who reviewed this hotel stayed anywhere else across the street from disneyland??? We would not stay here again. FIrst, we had three rooms and stayed 4 nights. The keys would only work sometimes! After 10 hours in DIsney we would get back and keys wouldn't work. The rooms were in the very far back of hotel and not convenient to walk to lobby. If you stay at another hotel across the street you can SEE the fireworks from your room. We asked for that, we were not even close. The topper was the last morning in 2 of our rooms... there were 2inch cockroaches!!!!!!!! We told the girl at the front desk when we were checking out and she just said, "oh wow" and then kept checking us out. WHAT?????? The rooms are VERY small. We have stayed at other hotels across from

Spent 3 nights at Park Vue Inn with family celebrating our granddaughter's 10th birthday.  We had adjoining rooms and were delighted to receive a complimentary fruit/beverage basket in each room. We didn't take advantage of the complimentary social hour buffets but thought that the breakfast buffets presented a good variety including eggs, sausage, bacon, hash brown patties, fruit, yogurt, waffles, syrup, toast, pastries, juices, and coffee.     We were greeted cheerfully upon arrival, at breakfast, and upon departure.     The close proximity to Disneyland was the main reason for selecting Park Vue Inn in the first place, but now we know of other reasons too.   We definitely plan to return!

Summary Heading: "Our 10 yr secret is now gonna be out there!"......
Summary: Because we've been coming to Park Vue for the last 10 years, it was suggested we write a review.  Our only hesitation is that we might make it sound so good, that it will now become even more popular and over-booked....therefore, raising the prices and less availability when we do use it!  8-)  Although we have wonderful relatives within a few miles of Disneyland and usually stay with them when we visit Disneyland (about every 2 years), there are times it just makes more sense to spend a night or two, right across the street from the entry!  And of course, since we discovered Park Vue in 2000 (when we booked a number of rooms to accommodate our large family who were celebrating "THE" Millennium there), we've had the privilege of seeing many improvements over the years.  The

Similar to other reviews, this hotel is located at the cross-walk to the Disneyland main entrance - you just can't get any closer.  That area is where the shuttles drop-off and pick-up so it's nice not to have that hassle.  Friendly service, decent breakfast and rooms are adequate with fridge and microwave.  Nice to be able to go back to the room around lunchtime so our son could have a nap, then go back to the park for more fun later.  Would definitely recommend and stay there again.

We stayed at the Park Vue for four nights in late November.  The location cannot be beat,  the breakfast was good, and all the employees were terrific.  We will definately be staying there again for our next Disneyland trip.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel and Value for Dineyland Travelers
Summary: Where do I begin?  For the vale and proximity to Disneyland, this is hands down the best hotel to stay at.  This hotel in directly across the street from Disneyland  Right off the bat, they provided a welcome basket with a bottle of fine cabernet to unwind after our long day of traveling. They also provided fresh fruit to save money n our upcoming Disneyland adventure.  When they learned it was our child's birthday, they surprised us with a birthday package with balloons and all sorts of goodies.  Needless to say, our little one was elated!  What a nice touch!  They also provided him with a cake courtesy of the Coldstone's which is attached to the hotel.  Next to the hotel, a 24/7 IHOP was extremely convenient and gave speedy service.  The room had a jacuzzi tub and the little

Summary Heading: Totally worth the every penny. Location, service, amenities, cleanliness and comfort!!!
Summary: I stayed just one night but wished I could be here for the whole week! Service was very friendly from the moment I made my reservation by phone. Every one we spoke to had a smile on their face. The hotel was very clean and so was our room. Beds were VERY comfortable. Perfect after a long day of walking in the parks. The breakfast was good and filling and the evening snack hit the spot. And Park Vue really is so close to Disneyland. My husband and I brought our 2 kids aged 4yrs and 6 months old. Being close was vital for our good time. I will absolutely be staying here again and suggest this to all freinds and family.

Summary Heading: Making an effort and it shows!
Summary: We picked Park Vue because of its location - you can't beat directly across from the entrance of the parks. What we appreciated about this hotel - and what is being reflected in a lot of these reviews - is the fact that they make a real effort to please their customers by focusing on the little things. With their location, they could easily get away with the bare minimum - they could charge for parking, offer minimal or no breakfast, etc. BUT they don't do this. They offer a free full breakfast and a free social hour. Their free meals saved us so much money, and the staff was always pleasant and helpful. The social hour easily satisfied us for dinner, it was nothing fancy, but always had soup and salad, and a kid-friendly cafeteria type entree, like nachos, mini corndogs,

Summary Heading: Turned out to be a great stay!
Summary: THe hotel is the best location for acess to Disneyland!  We had a few kinks with the reservations but all turned out well.  It was quite a large group that went.  The management did everything possible to make our stay the best it could be.  I was staying with my 3 little grandchildren in one the suites and we all loved the cookies, hot from the oven!  Thank you all for making our trip great!

Summary Heading: Great location and value near Disneyland
Summary: Positives - pool & hot tub (amazing jets), location (across st from main entrance), breakfast, social hour, complimentary fruit & cider basket, clean rooms, nice bed linens, quiet, nice size fridge + microwave Negatives - hmmm., there must be some...the room smelled musty although this could have been because it rained a lot and the kids were in and out from the hot tub & pool with wet feet. Conclusion - we have stayed at maybe 4 or 5 of the hotels directly across the st from main gate Disneyland and this is by far the best so far.  Would absolutely stay here again!

We recently stayed at the Park Vue Inn. We have stayed here many times before and it was always pleasant, but this time we had a really GREAT experience. The rooms had been upgraded (bedding - although the towels were a bit rough) They were very clean and our friend even checked for Bed bugs (he is funny that way) and found NONE. We checked in early and went to the Disneyland (which is right across the street). When we returned to our rooms that night we were great with lovely fruit baskets with Cider which we upgraded at the front desk to wine. In the morning we were treated to a wonderful breakfast buffet. Waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage, muffins fruit and cereal. All yummy and even in the rain it was fun. They had an inviting looking pool, but we passed on it due to rain. I

I spent a long time choosing the best place for our long awaited Disneyland holiday - from New Zealand my best source of info was trip advisor.  We loved it.  Location brilliant - we could come back whenever we wanted and watched the fireworks from our room one night.  Breakfast delicious (didn't have the hot stuff - only waffles, yoghurt, fruit etc).  Social hour food an added bonus and saved us loads of money on dinner, as did the free bottled water and cookies.  Room had everything we needed and was cleaned perfectly daily.  I did a load of washing - very cheap ($1 I think) and quick.  No complaints at all and we will be recommending anyone who asks us to stay at the Park Vue.

Summary Heading: Location, location, location at a fantastic price!
Summary: My family and I have made 7 trips to Disneyland in the past 6 years and our stay at the Park Vue was by far the best and the least expensive. The hotel is older but that is not an issue. We preferred it over Disney's Paradise Pier. The location cannot be beat. You are literally at the crosswalk that is closest to any entrance in to Disneyland. The queen beds are comfortable, bathrooms are updated and clean and each room has a microwave and refrigerator. The air conditioner is older, a wall unit, but our room was always comfortable. It was not dusty or smelly and we are an allergic family but had no issues. The only thing I would suggest to the Park Vue is to clean the doors and walls adjacent to them. As a nice perk the hotel provides a welcome basket with fruit, water bottles

Summary Heading: Great location, great facilities, great service
Summary: This hotel has a perfect location, directly opposite the Disneyland entrance.  It's family friendly and the staff are always willing to help.  Facilities are well looked after and with breakfast and 'social hour' food every evening, free food helps with the travel budget. Would recommend it for anyone who is focusing purely on Disneyland.

Summary Heading: The Park Vue is my home at Disney Land.
Summary: The Park Vue Inn is definitely a home away from home, when you're visting Disney Land. We were able to park the car for the duration of our trip and walk to the Park within 10 minutes. Beyond that, the Park Vue was comfortable, affordable, and has a wonderful, caring staff. LIttle touches like the welcome basket in the room and the happy hour and breakfast made our stay feel like we were guests in someone's home, not just hotel guests. The rooms are roomy, with plenty of towels, shampoo, etc., and coffee, tea, and hot chocolate. The microwave and mini-fridge make it easy to put your feet up and have a night in, if you need the break. All in all, the Park Vue gets my highest recommendation.

We have stayed here many times and it just keeps getting better.AN EXCELLENT STAFF IS THE KEY> The full breakfast is better than any nearby restaurant and they have added a light supper /social hour. The new cards for these don't work well. I suggest a new printer would help. I'm sure this will get fixed. If they could clone this hotel we could all stay when we want as it is becoming difficult to get reservations on weekends. THIS HOTEL ALLOWS NO PETS A BONUS IF YOU HAVE ALLERGIES

Summary Heading: Great location, minutes to Disneyland, but it's no Ritz Carlton
Summary: We stayed a couple of nights at the Park Vue mid November. The hotel boasts that it is "the closest hotel to Disneyland's main entrance", and it's hard to dispute that assertion. In less than five minutes you can be out of your room and in Disneyland, and it's an easy, flat walk. It's definitely an advantage to be able to duck back to the hotel, recharge your batteries then head back to the Park for the fireworks. As for the hotel itself, the accommodation is pretty basic. The rooms are clean and tidy, and big enough, which is more than you could expect for $100 a night. That also includes breakfast (nothing to write home about) and a happy hour of a light snack and some soft drink and coffee. There is also free parking, but you don't really need a car. The front desk staff did

This hotel is directly across the street from Disneyland...less than a 5 minute walk.  The service was incredible.  There were warm cookies, coffee, fruit and mints in the lobby.  There was a gift basket in the room.  The breakfast was adequate, there was an evening snack.  The room was clean and quiet.  The staff was friendly and helpful.    The room was a bit small and the air conditioner was noisy but...I was really impressed with this hotel and would highly recommend it.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Our rate at the Park Vue could not be beat.  The desk staff was very friendly and helpful over the phone (as we booked directly from the hotel) and in person.  Very slow (days) response time from the supervisor regarding a rate question and we had multiple calls before talking to her.  Once we talked she was VERY helpful and friendly.  We stayed in a Queen with Bunk Bed room, which was very tight but accomodating.  The room was clean but dated.  Some other rooms I noticed had LCD tvs while ours was a traditional CRT.  The bathroom was very dated but clean, no mold.  There was a faint mildew smell in the room that permeated everything but no mildew/mold was seen.  We were on the ground floor, so I don't know if the upper floor had this problem, but the carpets were amazingly

We had a great stay at the Park Vue Inn when we visited Disneyland this fall.  The location could not have been better.  We loved being able to walk across the street to the park.  The complimentary breakfast included waffles, fruit, eggs, bacon, cereal... it met all the diverse appetites of my family.  We stayed in the Queen plus bunk bed room which was perfect for our family - 2 kids 10&12.  Although the room is small it is set up well and we spent most of our time at Disney or the pool.  I would definitely recommend this as a bargain for families traveling to Disneyland.

Serves both breakfast and dinner. Room was bigger than my son's "suite" at another nearby hotel. Received complementary wine and fruit basket!  Despite my grandson being at this other hotel, Park Vue Inn provided a very generous gift bag and cake for him! Park Vue Inn also provided free water, cookies and fruit in the afternoon. And of course it couldn't be any closer to the Disneyland/California Adventure entrance.  It was quiet, comfortable and clean. Will definitely stay again. My son was so impressed that he will be staying there in the future as well! Loved the eggs and bacon - much more than I am used to.

Summary Heading: Park Vue Inn has the friendliest staff and it was a great value
Summary: The staff was always helpful, prompt and friendly... I'd say even more friendly than Disney cast members. At first sight I was disappointed because the whole hotel surrounds a blacktop parking lot with the pool in the middle. But my opinion changed right away. The pool is secluded by fence and bushes and is well cared for. Our room was fairly small but well appointed and clean. We appreciated the fridge in the room. Upon arrival we found a welcome basket of fruit and wine as well as birthday gift bag for our daughter who was celebrating during the trip. Wow...no extra charge for that! The free breakfast had great variety. The location can't be beat. It's literally a walk across the street to where shuttle buses drop off tourists. The walls are a little thin, but we ran the AC

We just arrived home last night, and couldn't wait to share our great stay at the Park Vue Inn. From the moment we checked in, to our departure, every staff member was polite, friendly and helpful to make sure we had everything we needed during our stay. The rooms were clean and spacious. We enjoyed the outdoor terrace for both morning and evening  meals. It really made a difference, and I was very impressed with the assortment of food that was offered.  We would highly recommend th Park Vue Inn, we are already  planning for our next stay.  Thank You Park Vue Inn for making it a great vacation. It's definately the "Best Kept Secret" at the Main Gate of Disneyland.  The Glendon Family     Windsor, CA.

Summary Heading: Will Stay Here Every Time We Visit Disneyland
Summary: The park Vue Inn is by far the best hotel on Harbor Blvd.  The price is great, the room was very good.  We booked the two room 3 queen bed suite.  It is a very good room nice beds.  The cost was very good and the pool is very good.  They supply towels at the pool so there is not need to bring some from the room or home.  It is right across the street from the main entrance to Disneyland/California Adventure.  They serve a very nice breakfast each morning for free and have afternoon get together s in the evening.  You can see the fireworks from the roof deck.  It is so much less expensive getting the suite rather than 2 rooms at another hotel.  My family had the time of our lives on the trip and the park vue was a big part of making the trip so nice.  We will stay here every time

Summary Heading: We were perfectly happy with our stay
Summary: We want to add our good review for this informal little gem of a motel. With 2 kids- 1 & 4, we wanted to be close for walking in and out of Disneyland and this was perfect. Our room was shady and very comfortable. The beds were nice and the room very clean. We had all we needed with a coffee pot, microwave and fridge. The staff was extremely nice and accommodating - even surprising us with a birthday gift for my daughter!  The buffet food was just fine - although we didn't eat there every time- since our room was such a value- we tried a number of fun, enticing restaurants.

Summary Heading: Good Value but internet don't work
Summary: we stayed in Park Vue between 11/2/10 and 11/6/10 for about $110 plus tax through hotel.com. The location is perfect for Disneyland. Breakfast and the food for "social hours" are decent. Staff are young (mostly late teen to early twenty) and eager to please. The have warm cookie and bottle water in the front desk for the asking.  Parking is free.  Internet is supposed to be free but it did not work during my stay.. I talked to front desk on 11/2, 11/3 and 11/5, so they are clearly aware of the problem. Judging from the response,  I suspected front desk  are aware of the problem but they did not have the technican or equipment line up to fix the problem.. I had to drive to Starbuck in S. Harbour and Ball to connect to internet.  It was a major inconvience for me. If interent is

Summary Heading: It has all been said before - Wonderful Value, Great Service
Summary: The location of this hotel is fantastic and the service makes it the ideal place to stay for a trip to Disneyland.  The continental breakfast has waffles, eggs, pancakes, yogurt, cereal, bacon, etc.  There is free water, fruit and cookies in the lobby and in the late afternoon there was a social hour which had soup and nachos the day we tried it.  If you go with a family you could conceivably save a lot of money on food by staying here.  Finally everyone went out of their way to be pleasant - the maids said hello to you in the hallway, the front desk people accommodated every need we had from directions to water to extra towels - all-in-all you felt like a valued guest.  It is an older building so don't expect a brand new multi-story chain hotel but the room was clean, the

Summary Heading: Good hotel, great location, loved the food availability
Summary: This hotel is right across the street from Disneyland, it was perfect with our two little ones in strollers.  Loved the fact that we didn't have to pay a penny for food in the park.  Just brought snacks to hold us over for dinner back at the hotel.  They were so nice to provide a birthday bag full of princess things, with balloons and a Coldstone cake for our daughter, free of charge.  Would definitely stay there again.

As a repeat customer, the Park Vue continues to improve its services for guests. Very friendly and obliging staff makes guests feel welcome. The rooms continue to be updated along with the services - new gym on site, improved breakfasts, introduction of new evening social hour and complimentary fresh baked cookies and water available from reception. The only complaint is the noise transference from the upstairs rooms to the downstairs rooms - however not significant to create any major hassle. Location across from Disneyland - who could want more.

I really enjoy staying at the Park Vue Inn. I am always happy with our checking in and out. Making reservations is always fast and easy. For this stay I had to change the kind of room I wanted and they were very helpful and made it easy. The rooms are simple and clean. They all have a fridge and microwave, which makes things easier when traveling with small kids. The beds are also better since they remodeled a couple years ago.  The location can't be beat. It is RIGHT across the street from the entrance to Disneyland. It will take you less than 10 minutes to get from your door to the gate. And half that time is just waiting for the crosswalk!  Also, the price is the BEST on the street. You can often find it for less than 100. I definitely recommend staying there.

We had cockroaches in our room....it was disgusting.  We complained twice to the front desk and we were told that a manager would respond.  No response.  I have sent emails.  No response.   We chose Park Vue based on the great reviews. The staff was friendly and the location was great but the cockroaches ruined our visit!!

Right across the street from Disneyland and California Adventure.  Close to the parks than the Disney Hotel. Nice clean rooms served their exact purpose.  A good nights sleep before and after a day at the parks.  The rooms were spacious, clean, and in good shape.  This hotel was exactly what we needed for the family day at the park. There is also free parking. It was nice being able to run across the street to pick up jackets for the continued evening fun at the parks. The breakfast and afternoon snack was a nice treat.   Overall I was very happy with the hotel and have recommended it several times now to my friend and family as a reasonable place to stay on your Disney trip.

My family and I have stayed at the Park Vue Inn several times (five, to be exact) and each stay has been a terrific experience. The hotel's proximity to Disneyland cannot be beat! It is directly across the street from the main entrance. The walk to Disneyland's fron gate is under five minutes.  The rooms are consistently clean and well-maintained. It seems that constant improvements and renovations are made, because the place looks brighter and fresher every year when we come back.  The staff is friendly and accomodating, always asking "is everything is okay?" and "how is your stay?" . The fresh-baked cookies and cold water was a pleasant (and welcome) added surprise, as was the welcome basket containing fruit and wine that was in our room upon our arrival.  We look forward to

Summary Heading: Will Never stay anywhere Else but Park Vue Inn
Summary: I get up the nerve to brave a Disneyland trip every 3 or 4 years....We have stayed all over Harbor Blvd.  This trip, the thing I was most interested in was location, then value, then quality...I am tired of walking for what seems like miles with kids and strollers and being worn out by the time you get to the Disneyland gate.  MANY hotels advertise across the street, but it is actuall across and down 1/2 mile or more.  Park Vue In is directly across from Disneyland gate.  When you walk through their parking lot you are at the crosswalk to the park entrance.  I was thrilled with the location. It was so close we actually went back to the room to rest up for evening. The Hotel is very attractive, clean, as everyone mentions super friendly staff, gift basket waiting with

1. Great value for money. For the price you're paying, you're not expecting the Hilton, right? Disney fans would most likely be out by 8am and back only after 10pm so you don't need all the added extras like seafood buffets, spa treatments, gym, landscaped pool ... Bathroom amenities are provided, and breakfast is included. Good value for a couple. Even better value for a family.  2. Great location. A 10 minute walk to the entrance of Disneyland. We were soaked on a ride and it was close enough to walk back to change.

This was an excellent value for the money. The complimentary, daily breakfast for each member of my family paid for itself immediately. That easily saved us $20 per day. We had to call on the staff a few times, but they were always helpful and quick. They made sure that everything was to our satisfaction. Plus, the hotel's proximity to the front door of Disneyland makes it the perfect place for families on a budget. We will be coming back!

Summary Heading: BEST Staff, BEST Location & BEST value for money
Summary: Hello Fernando, Laura, Olga, Judith, Santa, Lidia, Rocío, Orlando, Enrique,Tracy, Jose, Erick and All staff at the Park Vue Inn:  Can I just say on behalf of my family a big THANK YOU? (And Muchas Gracias!) This crew is obviously trained to value the word SERVICE.  Talk about real customer service here!  My children will always remember your kindness! The hotel isn't perfect, but the staff is amazing and you notice in the small gestures such as helping me to find my lost DSi, explaining me how to get to places, finding a hairdresser salon for children's haircuts, finding a hotel vacancy elsewhere if they're booked out, and the list goes on. The hotel offers many extras we don't get everywhere else such as the welcoming basket with fruit and sparkling drink, delicious home made

Summary Heading: Awesome Hotel!  Awesome location!!  Awesome service!!!
Summary: If you are looking for a hotel that is within walking distance to Disneyland and California Adventure and offers a continental breakfast then you have found the right hotel!!!!    The Park Vue Inn is directly across the street from the main entrances to the park.  If you were to park at the park you would be getting off the shuttle buses at the same location as this hotel.  We just had to walk across Harbor street then we were at the shuttle bus location.  Very convenient location!!!  We just parked our van at the hotel and walked across the street!  Check in time is 3:30 but we were able to park at the hotel before our check in and enjoy having our van parked at the hotel without having to park at Disneyland.  Most likely saved us 30-45 minutes of parking time/shuttle time!

Summary Heading: "Great Place to Stay....right across from Disneyland...will definately be back again"
Summary: This place is the best! So accommodating and right across the street from Disneyland...literally right across the street! From the complimentary cookies and bottle water and the check in counter, to the gift basket of fruit delivered to the room, to the birthday gift and balloons delivered to the room, to the complimentary breakfast and dinner...this place is 1st class!!! ...I will certainly be back again!

My husband, daughter and I stayed at Park Vue for one night on October 28, 2010, specifically so I could see what all the fuss is about since this motel is one of the highest TripAdvisor rated motels just across the street from Disneyland.    That day was my daughter's 13th birthday.  Supposedly, Park Vue gives birthday people some small gift, which was mentioned to my daughter on check-in.  Unfortunately, despite telling the desk later that evening that my daughter had not received the promised gift, and we were assured it would immediately be sent to our room, she never did get it.  Not a big deal to me, but it kind of bummed out my daughter.   However, the motel is clearly making great efforts to attract and keep its guests as it has a good, full breakfast, unlike most of the

Summary Heading: I enjoyed everything about the Hotel
Summary: This was our 1st time staying here. My sons 1st time at Disneyland, and Park vue made our vacation very relaxing and great!! From the front desk to the rooms, everything was very nice and clean and customer service was great. We enjoyed the breakfast and was so grateful for the dinner at night. Thank you Park Vue for making our stay a very exciting and nice stay.

Summary Heading: We'll definitely stay at the Park Vue Inn again...
Summary: SERVICE:   1) The front desk area provided complimentary water, fruit, delicious cookies, and Halloween candy. 2)  The hotel staff gave us access to their complimentary parking facility, access to the swiming pool, etc. upon early arrival. 3)  Upon check-in, a front desk staff member gave my baby a balloon we could tie to her stroller. 4)  Upon departing, another front desk staff member gave my baby a small cute trick-or-treat pail filled with little goodies.  ROOM: 1)  I booked a king-size bed room with a jacuzzi.  Upon entering the room, we noticed a gift basket filled with assorted fruit, wine, and water.  We noticed a note communicating that we can trade the wine for apple cider upon request.  This was perfect for no one in my family drinks alcoholic beverages.   2)  The

I have no other option than to absolutely recommend this hotel! The rooms were super-clean, staff always tried to do the best for us (and always did)¨. Probably the best hotel I stayed in during our 2-week trip through California! PLUS Disneyland is just acrross the street!

Summary Heading: Perfect Location, Free Hot Breakfast, and dinner!! We won't stay anywhere else!
Summary: We arrived on the 23 of October and stayed for 6 nights we had the 2 queen room which was very spacious.  There was a gift basket along with balloons and presents for my 2 kids that were celebrating birthdays! Everyone at this hotel is very friendly and helpful! We have stayed at many of the hotels on south harbor because we insist on being within walking distance this was the closest you can get and worth every dime!! We will be returning next week for a couple nights and we r really looking forward to it! Thanks Park Vue for making our trip a huge success!!! See ya soon!

Summary Heading: What a find, location, staff and service were excellent
Summary: We were very pleasently surprised. Location was great, right across from Disneyland made it so convenient to come home and rest midday and take a dip in the pool. Staff went out of their way to accomodate us, such nice extra touches, water and cookies at the desk,  the breakfast was delicious and filling, and they always seemed to take pleasure in interactions with us. If it was to ask them to print boarding tickets or arrange a cake for my brother's birthday, they always were available and pleasant. And the welcome basket in our rooms and the balloons in my brothers' room were all appreciated. I believe it was Brian, in charge of the breakfast who was also so personable. Keep up the great work

Summary Heading: A "MUST" when vacationing at Disneyland with children!  Don't go anywhere else!
Summary: The eintire  property inside and out is immaculate.  Breakfast, and now a lite dinnr, included in your room rate.   Gave us a wine and fruit basket as a surprise since we had stayed there before.  Litterally acroos the street from Disneyland (a 4 minute walk to the front gates).   Wonderful pool and hot tub.  Rooms with bunk beds for the kids in addition to a queen for adults.  If you're on any kind of budget this is SO worth your money you'll neve stay anywhere else .

Summary Heading: Great Value Great Stay with Family
Summary: Excellent service, warm welcome, quiet room, very comfortable beds, right across the street from the main gate of Disneyland. Full breakfast every morning and a light dinner each night. If you really care about the furniture and a flat screen tv this isn't the place for you BUT if clean, comfortable and a great value are your priorities this IS the place. We had a great stay!

Summary Heading: This place just gets better with each visit
Summary: We stayed one night at the Park Vue while we attended the Halloween Party at Disneyland.  We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived  to find that even though we would only be with them for a night, a fruit and wine basket and a personalized letter was left in the room to welcome us to the hotel.   We stayed in a 1-queen, bunkbed room (2 adults, 2 children).  While the room was a little tight with 4 people, the service at the hotel more than made up for it.   The room was very clean, with plenty of toiletries provided.  The beds were comfortable and my children loved the bunkbed option. We were pleased to discover they had added an evening social hour with salad, soup and snacks.  This is a new addition since our last stay.  We also discovered that they are now serving hot

Summary Heading: Outstanding value just across the street
Summary: We had a wonderful stay here.  There were 5 adults(myself, spouse, adult son, adult daughter and her spouse).  We had a standard room which still had room for a rollaway.  Room was fairly quiet.  Everyone was very friendly.  Breakfast included bacon, sausages, different eggs everyday(scrammbled, omelet), one day biscuits, one day hashbrowns, 2 waffle makers, toast, muffins, danish, donuts, toaster pancakes, fresh fruit, hardboiled eggs, cold and hot cereal, coffee, tea, juice, milk and chocolate milk.  There is also a dinner from 5-7 which we did not attend.  You are presented with a gift basket with fruit and wine or apple cider, and bottle water in your room with a personal greeting.  Additional water, fruit and cookies are available in the lobby.  This place is just about the

Summary Heading: Enjoyable stay at the Park Vue!
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue for four nights with our two young daughters, 2 and 5 yrs old. I booked online and noted they do special things for guests celebrating birthdays. We were going to Disneyland to celebrate both my girls' birthdays so I called and let the front desk know. When we arrived, our room was ready and we entered to find two beautiful balloon boquets attached to nice Disney  gift bags. Inside the gift bags were nice age appropriate gifts. We also had a nice fruit basket and bottle of wine! VERY NICE touch! The people were very friendly. The breakfast has a very nice selection: make your own waffles. bagels, donuts, eggs, hash browns, fruit, yogurt, juice, coffee, milk...We did not levae hungry. The gentleman that greeted us was always friendly and would joke with

Summary Heading: The Best When Staying Near Disneyland
Summary: This hote/Inn is the best when staying near the Disneyland Resort. I stayed there on many occasions and have never had a problem or a concern about the cleanest of hotel. The people are wonderful and always there with a smile. Rooms are greet, clean and well maintained. We are planning a family reunion in the coming years and this is where I will plan to book my entire family.   Park Vue. Thanks for the wonderful hospitality

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, best location on Harbor BLVD
Summary: This was the first time we did not have to deal with shuttles and it was great.  The crosswalk is right at the hotel and it only took minutes to walk from our room to the front gates.  Our hotel room was very clean and upgraded which surprised me for how old the hotel is.  The staff was very friendly and customer service was outstanding.  The free breakfast was excellent with lots to choose from.  I did note that the breakfast area became congested between 8 and 830 because just like at the supermarket, everyone seems to go at the same time.  We only did the social hour once and it was very nice, they had tacos.  I will definately stay here again.

Summary Heading: I have never been so frustrated with front desk service in all my life!!
Summary: We stayed with the Park Vue for our 5 day trip to Disneyland.  My daughter left her denim jacket in the shuttle on the way into anaheim.  The driver kindly returned it to the hotel the next morning but the staff never bothered to track us down and return it.  After realising our loss I tracked down through the shuttle company its whereabouts, of course by then we had left LA.  I have rung reception no less than 20 times trying to get this jacket Fed-Exed back to me but the reception staff WILL NOT oblige every time they come to pick up.  I have been tearing my hair out, I cannot speak to or contact management and this issue is still not resolved.  Very bad taste in my mouth :(

Excellent location, literally across the road from the entrance to the Disneyland parks.  Rooms are your typical motel set up but beds are comfortable and all very clean.
