Customer service rivals that of many three and four hotels that we have stayed at; cookies and water at check-in area; gift basket delivered upon arrival; phone call to assure all is satisfactory and not wait for any request for service.  Breakfast included with price of room; eggs, bacon and sausage found to be a bit lacking in flavor but waffles, cereal, and fruit also available.  All in all a great value for the money & we will definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Amazing front desk service - very satisfied
Summary: The front desk & hotel staff service is amazing! I am on a motorcycle road trip up and down the california coast and stay in hotels every night - so I am getting all the good and bad experiences of staying in moderately priced hotels.... the staff at this hotel went out of thier way to accomodate my needs (it was raining) to keep me and my bike dry overnight without any hesitation! They even gave me a free upgrade to a Jacuzzi suite when they noticed that i had been riding in the rain all day - which was the best! the outdoor pool and jacuzzi are nice, but having a real full size jacuzzi in your room is amazing - I would highly recommend it!!!!  The prices are competative with the surrounding hotels, but this hotel gives you a free breakfast and dinner (REAL cooked food - not

We had a nice stay at the Park Vue Inn.  The service was very good - friendly staff, cookies and water at check-in, and a welcome basket in our room with cider and fruit.  The room was clean and comfortable.  A bit noisy (could hear people walking and showering).  Would definitely stay here again - the location can't be beat.

I read the reviews on this site, and decided this was the motel my husband and I would stay in during our visit to Disneyland.  Was I ever glad I did! Located right across from the theme parks, its location was perfect.  The complimentary breakfast and social hour were great.  We didn't have to move our car for our 4 night stay.

In staying at this hotel, we were mostly looking at the fact that it was right across the street from Disneyland.  But after staying there this last week, we have so many great things to say about it now.  First of all, they are incredibly friendly.  The staff is kind and out-going and eager to meet all of your needs.  Second, they feed you a full breakfast, like it says, but there is also a "social hour" which is basically kid-friendly dinners every night.  Our kids were thrilled and we were tickled pink not have have to buy dinner in the park.  This hotel's location makes it easy to get back to for dinner. Third, they found out that our son was excited about it being his "half birthday" while we were there and they gave him an ice cream cake, balloons, a gift and a goodie bag!

Have recently returned after a very happy 7 night stay. 2 x queen bed room was great for a family of 4 with 2 teenagers. Very quiet room down the back. Hotel is so handy to Disneyland Park and neighbouring restaurants.Breakfast was great. Choice of fresh fruit salads, cereals,oats,make yourself waffles, toast,bagels,muffins,eggs,bacon, doughnuts etc etc. Laundry available for washing/drying. Small fee charged. Free bottles of water in the foyer.Free apples and free fresh baked cookies daily. Children both received a lovely balloon boquet and candy and ice cream cake for their birthday and a welcome basked of wine and fruit for us. Staff very friendly and helpful.Only concern/complaint I had was that my keycard to our room didnt work one night, so went down to reception and very

We arrived at the Hotel around 10:30am and did a pre-check in so we could enjoy the parks and pick up our keys when we got back.  We were given a pass so we could leave our car in the parking lot.  The walk to the park is so short!  We left the park at around 6pm and went back to pick up our key.  There were complimentary cookies and chilled bottles of water at the front desk.  When receiving our key we were notified that Social hour was from 5p-7p upstairs and they were serving all you can eat tacos that evening.  The kids were starving so we went straight up to eat.  The food was very good and very satisfying it was nice to be fed after a long day at Disney.  The host was so warm and inviting - definitely living up to the "Social" part of the hour.  We finally went to our room

We found the staff and service to be great.  We were happy with the free breakfast.  We were disappointed in the room.  We stayed in a room with a queen bed and bunk bed with trundle.  The room was tiny.   We had 2 adults, 2 children and we were literally bumping into each other in this small room.  The room smelled damp and musty and the pillows looked disgusting.  I developed a cough during our first night of staying and we also soon discovered that its a very noisy place to stay.  The bathroom was small and old.  We stayed 2 nights and then had to motel to a nicer hotel.

Summary Heading: Best of hotels on South Harbor across from Disneyland entrance
Summary: We are Disneyland Annual Passholders and have stayed at many of the hotels on Harbor Blvd (Tropicana, Fairfield Inn, etc) as well as some of the hotels further away (Homewood Suites & Holiday Inn).   This was our third time at Park Vue Inn and we brought my elderly parents to celebrate their anniversary and my husband's birthday.  First of all, you can't beat the location. It's right across the street from the entrance to both parks.  We have free parking with out passes and the walk from the Park Vue is closer than Disney parking.  Also, they will let you park in the parking lot even if you come earlier than check in time and later than check out time.  Second, they have a great buffet breakfast.  They do change it up, but they have eggs, waffles, yogurt, cereal, bagels.  It's

Summary Heading: THE BEST LOCATION FOR DISNEYLAND! PLUS HUGE FREE BREAKFAST!!
Summary: Before choosing a place to stay I did sooo much research, because I wanted a nice clean hotel with breakfast and it had to be close to Disneyland and at the same time be affordable. I'm pretty picky and I have nothing negative to say about our stay at the Park Vue Inn. You can't beat the price and the breakfast is fantastic. Plus they offer 24hr free fresh baked cookies and bottled water in the lobby! It's close to great restaurants, ice cream place and a great coffee shop. (we need our espresso!) We have a 5 and 7 year old and got the room with the bunk beds which were great! The pool was very nice and being so close to Disney we just came home for lunch and a swim. The service is 5 STAR. They really do everything to make your stay the most enjoyable. The motel is DIRECTLY

I have stayed in all 3 of the Disney hotels, plus several hotels on Harbor.  This one is the best and has become our Disneyland preferred hotel!  It is the closest to Disneyland park (there is actually one 30 seconds closer but I stayed there and found it was too noisy and the walls were very thin.)  Rooms are clean and reasonably sized.  This time we had the queen with bunk beds for a family of 4.  The room also came with a microwave, fridge, and coffee maker.  We fit our clothes into the 3 wide drawers (there was no closet).  A welcome fruit basket with wine was much appreciated.  Our room safe was locked and they sent maintenance over immediately to open it for us.  The free breakfast buffet was excellent -- fresh waffles, sausage, bacon, yogurt, donuts, cereal, eggs,

The continental breakfast was a lot more than I expected! Bacon, biscuits, fresh waffles, eggs, yogurt, and a whole lot more.The pool was clean and well maintained.  The laundry room was open late and offered coin operated products. The complimentary warm cookies and iced water after 11 was a nice touch. The basket of sparkling cider & fruit upon arrival was just what we needed. Thank you Park Vue! You made Disneyland less complicated.
I have been to Disneyland many times.  This is by far teh best hotel I have ever stayed in.  Cannot find anything negative to say about the 4 days we stayed there.

Summary Heading: Worth the extra price for location
Summary: This is a very nice hotel that has gone through some major changes over the years.  The complimentary breakfast and evening social is a nice plus.  Getting in and out of hotel is a bit confusing, there is no way out! It would be nice if the breakfast room was moved downstairs since there is no elevator.

We love to go to Disneyland a few times a year and our 1st priority is to stay close enough to walk into the park.  You can't get any closer than this hotel so that alone makes it a great place to stay but the little extras were amazing, waffles, social hour, fresh baked cookies and a welcome basket.  Wow!  My family never needed to get in the car or even walk down the block.  You really got the feeling that the staff enjoyed their jobs even the housekeeing.  The only problem we had was our key didn't work at check in and I didn't even have to go to the office because the housekeeper opened the room and called a maintainance person over, now that's good custormer service.  These days you don't always get good service so when a business takes the time to treat you well you need

My family and I stayed at PArk Vue for 7 nights. Vacation started off rough when we got to LAX and with thecar rental company (which lead to a very uspet individual!)We checked in a few hrs after estimated arrival time and was check in very quickly.  It was nice to see the cookies, fruits, and water out for the guests.  We got a great room location wise.  We also received a gift basket and birthday balloons and gifts  for my daughter who was celebrating her 2nd birthday.  The breakfast was great and Bryan was awesome.  the walk to the park could not be better!  Closer than the hotels on the grounds( walked to the Disneyland Hotel for a character breakfast)!  The water really  helped as we took a few bottles as we headed to the park.  Most def a MUST BOOK hotel for a trip esp

Summary Heading: Park Vue Inn is THE place to stay!
Summary: If you are visiting Disneyland and looking for a spot to stay, look no further!  This is THE place to stay!  From the moment we arrived, the hotel vastly exceeded our expectations.  The concierge staff were friendly, courteous, and expedited our check in.  There were freshly baked cookies, cold bottled water, and fresh fruit at the counter!    Our room was spacious and clean, smelled fresh  -- and there was a welcome basket waiting for us with a nice letter welcoming us.  The basket contained fruit, water, and a bottle of Sparkling Cider with two wine glasses!   Ten minutes after unpacking, we had a phone call from the front desk, just asking us if our room was alright, if we needed extra towels or blankets.  Amazing!  Went down to their "social hour" and didn't expect much.

Summary Heading: It is the best place for us to stay.
Summary: We had such a fantastic trip thanks to this hotel. There is no closer place to stay when visiting Disneyland. This is so important with four little kids. This hotel did not skimp on anything. They offer a great FREE breakfast and also a light dinner in the evenings. There were always cold water bottles in the lobby and usually some fresh cookies too. The pool area was nice, the breakfast area was nice. We had plenty of space in our suite, it was so great to have the kitchenette with small kids. Oh, they even had a welcome basket in our room with fruit, water bottles and wine (we don't drink but it was a nice gesture anyway). Our oldest daughter enjoyed the little store with cheap little toys to buy (much much less than Disneyland stuff) and there is a Cold Stone right there in

Summary Heading: WOW!! ~EVERYTHING ABOVE & BEYOND EXPECTATIONS~Supreme Free Breakfast, Free Cold Bottled Water, Free Fresh Fruit and MORE
Summary: You won't believe the attention you'll receive from this hotel. It was beyound our expectations. Way Beyond. This hotel is the CLOSEST TO THE DISNEYLAND ENTRANCE you're going to find. I mean right there at the crosswalk.  First of all our room was neat and clean and ready for us when we arrived at 10 am. The room had a queen size bed and a bunk bed for the kids. This is not a 5 star hotel, but we were treated better than any of the 5 star hotels we've stayed at and the rates were quite reasonable. FREE Cold bottled water on ice was available to us everyday from 11am to midnight. Very much appreciated since one bottle of water in Disneyland is $3. Free Fresh Fruit and Warm Fresh Baked  Cookies are also available during those hours. This in itself was more than we would have hoped

Summary Heading: Perfect location for Disney and would love to stay again!
Summary: This is the closest hotel to the entrance to Disney. We truely walked to the parks in 5 mins! The breakfast is great and they have a free snack time offered also. The staff is very helpful and friendly. If your purpose in going to Anaheim is to do Disneyland then this is a GREAT hotel for the value. The kids loved the bunk beds,  and we loved looking at the Disneyland sign right across the street!

Summary Heading: You're taken care of just like family!  Awesome value for your money!
Summary: *Park Vue Inn offers free HOT breakfast, free HOT dinner, FREE bottled water, FREE freshly baked cookies, FREE fresh fruits.  Because of those things alone, we saved about $660 instead of buying those items at the Disney Parks for 5 days.   *The price is right!  Our room averaged $100 per night.    *The staff was extremely friendly and very accommodating...our flight arrived early in the morning and we weren't supposed to check in until 3 p.m., however, when I went to drop off our luggage at their front desk, they offered me a free early check in.    My sister stayed at Disneyland Grand California Hotel and she had to wait around after a long flight until 3 p.m. for her room!  *Our room at the Park Vue Inn was very clean!   Even cleaner than my sisters room at the Disney Grand

Summary Heading: Top Notch, 5-star, Why Look Anywhere Else!!
Summary: Wow!!  Let me tell you about the Park Vue Inn... Upon arrival at the front desk we were greeted by the friendly staff with a smile and and an offer of cookies, fruit, coffee or tea, and Ice cold water..All complimentary!!. Check in was a breeze with very friendly staff that were happy to help. The lady at the front desk said, "If I can help with anything don't hesitate to call." Arriving at my room I was surprised to see a gift basket containing wine, fruit & water with a personalized note welcoming me to the hotel... very nice touch.  The room was beautiful, complete with a jacuzzi right in my living room and a big flat panel TV.  There was also a coffee maker with free coffee and condiments, an Ironing board and iron and even 2 very cozy thick robes. The pillowtop beds were

This was the third time we've stayed at Park Vue Inn in the past year, and we won't go anywhere else. Best place to stay in Anaheim, and it's great how close it is to Disneyland. The spa room is awesome, and so relaxing after a long day at the theme park! Staff are really helpful and friendly, rooms are really clean and the hotel has a good atmosphere. Can't wait to go back.

Summary Heading: Just stay here when visiting Disneyland
Summary: If you have been reading the other reviews, you will probably not read anything new here.  Location - Literally a 5 minute walk to the main gate of Disneyland.  We even walked back midday to take a break one day.  Meals - Breakfast was awesome.  A full buffet including eggs, sausages, bacon, waffles, pancakes, cereal, juices, fruit, yogurt.  You are not going to find this at any other hotel on Harbor.  Bryan the Food Manager knows how to lay out a spread.  There is also a "social hour" from 5-7pm, but we did not go to this, but I heard it has kid friendly meals like mac and cheese or chicken nuggets.  Staff - Super friendly and helpful.  We had a heatwave hit Anaheim during the week we visited (108 degrees on Monday).  The lobby staff had free bottles of water for all guests.

Summary Heading: Wow!!! What a great place to stay.
Summary: This hotel was wonderful.  Great service, nice room, and the breakfast was great.  They also have a social hour which works great for dinner.   The kids loved the pool and hot tub.  It is the closest thing to Disneyland without staying in the park.    They have lots of "extras" to make your stay even more enjoyable.

Park Vue Hotel was very clean.. The Employees greeted us wih smiles and friendliness. I was amazed at the Hospitality,The welcome note personalized for me  and  a basket of fuit and champagne was very thoughtful off the staff. Breakfast was an added feature that was given us for free. I compared the hotel to the disneyland resort hotel where my children stayed and couldnt believe the difference. I will alway stay at Park Vue when in Anaheim and recomend it to all my family and friends

We LOVED our room at the Park Vue. The bed was super comfortable (important!). The place was pretty quiet, particularly considering many children that stayed there.  It's closer to Disneyland than staying at the Disneyland hotel, and half the price. The 'continental' breakfast turned out to be a full-fledged thing, with fruit, muffins, pastry, waffle machine, juice bar, bacon, sausage, omelets, everything. they also offered a DINNER buffet, but we weren't able to take part in that due to our schedule. We hold disney annual passes and have stayed at the Embassy Suites and the Disneyland Hotel, but will probably never stay anywhere but Park Vue from now on.  We had a room with a jacuzzi, and enjoyed that greatly!

Summary Heading: Fab hotel! would recommend anyone to stay at the park vue
Summary: The staff were amazing, the room was all that you need, the breakfast was great and a really good way to start the day, the dinner was a bonus and helped save some cash for buying more pressies! the location you couldn't want better, All the little extra's make your stay so much better. The only one thing we would alter  especially in the suites is to have a comfy chair as not everyone wants to sit on a bed or a dining chair, i know you can be limited by space a bit but i'm sure something could work espcially like i say in the suites.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with good service and price
Summary: We took two adults and three kids for a three day trip to the Disney parks. This hotel is across the street from the main Disney park entrance. A lot of hotels say they are across the street or within walking distance, but Park Vue is the closest one to the main entrance. Go outside, cross the street and you're right where all the shuttles drop people off. We loved being so close we could come back for naps during the day without riding a shuttle or bus.  We had one of the newer rooms with a bunk-bed and a pullout. Perfect for us and the kids (they argued over who got to sleep on top, of course :). The Inn provides a great continental breakfast and a decent continental dinner. The breakfast included donuts, cereal, fresh fruit, eggs, sausage, bacon, juice and fresh waffles you

This Hotel is one of the closest to the park.  The rates are very good considering they include the following:  Breakfast and Dinner for all parties in your group You can walk to Disneyland so that saves you money on  parking They give you a gift basket of fruit and sparking cider or wine If your child is having a birthday they supply a present and a cake from Cold Stone. The staff is awesome, alway make it right.   My brother and I got reservations at the same time, when we checked in I was charged 10 less, well they refunded my brother the difference. They supply water and cookies in the lobby. I stay hear everytime I go except when I have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel.   I will always stay here when traveling to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: The Park Vue Inn is a great place to stay close to Disneyland
Summary: We are a family of six. We have 4 small children and stayed at the Park vue inn for our Sept. 2010 vacation. It is definately a great place to stay, they are right across from the main gate at Disneyland, they provide an amazing breakfast and there dinner was free!! It saved us so much money and the convience of having a hot delicious meal waiting for you was perfect and fast. You can go eat your dinner and then run back to Disneyland for the evening - just make sure to get your hand stamped when leaving.  We watched the fireworks on there roof top and the view was awesome!! We never entered the park as we could see it so well from our hotel there was no need! The ice cream at the front of the hotel was spectacular - it was so nice for us to have treats if we wanted! The hotel

I stayed at the Park Vue over Labor Day weekend. The location, obviously, is great: You can't get closer to Disneyland without staying at a Disney hotel. The amenities were nice, too: I received a gift basket with fruit, candy and cider (which I was able to exchange for wine at the front desk), and because it was my birthday, I also received balloons, a very cute Mickey Mouse mug filled with chocolates and a small ice cream cake (although I had to ask three times for the cake). Breakfast was decent, as well. Most days they had eggs or little cheese omelets (one day they had blintzes), bacon, sausage, pancakes/waffles, a variety of breads and cereals, hardboiled eggs, etc. The room was clean and fairly quiet, except for some noise from my upstairs neighbors.  One warning, though.

Summary Heading: We would stay here again (i think)
Summary: Good size room and nice surprise with gift basket. The Wifi didn't work well but may have been to do with the location of our room 141. The man on the front desk was polite and friendly the woman not so much. Breakfast had a good choice and social time between 5pm and 7pm was another nice touch but we didn't like having to stand behind rope and wait for tickets to be scanned before we could enter the breakfast room!! because of this we chose to have breakfast on our 2nd day at the Ihop next door and we didn't go to social again. It is a good location and was quiet.

Summary Heading: The only place we want to stay!
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue in May and again in September. In May I shared a suite with my sister and her family since my husband wasn't able to come to Disneyland. We had the kitchenette which was fabulous for preparing low cost meals. My brother and his family were also there and the staff put our rooms right next to each other which helped with sharing nap times and space. He was in a queen room with the bunk bed. The location is wonderful and such a relief after a long day at Disneyland. It also makes returning for naps so much easier.  In September we stayed in a Queen with bunk beds. Our 5 year old loved the bunk bed and slept as well as at home. The breakfast has been impressive with both stays. When we stayed in September they had added the Social Hour which we enjoyed the

Summary Heading: They get it at the Park Vue
Summary: The folks at the Park Vue Inn understand hospitality.  I typically stay at Four Seasons/Ritz Carltons and I was charmed by this place.  I needed a suite with a door that closes (mother-in-law snores) that is close to Disneyland.  The location is the closest you can possibly be to the entrance of the parks.  I paid $125 for the suite.  There was a kitchenette, living room with pull-out bed, and a bedroom with two queen beds.  When we checked in after a long morning at the park there was cold water, fruit and FRESH BAKED COOKIES in the lobby.  People, the cookies were still warm.  We devoured them.           In our room was a welcome basket with water, fruit, wine glasses, and a bottle of wine, which I exchanged for Martinelli's sparkling juice for my kid.  Being a guest entitles

Well we booked this hotel  based on the reviews and they still didn't give it what it deserved and say how great this place is! We stayed for 8 nights and recieved a wine and fruit basket upon arrival. As well as we recieved 2 beautifully gift wrapped anniversary gifts for our 10 year anniversary. The free breakfast is more than you get anywhere else with 4-5 hot items as well as all the cold cerels, pastries and everything else a breakfast can include. Not only is this a money saver but WAIT THERES MORE! They have this new thing called Social hour it is a dinner which is everynight 5-7 and if free as well! It was basic like hot dogs, hamburgers, tacos, pasta also salad and soup everynight. But hey if you don't have to pay for 2 meals a day you are saving big $$$. The location

Summary Heading: All that and a bag of....welcome basket!
Summary: Every positive review below stated everything we expected and they delivered!!!! Great comp breakfast in the morning, clean swimming pool and great rates. Staff friendly. AWESOME location!!!!  Brian was very nice to our little ones and stopped to chat to ask them what was our favorite about Disneyland. We received a call when we arrived and a letter to thank us for choosing the Park Vue Inn and if there was anything we needed. All in all a great place to stay!!!!!

Summary Heading: The Best Place to Stay Near Disneyland
Summary: We visit Disneyland every year and this is by far the best choice we have made. The beds are extremely comfortable, the rooms are very clean and the location simply cannot be beat. It's the closest hotel to Disneyland! Directly across the street from the park entrance (much closer than Paradise Pier, even if you take the Monorail!). The hot cookies and breakfast were fabulous. The pool was a perfect way to break up the day and the kids loved it. This is a great hotel and the employees aim to please in every way they can. Free parking, quiet at night, free wireless internet.  We will definitely return next year!

Summary Heading: What a great place to stay!
Summary: Whether you are just adults or have children this Park Vue Inn is an ideal place to stay, it right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland, California Adventure and Downtown Disney.  The staff here is wonderful, rooms are nice and comfy and to top it all off they offer a great breakfast, I personally loved the fresh fruit bowl and hot waffles but lots of other choices, they also have a social hour where they serve hot dinner type snacks between 5-7 and then in there lobby have hot baked cookies, bottled water and apples.  We have stayed here a few times before and the motel just seems to get better with every stay!

My husband and I heard about this place through a friend who highly rated it, so excitedly we booked it for a couple nights for a family vacation. Upon arrival, we were excited to see that a crosswalk separated them from the Disneyland location. We arrived in the morning and walked over to Disneyland with our 3 kids to hang out until our room woul be ready in the afternoon. After a morning in the park, we checked back with the front desk to let them know we were ready to check in. Granted, we were a half hour earlier than the 3pm check in, but excited that they said our room was ready for us!! After all our 3 kids were ready for a nap!!  So entering the room we see we what we had signed up for and excitedly the kids get into the bunk beds, while Dad went to bring in our luggage.

We have stayed at Park Vue several times over the years because of it's proximity to  Disneyland. They have continually improved the property, amenities and service. This time we enjoyed a gift basket in our room, free fresh baked cookies in the lobby, as well as the free hot breakfast (there was always a good cold breakfast). The pool area was redone and is vey attractive.  The rooms have been freshened up. It's convenient to park right outside your room. And the staff was very focused on making sure we enjoyed our stay.

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: We were able to check in early and still make it to the opening of Disneyland.  When we returned from a day of fun it was a big surprise to find an ammenityl basket in the room with wine, water and fruit.  Wish we could have taken them up on the additional day at a reduced rate.  We will definitely come back again.

We stayed at the hotel with extended family - aged 25 to 90 years old. We all enjoyed the hotel. It is truly the closest hotel to Disneyland. The rooms were clean, the staff was friendly and caring and the free breakfast was delicious.

Summary Heading: Great value, great location, great service
Summary: We've been staying at this hotel for years and the service actually gets better every time we stay. The continental breakfast isn't great but it's ok and saves us a lot of money on food. My daughter loves making her own waffles every morning.   The staff and service is outstanding. We were there for the Half Marathon and I was so happy to see they had bagels, juice, and coffee set up at 3:30 a.m. just for us runners. It was a very nice touch.  As for the location, you can't possibly get any closer to Disneyland (without paying a fortune to stay at the Disney owned hotels). It's the same distance to walk to this hotel as it is to walk to the shuttles for other hotels.   We will absolutely stay here again on our next trip.

this hotel is by far the best in town everything about it was awesome the breakfast was excellent, the staff was very friendly when checking in darlene asked me if i was here to celebrate anything and it was my daughters birthday she was turning 3 after we came back from dinner we had a gift with balloons waiting in the room my daughter was so happy, i had a problem with my room and it was taken care of immediately by the supervisor she was very well put and friendly my favorite part of the trip were the cookies in the front desk our favorite hotel by far we will defenetly be back!!!!!!!!!!

Summary Heading: Perfect-no.  Stay there again-in a heartbeat!
Summary: We are Annual Pass holders at Disneyland so we stay over for a night or 2 in Anaheim frequently.  After trying numerous different hotels we found the Ramada Maingate and have stayed there many times for happily.  We still love to stay at the Ramada and I recommend it highly, but when I stumbled upon the reviews for the Park Vue Inn, we decided to give it a try.  It was about $16 more then the Ramada but we definitely thought it was worth it.  We have a toddler and we usually get a room with a king bed and we all sleep together.  We've tried 2 queens before and it just didn't work as well for our little girl.  But when I saw I could get a room with a queen and bunk beds, I knew she would be excited to have a bed just her size.  It worked brilliantly!  Literally, the first time

Summary Heading: We love this home away from home!
Summary: We have stayed at the Park Vue Inn multiple times and are very happy with our stay every time.  My family of four and I visit Disneyland 2-3 times/year.  We enjoy Disneyland and California Adventure to the fullest, so our time at the hotel is limited primarily to evening hours and early mornings.  We find the rooms comfortable and clean, it is great that they all have a microwave and refrigerator.  My children, 4 and 7, LOVE to go to the pool on the occasion that we do come back to the hotel during the day.    The breakfast and social hour are a HUGE added value and the selection is just right.  We highly recommend this hotel for its service, location and amenities.

Summary Heading: Nice room. Great location. Friendly and helpful staff.
Summary: My family and I enjoyed our stay at the Park Vue Inn. Our room with two queen beds was clean and quiet. All motel employees were friendly and polite. Brian and Argenis were particularly welcoming and helpful. Would stay here again, and have already highly recommended to others.  The pool and surroundings are clean and well maintained. The hot breakfast bar featuring bacon, eggs, waffles, fruit, etc. and a light hot meal available in the evening added to the value of our stay.  The motel is conveniently located just across the street from Disneyland, and about a 30 minute drive to Newport Beach.   Avoid the nearby IHOP Restaurant. Employees are friendly, but menu prices are jacked up likely due to location. Try Mimi's Cafe a few blocks down the street. The food and atmosphere are

We travel (from Canada) to Disneyland twice a year and have stayed at many other hotels & inns surrounding the park, so based on that here goes: This Inn, in my opinion, is the absolute closest to the front gates of Disneyland that you can get...the location is unbeatable!  The staff (EVERY single one we encountered!)  were FANTASTIC!!! We had an issue with our lock, maintenance was ther within 4 minutes!  The Inn is well kept & maintained.  Rooms are dated, but clean. Linens were just ok, towels just ok, water pressure in the shower was almost too hard! lol We had NO noise in the evenings at all, it was VERY quiet and peaceful!  Parking was free wch was a huge plus for us. We received a welcome basket (hand delivered to our room) wch was much appreciated and only added to our

My family stayed at the Park Vue my friend stayed at the Best Western (next door) she couldn't believe the difference between the two motels...  1) the price was almost the same except the BW charged $8.00/day for their guests, 2) PV offered (almost ) full breakfast which included sausages, omlets, hash browns, and the normal stuff  , the food was very good. 3) they also offer a late snack , that 's almost a dinner in itself.  The staff was very nice and very accomodating in every way.

This hotel stands out over others we have stayed in in the area in three categories: -location -the right amenities -good value for price Location: We have stayed "on property"in the Disneyland and Paradise Pier hotels.  We have also stayed at other hotels on Katella and Harbor.  There is no hotel closer to the front gates of Disneyland than this one.  (Ok, the Grand California is basically inside California Adventure, but it is in a whole different category.)  Don't bother doing the math  or poring over the map- this really is the closest possible hotel- nothing is closer. The right amenities: other hotels in the same price category might have fancier bedding or cuter theming, but none had more of what we actually needed than this one.  Need a kitchen so you can save on food

This was our 2nd stay at the Park Vue Inn and it has improved since our last stay with an increased free breakfast selection and a social hour (which we didn't go to as we had already made dinner reservations elsewhere) but will next visit. There was a short delay at check in as the room wasn't ready but we gave them the benefit of the doubt as it was al busy. We booked the 2 room 3 bed suite which is great for the additional space it gives you without a huge price increase. The shower was the only problem as the water drains really slowly and so you end up standing in a pool of water - yuk!  Housekeeping did a great job considering most of them were also on breakfast duty at the start of the day.   The best part is the proximity to Disneyland - it is right at the lights across

Summary Heading: We couldn't have asked for more.
Summary: I was first found this hotel in an online search for hotels near Disneyland.  I was drawn to this one as they have rooms that hold 6 people, and for good rates.  I made the reservation online, no problems.  The hotel is literally across the street from the entrance to Disneyland.  There was a welcome basket when we arrived in our room with sparkling cider and fruit.  The room was great, 2 queens and a pull-out couch queen.  It had a kitchenette and also a 2nd vanity/sink outside of the bathroom, which was helpful as there were multiple girls trying to get ready for things as others were showering, etc.  The decor is contemporary, no weird floral pattern comforters, and the paint in the room is fun.  Housekeeping was excellent, and replenished us with plenty of towels and

This hotel is hands down the BEST for customer service--when I arrived my room wasn't ready yet so they held my bags and then took them up to my room while I went and played at Disneyland.  There s a welcome basket in your room with fruit, etc and complimentary cookies, ice water and fruit in the lobby.  I had to change rooms on the last night and they said to leave everything in one area and they would move it for us.  We came back in the afternoon and our room had all of our things in it--awesome!  The buffet breakfast is incredible-everything you could think of it.  I never got to experience the social hour but heard from other guests that it was amazing as well.  I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel (not to mention the location is great if you are gong to Disneyland)

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn for a total of six nights on two separate occassions and both were great experiences.  The Park Vue is everything you want in a hotel.   The location can't be beat. It's directly across the street from teh maingate, closer even than the resort's hotels.  We tok advantage of that to put our kids down for naps every day.   The staff is very friendly and helpful.  We arried at 1 pm, two hours before check in, and they found us a room that had been cleaned and let us check in.  One of the maintenance people even helped my daughter carry her luggage to the room.   The free breakfast is the best I've had at a hotel and they even serve free appetizers over happy hour.  Other freebies include free parkig and free high-speed internet.  Finaly, and most

We recently stayed one night here on a whirlwind trip to Disneyland.  We had the room with one queen bed and bunk beds.  We got there around noon and our room was not ready (which was fine since they said it may not be and check in wasn't until 2pm), but they gave us a parking pass and we parked our car and headed over to Disneyland.  They did not offer to keep our luggage in the lobby, but not sure I would have anyways.  The kids loved the cold water and free cookies in the lobby!  We did not get back to our room until 11:30 pm and had 3 very tired kids!  Everyone went right to bed and the kids slept great.  Beds are pretty squishy soft, which I liked but my husband wasn't too fond of.  The breakfast the next morning was GREAT!!!!  And we loved our basket in our room with apple

Upon arrival, all seemed great. We had a Welcome basket waiting in our hotel room that included wine and fruit. I have a two-year old, who naps between 1:00P-3:00P, so we would leave Disneyland and go to the hotel room for his nap during this time. The  housekeepers kept walking by our room with their cleaning carts making an extremely loud noise and yelling to each other back and forth. Our room was not cleaned the first day, so I had to call at night to request clean towels. There was no apology as to why the room wasn't cleaned. The next day, the same thing happened, so we had to ask them to clean our room. For the price we paid, I expected much more. There are so many hotels to choose from, and this is one I will not return to.

We arrived on August 21st at 8:00am left our luggage in a storage room in lobby then walked to DL.  It is right across the street to main enterance.  Park Vue called us around 2:00 to tell us the room was ready.  We  had a 2 bedroom suite.  It had 2 queen beds with flat screen TV in bedroom, living room had a sofa sleeper, fireplace, flat screen TV and a kitchen.  The room was very clean and enough space for 6 people to hang around in.  The complimenty breakfast was awesome omelettes, bacon, sausage, cereal, varierty on juices, waffles, hashbrowns and more and they kept it stocked with food.  They also had a social hour which was served from 5-7pm and it had soup, salad and a small entree.  This is now our new favorite place to stay while at Disney.

Summary Heading: will be staying at the park vue from now on
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue Inn during our trip to Disneyland and will be staying there from now on. Everything met our expectations. The service was great, it was clean and quiet. It is right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland. Hotel also provides a free breakfast and social hour. Both of these saved us a lot of money. Staff was great.

This was a return visit for us. Indeed, I can't imagine staying anywhere else for our annual trip to Disneyland. (The Park Vue Inn is so close to the Disneyland entrance!) The rooms are beautiful. You can watch the Disneyland fireworks while lounging in the pool, or hot tub: fabulously decadent! The staff is truly exemplary.  Their commitment to excellence is one reason we will keep coming back. They go out of their way to be helpful and welcoming. The free breakfast is delicious. (We were pleasantly surprised by the new social hour, which included complimentary dinner items!) The kids loved the  cookies and water bottles in the lobby area. Free parking is nice, too. We love the Park Vue Inn!

As I approached the front desk I was greeted by a young man. He was very knowledgeable, friendly and outgoing. He asked me about our drive, who was in our party and if we were celebrating anything in particular. I told him that we were going to Disneyland and we were celebrating my husband's birthday. He took notation of that and told me that he would send a little something to him. As we walked into the room, we had a small fruit and wine basket awaiting for us and a friendly note. About an hour later someone dropped of a bouquet of balloons and a small Disney cup w/chocolates inside of it. I truly enjoyed out stay and well as my family. Thank you to eveyone on staff who made our stay comfortable and enjoyable. P.S, my kids enjoyed the yummy treats you had available at the

From the moment we arrived, with a personalized letter and gift basket, to the easy, friendly checkout, this motel stay was very special.   Located right across from the Disneyland entrance (in fact, its closer than the Disneyland Hotel), this cute family motel was ideal for the entire family, from a 6 year old all the way to grandma.   We especially appreciated the hot breakfast that included omelettes, sausage, bacon, belgian waffles and more.  We were blown away with the evening 'social' that included complimentary hot service such as a taco bar, mini hamburgers, hot dogs, salad and other treats. Our family would recommend the Park Vue Inn to anyone looking for convenience, cute, and surprisingly low budget accomodations.  While it certainly isn't posh, in many ways, its much
We found the hotel to be very convenient for Disneyland. The rooms were clean and the staff very helpful. The pool is clean and big enough for a relaxing afternoon or evening dip and parking is easy.

I was traveling to the Disney resort with 3 teens and they wanted to stay until the park closed and later.  We live in Southern California but I didn't want to drive home that late.  I wanted a hotel that the boys could walk back to, so that I didn't have to stay up until 1 a.m.   This hotel is a tiny hotel sitting among the giant hotels on Harbor Blvd.  It is right across the street from the main Disneyland pedestrian walk to cross Harbor Blvd.  It is an older style hotel/motel  where the parking is directly in front of the door.   The last time I stayed at this older style of hotel in another state, I was very disapointed, but this hotel made such an effort to stand out from the other hotels in town, I was impressed.  The pool was so refreshing after a day at the hot park and

Before I arrived at the Park Vue I had reservations about whether or not it would be any good. However, it was an excellent choice. It is literally right across the street from the main gate, the closest hotel you could be in. Closer than the Paradise Pier or Disneyland Hotel. Welcome letter, fruit basket, and complimentary bottle of wine/apple cider. The free breakfast was supposed to be continental but included bacon, sausage, waffles, eggs, etc. Excellent breakfast. Also had free cookies, water, and apples in the lobby (didn't dicover this until 3rd day - too bad!). We found the hotel quiet and the only thing that woke me up was the fireworks from Disney the first night! Hotel is very clean and the pool was nice. Kids loved it.  This hotel is well priced ($120 per night). It

Summary Heading: This is the hotel we'll stay at year after year.
Summary: Great location, right across the street from the main entrance of Disneyland.  Loved the complimentary breakfast.  Plenty of variety and we got to make our own waffles.  The beds were the most comfortable we have ever had at a hotel.  Sleep soundly and didn't wake up sore.  The only negative was the carpet in our room was filthy.  It left our feet black.  We had to wear our shoes in the room.

Summary Heading: Great Place, Great Price, Amazing Customer Service
Summary: Just stayed here last week for our quick trip to Disneyland. The location is amazing, literally walk out your front door and across the street into the park. I can't say enough about the customer service. Every single employee that we saw or walked by would stop to ask if we needed anything. It was just refreshing to have such awesome customer service. The hotel itself is really a motel 6 type place that has been upgraded. On first view, there's nothing special. Here is what makes it special, warm cookies and cold waters at check in, free parking, free wifi, free breakfast, social hour with things like nachos and cheese enchiladas, a basket delivered to your room with fruit, water, and wine, and just flat out amazing service. We were actually laughing at how amazing it was. We

Summary Heading: Great hotel for trips to the Disney Parks
Summary: We always stay here for Disneyland trips. It is directly across from entrance to the parks. Easy stroller walk. The front desk is very accomodating. They allowed us to get our parking pass early in the morning so we could head over to Disneyland while waiting for check in time. I must have mentioned my son's birthday to the front desk. My 4-yr old was excited to find birthday balloons and a gift when we returned to the room. My husband and I were excited to receive a gift basket as well. Fruit, water and wine were a perfect ending to the day. The room was clean and comfortable, the breakfast was good, the pool was heated.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel at a Great Rate
Summary: We have stayed at the Park Vue several times in the last 2 years.  Its a family affair. We go with my brother and his wife and many times we both bring grandchildren.  The rooms are always clean and welcoming.  The breakfast has something for everyone from fresh fruit to make your own waffles.  They recently added "social hour" 5-7pm.   The kids love the pool.   The staff is the best.  They are very courteous and helpful whether making reservations over the phone or answering questions at the desk. They bake  wonderful "goodies" that greet you when you check-in. I have recommended it to friends who now sing Park Vue praises.

We have stayed at this hotel several times.  It is as close as you can get to the Disney parks and you can't find a nicer place for the money.  The rooms are very clean and decorated nicely and each has a refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot.  The beds and pillows are comfortable and they offer several types of rooms and suites.  The family suites are really convenient if you have 5 or 6 in your family.  The hotel has a plentiful breakfast with hot and cold food to get your day off to a great start, and they even have hospitality time in the early evening where they have soup, salad, and foods like nachos, chicken nuggets, or mac and cheese.  Parking is free and the staff is polite, helpful and friendly.  This hotel gets two thumbs up and I would recommend it very highly!

Summary Heading: Would stay at this Inn over and over.
Summary: I found this Inn to be clean, and comfortable.  The staff were very friendly.  To not have to pay for parking was a big Plus.  Two years ago we stayed three blocks from the Park Vue INN and we had to pay $20 a night for parking.  At the INN we had a nice breakfast everyday and a nice light /dinner every evening. FREE.  Fun and clean swimming pool.  I was very impressed.  For the money we paid I was also very grateful to the INN for being so generous.  We would stay there again for sure!

Summary Heading: Another great stay at The Park Vue
Summary: This is always our first choice for a hotel when visiting Disneyland.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The rooms are well maintained. We have found the queen/bunk bed room to be quite small,  but the two queen rooms are very comfortable. This was our first trip they offered the deluxe breakfast and we enjoyed it very much.  The free wifi was a big plus too.    We look forward to staying there again in October!

Summary Heading: Excellent Vacations,, right in front Disney
Summary: Very Clean. quite enough (on second floor), Breakfast and social evenings included.

I've stayed at 4 stars, and get, perhaps, a larger room. Extras (variety of pillows, massage, immediate service,...) always come at a price which never equals out when you do a value analysis. Sometimes, you just want the extra comforts and willing to pay.   To be honest, I like the cheaper places if for no other reason, they offer cable tv that city residents get verses the 20 channels and pay movies and self promoting channels the beg name hotels offer. The cheap hotels will not get you suites with fine art, bathrooms the size of many peoples 3rd bedrooms, and many times I must suffer through a bad night since they are - horrible.  Not so with the Park  Vue. My family visits Disneyland about 2-4 times per year for 10 years and we've stayed at a variety of the big hotels

Summary Heading: So Very HAPPY with the Park Vue Inn
Summary: When I was looking for a hotel I had four things in mind,  1-close to Disney, 2-free breakfast,  3 internet  4 a price in the family budget range.  The Park Vue Inn surpasses all four.  Its right beside the main Disney crosswalk – no hotel is closer, the free breakfast was awesome, I am in total agreement with the last few reviews. Internet is free which I use daily to keep me posted on life back home with my emails and sports scores, and the room rates are the same as the other hotels that I used on my other visits here. Sadly this is my third time in four years to Disneyland, so I don’t think I’ll be back next summer, but when I do make it back, I’ll be staying with my friends at the Park Vue Inn.

We love the Park Vue Inn, The room with a queen and bunk beds works perfectly for our family of four. A hot breakfast is available as well as free soup and salad in the evening. This hotel is literally right across the street from Disney with free parking. You just can't beat this value!

This is our favorite place to stay when we go to Disneyland.  It's right across the street from Disneyland, which is perfect for us and our kids. The continental breakfast is amazing!  They have a huge variety of food, it tastes great, and there's plenty of it.  The rooms are comfortable, and very nice.  They have fresh cookies in the afternoon, which we love.  The staff has always been friendly and helpful when we've had questions or issues that have needed to be resolved.  We have enough children that we need a suite whenever we go to a hotel, and the suites here are perfect for us and are a reasonable price.  Next time we go to Disneyland, or anywhere in that area, this is the place where we'll stay.

Summary Heading: Great hotel with an amazing location
Summary: My room was clean, nicely appointed, and has an amazing location right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland. My room also had something not very many hotels offer-abundant lighting.   They provided a lovely gift basket, have a tasty breakfast and during the day have bottled water and fresh cookies in the lobby.  My room also had a jacuzzi bathtub and after walking Disneyland for 12 hours the soak melted all my aches away.  As an annual pass holder at Disneyland and a frequent visitor I can say I will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Location, free parking and amenities galore!
Summary: We have stayed here in the past and this trip was only that much better.  The deluxe continental breakfast now includes hot selections.  The social hour had different dishes each night - pasta, hotdogs, nachos...great after a long day at the park.  The welcome basket was such a nice surprise with wine, fruit and water. We did have a shopping day planned and the lovely ladies at the front desk printed out maps and directions to my daughters' favorite stores.  They definitely made it a breeze with any area questions that we had. Much of our family booked directly with Disney and stayed a couple of doors up the road, but were so surprised at our location and our above-average room size that they will be booking Park Vue Inn on their trips next year!...as will we!!! Thanks Park Vue

Summary Heading: If all you are looking for is a place to sleep while visiting Disneyland, this is a great option!
Summary: Overall, I would say that this is an excellent "no-frills" hotel, and the price can't be beat given it's proximity to Disneyland.  Clean, friendly staff (tho' we didn't interact with them much),  and a much better than average breakfast.  The welcoming basket of sparkling apple cider and fresh fruit was a nice touch.  The room we stayed in was *small*, but since we weren't there much, the space was perfectly adequate.  Beds were comfortable, and the bunk beds were a hit!  More hotels should offer that option.  Of course, there are a few negatives.  We were completely unable to access the wi-fi in our room, and the bath towels were coarse and unpleasant.  Noise was a bit of a problem - but mostly because we were on the 2nd floor near the breakfast area, and the crowds of people

Summary Heading: Great hotel, awesome location, free food!
Summary: Just got back from Disneyland and stayed at the Park Vue Inn. I have stayed at alot of the hotels on the strip and even The Disneyland Hotel, and this one has been my favourite by far! It is directly across from the crosswalk to get to the park, and is right beside the IHOP for those late night snacks. The rooms were clean, and the staff was extremely friendly. You got an awesome free breakfast with bacon, sausage, waffles, bagels, juice, biscuits, gravy, cereal, toast, hashbrowns.... and then every evening from 5-7 there was social hour with free juice, coffee, salad, pasta, soup, and one night was nachos. This saved a ton of money because we would usually just have that as our dinner. We would come back around dinner every night to the lobby and there was free cold water

Summary Heading: Couldn't be more convenient for Disneyland
Summary: Directly across the road from the park entrance; you couldn't really ask for more.  Well if you do, how about an IHOP right next door!  Perfectly convenient if you are meeting friends for breakfast who are staying elsewhere.  Their sun deck is a wonderful spot to watch the nightly Disney fireworks as well.  I had a King size with a Jacuzzi tub for it was the only room left when I made my reservation.  Quite comfortable though.  My room was at the back of the property so it was quite quiet as well.  Had a nice welcome basket waiting for me in the room which had water, fruit, and a bottle of sparkling cider; what a pleasant surprise!  Service was extremely friendly.  They even allowed me to leave my vehicle parked there after I checked out while I spent the day at the park.  Just

Love this hotel. Stayed at this hotel many times over the years.  Always enjoyed the customer service and the staff very accomodating. Right across the street from Disneyland.  The rooms and pool are clean. They added a "social dinner hour" at no cost as well as a full breakfast.  Not bad at all.  Saves you a little money.  My teenager had a birthday while we were there and I had reserved the "birthday special" on line.  Well worth it! Gave her balloons and a cake and a small gift.  Cake was red velvet and ice cream.  The thing that keeps me coming back is the "Welcome  Basket" and nice letter in my room.  Rates also are really reasonsble  and they let you park 2 cars.  Again, love this hotel!!

For our family Disneyland road-trip we decided to stay at the Park Vue Inn because we we had heard that it isn't fancy, but the proximity to Disneyland was worth it.  It is literally right across the street and that was the best thing about the hotel.  Because we were coming from Oregon and driving all night I called a few days before to inquire about an early check-in.  I was told that if there was someone in the room that may not be possible, but we could park our vehicle in the parking lot and head to Disneyland and check in to the room when we returned.  We arrived at 9 am after driving 16 hours and were pretty tired.  Of course our room wasn't ready and the normal check in time was anytime after 3.  We paid for our room and took care of all the paper work and let them know

Summary Heading: Great motel for Disneyland trip with some pleasant surprises
Summary: Stayed for two nights for our disneyland trip. Everything about our stay was positive and we were very happy with everything. We were surprised by the fruit and wine welcome basket in our room, the very varied breakfast and the 'social hour' tea served between 5pm to 7pm every evening. Free cookies, cold water and apples at the reception. We came in and out of disney two times during the day for a quick refresh and to avoid Disney's high food and drinks costs. The swimming pool and jacuzzi was great.

This was our third visit to the Park Vue inn.  We have loved our stay every time.  Our room was clean and comfortable and we were not bothered by any noise from other guests.  The parking is free.  They have expanded the breakfast since our last visit.  They now have several hot items--bacon, sausauge, hash browns, eggs, ect.  The location is excellent!!  After a long day a Disneyland, it's nice to be so close to the main entrance.  We enjoyed having the fridge and micro in the room to help save on food costs.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  We have reccomended this hotel to many family and friends and we will continue to do so.  We are planning on a Disneyland trip in 2013, and we will be staying at the Park Vue Inn.

Park Vue Inn is the place to stay if you are visiting Disneyland. Located directly across the street from the entrance, Park Vue offers a fantastic value for your dollar, fabulous customer service, beautiful rooms, and delicious food. We won't stay anywhere else from now on!

This hotel is directly across the street from the entrance to Disneyland.  It was much better than waiting for a tram or charter bus to take us to a hotel, instead, we just went across the street.  I have stayed at places with the trams and they are crowded and have long lines, it was great to avoid.  Besides the location, the ParkVue has so many perks.  We were greated by friendly staff, were sent a gift basket to welcome us (filled with water, sparkling cider and fruit), and enjoyed freshly baked cookies and water every evening when we returned from the park.  Not to mention the breakfast.  It said it was continental, but really, everyday they had bacon, sausage, waffles, ceral, donuts, pastries, bagels, toast, and a variety of other foods that varied from day to day

Summary Heading: Location is great for families with children
Summary: We were very satisfied with the room and beds.  We have stayed in another hotel in the area and the beds were hard and uncomfortable, however these beds were extremely comfortable.  The free breakfast and social hour are well worth it and better than most.

We really enjoyed our stay at Park Vue Inn in Anaheim. Very friendly staff. Best part was getting breakfast tickets so that we could eat and go to Disneyland without having to make a side trip or spend a lot at the park. The happy hour tickets came in handy, too. Would definitely recommend staying here, especially with children!
Manager Response: Dear Heyqlk, We just wanted to thank you for your kind words. Our staff beams with pride when we review our positive Guest comments. The social hour is something new that we're trying this summer. We're glad you liked it. We are very much looking forward to your next stay with us!  Paul Durand, CEO Scalzo Hospitality, Inc

Summary: We just recently returned from a three day stay at the Park Vue and were pleasantly surprised!  I am a frequent traveler to Disneyland and have stayed at a number of hotels in the area.  My preference has been the Candy Cane Inn but now it is the Park Vue!  Yes, it is an older hotel but it is very clean.  We stayed in a room with a queen bed and bunk beds--it was too small for the four of us.  No where to lounge or hang out in the room.  But, the room was clean and ready for us.  The room had plenty of towels, a microwave, refrigerator and an efficient A/C.  We were on the second floor so we didn't hear anyone else during the stay.  There are signs all over the property reminding people to be quiet and respectful of others!  In fact, one item we got a kick out of was a note in

Summary Heading: If you are looking for a nice, clean and...
Summary: If you are looking for a nice, clean and extremely convenient location to stay while visiting Disneyland, this is the place.  If you are the type of traveler that MUST stay at only the finest accommodations available, stay at the Grand Californian, on the Disney property. If, however, you only plan to be in your room to sleep, save your money. Stay at the Park Vue Inn. The staff is friendly, the hotel is directly across the street from the entrance to the Disney Parks, and if you don't wasn't the included breakfast, Dennys is next door, and they share a parking lot with IHOP.

Summary Heading: Great location, super clean, older motel style accommodation
Summary: I read the reviews on this hotel prior to my trip and wasn't sure it was the right choice. I find it difficult to knock after my 3 night stay. I normally spend $250/night at 4 star plus accommodation, but wasn't willing to part with $400 plus at a Disney Resort Hotel.  Yes this is a 40+ year old motel that has been renovated several times. Textured walls and ceiling, 80's green carpet, newer crown mouldings and new stone countertop in the bathroom that seems out of place with the 25 year old tiles on the floor and around the tub. The location is right across the street from the Disneyland entrance; very convenient.  The clientele is average America, which took some getting use to (again we normally stay at 4 plus star hotels). I felt safe here. The staff worked very hard to make

Summary Heading: Brilliant hotel, great location, price and service
Summary: This was our second stay at the Park Vue and I would stay here everytime. The location is perfect. The rooms very clean with changes of bedding and towels every day. All of the staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfast is very nice although it does get crowded. Loved the free warm cookies and iced water on an afternoon. I wish all hotels were like the Park Vue. 10/10 on everything.

We stayed here for 5 nights while visiting Disneyland.  Entrance is just across the street "literally".  We stayed in room 248, a family suite.  Large, clean, refrigerator, microwave, room safe.  Breakfast was very good, included hot items such as eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles along with pastries,cereals, etc.    Check-in was very quick, pool was very nice, and an excellent value for Disneyland Lodging.

Summary Heading: Clean, GREAT location, and breakfast too!
Summary: Stayed there for the 1st time with my two teenage children.  Room worked out great for us ... bunk beds for the kids and a queen bed for me.  Buffet breakfast was good, eggs, ham, bacon, biscuits and gravy...and a variety of cereal, fruits, and beverages.  Location is directly across the street from both parks, and they have a very nice outside area for viewing the fireworks perfectly.  I was able to get the room for 3 nights PLUS a 5 day hopper for all of us for under what it would had cost separately.  Overall, I would not hesitate again to book my trip again at this hotel....the staff was very helpful and friendly too!

Summary Heading: You couldn't get much closer to the park, such a great value.
Summary: I recently went to California to visit Disneyland.   Before booking I read all the recent reviews on trip advisor and picked this hotel hoping for the best.   I wanted to be a quick walking distance from the parks.   The hotel is literally right across the street from the parks a 5 minute walk.  We booked a deluxe king room with a jacuzzi tub for 2 nights.  This room was located in the back corner of the hotel and it was very quiet.  The room was beautiful with a full bathroom and an additional sink.  There was also a fridge and microwave.  When we arrived a basket of fruit and wine was delivered to welcome us.  The jacuzzi tub was so fun and just what the doctor ordered after spending hours in the parks.  The breakfast was plentiful.  We arrived prior to check in and we were

The best feature of this hotel is the location; the place is so close to DL it is not even funny. Maybe a 2-3 min walk to the front gates depending on how long you have to wait to cross the street and how many people are in the bag check line. Being this close to the park is very convenient to go back to your room in the middle of the day to cool off or rest up without wasting too much time waiting for a shuttle or on a long walk back to your room.  The pool was a decent size and 9 feet deep plenty of towels and a Jacuzzi. I thought the rooms were very nice for what we paid; it looked as if the bathroom was recently remodeled and we had a new fridge and microwave.  Every employee that we came in contact was very nice and accommodating with requests for extra towels etc.  The

Summary Heading: Your not just another customer, I felt very welcome
Summary: It's the small touches the hotel offers that make it a welcome place to stay. There are alot of hotels right across the street from Disneyland with alot of people going to and from the attractions, but Park Vue Inn does not make you feel like your are just another customer they make it a point to send a welcome letter and fruit basket with wine ( for non alcoholic drinkers) they will exchange your wine for apple cider or bottled water.  The free breakfast had a large variety of selections, We were even offered dinner,  just another idea the hotel is trying to give more value for the money.  i hope more of the guest take advantage of this service.

Location was as advertise-across the street from Disneyland's main entrance.  We loved the welcome fruit and wine basket upon arrival. The complimentary breakfast included many items not usually found at other hotels...bacon, sausage, eggs and waffles. We didn't know if we were entering the park our first day, so we did not buy hopper passes in advance. It was very convenient to purchase the hoppers passes in the lobby of the hotel.  Clean rooms, great value.

Summary Heading: Visiting Disneyland you must stay at...
Summary: ...the Park Vue.  The hotel is 60 seconds outside the front gate of Disneyland.  Although the hotel offers it's own "free" buffet breakfast in the morning (which is sufficient) the hotel is sandwiched inbetween a Denny's and a IHOP is you're in need of something more.  The staff at the hotel are very helpful.  The cleaning is very efficient.  Rest assured your room will be clean when you return from the park by the afternoon if you need a little rest.  We've stayed at the Park Vue the last three times we visited Disney and our last visit in June they made quite a few upgrades to the lobby, the rooms and the breakfast buffet.  Well worth the stay while enjoying the happiest place on earth.

Summary Heading: It's the little touches that make your stay fabulous
Summary: Welcome letter and basket upon arrival to hotel; water, apples, and cookies in the evening;  hot continental breakfast and appetizers in the evening, these are the things that make this inn a great place to stay. Prefect location right across the entrance from Disneyland and a nice selection of restaurants in walking distance. The staff is friendly and helpful and rooms are clean and comfortable. Pool area is nice and towels are readily available. Lots of different room configurations, even has rooms with bunk beds. Of course it could be updated and the noise does carry. It could really use an elevator but overall great stay and will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great location, great price, great hotel!
Summary: This was a first time visit to Disneyland for us and we only had the one day.  This hotel helped make our stay enjoyable!  Met my brother, sister-in-law and 4-yr-old niece there.  The room we got was big enough for each of us to have our own bed and cost less than many others.  The welcome basket was a wonderful surprise - the fresh fruit went into our bags for the next day at Disneyland!  We were able to watch the fireworks from their terrace without having to go into the park.  The breakfast was great - waffles, eggs, bacon, cereal, bagels, fresh fruit, yogurt, etc.  Way more than we were expecting!  Being able to park our car there and walk to the park even after having checked out in the morning was fantastic!!  This hotel really is the closest to the park!!  My brother has

Summary Heading: The only place to stay when visiting Disneyland.
Summary: Love staying at the Park Vue Inn.  I have been staying here for the past several years when I visit Disneyland.  Location is perfect. You're only a couple 100 yards away and you're there.  Can't wait to stay there again.  The staff is great.  They always make you feel special.

Summary Heading: Great location and quality for a Disneyland visit
Summary: Very enjoyable stay for our first family trip to Disneyland. Location was ideal, virtually across the road from main gate. Room was comfortable, clean and all we needed for our requirements. Plenty of eating options nearby and a reasonable breakfast available for guests at the hotel. Our kids also loved the pool and being able to see fireworks from the balcony. The "Welcome Basket" was another nice touch too.

We stayed at the Park Vue for 5 nights while we were in Anaheim.  It is literally right across from the park entrance, so access to Disneyland was a breeze.  We often came back in the middle of the day for lunch or just a break from the parks.  The room was very clean but TINY. The kids each had their own bed, though, so no fighting at bedtime about stealing covers or wandering legs/arms etc.  The room had a fridge and a microwave, so we could keep things to make lunches.  The breakfast was good... eggs, bacon, waffles, cereal etc. but on a couple days it was so busy that there weren't chairs for everyone to sit in.  Going early is better (breakfast is from 7-10, so if you have early entry to the park, you either choose breakfast or the park.)  For the most part, the hotel was

Summary Heading: Great little hotel across street from Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is directly across the street from the Disneyland resort just a 5 minute walk away. It's actually a shorter walk to Disneyland then from it's own hotels and only about $150 per night is a relatively great deal. Not many rooms so make your reservations in advance. Have to wait until 3pm to check in to room but is OK while spending morning in the resort and coming back to hotel in afternoon for a rest. Complimentary apples, water bottles, internet access, and breakfasts are awesome.

We had a group of ten when we stayed at the Park Vue in May. (3 rooms) The breakfast was amazing and was so much more than any other free breakfast that I have had any any of the other hotels we have stayed at.  We had the suite and had plenty of room and saved lots of money cooking in our room and the maids even washed our dishes!  The only problem that we had is that we had specifically requested rooms on the main floor and wanted the rooms as close as we could have to each other, unfortunetly they had to put us on the upper floor instead of the ground floor and it was a little difficult getting a baby stoller down the stairs every morning, other than that we had no complaints.    The location of this hotel is fantastic, right across from the main gates!! It took us less than

This hotel is LITERALLY across the street from the Disneyland Resort.  The walk from the front gates of Disney to our hotel is no longer than the walk to some of the resort hotels!  The breakfast was AMAZING, hot fresh, tasty and a great variety!  We stayed in a 2 room suite so the kids could head to bed early in their room and we could stay up later:)  The staff was SO helpful and amazing and nice!  Megan, at the front desk, was SO helpful in setting up our shuttle back to the airport for us.  She didn't even hesitate to help!  It made for such a relaxing stay!  The beds were super comfortable.  Housekeeping replaced all new towels and took out trash for us every day and even set up our girls stuffed animals on their bed in a cute way after making the bed:)  We were nothing but

This was our second stay at Park Vue Inn and I only have positive things say.  It's right across the street from the Disney intrance, it's clean, has reasonable rates and a great breakfast to start your day.  We stayed on the 4th of July and had a great view of the fireworks from the hotel balcony.  Great place for a family to stay that will be taking in the Disney parks.

Summary Heading: 2nd stay in 3 years and I will go back again, Loved IT !
Summary: This is our 2nd stay at Park Vue - we stayed for 5 nights. The location is the best, as it is the closest to the parks. We arrived about 3 hours early to check in time and we got our room right away and free parking. The breakfast is everything you could want - the only thing I would change would be to start it an hour earlier at 6 a.m. - for those early magic entry days. The breakfast alone saved us $40-$50 a day. Our room was comfortable and had a microwave,fridge,iron...everything needed. We were greeted with a wine/fruit basket ! There is a Coldstone on the property - which we loved. The pool and hot tub worked out great. I think the people who rated this hotel poorly should stay at 5 stars from now on and pay 3-4 times more - we had no problem. We can't wait to go to

Have stayed at many hotels in the Disneyland area, both on Disney property and off.  There were about 10 people in our group (kids, too).  Beds were very comfy.  Service was great.  A good value for our money.  We've spent much more and gotten awful service.  Breakfast was a plus, too.  Lots of variety to choose from, although can be busy at times with people loading up before heading over to Disney.  It literally is right there at the crosswalk to go over to Disney.  IHOP is in the parking lot, another plus.  And the Cold Stone on property got lots of our business!  I liked it that the Park Vue has only two stories.   Other hotels in the area had many floors and with kids six and under,  that was a concern.  The kids liked the pool, too.  We'll definitely be staying here next

Summary Heading: Great Value for your Money and Family Friendly
Summary: This Inn is directly across from the Bus entrance to Disneyland.  The staff, rooms and service are amazing.   The breakfast is a full breakfast.  We stayed in two of the family suites and loved them both.  Beds are really comfortable and in one room there was even a stove to cook if wanted.   Youe definately would not go wrong if you choose this Inn.   We ourselves will definately stay there again.

We were very impressed with Park Vue inn.  We had stayed at the Grand California Hotel and spa last year, and loved it. The grand Hall is amazing, but the rooms are very small. For a quarter of what you pay to stay at the GC you can stay here with bigger rooms, and the location is the same distance from the GC to Disneyland as PVI is to the entance of DL. Will stay here again, and again.

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn prior to the renovation and it was good then.  Now it seemed even better.  The rooms were clean service was exceptional all employees were friendly and courteous.  The welcome basket was enjoyed by my wife, myself and our two grand children.  There were more selections with the breakfast buffet.  The kids totally enjoyed the freshly baked cookies in the lobby daily.  Last but not least the pool was very clean and the temperature of the water was good, not too hot not too cold.  Thank you, Park Vue Inn  The Ruggiero's

Summary Heading: If you like your sleep go somewhere else, very noisy
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights to visit Disnneyland etc. On a positive note the hotel is right opposite the main gate to Disneyland and the Calafornia Adventure Park. This allows you to easily go back to the room when you have had enough and return later in the afternoon.  The complimentary fruit basket and wine is a nice gesture, but the wine is a very rough red, could not drink it. Take up the option of exchanging it for a bottle of apple cider. The breakfast was ordinary not much choice but its the old adage you get what you pay for.  We had a downstairs room which was for the disabled (although we are not in this category) it was right next to the laundry where the hotel did its towels etc. We arrived about 2.30 PM and it was in full swing and the noise inside the room was

Summary Heading: Great hotel for seeing Disneyland, great location.
Summary: My teenagers and I headed to Disneyland and couldn't get into our usual hotel next to Disneyland, so we found the ParkVue Inn. When we arrived we were all pleasantly surprised. It was even closer than our other favorite. (Disneyland was directly across the street from our parking lot, and was within walking distance, even for the smallest child. Can't get any closer). Pool was relaxing-not crowded, breakfast was very satisfying with lots of choices. (Not just continental) rooms were satisfactory, clean, and comfortable. The only downfall with the rooms, was the noise from the neighbors room. After realizing that they were so noisy in the morning, we were much quieter in the evening, after returning from Disney. All was well when we figured out they were morning people, and we

We, grandparents, sons, daughter and grandchildren, stayed at the Park Vue Inn 6/24 through 6/27.  Everything at the Inn was outstanding...we can't say enough!  The folks at check-in are friendly and very professional, and the rooms are well equipped and comfortable.  The welcome fruit basket in each of our three rooms was an unexpected treat, as were the warm chocolate chip cookies in the reception area.  The included breakfast was excellent and saved us a lot of money with six adults and four children.  Each day had something a little different along with the standards, and it was all very fresh.  As far as access to Disneyland, the Park Vue can't be beat unless you stay on the property.  We've stayed in five other hotels nearby but will never stay anywhere else.  Thank you

After arriving back from the day at Disneyland, I was greeted by 2 cockroaches at least 2-3 inches long and asked to be moved to another room in a different building.  I was told that those weren't cockroaches but "Palm Bugs" and that I could look it up on the internet, which I did and found something that looked totally different than what I had seen.
