(very small and green).  I totally packed up all of our stuff at midnight and moved to a different hotel 2 blocks away, documenting the reason and requesting a refund for the night's lodging. Moving at 1am and then trying to feel comfortable anywhere else left me crying and then by 2 am laughing just to deal with the stress.  I never did receive credit back to my credit card, even after over 10 phone calls, 10 or more emails, and

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn for our three days at Disneyland.  We could not have been happier with our choice.  The hotel was a hop, skip, and jump away from the main gates to both parks....very easy to walk and also return to the room anytime we needed to.  We loved the breakfast each morning...great selection and good food...plenty of seating as well.  Lots of available parking as well.  Staff was very nice, rooms were great.  Beds were comfy.  I highly recommend the Park Vue Inn.

Summary Heading: nice location, clean, exxcellent breakfast buffet
Summary: Our room was downstairs and we heard every step the people above us made.Other than that it was quiet. Very pretty with plants and palmtrees. The free breakfast was amazing. Hot food, eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits and gravy, crepes, pancakes, danish, donuts, muffins, a machine to make your own waffles - nice and fresh that way-  fresh fruit consisting of cantalope, honeydew, grapes, oranges.  Also whole apples and bananas, yogurt, boiled eggs, bread to make toast. Cereal, oatmeal, coffee, tea, milk/choc. milk, juices.  I'm sure I'm forgetting something, there was so much.  Also when we checked in the desk had bottles of ice cold water, apples and choc. chip cookies.  We will always stay here when we visit Disneyland.

Can't beat being across the street from the main entrance. Takes 5 minutes to walk to the main entrance. Great that the hotel had small fridge. Rooms were spacious. Breakfast included was decent. IHOP is right next door (kids eat free after 4pm). Fitness room was disappointing- just a couple of cardio machines (like I need cardio after walking around Disney).

This hotel is great!  Park Vue Inn is all about service and quality.  The staff was extremely helpful; the room very clean, classy and quiet; and the location... perfectly across the street from Disneyland.  WE LOVED EVERYTHING ABOUT PARK VUE INN!  We checked in at 9:00 am and although it was too early to get a room, we bought our tickets to Disneyland from in the hotel lobby and were allowed to park in the hotel parking lot.  We arrived back at the hotel at 11:00 pm after spending the day in Disneyland, and got our room.  It was a classy and very clean room.  The basket of fruit topped everything off.  We only wish we were able to stay longer. WE WILL BE GOING BACK TO PARK VUE INN!

Summary Heading: Excellent Location!  Great Service!  Clean Rooms!  Will stay again and again!
Summary: I have stayed at the Park Vue Inn at least 10 times in the past 2 years.  It is our Disneyland hotel of choice.  The service is always friendly.  The rooms are a bit datd but clean every time.  The Suites are perfect for a long stay (though often hard to get).  The breakfast has been improved over the last few years.  It used to be almost all carbs, little fruit, and not very exciting for a long stay.  But now, the owners have taken suggestions and there is make your own waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, juices, coffee, pastries and bagels, and more.  Even more fruit choices.  At our last trip there was fresh cut fruit!  The only upgrade I would make is that the rooms aren't dark enough at night (a lot of light seeps in over the blinds - I end up using towel to block the

Things I liked:  free fresh cookies, fruit and bottled water at check-in, gift basket with fruit and a bottle of wine was waiting in room along with a personalized welcome sheet, across street from main entrance to Disney, next door or close to IHOP, Cold Stone, Tony Romas, McDonalds, courteous staff, clean rooms, good price compared to Disney Hotels, which, IMHO are just another way for Disney to suck every penny they can out of you. Refrig, hair dryer and microwave, programmable safe were in room. Things I did not like:  small room, bunk beds did not have good handles so was always scared the kids would fall off,  complementary breakfast was just OK, did not see TV channel guide in room and when using the channel button on remote, it would skip channels so you would have to

My sister, my daughter and myself travel several times during the year, together. We enjoy the Southern California area and especially Disneyland.  My sister and myself were priviledged to attend the Original opening of the Disneyland Park accompanying our Mother and Grandmother, yes way back in 1955!! Now that we are confirmed Disney-holics, our trips are frequent. A year or so ago we discovered the Park Vue, while crossing the street "directly across from the Disney Park".  We checked it out and quickly made reservations. Now we ALWAYS stay at The Park Vue. The location is not  the easiest  convience of this comfortable place. From the Lobby and most personable people you could encounter to the yummy breakfast (Included in your room price) Everything in between is just what

Absolutely love this hotel.  We have stayed here twice while visiting Disneyland and would recommend it highly.  The staff are superb.  Anything we needed they accommodated us.  The continental breakfast was excellent and had alot of selection.  My grandsons loved the waffles.  Would like to see lids for the cups since we took our food back down to our room.  We watched the fireworks from your balcony a couple of nights and that was alot of fun.  The only one thing negative is that in the morning, there was not alot of hot water.  In the evening though it was very hot.  Thank you Park Vue.  Will definately stay with you each and every time.

Summary Heading: Disneyland right accross street. Excellent value. Excellent service.
Summary: I hate to write this review as positive, because more people will be staying here, and I may not be able to get a reservation next time. We have stayed at a couple other hotels next to Disneyland, also at the Disneyland Hotel. This is the third time we have stayed here and it was the best. There is a hot tub by the outdoor pool that was great. The free breakfast is excellent  for starting the day. The rooms are older, but clean. It is not the newest hotel around, but is great at what it does. Beds are comfortable. Towels could be better....If you are a hotel snob then do not stay here, if you want to be at the closest hotel to Disneyland, then this is your place. Parking is plentiful. For the price and location you will not find a better place to stay.

The  complaints I have is there is no elevator to the second floor and I had to have my key reset 4 times in 2 days.  The room was clean, beds comfy. the room layout was perfect.  Breakfast was great (for a complimentary).  Location was sooo close to Disneyland.  I was impressed. I would recommend this motel for anyone staying at Disneyland.  We stayed in the dbl queen suite with pull out sofa.  It had a full Kitchen set up.  We could see the fireworks from the pool.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel accross the street from Disneyland
Summary: This hotel offers a wonderful free breakfast buffet that includes make-your-own waffles!  The kids loved that!  The rooms are clean and the beds are pillow-top and  very comfortable.  The staff are very friendly and helpful.  You get a 10% discount at Stone Cold Creamery located right at the hotel.  It is the closest hotel to the intersection crossing over to Disneyland.  You can't get any closer than that!  We are already recommending this to friends!  We will always stay here in the future on trips to Disneyland.

Booked online last minute for one night. Chose this hotel for its location. It's driveway is literally right next to the crosswalk to get in the the main entrance to Disneyland. You know that IHOP? It's the hotel on the right. They let us check in and park our car (free parking) while we went to Dland in the early am (our room wouldn't be ready until 2pm) Had the single king /jacuzzi. The room was terrific. Huge, clean, modern, great a/c, fridge AND microwave (so convenient) and last but not least, the jacuzzi... so perfect after a late long day of walking around the parks. The pool and hot tub were clean and great temperatures. Shortly after check in, we received a gift basket thanking us for chosing their hotel which contained a variety of whole fresh fruit, bottled water &

First time staying at this hotel. We were impressed with the service the moment we checked in.   Check in/Service: Quick and easy.  They offered water, cookies and fruit at the counter upon check in. After about 15 min in the room, they called to ask if everything was satisfactory. VERY NICE touch! There is a free continental breakfast with hot food that was great. The first day we ate at IHOP but quickly realized it wasn't worth the price (considerably more expensive then your neighborhood IHOP for sure) and stayed in the next day.  Room: Our room was small but I expected that. Next time we will do the suite. The bunk bed was really neat for the kids and loved  that all the "needed items" (microwave, frig, etc) were still available in a small space. The hotel left a nice

This was the perfect family hotel. Right across the street from Disneyland entrance. Dining places right next door so you can eat outside the park, saving $$. Hotel stay included a hot breakfast every morning with waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage. Also had yogurt and fruit and cereals. Was cheaper than most of the hotels. We rented 2 rooms and they were able to keep us next to each other. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They help us arrange our shuttle back to LAX. Great place.

Great staff, very willing to help, clean, well-kept rooms.  No frills, but excellent location to Disneyland.  Breakfast staff hard-working and keeps complimentary breakfast well-stocked.  If you take advantage of the breakfast, BE SURE TO TIP THE WORKERS!!!  They deserve it.  Some families just eat and leave, without tipping.  So many families utilize the breakfast feature, imagine if every family tipped just $1 per morning, this would definitely make their day!!

We have been to Disneyland eight times before as a family of four and stayed at many of the popular and more pricey hotels in the area. This time is was only myself and my adult daughter traveling (6 nights). I decided I wanted a place as close as possible to Disneyland, then read through the hotel comments on Trip Advisor.  Park Vue Inn exceeded our expectations.  Our room had 2 queen beds, a flat screen TV, the sink was outside the bathroom, a mini fridge, microwave, coffee machine which included hot chocolate and tea, and the room was quite spacious. It was not overly fancy (the same as most hotels in the area) but the beds and bedding were very comfortable and clean.  We had requested a quiet room on the second floor when booking and they accommodated us. The price was

Arriving from a long trip, to a hotel that didn't have my room ready wasn't as bad as waiting in the lobby with a front desk clerk who was very rude(Arlene)  she had NO professionalism in what she did very BAD looking to top it off.  I can say our trip got better when we finally got our room, we were surprised with a welcome basket, very pleasant. I couldn't be happier with the location of our hotel right across from disneyland which was convinient to my son and I.  Can I say breakfast was wonderful, everything we can ask for, besides the arrival issue my stay was marvelous at the ParkVueInn.  I would recommend it anybody visiting Disneyland. I will be here next trip to disneyland.

Upon arriving in our room the Crib was already set up for baby and we were greated with a lovely basket of goodies.  Location was just a short walk across street from Disneyland.  Beds were the most comfortable we have slept in at a hotel in a long time.    The daily breakfast was very nice and a good selection offered.

I was glad to see that this hotel no longer uses the bedspreads they show on their websites, but uses the 3 sheet bedding instead. We were happy with just about everything; the only thing being that there was a bit of a bad odor in the room that the maids obvsiouly had tried to get rid of using different chemicals and leaving the fans on. Apart from that everything else was as clean as possible. The breakfast is similar to that which you get in Holiday Inn, but we were happy.

I have stayed at Park Vue with my family many times and have never been disappointed. The rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable, and you cant beat the location (literally steps from Disneyland). Their prices are affordable, especially when you factor in the included breakfast. I was even able to sit out on their upstairs patio and have a fantastic view of the Disneyland fireworks show. The staff is always friendly and very helpful.

Summary Heading: Relax! It is taken care of!
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for the first time, myself and two kids one who has special needs. From the time I called for added directions until the time I left, the staff were helpful, attentive and you never felt like you were a "bother" like you do in some places. Right across from Disney, we could just walk home for a rest any time. Nice pool, very clean. Free breakfast was a huge plus, good food, fresh fruit and again service with a smile.  Gwen

We just got back from our trip to anaheim in which we stayed at park vue, which is across the street from disneyland. We booked a two room suite, which they gave us, and to our surprise we even had a gift basket waiting for us in our room! Room 248 is perfect, its the second floor and an end unit so it is very quiet, and also its just steps away from the pool! The beds were soft, which we like, my only concern was the squeekiness of my bed when i rolled over, but after a few nights i didn't even notice it anymore.  The counters were updated, the carpet worn but clean. There was plenty of room for our suitcases and stuff for a family of 5. The staff are very friendly we found and when we asked for the best way to go to the anaheim plaza to shop they recommended a van service

Summary Heading: ONE OF THE CLOSEST TO DISNEYLAND
Summary: we stayed on may 20th thru 23. what a surprise to find a complementary  fruit and wine basket in my room. the rooms where bigger then what i was expecting, and clean. the front desk was very friendly. the location to Disneyland made it easy to go back for a quick nap before going back for more fun. will stay here again

my husband and decided to stay here for a quick two day trip to disneyland, I chose this place because of the direct location of being right across the street from disneyland. This is really the only reason why I would stay here again. check in was fine, and it was way easy to store our luggage since our room wasn't ready yet. the front desk girls were a littl distracting with their fake eyebrows, lashes and boobies(with the exception for one who was super cute and super helpful). The "warm" breakfast was nothing to write home about and we ended  up skipping it and heading into the park to eat.  our "king size bed"  turned out to be a queen with a bunkbed, but was fine. the room was clean; however the carpet was horrible, and its in desperate need of replacement.  The only real

We have stayed at other motels near this one and this one is the BEST!  It suited our needs perfectly with 3 small children. We don't spend much time in the room while we are there but when we did it was very comfortable. The continental breakfast exceeded our expectations. We will definately stay here again and again.

Summary Heading: You can't beat the location, comfort, and price
Summary: This is about as close as you can sleep to the Disneyland Parks.  Quiet, comfortable, affordable....  loved that the rooms had Queen sized beds (instead of doubles) and refrigerators.  Would definitely stay there again and recommend this place to friends!

I love this place its rite across the street from Disneyland! The front desk girls rock they are very sweet. They checked me in as soon as i arrived i loved that about park vue inn i would so go back in the future and tell all my friends about this amazing hotel. They even have a cold stone ice cream place next door when i went to cold stone it was a friday and they had music and lights i was so ready to order a margarita but than i noticed it was just my favorite ice cream place cold stone.

Summary Heading: A fabulous experience at the Park Vue Inn, Disneyland!
Summary: This is a great, convenient hotel with lots of positive amenities!  We were greeted at the hotel by a courteous staff, and in our room with a fruit/wine basket!  The room was very clean and kid friendly!  The bunk beds were a great added feature.  The queen bed was VERY comfortable.  The free breakfast was very good and there was plenty to choose from.   All of this and the fact that the hotel is truly right across the street from the Disneyland entrance, made our trip great!  We highly recommend the Park Vue Inn and will stay there again when in Anaheim!

I wanted everyone to know that we have stayed at the Park Vue Inn several times. This last trip though we got BED BUGS. I spoke with the hotel several times and they claimed they didn't have any. We had bites all over us and have been fighting them in our home since we returned in October. I spoke with them again in May and they claimed they had no problems with Bed Bugs. This is not true. We are sad that they wouldn't take care of us. We travel there 5 times a year and now will stay somewhere else.  Here is a photo of some of the bites.

Summary Heading: not a bad place at all
Summary: This was are second time to disney land but are first time staying here. Location is great. The staff were all great. They helped in every way they could. They give you a welcome basket with wine and fruit. We broke the bottle a few day's later and they replaced it for us . The breakfest was great cheese omlett, waffles,fresh fruit. and much more. Only 2 things I disliked (1) The maid surives was not that great ,you must be out of your rome by 9am and not come back till much later if you want it cleanded. And the walls are thin. But would I come back and stay here yes I would.

We had no problems booking and received a better deal on the phone then online.  Travelled with two teenagers and a little one who turned 5.  The hotel made up a nice birthday package for him with balloons, cake and a gift.  The continential breakfast was amazing and the service provided there was top notch.  They kept the food stocked and fresh.  I loved the fact that it was Super Close to the park that made it nice to come back for a quick swim in the afternoon or to drop off packages.  We have stayed at this hotel before and this time stayed in the room with 1 Queen and Bunk Beds the room was a little tight for 5 of us but it worked fine as we were not in the room very often just too sleep.  The only drawback was there was no cartoon channel that we could find.  The Free

These people are horrible. The front desk was by far the rusdest I've seen. The qirls speak spanish in front of you (very rude) they let the phone ring forever before answering (annoying) and the chubby girl (Arlene) that "helped" me was so unfamiliar with what she was doing, she was clueless. She was also very rude to me when I simply asked the hours for the pool, she grabbed the key holder from my hands and flipped it over on the counter and said "all the hours are right here ma'am" like I had ruined her life by asking. Also the girl I spoke to on the phone was so sweet (definately not arlene) and told me that they give out fruit baskets with wine, I asked if they had anything non-alcoholic  and she told me that they always have apple cider, when I asked Arlene to switch it,

Summary Heading: Place to stay if you are going to Disneyland
Summary: These rooms have refrigerator & microwave.  Rooms are clean and the breakfast they serve every morning is top notch.  Not just the normal Continental Breakfast, but eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns, pancakes, waffes!  We've stayed here four times over the past few years and have never been disappointed.  Free wireless!  Located at the traffic light to cross to Disneyland.  We will never consider another hotel when we are visiting Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great location, clean and comfortable rooms, excellent breakfast
Summary: We had stayed at a neighbouring property in 2007 which was just OK so we thought we’d give the Park Vue Inn a go this time.  The location, as you would expect, is outstanding, just a walk across to the entrance to Disneyland/California Adventure.  We were very happy with our stay.  The rooms are clean, the beds comfortable, bathroom a large size with the sink being outside the bathroom.  The airconditioning was old and oddly located on the wall above the sink.  It was a reasonably cool time when we were there so we didn’t really need to use it that much but I don’t know how effective it would be in very hot weather and sleeping with its noise might be a little difficult.  The room had a very old CRT TV but I did notice while walking by that some rooms had flat panels so I

Summary Heading: Wonderful service made for a nice anniversary
Summary: My husband and I went on a trip to Disneyland for our anniversary.  Being annual passholders we have stayed at many of the hotels in the Disneyland area.  This was our first but definitely won't be our last stay at the Park Vue Inn.  Check in was easy, the room was nice and clean with plenty of towels and extras pillows and blankets already in the room.  Upon getting in our room the front desk called to be sure we didn't need anything extra which is so nice cause usually we want extra pillows but since they already had them in the closet it was not needed. I guess I had mentioned in passing it was our anniversary when we checked in because upon our return from Disneyland there were balloons, candy, a fruit basket and a bottle of apple cider in our room with a nice note wishing

Summary Heading: Very happy and satisfied with Park Vue Inn...nice location too!!
Summary: Our family stayed at Park Vue Inn and we did not regret it at all.  The location was great...we just cross the street and we're at Disneyland!!  We stayed for 4 nights and we can even watch the fireworks display at Disney right at our room.  The staff was very helpful and accommodating, and the room was spacious and clean.  Tonet Marquez Manila, Philippines

Summary Heading: Clean, good value, great continental breakfast!
Summary: Nice clean place to stay, the closest off-site accomodation to Disneyland main gate, reasonable rates, continental breakfast is very nice with eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, cold cereal, fruit, yogurt, toast, etc.  Very nice.  Staff were extremely courtesous - especially the ladies in the breakfast room.  Staff surprised us with balloons and a nice gift for our daughter's birthday while we stayed.  100% recommend Park Vue Inn.

Summary Heading: Excellent value, clean rooms, perfect location & great staff!
Summary: Our family visits Disney Land at least once a year for 5 to 7 days at a time. Over the years we have stayed as several different hotels near Disney but in the last few years we have stuck with Park Vue Inn. For our Disney trips we don’t need a plush hotel but at the same time we want a clean and comfortable room.   Each visit we have been greeted with a fruit and wine basket and this year the free breakfast was significantly upgraded. It included waffle makers, bacon, sausage, hot and cold cereal, pastries, fruit, juice and coffee (plus other miscellaneous items). The kids are thrilled that the staff that cleans the room organizes their Disney plush dolls on the bed each day. It brings a smile to their face every time.  As you can tell by the map this hotel is as close to Disney

You can't get any closer to Disneyland's main gates, which works out very well for us as we like to open the park, close the park, and return for a nap in the afternoon.  We had stayed at the Park Vue in 2009, and chose to return in 2010 because we didn't mind roughing it a bit as a tradeoff for the convenience and value.  We found that they had improved room cleanliness and the quality of the beds and linens.  They greatly improved the free breakfast from a continental in 2009 to a hot breakfast including eggs, bacon & sausage, and make your own waffles.  The outdoor pool is larger than most on Harbor and very clean.  We'd definitely go back again.

Summary Heading: If you are going to Disney Land, this is where you need to stay !
Summary: I have traveled with my family to Disney Land twice in the last two years and we have stayed at Park Vue Inn each time and loved it there. They are literally right across the street from Disney Land entrance. The free breakfast is great also. The rooms were perfect and there was even a nice pool for the kids to play in. I highly recommend this hotel. We also found the IHOP to have a great family deal after 4pm where kids eat free so check that out. The best deal we found on tickets was on Costco.com for Disney, Sea World, Universal Studios, and San Diego Zoo. We used expedia.com one time for tickets and it took forever to get into the park with those. We just walked right in with the costco.com tickets.

Summary Heading: Best lodging deal on Disneyland's doorstep
Summary: We have been staying at the Park Vue for years because of the good AA discounts and proximity to Disneyland park. The hotel has improved over the years with upgraded rooms, continental breakfast, free wireless, and onsite laundry. There is great parking for hotel guests and plenty of ice. Perfect for families with kids who could use that afternoon nap break before more evening Disney adventures. There are nearby restaurants too.

We stayed at the Park Vue in for 9 nights in April of this year.  It was our first time at Disneyland and we had such a good time.  Check-in was very smooth.  We were able to get into our room just before 3pm.   The welcome basket was a wonderful touch.  And all the staff was excellent.  Any time I went to the lobby to ask a question it was always answered quickly and courteously.  Our room was on the main floor about half way down.  The room was a queen bed with a bunk bed and very clean.  We’re a family of 5 with 3 girls aged 14, 9 & 6.  My two youngest shared the bottom.  My husband’s and my queen was very comfortable as well.  The free continental breakfast was excellent.  There was always enough food, and if something ran out the ladies were quick to replenish it.  What a

Summary Heading: Directly across the road from Disneyland
Summary: We recently stayed at the Park Vue with 2 children for the purpose of visiting Disneyland.  The hotel is directly across the road from the entrance, so it was perfect.  The Disneyland fireworks can be seen from your front door.  We received a welcome pack of wine and fruit upon arrival which was a very welcome suprise.  The children were in bunk beds which they loved unlike other accommodation wherein they had to share a double bed.  The children also enjoyed the pool and spa.  Parking outside our door was a dream.  Also having a hot breakfast was a treat.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Location -- What more could you ask for?
Summary: We are a family that goes to Disneyland every 5-6 months.  This was our 6th trip in 3 1/2 years.  We have stayed at other hotels for each of the other trips.  They all had their pros and cons.    We decided to stay at the Park Vue this time because our 18 month old will not sleep in her stroller so we have to come back to let her take a nap.  The location is so nice.  5 minute walk gets you to the gate.  It's really nice because as soon as you cross the street you are in the magic!    First, the pros.   1.  Room was very neat and clean.  2.  They had a wine, water and fruit welcome basket waiting for us when we opened our door.  Plus there was a personalized letter stating that they were there anytime we needed them.   3.  Water was always hot when we took a shower.  4.

We chose the Park Vue Inn due to the great reviews, the proximity to Disney and the free parking.  We also thought it important to have free breakfast.  Upon arrival, we checked in pretty quick and were surprised with nice, warm cookies.  We were given a room really close to the front and were worried it would be too noisy but they didn't have any other rooms further back available.  We had a room with a queen bed and bunk beds.  Although the room was small it was very clean and large enough to sleep in.  The room also had a nice basket with fruit, water and some cider.  The bathroom was clean and the shower had good water pressure.  We found the beds comfortable enough.  We walked to McDonalds about 1/2 a block away for dinner and then across the street to pick up our tickets

Summary Heading: Best location for main entrance to Disneyland!!
Summary: This exceptionally located motel-style inn was perfect for our brief stay in Anaheim.  The entrance is directly across the street from the main entrance to Disneyland.  Perfect for being able to leave Disneyland mid-day and go for a swim or a hot tub.  Very friendly staff, and decent sized rooms have a fridge and mini-microwave.   Our only comment, not complaint, was that the lights outside the room were really bright and lit up our whole room.  We used our cell phone clips to hold the curtains closed to keep some of it out!!     There was a free breakfast buffet that had all kinds of options - cold cereals, bagels, toast, waffle stations, fresh fruit, omelets, bacon and sausage, coffee and juices.  Also, having Cold Stone Creamery next to the lobby was a plus!  Will definitely

This was our second stay in 15 months.  We actually had the exact same room.  Rooms have been recently renovated.  Beds and bedding were new and super comfortable.  Our room had a queen bed, bunk beds for the kids, and refrigerator and microwave. Rooms were clean.  When we arrived in our room there was a personalized note and gift basket welcoming us.  This hotel is family owned, staff is very friendly, accommodating and helpful.  You cant beat the location, as it is literally at the doorstop of Disneyland.  There is also a free full breakfast buffet, which saves huge money over breakfasting in Disneyland.  We would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: We thoroughly enjoyed our recent eight-night stay at the Park Vue Inn.
Summary: We originally picked this hotel because it was a great price compared to other hotels in the area, and it was the only hotel we found in the area that offered bunk beds for our kids. The bunk beds enabled us to put our 10-year-old on the top bunk while our 6 and 4-year-olds shared the bottom bunk, and we didn't need to clutter the room with an extra cot. The decor was slightly dated, but the rooms were very clean, staff was very helpful, complimentary breakfast was great, and parking, internet and room safe were all free. Pool was also great for the kids and you can't get closer to the park entrance! This is a great hotel for families who want a good, clean, affordable option for their Disneyland vacation. I would definately stay here again. We stayed at a more expensive hotel

Summary Heading: It made it a great vacation
Summary: This was a nicer Hotel than I had hoped for.  I knew none of the Hotels across from the entrance to Disneyland were going to be 5 star, but after much research I booked with Park Vue Inn.   We were pleasantly surprised that what we had read was true and it was a very comfortable and clean room.   We loved the pillow top beds, infact my 10 year old wanted to take the beds home with us, the beds were covered with white bedspreads that you knew were clean and fresh.  The room had a fridge, microwave and safe.  We could walk back to the room from Disneyland and have lunch or a snack and swim, so it was a great location.  The laundry was close so I could use that as well.  The staff were very helpful and helped us if we needed anything.  They brought us a nice gift basket with fruit

Summary Heading: Will be staying here again soon!
Summary: Okay, the only thing negative that happened was that some young children ran loudly past our room early in the morning. This was mid-April (Spring Break for a lot of people).  That's it. Everything else was great. The 2 queen/sleeper sofa suite and a roll-away bed fit our entire group (Grandparents, Uncle, Aunt, My husband and I, and our 2 children). It was a snug fit (the roll-away bed was halfway in the kitchenette) but comfortable and safe. Awesome breakfast (it actually filled us up and helped our budget); you're RIGHT ACROSS the street from Disneyland; super clean rooms, cute pool and spa (we used it the next morning to splash around in before leaving) and friendly people at the front desk...what more could you ask for?  We plan on staying again this year even though we

The service was excellent.  We had gotten lost and the kids were too tired to walk back, they sent a taxi to rescue us!  The bunk beds were a nice touch for the kids.  The free continental breakfast was more than we expected, usually you would only see fruit, yogurt and toast but they had bacon, hash browns, make-your-own waffles and cheese omelettes. The housekeeping staff was always on top of things.  The Wifi was unfortunately not very reliable.

Surpised our six year old with this trip. Usually stay on the resort but decided to save some money this year and researched all of the neighborning hotels.  We were surprised and thrilled with the Park Vue Inn.  The Park Vue Inn is just as close a walk to the Disney main entrance as the Disneyland Hotel and you dont have to move through the bustle of Downtown Disney.  The room was comfortable and clean.  The breakfast each morning was better than expected.  The staff were all helpful and friendly.  Without a doubt we will be staying there next time we head out to see Mickey and friends.
i used to stay here with expedia.  but their expedia room was way too noisy.  the location was great and they have other rooms that they wouldnt give me, so good luck

Both my husband and I surprised our kids with a trip to Disneyland over spring break. We searched the websites for the best location and price. After much searching we found the Park Vue Inn to be just what we were looking for. Due to the age of our kids ( 5 and 8) - it was walking distance ( across the street) so not far for the kids to walk and we didn't have to wait for a shuttle. The pool was great on the really hot days and the hot tub was awesome too. The continental breakfast was fabulous. Such a variety of foods from oatmeal, toast, french toast, cereals to eggs, hashbrowns, bacon and sausage - quite the choice each and every morning. Sitting on the upstairs outdoor deck was a great way to start the morning. Great place for a great price!!!

Summary Heading: good inn with great service and accommodations
Summary: We always stay at the Park Vue Inn for its value and friendlyness. We travel to Disneyland at least 3 times a year, and do not hesitate to book our rooms at the Park  Vue Inn. The rooms are nice and clean. Service from the housekeeping, front desk, and maintenance section are outstanding. Full breakfast ( eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, and fruits ) are  a welcome treat, since the cost of the rooms are very reasonable. Small workout room,  pool, and jacussi ( spelling ??? ) are nice. The gift shop is convenient, and offers an  assortment of goodies. The free parking, and FREE high speed internet service is great. You do not need a car while staying there, since your rooms are only about a 5 minute walk to the Disneyland entrance. Will definitely stay there every time we go to

Overall this hotel was exactly what we expected.  It was clean and tidy, with adequate good sized rooms. We enjoyed the layout - with the handbasin outside the bathroom, and the fridge, microwave and safe all came in handy!  The breakfast was ok, a good selection - fruits cereals, juices,cooked eggs,bacon and sausages and the waffles were yummy! The quality of the food was as to be expected for the style of hotel. The staff were all friendly and very helpful.  Our room took a while to be ready after we arrived ( which was early) and a lovely basket of goodies was sent to our room as an apology - which I felt was a great touch, as it was still ready by 3pm ( the check in time).  The pool is clean and has a really deep end for the adults and a shallow end for the kids, it was warm

I have stayed here for three years in a row for a Catholic Conference, and I must say the staff continues to make you feel welcome the moment you arrive.  It was an enjoyable surprise to find a fruit and wine basket with a personal letter waiting in my room at check-in.  To top it off the free continental breakfast buffet has been expanded as well to offer waffles, egg and cheese omelets, sausage, bacon, and more.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  The only note is that if you like large towels you might want to bring your own, while they are adequate, they tend to be small.  A great choice for those wanting to be close to the entrances of Disneyland and California Adventure, as you are right across the street from the main entrance. Many restaurants are within walking

In January 2010, we booked this hotel based on the recommendation from a book rating hotels near Disneyland.  They gave it a 73 rating (out of 100, very good) based on the closeness to the main gate (none closer, 6 minute walk from our room to stepping inside the Park, no need for shuttle bus), upgraded beds and bedding (FABULOUS!), heated & clean pool, deluxe breakfast (waffle griddles, cereal, fruit, juices, etc.).  When we arrived, there was a welcome basket of fruit with a bottle of California wine (and 2 wine glasses), along with a note from the manager addressed to us.  There is an onsite gift shop outlet with an excellent selection of Disney t-shirts and other items at less than half the prices at the Park.  We got all 3 kids t-shirts and the girls were stopped 10x by

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you want be close to Disney:-)
Summary: I was looking for a place to stay that we could walk to the parks.  I found Park Vue Inn on the internet and look to see how close it was to the park.  It is across the street from the park.  We parked when we arrived and didn't start the car again until we left for home.  One time we stayed in a Disney hotel and this one was closer.  Also one time we stayed at a hotel with a bus that would take us back and forth.  This was way better.  Park Vue Inn also has a great breakfast you can fill up on in the morning and save some money by not eating in the park.  A few of days we would go back to our room around 1 eat some lunch in our room take a swim then head back to the parks later.    The only bad thing I can think of is the bed was hard.  We will stay there again.

Booked this in advance for a friend and faxed back paper work my card was charged on 2 dates the day I booked and the day I faxed papers.  When friend got there they told her she had to pay again.  I called and was treated rude was informed by Yarinda that they had no papers and when asked to speak to Manager was told he has no set hours.  Lied over several statements said there was no indication that I requested it for a friend but when aske for her to fax me my reservation credit she pulled up my fax that she did not have.  Then when I pointed it out she hung up on me! Needless to say they will never get my business

We've stayed at the Park Vue before (couple of years ago).  Changes seem to center on a new customer focus.  Little notes (Happy Easter), a welcome fruit and wine basket, etc. for a "standard" room were nice surprises.  The free breakfast featured a broad assortment of food and beverages.  We were on a Disneyland-only vacation, so a hearty breakfast got the day started right (and saved an expensive Disney meal).  If you subtract the alternative cost of an equivalent breakfast for a family of two adults and two teenagers (about $60 with tip), the room netted out to $69 a night.  With a location directly across from the main gate, with comfortable beds, that's a deal!  Not luxury, but clean and comfy.  Very friendly staff.

Park Vue Inn was well suited to us.  Location, location, location – perfect!  After having an above average continental breakfast, we walked across the street to Disneyland.  The Inn is that close.  When it was siesta time, we came back to the room for a bite to eat.  Two of us stayed behind for a nap and the other two ventured back to the park.  We enjoyed the flexibility of coming and going. The Inn employees were welcoming and helpful at all times.

We had a great stay at the Park Vue Inn. The location is excellent being right across the street from the Disneyland entrance. The distance to the park was an easy five minute walk. The breakfast was also great with so many things to choose from, there was plenty to satisfy each member or our family. We were also surprised and very happy to receive the welcome basket which included fruit, water bottles and sparkling apple cider. The beds were great and gave us a comfortable rest after walking around Disneyland all day. My girls loved the swimming pool. The front desk even called after we settled in our room to make sure everything was ok. When you wrap up all the good things about this hotel with the price for the stay the value is excellent.

We selected this hotel because it is in easy walking distance of Disneyland.  The breakfast was a pleasant surprise in light of its variety.  The people at the desk were very nice.  It has a very small exercise room, but we didn't care.  There is no restaurant, but there are many restaurants in walking distance.  Parking was free and plentiful.  The only drawback was the noise of people chatting.  With teens, we tended to stay at the park late and sleep in a bit.  Of course, many people, especially ones with small kids, leave early in the morning to beat the rush.  Excited children make a lot of noise, and the walls are thin.  Other than that, I would recommend the hotel.

Summary Heading: A value priced gem right across from Disneyland
Summary: I have been to this hotel many times before and after their remodel and it is my hotel of choice when I am in the Anaheim area. You cannot get any closer to Disneyland for walking distance. Their continental breakfast is superb. All of the employees including the gardeners and maids are so friendly and helpful and they just made me feel like family whenever I visit (about twice a year). They added internet service at no cost to their guests located in the lobby and this was such a huge plus for me. The fruit and wine gift basket was so thoughtful and so appreciated at the end of a long day at Disneyland. The beds were so comfortable and I never slept better. The showers have great water pressure and didn't run cold at all.  Right next door is IHOP, a big plus for lunch or

This hotel seems nice.  The rooms look good and the location can't be beat.  BUT they have roaches in the rooms.  We stayed in rm 111 and found roaches and when we complained we were told they were Palm bugs...HMM so with the handy dandy iphone we looked palm bugs up.  Not what we found unless they meant Paletto bugs which are american cockroaches!  So for sure they have roaches!  We were feaked out the last morning there when we woke up t find a huge dean one. One of us had at some point during the night stepped on it in the walk way and didnt know it!  EWE.  The MGR would not talk to me and was supposed to issue a credit and call me and he did neither of those things.  I stood in the Lobby and told anyone who came on that this place has roaches and I have called to health dept

Summary Heading: Perfect place for going to the Perfect Place.
Summary: When going to Disneyland there is no better place to stay in my view. It is the closest motel outside the park. Price was excellent. Park Vue was clean, fairly quite, the staff was very friendly and helpful. I was greeted with a fruit basket in my room. PV has a free breakfast that has something for almost everyone it is a real nice way to start your day.It is definetly not the Hilton but if you want a  average motel it is Much Better than that.

Summary Heading: Awesome location w/ great service and great breakfast!
Summary: Awesome location right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland!  Staff was extremely friendly wanting to make sure our room was satisfactory and offering their assistance if we should need it.  We were also surprised with a welcome basket of fruit, water bottles, and a bottle of wine!  Completely surprised by that!  The breakfast that is included was awesome!  Cereals, danishes, bagels, waffles, omelets, bacon, hash browns, 4 juices, coffee, etc.  Very nicely done with a beautiful roof-top patio.  Would definitely recommend this hotel - and have already!
As Annual Disneyland Passholders, we regularly stay at this hotel.  It is convenient and the new expanded breakfast is wonderful!  The staff is very helpful.

The Park Vue is very nice and the people working there make you feel like a valued guest. Their continental breakfast is first rate saving you money before you head into the park.  The main entrance to the Disneyland Resort is right across the street so it gives you great access to both parks and the Downtown Disney area.

The ease and convenience of this hotel's location is their strongest attraction-right across from the entrance to the park, which allows for 'breaks' during the day and a short crawl home at the end of your visit. However, if you are interested in 'just a room to sleep after a tough day' you may have trouble getting that. The beds were worn and the linens were rough. The noise level is problematic since all doors access the courtyard and people walking past (upstairs anyway) actually shake the beds nearest the windows. The staff was friendly and efficient and the rooms were clean and well serviced just in need of some updating. Overall, it is a great choice for the location and price.

Summary Heading: We found our new home away from home!
Summary: What a gem!  For the last couple of years as our family has grown, we have been trying to find a hotel that not only fits us all comfortably but is affordable and within walking distance to the Disneyland Park.  We have 4 children, 2 of which are teens and 2 are smaller.  This hotel was perfect!  We reserved the 2 Queen suite with a pullout couch and small kitchen.  We prefer to pack lunch each day so the kitchen was wonderful to prepare and store a weeks worth of food for a growing family.  There was also plenty of mirrors and sinks for mutliple people to get ready in the morning.  The tub was jetted too which was great after a long day walking.  This suite had a connecting door with two seperate areas, so when the little ones went to sleep we could still watch TV and read in

Summary Heading: Great stay, excellent location and first rate staff !!
Summary: The most obvious reason to stay here is that it is directly across the street from the entrance to Disneyland. After staying there for three nights, I can honestly say that I would gladly stay again and not just for the location !!!  The staff is friendly and extremely helpful.  We arrived early and, after checking with housekeeping, were allowed to check into our room.  On our last day, even though we checked out at 10:30 am, since we were spending the day at Disneyland we were told we could park our vehicle in their lot until we were ready to leave.  The free breakfasts were hot and more than ample.  Any request made of the front desk was immediately addressed.  I cannot say enough about the gracious way we were treated--Thank you Park Vue !!!

We arrived at our hotel early and to our surprise the room was ready for us. Not just clean, but complete with complimentary fruit basket and welcoming letter.  We were staying in a room with a separate bedroom and were more than happy with the space.  The separate bedroom had 2 queens and the main space had a pull out couch (not terrible even) and a kitchen area which was wonderful to have given that our youngest is a baby and the 2 sinks in that space were great as there were 6 of us in total.  The room was well equipped with coffee and kitchen supplies and a microwave and fridge.  The complimentary breakfast was great.  Good supply and variety and decent quality.  Two years ago we stayed next door at a different hotel chain and spent significantly more money for a less

My daughter and I have stayed at the Park Vue Inn several times.  Each time the service was great, the rooms were clean and the location to Disneyland can't be beat!  The free breakfast is more like a buffet and is actually good unlike many hotels.  This last time we went for my daughter's 6th birthday.  When we checked in their were balloons and a Disneyland T-shirt as a gift.  I will certainly stay again.  Great hotel!!

I have to agree with the lady from Minden Nv. same thing happened to us. I called and made the reservation a month ahead for our 20th wedding anniversary. I was told there would be decorations and a gift in the room, when we arrived there was nothing. Whn we inquired, we were told they didn't have us listed as an anniversary, so whoever took my reservation didn't enter it even though I was very specific, even stating it's a milestone, our 20th! OK, so that night we get two wilted roses, a balloon and two dusty Donald Duck tumbler glasses (the cake ONLY comes with birthdays although they do not say that on the website). So anniversary thing pretty botched, I was disappointed. BUT to top it all off the next morning there is NO HOT WATER. OK so now I can't take a shower either?

The location directly across the road from the main entrance to Disneyland can't be beat.  The children (4 & 6) really enjoyed the pool and bunk beds (must reserve specifically).  We also enjoyed the breakfast--a step up from prepackaged pastries to be sure!  Overall I would highly recommend it and will stay here again the next time we are forced to come to Disneyland!!

Great location across from the main gate to Disneyland.  A woman named Laura was working the check-in desk and was a little rude to us.  We had arrive an hour early so we had to come back at 3pm which was fine.  We came back to check-in at 2:58 and said that "it wasn't 3 yet and it is only something like 2:50" so we had to wait.  I had another woman wait on us right away and our room was ready.  Our room was to have balloons and cake delivered to it because it was our friend's birthday, but it didn't arrive until 9:30pm when we received a call, which woke us up, and they delivered the cake.  I had also called for an extra blanket at 8pm, the person said they would be right over and they never showed up.   The breakfast room does not have enough tables for everyone to sit and the

Summary Heading: for the money great place to stay
Summary: for the money this place was great.  we had three queen beds with teenagers this was great. walking distance to everything, the place was clean and every day while at the park housekeeping came in. the bathroom is not five star but clean and great water presure.check in was a snap and everything was ready staff was very friendly. the free breakfast was outstanding every morning fresh make your own waffles egg omlets bacon sausage fresh fruit cereal to much to mention all this is not a cold  danish and go for the money this place is great i recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Best hotel for families at Disneyland period.
Summary: We have stayed twice at the Park Vue.  It is the closest non-Disney hotel to the entrance (directly across the street.)  The rooms are clean and comfortable.  The rates reasonable.  The service is excellent.  The free continental breakfast is better than most restaurants.  The pool is great for hot days.  There is a Cold Stone Creamery & IHOP at the hotel and there is a McDonalds, Dennys, Tony Roma's and Captain Kidd's within minutes.

This was our second visit to the Park Vue, the first being about 4 years earlier.  There were definate improvements this time, including new furniture, and a new complimentary breakfast.  My kids loved that they were offered bunk beds in the rooms, no sharing a bed!  The furniture was very nice, and the beds were bar none the most comfortable motel  beds I've ever slept in!  The staff was very helpful and nice, I was on the phone with a Gabby several times before our arrival, and she always remembered who I was and was happy to meet us when we arrived, like a small town environment.  Odd requests for things like bandaides, can openers, sparkling apple cider, and more, and more, and more towels, were brought quickly.  Breakfast consisted of homemade (by us) waffles, wonderful

We we're so happy to be able to walk right across the street after a long day at the parks. That right there was a big plus for us. It was also close to resturaunts and everything else you might need. The staff was great and they had a gift basket for us on our first day as well as balloons for our birthdays, that was really special and the kids loved it! The heated pool and hot tub were also nice to relax in. We enjoyed the free breakfast every morning, there were a lot of foods to choose from and it saved us quite a bit of money. The breakfast room was a bit small but they also had outdoor seating or you could take it back to your room if needed. We had a double queen room and thought it fit our needs just fine, it had a microwave, coffee pot and small fridge. The water

Summary Heading: Great location - right across from entrance to Disneyland
Summary: The Park Vue Inn has a really great location!  Once you walk to the sidewalk in front the intersection to cross into Disneyland Parks and downtown Disney is a few steps away.  There is a McDonalds, IHop and Subway within walking distance.  The continental breakfast was pretty good.  My family really liked the waffles, egg dish, and the muffins and it saved us time and money.  The pool was pretty and was very clean.   The rooms were kept well and it was nice having a little refrigerator.  We would definitely stay again.  It was a good value for the money.

I have stayed at 3 hotels are near Park Vue and based on price, comfort, free internet, location, staff & amenities I would have to rate this hotel as the best on Harbor Blvd. I would definitely stay again and definitely recommend to vacationers. As for hearing people wake up I didn't because we were at the park all day and slept hard and good through all the noise I guess haha. Didn't try breakfast because woke up at 9am each morning and left at 10am to go to McDonalds, Denny's or Ihop in walking distance. Hotel is also near Tony Roma's, Mimi's Cafe, Quiznos, and Coldstone is located right in front of hotel lobby. The hotel is right in front of the street light you cross to the front entrance to Disneyland which is convenient to walk to Disney and to go back for mid day rest

Easy walking distance to Disneyland/California Adventure, the front staff was great and helpful.  Millie's Cafe is a short walk from the hotel and has GREAT food and service at a family friendly price!  The hotel is very loud, especially from 6:30am - 10am as people are heading up to the free breakfast (which is good by the way), just don't plan on sleeping in!  There were never any towels at the pool, we were told to take them from our room then call and ask for more for the morning, which was ok until they didn't put any in our room after cleaning it!  They didn't clean the room one day, we had to call and ask for it to be done.  Next time I think we'll try the Day's Inn right next door.

This hotel is great for visiting Disneyland.  It is located right across the street from the main entrance and is well suited for families.  The bunk beds were great for two kids of the opposite sex, the room was clean and bed was comfy.  The complimentary breakfast had lots of choices (eggs, sausage, waffles, cereals, danish, fruit, etc.) and was kept well stocked even during "rush hour".  I liked the gentle reminders throughout the hotel to please be quiet for other guest (although didn't alway do the trick - but not their fault) but the real kicker was the complimentary basket of wine, water and fruit upon our arrival - a touch I have never seen in other moderately priced (or higher end) places.  The front staff was also very friendly and accommodating.  The only down sides

This is a clean, quiet hotel right next door to Disneyland. It features a full breakfast which is fabulous. STAFF are the most helpful and pleasant in my experience. The BREAKFAST STAFF SHOULD GET A RAISE FOR THEIR HARD WORK. After 10 plus years visiting from Canada this is a nice surprise to find this hotel only gets better. This is a non-smoking, no pets facility so no ALLERGIES.

Summary Heading: Love the Park Vue Inn - within 3 min walk of Disneyland entry gates
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue Inn for 1 night on the 26th Feb to go to the Bon Jovi concert. This is the 2nd time we have stayed here (last time we had the kids with us). We are from Australia  Once again the staff were helpful and on arrival in our room there was a beautiful gift basket comprised of fruit and a bottle of wine which was a lovely touch. The rooms may be a little tired but they are clean.  We didn't get a chance to go Disneyland this year as we were only in Anaheim overnight but the location can't be beat as it is right at the road crossing to Disneyland.  IHOP & Tony Romas are next door and Coldstone Ice Creamery on site.  We will definately stay here again   PS. The Bon Jovi concert was great!

The location is great, the staff was friendly and helpful they were quick to correct any problems.  The only complaint I have is the beds are alittle firm and noise, and the pillows are terrible (bring your own ).

The rooms were clean, the bunk beds were comfortable and sturdy!  They accomodated us when we arrived early.  They left a complimentary welcome basket for us after we arrived.  The prices were very reasonable, especially with the breakfast!  It was served on a nice balcony and had everything you could have wanted for breakfast, with ladies working hard to keep it stocked and clean.  The location couldn't have been better with lots of dining, at a walking distance.  Nice, clean gym with new equipement and a TV.   You could easily park right outside your room.   The maintenence team was busy keeping things clean and updated while we were there.  We will definately be back next year!

We are return guests to the Park Vue Inn and we just love the friendly staff.  The rooms are always clean and well kept.  When you make a special request they always try to get you whatever you need.  Our grandson knows that when we go to the "hotel" as he calls it, that all he has to do is ask for a balloon and he will not only get it, but be asked what color he wants.  We love it there!  Paula McGee

It's a good value for where it is located. The room was very clean and tidy. Ok decor and TV reception. We went down for my birthday and to my surprise when we came back to the room the manager left a basket with wine, balloons, chocolate and so much more. It was their way of saying "Happy Birthday". It was a great surprise. One great perk is there is a 24 hour IHOP next door. The only downfall is if you are on the second floor and there is a child running down the hall you can hear them the entire way down. Other then that it was a great place to stay.

I recently gave a good review to this hotel, but I have had a terrible experience that has changed my mind!  Shortly after returning home from our trip, my children started showing me strange bites on their arms and backs.  I did some research and realized they were bed bug bites.  They don't show up for 7 to 9 days after you have been bitten.  I also realized we had seen one of these bugs climbing up the wall of the hotel, but I didn't know what it was, so I didn't worry about it.  I e-mailed the hotel  two weeks ago with my concern so they could address the problem, but they haven't responded. In my opinion, I have given them more than enough time to respond before going public with my complaint.   If you google bed bugs, you will see what a terrible nightmare they are.  You

Summary Heading: Convient location, price and great service make this a good choice.
Summary: I am a Disney annual passholder, so I'm in Anaheim quite often and have stayed at a variety of motels.  It's wonderful to be able to leave Disneyland, walk across the street and find Park Vue Inn just at the right of the crosswalk.  Though the walls are thin and you can hear nearly everyone walking by your room, the noise factor is offset by the price of the night's stay, the really nice people behind the front desk and the great location.  I didn't eat their morning breakfast, but saw Belgian waffle makers in there.  Come on, how many motels offer waffles with their free breakfast?

Summary Heading: Great value, great location, exactly what we were looking for.
Summary: After being tricked into booking at the Ramada Limited Maingate (a mile from the Disney entrance and a complete dump), we walked from that reservation and booked at the Park Vue Inn.  It was a very clean, had friendly staff, and was not only walking distance from the park but about as close as one could get without actually staying at a Disney hotel.  Being able to walk 5 minutes to and from the Park Vue was a treat as very convenient! The pool and hot tub were great.  The breakfasts were also great with a good variety of choices.  Bunk beds for the kids were an added bonus that we hadn't counted on. It's not a 5 star Hilton but when staying beside Disney, you're going to spend most of your time there and just need a place to sleep or take a break for a while. We'll go back.

New guy at desk was very nice and apologetic since I waited for some time to be checked in. The girl helping him was rude and VERY unprofessional. Don't understand why she was training him at all. I think that erked me most about this hotel. The front desk workers don't acknowledge you at all. They look at you and keep walking. A decent hello and someone will be right with you would have been nice. You could hear them laughing at the back while the new guy was doing his best. Kudos to him.  We did get a room closest to the front which was GREAT. The location is GREAT. Only reason why I would want to stay there again especially if you have young children. Don't care to much to ride the ART I've stayed at other surrounding hotels but loved the fact that Park Vue is really close.

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay, excellent service, very close to Disneyland.
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue for 7 nights and it was wonderful.  The hotel is right across the street from the main entrance to Disneyland which is great when you are traveling with small children.  The breakfast was amazing, eggs, fresh waffles, fruit, pastries, cereal, bacon, sausage,  and a variety of juices.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.  Our room had a queen bed and bunk beds and we had enough room for our portable crib.  This was our second stay at this hotel, and we will definitely stay here again.

We stayed here for 4 nights in October while visiting Disneyland.  The location can't be beaten - right across the road from the Disneyland entrance.  5 minutes walk and you are in either of the parks.  The building is showing it's age a bit - you can hear noise from upstairs rooms and there is a stale smell in the rooms, but it is clean enough.  Let's face it - most of the time you aren't going to be there anyway.  Our room had 2 queen beds and a sofa bed, plus a small kitchen.  The beds were fairly comfortable and the kitchen was good, except it had insufficient utensils for meal preparation (we had to go out and buy a chopping knife). There is an IHOP on the premises that had reasonably priced food, plus there is also a Cold Stone Ice Creamery.  The hotel also has a pool (in

This hotel is the best one that we have stayed at around the Disneyland area.  We were travelling with teenagers and it was perfectly located for them, you couldn't get any closer.  The pool was great, it was clean and heated, the hot tub was also great.  The staff were helpful and courteous.  The rooms were quiet, a good size and clean. Lots of parking.  The continental breakfast was more than we had expected. We will definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Dont stay sleep in ur car.
Summary: The air conditioners did not work and we had cockroach told front desk, did not help left a day early. Said would get a refund and never got one.

Summary Heading: Park Vue Inn far exceeded our expectations!
Summary: Our bed was comfortable, the kids loved the bunk beds, the bathroom was very clean, the staff was extremely kind and courteous and the breakfast was fantastic.  It was five minutes to the Disneyland entrance and right next door to an IHOP, which the kids loved.  We were blown away by the staff, we felt as though we were staying at a five star hotel, and the price was unbeatable.  They even delivered a welcome basket to our room.

For a recent family "girls trip" to Disneyland we stayed at the Park Vue Inn. Wow, other than staying in a Disney property, I don't think you can get any closer to the entrance than this hotel. We chose it also based on the fact that it had a 2 bedroom suite that can sleep 6 which cost just a little more than a regular room. The free breakfast is also a great feature, saving us some money in the park. The rooms were very clean, and pretty roomy, considering we had 6 people with full suitcases in there. Probably our only cons would be that some of the pillows were a little flat, but there were enough extra that we could just stack several together, and that our key cards kept getting demagnetized, even though we were very careful about keeping them away from cell phones or other

Summary Heading: Highly recommended for great service and high value for the money!
Summary: Wonderful location right across the street from the Disneyland entrance.  Free parking and free breakfast!!!  The rates are VERY reasonable and the rooms are clean and well maintained!!  The bonus of the motel was this.....after a long day of Disneyland adventures, we arrive at our room to find a birthday balloon bouquet tied to a gift for our 8 year old's Birthday AND a wonderful basket with wine, fruit and water!!  What a wonderful way to end a great day!!!  Do not hesitate to pick this motel.

We went to Disneyland before Christmas hoping to miss the big rush of children.  We arrived a bit late on Thursday evening while checking into our room we were offered warm chocolate chip cookies...doesn't get much better than that, I thought (until we watched the Disneyland night-time fireworks from the balcony of our room in our warm pajamas.  We went on and bought our 2-day park hopper passes, knowing we were taking a risk, rains had been promised for the entire weekend!  Friday was magical, as always, at Disneyland.  Just a few sprinkles, no crowds, couldn't ask for a better day!  We woke up Saturday to pouring rain.  We thought about how we could manage the parks in the rain and decided it was just best to take our loses and head on home, Mesa AZ, and come back and play

This hotel is right across the street from the entrance to Disneyland.  The rooms are clean and serviced well.  The continental breakfast is adequate.  The service is great, however!  They are responsive and quick.    We had 3 rooms (3 teenagers, 6 younger children, 1 baby and a child that need wheelchair access).   They were great to accomodate requests for this large group!  Very pleasant experience!

Was one of the best places I stayed in.  The staff is so nice and polite.  Had a welcome basket in the home, the front office called about an half hour after check in to see if we needed anything.  When we did ask so something, it arrived within 15 minutes.  They were great.

As Disneyland season pass holders we travel often to the Anaheim area.  We have stayed at a number of the Motels in the area.  Our last trip down my wife wanted a hot tub to relax in for her birthday.  We booked a room at the Park Vue, when we arrived we were so impressed!  Not only did the door open to a very clean (it even smelled clean) room, there sat a nice welcome basket filled with wine, waters and fruit!  The beds were the best I have encountered (even better than the Disneyland hotel), rivaling our pillow top mattress at home.  Our kids loved the oversized bunkbeds and even they were comfortable too.  They had a good breakfast with something for everyone including bakery fresh donuts.  The hot tub was great my wife said and the pool was even heated in the winter...the
This is a very good place to stay if you are going to be going to Disneyland.  It's right across the street.  They serve a good continental breakfast.

Summary Heading: I highly recommend this hotel - excellent accommodations with friendly staff!!!
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue Inn for 4 nights in December and this is truly the absolute best hotel we have ever stayed at in California!!  The accommodations are very clean and roomy, the beds are comfortable, and, most importantly, it is quiet at night.  There is a fridge, microwave, and coffee maker in each room.  This hotel is directly across the street from Disneyland, so we could just walk to the park and come back anytime to get coats, etc.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Every single staff member from housekeeping, to the front desk, to maintenance, was absolutely wonderful!  On Saturday night, a couple staff members did crafts with the kids by the fire, while the kids sipped on homemade cookies and hot chocolate. Then, to top it off, they read Holiday Stories to

Having stayed at this hotel last year and enjoyed it, we were very surprised to find our stay this year to so disappointing and i don't think we will be back next year unless things change.  The renovations to the lobby were beautiful, and the staff was amazing - they all deserve raises.  What was lacking was the quality of our room and the breakfast.  Our room was so run down, that our tv was held on the wall by a 2x4 piece of wood, the fixtures, grout, & furniture were cracked and run down. Our carpet was soo dirty that socks were almost ruined in a few minutes - not what we expected.  As a family planning and budgeting for a vacation, having breakfast included in your stay is quite a savings.  we were unable to eat breakfast at our hotel during our 5 day stay because, it was

Thanksgiving weekend (Sat thru Mon) we booked three rooms, two for grandparent couples and one for Dad Mom and tots.  We asked for rooms near each other; they provided adjacent ones.  Rooms were large, clean, quiet, ready when promised and priced very reasonably.  I don't think you can get any closer to Disneyland and California Adventure entrances than this!  IHOP restaurant is in the same parking lot, Coldstone Creamery in the front, Tony Roma's and Denny's are right next door.  Continental breakfast was adequate, staff was helpful and courteous.  WiFi signal was a little weak and slow, but useable.  Would definitely book there again for Disneyland with the family.

This hotel was PERFECT for what we were looking for.  When we were walking back from Disneyland to our hotel right across the road we would be quite smug at how close we were while other visitors were waiting for buses.  We could get home very quickly to pick up warm clothes or have a break.  The breakfast was fine.  Beds were COMFY.  Staff very attentive and helpful, thanks Brenda for your help organising our shuttle to Long Beach.  The kids could spot those warm cookies on the front desk from half a mile away!  They were much appreciated after a big day out.  We could watch the Disneyland fireworks from our 2nd floor room.  Laundry was great and cheap.  Pool clean and heated.  Rooms serviced daily.  Free wi-fi for our laptop and a free computer in foyer for teenager.  Free

Summary Heading: Across the street from Disney Land Hote.  Great for small kids to go back to the room and re-charge.
Summary: Great location right across the street from Disney Land Resort.  Great for small kids to go back to the room and re-charge during the day. Good value with continental breakfast, pool and Jacuzzi.  They even had a lunch buffet for Thanksgiving.  3rd time staying there and we'll be back.

Summary Heading: Once again a fantastic stay at Park Vue
Summary: My Mum and I have stayed at PVU for the past 11 years.  I have stayed there 14 times and Mum 3 times. The staff are extremely friendly and every room I have stayed in there has been clean and comfortable.  I have NEVER seen a roach or spider in ANY room.  The beds have been great (I have a bad back but did not have any trouble sleeping on the mattresses) sheets have always been clean and fresh and I have had extra towels or pillows delivered within 5 minutes of a request.  The room was always made up early in the day (perhaps because we usually get a room close to the back of the hotel - maybe they work from back to front?) This trip there was a small issue with my prepaid credit card because its not embossed with my name.  I did explain its a card issued by a major bank in

I originally booked Park Vue because we wanted to be as close to the Disney gates as possible, as we had no car. Couldn't have chosen a better hotel for location! Literally right across thre street from Disney. Also very close to some chain restaurants which we did not east at, but it would be handy for families.   The free breakfast was a typical continental breakfast...cereal, oatmeal, fruit, pastries, toast, yogurt, etc. No complaints here! They had delicious donuts that we ate too many of! It was not overly crowded anytime we went either.  The room was basic and clean. It was nice having a refridgerator and microwave in the room. The room was not luxurious, but nothing wrong with it either.  We thought the staff was pelasant and helpful as well.  I would recommend this place

Summary Heading: Great location - You get what you pay for
Summary: There are so many mixed reviews for this property and I really panicked prior to staying there, that I had made a terrible mistake but my worries were unfounded. After flying in from a 14 hour flight with a jump of the international date line, I had emailed with my booking a request for early arrival.  I didn't think I had a hope, so I was extremely surprised when we they handed us our room keys at 9am in the morning - Brilliant. We had booked a king room with jacuzzi on the ground floor and even though our room was the very last room right in the back corner, it really had it's bonuses.  Nobody walked past our room making noise and we could open the curtains without people starring in.  Also being the last room meant we had extra windows facing out to a rear properties carpark,

We have stayed here a few times before because of the location and price.  The cleanliness was always only so -so (gross carpet), the breakfast mediocre, and the staff not the friendliest.  This past March my grandfather passed away the morning of the day we were supposed to check in.  We called to cancel and were promised 50% refund of the deposit back to our credit card and the other 50% on our account for a future stay.  When we went last week, this credit was not found.  The person in charge of the situation was left a note, I emailed twice and left a voicemail.  I have not heard back yet and the situation has not been resolved.  The lack of professionalism with this establishment is very frustrating.  I will never return or will likely never recommend it to anyone.

The Park Vue Inn was more than I expected.  Loctated directly across the main entrance of Disneyland, fantastic friendly and helpful staff - even had a free welcome basket with wine, water and fruit in our room on arrival.  We had a family suite that had 2 queen beds in one room and a pull out sofa in the living room, there was also a kitchenette!  The only negative was the sofa bed - pretty old, missing springs and very uncomfortable (we needed to use it too since we travelled with our 4 children) Overall, would definately stay there again.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Spot To Lay Your Head
Summary: Our experience at the Park Vue Inn was great. When we arrived we were placed in our room straight away no waiting. The front desk staff very helpful they accepted packages on our behalf and we were always notified the parcels were there by a voice message on our phone. We also had a difference in our room rate from what when we booked but the staff promptly fixed the issue. Our room was clean and comfortable the bathroom did have a sewer  smell in it but we just left the window opened and it got better , but we did notice the smell when we were in disneyland so i think the whole suburb has a sewer smell issue not the hotel. We had a 1 bedroom which had 2 queen beds in it and the lounge area had a sofa bed. The room had a small kitchenette in it which was good but we would have

Perfect location to Disneyland.  Rooms were decent, beds & pillows need major upgrade.  We used our own pillows.  Our reservation was messed up by the front desk clerk.  Our friends were issued keys to 2 different rooms, and each time they walked in on guests already occupying the room.  We got a phone call from the front desk asking if we needed anything.  We asked for extra towels and they said they would be right down.  No one ever showed up.  We waited for over an hour before leaving the room.  When checking out , there was no one at the front desk to check us out.  We waited at the front desk for 5 minutes before anyone showed up.  The only thing this hotel has going for it is the location and the free parking.
Manager Response: Dear RRDUtah, I would like to extend my sincerest apologies for the lack of follow-through and professionalism of my staff during your stay. We take your feedback and opinions very seriously and I can promise you we will address the issues that you have identified.  Please know that your experience comes as a complete shock to me, as we have over 58 excellent Trip Advisor reviews.  I will research your stay and showcase your experiences on our next weekly training huddle.  Sincerely, Scalzo Hospitality, Inc.

Summary Heading: Staff was rude and very patronizing!
Summary: While the rooms were clean and comfortable the front desk staff were extremely rude!  Upon check-in the front desk clerk overcharged my bank card by about $300.  Later when I realized this I returned to the front desk to have him fix it.  While trying to "fix it" he overdrew my account resulting in three separate overdraft fees of $35 each!  The girl that came to help him was rude and very patronizing.  She did not apologize and said there was nothing they could do about the overdraft fees.  I asked to speak with the manager.  He was in a "meeting and couldn't speak with me".  Last time I checked I was the customer and was spending a good deal of money at his hotel.
