I think he could have a taken a few minutes to speak with me.  Finally later that day another front desk employee

Overall, a pretty good hotel. It's location is perfect (it is right across the street from the main entrance to Disneyland) and the free breakfast is a nice perk.  However, be forewarned - getting breakfast is difficult as the breakfast area is small and there are a lot of people trying to get some food at the same time.  Our room was a queen-sized suite w/ bunk beds, it was tiny and a bit dated.  However, since we only slept there, it really wasn't an issue.  The microwave did not work nor did the coffee maker.  But when we arrived, there was a nice fruit basket with a bottle of wine and a nice, personal welcome letter that was much appreciated.  I don't think we'll stay at this hotel again should we return to Disneyland as I think there are better hotels at greater values in

I cannot ask for better ... the location is the best ... in my opinion, it is much better than the disney hotels distancewise and moneywise ... clean, free parking, free breakfast, free wireless, and amazing staff ...

Our experience at the Park Vue Inn was great.  We arrived at 10 a.m. on the day we would check in and they got us into our room right away rather than making us wait until check in time at 3:00 p.m.  Our room looked and smelled clean and they had the air conditioner already on so it was comfortable.  We had a queen bed and a bunk bed for the kids (they loved the bunk bed).  The fridge was older but worked fine and accomodated our needs and the microwave and iron both worked fine.  The room felt a little dated, but it was nothing different than most other budget hotels.  It was actually a motel, but it was fine with us.  It also had a room safe and free unsecured WIFI.  There was also all the basic cable channels so there were plenty of TV options.  The best part of the hotel was

Summary Heading: Comfortable and within a few minutes walking distance of Disneyland and DCA.
Summary: Having researched most if not every single accommodation within easy access of Disneyland that did not require the use of either a car or a bus we decided on staying at the Park Vue Inn for the following reasons. Having three children all under the age of 8 it was important that the accommodation we stayed at had the balance of comfort, space and within easy walking distance of both Disneyland and Disney's California Adventure theme parks. One would be forgiven in thinking that it's close proximity to Disneyland would make it costly. However it was very actually reasonably priced for a family of 5 and less expensive than most hotels that were in fact further away from Disneyland. (This however may be a reflection in the range of services provided by the other hotels in contrast

Summary Heading: Cockroaches and Spiders in room, yuck!
Summary: The room was very nice and the location is great but the first night there was a giant cockroach climbing the wall and the second night a big black spider was crawling on the bed right next to my 8 month old daughter.  We killed both the spider and the cockroach and gave them both to the hotel staff.  They didn't seem to care at all, we mentioned it again at check out and they were like, ok but was everything else ok with your stay.  Everything else about the room was nice but I personally don't like to stay somewhere that has cockroaches and spiders in the room.  For over $100 a night I expect no to have to share my room with bugs.

Our family stayed at the Park Vue Inn for one week earlier this month. We have 2 small children and the bunk beds were a plus. The room was very clean and each day the linen on the beds were changed. The staff was very courteous and always very helpful. We were there to visit Disneyland and the Park Vue Inn is actually alot closer to the entrance to the theme parks than the Disneyland hotels. We would return to the room in the afternoon to relax and each day, the room would already be cleaned by housekeeping. The pool and hot tub were very clean and towels were readily available poolside. The breakfast offered much variety such as cereals, bagels, waffles, juice, milk, coffee, etc. The food was always being replenished. There is also an outside patio area just outside the

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn in July of 2008 with our children and 2 other families.  While 2 families had a positive experience, the third had nothing but complaints.  Since our experience was positive we decided to try it again on a getaway for just my husband and myself.  For this we reserved a Single King room instead of a family suite.  What a mistake.   When we booked we were told about the Fruit Basket for returning guests and we were excited to see our Single King Room.  There was no gift basket....and The room was so small the door brushed the bed everytime we opened it.  The bathroom was the tiniest one I've ever experienced and the spontaneous hot and cold shower was interesting.  The room had an odor and just felt old, dirty and worn out.   However...we are on a

Summary Heading: I wasted 3 hours of precious holiday time
Summary: When I booked this hotel for 7 days, they got my credit card details and charged the first night outright. I couldn't arrive on the first day of reservation due to flight problems, advised PArk Vue, and told them that my sister from Italy will be checking in on the first day. They said it will not be a problem and asked for her name. When she was checking in, PArk Vue insisted she pay the 6 days  in advance(the first night was already charged from my credit card). My sister explained that it was our agreement that the accommodation was to be paid by me, that they could charge my credit card that they had on file but they insisted that my sister pay.  My sister asked if she can pay half(3 days) anyway, this was still to be considered an advance payment but they didn’t accept that

Was back in OC for a business trip in late July, so decided on some "me-time" with a three day stay in Anaheim.  Had just been there in September, and stayed at the Carousel Inn, and even though I disliked their parking and internet fees, the overall experience there was pretty good. However, looking to save a few steps and a few dollars, (and noting their free parking and wireless internet availability), I booked the Park Vue Inn instead.  BIG mistake.  With few exceptions, my overall experience was extremely negative.    I arrived in mid-morning, fully expecting my room would not be ready, and it wasn't, but they gave me a parking pass and I spent the rest of the morning and much of the afternoon at Disneyland.  When I arrived back late afternoon, was told to "hold on a

Terrible.  We stayed just a few hours and checked out.  There are a lot of other hotels close to Disney - don't pick this one just because of vicinity.  We had to change rooms right when we arrived due to a horrible smell.  Our new room was just a few doors down.  The beds creaked so bad and sank so low that we thought they would break.  An awful smell came out when you turned on the sink - not sure if it was the water or the drain.  My son described it as rotten eggs.  The window lock was broken.  Then we found a roach.  At that time we packed up and left.  Then the manager refused to come out and speak to us when we went to the front desk and refused to come to the phone when we called the next day.

Summary Heading: Convenient, Clean and Very, Very Nice Staff
Summary: My sister and I spent a week in LA and stayed at the Park Vue because of its location.  The check in staff were exceptionally friendly and called within 20 minutes to confirm the room met our expectations.  We were provided a basket of fresh fruit, bottled water and a bottle of wine - what a nice surprise!   We were able to walk to Disneyland within 5 minutes.  The breakfast provided was more than adequate to start the day.  The breakfast room was especially fun - getting to meet folks from around the US who were on their way to "the happiest place on earth," too.  Even though the motel is on a very, very busy street, our room was quiet; the bed was comfortable; and  the room nicely cleaned each day. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to friends and

We were a little bit nervous about any affordable hotels in this area but after reading for 7 hours on TRIP ADVERSOR, we decided to rent this one for 5 nights. The location is not just right across Disney as all the other one are advertising, it is also right across the main gates!!!! We were on the second floor and were so tired at night that we slept no problem. We had breakfast there every morning. If there is something missing, just ask...they will put more. The employes working in the breakfast area are not smiling (never) but who cares, we were there just the time to eat. The beds were comfortable, we had a fonctional fridge in our room and a microwave. The bathroom was old but we were able to take our shower. It serve the purpose. I read comment about stuff being stolen;

This hotel exceeded our needs and our expectations.  Our room was a suite with 3 queen beds and it was very spacious.  We planned our stay with frugality in mind, so we had brought our food (mostly frozen dinners/sandwiches/hot dogs) and returned to the hotel for our meals. We took full advantage of the micro/fridge combo. The proximity to the park is amazing and it allowed us to relax back in the room away from the crowds during our meals, and then head back out for more once we were ready.  We planned our meals around our fastpasses, ie, we would get the pass before we left the park, return to the hotel and eat/relax, then back to the front of the line for the attraction we had the pass for.  My husband was not as much of an adventurer as the kids and I were, so after dinner,

Horrible service!  We arrived to the Park Vue around 11am and were able to do a "early check-in".  At that moment I found out they did not have the room I requested available, so we were given an "upgraded room" with one King bed.  I have a young child and one bed was not going to work for two adults and one child.  They promised to have an extra bed brought into our room  After contacting the main desk three times, I was  told that they were sold out of the extra beds.  At this time it is 10pm and my child is getting tired.  They moved us to another room (the room we had requested originally) that someone just checked out of.  The room was supposed to be cleaned, but to my surprise there was hair all over the floor and when I pulled the covers back from the bed, there was hair

Summary Heading: Great for little legs. Closest to Disney's maingate!
Summary: We stayed 3 nights at the Park Vue Inn. Location was awesome! Was the closest to Disney as you can get except for whichever motel was one the other side of IHOP, I can't remember. We could easily walk to the main gate with our six year olds and  2 year old (in a stroller). The only thing between the motel and disney is a 4 lane street. We got the room with bunkbeds. There was no wall seperating them like I thought from the website. Everything was clean! There was a small fridge, microwave, and single cup coffee maker. We ate the traditional cold continental breakfast that they provide for free. The kids ate donuts and hubby and I had coffee and cereal. Then we snuck some fruit for the road. The only complaint I would have is the noise factor. We were upstairs so I'm sure that's

Summary Heading: Great location!! Literally right across the streets from Disneyland gates
Summary: We stayed here for 1 night during our 2-day visit to Disneyland.  We did not do anything except sleep in the room because we spent most of our time at the park.  We wanted a hotel right next door to Disneyland mainly so we can get up early and go to the park, also, to park our car! They have free parking for hotel guests.  The hotel staff were friendly and the rooms were clean.  We overslept so we called the front desk and they were nice about letting us check out at noon instead.   There is an iHop restaurant right next door and a few other restaurants within walking distance.  I highly recommend this hotel if you want a hotel literally right across the streets from Disneyland!

Summary Heading: Wonderful staff, great value, perfect location
Summary: I stayed with my 4 year old in one of the 2 queen bed rooms. While the wood furniture is definitely showing its age, and the mattresses are about due for replacement, and the TV is a bit on the small side, my room was clean and bug-free (always a concern during warmer weather). The larger refrigerator was great and the microwave definitely came in handy.  The staff was always friendly especially to my daughter who had never been to Disneyland. As other reviewers have mentioned, you couldn't possibly stay any closer to the parks unless you were to stay at the Grand California, which is actually located in California Adventures. In fact, the Park Vue is probably a shorter walk than to the Disneyland Hotel (but then you get the monorail, for Park Vue you've gotta use your legs). My

I want to thank the staff at the Park Vue for a wonderful experience. Staff was very accommodating and went out of their way to be helpful and friendly.   The ammenities in the rooms are better than at the Disney hotels. I appreciate having a mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker in my room We will be back  soon to enjoy their wonderful hospitality. Good job Park Vue!

My two daughters and I stayed May 14 to 18. While we agreed that the room was smaller and not as new/nice as the Disneyland Hotel we stayed at last time we all agreed that the distance from the park to the hotel and the vastly reduced cost made this a winner.  With kids (age 10), you could walk from the depths of Disneyland and be at the hotel in 10 minutes.  A nice touch was the fact that after 1/2 hour of being in the room the front desk called to ensure everything was fine or if more towels were needed.  The room had been very recently cleaned but unfortuntaely the cleaning agent smell was lingering when we entered the room.   The proximity to restaurants was also a bonus, particularly Mimi's.  I did not have any issue with the beds and do have a bad back.  The breakfast is

Summary Heading: Service OK, hotel nice, beds not comfortable
Summary: We arrived at the hotel for a 4 night stay across from Disneyland.  Check in was a breeze and very fast.  The hostess was very pleasant.  After opening our room and starting to unpack we received a phone call to verify everything was OK.  Very nice touch.  We had a room at the end of the row with a King bed and in room jacuzzi tub.  The room was layed out well, the tub was great and the bathroom was clean.  Some issues we had.   - We had some issues attempting to figure out how to keep water in the shower while showering.  The curtain did not seem to want to contain everything.  Shower had good pressure and lots of water. - On one evening the cleaning staff left a cleaning rag in our room on our cooler.  Additionally, while the coffee area was cleaned, it was not replenished.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay if Your Focus is Disneyland
Summary: The Park Vue Inn is a value hotel with one great asset: Location.    Unlike others on the Harbor Blvd. strip who may claim to be next to Disneyland, this one is the closest.  It is easier to walk to the entrance of both Disney parks from the Park Vue than it is from one of the Disney hotels - at less than half the price.  I stayed one week with a family of 4 in one of the suites.  I am glad I paid the extra freight for the suite because the normal rooms looked a bit tight.  It was reasonably quiet, the beds were comfortable, check-in and out were painless, a welcome basket was provided upon arrival, and you could view the Disney fireworks from your room.  Continental breakfast was sufficient, albeit basic.  All in all, I would recommend this hotel for people who are sightseers

Summary Heading: The Family Hotel across the road from Disneyland
Summary: We recently stayed at the Park Vue Inn for 10 nights from 29th April, 2009.  It is the PERFECT location for visiting Disneyland with young children ( 5 and 8 Year old ).  You can't get any better than walking literally across the road after a long day at the park. We found the hotel was very family friendly and we felt very comfortable the whole time staying there. The pool was great, the laundry was great ( wished it stayed it open longer than 10pm though ) the breakfast was great and staff helpful. It was a safe and relaxing place to come home to.   Only complaint would be the NOISE at times from the rooms above us. The constant sounds of children running up and down the hallways or rooms would echo through to our room. You could hear people in the rooms above our room. But by

Summary Heading: Why Did the Chicken Cross the Road?
Summary: I do not expect a hotel to perfect in every possible respect - and this one isn't. But when I visit a tourist destination, I want the hotel to be reasonably proximate to my end goal. Holy Moly! You can't get any closer to Disneyland than the Park Vue Inn. To paraphrase Groucho Marx, "If I get any closer, I'll be on the other side."  I think this hotel may be closer to the main gate than the Disneyland Hotel.    Closeness aside, this is an OK motel, especially for the price. The front desk guy was really nice (they offered us some warm chocolate chip cookies that just happened to be on the counter). The parking was right outside the room. The room was easy to access.  This facility has been around for awhile and in some respects shows that age. Some amenities are a bit tired. It

We stayed here after a co-worker recommended the location. It is literally right across the street from the main entrance. The location could not be any better unless you were staying inside the park! The rooms were neat and clean. Not a 5 star hotel, but it did the job. They provide free continental breakfast and Denny’s is right next door.  My then 2 year old had never slept in a regular bed before and he loved the beds!   Bottom line is this place is clean and location, location, location!

Summary Heading: The best value for Disney visitors.
Summary: I couldn't have been more pleased with the service, the room, the location, everything! When they didn't have the double I requested, they gave me a king jacuzzi room with a roll away at no additional charge. 15 mins after I checked in, they called the room to make sure everything was okay. Clean, right across the street from Disney, next door to IHOP, free parking (they didn't charge me for the last minute extra car either!). I'll stay here anytime I take trip to Disneyland.

I was a little worried about this hotel with it's VERY close proximity to the Disneyland/California Adventure gates and how busy it must be and the relatively low price.  Most of the reviews I read were positive, but there were a few negatives.  We found it to be a hotel in a busy area of hotels.  The lobby is comfortable and homey looking.  The desk staff were helpful, efficient, and courteous.  Our room was large enough (we spent the day at Disneyland and only needed a bathroom and bed by the time we returned!) and very clean.  We did not have any problems with noise, but were in a 2nd floor room at the end of the building.  The complimentary breakfast was okay, it would be better if it had some protein (bring some peanut butter to spread on toast).  The rooftop patio is nice

Summary Heading: Great Location, Friendly Staff & Service, Noisy room on bottom floor.
Summary: Service was great and very helpful. Rooms neat and tidy. Amenities good, free internet and local calls. Right Across the road from Disney entrance, excellent spot. Request a top floor room, the noise from rooms above can be very annoying and difficult when trying to sleep.  Good luck,  Fishers 2009 Australia.
No manager on site.  No security with luggage storage.  No first-aid kit or training.  Staff not trained to handle emergencies.

Summary Heading: Excellent stay, right across from the park
Summary: We stayed in room 140 with a spa tub. It was a wonderful room and unlike other reviews on this website, the tub filled up fast and was spectacular after walking all day at Disney. The iwireless nternet was EXTREMELY slow though. We told them that it was our anniversary and there was an excellent fruit and wine basket waiting for us when we arrived. They let us check in early, park and go into Disney. We picked up the keys when we came back that evening. The staff was wonderful and very accomodating. There was great coffee and fresh chocolate chip cookies in the office. The room had a microwave and refridgerator. Plenty of towels, two spa robes, and a comfortable bed. The business center didn't work when we were there, but the staff not only printed our boarding passes, but even

When searching the Disneyland area for a place to stay this seemed to be the most convenient and not a bad $ for the location.  It turned out to be a Great location, you can't beat the easy walk across the street right into Disneyland.  The continental breakfast that was offered was quite good - yogurts, fresh fruit, juices, bagels, croissants.  The room was very large and equipped with a microwave, coffeemaker, small refrigerator and hair dryer.  The beds were very comfortable.  If we were to return to this inn again, we would request a room without adjoining doors.  The adjoining doors had zero insulation, which made for a noice problem when the family next door returned from their day at the park.  Screaming kids running around shooting their toy guns and being yelled at by

We stayed at this hotel because of the glowing reviews it had received on Trip Advisor; however, we were sorely dissapointed.  The walls were paper thin,and we would hear people walking above us.  The pool was being renovated while we were there and no one cared to mention that when we made our reservations.  The beds were incredibly uncomfortable, the blankets had holes in them and the exit door was filthy on the inside.  Our children were crabby because they didn't sleep well and therefore our last day was somewhat miserable.  The breakfast was convenient and better than what I was expecting.  We will not stay there again even though they are right across the street from the main entrance.  It will be worth our time to walk a bit more for a good night's sleep.

Summary Heading: Amazing Hotel, Amazing Location, Amazing Staff
Summary: This was a life long dream to travel from the midwest, and take the kids to Disneyland.  We were thoughrally impressed with our location right across the street from Disney.  The Shuttle from the airport took all of the worry out of having to rent a car.  Upon arrival, we were greeted with warmth and class at this hotel, and treated like royalty.  The rooms were impecably clean and had pleanty of ammeities for a family of four.  We especially loved the breakfast buffet.  We found it to have more nutritional value than other breakfasts with a large assortment of juices,  and beverages, as well as cereals, rolls, waffels , and bagels.  We were able to enjoy our breakfast on the outside patio overlooking the entrance to Disney.  This feature alone was well worth the trip, as our

Summary Heading: Great for the price - perfect location for Disney
Summary: I booked The Park Vue direct with the hotel as it was cheaper than sites like Hotels.com.   Upon arrival we were greeted by a very friendly receptionist and our check in was a breeze. We were in our room within 10 minutes.   Our room was small and basic  but it was clean with one queen and bunk beds.  Waiting for us was a welcome gift of a basket of fruit and a bottle of wine - which we thought was a lovely touch.   There is a laundry room on site which was invaluable.  The complimentary breakfast was an added bonus and provided a great choice for everyone.   The hotel is litterally directly opposite the main entrance to Disneyland so we did not have too far to walk.    Walking round Disney can be very tiring so we used to go back to hotel early afternoon for a rest,  go for

For us, this location far exceeded our expectations. We booked our stay based primarily on the convenient location of the Park Vue Inn with relation to VALUE and REVIEWS. The fact of the matter is that we paid a reasonable price for a hotel with an exceptional location and a service-level that we require. The reviews on this site as well as 4 other sites, are mostly commendable. The only time that they are given a bad review is when someone expects 4 star service at a 2 star price. Suck it up "Sunshine"!  If you are planning a trip to Anaheim with the main intention of going to Disneyland and California Adventure for an awesome and affordable family vacation then this is the place for you! You honestly walk "ACROSS THE STREET" to get to the entrance. If the family wants to get

Summary Heading: Our well kept secret - Not anymore!
Summary: This review comes after over a year of our visit. But we have been unable to get a room on our recent visits, so guess the cat's out of the bag!  We stayed 2 nights Thanksgiving 2007 (yes, we're gluttons for punishment - visiting DL around big Holidays). As we began driving up to San Francisco, we fell sick from dinner (see my restaurant review), so we chose to drive back. Called the front desk and asked if we could stay another day  and if they would let us stay up to the following evening (24 hours) for the price of one night (since it would be *really* late check-out). They were cool since they were not fully booked. Nice touch!  The room was a little middle-aged, ahem. We had the view of a wall, but we spent maybe one full waking hour a day in the room, so we did not care.

Summary Heading: Another great stay at the Park Vue
Summary: This was our 2nd time staying here and we were not dissapointed.   Check in: Was a snap and the staff was very accomodating ( especially Yarindy, I believe her name was).  The Room: We recieved a single King Jacuzzi room which was fantastic after a long day at the parks.   Breakfast: Ehhh. It 's the usual stuff..... Muffins, Juice, Donuts.......etc.  Location: Can't be beat. The crosswalk to Disneyland is right in front.   The only downside we encountered were the people in front of the property doing some type of time-share sales pitch. Very annoying!   I would definitely reccomend this hotel/ motel. It's a clean, basic, friendly and extremely close place to stay at a reasonable price.

The Park Vue seems to be a family-run motel.  We had clean rooms with free wifi.  Front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful.  While waiting for my husband, I sat inthe lobby and  observed them keep their cool while dealing with an outrageously out-of-line guest.  Free coffee 24/7 in the small lobby.  Free breakfast - typical fare of the the value-type properties. An ice-cream shop is attached to the front - I think it was Coldstone. IHOP is next door just through the parking lot.  Many souvenier shops close by. This is on a very commercialized street.  Best attribute is that is truly just across the 4-lane street from the Disney arch/pathway you walk down to get to the security lines/tables leading into the entrances of Disneyland, California Adventure, and Downtown

We went to the Park Vue Inn as a referral from a friend.  We were so excited to actually be able to find a place close to Disneyland especially since we have two little ones that get tired quickly.    First of all, when I booked this hotel I did alot of research to find the best rate for the days we wanted but because of some older reviews, I wanted to book directly with the hotel.  So, I called them directly and told them I could get a better deal on....  And they tried to beat it.  I actually got a better deal than I would on another site.  Next, we were traveling with friends that had 4 kids.  We got the queen with the bunk beds and they got the 2 room suite.  Both were beautiful and very clean.     About 10min after we arrived and checked in, we received a phone call from

The Park Vue inn is in the perfect location for visiting the Disneyland Resort.  Directly across the road from the main entrance.  I travelled alone but think it would be a great place for families to stay too.  Being able to walk to Disneyland and not have to wait for a shuttle bus was a definite advantage for me.  My room was great, comfortable bed and very clean. Friendly and helpful staff. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to any travellers.

We just returned from a 6 night stay at the Park Vue Inn.  We had a wonderful time and would highly recommend this property.  The rooms were clean and well stocked.  The location couldn't be better as it was directly across the street from the entrance to Disneyland.  It took us maybe 5 minutes and that was even with having one of our family members in a wheelchair.  I have to say the walls are paper thin and very early in the morning you can hear the kids running up and down the halls, but who cares, we didn't let it affect our trip.  I plan on staying here everytime we go.

We wanted to be close to Disneyland park. We were just a crosswalk away - great location!! Being an older hotel, we were hesitant to book a room but we (two adults and two children under the age of 13) enjoyed our stay. We got a room on the main ground floor. There are no elevators but it's only two floors. The rooms were clean and the staff was very friendly and responded to our requests immediately. Parking was a breeze. They have a microwave and fridge. Our kids enjoyed the continental breakfast every morning. Thin walls and couldn't sleep one night when we got our new loud neighbors but overall, we had a memorable experience. Being so close to the park, you will hear the fireworks every night. They also offer kitchenette suites. There's a gift shop and Cold Stone creamery

We originally were going to stay Sept 6, 7 and 8.  When we checked in we realized this was another one of the hotels by Disney that feels they can charge $140 a night just because of their location.  The carpet was filthy.  Two tv's both with snowy screens.  When I called to see if they could take a look, the maintenance man shook the wires and said there was nothing he could do. This is a hectic parking lot and limousines were blocking the driveway.  I was told to go around and go out through IHOP's parking lot.  Thank goodness we didn't settle, especially for 140 a night!  We walked  to another nearby hotel and booked a room for the remainder of our stay.  The only plus for Park  Vue Inn is that they're right across the street from Disneyland.  If this is worth 140 a night to

While the location of the Park Vue Inn is convenient, we were given a room (243) for 8 days in the back left hand side (behind the IHOP) which unfortunately had a garbage dumpster from the next property below it. I asked for a quiet room (which would have been the other side backed up to the Desert Inn). We were woken up at least 3 times by the garbage pickups earlier than we needed to awaken.  When I asked to speak to a manager no one could help me. Front desk WOULD NOT cash a $50. travellers check after they took $838. from me in advance!  Breakfast OK but nothing special.  (Could not even get half and half for coffee-they serve coffeemate.) I recommend the place next door-the Desert Inn & Suites- use the coupons if you can in the FREE Travel Coupon Guide available almost

My grand daughter and I spent one night at Park Vue (room 124) to go to Disneyland.  Stayed here many years ago and it has been updated.  Double windows helped with keeping things quiet.  The room was clean, there was a coffee pot, small ref and the bathroom was immaculate.  When we go again to Disney, I would book this motel first.  The walk to Disney was a piece of cake for my old legs!  Had a nice (provided) breakfast at the motel before our trek.  Good variety too.  For parents with kids, this motel would be a fine choice, unless you are rich and can stay at the Grand Californian!
Located just across the main entrance of Disnelyand Park (SUPERB LOCATION), we find this hotel perfect for our one-day stay in Anaheim. Room clean, bathroom ok, friendly staff.

I chose this motel because I wanted a budget-priced motel close to Disney that provided breakfast, free parking and a pool. What we got was a budget-priced motel that was right at the crosswalk to Disney, a free breakfast, free parking and a pool. The pool didn't have slides but the kids didn't care - it was reasonably sized and the motel provided towels poolside. The kids loved it. The breakfast was fine: toast, cereal, fruit, waffles, yogurts and donuts. It was constantly stocked by the efficient and friendly attendant.   Our room was not ready when we arrived and I was a little unimpressed by the desk clerk, but others did their job fine and hey, I wasn't at a five-star hotel. They were quite helpful when we asked for information about Anaheim and nearby attractions.  The

We arrived at the Park Vue on July 29th. Room was ready when we got there and the front desk staff were very nice and helpful.  Our room was located near the back of the parking lot on the 2nd floor. Room was plain but overall clean. Beds were comfy enough. My biggest complaint would be that the sheets were GREY and the 1 bed had the pillow shams on it and the other bed had none. Pillows were very flat and the bed without shams was even missing some pillow cases. Now as we didn't spend a ton of time in the room we didn't bother saying anything. I did think that they would have at least thought on their own to make sure both beds had the shams and pillow cases. We did arrive the day of the earthquake so thought that maybe this was the case for the slightly unfinished look to the

Our family of five spent 4 nights at the Park Vue in early July.  We arrived at the hotel on a Tuesday afternoon and were given our room quickly. Our room was on the ground floor. We had a kitchen area with a small fridge, stove, microwave and coffee pot. Our room also had a sitting area with a fold out couch, a fireplace and a flat screen tv. Off the sitting area was a bedroom with 2 queen sized beds a full sized closet, dresser a small table with two chairs and a second tv. We were very happy with our room. There was plenty of space for the five of us and Disney was such a short walk away that we were able to come back to the room for lunch and a rest in the heat of the afternoon. The other thing we enjoyed about the motel was that it was very quiet. We had driven almost 30

We booked rooms 145, 146, and 210. When we first went in our rooms we all had thought they were doable rooms, the $128 price tag on a Monday and Tuesday was I think a little much but we agreed because of the location. The problem we had was not really with the room, just the room mates that came with the room. COCKROACHES!!!!! Mom was freaked out, sis was freaked out, I had to be the exterminator that night. I caught 2 (they were nice sized, about 1 1/2 inches long. The rest got away. They did come back out at night on the walls but would scurry away when the lights came on. We told the receptionist about the roaches but she insisted they were "Palm Bugs" I showed her the 2 critters and even after seeing them for herself she insisted they were these palm bugs and they couldn't

*read this reveiw if you want some information on this hotel*  My Family stayed here July 2008 for 5 days.(we have 3 kids ages 1,4,10, there were 3 adults, so 6 of us total) We got a room with a queen bed, a bunk bed and a crib. Check in is at 3:00 We arrived early at 2:00 and the room was ready so they let us in our room. about 20 minutes later, the front desk called our room to make sure we had everything we needed.   The room was clean and cozy. The kids loved the huge bunk beds. The crib was set up next to our bed. There was a mini fridge and microwave. The fridge worked fine keeping the food cold, but the very small freezer did not work to freeze any of our water/soda bottles. Our room was first floor, next to the gift shop.The hotel is the closest to disneyland. You walk

We (2 adults, 2 children) stayed for 5 nights and the best thing about the hotel was the location...check in was ok (tried to check in early but the room was not ready, although we were allowed to park, then go get lunch/shop until the room was ready).  Front desk said they would call when the room was ready but they never did.  The room was clean, but the air conditioner was not quite strong enough (we were there during a heatwave).  The refrig/microwave in the room were a great convenience.  During the heat of the day we walked back to the room from disney (about a 6 min walk) and had lunch and cooled off.  Used the laundry room.  Everything worked fine.  Breakfast was ok.  We paid $120/night.  Normally, we go through Priceline and get a way better rate, but cannot get such a

For the money you cant beat this hotel for its location. I have stayed on property (disneyland hotel+ paradise pier) and the walk from park vue to the front gate was much-much faster.  I cant believe how much $ we could have saved if we would have stayed here our whole trip.(We split it up between this hotel and paradise pier.) I walked down to the little store and bought food,pop, and cocktail fixins".  The room had a fridge and a microwave so that saved alot of money. The breakfast was great and had everything we needed. Yeah the room was a little small and dark but for $60.00 bucks a night, I can deal with it. We were traveling with our 7 and 9 year old girls and I never felt unsafe. They loved the bunkbeds! I would stay here again just for the location and value,I probley

The best part of our stay was how close the hotel was to Disney It was directly across the the street!  Check in was the worst part ever. We were an hour early, so they took all our information and told us to come back in one hour. Well we came back 3 hours later and ther was a line out the door! One poor girl was checking everyone in, and when the phone would ring she would answer it and we would all have to wait longer. It took another hour before it was our turn, only to be told our room was still not ready! They gave us a different room which seemed a bit dirty, and the bed was not completely ready. It had a room with what was supposed to be a large whirlpool tub( it was not) Housekeeping was very slow, not until late afternoon would they come around. I think the most

Hi  I;m from singapore and stayed in Park vue for US$93/nite including breakfast from May 26 till May 30 2008.  In general I quite like the place.  Pro Very very close to DL..just by the traffic lights. would recommend to families with small children and those would would like to make multiple to and fro trips Would even recommend the place to grandparents as well. Good variety of breakfast Quite a good size of 2 Q room..rollaway reasonable priced at US$10/nite prompt service by maintainance guys  Cons need a  little improvement fr reception - long Queue as there is only 1 receptionist at work.  Other hotels are nearby too..I would go back if the price is a little lower :-)..  Overall I've a enjoyable holiday

We had a very good experience at this hotel. We had booked 2 ajoining rooms for 10 nights but when we arrived the rooms were not joined. In a matter of 2 days we had upgraded ajoining rooms. The staff are very professional and helpful. When they found out it was our granddaughter's birthday, they placed 2 gifts in the room. She was so excited about her new Minnie Mouse and a Disney T shirt. The rooms we had were clean and there was no shortage of towels. The pool was good as well. The only problem we had was the noise from other guests. We would go back to this hotel anytime. The location could not have been better!  Joanne Sirois from Nova Scotia Canada

Pleasant, prompt and helpful service from all staff; clean rooms; good selection of breakfast items to start the day and save some $$.   Enjoyed the pool too.  And of course, the location cannot be beat.  Would definitely stay again, and will recommend to others.

This was the worst hotel stay I have ever experienced.  We approached our chioce of hotels near Disney with the thought that as long as it was clean and quiet, we didn't need luxury - after all - we would be in the park all day.  The Park Vue Inn was directly across from the stop light that allows you to cross over to the main gates, so it made perfect sense.  NO!!!!!  The floorplan for the room we chose on their website did not even exist. So once we got there, we were stuck with too few beds and bathrooms for too many people.  The towels were worn beyond belief and were an icky beige - as though the hotel had not learned of the modern invention of bleach.  The pillows were little balls of lumpy foam.  The carpet was so dirty, my feet were black after crossing from the shower

Summary Heading: I hope our experience wasn't typical
Summary: Our room was nice when we arrived.  We didn't thoroughly check it out until we were in for the night.  When I pulled the sheets back on our bed, the mattress was soaked, it had soaked through the mattress pad and sheets. Instead of offering to immediately move us to a new room, the maintenance man came and flipped the mattress over, and re-made the bed!  My husband demanded they move us to a new room.  They did, but it was a smaller room, and not entirely clean, itself.  The next day they upgraded us to a suite and credited our room rate, but it still made for a less than pleasant experience.

Stayed for one night midweek We drove from Palm Springs on Wednesday morning and arrived at 8AM -Front desk was very curteous and I did a pre-check-in -They took my Credit card info, let me know what room I will be in (so I could park near it), gave me a parking pass for that day and the next and said our room would be ready at 3PM -We parked the car and walked literally across the street to Disney. Very Easy -Returned at 8PM got our key and went to the room  Very basic motel room - Seemed clean and not too noisy - In the morning went to the breakfast room -Not to busy at 8AM- there was a woman restocking and cleaning up -Lots of fruit, crossants, cereal, donuts etc. Threw our stuff in the trunk, checked out and walked over to DL for the day again - Came back at 8PM and drove

I picked this hotel from Expedia and it wasn't rated very high (two & a half stars). We hired a mid sized car from the airport which Hertz upgraded for free so we could get a GPS. There are many freeways criss crossing Los Angeles and you won't get a GPS if you hire the cheapest cars available.   The main office of the Park Vue Inn was being renovated when we arrived late January 2008. They were operating from a aluminium shed but there was always someone there and they were helpful enough.   There was a IHOPS (International House of Pancakes) restuarant right next door. It is open 24 hours but it never disturbs your sleep. The food is very reasonably priced and you can get some great breakfasts. I think it was $6 for all you can eat pancakes.   There was a Tony Romas Famous

Just returned from a one week stay at the Park Vue Inn.  You cannot beat this place for location as it is located on Harbour Boulevard directly across from the entrance to Disneyland.  In less than 5 minutes you can be in the park or at Downtown Disney.  Many restaurants within easy walking distance as well.  Although it is one of the smaller hotels with only two floors, the rooms are clean and well maintained.  Small television, but if you are here for Disney then you are likely to be watching only for weather updates and cartoons in the morning.  Our room had a small fridge, microwave and coffee.   We had room 217, which was directly across from the swimming pool.  It was nice as it was close to the stair.  On one side of our room was the service room for the maids which gave

First the bad.   The hotel has a way of booking that is different than what I am used to.  We booked through their website back in feb and as it turns out they only get an approval authorization, rather than actually charging your card.  It's a bit of a shock when you think your room is all paid for and then you find out that it isn't, but after several calls to my credit card company I did, indeed, find out my card hadn't been charged in february.  My sister also went with us and rented a car and the same way of charging also applied.. so once we figured that out we were OK.  Oh, and also when you book through the hotel and you think you have the final fee/bill it says at the bottom tax is not included... so plan for that.  The hotel staff/front desk was very patient and

not as nice as I thought it would be.  the best part of this hotel is it close to the gate, the rooms are just ok but dont take off your socks the carpet is filthy, tiny tv, the safe in the room was a joke it was not even bolted to the floor it fell over when I touched it, the breakfast  was not to bad you got the normal stuff  the only thing when we were ther they had to tar the roof for seval days when we where eating breakfast that was thoughtful smelling tar when your eating. there are better hotels in the area. oh! yea they tried to charge me for A crib when the website said no charge $18 . dont pay $150 rate not worth it. I might stay if I got the $100 rate again.

We just returned from Disneyland and had stayed 3 nights at the Parkvue inn in a 2 room 3 queen room.  I will say that the fact of the hotel being directely across the street is a major plus.  It was about 5 mins from our room the gates of both parks.  The hotel lobby is still under construction and the office is in a trailer in the parking lot.  The room was nothing to write home about but worked for a place to sleep.  The beds feel as if they are at the end of good use and are way soft.  There was a bit of mold in the bathroom and the room did smell a bit musty if the fan and ac were not running.  The staff was nice and took care of what was needed.  The way we looked at it we were in Ca to spend time at Disneyand not in the room.  All in all it is a good place for the price

This is the third hotel we've stayed at near the crosswalk to Disneyland, and it was comparable to the others.  Nothing fancy, but a good basic, clean place to sleep within very easy walking distance to the main gates.  So much better than staying farther away and dealing with parking and shuttles!  Our room had two queens in one room and another queen in a separate bedroom.  It was comfortable for our family of six.  There was a small fridge and microwave, and there were two tvs and free wifi.  Our room was at the back of the property, on the second floor.  This is very nice because it's quiet, but it does mean a longer walk to the street, and there is no elevator, so we had to lug all of our bags up the stairs.  Also, there was no easy way to get our stroller up the stairs, so

I booked and pre-paid a 2-queen room for 2 nights through Hotels.com. When we arrived, I was told that we could only have a 2Q for one night, and that we would have to move into a 1Q + bunk beds for the second night. I couldn't have either for both nights...we're sorry. I called Hotels.com to express my annoyance at not getting what I'd paid for. They said they'd never heard of such a thing and called the hotel themselves. Seems that the hotel had no other room available for either night, and since I hadn't booked through them, I was the lucky one to get "bumped". Hotels.com gave me a twenty dollar per night credit, but Park Vue gave me nothing. Okay, not a good start, but we were on vacation, so we'd make the best of it, although some sort of compensation or at least

This motel is directly across from the entrance to the parks! The room we stayed in was a good size, with a king size bed, a fridge, microwave and a safe. They provided a nice welcome basket on arrival, which included a bottle of wine, two bottles of water and some fresh fruit. Very handy! Room service was pretty good. Some times they'd be really early and some times they were really late. But usually they were pretty good. The reception was undergoing some construction while we where there, but it didn't really affect us. We would deffinately stay here again. Great price, and it's SO close!

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn in March for a last minute trip to Disneyland.  Since we booked last minute, there were very few hotels available and we chose the Park Vue because of its location.  We are annual passholders that normally like to stay at one of the Disney hotels, but since it was last minute there were no rooms available at an affordable rate.  Usually we will get discounted rates for being passholders.    One good thing about the Park Vue Inn was its location.  You are directly across the street from the sidewalk entrance to the park.  It took us about 5 minutes to walk to the turnstiles of Disneyland with our two kids, ages 3 and 6.  The room itself was ok.  The bathroom looked like it had been renovated, and there was a fruit and wine basket left for us when we

If you are looking for a basic hotel with no thrills, this is the place. Just a nice basic family place to stay with an easy walk to Disneyland. The kids loved the bunk beds and the night lights on each bunk were a nice touch. Free internet access was nice. If you need a lot of space, brand new towels and sheets, a water slide, etc, find a five star hotel. The hotel is a little damp. The hot water at times may take up to 4 mins to get to your shower.  Just let it run and wait.  Again, you get what you pay for. We did not have any issues with noise on the second floor.  In fact, we did not hear anything outside of our room (except the fireworks at 9:30 each night). The pool does what a pool should do, get you wet and cool you down. (Is it really supposed to be 85 in March?).  The

We are from Canada and we recently came back from California. The Park Vue is the way to go for a family Disney vacation as it has it's location at the entrance of the park. Yes it is a 2.5-3 star hotel. Our room tended to be a bit small for four people because we chose the bunk bed room but who tends to be in the room anyhow as you are there for the attractions. We found it very accomodating, clean, staff was helpful and friendly, and the best touch was getting a free fruit and wine basket as a welcoming gift. The free continental breakfast was very well done for a starter in the morning. It had hot and cold cereal, waffles, toast, croissants, fruit, juice and coffee. They are renovating the front entrance so there is no lobby which it is a bit of an inconvenience but they were

Summary Heading: There has to be better choices...
Summary: Stayed here for only one night in February.  Booked it due to the good reviews here, the low price, and the proximity to Disneyland. We had no idea that the whole front part was under construction, the room was sub-par, and the bed had a canyon in the middle of it.  There are dozens and dozens of motels close to Disneyland.  We were sorry that we chose this place, and were grateful that it was only for one night.

When we arrived they were working on remodeling their front desk.  Upon making my reservation with them, I was not advised that their front office is in a small shed like facility in the interum.  It looked like one of the construction buildings/storage units.  Once we walked quite away down their facility we realized it and found the building.  The front desk person was on the phone and not very attentive to us (the only ones in the office).  She wasn't talking to someone about the hotel or arrangements.  After she was off the phone she did a great job. The first room we were sent to was at the back of the facility in the corner.  It was a small room stuffy room.  When I turned on the air/heat unit it shot out black stuff in my face (window unit).  Once on, it was fine.  We

We stayed in a room that had one king bed and a jacuzzi tub (in addition to the bathroom tub/shower).  If it weren't for the proximity to Disneyland and that Jacuzzi tub, we probably wouldn't stay here again.  the good:    -The hotel is DIRECTLY across the street from the pedestrian access to Disneyland.    -the jacuzzi tub was wonderful after walking around for 12 hrs at Disneyland.  the bad:  -the walls are PAPER thin.  I don't know if they need some sound insulation at the doors that connect the rooms or what, but it sounded like the family next door was in our room.  Fortunately our room was at the end of the line, so we only had to share one wall.  -the towels and linens are old.  The sheets were so worn/old that the elastic wouldn't hold the fitted sheet onto the mattress

Friends recommended this hotel to us - it is directly opposite the gates to Disneyland - perfect location, yet quiet.  The desk staff were most helpful, and always ended by saying "our pleasure to serve you". Price averaged out to $100 per nite including all taxes and "energy charge".  This included the best continental breakfast I have ever seen in a hotel. Real fruit, juices, yogurt, both white and wheat toast, waffles to toast, croissants, and the ever-present donut/danish. Our 5 grandkids started the day well every day, and so did we! A great place to stay!!!

This hotel is the closest one to the crosswalk that you take to get to the main entrance to Disneyland/CA Adventure.  There are other motels that are also "across the street", but you have to walk a block or so to get to the main crosswalk.    It's nothing fancy, but it is clean and well maintained, and the staff was helpful and friendly.  They were able to check us into one of our two rooms at Noon, but said if they couldn't, that they would store our luggage until it was ready.  We rented two rooms with two queen beds in each.  There was a fruit basket with bottled water and wine  when we got to our rooms, and the front desk called us to be sure everything was to our liking.   The rooms, closet, and bathrooms were large.  Only issue was that our tub wouldn't plug so made baths

We just returned from a 3 night stay.  We were in a bunk bed room on the ground floor.  Our kids loved the bunk beds.  We loved the closeness to the park, especially at night when the kids were tired.  The staff was accomondating and friendly.  We were a bit surprised to see the construction occuring, but it did not affect our stay other than we almost missed the entrance.  The only concern we had during our stay was the dampness of the room.    The weather was cool and rainy during our stay.  We attempted to put on the heater, but we did not have heat.  When we put on the fan, the fire alarm beeped sporadically.  And the first day, my husband had to take a cold shower.

We stayed at Park Vue Inn for 5 nights.  My overall review is that we stayed here for the Location to Disneyland.  If it was not for the location, we may not stay here again.  The walking entrance to DL is directly across the street.  This makes it nice to come back to the room after a long day in DL.  We spent 4 nights in the 2 Double Room- it was very roomy, however the beds were comfy but they made really weird sounds, like you could hear the springs pop while you were sleeping.  The walls were very thin, and we think there was a family of elephants staying above us.   The last night we changed rooms because my kids wanted to stay in the Bunk bed room with one queen.  That room was upstairs and had the worst bed- hard and made even worse sounds.  The kids loved the bunk beds,

This hotel was great.  You cant get much closer to Disneyland than this hotel!  The beds were comfy, the room was big, the staff was nice (but a little slow at times).  The bathroom was huge and redone, it was great.  The breakfast was good, but go as early as possible because the other guests would eat all the good stuff up.  I also really appreciated the fact that they didnt care how many people were in our room, as long as we were comfortable they didnt care.  We had the room with 2 queen beds and had 6 adults plus 2 kids.  We took both the beds and pushed them away from eachother against the walls and then put an air mattress in the middle for 2 of the adults, then the kids had their own air mattresses at the foot of the 2 main beds, and there was still walking room and

Summary Heading: Clean, VERY Close, comfortable Love the bunk beds!
Summary: This is a  very clean, comfortable hotel right at the crosswalk across from Disneyland. It's the closet hotel to the Main Gate.  The only downside was that there is no elevator to the second floor. Otherwise, we enjoyed our stay. Our room had bunk beds which my 2 boys loved. There was a small refrigerator, which helped to keep bottles, sodas or whatever in.  The bathroom is small, but very adequate.  The complimentary breakfast was more than adequate. We enjoyed waffles, bagels, fruit, cereal, instant oatmeal, milk, juice, muffins, danishes. What more could you want for the price paid??  We will stay here again and again. 5 stars!!

We stayed at the Park Vue January 27th - January 31st 2008.  The location cannot be beat.  Literally a three minute walk to the main gate and that's with a 2 year old. Hotel - A little surprised to see the lobby torn up for remodel and a Cold Stone Creamery being put in.  Lobby will be closed for another 8 weeks.  We had to check in in a little trailer, really no big deal.  Hair dryer was broken when we entered the room, it was replaced within 3 minutes (very impressed).  All in all, I was very impressed with the Park Vue.  Rooms are set up very nice with a separate tiled area with fridge, microwave, and sink.  Shower had great pressure, and beds were extremely comfortable.  This may sound sutpid, but the ability to park right outside the room door was a huge plus since we had

We arrived at 1200 and were allowed to go to our room immediately. We were very pleased with our room on the 2nd floor with 1 bedroom and it had 3 queen sized beds. Reception sent us a basket of fruit and Champagne completely surprising us. Our stay was for 6 nights and we could not find fault with anything. Definitely will be staying here next trip. The room was always clean, however I would recommend the top floor as the floor is probably squeaky when you stay on the ground floor (like lots of motels in USA). Reception is in a shipping container at the moment as they are refurbishing their offices.

I go to Disneyland several times a year, and this was my first time staying at the Park Vue. My lodging needs are pretty basic, since I don't spend that much time in the room, so I'm not one to need a lot of amenities.   I arrived at the motel just before 6:30 AM (event in the park), and knew it was too early to "officially" check in, but the early morning staff was very friendly and after checking my reservation gave me my parking pass for my car.   When I did check into my room later that afternoon, I found a room that was clean and well stocked with towels, a fridge, microwave and coffee maker. In the closet was a safe, iron and ironing board. The beds were pillow top mattresses and were very comfortable. I did find it a bit strange that the towel rack was actually in the

If you are looking for basic accomodations at an affordable price with the best location to Disneyland....then this is the place! The Inn is located just a short walk from the park entrance, and offers clean and comfortable rooms with a small fridge, coffeepot, iron and hair dryer. Just a word of caution for couples.......ask for a room with 2 queen beds as opposed to a single king. The rooms with 2 queen beds are quite a bit larger! Each reservation includes breakfast....which offers hot and cold cereals, muffins, waffles, fresh fruit, coffee and juices. We actually grabbed extra fruit to eat later!

We were unable to book into the Best Western Park Place Inn next door, so we tried the Park Vue Inn. Are we ever glad we did! The rooms at the Park Vue Inn are bigger, brighter, and cleaner . We also liked having two queen sized beds vs a queen bed and an uncomfortable pull out couch like next door. Plus, the room was much cheaper here at the Park Vue Inn. The free continental breakfast is similar to others in the area. Toast, toaster waffles, donuts,cereal,yogurt, apples, bananas, oranges, coffee, juice . We brought our own jar of peanut butter from home to add a little more protein to the breakfast. There were enough tables to sit at and there is also an outdoor roof top patio which is reported to be good to watch the fireworks from . The rooms are quiet and very clean . There

We have stayed on the disney property hotels, and some nearby hotels too... We paid a lot of money for the other places, a lot!... And we decided to try the Park Vue...   We are a family of 6... So finding accomodations is sometimes hard.  ALL I HAVE TO SAY IS WOW!    At this location you may not get the rooms with views of disney, but they do offer the terrace you use.  And even enjoy coffee or something from the tables on the terrace.    But the rooms are very spacious... The little kitchenettes are amazing... We were all soo greatly satisfied with the room.... Ohhh and by the way... The tub, in the bathroom has jets... so its a a huge plus for the little ones to play/splash around in!    The rooms were clean... There was more than enough room for everyone... Tons of food

Can't be beat for location, cleanliness, and comfort for a Disneyland visit.  Was traveling with my adult daughter , on a budget, and was pleased to find an affordable place across the street from Disneyland (no parking, shuttle hassles) Beds were comfortable, and the continental breakfast with waffles, yogurt, fruit, juice, and cereal held us all day at the park.  Has a 24 hour  IHop next door, and a nice  gift shop right there.  Pool area looked very clean and nice, and if it hadn't been January we would have enjoyed it.  Desk staff was friendly.  The outdoor corridors were well-lit, so we felt safe walking to our room even after dark.  Will definately stay there again, and recommend it to others. Menomonee Falls, WI  January 2008.

Everything was perfect. Check in went smoothly. The staff was very polite and helpful. Hotel grounds were very clean. The room was clean and had lots of space. I loved the fact that they had a fridge and microwave in the room. The beds were very comfortable.  The sheets were very clean. Pillows where nice and soft! Pool was clean at all times. They had a small laundry room that was well kept.  I see a few people mention that the walls are thin I had the opposite experince. We are all light sleepers and had no problem with noises out of the rooms. Maids were also very polite and always had our room stocked up.  I have no complaints on the park vue so far this has been the best hotel we have stayed at in the disney area. the price was great! I paid about $95 a night I love the

My partner and I have been staying at this property for about five years now. We absolutely love this place. Especially since their complete renovation a few years ago. We go about 3-4 times a year to Disneyland and we stay here at the Park Vue inn every time for more that two nights at a time. We have never had any complaints during our stay, and like everyone else says, the park is so close, within walking distance, not even five minutes. The front desk staff has always been helpful and courteous. I noticed on other peoples reviews of this establishment that they are getting fruit baskets and wine....hmmm could that be true, like i said i stay here 3-4 times a year and have yet to receive any sort of basket from them,,,,,,oh well i'm staying at the Parkvue this coming thursday

We like staying here since it is close to Disneyland and DCA.  It is right near the signal where you cross the street to go to the parks.  It is about a 5 minute walk to the park entrance.  Hotel is nothing special for us, just a place to stay.  Rooms were nicely decorated.  There were lots of fluffly towels in the room.  Although we thought there needs to be more soundproofing between the rooms.  We could hear people's conversations next door.  There is plenty of parking available.  We have stayed at other hotels nearby and parking tends to be unavailable if you arrive late.  One thing we noticed this time upon check in was that the hotel is a non-smoking hotel.  At least we don't have to worry about getting stuck with a smoking room.    TV reception was decent this time.  It

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while visiting Disneyland
Summary: We took our 18 year old twins on a surprise trip to Disneyland for their birthdays and wanted to stay very near the park, as we planned to spend our entire days there and use the motel for sleeping only. The Park Vue Inn did exactly that and did it well.      We arrived via limo from the airport about 9 p.m. and were greeted by a very friendly front desk person. Our room was a standard motel room, but very adequate for our needs. The front desk girl called our room soon after we unpacked to make sure everything was OK.  It was a nice touch.       The room was quiet and the beds comfortable. We did not have a chance to try the breakfast or any other motel services.      The best part is the motel was right across the street from Disneyland, so we could walk back to our room in

We just got back from the Park Vue Inn.  I can't say enough good things about the property.  First of all it is literally right across the street from Disneyland/California Adventure.  We timed our walk from the hotel and it was less than four minutes to the front gate.  Breakfast was an added plus.   On our second day, we were pleasantly surprised with a complimentary fruit and wine basket.    We have done  A LOT of traveling and have never had a hotel give us a basket before.   A great holiday treat.  We definitely will be staying here again.

I stayed at the Park Vue 3 nights. I had a Jacuzzi King Suite. Oh the location can't be beat. The Jacuzzi rooms are located in the back, it still was worth the walk. The suite was large and the jacuzzi tub was to die for.   I know most people go with kids, this is definite for a solo relaxing person, or a couple. I was also given a fruit basket and bottle of wine  the day before I left. I was unable to enjoy the wine because of the cork with no cork screw. ???   The bed had LOTS of nice comfortable pillows. There was the jacuzzi in the middle of the large king suite, a large area by the additional bath with a tub and shower. The pressure was great. So many fluffy real towels. If you go to the web page you can view the Jacuzzi suite, but the picture does it no justice.  I also

I booked this hotel on the strength of it's proximatey to DisneyLand. It wasn't the cheapest in the area and certainly not the most expensive, but it's location just cannot be beaten, it is right opposite the main entrance (you could even see the monorail from our room) 5 mins walk at the most and your walking down Main Street! (depending on the street light and ticket booth queue) On arrival my Husband and I were greeted by staff in reception who seemed genuinly pleased to meet us and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We were assigned a double room on the top floor which was extremely comfortable and clean, there were amenities in the bathroom plus tea and coffee making facilities and a fridge. We were welcomed with a fruit basket and bottle of wine.  Reception

To begin with, we have visited Disneyland a number of times.  We have two children and priorities (with respect to lodgings) change over time.  We have stayed at the Castle Inn (where there was a wading pool), the Carriage Inn and Howard Johnson.  Our first inclination was to return to the Howard Johnson.  We have stayed there several times and have recommended it to numerous friends.    We decided to switch away from the Howard Johnson in order to gain two things:  a complimentary breakfast and separate beds for our 10 and 12 year old boys.  The boys are too heavy to lift from one bed to another and go to sleep more easily when they are not sharing a bed.  Anyhow, after considerable internet research, we decided that we’d give the Park Vue Inn a try.  We were very disappointed

Summary Heading: Everything we needed & so close to Disneyland!
Summary: The Park Vue Inn was great - - it met all of our needs.  They let us arrive early, even though our room wasn't ready (approx. 9am day of check-in) and leave our car in their lot so we could go to Disneyland.  Then, the next day after we checked out, they allowed us to leave our car in their lot all day again, while we visited California Adventure.  That saved us a lot of money on parking!  I can't remember exactly what we paid for the hotel accommodation, but it was just about $100 including taxes.    The appearance of the hotel is very nice on the outside.  The rooms are clean and simple: King Bed, TV, microwave, etc.  They offer a pleasing complimentary breakfast with things like fruit, juice, coffee, cereal, muffins/danishes/doughnuts, etc.    The best part about this hotel

Dump, Dump, Dump.  Noisy, Noisy, Noisy. If you don't like to sleep this is a great place to stay!  I have never stayed in a hotel where the other guest were so inconsiderate.   As for the room if you like sleeping on dingy,  stained sheets then great this is the place for you.  The only good thing about this hotel is that it is across the street from disneyland.   Oh and the staff at the front desk was nice.

First off my family goes to Disneyland at least once a year and sometimes 2 times. We went there on 10/20/07 for 2 days. We have stayed at the Park Vue many times before. Since they renovated the place it is an excellent place for a family to go to Disneyland and walk back during the day for a break instead of waiting for a shuttle. The staff was excellent from check in to check out. After we check in I got a call from the front desk just to make sure everything was ok. Then we received a nice fruit basket from the hotel with a bottle of wine as a thank you. When we got home I checked my e-mail and received one from Park vue thanking me once more.   We have stayed at all the hotels across the street from Disneyland and they were ok but the Park Vue gave that little extra to make

The only good thing about this hotel was location - right across the street from Disneyland.  Other than that, my exerperience was lousy.  The rooms are small, and the property is very noisy.  Both mornings we were awakened by the obnoxious beeping sound of a large truck backing up over and over again in the driveway....at 6:30am.  They charged us daily for use of the safe; they charged us for use of the wireless internet; the television got about 3 decent channels.  Next time, I'm staying next door at the Best Western.
Manager Response: Our sincerest apology to the traveler from Marin County. We greatly value our guests and have round the clock Guest Assistance Services and each member of our team is empowered to ensure the guest's stay is a pleasurable one. We regret our loss to make things right for you and would be very grateful for a second opportunity to make a first impression.

Summary: The Park Vue Inn was beyond my expections and I would like to recommend it to anyone looking for acommodation in Anaheim. We could not have been closer to Disneyland, an easy 5 minute walk and you're in Disneyland or California Adventure. The room we had was clean and very nice . We stayed on the bottom floor and only heard an occasional sound, barely worth mentioning, certainly nothing to keep us awake.We chose a 2 queen bed room with a seperate living room. It had 2 queen beds in a bedroom with a television and a double sofa bed in the living room with a plasma television. The bedroom had both ceiling fans and an air conditioner and the living area had an air conditioner also. It had a full kitchen and a second vanity area in the kitchen which made it much easier for 4 people

Summary Heading: Not bad for the money and CLOSE to DL!
Summary: We spent a long weekend here so we could see the last Angels games of the regular season and spend some time at one of my favorite places - Disneyland!   We had made a reservation and wanted a king bed  in a room that was closer to the front of the hotel and on the first floor, but they said they didn't have one that was available for all our nights. So we ended up at the back of the property on the 2nd floor, with 2 double beds. No big deal really, it's a just a preference.  The room was quiet and clean, plenty of space for my husband and I. The bathroom had the vanity outside of the tub abd toilet area, which is nice for getting ready in the mornings. The beds were ok to sleep on and we really didn't notice any noise from our neighbors. The fridge was a welcome sight too,

Summary Heading: Mostly a Great Stay With a Couple of Disappointments...
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue Inn Oct. 3 - 13.  First off, it was a great trip and the location was absolutely perfect for us with a 4 year old.  FIRST THE GOOD:  the hotel itself is situated directly across from the main gate and is about a 6 min. walk, exactly as other reviewers stated it was.  The exterior was well kept and the rooms were reasonably clean and odour free.  We didn't have much interaction with the staff but they seemed very cheerful and informative.  NOW THE NOT SO GOOD:  I had requested 7 months in advance when I booked, to have a room with bunkbeds on the TOP floor.  My 2 kids (1 boy & 1 girl) don't sleep well together in the same bed, so the bunks was kind of important and was the main reason i booked this hotel.  When I arrived at 2:30 our room wasn't ready,

Great four nights top floor towards the back ,quiet, housekeeping did a great job everyone friendly very good breakfast more than just donuts staff on hand to keep it stocked and clean... heated pool  was NICE after a long hard day of FUN.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful comments and candid response. We take pride in ensuring that our guests here are taken care of and always return with the same great experience time and time again. I will make sure that our staff read your comments and appreciation to be a part of a such a company providing excellant customer service. Let us know what else we can do to better serve you. Thank you once again. Park Vue Inn looks forward to having you here in the future

Summary Heading: great value at the park vue
Summary: We started our holiday in california at the Park Vue Inn and rated it the best of the three hotels we stayed in. The rooms were clean and well equipped, the facilities were excellent, children loved the quiet enclosed pool for late afternoon swims. The complimentary breakfast was plentiful in choice and quantity and was a very pleasant surprise after the reviews i had previously read. I would definitely stay here again, certainly the nearest hotel to disneyland barring the onsite luxury ones. Great value for money and exactly the right start to our californian holiday. Staff were pleasant and informative.

Summary Heading: Make sure you keep your cancellation number
Summary: I've stayed at Park Vue several times enjoyed every stay thoroughly, except this time I called and canceled my stay 2 weeks in advance, and since I didnt write down my cancellation number got charged full price. The guy that supposedly canceled my reso read a number/letter combo off to me just didnt write it down.  I've canceled here before no problems, the only positive was they said I can stay there again with  half what I was charged applied to balance of my next stay. Better than nothing I suppose. Just remember write your cancellation number down and keep it till you see you credit card statement

You really can't get any closer to Disneyland than the Park Vue Inn. They offer clean, affordable rooms with a pool and free breakfast. Staff was friendly and helpful. My family of five stayed in a bunk bed room, with an additional roll away bed. We didn't need much more than a place to sleep and swim. There was also a mini fridge in our room which we used. The bathroom was clean and the water pressure in the shower was great (a must for a gal with long hair).   The Park Vue was perfect for our needs, and within our budget!

Our family of four, 2 parents, 2 kids 6 & 10, recently stayed at the Park Vue Inn for three nights as part of a 10 day trip to California.  Our room had one queen and one bunk bed with a newly updated bathroom. Although we felt the room was a bit compact, it afforded us just enough space for us and our 3 large suitcases.  Upon check-in, we were greeted in a friendly manner. We arrived early about 1pm which was 2 hours before check-in time, but we were able to complete the paperwork, and were able to put our luggage in a locked room next to the desk area while we went for lunch and a walk around the area before returning at 3pm to get into our room.   The only complaint I had, is there was a surcharge of $2 per day added to our bill, an environment tax they said. Now two dollars

Summary Heading: Manager needs help in customer service
Summary: I stayed at the Park Vue in July of 07.  We had never stayed there before and would not recomend it to anyone.  The hotel itself was fine, but the manager needs some help.  We were sitting in the lobby waiting for our room to be cleaned at 3:30 in the afternoon when another customer came in with a concern.  He was concerned about the fact that their room was never ready before late afternoon.  They had small children who needed to take naps after a long morning at Disneyland.  He explained to the manager that his wife had made the beds herself for three days and they had to find the maids to get clean towels. He was not upset just concerned.  The manager proceeded to scream at the man and call him a liar multiple times.  This was something that could have easily been handled.

Short walk to Disneyland Entrance across the street.  Easy walk to Ihop,Tony Roma's, Denny's.  We got a free upgrade to king size bed w/jacuzzi.  Refridgerator / microwave included.  Room was clean.  Continental Breakfast--bananas, apple, cereal, coffee, etc.  just basic stuff.  Will definately stay here again.  We loved it because we parked the car and had the convenience of leaving the park and coming back for the much needed naps.  Staff was courteous.

Our family recently stayed for 5 nights, and it was great.  Nice clean rooms, spacious, and the property was not only well kept, it was an excellent location when you are on a Disney Vacation. We arrived much earlier then the check in and they had the room ready for us when we returned in 2 hours.   A family of 5 the one bedroom suite was great. The continental breakfast was good and always well stocked.  Staff was friendly and I have to again mention location location location.  I would stay again.

My husband and I stayed for 5 days in April 2007. I chose the hotel as we wanted somewhere moderately priced and very close to Disneyland. As other reviewers have said, you could not stay any closer. It is right next to the pedestrian crossing from the resort. The walk to the park entrance took less than 5 minutes.  The hotel is what in Australia we would call motel -style, ie the rooms are accessed from an external balcony. There is car parking in front of the ground floor rooms. I requested a 2nd floor room when we booked through Expedia, and we were given one.
