There is some noise when people go by your room in the morning, but just what you would expect from a motel of this type. The room was otherwise quiet.  The front desk staff were polite and helpful, and all the requests

I booked a one bedroom suite with kitchen and one regular room for a 2 night stay over Easter weekend.  We arrived early and were checked into our room by 1:00 p.m.  The suite was well appointed with a plasma tv, comfy couch and two queen beds in a seperate bedroom.  The bathroom had a jetted tub, and there was an extra vanity area ajacent to the kitchen.  There was a small stove and frig, but no utensils or cooking items.  I went down to the front desk and the owner happened to be in his office.  He told me that he would purchase the items I needed and have them put in our room for the morning.  Our daughter and her family checked in around 4 and they had a regular room on the 2nd floor.  It was roomy and clean, plenty big enough for the 3 of them.  The front desk personnel

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn in April during Spring Break.  The hotel served its purpose of being located right across the street from the Disneyland entrance.  I’m not really picky when it comes to hotels, but I really wasn’t too happy with our room at the Park Vue Inn. When we arrived in Anaheim, we checked into the hotel and was greeted by very friendly hotel staff and promptly checked us in.  When we got into our rooms, it had a somewhat musty smell coming from the bathroom?  We also found that the rug must have been shampooed recently as it felt damp still?  Overall, the room was visibly clean and organized.  The bathroom walls need some paint as there were patches/repairs that needed touching up with paint.  We had no problems of low shower pressure and there was always

Although the location can't be beat, right acroos the street from the Disneyland Parks, we had other issues. At first we were happy with the room...basic, clean, fridge and 2 beds. The first problem was the shower head. If you don't mind streams in different directions, not a problem. I couldn't wash my hair without moving my head in circles to try to catch the water. A bigger issue were the mattresses. My daughter and I both itched the entire night and woke up with bites all over. The sheets were changed by very friendly staff, but the problem didn't go away. We had no choice but to stay since it was Easter week and everyone else was sold out. we tried the complimentary breakfast only once. By the time we arrived "everything" was gone. I asked the worker there and she said that

I booked by Entertainment Book for savings. I paid $99 week days, $120 weekend nights.  My dates of stay were March 3, 4, 5, 6, and 7th.   Hotel location is perfect for Disney and CA theme park. Literally  the closest hotel across the st. from entrance to these popular attractions.  In my opinion, it is even better than the actual Disney Hotels as far as distance you must walk to gain entrance to the parks. You should not need a vehicle unless you wish to travel to other locations/attractions since most everything at least that I needed, was easily within short walking distance.   Key points from my hotel experience:  Book upstairs to avoid hearing other's foot steps above you, hense, excess noise. It can be loud when folks return from park in pm when it closes. I had room

We stayed at the Park Vue for a week, while visiting Disneyland in February and the beginning of March. It was absolutely wonderful for our little family- we got a room with bunk beds, which my kids thought was terrific, there was a nice sized refrigerator and a microwave, coffeemaker (though the coffee wasn't great) and hair dryer- anything you'd need. The mattresses were very comfortable. The shower head was a bit low, but there was good water pressure and adequate hot water at all times. The room wasn't very big, but there was enough space for us to do everything we needed, and we weren't there to hang out at the hotel anyway. There is a coin-op guest laundry with 3 washers and 3 dryers, the dryers consistently did their job the first time. The pool was warm enough to be fun

We stayed at this Hotel from February 24-28th. The location was great and it was certainly clean enough. Unfortunately, we left (hidden in a duffle bag) $150.00 and it was stolen from our room!  Be sure to use the safe if you stay here. Do not leave any valuables or cash (yes, we are stupid) as the maid service will take off with it. The management did nothing about it. In addition, we had absolutely no internet service available to us during our stay (We were promised this service). We would not stay here again, as our complaints were not handled properly by the Hotel (Expedia did their best to help out).  We're bummed out because other than the Internet and the theft issue it would be a Hotel we would consider staying at in the future.

My family  (two adults and 2 children aged 3 & 5) stayed at the Park Vue in December 2006. We booked a standard room - two queen sized beds. We asked for an upstairs room after reading on this site about the noise if you had a ground floor room. Our friends downstairs had a lovely suite, but they did find it a bit noisy, but i believe that the suites are all downstairs.  The experience was excellent.  The room was quite spacious, exceptionally good value for the money, and included a microwave. The housekeeping staff were very good - even washing up some mugs and plates of ours, which we thought very good service. The room was very clean. My only criticism could be that the curtains didn't quite reach together, but this is such a small niggle in an overwhelmingly good

Summary Heading: Park Vue location can't be beat!!!
Summary: We stayed in the family suite for 10 days in mid February.  There were 3 queen size beds, one being in its own room with t.v.  We are a family with 5 kids and the 3 little ones shared one bed easily.  I liked having a fridge and microwave.  We left the park at 1:00 or so, to have a swim and lunch.  We would head back around 4:00.  Our location was quiet, near the pool.  We did hear a garbage truck each morning, but we were up anyhow.    The kids loved the pool and swam every day.  It was heated and not a bad size.  The breakfast was fine.  Pastries, toast , muffins, apples ,bananas and cereal and milk.  My kids loved it.  I usually added a yogurt in my room.  I used the laundry and found it worked well.  The best thing was the location.  It  is right at the crosswalk to

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn for 7 nights.  We enjoyed the location - right across from the Disneyland entrance.   We were surprised at how quiet our room was.  Other than hearing people walk by our room occasionally, we hardly noticed other sounds.  It was about the quiestest motel room we have ever stayed in.  We had a full kitchen in our suite but no dishes, utensils or cookware.  That was disappointing.  We did appreciate the second sink and mirror outside the bathroom.  There were six adults sharing the suite and it did get stuffy.  The hide - a - bed was quite saggy, but I guess that is to be expected.  The staff were curteous and helpful.  Our room was always very tidy when we came back at the end of the day, with plenty of towels.  The kids tried out the swimming pool

We are just back from 3 nights at the Park Vue Inn and were So Happy we chose it!  Of course it's not a fancy hotel, but our room, though small, was obviously re-done with new furniture and wallpaper.  The breakfast was just fine and we were all able to fill up on toast, cereal, pastries, juice, coffee and fresh fruit.    For  $72/night for the first two nights and $62 for the third (via their website) we were very satisfied.  You are literally at the crosswalk to the main entrance to DLand & DCA.   Just an excellent location.  If you're looking for a luxury hotel with nice amenities, this is not the place for you.  If you're looking for a clean, safe, convenient, affordable, friendly place to lay your head after a day at the park, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

I just stayed for a couple of nights at the Park Vue Inn. The location was fantastic, however, it was $211.00 for two nights on a AAA discount,...it was more like a $50.00 a night motel. The room had a horrible musty smell to it, and we tried opening the windows, burning a candle, etc...It never went away. The bathtub wouldn't hold the water, I LOVE baths. The tub would not  plug. So much for that! We were close to the breaksfast room, so people, and KIDS were running by our room constantly from 6:30 am until 9am, when we got up...it was deafeningly loud. Stay all the way towards the back of the property, if you have a choice. I see people complain about the breakfast. I thought it was fine...wonderful sugar doughnuts, good coffee, wonderful orange juice,...not super healthy,

Summary Heading: Pleasant stay, not a top class lodge, though
Summary: The rooms are decently equipped, it feels safe all day long, nice crew, but sincerely the continental braksfast they serve is less than I expected. the dining room smelled like stale paint and most of the meals are not over average. All in all if you can afford to go just at the IHOP located just beside the hotel your stay at the park Vue Inn can become more pleasant. The crew speaks fluent spanish, you can get directly at the lobby tickets for Disneyland and it is located just in front of the main entrance of the park. Such a location is worth it all.

We stayed only one of our three nights because when I got up the next morning there were giant cockroaches in the bathroom.  I was terrified!  I have a three month old and two other kids under five.  The thought of having those bugs crawling on us and everything while we slept still make me squirm.  Yes, its very close to the park but stick with a good neighbor hotel or one that is not infested with giant cockroaches.  Also the hotel displays a Disney Good Neighbor Hotel logo, but I called Disney travel and found out they are not affiliated with Disney.  Since our stay, I have been trying to get them to refund my nights stay, but so far have only gotten the run around.

My husband and I were pleasantly surprised with this Hotel. The location was perfect. You can't get any closer to Disneyland and After a long day it's great. We even went back to the room to change clothes (after the Grizzly River Run) and were back at Disneyland in no time! We spent Christmas in the Park and it was crowded but a great time. We had a room on the 2nd floor and didn't hear a thing.  The room was clean and basic. Nice to have a fridge for snacks and drinks. Everyone talks about the poor breakfast. It's a typical continental breakfast.  ereal, toast, donuts, yogurt, fruit, juice, coffee. Good enough to start the day. When we go back to Disneyland, we'll definately stay here and recommend this hotel to everyone!

My son and I stayed here for 2 nights, 1/23/07 & 1/24/07.  The hotel recently renovated and the place looks great!    Check-in was fast and easy. Very friendly staff.    We got a room upstairs in the back and it was very quiet.  The rooms have new bedding, new carpet, new marble counters etc.  Everything was just great.    Only flaw would be the boring free breakfast. More variety would be a big improvement.     We will be staying every time we go to Disneyland.  Just a 30 second walk across the road and your on Disneyland property!

Took the advice of other reviewers of this hotel and very happy we did. When we arrived we were told we had been upgraded at no extra cost. The room was a decent size, clean and well set out. Other reviewers advised to ask for a room on the first floor as it would be quieter - we heard nothing except a couple of people walk by our room on the way to breakfast. I imagine the ground floor would be noisier as cars were parked right outside the units.  We could not believe that Disneyland was across the road! Just so convenient if you want to return to the hotel during the middle of the day to have a break from the crowds or grab some warmer clothes for the evening.  The only disappointment was that the breakfast room was being renovated at the time and we had to walk over a half

Summary Heading: Close to D.land, but choose room carefully
Summary: Staff was friendly.  We checked in very early (10:00 am), thinking we would have to wait until later for our room.  They actually had a room ready, and set us up right away.  There may only be one other hotel that is physically closer to Disneyland's front gate.  Hotel sells D-land tickets, which saves time at the front entrance.  Room turned out to be a handicapped room, right next to the laundry room.  5:30 am rolled around and it started to get a bit noisy with the day crew coming on.  If I stayed there again, I would try for the second floor, away from the laundry room.  Breakfast bar was low end.  Cold cereal, muffins & toast, some fruit.

This is my second stay at Park Vue (Aug '02 and Sep '06) and honestly for the price when compared to hotels surrounding it, its a bargain plus its DIRECTLY across the road from Disneyland main entrance.  (Having said that you've still got to walk 5 mins to get from the entrance to ticket booths but its so convenient.)  This is the place to stay if you'd like to save some dollars on accomm to spend in Disneyland instead.  We stayed in a Single King (2 people) that is in the same wing as Reception and the room was comfortable and provided everything you'd expect.  The breakfast area was being renovated at the time so we took our breakfast back to our room or sat by the pool instead of sitting in the tiny breakfast room.  IHOP is right next door and they do enormous American-sized

We stayed in the two room family suite, room was great, staff were very helpful and friendly, you can also book your trips through the hotel, location is excellent for disney and there are plenty of places to eat close by, continental breakfast was great and plenty of it, We will be staying here again next time we visit from the UK

I was very apprehensive about the hotel as I had seen some mixed reviews, but having stayed there for 4 nights this month, I have no hesitation in recommending it to families visiting Disney, it is right across the road!  You cannot ask for a better location!  There are plenty of restaurants all around (off park) and the complimentary breakfast buffet (continental) is fabulous........a healthy option to start the day!  There is onsite parking for which you are not charged, you dont need your car at all while visiting this area.  The pool is great for chilling after the park gets too much and the rooms are comfortable and spacious, although a bit gloomy due to lack of natural light.  Only downside is the noise of families returning from the park at night so request a room further

Summary Heading: The Lesser Of the Harbor Blvd. Evils
Summary: We decided to try Park Vue Inn when our "usual" Disney motel, Park Place Inn next door, was totally booked, and I noticed in Trip Advisor reviews that it's recently been renovated. I also booked Anaheim Desert Inn, which we have tried, in case I got cold feet about Park Vue. I stayed unsure, and kept researching until I found useful info on another travel review site, where they list construction and renovation dates of hotels. Out of the top possible motels "across the street," Park Vue was the oldest original construction -- I was very nervous. We finally decided to just take a chance and try Park Vue. We're glad we did.   We have previously stayed at Park Place Inn, Tropicana Inn and Anaheim Desert Inn -- along with the Park Vue, the closest four in a row at the Disneyland

We stayed at the Park Vue inn on Dec 22-24. Our stay was wonderful. All we had to do to get to Disneyland was walk across the street! It was great! They had a continental breakfast every morning, and it was ok. Dry cereal, juice, donuts, croissants, coffee, fruits, oatmeal. The selection is better when you get there first thing. The second morning there wasn't as much, but it was still good. We stayed in a room with 2 bunk beds and a queen sized bed. It was very nice. The ONLY complaint I really had was that the hot water didn't get very hot at all in the shower. The room was cleaned by housekeeping every day and we had no problems at all. We parked right in front of our room. The first night we were there, the fireworks woke us up! We could actually see them from our room

Firstly, the other reviews advising of the wonderful location, are completely accurate. You just cannot get better.  It really is on the edge of the eastern gate of Disneyland. I stayed only one night, being in the middle of the Californian winter. After having done extensive walking and rides, it was a fantastic relief to only walk across the road and tumble into the room. I've read reviews about the "poor beds" and the poor "standard of the rooms". Well, these reviews are now ancient history. The entire property has been renovated and quite well done too. The temporary breakfast area was unusual, but, that is what happens when renovations/improvements occur. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. Remember, it is a three star hotel, so don't expect flowing water

Summary Heading: Great deal on a nice hotel
Summary: This has to be the best bargain in Anaheim.  It is directly across from the Park entrance and has really reasonable prices.  It is closer to the gates of Disneyland/California Adventure than the Disneyland Hotel.  Great staff and nice amenities make this a hotel we will definitely return to.    When staying at a hotel, my first consideration is cleanliness.  There were nine of us traveling – five adults and four children.  We booked three of the “newly remodeled” bunk-bed rooms.  All three of our rooms were very clean, as was the entire hotel property.  There were always plenty of linens in our room and the rooms were made up everyday.    There was a newspaper delivered outside of the rooms each day as well.    We were in rooms 208, 209 and 210.  Very nice, very clean rooms with

Summary Heading: LOVED the jacuzzi tub in room!
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue in October and I was wary because we always stay at the hojo but the Park Vue has a jacuzzi tub in-room so we gave it a try.    The room was recently remodeled, the bathroom looked completely new and was very nice.  We LOVED the in-room tub, it was awesome after a day at Disneyland!!  The furniture was ok, my only complaint with the room is that the bed was kind of hard for my taste and the linens seemed to be pretty low quality.  But nothing is more condusive to sleep than a full day at DLR!  So it didn't bother us too much.  I didn't experience a problem with noise and my husband is a light sleeper.    Our room was on the second floor all the way in the back so we weren't near the road, I will be sure the request that again when we come back.  I can

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Park  Vue ....again
Summary: We enjoyed our 2 night stay at the Park  Vue Inn.  The place looked nicer than we remembered it to be when we stayed there about 6 years ago...better parking and more spacious in the lot.  We were able to check in early and park the car in the lot and parked there for a few hrs even after we checked out.  The room was clean and spacious, frig and m/wave spotless and handy to have for snacks.  Breakfast could offer a better choice....hopefully they will add to the menu when they finish with their NEW breakfast area.  The hotel couldn't be more convenient to the Disneyland entrance - IHOP and Dennys on either side, close to Mimi's Cafe, Tony Romas, McDonalds and some small restaurants and shops.  Dennys wasn't crowded around 5:00 on Friday night - got right in between our trips to

Summary Heading: Anaheim's Best Kept Secret! (Honolulu, Hawaii, Oct. 2006)
Summary: I don't know where the rest of these people were staying but in my view, Park Vue Inn was marvelous! No problems!  Have to admit I was a little wary because of past reviews but all was wonderful!!  We arrived at 7:00am, (myself, husband and twin 9 year old sons)I asked if we could have an early check in and they put us right into a room.  There was enough space for all of us. A COMFORTABLE Queen sized bed and adult sized bunk beds.  Housekeeping was wonderful and always made sure we had fresh towels, soap, shampoo, coffee and cups.   The room was spotless.  Drain was a little slow in the bathtub but liveable.  There is a small mirrored fitness center off the lobby area which we used every morning.  There is a stationary bike, treadmill, eliptical and "band" weight machine.

Summary Heading: Do not stay in this hotel
Summary: The walls are paper thin.  You can hear the people all around you. When you took off your shoes the carpets were sticky  and within an hour the room started to smell like an outhouse only to find out that raw sewage was coming up through the bathroom sink.  The kitchen sink was completely clogged up.  Every time you ran any water, more sewage came up through the pipes.  When I complained to the front desk, they sent a maintenance man over to our room only to find out it would take several hours to fix the problem.  We immediately packed our bags.  The hotel did not have another room to move us to.  We had to go to another hotel nearby and pay a premium price for a hotel room but it was worth it to get out of that health hazard.

My family and I have stayed at the Park Vue Inn two times. Both times we had difficulties.  The first time, we had scheduled a late check in. When we arrived I was told that they had given our room away because we were late. They did find the information about our late check in and apologized.  They gave us a room, however not the room originally requested.  We put our young children to bed and could not get the heater working. I complained. They could not give us a new room, and assured us the heater would be fixed the next day. The next night the heater did not work. I complained again. They said they would fix or replace the heater. The third and final night it still did not work.  We spent three nights in an incredibly cold room.  The seconded trip, I again made a request

Summary Heading: A very nice, clean, hotel with lots of amenities!
Summary: As part of a Birthday gift, I treated my girlfriend to two days at Disneyland & DCA with an overnight stay at a nearby hotel. After much research on the internet, I decided to try out the Park Vue Inn.    It's not a 5 star hotel like Bellagio in Las Vegas, but for the hospitality, cleanliness, convenience (directly across the street from Disneyland's main entrance), complimentary continental breakfast, professionalism of the staff, and convenient parking (even during construction) I would rate this a 4 out of 5.    Upon entering our room, there were extra towels, linens, and pillows set out.  The carpet was spotless and everything was immaculate. Amenities included a coffeemaker, microwave oven, mini-fridge, hairdryer, and iron+ironing board. The tiled bathroom contained a

WE stayed at the Park Vue Inn on September 30th thru October 4th. We had a two room suite as our party was 3 adults and 3 children and needed the second room and also 3 queen beds. We were so happy with our rooms, we had previously stayed here, maybe 4 or 5 years ago and it was just so-so, this time the rooms were clean, large, and the beds were heavenly! WE didn't want to leave on Wednesday morning. The front desk was very helpful, and maid service was very impressive, our rooms were nice and clean after a long day at the Disney parks. The pool was clean and refreshing, altho not the largest, it was nice for a quick cool down. My only suggestion would be to add some protein to the  breakfast bar, as there was not any thing substansial there in the mornings, we went to IHOP and

This hotel was so convenient just steps from the main entrance clean rooms with comfortable beds a beautifull garden out front with a fountain . The staff was so friendly when and if we needed something we had it. I must say great hotel.I would stay there again.The best part of our vacation was Shell Vacations Club they have a dest in the back lobby of Park Vue they were very helpfull with directions and they new where to find brocures on everything we were looking for If their not inside you can find them out side saying good morning as you walk by the hotel .They were giving out disney dollars to familys who went on their timeshare tour 90 minutes of time and free subway for lunch. We were leaving town the next day and were not going back to disney land so instead they offered

Summary Heading: Nice jacuzzi, in front of entrance
Summary: After a (hot) day in Disneyland, we wanted to find a room close to the park, because we wanted to visit again the day after.  Park Vue Inn was across the street, with some restaurants and bars closeby. And they had a nice pool and free parking space and continental breakfast.  We took a room with a jacuzzi ($100), and it was worth it> The jacuzzi was big and clean, and it was a nice thing to lie with my girlfriend in the bubbling water after a long and hot day in Disneyland. We felt reborn after spending 45 minits in the jacuzzi.  After that we had a bit in one of the restaurants closeby, and had a drink in the (Hawaiian?) bar just around the corner.  There were indeed some people at the front entrance asking if we were intrested in some time sharing, but as soon as we said no,

I loved this hotel; this was my first time staying at the Park Vue Inn. I have stayed in Anaheim three times and no doubt I would choose this hotel again.   When we arrived at noon, out hotel was ready for us right away as I had requested an early check-in. We walked into our room and were very pleased with the layout and cleanliness. We had a plasma tv and fireplace with a jacuzzi tub in the bathroom with a vanity both in the bathroom and outside of the bathroom. As an added bonus there were housecoats and new slippers in the closet.   Every morning we received a complimentary newspaper. The breakfast room was ok. It had toast, muffins and other pastries with juice and coffee. You could purchase cereal or yogurt there as well. Our rooms were kept very clean and there were

My review comes from a "first time in USA Englishman" view point so forgive me if some details seem old to the more experienced among us.    This hotel has an excellent position in relation to acessing disneyland (if not THE best compared to competitors): All you do to get to Disneyland is cross the street. Very useful when travelling by foot, or returning to your hotel in a hurry or tired etc.    If you do use a car during your stay, it can be parked on site for free,  and close to your room if you're lucky.   We found the cold temperature of the water in the pool took some getting used to, but our children used it every day. The pool itself has been thoughtfully landscaped so as not to be over looked.    The on site gift shop is marvelous, has Disney goods at much lower prices

We stayed at the Park Vue Inn the end of July, GREAT Location and price, just 5 minutes from Disneyland Gate. The Conteniental Breakfast was OK, but IHOP is right next door, we were able to take a break for lunch and a swim  in the pool during the day to get refreshed. Very clean and the staff was excellent, we left Saturday night and we were able to leave our car parked there , so no parking fees, but we checked with hotel staff first. We will certainly be back, we were very pleased

We just stayed at Park vue Inn and it was alright stay. It is across the street from the entrance so you can't beat the location. The bed was very soft which made it very uncomfortable for my wife. The breakfast simply consisted of dry toast (NO PEANUT BUTTER!) small muffins and some donuts plus tieny tiny juice cups and coffee. You had to pay extra for cereal, yogurt etc. There is no internet access in the room plus the hotel is too cheap to pay for cable so you simply get the local channels (which are very fuzzy) plus some cable channels off of the satellite.  The pool was very clean but the pool chairs definetly need an upgrade. At night it was very cool to watch the fireworks from your room. All in all it was an ok place to stay but I would try something different if I

We were worried about staying here as there had been some poor reviews, but opinions seemed to have improved and it received high praise.  Location is excellent as it really is across the road from Disney.  We were allowed to check in early and the staff were helpful and friendly, but a little "jobsworth".  The breakfast was very basic, toast, fruit and pastries.  The shop on site was very good and sold most things.  We had 4 rooms for 8 days and one of the rooms had a flood and some clothes were ruined.  It took ages for the plumber to arrive and even then there was a drip.  Also the hotel is very noisy, not from guests, but from the maids starting work very early and talking very loudly and laughing a lot at 6.00 a.m.  Overall I was not impressed.  It was cheap but I would not

Arrived in Anaheim for a month's holiday in the USA.  After many many weeks of planning and reviewing on Tripadvisor we arrived at Park Vue Inn and shown a room very different to what I had expected and requested confirmation of prior to leaving.  There were five of us 2 adults, 3 girls, 2 x teenager, 1 8 yr old.  Mgmt agreed the room we were allocated would be very tight fit with roll away and luggage.  They then offered me additional room for extra US20.00/night.  Then gave us a wonderful extra room with jacuzzi in adults room.  So top marks.  We had five nights with the girls and Mum and Dad able to get some space after busy days in Disneyland.   Our bed was soooo comfortable - the best bed we have slept in for a long time- even better than home.  The pool area we found very

We just returned from a 6 day stay at the Park Vue Inn and had a wonderful time.  We're a family of ten (Grandma, Children and Grandchildren) and booked 3 rooms.  PVI was able to give us 3 rooms together with 2 of them connecting, which was very convenient.  The rooms were very clean and new looking.  It was so very nice to have the refrigerator and microwave in the room.  We stopped at Target on the way in and bought lots of bottled water and snacks.  Check in was easy and the front desk staff friendly and helpful.  When we needed extra towels, they sent them right up.  We did have a clogged toilet, but it was fixed within 10 minutes of calling the desk. Being so close to Disneyland was so nice....a quick walk when Grandma needed a break!  IHOP is right there, but none of us

First of all for convenience this hotel totally delivers.  It is truly across the street from Disneyland!  We even watched the fireworks from our room.  There is a nice souvenir and convenience shop on site, and the Denny's next store was accommodating about takeouts.  When we arrived in the early AM, Park Vue Inn allowed us to park and go to Disneyland even though checkin was in the afternoon. The room was nicely renovated but there was a problem with the shower floor being higher than the rest of the bathroom.  Every time someone took a shower, water seeped over the whole bathroom and into the tiled-floor sink and kitchen area.  I found this hazardous.   Also, the hotel lobby was not conducive to hanging around, which was really noticeable compared to the hotel we had just

Summary Heading: Ok place, not the best customer service, but close to DL
Summary: One great thing that I can say is that we were able to get a room one day prior to arriving,,,what a blessing! Park Vue is literaly the closest hotel to DL and Calif adventure, you have to stay here if you are looking for convenince! The rooms are clean but plain, wierd thing is that the air conditioner is located in changing room not in main area near beds. Lobby is super clean and cold. Front desk people need to work on being more friendly, and greeting paying customers with a friendly smile.  P.S. PVI is located directly in between Denny's and IHOP....eat at Dennys....less money, less people, better service plus u get a 10% discount just by showing your room key.  Have fun!

Summary Heading: perfect position for the novice tourist
Summary: We stayed at the Park Vue Inn from 27 Nov. to 4 dec 2005. The position of this motel was perfect for a visitor to Disneyland - directly opposite the entry to the park and surrounded by restaurants and take -away food places. The rooms had just been refurbished and were more than comfortable , lovely and clean and quite well equiped . At the time , work was still being done on tiling outside so the motel probably wasn't looking its best but they tried to keep construction gear out of the way.The complimentary breakfast was a bit disappointing but that may have been our Australian expectations of what a breakfast really is!. Our one main problem was the help , or lack of it, by reception staff on booking day tours. They were initially quite eager to book trips but it appears that

Summary Heading: Great Location and Staff, Good Value, Renovated Rooms
Summary: This was my first stay at the Park Vue Inn. My first impression was a good one. The lobby was nice and was clean-looking and clean-smelling. The staff was very friendly and check-in was a breeze. They stowed my luggage in a locked room as I arrived very early - 7:45 a.m.   Second impression was not as good, but still not 'bad.' Note: The PVI is beginning outside renovations now that the guest rooms are completed.  As I walked along the outside corridor, I was a little put-off by the sticky gunk that seemed to be on every guest room door. However, as I confirmed later, it was leftover label-backing as the doors were new. (In a nice conversation with the front desk folks at check-out, I mentioned the importance of first impressions and the young man appreciated my suggestion that

Summary Heading: Rooms are OK but pool area stinks!
Summary: I stayed here with my 3 small kids (ages 4, 6, and 7) for 4 nights in the middle of July. Anaheim was going through a heat wave and it was miserably hot.  Good things: 1. The location! It is literally right across the street from the walking entrance. There is also an IHOP on property that we ate at.  2. The AC in the room worked pretty well. It was a heat wave but the AC cooled off the room eventually, although housekeeping turned it off or on low when we were gone.  3. The room was nice enough. Nothing fancy but nothing dirty or wrong. The bathroom was spacious and I liked having the sink outside the shower/toilet area.  4. When we told the manager we were going swimming, he asked if we needed more towels and he later called to ask if we needed more pillows (since there were 4

My boyfriend and I are frequent visitors to Disneyland and we often stay at a motel around the Park to save some money.  Our usual choice of place was booked for the weekend we wanted to go, so we decided to try Park Vue Inn for a change.  Let's just say that the place was below average for the price they charge and we will not be going back there again in the future.  Also, the harassing time-share seller were really annoying!  They even harassed customers walking in and out of the lobby! It started out with trying to check in at 3PM, which is the usual check-in time for this place.  We get there at 3PM, and we get the response that the room is not ready and it will not be ready for another 30 minutes.  Thinking that it may have been a busy morning for the cleaning crew, we

Summary Heading: PARK VUE INN -- THE ONLY HOTEL FOR US
Summary: We love to stay at the Park Vue Inn it is very reasonably priced (especially for the location).  We stay at the Park Vue at least 3 times a year and continue to return. The room sizes are comfortable and they are very accomidating to getting a ground floor place (we have a 20 month old and getting the stroller up and down the stairs is to hard - they do not have an elevator).  The breakfast (free stuff) includes donuts, bread, fruit (oranges, apples and bananas EVERY DAY), you can also purchase a variety of things like cottage cheese, cereal and milk, yogurt and more, at reasonable prices.   The pool is outside, clean, includes a few toys for the kids is secluded by shrubbery so your not showing your self off to those people parking at IHOP.  They have an on-site laundry, which
You can't find better location if you visit disney. Stuff is friendly, breakfast is ok, nice rooms, pool is sad...  Great value.

The location of this motel is superb, directly across the road from the main park enterance. Check in was also great, we arrived before 10am and were able to get our room key, there and then. The room was quite small but it was newly painted and clean. Breakfast was fine with muffins, pastries and coffee, which can be taken back to your room. There is a pool off the car lot which we did not use. A good selection of places to eat are close and there are takeout menus in the room for phone in food. I would stay again for sure.

My son, daughter-in-law, 2 1/2 and 1 yr old grandduaghters and myself stayed 2 nights for my granddaughters birthday.  The 1 bedroom suite was adequite but the day before, we were confirmed for a living room suite which, when we checked in were told was not availble due to the remodeling. This confirmation was done by the hotel.  They eventually changed our room charge to the appropriate price, but we had to ask several times.  My granddaughter and I were injured in the parking lot and they did not have a first aid kit availble.  The fridge, micro and coffee were all fine except the maid left some food in the fridge from a previous guest.  The front desk personnel were very pleasant but were not very helpful when it came to the problems we had.  I reported the remote in the

Summary Heading: Very Nice Stay with Great Location
Summary: This Hotel is truely the closest Hotel to the Entrance of Disneyland Resort, (5 to 10 minutes walk and you are in the parks), without staying at one of the 3 very expensive on resort Hotels, the crosswalk to Disney was just 10 metres away from Hotel entrance. We booked one of the rooms with a jacuzzi, it was excellent, large, clean and quiet, the renovation of the rooms are almost complete and was not a problem. The staff were friendly and helpful and check in was a breeze. There are good restuarants nearby. Would definatley stay there again.

Since I have never stayed at any of the hotels close to Disneyland I can't compare the Park Vue Inn to any of the others. There are pros and cons to staying at this hotel. It is much like a motel with doors facing into the parking lot. The Pros:   proximity - it is across the street from the disneyland which was awesome. You could run back for a sweater or just go back for a meal and then go back to the parks without waiting for shuttles. There were also lots of restaurants and shops within walking distance.  free breakfast - they always had fresh, unblemished fruit, hot great tasting coffee, fresh: croisants, muffins, pastries,both whole wheat and white bread to toast with jams, and could purchase for $1us cereal, milk, yogurt, etc. It was enough as we aren't huge breakfast

When booking I really wanted a hotel close to Disneyland, The Park Vue can not get any closer. It is a two minute stroll to the ticket gates. The room we got was newly renovated, with a big comfy bed & pillows. There was plenty of space in the room. There was also a bar fridge & mircowave, handy for families staying for a few days. Ask for a top floor room as there was a bit of noise from the kids upstairs.   The hotel is between Denny's & Ihop, good cheap meals after a hard day a Disneyland. The servings are so big one burger was enough for the both of us. The free breakfast is a kids dream, Dougnuts, pastries & muffins. A sugar rush before heading out to face the rides. I heard they are going to refurbish the breakfast area, it does need it. The breakfast staff are great, make

OVERALL: 'Above average' rating considering the star rating and location (not the hotel room itself).  Well worth the convenience to Disney.  I would rate this with the 2 to 2-1/2 star hotels (similar to the Holiday Inn Express types).  Simple and clean.  No luxury, but has all the basics.  Perfect for those who spend their entire day at the parks.  LOCATION: Believe it when they say 'at the crosswalk' to Disney.  The Inn sits adjacent to IHOP.  The crosswalk is at the front of IHOP--less than a 0.5 minute walk from the Inn.  Then I would say it is a 5 minute walk to the 'plaza' between the 2 Disney park ticket booth areas.  AMENITIES: Clean.  Good size room--plenty for family of four not to feel cramped.  (Bigger than a WDW deluxe resort room.)  We stayed near the back in a

My husband and I were interested in a hotel that was inexpensive (as we were staying there for 7 days paying about $65 per night with Entertainment.com), close to the Disneyland Resort (Disneyland, California Adventures, Downtown Disney) and was pretty decent.  We found this all and much more at the PARK VUE INN.  LOCATION: It's largely advertised as "the hotel directly across from Disneyland" and this is very much true.  The front of the hotel is literally a few steps from the crosswalk that leads into the park. It is very, very convenient to go back to the hotel after a long morning and return in the evening after resting without much time wasted in between.  It was particularly nice not having to wait for any shuttles or trams after a long day.    HOTEL SERVICE: We checked in

They do have a great location if you are visiting Disney. But , they have remodeled and the bedrooms have a very strong smell to it, from the wood work, I had to pack up and walk out 2 hours after check-in with my 3 kids and got no help from the staff. They charged 155.00 anyways, did not care. We end up at the marriot just half mile away and paid 180 for a 5 star hotel. What hurts the most is that they really did not care about my baby getting sick on the smell of wood stain. Horrible.
We stay for just one night and was impressed on how clean the room was. It's not the Ritz but for the money and location, it was a nice stay.

This hotel was an excellent choice for many reasons.  I took my 9 year old son on a trip to Disneyland with a four night stay at the Park Vue Inn.  The newly remodeled room we stayed in was beautiful with a jacuzzi tub (in additional to the tub/shower in the bathroom) and king size bed. Decor was very nice with earth tone colors and a large TV.  The location is wonderful as his tired legs did not have far to walk after fighting the crowds after fireworks and parades.  He even enjoyed the jacuzzi tub to relax his tired muscles.  Our room was at the back corner of the hotel so the noise was very minimal, plus if you have walked all day you are tired and sleep great.    We were sitting in the lobby waiting for a friend and had an opportunity to watch the front desk staff.  They

Hotel is being remodeled-stayed in an updated room. Comfortable, pretty, very convenient to Disneyland. Two-story property without an elevator. Our room was missing a 'Do not disturb' sign; only saw two in use and the hotel was full. So maybe other rooms were missing theirs, too. Only stayed a couple of days, so it was no big deal. Right next to IHOP.

Well what can i say the Park Vue Inn Is the best Hotel in the Anaheim Resort!!!!**clapping!! very good service very great location the rooms were very very clean very nice i felt at home!! the Office Staff is the BEST!!  Park Vue Inn Is the Best Hotel in the Anaheim Resort!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

My wife 4 kids and I stayed at Park Vue in for 5 days.  It was a great experience.  Our friends always stay at the Park Inn 2 doors down, we talked them into staying with us and she was very impressed.  She said the only difference was the walls seemed thinned they heard more outside noise and the people next door.  We were there during the remodel so at times during the day it was noisy but we were there to eat not sleep.  I have no complains my kids enjoyed it, the room was easy to access even on 2nd floor.  We plan to make yearly trips, I have to admit we are going to try the Park Inn soon just to see but the staff and our treatment was so good, I think Park Inn  will have a hard time beating this experience.

Summary Heading: Great Place!  Would stay here again!!
Summary: What a pleasant surprise!  I am always cautious about staying in Anaheim because there are so many visitors and you never know what shape hotels will be in.  Well, I was very pleased with the cleanliness of the rooms, the professional staff but mostly because you can walk right across the street to Disneyland.  I would suggest that you ask for an "upstairs" room and away from the staircase.  The noise of the upstairs people was a little much... especially because they had a crying baby!  But for the most part it was an excellent stay.  Ask for the remodeled rooms... I would stay here again.  Great for kids!

Our family recently stayed at the Park Vue Inn when we visited Disneyland this January and I have to say,  We were impressed by this hotel.  It had recently been refurbished.  Very comfortable pillow top mattresses.  We all slept wonderfully!  Very appreciated after a long day at the Parks.  Friendly staff,  Prompt housekeeping,  warm pool with a nicely landscaped tall hedge surrounding it for privacy.  Grounds were kept clean.  It is a smaller hotel,  just two stories,  which makes it even easier to get to your room.  and located right by the pedistrian crosswalk to Disneyland.  Desk staff were friendly and professional with prompt and efficient check -in.  I am so surprised that this hotel only gets  1 star rating!  I have stayed at 3-4 stars hotels and not received such good

What a  cute little hotel, clean, newly remodeled, & spacious perfect with our kids. We’ve stayed at a few others on Harbor Blvd but just loved this one! It was on the other end of the cross walk as you exit Disneyland, wonderful after a long day of walking or getting drenched on the grizzly river, so you can change.  The staff was awesome too, from the  front desk to the housekeeping, very friendly people. We asked for extra towels and blankets and immediately received them promptly. The free continental breakfast was great to grab something on your way out, donuts, toast coffee, & juices. and hold you over. Asked for extra towels and blankets and immediately received them. =)No problems here….good stuff just perfect for our park hopping! Thanks Park Vue Inn, we’ll definitely

Summary Heading: Wonderful Motel, Wonderful Location, Wonderful Staff
Summary: Just stayed at the Park Vue Nov 13-17 during our visit to Disneyland.  What a great experience!  Park Vue is as close as any Hotel to the magic, including the Grand Californian (about the same distance to walk from either to the Disneyland main entrance) and was a wonderful place to stay.  Our room was clean, nicely styled with California Mission/Craftsman style furniture, and quiet.  Hotel staff was wonderful to work with.  Continental breakfast was what you would expect at most places with pastries, toast, fruit, juices, coffee, and jams and jellies.  Cereal and yogurt were available for a very resonable fee ($1).  Not a 5 star resort in terms of the extra ammenities, no elevator, but its only 2 stories.  I will definitly stay there again and be happy about it.  GO FOR IT! You

Our family of 2 adults & 2 kids [11 , 8 ] have just returned from a 8 night stay at the park vue inn . Let me start by saying the location is fantastic , straight across from disney . The room we stayed in [124] was great it had just been renovated & included a fridge , microwave & tv . The room was a good size with 2 queen beds & was very clean . The staff could not do enough for us they asked on several occasions if everything was ok & it was . The only complaint was not with the hotel but with a noisy family upstairs for 2 nights , but we noticed that on all our usa hotels on our travels. We got a great rate of $60.00 us dollars per night & highly recommed this hotel for families on a budget , you wont be disappointed . Due to the 100 deg days we had when we stayed the kids

My 2 kids and I had a great stay at the Park Vue. Thank God for Tripadvisor having this message board! I took the advice of staying there from reviews made here. I made contact with the hotel via emails and calls regarding reservations,etc. staff were quick to respond and very helpful. Also upon arriving and departing, again helpful. Our room, the breakfast area and the pool were also well kept. The location is perfect. If you're on a budget, I highly recommend a few things, The Park Vue Inn (there's a fridge and microwave), head down to Target (it's just down the street) and buy food,milk, etc there. There's a McDonald's,IHOP and corner store (which sells sandwiches,ice cream,liquor,etc) all very close to the hotel. There's also on-site laundry facilities. And you get a good

We just got back from staying at this hotel and we were quite happy with it. For those who gave this hotel a bad rating, my guess is that they have never stayed at any of the hotels on Harbor Blvd. Most of the hotels in the area are quite basic, no frills. If you've done any research, you'll see that this hotel is quite cheap for the area so you really can't expect a lot.We have stayed at a number of these hotels on Harbor, we go to Disneyland every year and we found this hotel to be the best for the money.   If you want a nice hotel or any frills, don't try to economize on your hotel. If you just want a clean place to stay for not a lot of money, I highly recommend this hotel. We will absolutely stay there again.

The place is decent.  It was clean.  The best part is it is right across from Disneyland's main entrance.  One warning.  There is an IHOP right next to the hotel.  I thought fantastic until I saw the inflated prices.  My seven year old ate a $12 chicken ceaser salad.  I had a $12 omlet.  My soda was $3.  I thought it was funny that I could eat cheaper at Disneyland.

The Park Vue Inn was a good hotel.  The pool was warm that you didn't need a hot tub.  but it was more like an average temperature.  The breakfast had a good variety.  We had a remodeled room which was worth the price.  It is a 3 minute walk to disneyland.  There is big bathroom area.  The beds are comfortable.  I suggest you stay at the Park Vue Inn.

Summary Heading: Location is the only reason to stay here
Summary: I stayed here two nights in mid-August. Like the other reviewers have said, the  only reason you should stay at this hotel is the location. It's adjacent to the crosswalk across Harbor Blvd to Disneyland. The location can't be beat.  The hotel itself is another matter. It's a typical motor inn (two story building, rooms entered from the outside instead of an interior hallway). I booked a room with a king bed, but the hotel's reservation system insisted I booked a queen bed. Didn't bother me, though. I asked the desk clerk for a room on the 2nd floor. Despite his effort, which included calling the housekeeping department to ask if particular rooms were cleaned yet, I wasn't able to get one on the 2nd floor. No matter. I settled for a room on the first floor.   Fortunately, I

The free breakfast was toast, doughnut holes, fruit, juice, and weak coffee.  You can have cold cereal and milk for $2.00 (a dollar each).  Why advertise a free breakfast?  The room was clean and updated but only average.  The pool sits in the middle of the parking lot behind IHOP.  I would stay there again only for the location but won't expect much from the breakfast.

If you're going to Disneyland and are on a budget, this is a great little property. It's directly opposite the entrance to the Disneyland Resort and is as close as you can get. It's even closer than walking through Downtown Disney to the Disney resorts themselves.  The Park Vue Inn is a budget property, but still I found the rooms clean and comfortable, large with microwave, fridge, lots of wardrobe space and room for luggage.  They offer a free continental breakfast, which gave you basics for breakfast. Better than nothing! The IHop is right next door and McDonalds, etc, just a few minutes walk away. Parking was free. The only negative I found was the walls were very thin and you could easily hear people walking and talking as they walked along the corridors. Our rooms were

It wasn't nothing fancy but we thought it was clean, continental breakfast OK but what do you want for the price. You can't beat the location even if you stay on Disney property.  We stayed for a week and had not complaints about the place. If you go to Disney how much time do you spend in the room anyway?  We had a mini frig and microwave, clean towels every day. We even could see the fireworks from our room.

The location is great, you can't get any closer to the main gate of Disneyland.  The staff is also quite nice.  Our rooms were ready an hour early.  But there are some problems.  The hotel is apparently refurbishing the guest rooms, and we got one of the not-yet-refurbished ones.  Actually the furnishings were fine, but the carpet was pitiful.  Our 11-month-old daughter was crawling around and within 10 minutes her hands and feet were completely black.  The same happened to us if we walked around barefoot.  Friends of ours stayed in a refurbished room and did not have this problem.  I'd probably rate the place 4 stars after the refurb is complete, but for now, I'm giving it two stars.  There's really no excuse for not steam-cleaning the carpets now and then.  For the same price,

Summary Heading: Will return if we are ever on the left coast again!
Summary: We went on a 3 day Disneyland trip, staying at the ParkVue. We plan to return on a future vacation. The location was terrific - a two minute walk to the Disney front gate.  The service at the ParkVue was very friendly. The room interior was dated but functional, with a small refrigerator, coffee maker, and microwave. Our room was quiet - contrary to some of the postings we have read.  The small, free continental breakfast was quite adequate and the lady who serves there is one of the nicest people we have ever met.   Right next door is a Denny's as well as an IHOP.  I would never walk into the IHOP again, WAY overpriced and cold disgusting food.  Denny's, however was one of the best Denny's we have been at.  Regular prices for the food, not jumped up due to location.  Extremely

Skeptical at first due to the low price for the area and the fact it was a one star but it was not bad at all! We usually stay at DisneyLand on site or at a nicer hotel but since there was no availability I chose this one. The price was wonderful and it did go up a bit on weekends but they ALL do. We had a room with two queen beds and our friends had a room with one king. Both rooms had an iron, ironing board, coffee pot, alarm clocks, microwave, and fridge. The location is great! It is right across from the front gate of DisneyLand and that was perfect! IHop is next door and open 24/7 and Denny's is also next door so you have  great options for breakfast without driving if you do not want the free one they offer. They do have a free continental breakfast with coffee, juice,

We recently stayed at the ParkVue Inn over spring break.  We love the location~ we felt like we really got the most of our Disney tickets.  The lines at Disney were crazy during the day.  We were able to go to the park in the morning, return for lunch and rest, go back to the park after dinner (without all the lines) and enjoy the rides and fireworks.  The breakfast is fine- the only problem was guests being inconsiderate and filling boxes with the breakfast items to go.  The only other complaint was car alarms, but there again, that is the guests... We would recommend this hotel to others.  Great for families with young children (no need for a car, Ihop is right there as is McDonalds, etc).

Summary Heading: Cant beat the location or price.
Summary: We had one day left on our 3 day hopper tickets of our 2 week vacation and decided we would try and get a hotel close to the gates along Harbour drive across from Disneyland. I new the Park Vue Inn was reasonably priced and close. I called to reserve a room but was told they were all booked. I then went onto Expedia and was able to get a room for the night I needed. The room 143 had just been renovated and was nice and clean, two queen beds with a large bathroom and shower with plenty of pressure. I could hear the people in the room above us taking a shower but it was to be expected and not a problem at all for any of us, (as we would be up very early to get to the park when it opened and not back to the room till very late).  The pool, even though it was in the middle of the

This was a "no frills" hotel.  The price was resonable.  The rooms were clean but small. The continental breakfast was ok, Juice, toast, muffins, coffee, tea, bananas.  If you wanted milk or cereal you had to buy them for about $1.   But we weren't there to stay in the room the whole time.  We spent most of the time at Disneyland and California adventure.   The enterance to the main gate was directly across the street.  This has to be one of the closest hotels to the park.  Our only complaint was: when I called directly to the hotel to make the reservation (spoke with Jasvinder) He booked the room and gave me a res.#.  When we got there, there was No reservation and no room avail.  They set us up in another hotel around the corner for one night and then the next 2 nights we came

Summary Heading: location is the only great thing about this place
Summary: Rooms were in the 2 star catagory for me. Bedding was very worn and should be replaced. There continental breakfast was a joke. Skip the nearby Denny's and enjoy the Millie's Resteraunt.  There is not sufficient parking. The only outstanding thing about this hotel is the location. RIGHT ACROSS THE STREET FROM THE PARK. No need to use the Disney tram that takes you from the enormous parking structure to the front gates. You can walk and be there within 5 minutes. My husband says..... you are only sleeping there. Why spend ridiculous amounts of money for a 4 or 5 star hotel when you can stay here and spend your saved money in the park.

Summary Heading: great location, good service. good overall
Summary: As a first time visitor to the States, we  found it good that the staff @ Park Vue  were so helpful with any questions we had. Tips on eating out, Disney, and local shopping areas, were found to be really good.  If critical of anything, it would have been the upstairs pathways.  Very noisy when staying in a ground floor room, ( as we were ). So people coming and going later in the night, presented some issues for us, considering we had 2 young kids trying to sleep .  Other than that,  we found the rooms well maintained and cleanly presented each day on our return.  Close to all things we needed, not to mention the great location across the main gates from Disney. Will  not have a problem staying there if we visit Disney / or Orange County area again

Summary Heading: The Good, The Bad but not really Ugly
Summary: The Good:  Location, location, location!   Closest we've ever been to Disney.  Love not having to walk 2 miles to and fro daily.  Parking was good, too.  First time we rented a car so that was important.  Price was the best we could fine online relative to the "location" - i.e., this was the cheapest and the closest we found.   Coffee pot and microwave worked.  Fairly clean, though we didn't spend that much time on the carpet...Shower  and air cond worked fine.    The Bad:  It was the cheapest we've found and you get what you pay for:).  SMALL room!   My children are older and we all take up more space :).  Cramped is an understatement...BUT we only needed a place to serve as base camp so it was ok.  Maids were loud and came knocking on the door every day to make sure we were

Summary Heading: If you like rip-offs and bad smelling rooms!
Summary: We stayed at this establishment over a year ago, and were promised the $69 rate at the time I booked on the phone. I even had a confirmation number. However, upon my arrival, they wanted to charge $110.00.  This was a huge difference!  I was upset and complained to the manager, who said that there were only so many rooms at the promotional rate, and that once they ran out, we were out of luck. My room smelled of urine, and the beds were filthy. Even though the location proved to be the best, the room was horrible. Upon further inspection, we found urine on the bathroom floor, and the air conditioner was broken.  I complained to the BBB. Apparently their record is less than satisfactory.  Save your money and book next door at the Desert Suites.

We left our 3 children at home and went on an adult trip to Disneyland. We always stay at Residence Inn/Garden Grove with our children, but we were trying to be as cheap as possible so we chose Park Vue Inn because it was the cheapest ($51/nt.). First the positives: Location was great! Probably the best location to walk to Disneyland. There was a microwave and a nice-size mini-fridge in the room. The closet was large and had 8 wooden hangers. The air conditioner was not loud but perfect for white noise, which we needed as you will read about on the negatives. The rooms were quite large and check-out was quick. Now for the negatives: Paper thin walls, almost as thin as the towels and toilet paper. We could hear every footstep and movement upstairs and they were just walking

Summary Heading: Incredible Value for Money & Great Location Too!
Summary: As part of our "dream" USA Holiday,we stayed at the Park Vue Inn in Anahiem early December 2004 for 15 nights.We also stayed in Las Vegas & San Francisco too.  There were four of us,my wife,two teenage daughters & myself.(About 9 years ago we visited & stayed there & it was good value then) and I have no doubt that the Park Vue Inn is still the best value for money accomodation you'll find in Anahiem.  It is a great location,right opposite the entry to Disneyland/California Adventures so you don't need to use buses or shuttles to come and go to Disneyland.Just walk back to your room anytime it suits - it's so easy! We had a hire car which we were able to leave at the hotel car park (saving on Disneyland Parking fees!)   We based ourselves at the Park Vue Inn & then drove

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with family
Summary: My husband and I stayed here in the spring of 2004 with our 4 year old daughter. We had a two Queen bed room in the back part of the hotel on the top floor so no one was walking on us at night. The only problem I had was the same with most hotels, some people coming and going at night don't care about other people trying to sleep and were noisy, (one guy just can't figure out his car alarm!) this can happen anywhere. The rooms are just the right size. The air condition could of worked alittle better, we left it on high while we were at the park and the room was just cool enough when we got back that night. The people were very nice that work here, easy check-in and out.  The breakfast in the morning is just fine, fresh pastries, cereal, fresh fruit, juices and coffee, it's free!

Stayed at the Park Vue for one night in early December, 2004.  We picked this hotel due to its low price and PRIME location right next to the enterance to Disneyland.  The room was basic and a bit small with very little storage space.  It would have felt cramped if we had more luggage.   The staff was very friendly and said it was no problem to leave our car in their lot all day after we checked out.  We grabbed some pastries and juice from their breakfast buffet and were in line at Disneyland before we finished munching.  We would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great Value for what you pay
Summary: It was our first time in the states and of course we had to go disneyland, so the best place to stay was here with a 3 day pass and just a walk across the road to disneyland its great, you can even see the fireworks from your rooms if you cant stay to watch. we were there in the end of october and disney was quite great time to go.  The rooms are not flash, but had 2 queen beds and good size with shower over bath, fridge, microwave, tv, air con all that you need and were clean and tidy and i thought were good value and i would stay here again.  Breakfeast was included make your own toast or have donuts, pastries or just some fruit. plus 3 different jucies or tea and coffee all included in your stay, not flash but something in your tummy to start the day and not bad.  staying

We are a family with 3 young kids (1, 4 and 6 years) so we wanted a place that was close to Disney. The location of this hotel is excellent!! It's just right across the street from the main entrance.  So having that walking convenience makes up for the small negatives that we experienced (which I'll get to later). We also enjoyed being able to see the nightly fireworks from either the 2nd floor terrace or our hotel room.  (We stayed upstairs in room 212.) When I made reservations a month earlier the hotel clerk made a note that we would like an upstairs room, but I wasn't expecting to be able to get it since we were staying during the days surrounding new year's eve.  How excited we were when we were settling into our room that first night, heard the fireworks, opened our drapes

Stayed here in late September 2004, its been 12 years since I was last here and have things changed (for the better of course). Park Vue Inn the rooms were clean, had fridge and microwave. Had laundry, pool was good, the best thing it was right accross from the entrance to Disney, no buses or trams to get to Disney here. You could go and spend some time in the morning go back have a rest and swim and go back to Disney for the afternoon and night, "brillant". Heaps of restaraunts around. The desk staff werent all the knowledgeable about things but we found what we were looking for. If I went back I would stay here again no problem

DO NOT STAY HERE!!  staff lie on top of lie to 'stall' your complaints.  cannot get to manager hotel.  I'm looking for a way to file a formal complaint with the better business bureau & chamber of commerce.  no respect for guests, rooms misrepresented on websites, small, needing remodeling, which they were doing (chainsaw & all) during our afternoon naps (no sleeping) the noise level was terrible, maids woke us up bright and earlier talking very loudly and you could hear everything around you.  it was the WORST experience in 3 years of quarterly hotel visits along harbor blvd.  We will NEVER stay here again and highly recommend anybody that enjoys comfort, quiet and accomodating hotel staff not stay here either.  ridiculous and the manager is not returning my calls to resolve

Very basic,small room, the room with 2 queen beds was very cramped for 2 adults and 2 kids, but kept very clean.The breakfast was adequate and you could buy extras if you wanted or IHOP was right next door!! It served its purpose as we were only in there to sleep. The in room safe had a lost key but the lock was promptly changed as soon as we reported it. Excellent location right across the road from Disney.Good value. I would stay again.

Summary Heading: Ignored our request...and the bed was like a stone slab.
Summary: We usually stay on a Disneyland property when we visit, but were on a budget, so we decided to stay at this location.  Although the location cannot be beat (sooo close to the park!), we encountered several problems.  The biggest problem was the fact that even though we had specifically requested a non-smoking room, they gave us a smoking room!!!! I couldn't believe it!  We thought the room had a funky odor, but didn't notice the fact that the non-smoking rooms had small placards that said non-smoking (our room did not) until the second day.  Considering we made these reservations a month in advance, checked in at 7am, and at least 85% of their rooms are non-smoking, there really was no excuse to give us a smoking room.  Also, this property goes back from the street, so if you

Pool was cold but ok. Room was a little crammed because we had to put up a portable crib. Breakfast was not much but they did offer extras (like cereal) for a fee. Great location with restaurants close by but would probably not stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great Location, comfortable stay, good price
Summary: We just returned from a 3 day Disneyland trip, staying at the ParkVue.  We plan to return on a future vacation.  The location was terrific - a two minute walk to the Disney front gate.  This is especially nice with kids (no parking/waiting for trams, etc).  The service at the ParkVue was friendly.  The room interior was dated but functional.  Also, our room was quiet - contrary to some of the postings we read before the trip.   The pool was a great way to cool off mid-day and recharge for an afternoon at the park - it seemed to be underused, which was nice.  The Disney fireworks are viewable from the patio area, so no walking necessary with the kids.

Summary Heading: Great Location, but that's as far as it goes.
Summary: We've stayed here over 5 times in the last 2 years and love the location because it is right next door to IHOP and right across the street from the Disney main entrance. So you don't have to worry about parking or eating. We got our room on the internet at a cheaper price but then if you want to extend, it felt like they were raising the price each time because they knew they already had you there.  They said their rates fluctuated each day.  We just jumped on the internet again and got a room for the next night for $20 cheaper.  The continental breakfast had some bread, juice, and fruit, but they would charge you for the cereal or anything else.

Our stay at the Park Vue Inn was very nice. The hotel has recently undergone improvements (they were just adding the finishing touches) and it looked very nice. It was clean and well kept. The accommodations were clean and comfortable and you canÂ t beat the location. When we needed a break from Disneyland, we just walked the 5 min back to the hotel for a nap or a swim. I would recommend this hotel to any traveler to the Anaheim area. We enjoyed our stay very much and felt there was a personal touch to the place that you donÂ t get at larger corporate hotels.

My Family stayed at this hotel over night when we went to Disneyland & Caliufornia Adventure on feb 28-29, 1994  Location was great, right across from the disneyland gates, theres an ihop almost in same parking lot, and a denny's just a few short steps down the street. i booked this hotel online and paid around $60 for the night which is not bad, hotel desk person was nice. you do have to giuve them a credit card for a deposiot when you check in which i did not like, but i have not been charged so no problem there.  we went to breakfast at dennys so not sure about continental breakfast, but what do you expect? beds were comfortable and room was clean. i also like having key cards. room had tv with several channels & you can order movies if you want, but a bit pricey @ $11 each.

PLEASE don't stay here! Where do I start? We made our reservations in with the Park Vue Inn in December and they never mentioned that they would be doing renovations to the (whole) motel. The construction workers were stuccoing, painting and walking across the roof dropping 60lb bundles of tar paper every morning between 6-7am!!!! (And I thought we might get to sleep in on vacation-WRONG) There was scaffolding EVERYWHERE, you had to duck or climb over it to get to the stairs leading to your room (we have pictures). Our friends were trapped in their room at 7am one morning with plastic stapled over their door. Parking was a nightmare because the parking places were roped off. If you were one of the lucky ones to get a spot you'd better watch out because they still stuccoed and

Summary Heading: UNDER RENOVATION- If I only knew!!!!
Summary: Well, where do I start? The phones didn't work and there were scafoldings up one side and down the other in front of the rooms with a generator buzzing away and baracades in front of 20% of the parking spaces! The front entrance, you know, where you park to check in- was baracaded. I woke up to gentlemen slapping stucco around in front of my window, over my car! I had to carry my bags UNDER the scafolding because there was no other way to my car only to find a vehicle directly behind mine, blocking me in with no parking pass on his dash!  I had to move the barracade and shimmy my car out and replace the baracade so I wouldn't wake the whole hotel up trying to get the jerks attention to move his car! But the staff was armed and ready for any complaint coming there way, with a

Summary Heading: Save money on parking, just walk to disneyland!
Summary: We always stay here because you can't beat the location. It's the closest place to stay if you want to walk to Disneyland. If you park in the Disneyland garage, it's $10 a day. (they may have raised the price) so even though it's not the NICEST place to stay you will save money on parking. I've stayed her numerous times without any major complaints. Our room came with a small fridge which was nice because if we ate out, we could bring our leftovers back to the room for a midnight snack. It's also very close to other restaurants. I think IHOP is next door. Once you cross the street to Disneyland main gate, then you're only steps away from DOWNTOWN disney where there are more shops and places to eat.

I had read the reviews and figured it couldn't be that bad for the price, but it was not good either. They weren't kidding when they said it was noisy!!! The doors are paper thin, and if you are so lucky as to get a room on the bottom floor, then you are subject to an elephant stampede on the floor above, as well as the constant beeping and honking of car alarms. When you see continental breakfast, don't believe it, all that is continental is some juice and croissants. You have to BUY anything else. I don't believe the value was worth it

My husband and I paid for our room in advance and when we arrived (around 6pm) our room was DIRTY! There was food by the TV and the bed was messed up. At first we thought they'd given us the wrong room number. We went back and they said if we'd leave for a while it would be clean when we returned. This was a year ago and we vowed to never return to this hotel no matter how close it was to the park. We go to Disney for our anniversary every year...  The continental breakfast was nothing. If you stay here, plan on going next door for breakfast, too. NOT the bargain they make it out to be.

The only good thing about this hotel was the location being that it was accross from Disneyland and had an IHOP open 24 hours. This is budget accomodation, the room was clean but because we were staying on the ground floor we heard peoples footsteps above us all night and we had a light shining in our window. When we booked, the website advised that there was a shuttle to take you to other destinations but when we asked about it staff were rude and there was definately no shuttle. The buffet breakfast consisted of toast and juice, if you wanted cereal you had to pay for it! I wouldnt stay here again, there are much nicer/quiter hotels accross from Disneyland!

My husband and I were on our honeymoon and upon check in were told we had to pay a fee for electricity. We requested that the fee be removed since we werent told about it. The check in clerk agreed to remove the fee as a wedding gift to us. The clerk then ask for a credit card number in case any damage was done to the room. I explained that the only card I had was my visa bank card and to make sure no one would charge the fee to it. The check in clerk assured to me this would not happen and they would tell me before they made any charges. When we came back from the honeymoon I went to my bank and found my account negative. The park view inn had charged my account and kept charging adding fees. I called and talked to the manager Angel, was extremely defensive and rude and he told

We stayed at this Hotel in September of 2002. @ $59 a night. The location is everything, right accross the street from both parks. We have two small children so the option of returning for a quick nap was more than realistic. One night around 8pm our 1 1/2 year old daughter ripped the cabel out of the wall socet. We called the front desk and within 20 minutes a maintenace guy showed up and repaired it in a snap. The breakfast is not really a breakfast. The OJ was decent and the donuts where at least a space filler. The rooms were clean. The water became a problem if you took a shower the same time as your neighbor so I switch to shoering at nights. Overall, considereing price and location I would recommend staying at The Park Vue Inn.

Summary Heading: You get more than you pay for
Summary: We go down to Disneyland about once a year and we always stay at the park vue for the last 5 years. Yes it is DEFINITELY a two star hotel. This means your room may not be clean by noon (mine always has but my mom's was missed once), the continental breakfast is juice, donuts and toast (we often eat someplace else - IHOP is right next door), it is understaffed (don't expect prompt delivery of extra towels) and it has the wear and tear you expect for two stars. But you cannot stay any closer to Disneyland without being in a Disneyland hotel. The price is always good (significantly cheaper than the competition - the going rate for august appears to be $60/nite). It has a pool to entertain the older kids while the little ones are napping and it has never been crowded when I've been

Summary Heading: Never Ever Stay At This Place!
Summary: This place is a total rip off.  I made reservations in advance, when I arrived they did not have a room for us, they promissed to take care of us and told us to go to another hotel 6 blocks down the road.   The manager (Angel) promissed to make up the difference in the room rates yet he has failed to do that and instead offered a future discount to his hotel if and when we return to the area.  I would not recommend this place to anyone. They lie and they ruined our short stay.

We have tried many hotels walking distance from Disneyland.  This hotel is one of the closest to Disneyland, but the room accommodation was not up to our expectations.  The room could be cleaned better (i.e., the room smelled and the bathroom smelled of urine) and the electricity kept going out.  Also, they didn't provide extra  kleenex and toilet paper and we ran out.

I wasnt expecting much but was pleasantly suprised by this establishment.  As the previous reviewer writes it IS right across the road from the main gate of both Disneyland and California Adventure Park.  This street is just row after row of motels, hotels and restaurants (some 24hrs per day).  Shuttle pickup/drop off point for Airport Bus and Coach USA tours is right next door.  Hotel is really suited for families with fridge, microwave, safe, bath/shower all in room.  The rooms have advice on takeout menus and also lists what restaurants are available.  Continental bfast is included in price of the room.  A shop is attached to the hotel for all those last minute purchases and they also provide internet access at a cost - although when we used it the computer was having

Location, Location, Location...  This Property Resides Just Across The Street From The Parking Tram Unloading Area In Front Of Both Disneyland And California Adventure. While The Rooms Are Basic, They Also Provide A Heated Pool, In-Room Coffee, Refridgerator, Hair Dryer, And A Self-serve Complementary Continental Breakfast With Seating Outside On A Patio Overlooking The Entrance To Disneyland. Confirmed Reservations Are A Must, And Additional Room Discounts May Be Available By Picking Up Those Tourist Brochures And Clipping Out A Coupon. The Coupon Worked For Us, But You Can Be Sure They Limit The Rooms Available For The Discounts. There's A Restaurant Next Door, And Many Within Walking Distance. Once The Car Is Parked, It Won't Be Needed Until You Plan To Go To Another
